Tailo: I ê tshàn-lān tshin-tshiūnn kng; tuì I ê tshiú ū tshut kng-suàⁿ, tī hia I ê lîng-li̍k khǹg-.leh.
English: His splendor is like the sunrise. Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden.

Tailo: Ū lâng thong-ti Iâkop kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê kiáⁿ Iôséhuh lâi beh tshuē lí. Isulael tsiū bián-kióng khí-.lâi, tsē tī bîn-tshn̂g.
English: Someone told Jacob, and said, Behold, your son Joseph comes to you, and Israel strengthened himself, and sat on the bed.

Tailo: In-uī guá ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kháu-tsâi kah tì-huī, hō͘ lín ê tuì-ti̍k lóng bē-tàng tuì-khòng kah piān-pok.
English: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

Tailo: Nā-sī lí tâng-bú ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī lí ê kiáⁿ, lí ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, á-.sī lí sim-huâi tiong ê bó͘, á-.sī tshin-tshiūnn lí sèⁿ-miā ê pîng-iú, thau-thau-á ín-iú lí, kóng, ' Lán lâi-khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī lí kah lí ê tsó͘-sian pîng-sî m̄-bat-.ê,
English: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend, who is as your own soul, entice you secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which you have not known, you, nor your fathers;

Tailo: Sím-mi̍h sî khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí phuà-pēⁿ á-.sī tī kaⁿ-.ni̍h, guán ū khì kā Lí thàm-hóng? '
English: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?'

Tailo: I jīn-tshut sī Piattò͘ ê siann, huann-hí kah bē kò͘-tit khui mn̂g, tsáu ji̍p-khì pò-kò kóng, Piattò͘ khiā tī mn̂g-kha-kháu.
English: When she recognized Peter's voice, she didn't open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.

Tailo: Iosiúah koh kóng, Tsiū án-ne, lín thang tsai ua̍h ê Siōngtsú tī lín tiong-kan, ē tī lín ê thâu-tsîng kuáⁿ-tio̍k Ka-nân lâng, Hiat lâng, Hi-bī lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Gi-ga-sih lâng, Amô͘lī lâng kah I-é-bú-suh lâng;
English: Joshua said, Hereby you shall know that the living God is among you, and that he will without fail drive out from before you the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Hivite, and the Perizzite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Jebusite.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, pō͘-ping tńg-khì iâⁿ-pâng, hō͘ bé-ping kè-sio̍k hō͘-sàng Páulô.
English: But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks.

Tailo: Tī lí ê sì-kho͘-uî-á lāi, tshit ji̍t lóng m̄-thang khuàⁿ-tio̍h kàⁿ, thâu tsi̍t ji̍t ê-hng só͘ hiàn ê tsè-bah, m̄-thang lâu tsi̍t-tiám-á kàu thiⁿ-kng.
English: There shall be no yeast seen with you in all your borders seven days; neither shall any of the flesh, which you sacrifice the first day at even, remain all night until the morning.

Tailo: Iésu tuì i kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t kiù-un lâi-kàu tsit-ê ke, in-uī i mā sī Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: Jesus said to him, Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

Tailo: Thian-hā lia̍t ông lóng lâi ài beh kìnn Só͘lômóng ê bīn, thiaⁿ i ê tì-huī, to̍h-sī Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù tī i ê sim-lāi ê.
English: All the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.

Tailo: Koh bô guā kú, sè-kan bē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, to̍k-to̍k lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, in-uī guá ua̍h-.leh, lín mā ē ua̍h-.leh.
English: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī Tse-lông ê kiáⁿ Elíap ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

Tailo: Piattò͘ kah Iô-há-neh kā in huāⁿ-tshiú, in tsiū tit-tio̍h Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá.
English: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Gia̍h tshit ki kó͘-tshue hit tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài, tsún-pī hó-sè beh pûn.
English: The seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì Alông kóng, The̍h hit-ê hiuⁿ-lô͘, īng tuâⁿ tíng ê hué té tī hit tiong-kan, hē hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn, kuáⁿ-kín tuà kàu huē-tsiòng hia, kā in sio̍k-tsuē; in-uī ū tuā siū-khì tuì Siōngtsú huat-tshut, un-i̍k í-king teh huat-tsok.
English: Moses said to Aaron, Take your censer, and put fire therein from off the altar, and lay incense thereon, and carry it quickly to the congregation, and make atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from Yahweh; the plague is begun.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Kiò i tńg-khì i ê tshù, m̄-thang kìnn guá ê bīn. Αpsalôm tsiū tńg-khì i ê tshù, bô kìnn ông ê bīn.
English: The king said, Let him turn to his own house, but let him not see my face. So Absalom turned to his own house, and didn't see the king's face.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, bīn tsiū sit-sik, iu-thâu kat-bīn lī-khui Iésu, in-uī i ū tsin tsē tsâi-sán.
English: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

Tailo: it-tīng bē-tàng ji̍p-khì Guá tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín lín tuà ê tē; to̍k-to̍k E-hun-neh ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah, ē-tàng ji̍p-.khì.
English: surely you shall not come into the land, concerning which I swore that I would make you dwell therein, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.

Tailo: Guán ai-kiû Siōngtsú ê sî, I thiaⁿ guán ê siann, tshe-khián sù-tsiá tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p, taⁿ guán tī lí ki̍k piⁿ-á ê siâⁿ Ka-té-si.
English: and when we cried to Yahweh, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt: and behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of your border.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê bat siū thòng-khó͘ ê tē bô koh tiàm tī o͘-àm. Tsá-tsîng Siōngtè hō͘ Tse-bú-lông kah Náhuthalím ê tē siū khuànn-khin, āu-lâi tsiū hō͘ iân hái ê lō͘, Ioltàn hô ê hô guā, guā-pang ê Ga-lí-la-iah tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish. In the former time, he brought into contempt the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali; but in the latter time he has made it glorious, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

Tailo: In-uī I ê ba̍k-tsiu kàm-tshat ta̍k lâng ê lō͘, khuàⁿ-bîng i ê kha-pō͘.
English: For his eyes are on the ways of a man, He sees all his goings.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tsit-ê khit-tsia̍h sí-.khì, thiⁿ-sài hû i khì-kàu Abulahàm ê hing tsîng. Hit-ê hó-gia̍h lâng mā sí-.khì, suà hō͘ lâng kā i bâi-tsòng.
English: It happened that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels to Abraham's bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ-tio̍h án-ne tsiū tsin huann-hí, koh tap-ìng beh hō͘ i tsînn. Iôtah tsiū tshuē-khuàⁿ ū siáⁿ-mi̍h ki-huē thang kā Iésu tshut-bē.
English: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.

Tailo: Lí tī siâⁿ lāi ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì, tī tshân-.ni̍h ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the field.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ông-hō͘ Ua-si-thih m̄-khíng lâi, m̄ tsun-thàn thài-kàm só͘ thuân ông ê bīng-līng, só͘-í, ông tsin siū-khì, sim-lāi tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h.
English: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king's commandment by the chamberlains: therefore was the king very angry, and his anger burned in him.

Tailo: hō͘ guá an-jiân tńg-lâi guá ê pē ê tshù, án-ne, Siōngtsú it-tīng tsiâⁿ-tsò guá ê Siōngtè,
English: so that I come again to my father's house in peace, and Yahweh will be my God,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsè-si tiong ê tsa-po͘ ting, lóng tio̍h tsia̍h tsiah-ê, tse sī tsì-sìng ê mi̍h.
English: Every male among the priests shall eat of it: it is most holy.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ tsiū án-ne tī lán tiong-kan uân-tsuân si̍t-hiān, hō͘ lán tī sím-phuàⁿ ê ji̍t thang hó-tánn bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, in-uī lán tī tsit sè-kan ū kah Iésu kāng-khuán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: In this love has been made perfect among us, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment, because as he is, even so are we in this world.

Tailo: Siōngtè hō͘ guán ū tsâi-tiāu tsò Sin-iok ê lô͘-po̍k; tsit-ê iok m̄-sī īng bûn-jī siá ê, sī Sìng Sîn ê iok; īng bûn-jī siá ê lu̍t-huat ē tuà-lâi sí-bông, m̄-koh Sìng Sîn ē siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā.
English: who also made us sufficient as servants of a new covenant; not of the letter, but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

Tailo: Lín uī-tio̍h beh tsun-siú lín ê thuân-thóng, suah lâi huì-tû Siōngtè ê uē.
English: he shall not honor his father or mother.' You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū tsun-thàn Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù ê, in phah Huilīsū lâng ê kun-tuī, tuì Gi-bóng kàu Getsel.
English: David did as God commanded him: and they struck the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.

Tailo: Lán pún-sin tshut-sì tsò Iô-tá-iah lâng, m̄-sī lâng só͘ kóng ê Guā-pang tsuē-jîn .
English: We, being Jews by nature, and not Gentile sinners,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tiōng-hu thiaⁿ-tio̍h liáu-āu kā i huì-tû, i tsiū tio̍h tam-tng tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tsuē.
English: But if he shall make them null and void after that he has heard them, then he shall bear her iniquity.

Tailo: Lín siū kíng-suán, sī tsiàu Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè ī-tīng ê tsí-ì, koh uá-khò Sìng Sîn lâi tsiânn tsò sìng-kiat, thang sūn-ho̍k Iésu Ki-tok, koh tuì I ê hueh tit-tio̍h kiat-tsīng. Guān Siōngtè ê un-tián kah pîng-an tshiong-muá lín tāi-ke!
English: according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit, that you may obey Jesus Christ and be sprinkled in his blood: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ lí ê pē-bú huann-hí, tio̍h hō͘ lí ê lāu-bú khuài-lo̍k.
English: Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tse to̍h-sī i ê lō͘ ê khuài-lo̍k, í-āu ē ū pa̍t-ê tuì tē-.ni̍h seⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Behold, this is the joy of his way: Out of the earth shall others spring.

Tailo: I ê ba̍k-tsiu bô lī-khui gī lâng; hō͘ in kah kun-ông tsò-hué tsē-uī kàu íng-uán; In tsiū tit-tio̍h ko-sing.
English: He doesn't withdraw his eyes from the righteous, But with kings on the throne, He sets them forever, and they are exalted.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuà tī hong-iá ê siâⁿ-pó, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī Ji-hu khòng-iá ê suaⁿ-tē. Sàulô ta̍k ji̍t tshuē i, tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè bô kā Tabi̍t kau tī i ê tshiú tiong.
English: David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill country in the wilderness of Ziph. Saul sought him every day, but God didn't deliver him into his hand.

Tailo: Koh ū thang-mn̂g saⁿ tsuā, thang kah thang sio-tuì, saⁿ tsuā lóng sī án-ne.
English: There were beams in three rows, and window was over against window in three ranks.

Tailo: Lín ta̍k tsi-tso̍k tio̍h kíng saⁿ-ê lâng, guá beh tshe in khì, in tsiū tshut-huat piàn kiâⁿ hit-ê tē, tsiàu in ê hūn-gia̍h uē-tô͘, tsiū tńg-lâi guá tsia.
English: Appoint for you three men of each tribe: and I will send them, and they shall arise, and walk through the land, and describe it according to their inheritance; and they shall come to me.

Tailo: Tē ē tian-tian tó-tó, tshin-tshiūnn tsiú-tsuì ê lâng, koh iô lâi iô-khì, tshin-tshiūnn tiàu-tshn̂g. Tsuē-kò tāng-tāng teh in, tì-sú in it-tīng ē tó lo̍h-.khì, bē-tàng koh khí-.lâi.
English: The earth will stagger like a drunken man, and will sway back and forth like a hammock. Its disobedience will be heavy on it, and it will fall and not rise again.

Tailo: Kì-jiân Siōngtè liân-bín guán, kā tsit-ê jīm-bū kau-thok guán, guán tsiū bô koh lué-tsì.
English: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, even as we obtained mercy, we don't faint.

Tailo: In beh sàng lín ê tsìng hiann-tī tuì lia̍t kok tiong tò tńg-.lâi, hō͘ in ū ê khiâ bé, ū ê tsē tshia, tsē kiō, khiâ lô, khiâ lo̍k-tô, kàu Guá ê sìng-suaⁿ Êlúsalèm, tsiânn-tsò lé-mi̍h, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú; tshin-tshiūnn Isulael lâng īng tshing-khì ê khì-kū té lé-mi̍h, hiàn tī Siōngtsú ê tiān. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: They shall bring all your brothers out of all the nations for an offering to Yahweh, on horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and on mules, and on dromedaries, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says Yahweh, as the children of Israel bring their offering in a clean vessel into the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k ê tshe-īng thàu-tsá khí-.lâi tshut-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū kun-ping, bé kah tshia teh uî-khùn siâⁿ. Tshe-īng kā i kóng, Tshám ah! Guá ê tsú, lán beh án-tsuáⁿ tsiah hó?
English: When the servant of the man of God was risen early, and gone forth, behold, an army with horses and chariots was round about the city. His servant said to him, Alas, my master! how shall we do?

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá tsiah siong-sìn, hiah-ê bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h to lâi sìn ê lâng, tsin ū hok-khì.
English: Jesus said to him, Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê bi̍k-sī tuì lín lâi kóng tshin-tshiūnn hong-.leh ê jī-iūⁿ. Lâng kā tsit-ê jī-iūⁿ kau hō͘ bat jī ê lâng, kóng, Tshiánn tha̍k hō͘ guá thiaⁿ! I kóng, Guá bē-tàng tha̍k, in-uī hong-.leh.
English: All vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is educated, saying, Read this, please; and he says, I can't, for it is sealed:

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng kóng, ' Lín it-tīng tio̍h siú Guá hiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, in-uī tse sī Guá kah lín ê tiong-kan ê tsìng-kì, kàu tī lín ta̍k sè-tāi, hō͘ lín tsai Guá to̍h-sī Siōngtsú, hō͘ lín tsiânn-sìng ê.
English: Speak also to the children of Israel, saying, Most assuredly you shall keep my Sabbaths: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that you may know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies you.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ông tsiū tshe lâng khì, tuì Lô-tí-pa lâng Ammíel ê kiáⁿ Makil ê tshù kā i tshuā-.lâi.
English: Then king David sent, and fetched him out of the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, from Lo Debar.

Tailo: Siōngtè nā bô kiám-tsió hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, tsiū bô tsi̍t-ê lâng ē-tàng tit-kiù; to̍k-to̍k Siōngtè ē uī-tio̍h I ê suán-bîn lâi kiám-tsió hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.

Tailo: Sio̍k tī Melalih ê kiáⁿ-sun Hosah ū kuí-nā-ê kiáⁿ, tuā ê sī Simlī, i pún m̄-sī tuā-kiáⁿ, tsóng-.sī, in lāu-pē siat-li̍p i tsò tuā-kiáⁿ.
English: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him chief),

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ m̄-sī khò kóng-uē, sī khò kuân-lîng.
English: For the Kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.

Tailo: Ap-hui-a tsí-muē kah guán ê tsiàn-iú A-khip-pò͘, í-ki̍p tī lín tau teh tsū-huē ê kàu-huē.
English: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:

Tailo: mā kā in ê sîn-bîng hiat tī hué-.ni̍h, in-uī in m̄-sī Siōngtè, sī lâng ê tshiú só͘ tsō ê, tshâ tsò ê, tsio̍h-thâu tsò ê, in tsiū kā i tsâu-bia̍t tiāu.
English: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone; therefore they have destroyed them.

Tailo: I koh tuì tsi̍t-ê lâng tshòng-tsō ta̍k tsióng-tso̍k ê lâng, hō͘ in tuà tī tsuân tē-bīn, koh kā in tīng nî-hān kah in só͘ tuà ê tē-kài.
English: He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth, having determined appointed seasons, and the boundaries of their dwellings,

Tailo: In-uī in khì-sak Guá, tī pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng sio hiuⁿ, īng in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê kik Guá ê siū-khì, só͘-í, Guá tuì tsit só͘-tsāi siū-khì, tshin-tshiūnn hué to̍h bô suah.
English: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the work of their hands, therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and it shall not be quenched.

Tailo: Moltékái tsiū kā i só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, í-ki̍p Hamán só͘ kóng beh hiàn tī ông ê khò͘-pâng ê gîn ê khak-si̍t sò͘-gia̍h, thang tsâu-bia̍t Iôtah lâng ê, lóng kā i kóng;
English: Mordecai told him of all that had happened to him, and the exact sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king's treasuries for the Jews, to destroy them.

Tailo: Kok lāi ê tsóng-tiúⁿ, khim-tshe, tsóng-tok, bô͘-sū kah sûn-hú lóng tsò-hué gī-lūn, ài beh siat tsi̍t tiâu ông ê tiâu-lē, lâi li̍p tsi̍t tiâu giâm-keh ê kìm-līng, to̍h-sī tī saⁿ-tsa̍p kang lāi, tû-khì kiû ông í-guā, kiàn-nā bô-lūn tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng, á-.sī tuì lâng lâi kî-kiû ê, lóng tio̍h kā i hiat lo̍h-khì sai hia̍t.
English: All the presidents of the kingdom, the deputies and the satraps, the counselors and the governors, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to make a strong interdict, that whoever shall ask a petition of any god or man for thirty days, save of you, O king, he shall be cast into the den of lions.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê lâng í-king kah lán sio-siâng, ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t siān-ok, taⁿ khióng-kiaⁿ i koh tshun tshiú tuì ua̍h-miā-tshiū bán kué-tsí lâi tsia̍h, tsiū ē ua̍h kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh God said, Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he put forth his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever...

Tailo: Lín koh tio̍h tuà gîn tîng-puē, mā tio̍h kā lín pò͘-tē kháu i hîng lín ê gîn, tuà tò tńg-khì hō͘ i; hit-ê kiám-tshái sī sit-tshò.
English: and take double money in your hand, and take back the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks. Perhaps it was an oversight.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, iáu ū tsi̍t tsân uē, lí tio̍h siū khuàn-kái; tù tsheh tsē, bû kiông-tsīn; tha̍k tsheh tsē, sing-khu ē ià-siān.
English: Furthermore, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.

Tailo: Guán kín-sīn tsàu hō͘ ông tsai, tsit-ê siâⁿ nā koh khí-tsō, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ khí hó, tsiū án-ne, hô guā ê tē tsiū bô lí ê hūn.
English: We inform the king that, if this city be built, and the walls finished, by this means you shall have no portion beyond the River.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Abisai pó-hō͘ Tabi̍t, phah-sí hit-ê Huilīsū lâng. Tong-sî tuè Tabi̍t ê lâng tuì i tsiù-tsuā kóng, Tsit sî liáu-āu, lí m̄-thang koh kah guán tshut-tsiàn, khióng-kiaⁿ phah-hua Isulael ê ting.
English: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him, and struck the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, You shall go no more out with us to battle, that you don't quench the lamp of Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Mô͘ap tuì tsá-kî í-lâi, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hióng-siū pîng-an; tshin-tshiūnn tsē-tshing ê tsiú, bô tuì tsit-ê khì-kū piàⁿ tī pa̍t-ê khì-kū, mā m̄-bat siū lia̍h. In-uī án-ne, i ê guân-bī iáu tī-.leh, khì-bī bô piàn.
English: Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his lees, and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither has he gone into captivity: therefore his taste remains in him, and his scent is not changed.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu, tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ, suah gāng-.khì, suî-sî tsáu-uá-lâi kā I tshíng-an.
English: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng uī-tio̍h sí-.khì ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á teh thî-khàu pi-siong. Iésu kóng, M̄-thang thî-khàu, in-uī i m̄-sī sí, sī teh khùn niā-niā.
English: All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, Don't weep. She isn't dead, but sleeping.

Tailo: Guán sī bô lāu-pē ê ko͘-jî, guán ê lāu-bú tshin-tshiūnn kuáⁿ-hū.
English: We are orphans and fatherless; Our mothers are as widows.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kah Alông kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Tailo: Ebiat ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p kóng, Amí-me-li̍k sī siáⁿ lâng, Sīkhiàm sī siáⁿ lâng, tio̍h hō͘ lán kā i ho̍k-sāi? I kám m̄-sī Ia-lu-ba-al ê kiáⁿ? I ê kun-tiúⁿ kám m̄-sī Tse-bul? Lín tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Sīkhiàm ê lāu-pē Hamool ê lâng, lán án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h kā i ho̍k-sāi?
English: Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? Isn't he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? serve you the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: but why should we serve him?

Tailo: In-uī He-lo̍t tsai Iô-há-neh ê tsò lâng kong-gī koh sìng-kiat, só͘-í kiaⁿ i, mā ū teh kā i pó-hō͘. He-lo̍t muí-pái thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iô-há-neh ê uē, sim tsiū tshau-huân put-an, m̄-koh i iáu-sī huann-hí ài thiaⁿ.
English: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in jú kian-tshî kóng, I tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng khai-sí, taⁿ lâi-kàu tsia, I tī Iô-tá-iah tsuân tē kà-sī lâng, siàn-tōng jîn-bîn.
English: But they insisted, saying, He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.

Tailo: Hông-hun ê sî, Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ tsiū tshut-khì siâⁿ guā.
English: When evening came, he went out of the city.

Tailo: I tsiū tuì ông kóng, Guá tī pún-kok só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê tāi-tsì kah lí ê tì-huī, lóng sī tsin-si̍t!
English: She said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts, and of your wisdom.

Tailo: Tng Iésu kiò La̍h-tsa-lō͘ tshut bōng, hō͘ i tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ê sî kah Iésu tsò-hué tī hia ê kûn-tsiòng ū kè-sio̍k teh tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, was testifying about it.

Tailo: I tsiâⁿ-tsò kuân-tuā, kàu tī thian-kun, kā tsi̍t-kuá kun-tuī kah kuí-nā-ê tsheⁿ-sîn hiat lo̍h tē-.ni̍h, koh kā in thún-ta̍h.
English: It grew great, even to the army of the sky; and some of the army and of the stars it cast down to the ground, and trampled on them.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ īng tuā kuân-lîng kiàn-tsìng Tsú Iésu ê koh-ua̍h, kûn-tsiòng mā lóng tit-tio̍h tuā un-tián.
English: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.

Tailo: Τio̍h tsiàu in só͘ beh kà-sī lí huat-tō͘ ê tsong-tsí, mā tio̍h tsiàu in só͘ kā lí kóng ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi kiâⁿ; in só͘ tsí-sī lí ê phuàⁿ-sû, lí m̄-thang phian tsó á-.sī phian iū.
English: according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left.

Tailo: Lí tsiū ē bîng-pi̍k kong-gī ê phuàⁿ-tuàn, kiânn tsìng-ti̍t kah só͘-ū ê hó lō͘.
English: Then you will understand righteousness and justice, Equity and every good path.

Tailo: Lia̍t kok tuā siū-khì, Lí mā tuā siū-khì. Sí-lâng siū sím-phuàⁿ ê sî-kî kàu à. Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, to̍h-sī hiah-ê sian-ti kah tsìng sìn-tô͘ í-ki̍p kìng-uì Lí ê miâ ê, bô-lūn tuā-sè, Lí pò-siúⁿ in ê sî-kî kàu à. Hiah-ê pāi-huāi tāi-tē ê lâng siū Lí huí-bia̍t ê sî-kî kàu à.
English: The nations were angry, and your wrath came, as did the time for the dead to be judged, and to give your bondservants the prophets, their reward, as well as to the saints, and those who fear your name, to the small and the great; and to destroy those who destroy the earth.

Tailo: La̍h-mot kah i ê kau-iá, A-nem kah i ê kau-iá;
English: and Ramoth with its suburbs, and Anem with its suburbs;

Tailo: Iésu ji̍p-khì tshù lāi, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tsiū kiâⁿ uá khì. Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín kám siong-sìn guá ē-tàng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì? In ìn kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ē.
English: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, Do you believe that I am able to do this? They told him, Yes, Lord.

Tailo: Sanballat thiaⁿ-tio̍h guán khí siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tsiū tuā siū-khì, tuā-tuā thòng-hūn koh thí-tshiò Iôtah lâng.
English: But it happened that when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall, he was angry, and took great indignation, and mocked the Jews.

Tailo: Sâmsóng tuì Huilīsū lâng kóng, Lín kì-jiân án-ne tsò, guá beh tuì lín pò-siû, tsiah ē suah.
English: Samson said to them, If you do after this manner, surely I will be avenged of you, and after that I will cease.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá thiu-suè ê lâng mā lâi beh niá siū sé-lé, in mn̄g Iô-há-neh kóng, Lāu-su, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah hó?
English: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, Teacher, what must we do?

Tailo: Jī-.gue̍h, ū tsin tsē lâng tsū-tsi̍p tī Êlúsalèm, tsiâⁿ-tsò tsin tuā ê huē, beh siú Tû-kàⁿ-tseh.
English: There assembled at Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī tē-tsiūⁿ teh puê ê mi̍h sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê, lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: Every creeping thing that creeps on the earth is an abomination. It shall not be eaten.

Tailo: I nā tuì hí-nî khí kā tē hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, tsiū tio̍h tsiàu lí só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn lâi tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand.

Tailo: Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun tī i siū buah-iû ê ji̍t, só͘ tio̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê lé-mi̍h, to̍h-sī iù ê mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat, tsò tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sò͘-tsè, tsá-khí sî tsi̍t-puàⁿ, ê-hng sî tsi̍t-puàⁿ.
English: This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to Yahweh in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering perpetually, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si khiā khí-lâi tuì Iésu kóng, Tsiah-ê lâng teh kò Lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí ná ē lóng bô beh tap-piān?
English: The high priest stood up, and said to him, Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?

Tailo: Tsìng lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, lóng tsin kám-tōng, tuì Piattò͘ kah kî-tha ê sù-tô͘ kóng, Hiann-tī, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò?
English: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, Brothers, what shall we do?

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ū tsai-hō, i ē tú-tio̍h tsai-lān; in-uī i ē tsiàu i ê só͘ kiâⁿ siū pò-ìng.
English: Woe to the wicked! Disaster is upon them; For the deeds of his hands will be paid back to him.

Tailo: Ū lâng kah tshù-piⁿ ê bó͘ kiânn khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, mā ū lâng îm i ê sim-pū lâi kā i uè lah-sap; tī lín tiong-kan mā ū lâng lîng-jio̍k i ê tsí-muē, to̍h-sī i ê lāu-pē ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: One has committed abomination with his neighbor's wife; and another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law; and another in you has humbled his sister, his father's daughter.

Tailo: tsô-kia̍p tshâ, tiám ting ê iû; phang-phang ê phín-liāu thang tsò ko-iû lâi buah, mā tsò phang-hiuⁿ;
English: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Mô͘se bīng-līng jîn-bîn kóng,
English: Moses charged the people the same day, saying,

Tailo: Lín tio̍h siàu-liām tsit-ê tāi-tsì, ka-kī tsò tāi-tiōng-hu; puē-gi̍k ê lâng, tio̍h īng sim lâi siūⁿ.
English: Remember this, and show yourselves men; bring it again to mind, you transgressors.

Tailo: Tuì ji̍t kuè-tàu kàu hiàn ê-hng-tsè ê sî, in teh kóng in ê sian-ti uē; tsóng-.sī, bô siaⁿ-sueh, bô ìn-tap, mā bô tshap in ê.
English: It was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening offering; but there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any who regarded.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū tuì Mô͘se ai-uàn, kóng, Guán beh lim siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: The people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng ìn kóng, Sin-seⁿ ah, bô puànn-lâng. Iésu kóng, Guá mā bô beh kā lí tīng tsuē, lí thang tńg-.khì, taⁿ í-āu m̄-thang koh huān tsuē.
English: She said, No one, Lord. Jesus said, Neither do I condemn you. Go your way. From now on, sin no more.

Tailo: Liáu-āu, Guá beh īng Guá ê Sìng Sîn kàng-lo̍h hō͘ huān-nā ū jio̍k-thé ê. Lín ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tsò sian-ti kóng-uē, lín ê lāu lâng ē tit-tio̍h bîn-bāng, lín ê siàu-liân lâng ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng.
English: It will happen afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh; And your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your old men will dream dreams. Your young men will see visions.

Tailo: Ông ta̍k pái ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān, sī-uē tsiū tuà tsiah-ê pîn-pâi khì, jiân-āu koh tuà tò tńg-.khì, hē tī sī-uē ê tshù.
English: It was so, that as often as the king went into the house of Yahweh, the guard bore them, and brought them back into the guard chamber.

Tailo: Kì-jiân Siōngtè hō͘ lán tsìn-ji̍p I ê an-hioh ê ìng-ín iáu tī-.leh, lán tio̍h ū kìng-uì ê sim, tsiah bián-tit lín tiong-kan kiám-tshái ū lâng siūⁿ kóng tit bē-tio̍h tsit-ê ìng-ín.
English: Let us fear therefore, lest perhaps a promise being left of entering into his rest, anyone of you should seem to have come short of it.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng, Guá beh bīng-līng Guá tsiah-ê suaⁿ huat-tshut to-kiàm lâi kong-kik Go͘k; ta̍k lâng ē īng i ê to-kiàm thâi i ê hiann-tī.
English: I will call for a sword against him to all my mountains, says the Lord Yahweh: every man's sword shall be against his brother.

Tailo: Tshân-iá ê tshiū-ba̍k lóng ē tsai, Guá — Siōngtsú hō͘ kuân ê tshiū kàng kē, kē ê tshiū sing kuân, tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū ta-.khì, ta-.khì ê tshiū bō͘-sīng. Guá — Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, mā án-ne kā i tsiânn.
English: All the trees of the field shall know that I, Yahweh, have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree to flourish; I, Yahweh, have spoken and have done it.

Tailo: Lí siu-huê Lí it-tshè ê siū-khì, suah Lí ki̍k-lia̍t ê siū-khì.
English: You have taken away all your wrath. You have turned from the fierceness of your anger.

Tailo: Tû-pâng-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h bāng kái liáu hó, tsiū kā Iôséhuh kóng, Guá mā tī guá ê bāng tiong khuànn-kìnn, tī guá ê thâu-khak tíng ū saⁿ-khing piak ê piáⁿ,
English: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, I also was in my dream, and behold, three baskets of white bread were on my head.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtè kā I thê-sing kàu siōng kuân ê tē-uī, siúⁿ-sù I tshiau-ua̍t bān-miâ ê miâ.
English: Therefore God also highly exalted him, and gave to him the name which is above every name;

Tailo: Si-óng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, i ê suí tsuân-pō͘ bô-.khì; i ê kuì-tso̍k tshin-tshiūnn tshuē bô tsháu-tiûⁿ ê lo̍k. In bô khuì-la̍t, siū kuáⁿ tī jiok i ê lâng bīn-tsîng.
English: From the daughter of Zion all her majesty is departed: Her princes are become like harts that find no pasture, They are gone without strength before the pursuer.

Tailo: In-uī lín ū jīn-bat Siōngtè kah lán ê Tsú Iésu, guān lín tit-tio̍h hong-hong hù-hù ê un-tián kah pîng-an!
English: Grace to you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h sì-ê sai-hū.
English: Yahweh showed me four craftsmen.

Tailo: Iésu koh īng phì-jū kā in kóng, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng khai-khún tsi̍t tè phû-tô hn̂g, īng tshiûⁿ-uî á uî khí-.lâi, ó͘ tsi̍t-ê khang lâi tsò tsiú-khut, koh khí tsi̍t tsō tsiú-keⁿ lâu, jiân-āu tso͘ hō͘ tshân-tiān, tsiū khì pa̍t-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He began to speak to them in parables. A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the winepress, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

Tailo: In-khîn kè-uē ē tit-tio̍h tshiong-sīng; sò-sìng ê lâng ē tì-kàu khiàm-khueh.
English: The plans of the diligent surely lead to profit; And everyone who is hasty surely rushes to poverty.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Ai-ah! Tsit-ê sè-tāi ê lâng ná ē hiah-ni̍h bô sìn-sim? Guá tio̍h koh kah lín tuà guā kú? Guá tio̍h koh jím-nāi lín guā kú? Tshuā lí hit-ê hō͘ kuí hū-sin ê kiáⁿ lâi guá tsia.
English: He answered him, Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín ê gín-á, to̍h-sī lín só͘ kóng ē hông lia̍h-.khì ê, Guá ē tshuā in ji̍p-.khì, in tsiū tsai sī lín só͘ khì-sak hit-ê tē.
English: But your little ones, that you said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which you have rejected.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē lín tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, in-uī Jîn-tsú teh beh hō͘ lâng tshut-bē kau khì hō͘ lâng ê tshiú-thâu ā.
English: Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.

Tailo: Tsuân-lîng Siōngtè tī hit lāi-bīn kuáⁿ-suàⁿ lia̍t ông ê sî, sè-bīn tshin-tshiūnn Sal-mòng suaⁿ teh lo̍h seh.
English: When the Almighty scattered kings in her, It snowed on Zalmon.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Abúlâm kóng, Lí it-tīng tio̍h tsai, lí ê kiáⁿ-sun ē tshut-guā tī pa̍t lâng ê tē, koh ho̍k-sāi hit só͘-tsāi ê lâng; hit só͘-tsāi ê lâng ē kā in khó͘-to̍k sì-pah nî.
English: He said to Abram, Know for sure that your seed will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years.

Tailo: Kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê lâng, bē kè-sio̍k huān tsuē; kè-sio̍k huān tsuē ê lâng, m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ki-tok, mā lóng m̄-bat I.
English: Whoever remains in him doesn't sin. Whoever sins hasn't seen him, neither knows him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h bîn-á-tsài lâi tshau-huân. Bîn-á-tsài ê tāi-tsì bîn-á-tsài tsiah lâi tshau-huân; tsi̍t ji̍t ê kan-khó͘ tsi̍t ji̍t tng.
English: Therefore don't be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day's own evil is sufficient.

Tailo: Guá tò tńg-.khì ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, tī hô piⁿ siang pîng ū tsin tsē tshiū-ba̍k.
English: Now when I had returned, behold, on the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.

Tailo: Asel mā bô kā A-kho tuà tī Sitòng, A-hik-la̍h, Ak-tsip, Hik-pa, A-hut-kik kah Le-hap ê jîn-bîn kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Asher didn't drive out the inhabitants of Acco, nor the inhabitants of Sidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob;

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tshing-khì hit king tshù, tio̍h tshú nn̄g tsiah tsiáu kah pik-hiuⁿ tshâ, tsu-âng sik liāu kah gû-tshik-tsháu.
English: To cleanse the house he shall take two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.

Tailo: Sian-ang-á ē-tàng īng tshiú lia̍h, tsóng-.sī, in tuà tī ông-kiong lāi.
English: You can catch a lizard with your hands, Yet it is in kings' palaces.

Tailo: Koh tī huē-tn̂g lāi ài tsē kuân uī, tī iàn-si̍k tsē tuā-uī.
English: and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh mn̄g Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú ìn kóng, Lí khí-.lâi, lo̍h-khì Keilah, in-uī Guá beh kā Huilīsū lâng kau tī lí ê tshiú.
English: Then David inquired of Yahweh yet again. Yahweh answered him, and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into your hand.

Tailo: Sim lāi ê pì-bi̍t tsiū ē hián-lō͘ tshut-.lâi, ē phak lo̍h-khì kìng-pài Siōngtè, kóng, Siōngtè tsin-tsiàⁿ tī lín tiong-kan!
English: And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. So he will fall down on his face and worship God, declaring that God is among you indeed.

Tailo: Hok-kok kah i ê kau-iá, Le-hap kah i ê kau-iá;
English: and Hukok with its suburbs, and Rehob with its suburbs;

Tailo: I īng hué-hu tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h, i ê sim hun-bê, hō͘ i phian-siâ, i bē-tàng ka-kī kiù, mā bē-tàng kóng, Guá ê tsiàⁿ tshiú lāi kám m̄-sī ū pe̍h-tsha̍t?
English: He feeds on ashes; a deceived heart has turned him aside; and he can't deliver his soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?

Tailo: Iésu án-ne kóng liáu tsiū kā tshiú kah kha hō͘ in khuànn.
English: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

Tailo: I koh thìng-hāu tshit ji̍t, pàng hún-tsiáu tshut-.khì, hún-tsiáu lóng bô koh tńg-.lâi.
English: He stayed yet another seven days, and sent forth the dove; and she didn't return to him any more.

Tailo: Tē-peh ji̍t, ông tshe jîn-bîn suàⁿ-.khì; in tsiū kā ông tsiok-hok; in-uī Siōngtsú tuì I ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t kah I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael só͘ si-tshut it-tshè ê un-huī, in tsiū huann-hí, sim-lāi khuài-lo̍k, ta̍k-ê tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: On the eighth day he sent the people away; and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that Yahweh had shown to David his servant, and to Israel his people.

Tailo: Iésu koh kè-sio̍k kóng, Lín koh thiaⁿ tsi̍t-ê phì-jū, ū tsi̍t-ê hn̂g-tsú khai-khún tsi̍t tè phû-tô hn̂g, īng lî-pa uî khí-.lâi, lāi-bīn ó͘ tsi̍t-ê tsiú-khut, khí tsi̍t-ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu. I kā tsit tè hn̂g tso͘ hō͘ tshân-tiān, tsiū tshut-khì lí-hîng.
English: Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá khǹg lín tio̍h tsia̍h, tse sī kuan-hē lín ê tit-kiù, in-uī lín bô kah tsi̍t-ê lâng ē sit-lo̍h tsi̍t ki thâu-mn̂g.
English: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety; for not a hair will perish from any of your heads.

Tailo: Siāng khuán, tiōng-hu tio̍h thiàⁿ ka-kī ê hū-jîn-lâng tshin-tshiūnn thiàⁿ ka-kī ê sing-khu; thiàⁿ ka-kī ê hū-jîn-lâng to̍h-sī thiàⁿ ka-kī.
English: Even so ought husbands also to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Lí kiânn tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, sī pà-sìng îm-hū ê só͘ kiâⁿ, khó-kiàn lí ê sim sī guā luán-jio̍k!
English: How weak is your heart, says the Lord Yahweh, seeing you do all these things, the work of an impudent prostitute;

Tailo: Lâng in-uī tshuì só͘ kiat ê kué-tsí ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì muá-muá; lâng tsiàu i tshiú só͘ tsò ê tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ.
English: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth. The work of a man's hands shall be rewarded to him.

Tailo: Kong-gī pó-hō͘ kiânn tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng; siâ-ok pāi-huāi huān tsuē ê lâng.
English: Righteousness guards the way of integrity, But wickedness overthrows the sinner.

Tailo: Lí in-uī sim-lāi só͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê, ba̍k-tsiu só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê, tsá-khí sî ē kóng, ' Khó͘ bē-tàng tsit sî thiⁿ àm! ' Àm-sî ē kóng, ' Khó͘ bē-tàng tsit sî thiⁿ-kng! '
English: In the morning you shall say, Would it were even! and at even you shall say, Would it were morning! for the fear of your heart which you shall fear, and for the sight of your eyes which you shall see.

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng mn̄g i kóng, Kā lí kóng, ' Giâ pho͘-á khí-lâi kiâⁿ. 'ê sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Then they asked him, Who is the man who said to you, Take up your mat, and walk'?

Tailo: Liân guá tī The-sa-lô-nî-ke ê sî, lín mā kuí-nā pái tshe lâng lâi kiong-kip guá ê su-iàu.
English: For even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to my need.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h sian-ti ê miâ lâi kā i tsiap-la̍p ê lâng, ē-tàng hun-hióng sian-ti ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward: and he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward.

Tailo: Guá mā beh tsò tāi-tsì lâi huán-tuì lín, Guá pún-sin beh in-uī lín ê tsuē, kā lín phah tshit puē tāng.
English: then I will also walk contrary to you; and I will strike you, even I, seven times for your sins.

Tailo: Τī Isulael tiong, i ê miâ ē hông kiò-tsò ' thǹg-ê ê lâng ê ke'.
English: His name shall be called in Israel, The house of him who has his shoe untied.

Tailo: Lí-pī tsò-.lâng tiāⁿ-tio̍h, iáu-buē siū sio̍k, buē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, lâng nā kah i kiânn kan-îm, nn̄g lâng tio̍h siū hîng-hua̍t, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang hō͘ i sí, in-uī lú-pī iáu-buē tit-tio̍h tsū-iû.
English: If a man lies carnally with a woman who is a slave girl, pledged to be married to another man, and not ransomed, or given her freedom; they shall be punished. They shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

Tailo: Tī hit ji̍t, lín ē kóng: Tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú, kiû-kiò I ê miâ, kā I só͘ kiâⁿ ê tī lia̍t pang tiong suan-iông, kóng-khí I ê miâ í-king siū tsun-tsò kuân.
English: In that day you will say, Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name. Declare his doings among the peoples. Proclaim that his name is exalted!

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê kah i ê lîng-li̍k, i án-tsuáⁿ kau-tsiàn, án-tsuáⁿ huê-ho̍k Ta-má-su-ko kah Hamat, to̍h-sī tsá-tsîng sio̍k Iôtah ê, hō͘ in koh kui Isulael, kám bô lóng kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might, how he warred, and how he recovered Damascus, and Hamath, which had belonged to Judah, for Israel, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: I tī bîn-tshn̂g tíng iáu-teh tô͘-bô͘ tsuē-ok; i kuat-tīng beh kiânn pháiⁿ lō͘, i bô thó-ià pháiⁿ tāi.
English: He plots iniquity on his bed. He sets himself in a way that is not good; He doesn't abhor evil.

Tailo: Siōng-Tsú kóng, Kàu hit ji̍t, Tabi̍t í-king tó-.khì ê pò͘-pênn, Guá beh koh kā i khiā khí-.lâi, mā beh pó͘ i ê phuà-khiah, beh khí i hiah-ê tó-huāi ê, lâi kā i kiàn-li̍p khí-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn í-tsîng án-ne.
English: In that day I will raise up the tent of David who is fallen, and close up its breaches, and I will raise up its ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín bē-tàng koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h hi-ké, mā bē-tàng koh tsiam-pok. Guá beh kiù Guá ê tsú-bîn thuat-lī lín ê tshiú. Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: Therefore you shall no more see false visions, nor practice divination. I will deliver my people out of your hand; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Αpsalôm ua̍h-.leh ê sî, tī ông ê suaⁿ-kok uī ka-kī khiā tsi̍t ki thiāu, in-uī i kóng, Guá bô kiáⁿ thang lâu guá ê miâ. Tsiū īng ka-kī ê miâ tshing hit ki thiāu, kàu kin-á-ji̍t kiò-tsò Αpsalôm ê kì-liām pi.
English: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself the pillar, which is in the king's dale; for he said, I have no son to keep my name in memory: and he called the pillar after his own name; and it is called Absalom's monument, to this day.

Tailo: O̍h uē ê lâng ê giân-gí tshin-tshiūnn hó tsia̍h ê mi̍h, tshim-ji̍p lâng ê pak-tó͘ lāi.
English: The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: They go down into a person's innermost parts.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn kā Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ Ehuahátsuh siat-li̍p tsò ông, tī Êlúsalèm suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē.
English: Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and made him king in his father's place in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh tuì Guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē pue̍h in ê kin, jî-tshiánn Guá uī ka-kī ê miâ só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê tsit king tiān, mā beh tuì Guá ê bīn-tsîng kā i khì-sak, hō͘ i tī bān-kok tiong tsiâⁿ-tsò uē-pèⁿ lâi siū khau-sé.
English: then will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have made holy for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and I will make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.

Tailo: Guán tuì lín kóng kuan-hē lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê tuā kuân-lîng kah tsài-lîm, m̄-sī kin-kì kî-khiáu hi-ké ê thuân-suat, sī guán ū tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê tuā ui-giâm.
English: For we did not follow cunningly devised fables, when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Tailo: Lāu-pē kā i kóng, ' Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tsò-hué, guá só͘-ū ê tsâi-sán lóng sī lí ê.
English: He said to him, Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Siōngtè īng sè-kan lâng khuàⁿ-tsò gōng ê, lâi hō͘ tì-huī ê lâng kiàn-siàu, mā īng sè-kan lâng khuàⁿ-tsò luán-jio̍k ê, lâi hō͘ ióng-tsòng ê lâng kiàn-siàu;
English: but God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise. God chose the weak things of the world, that he might put to shame the things that are strong;

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit-ê tuì lú-pī seⁿ ê sī tsiàu sio̍k-sè lâi seⁿ, hit-ê tuì tsū-iû ê tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ ê sī tuì Siōngtè ê ìng-ín lâi seⁿ.
English: However, the son by the handmaid was born according to the flesh, but the son by the free woman was born through promise.

Tailo: Ehulaim ê tsuì-hàn, i kiau-ngō͘-ê bián-liû ē siū ta̍h tī kha tsîng.
English: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden under foot.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t, Sàulô ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan kā gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Lâi, lán lâi-khì hit pîng, kàu Huilīsū lâng kun-iâⁿ hia. Tsóng-.sī, i bô kā in lāu-pē kóng.
English: Now it fell on a day, that Jonathan the son of Saul said to the young man who bore his armor, Come, and let us go over to the Philistines' garrison, that is on yonder side. But he didn't tell his father.

Tailo: Guân-khí-thâu, Siōngtè tshòng-tsō thiⁿ kah tē ê sî,
English: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

Tailo: tuì i kóng, Hitsekia án-ne kóng, ' Kin-á-ji̍t sī huān-lān tsik-hua̍t lîng-jio̍k ê ji̍t, sī tshin-tshiūnn kiáⁿ beh tshut-sì, ā bô la̍t thang seⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: They said to him, Thus says Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of rejection; for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Mô͘se tsiū siá tsit-ê kua, īng lâi kà-sī Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: So Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.

Tailo: Iésu hiòng tsîng kiânn, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g-ê hiaⁿ-tī-á, Tse-beh-tái ê kiáⁿ Iâkop kah i ê sió-tī Iô-há-neh. In kah lāu-pē Tse-beh-tái tī tsûn tíng teh pó͘ bāng. Iésu mā tsio in lâi tuè I.
English: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.

Tailo: Ióng-sū ná ē tó tī tsiàn-tīn! Ionáthan siū thâi tī lí ê suaⁿ-thâu.
English: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! Jonathan is slain on your high places.

Tailo: Hiàn-sin-tsiá-tio̍h tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu thì ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê thâu, kā ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê thâu-mn̂g hē tī siā-un-tsè ē-bīn ê hué tíng.
English: The Nazirite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.

Tailo: Kàu ji̍t àm, lí tio̍h tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, phāinn tī king-kah-thâu tshut-.khì, mā tio̍h tà lí ê bīn, tà kàu bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h tē, in-uī Guá beh īng lí tsò Isulael tsú-bîn ê tiāu-thâu.
English: In their sight shall you bear it on your shoulder, and carry it forth in the dark; you shall cover your face, that you don't see the land: for I have set you for a sign to the house of Israel.

Tailo: Guá thiàⁿ Siōngtsú, in-uī I thiaⁿ guá ê uē, thiaⁿ guá ê khún-kiû.
English: I love Yahweh, because he listens to my voice, And my cries for mercy.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan, kah Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn, í-ki̍p Isulael ê tsú-bîn, pi-ai, thî-khàu, kìm-tsia̍h kàu ji̍t àm, in-uī in tó tī to hā.
English: and they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of Yahweh, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

Tailo: I kā in kau hō͘ guā-pang lâng ê tshiú; uàn-hūn in ê lâng tsiū kā in kuán-hat.
English: He gave them into the hand of the nations. Those who hated them ruled over them.

Tailo: Mánáse kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê kah i só͘ huān ê tsuē, kám bô lóng kì tī Iôtah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Atah seⁿ Iâ-bal, i tsiâⁿ-tsò tuà pò͘-pênn tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lâng ê tsó͘-sian.
English: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.

Tailo: Sì-bīn uî ê tshù hiah-ê pâng-king, sio-lī jī-tsa̍p tiú ê khuah.
English: Between the chambers was a breadth of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iésu tuì hiah-ê lâng kóng, Lín gia̍h to kah thuî-á tshut-lâi lia̍h guá, tshin-tshiūnn beh lia̍h thó͘-huí, sī-.bô? Guá ta̍k ji̍t tī sìng-tiān lāi tsē-.leh kà-sī lâng, lín bô lâi kā guá lia̍h.
English: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn't arrest me.

Tailo: Hilâm koh kóng, Tshòng-tsō thiⁿ-tē ê Siōngtsú, Isulael ê Siōngtè, sī ing-kai o-ló ê! I siúⁿ-sù Tabi̍t ông tsi̍t-ê tì-huī ê kiáⁿ, hō͘ i ū tshong-bîng gâu kè-bô͘, thang uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú khí tiān koh uī i ê kok khí hông-kiong.
English: Huram continued, Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who has given to David the king a wise son, endowed with discretion and understanding, that should build a house for Yahweh, and a house for his kingdom.

Tailo: Io-si-iah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Iôtah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Samuel kóng,
English: Then came the word of Yahweh to Samuel, saying,

Tailo: Ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì tio̍h tsiàu tia̍t-sū, kui-kui kú-kú lâi tsò.
English: Let all things be done decently and in order.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng hiah-ê siú-líng khì kìⁿ hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, tuì i kóng, Lí tio̍h làu Sâmsóng, khuànn i ê tuā khuì-la̍t tsāi tī tó-uī, guán án-tsuáⁿ tsiah ē iâⁿ i, thang kā i pa̍k khí-lâi hō͘ i khùn-khó͘, guán tsiū ē ta̍k lâng hō͘ lí tsi̍t-tshing tsi̍t-pah gîn.
English: The lords of the Philistines came up to her, and said to her, Entice him, and see in which his great strength lies, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him: and we will each give you of us eleven hundred pieces of silver.

Tailo: I suî-sî tuè i khì, tshin-tshiūnn gû hông khan-khì thâi, koh tshin-tshiūnn gōng lâng tuà só-liān khì siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: He followed her immediately, As an ox goes to the slaughter, As a fool stepping into a noose.

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn beh in-uī Siōngtsú lâi khua-kháu; khiam-pi ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h mā ē huaⁿ-hí.
English: My soul shall boast in Yahweh. The humble shall hear of it, and be glad.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng kóng, Guán tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè lâi hîng I? Ìn kóng, Τio̍h īng kim lia̍p-á gō͘ lia̍p, kim niáu-tshí gō͘ tsiah, tsiàu Huilīsū siú-líng ê sò͘-gia̍h, in-uī lín kah lín ê siú-líng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tsai-hō sio-siâng.
English: Then they said, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him? They said, Five golden tumors, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ông hun-pia̍t Siōngtsú tiān tsîng īⁿ tiong ê só͘-tsāi uī sìng, tī hia hiàn sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê iû, in-uī Siōngtsú thâu-tsîng ê tâng-tuâⁿ siuⁿ sè, bē iông-ín tit hiah-ê sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê iû.
English: The same day did the king make the middle of the court holy that was before the house of Yahweh; for there he offered the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar that was before Yahweh was too little to receive the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings.

Tailo: Gōng lâng kóng tuā-uē sī bô sik-ha̍p, ū tō-tik ê lâng kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t koh khah bô sik-ha̍p.
English: Arrogant speech isn't fitting for a fool, Much less do lying lips fit a prince.

Tailo: koh tī Iôtah suaⁿ-tē khí siâⁿ, tī tshiū-nâ lāi khí iâⁿ-tsē kah bāng-ko lâu.
English: Moreover he built cities in the hill country of Judah, and in the forests he built castles and towers.

Tailo: I tī hiann-tī tiong, suî-jiân kiat kué-tsí tsin tsē, tsóng-.sī, ē ū tang hong tshue-.lâi, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú ê hong tuì khòng-iá tshue-.khí, i ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ ē ta-.khì, i ê guân-thâu ē tuān-tsua̍t, i ē tshiúⁿ-tua̍t só͘ tsik-tsū só͘-ū thang huann-hí ê pó-khì.
English: Though he is fruitful among his brothers, an east wind will come, The breath of Yahweh coming up from the wilderness; And his spring will become dry, And his fountain will be dried up. He will plunder the storehouse of treasure.

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Lóng bô gī lâng, liân tsi̍t-ê to bô!
English: As it is written, There is no one righteous. No, not one.

Tailo: I suî-jiân īng kuí-tsà am-khàm ka-kī ê uàn-hūn, I ê pháiⁿ ē tī huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng lō͘-hiān.
English: His malice may be concealed by deception, But his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.

Tailo: In tsiū khì thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē, tuì Tsîn ê khòng-iá kàu Le-hap, kàu ji̍p Hamat ê lō͘-kháu.
English: So they went up, and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to the entrance of Hamath.

Tailo: Jiânāu lí thang khuànn guán ê bīn-māu kah hiah-ê tsia̍h ông hó mi̍h ê siàu-liân lâng ê bīn-māu, tsiū tsiàu lí só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi khuán-thāi lí tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k!
English: Then let our faces be looked on before you, and the face of the youths who eat of the king's dainties; and as you see, deal with your servants.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ū un-huī, ū liân-bín; bô khuài siū-khì, ū tuā tsû-ài.
English: Yahweh is gracious, merciful, Slow to anger, and of great loving kindness.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tshénn khí-lâi liáu-āu, tsiū tsiàu Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài só͘ bīng-līng ê, khì tshuā Mâlíah lâi tsò bó͘.
English: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;

Tailo: Tī só͘-ū ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê ji̍t, kiàn-nā phû-tô tshiū só͘ tshut ê, tuì hu̍t kàu phuê lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is made of the grapevine, from the seeds even to the skins.

Tailo: Koh kā i tsò nn̄g-ê kim-khuân, an-tì tī khí-suàⁿ ê ē-bīn, tsò tī tuâⁿ ê siang pîng nn̄g ki huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ ê tíng-bīn, tsiah-ê khuân sī tsò tshng kǹg ê lō͘-īng, thang kng tuâⁿ.
English: He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it.

Tailo: I ê tsìng sù-tsiá, lín tio̍h o-ló I! I ê tsìng thian-kun, lín tio̍h o-ló I!
English: Praise him, all his angels! Praise him, all his army!

Tailo: Tng Iétsebel thâi Siōngtsú tsìng sian-ti ê sî, guá só͘ tsò ê kám bô lâng kā guá ê tsú kóng? Tsiū-sī guá kā Siōngtsú ê sian-ti tsi̍t pah lâng tshàng tī tōng-.ni̍h, gō͘-tsa̍p lâng tsò tsi̍t tso͘, īng piáⁿ kah tsuí kā in iúⁿ-tshī.
English: Wasn't it told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of Yahweh, how I hid one hundred men of Yahweh's prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?

Tailo: Hit sî, Iésu hō͘ Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá kah muá-sim huann-hí, kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú, guá o-ló Lí, in-uī Lí kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tuì tì-huī tshong-bîng ê lâng am-khàm khí-.lâi, khiok tuì sè-hàn gín-á ū hián-bîng tshut-.lâi. Thiⁿ-pē ah, sī lah, in-uī tse sī Lí khuàⁿ-tsò huann-hí ê.
English: In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.

Tailo: Koh īng tuì Sìng Sîn só͘ tit-tio̍h it-tshè ê tô͘-iūⁿ, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tiān ê īⁿ, sì-kho͘-uî ê pâng, Siōngtsú tiān ê kim-khò͘ kah sìng-mi̍h ê kim-khò͘ tsiah-ê tô͘-iūⁿ lóng kau hō͘ i;
English: and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of Yahweh, and for all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;

Tailo: Τio̍h tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ beh kíng-suán ê só͘-tsāi, piak lâi tsia̍h, keh kang tsá-khí lí ua̍t tńg-khì lí ê pò͘-pênn.
English: You shall roast and eat it in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose: and you shall turn in the morning, and go to your tents.

Tailo: In só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê sī hi-ké, sī pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsiam-pok. In kóng tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê, kî-si̍t Siōngtsú bô tshe in tsò sian-ti, in iáu teh ǹg-bāng hit-ê uē ē ìng-giām.
English: They have seen falsehood and lying divination, who say, Yahweh says; but Yahweh has not sent them: and they have made men to hope that the word would be confirmed.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Guá bat tsai-tsìng lí, lí sī siōng-tíng ê phû-tô tshiū, tsuân-jiân sī tsin ê tsíng-tsí; lí tuì tī Guá, ná ē piàn-tsò pa̍t khuán phû-tô tshiū ê pháiⁿ ki?
English: Yet I had planted you a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then are you turned into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine to me?

Tailo: Só͘-í, sî-ki iáu-buē kàu, lín m̄-thang phue-phîng lâng. Tán kàu Tsú tsài-lîm ê sî, I ē īng kng tsiò o͘-àm ún-ba̍t ê pì-bi̍t, kā ún-tsông tī sim-lāi ê kè-bô͘ hián-lō͘ tshut-.lâi. Hit sî, ta̍k lâng ē tuì Siōngtè tit-tio̍h I ê o-ló.
English: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each man will get his praise from God.

Tailo: Só͘ kí-khí ê thuí kah só͘ iô ê hing, in tio̍h kah hué-tsè ê iû tsò-hué tuà-.lâi, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng iô lâi tsò iô-tsè; tse tio̍h kui lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ, tsò íng-uán tit-tio̍h ê hūn-gia̍h, lóng sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng ê.
English: The heaved thigh and the waved breast they shall bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before Yahweh: and it shall be yours, and your sons' with you, as a portion forever; as Yahweh has commanded.

Tailo: Ū ê lâng kóng, Uī-tio̍h ki-hng, guán kā guán ê tshân-hn̂g, phû-tô hn̂g kah tshù-the̍h the̍h-khì tián-tǹg hō͘ lâng, lâi tit-tio̍h ngó͘-kok.
English: Some also there were that said, We are mortgaging our fields, and our vineyards, and our houses: let us get grain, because of the dearth.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā lâng só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê mi̍h lóng tio̍h kui hō͘ tsè-si, lâng īng siáⁿ-mi̍h hō͘ tsè-si ê, lóng tio̍h kui tī i.
English: Every man's holy things shall be his: whatever any man gives the priest, it shall be his.

Tailo: tse mā sī sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ing-kai pān ê tsuē, in-uī guá án-ne tsò sī puē-gi̍k tī tíng-bīn ê Siōngtè.
English: This also would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges; For I should have denied the God who is above.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, lín tio̍h ū sìng-huē, tio̍h khik-khó͘ ka-kī ê sim, lóng m̄-thang tsò-kang.
English: On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation; and you shall afflict your souls: you shall do no manner of work;

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-ê khit-tsia̍h miâ kiò-tsò La̍h-tsa-lō͘, kui sing-khu seⁿ kah tsuân liàp-á, tó tī hit-ê hó-gia̍h lâng ê mn̂g-kháu,
English: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was laid at his gate, full of sores,

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lāu-bú, tse kah lí guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuan-hē? Guá ê sî iáu-buē kàu.
English: Jesus said to her, Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael mā ē ka-kī tuà tsē-tsē ji̍t, bô kun-ông, bô siú-líng, bô tsè-sū, bô tiau-khik ê thiāu, bô tsè-si ho̍k, tshù lāi mā bô ngó͘-siōng.
English: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without king, and without prince, and without sacrifice, and without sacred stone, and without ephod or idols.

Tailo: Piⁿ-pâng ê tiong-pâng ê mn̂g, sī tī tiān ê tsiànn pîng, tuì kńg-lê-thui tsiūⁿ tiong-tsàn, tuì tiong-tsàn koh tsiūⁿ-kàu tē-saⁿ tsàn.
English: The door for the middle side chambers was in the right side of the house: and they went up by winding stairs into the middle story, and out of the middle into the third.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng ū huat-tshut bīng-līng, nā ū lâng tsai Iésu tī tó-uī, tio̍h lâi pò-kò, hō͘ in thang khì kā I lia̍h khí-.lâi.
English: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.

Tailo: Guá lâu ba̍k-sái, īng kìm-tsia̍h lâi khik-khó͘ guá ê sim, tse tian-tò hō͘ guá siū tsìng lâng lîng-jio̍k.
English: When I wept and I fasted, That was to my reproach.

Tailo: kā in kóng, Lín m̄-thang ah só͘ lia̍h ê lâng ji̍p-lâi tsia, in-uī lín só͘ siūⁿ beh tsò ê sī ē hō͘ guán tik-tsuē Siōngtsú, ke-thinn guán ê tsuē-kò kah guán ê kuè-sit, in-uī guán ê kuè-sit tsin tuā, í-king ū Siōngtè ê tuā siū-khì lîm-kàu Isulael à.
English: and said to them, You shall not bring in the captives here: for you purpose that which will bring on us a trespass against Yahweh, to add to our sins and to our trespass; for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.

Tailo: Lí nā sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, tsiah-ê kok pí guá khah tuā, guá ná ē-tàng kā in kuáⁿ-tio̍k?
English: If you shall say in your heart, These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?

Tailo: In thiaⁿ He-lo̍t ê uē tsiū tshut-huat. In tī tang-hong khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê hit lia̍p tsheⁿ, hut-jiân tuà thâu-tsîng teh kā in tshuā-lō͘, lâi-kàu hit-ê enn-á ê só͘-tsāi, tsiū thîng tuà hit tíng-bīn.
English: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú! Tio̍h tshiùnn sin ê kua o-ló Siōngtsú, tī sìng ê tsú-bîn tsū-huē tiong o-ló I!
English: Praise Yahweh! Sing to Yahweh a new song, His praise in the assembly of the saints.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Alâm lâng nā pí guá khah kiông, lí tio̍h lâi pang-tsān guá; Ammóng lâng nā pí lí khah kiông, guá tsiū khì pang-tsān lí.
English: He said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for you, then I will help you.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū lâng khí-lâi kā lí jiok, siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā, tsóng-.sī, guá ê tsú ê sèⁿ-miā ē tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè hia, pau tī ua̍h-miā ê pau lāi; lí ê tuì-ti̍k ê sèⁿ-miā, Siōngtsú ē kā i hìⁿ tshut-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tuì hìⁿ soh ê tiong-kan hìⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Though men be risen up to pursue you, and to seek your soul, yet the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with Yahweh your God; and the souls of your enemies, them shall he sling out, as from the hollow of a sling.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t guá nā beh khua-kháu, mā bô sǹg sī khong-khám, in-uī guá beh kóng ê sī sū-si̍t; tsóng-.sī, guá ka-kī iok-sok, tsiah bián hō͘ lâng tuì guá ê phue-phîng, tshiau-kuè i só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê.
English: For if I would desire to boast, I will not be foolish; for I will speak the truth. But I refrain, so that no man may think more of me than that which he sees in me, or hears from me.

Tailo: Nā án-ne kóng-khí-.lâi, hiah-ê thún-ta̍h Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, biáu-sī hō͘ in pún-sin sìng-huà kui Tsú ê iok ê hueh, koh bú-jio̍k si un ê Sìng Sîn ê lâng, lín siūⁿ in ing-kai siū ê hîng-hua̍t tio̍h ke guā tāng?
English: How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?

Tailo: Tsò sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ, tsóng-kiōng gû-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah, iûⁿ-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tsa̍p-jī tsiah kah tsò-hué hiàn ê sò͘-tsè tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah;
English: all the oxen for the burnt offering twelve bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs a year old twelve, and their meal offering; and the male goats for a sin offering twelve;

Tailo: Guá tsai lí ê só͘ tsò. Lí khuàⁿ, guá í-king tī lí ê bīn-tsîng kā lí khui tsi̍t sìⁿ mn̂g, sī bô lâng ē-tàng kuainn ê. Guá mā tsai lí kan-taⁿ ū tām-po̍h-á khuì-la̍t, khiok ū tsun-siú guá ê tō-lí, m̄-bat hó͘nn-jīn guá ê miâ.
English: I know your works (behold, I have set before you an open door, which no one can shut), that you have a little power, and kept my word, and didn't deny my name.

Tailo: Mô͘se án-ne kiânn, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Thus did Moses: as Yahweh commanded him, so did he.

Tailo: In khan tshit tsiah gû-káng, tshit tsiah iûⁿ-káng, tshit tsiah mî-iûⁿ-á, tshit tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, beh uī kok, uī sìng-só͘, uī Iôtah, hiàn tsò sio̍k-tsuē ê tsè. Ông bīng-līng Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun hiah-ê tsè-si, kā in hiàn tī Siōngtsú ê tuâⁿ.
English: They brought seven bulls, and seven rams, and seven lambs, and seven male goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom and for the sanctuary and for Judah. He commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit pún tio̍h hē tī i hia, tsi̍t-sì-lâng tio̍h tha̍k, thang ha̍k-si̍p kìng-uì Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, tio̍h tsip-siú tsit-ê lu̍t-huat só͘-ū ê uē kah tsiah-ê lu̍t-lē, lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: and it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life; that he may learn to fear Yahweh his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them;

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Tshut-tsāi hiah-ê lîng-sìng-siōng ê sí-lâng khì bâi-tsòng in jio̍k-thé siōng ê sí-lâng, m̄-koh, lí tio̍h khì thuân pò Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê hok-im.
English: But Jesus said to him, Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Tsiū tshe lâng the̍h hit niá tshái-sik ê saⁿ khì in lāu-pē hia, kóng, Guán tshuē-tio̍h tsit niá saⁿ, tshiáⁿ lí jīn khuànn sī lí ê kiáⁿ ê guā-saⁿ-á m̄-sī?
English: They took the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father, and said, We have found this. Examine it, now, whether it is your son's coat or not.

Tailo: In khau-sé lâng, tsiàu pháiⁿ ì-sù kóng tsè-ap lâng ê uē; in kóng tuā-uē.
English: They scoff and speak with malice. In arrogance, they threaten oppression.

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng siū lîng-jio̍k lâi kiàn-siàu! Guān hiah-ê kè-bô͘ hām-hāi guá ê lâng ua̍t tò tńg-khì lâi làu-khuì!
English: Let those who seek after my soul be disappointed and brought to dishonor. Let those who plot my ruin be turned back and confounded.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ guá ê kiàn-tsìng tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h, guá pó-jīn ê lâng tī tíng-bīn.
English: Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven. He who vouches for me is on high.

Tailo: Guá siūⁿ, tī guá iáu ua̍h-.leh ê sî, guá ing-kai tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā lín thê-tshéⁿ.
English: I think it right, as long as I am in this tent, to stir you up by reminding you;

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn sing-khu nā bô lîng-hûn to̍h-sī sí-.khì, sìn-gióng nā bô hîng-tōng mā sī sí-.khì.
English: For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead.

Tailo: Sàulô tsiū khí-.lâi, tshuā Isulael tiong kíng-suán ê ping saⁿ tshing, lo̍h-khì kàu Ji-hu ê khòng-iá, beh tī Ji-hu ê khòng-iá tshuē Tabi̍t.
English: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.

Tailo: Ta-ke khuàⁿ-tio̍h i kuat-ì beh kah i khì, tsiū bô koh tuì i kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: When she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, she left off speaking to her.

Tailo: Tsit kuàn phang-iû ē-tàng bē tsin tsē tsînn lâi kiù-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng.
English: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōngtè ah, taⁿ guá kiû Lí ba̍k-tsiu khuànn, hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ, tī tsit só͘-tsāi só͘ hiàn ê kî-tó.
English: Now, my God, let, I beg you, your eyes be open, and let your ears be attentive, to the prayer that is made in this place.

Tailo: Tsetikiah tsē-uī ê sî, jī-tsa̍p it huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông tsa̍p-it nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Hamutal, sī Lipnah lâng I-é-lí-miah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê tsìⁿ siā tshut kng, Lí ê tshiuⁿ ê kng iām-iām sih, ji̍t kah gue̍h thîng-tsí tī i ê uī-tì.
English: The sun and moon stood still in the sky, At the light of your arrows as they went, At the shining of your glittering spear.

Tailo: Lín ū thé-thiap siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê lâng, lín mā ū lún siū lâng tshiúⁿ-tua̍t lín ê sán-gia̍p, in-uī lín tsai ka-kī ū koh khah hó koh kú-tn̂g ê sán-gia̍p.
English: For you both had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in the heavens.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se tuì Ka-té-si Bal-né-ah tshe guá lâi thau-khuàⁿ tsit-ê tē, hit sî guá tú-á sì-tsa̍p huè, guá tsīn guá ê sim kā i huê-hok.
English: Forty years old was I when Moses the servant of Yahweh sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land; and I brought him word again as it was in my heart.

Tailo: Guán ê tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ tng siàu-liân ê sî, tshin-tshiūnn tshiū-á tuā tsâng; guán ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tshù-kak ê tsio̍h-thiāu, tsiàu khí ông-kiong ê khuán-sit tiau-tok.
English: Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants, Our daughters like pillars carved to adorn a palace.

Tailo: Sâmsóng ìn kóng, Lâng nā īng m̄-bat īng kuè ê sin soh-á pa̍k guá, guá tsiū ē luán-jio̍k tshin-tshiūnn pa̍t lâng.
English: He said to her, If they only bind me with new ropes with which no work has been done, then shall I become weak, and be as another man.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū bong in ê ba̍k-tsiu, kóng, Tsiàu lín ê sìn-sim kā lín sîng-tsiū.
English: Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it done to you.

Tailo: i tsiū kā i ê lâng hun-tsò saⁿ tuī, bâi-ho̍k tī tshân-.ni̍h, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sīkhiàm lâng tuì siâⁿ-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi, tsiū khí-lâi kā in kong-kik, kā in thâi.
English: He took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field; and he looked, and behold, the people came forth out of the city; He rose up against them, and struck them.

Tailo: In tsiū khì, īng hong-tiâu kā hit lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu hong khí-.lâi, lâu uē-ping tiàm hia kò͘-siú.
English: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, ū lâng tī A-só-to͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Hui-li̍p-pò͘, i iân-lō͘ tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ-tshī thuân hok-im, it-ti̍t kàu Kai-sa-lī-a.
English: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ ê āu-bīn, to̍h-sī sai-bīn, tio̍h tsò la̍k tè pán.
English: For the far part of the tent westward you shall make six boards.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè m̄-nā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ti̍k-pia̍t ê un-tián thang sìn-khò Ki-tok, mā hō͘ lín uī-tio̍h Ki-tok lâi siū khó͘,
English: Because it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him, but also to suffer on his behalf,

Tailo: Lán tsiàu jio̍k-thé ê pún-sìng teh ua̍h ê sî, lu̍t-huat kik-khí lán huān tsuē ê io̍k-liām, tī lán sing-khu pah-thé teh ūn-tsok, kiat-kó sī kiat sí-bông ê kué-tsí.
English: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were through the law, worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tuì Siōngtsú só͘ siū ê hūn-gia̍h, kiông-pō ê lâng tuì Tsuân-lîng-.ê só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p to̍h-sī tsit-ê.
English: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, The heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng, kā in kóng: Lín kàu guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín hit-ê tē ê sî, tē tsiū tio̍h kā Siōngtsú siú an-hioh.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a Sabbath to Yahweh.

Tailo: Siâ-sîn tsi̍t ē hō͘ Iésu kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, é-káu ê tsiū khai-sí kóng-uē. Hiah-ê kûn-tsiòng lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ, kóng, Tī Isulael, guán m̄-bat khuàⁿ-kuè tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying, Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!

Tailo: Kī-tsua̍t guá koh m̄ tsiap-la̍p guá ê uē ê lâng, ū tsi̍t-ê sím-phuàⁿ tsiá ē kā i sím-phuàⁿ. Tī bua̍t-ji̍t ê sî, guá só͘ kóng ê tō-lí ē kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: He who rejects me, and doesn't receive my sayings, has one who judges him. The word that I spoke, the same will judge him in the last day.

Tailo: Hit sî, Guá beh hō͘ bān-bîn ê giân-gí piàn-tsò tshing-khì, thang kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ, tâng-sim tsi̍t-ì lâi ho̍k-sāi I.
English: For then I will purify the lips of the peoples, that they may all call on the name of Yahweh, to serve him shoulder to shoulder.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, só͘-ū íng-uán hiàn ê, to̍h-sī lâng tuì i só͘-ū ê íng-uán hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, bô-lūn sī lâng, á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, á-.sī i sán-gia̍p ê tē, lóng m̄-thang bē, mā m̄-thang sio̍k-huê. I íng-uán hiàn ê sī tsì-sìng ê, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote to Yahweh of all that he has, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, Guá kiânn tsit-ê m̄-sī uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h Guá ê sìng-miâ ê iân-kò͘, to̍h-sī lín tī kiâⁿ kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong só͘ siat-to̍k ê.
English: Therefore tell the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: I don't do this for your sake, house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations, where you went.

Tailo: Tú-tio̍h tuā hō͘ phuah, tuā-tsuí lâi, tuā hong sàu, tshiong-tio̍h hit king tshù, tshù mā bē tó, in-uī ū kian-kò͘ ê tē-ki tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng.
English: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it didn't fall, for it was founded on the rock.

Tailo: Koh tuì hit-kha hē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng té bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ ê khing-á lāi, the̍h tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè kiáu iû ê piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè po̍h piáⁿ,
English: and one loaf of bread, one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before Yahweh.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū kah tsè-si Êlīatsal, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh tsín-kiù Guá ê iûⁿ-kûn, bô koh hō͘ in tsò siū tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h; Guá mā beh tī iûⁿ kah iûⁿ ê tiong-kan kiânn phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: therefore will I save my flock, and they shall no more be a prey; and I will judge between sheep and sheep.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h thâi iûⁿ-káng-á tī sìng-só͘ ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī thâi sio̍k-tsuē-tsè kah sio-tsè ê só͘-tsāi. Pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè tio̍h kui hō͘ tsè-si, tshin-tshiūnn sio̍k-tsuē-tsè kāng-khuán, sī tsì-sìng ê.
English: He shall kill the male lamb in the place where they kill the sin offering and the burnt offering, in the place of the sanctuary; for as the sin offering is the priest's, so is the trespass offering. It is most holy.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê ting iáu-buē hua, Samuel í-king tī Siōngtsú ê tiān, tī Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī hia teh khùn.
English: and the lamp of God hadn't yet gone out, and Samuel had laid down to sleep, in the temple of Yahweh, where the ark of God was;

Tailo: Sè-kan bē uàn-hūn lín, in uàn-hūn guá, in-uī guá put-sî teh tsí-tshut in ê siâ-ok tsok-uî.
English: The world can't hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.

Tailo: Abúlâm tsiū puaⁿ-suá pò͘-pênn lâi-kàu Hebúlông, uá Mamlē hiah-ê siōng tshiū tuà; i tī hia uī Siōngtsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ.
English: Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Iosiúah kong-tshú Ma̍kketah, īng to kā in kah in ê ông thâi-sí ; hit lāi-bīn ê lâng tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t, bô lâu kah puàⁿ-ê. I tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ông án-ne khuán-thāi Ma̍kketah ê ông.
English: Joshua took Makkedah on that day, and struck it with the edge of the sword, and the king of it: he utterly destroyed them and all the souls who were therein; he left none remaining; and he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu Elkánah kā i kóng, Hannah, lí ná ē teh thî-khàu? Ná ē m̄ tsia̍h pn̄g? Ná ē sim iu-būn? Guá tuì lí kám bô pí tsa̍p-ê kiáⁿ khah hó?
English: Elkanah her husband said to her, Hannah, why weep you? and why don't you eat? and why is your heart grieved? am I not better to you than ten sons?

Tailo: Lí nā it-tīng beh khì, tsiū tio̍h hùn-ióng tsing-tsiàn! Siōngtsú ē hō͘ lí pāi tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī Siōngtsú ū kuân ē pang-tsān lâng, mā ē tshia-tó lâng.
English: But if you will go, do valiantly, be strong for the battle: God will cast you down before the enemy; for God has power to help, and to cast down.

Tailo: Guān guá ê tshuì-tûn huat-tshut o-ló ê uē, in-uī Lí ū kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá.
English: Let my lips utter praise, For you teach me your statutes.

Tailo: In ê bé pí pà khah kín, pí ê-hng sî ê tshâi-lông khah bíng. Bé-ping pâi-lia̍t khui-khuah, bé-ping tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi; in tshin-tshiūnn ing-tsiáu kuáⁿ-kín pue-lâi beh tsia̍h.
English: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves. Their horsemen press proudly on. Yes, their horsemen come from afar. They fly as an eagle that hurries to devour.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú tī tsit-ê tē huat tuā siū-khì, kā tsit pún tsheh só͘ kì it-tshè ê tsiù-tsó͘, lóng kàng-lo̍h tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: therefore the anger of Yahweh was kindled against this land, to bring on it all the curse that is written in this book;

Tailo: Kā in kóng, ' Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tiàu Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal lâi. Tī só͘ khǹg ê tsio̍h-thâu tíng, Guá beh an-tì i ê pó-tsō, i ē tī hit lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu tíng tah suí ê pò͘-pênn.
English: and tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne on these stones that I have hidden; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.

Tailo: Bān-bîn tī I ê bīn-tsîng tshin-tshiūnn bô mi̍h, hō͘ I khuànn hui-siông bô, to̍h-sī khang-khang.
English: All the nations are like nothing before him. They are regarded by him as less than nothing, and vanity.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng tsiah-ê siú-líng, kā Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k kah ke-kháu,
English: Moses and Aaron and the princes of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families, and by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, Iésu tī tsi̍t-ê huē-tn̂g teh kà-sī lâng.
English: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Siōngtsú siúⁿ-sù ki̍k tuā ê kiù-un hō͘ I só͘ siat-li̍p ê ông; si-lo̍h tsû-ài hō͘ siū I buah iû ê lâng, to̍h-sī hō͘ Tabi̍t kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: He gives great deliverance to his king, And shows loving kindness to his anointed, To David and to his seed, forevermore.

Tailo: In tsiū tshuē ki-huē, phài bi̍t-thàm ké-tsò gī lâng, beh tshńg Iésu ê uē-phāng, thang kā I kau hō͘ tsóng-tok lâi e-huat pān-lí.
English: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tuì Aigi̍p só͘ tuà-lâi Iôséhuh ê kut-thâu, in kā i bâi-tsòng tī Sīkhiàm, to̍h-sī Iâkop tsá-tsîng īng tsi̍t-pah gîn tuì Sīkhiàm ê lāu-pē Hamool hiah-ê kiáⁿ só͘ bé-.lâi ê tē, tsiū tsò Iôséhuh kiáⁿ-sun ê sán-gia̍p.
English: The bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem, in the parcel of ground which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of money: and they became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.

Tailo: In-uī lín tsò sìng-kiat ê jîn-bîn, kui tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè. Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tuì tē-tsiūⁿ bān-bîn tiong kíng-suán lí, ti̍k-pia̍t tsò I ka-kī ê tsú-bîn.
English: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God: Yahweh your God has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.

Tailo: Tsí-ū Siōngtè tsiah ē-tàng kuat-tīng; I hō͘ tsit-ê kàng kē, hō͘ hit-ê sing kuân.
English: But God is the judge. He puts down one, and lifts up another.
