Tailo: Āu-lâi, Abulahàm kā i ê bó͘ Sala̍h bâi-tsòng tī Ka-nân tē Mamlē thâu-tsîng ê Mak-pe-la̍h tshân-.ni̍h ê hia̍t, Mamlē to̍h-sī Hebúlông.
English: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre (that is, Hebron), in the land of Canaan.

Tailo: M̄-thang iông-ín siū-khì kik-tōng lí, tì-sú lí bú-bān; mā m̄-thang in-uī sio̍k-huê ê kè-tsînn tuā, lâi kiâⁿ phian lō͘.
English: Don't let riches entice you to wrath, Neither let the great size of a bribe turn you aside.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsia̍h kàu pá, koh khioh só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê piáⁿ-tshuì muá tshit nâ.
English: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Lí só͘-ū ê kà-sī guá lóng lia̍h-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t; jî-tshiánn guá uàn-hūn it-tshè ê siâ-lō͘.
English: Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right. I hate every false way. PEY

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hâ io tshin-tshiūnn tāi-tiōng-hu, guá mn̄g lí, lí tio̍h ìn guá.
English: Now brace yourself like a man. I will question you, and you will answer me.

Tailo: Guá ê sim bô ài ua̍h, guá beh tuā táⁿ kóng-tshut guá ê ai-uàn; guá sim-lāi ê thòng-khó͘, guá tsiah beh kóng.
English: My soul is weary of my life; I will give free course to my complaint. I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

Tailo: Hit-ê ji̍t nā kàu, lín tio̍h hōng guá ê miâ kî-kiû. Guá bô kā lín kóng, guá beh thè lín tuì Thiⁿ-pē khún-kiû.
English: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don't say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,

Tailo: huē-tsiòng tsiū tio̍h tsiàu hiah-ê huat-tō͘, tī phah-sí-lâng ê kah pò-siû-.ê ê tiong-kan kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: then the congregation shall judge between the striker and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances;

Tailo: Lín nā tuì Tsú ū kian-kò͘ ê sìn-sim, guán tsiū kám-kak ū tsin-tsiàⁿ teh ua̍h.
English: For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord.

Tailo: Pó͘-kuà tio̍h sù-hong, áu siang-tîng, tn̂g tsi̍t lia̍h, khuah tsi̍t lia̍h.
English: It shall be square and folded double; a span shall be its length of it, and a span its breadth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tuì tó-uī ē-tàng tshuē-tio̍h tì-huī? Tshong-bîng ê só͘-tsāi tī tó-uī?
English: But where shall wisdom be found? Where is the place of understanding?

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê iân-kò͘, in-uī Nethániah ê kiáⁿ Isimael ū thâi-sí Ahikam ê kiáⁿ Getália̍h, to̍h-sī Babúlông ông só͘ siat-li̍p lâi kuán-hat tsit-ê thó͘-tē ê, só͘-í in tsin kiaⁿ.
English: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.

Tailo: Guá suî-jiân tsò gī, guá ka-kī ê tshuì ē tīng guá ê tsuē; guá suî-jiân uân-siān, i ē hián-bîng guá ê hîng-gi̍k.
English: Though I am righteous, my own mouth shall condemn me. Though I am blameless, it shall prove me perverse.

Tailo: In-uī lín ta̍k lâng lóng kuáⁿ-kín teh tsia̍h ka-kī tuà-.lâi ê mi̍h, kiat-kó ū lâng pak-tó͘ iau, ū lâng tsiú-tsuì.
English: For in your eating each one takes his own supper first. One is hungry, and another is drunken.

Tailo: I koh tshuā guá tò tńg-lâi-kàu sìng-só͘ ê guā-bīn ǹg tang ê mn̂g; hit-ê mn̂g kuainn-.leh.
English: Then he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which looks toward the east; and it was shut.

Tailo: Huilīsū ê tsuân tē, m̄-thang in-uī phah lí ê kuái-á í-king áu-tn̄g lâi huann-hí. In-uī tuì tsuâ ê nn̄g ē seⁿ-tshut to̍k-tsuâ, i só͘ seⁿ ê sī ē pue ê hué-tsuâ.
English: Don't rejoice, O Philistia, all of you, because the rod that struck you is broken; for out of the serpent's root an adder will emerge, and his fruit will be a fiery flying serpent.

Tailo: Elísiah tsù-ba̍k kā i khuànn, tì-sú i kiàn-siàu. Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū lâu ba̍k-sái.
English: He settled his gaze steadfastly on him, until he was ashamed: and the man of God wept.

Tailo: In ê ba̍k-tsiu tsiū khui. Iésu giâm-giâm kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín tshian-bān m̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai tsit-hāng tāi-tsì.
English: Their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly charged them, saying, See that no one knows about this.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, thong-kuè lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok kah Sìng Sîn ê thiàⁿ, guá tshiánn lín tsīn-la̍t kah guá tsò-hué kî-kiû Siōngtè,
English: Now I beg you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in your prayers to God for me,

Tailo: Lí m̄-bián kiaⁿ in, in-uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tī lín tiong-kan, I sī tuā koh thang kiaⁿ ê Siōngtè.
English: You shall not be scared of them; for Yahweh your God is in the midst of you, a great and awesome God.

Tailo: I sī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè; tsuân tē lóng ū I ê sím-phuàⁿ.
English: He is Yahweh, our God. His judgments are in all the earth.

Tailo: In tsiū lō͘-hiān i ê ē-sin, īng to thâi i, lia̍h i ê kiáⁿ-jî, hō͘ i tī tsa-bó͘ lâng tiong-kan lâu tshàu-miâ, in-uī in tuì i kiânn sím-phuàⁿ.
English: These uncovered her nakedness; they took her sons and her daughters; and her they killed with the sword: and she became a byword among women; for they executed judgments on her.

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn put-tīng, sim-kuann kui ji̍t iu-khó͘ beh kàu guā kú? Guá ê tuì-ti̍k ko-sing iâⁿ-kuè guá, tio̍h kàu guā kú?
English: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, Having sorrow in my heart every day? How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tī sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ tíng sio hiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: as it is taken off of the ox of the sacrifice of peace offerings. The priest shall burn them on the altar of burnt offering.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù I-é-lí-miah lo̍h-khì Iôtah ông ê kiong lāi,
English: Thus said Yahweh: Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tâng tsò sé-tn̄g ê phûn, i ê tsō mā tio̍h īng tâng tsò, thang īng lâi sé-tn̄g. Tio̍h kā i hē tī huē-bō͘ kah tuâⁿ ê tiong-kan, lāi-bīn tio̍h té tsuí.
English: You shall also make a basin of brass, and the base of it of brass, in which to wash. You shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.

Tailo: Guá koh tsìn-tsîng khì-kàu tsuí-tsuâⁿ ê mn̂g kah ông ê tî, tsóng-.sī, tī hia bô tsi̍t-ê uī-á thang hō͘ guá khiâ ê tsing-seⁿ kuè-.khì.
English: Then I went on to the spring gate and to the king's pool: but there was no place for the animal that was under me to pass.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh kóng, Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, Siōngtsú ē kā i phah, kiám-tshái i ê sí ji̍t beh kàu, á-.sī i ē lo̍h tsiàn-tīn lâi sí.
English: David said, As Yahweh lives, Yahweh will strike him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall go down into battle and perish.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô kì tī Iôtah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: In-uī tse Guá beh hō͘ Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun khùn-khó͘, tsóng-.sī, bô kàu íng-uán. '
English: I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not forever.

Tailo: M̄-thang kóng kiàn-siàu kah siâ-îm, á-.sī hā-liû ê uē, tian-tò tio̍h kóng kám-siā Siōngtè ê uē.
English: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not appropriate; but rather giving of thanks.

Tailo: Iáu-buē thiaⁿ-liáu tsiū ìn-tap, to̍h-sī i ê gû-gōng kah lîng-jio̍k.
English: He who gives answer before he hears, That is folly and shame to him.

Tailo: Bô-lūn saⁿ-á-khò͘ á-.sī phuê-hu bak-tio̍h tsing-tsuí, tio̍h īng tsuí sé, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: Every garment, and every skin, whereon the semen is, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Kāu-uē ê lâng bē-bián ū kuè-sit; iok-sok tshuì-tsi̍h ê lâng sī ū tì-huī.
English: In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience, But he who restrains his lips does wisely.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā in kóng, ' Tse sī tuì-ti̍k só͘ tsò ê. ' Kang-lâng tsiū kóng, ' Án-ne lí ài guán lâi-khì kā hiah-ê phê-á khau tiāu bô? '
English: He said to them, An enemy has done this.' The servants asked him, Do you want us to go and gather them up?'

Tailo: Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê só͘ tit-tio̍h ê siâⁿ kiōng tsa̍p-saⁿ tsō siâⁿ kah i ê kau-iá.
English: All the cities of the children of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their suburbs.

Tailo: Siōngtsú īng tuā kuân-lîng tshòng-tsō tē; īng tì-huī kiàn-li̍p sè-kài, īng tshong-bîng thián-khui tsiah-ê thiⁿ.
English: He has made the earth by his power, he has established the world by his wisdom, and by his understanding has he stretched out the heavens:

Tailo: M̄-bián kiaⁿ lín só͘ kiaⁿ ê Babúlông ông. ' Siōngtsú kóng, M̄-thang kiaⁿ i! In-uī Guá kah lín tông-tsāi, Guá beh tsín-kiù lín, hō͘ lín thuat-lī i ê tshiú.
English: Don't be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid; don't be afraid of him, says Yahweh: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.

Tailo: Lín lóng m̄-thang tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h kang, tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi, tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: You shall do no manner of work: it is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: Ké sian-ti sī sio̍k sè-kan, kóng sè-kan-sū, só͘-í, sè-kan lâng tsiah thiaⁿ in ê uē.
English: They are of the world. Therefore they speak of the world, and the world hears them.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng só͘-ū ê kak, I ē kā i tsám-tn̄g; gī lâng ê kak ē tit-tio̍h kí-khí.
English: I will cut off all the horns of the wicked, But the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Guá uī-tio̍h Si-óng hui-siông jia̍t-sim, Guá uī-tio̍h i jia̍t-sim, huat-tshut tuā siū-khì.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: I am jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and I am jealous for her with great wrath.

Tailo: Guá beh kā ún-tsông ê pó-bu̍t kah ún-ba̍t ê tsâi-pó siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí, hō͘ lí tsai kiò lí ê miâ tiàu lí ê to̍h-sī Guá — Siōngtsú, Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: and I will give you the treasures of darkness, and hidden riches of secret places, that you may know that it is I, Yahweh, who call you by your name, even the God of Israel.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kiàn-tsìng to̍h-sī, Siōngtè í-king ū siúⁿ-sù íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā hō͘ lán, tsit-ê ua̍h-miā sī tuì I ê Kiáⁿ lâi ê.
English: The testimony is this, that God gave to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tshut tī Isulael, sī sai-hū só͘ tsō ê, i m̄-sī Siōngtè. Sa-má-lī-a ê gû-á tsua̍t-tuì ē tú-tio̍h siū phah-tshuì.
English: For this is even from Israel! The workman made it, and it is no God; Indeed, the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.

Tailo: Í-king ū tsin tsē tāi-tsì ke-thinn khang-hi, tuì lâng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik?
English: For there are many words that create vanity. What does that profit man?

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai o-ló ê, I huaⁿ-hí lí, hō͘ lí tsē I ê uī, thang uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tsò ông, in-uī lí ê Siōngtsú thiàⁿ Isulael, ài íng-uán kā i kian-kò͘, só͘-í, siat-li̍p lí tsò in ê ông, hō͘ lí píng-kong kiâⁿ-gī.
English: Blessed be Yahweh your God, who delighted in you, to set you on his throne, to be king for Yahweh your God: because your God loved Israel, to establish them forever, therefore made he you king over them, to do justice and righteousness.

Tailo: Lí ná ē in-uī lí ê siong lâi tuā-siaⁿ huah? Lí ê thòng-khó͘ bē i-tit. In-uī lí ê tsuē-kò tsin tāng, tsuē-ok tsin tsē, só͘-í Guá īng tsiah-ê khuán-thāi lí.
English: Why cry you for your hurt? your pain is incurable: for the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins were increased, I have done these things to you.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng in ū lâng thiàu-bú, tshiùⁿ hô, kóng, ' Sàulô kā in thâi-sí ê tshing-tshing, Tabi̍t kā in thâi-sí ê bān-bān. ' Só͘ kóng ê, kám m̄-sī tsit-ê Tabi̍t?
English: Is not this David, of whom they sang one to another in dances, saying, Saul has slain his thousands, David his ten thousands?

Tailo: I khuànn tē, tē tsiū tín-tāng; I bong suaⁿ, suaⁿ tsiū tshut ian.
English: He looks at the earth, and it trembles. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

Tailo: Tshit-gue̍h kan, Elísiamah ê sun — Nethániah ê kiáⁿ Isimael, i sī ông-tshin, mā sī ông ê tāi-sîn, tshuā tsa̍p-ê lâng lâi Mi-su-peh, kìnn Ahikam ê kiáⁿ Getália̍h. In tī Mi-su-peh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: Now it happened in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal and one of the chief officers of the king, and ten men with him, came to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they ate bread together in Mizpah.

Tailo: Lí gia̍h thâu khuànn sì-hng, in lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi lí tsia. Lí ê tsìng kiáⁿ tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi; lí ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ mā beh hō͘ lâng phō-.lâi.
English: Lift up your eyes round about, and see: they all gather themselves together, they come to you; your sons shall come from far, and your daughters shall be carried in the arms.

Tailo: Ū thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu ê, i ê saⁿ-khò͘ tio̍h thiah-li̍h, i ê thâu-mn̂g tio̍h phah-suàⁿ, am i ê tshuì ê tíng-tûn, tuā-siaⁿ huah, ' Bô tshing-khì, bô tshing-khì. '
English: The leper in whom the plague is shall wear torn clothes, and the hair of his head shall hang loose. He shall cover his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean! Unclean!'

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông í-ki̍p Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng, tsiū tuì Lēbī lâng án-ne kiânn; kiàn-nā Siōngtsú lūn-khí Lēbī lâng só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê, Isulael lâng tsiū tuì in án-ne kiânn.
English: Thus did Moses, and Aaron, and all the congregation of the children of Israel, to the Levites. According to all that Yahweh commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.

Tailo: I só͘ i-uá ê ē tuān-tsua̍t; i só͘ uá-khò ê sī ti-tu-bāng.
English: Whose confidence shall break apart, Whose trust is a spider's web.

Tailo: Siōngtè huí-bia̍t Ka-nân tē-khu tshit-ê bîn-tso̍k liáu-āu, tsiū kā hit-ê thó͘-tē pun hō͘ in tsò sán-gia̍p, tsha-put-to ū sì-pah gō͘-tsa̍p nî.
English: When he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred fifty years.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, lí tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, kin-á-ji̍t lí tī tōng lāi, Siōngtsú kā lí kau tī guá ê tshiú. Ū lâng kiò guá thâi lí, tsóng-.sī, guá thiàⁿ-sioh lí, guá kóng, ' Guá bô beh tshun tshiú hāi-sí guá ê tsú, in-uī i sī Siōngtsú só͘ buah iû ê. '
English: Behold, this day your eyes have seen how that Yahweh had delivered you today into my hand in the cave: and some bade me kill you; but my eye spared you; and I said, I will not put forth my hand against my lord; for he is Yahweh's anointed.

Tailo: I koh hō͘ in ū kuáⁿ kuí-ê kuân-pìng.
English: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:

Tailo: Guán koh uī ka-kī tiāⁿ-tio̍h kui-lē, ta̍k nî ta̍k lâng tio̍h la̍p si-khel ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it, tsò guán ê Siōngtè tiān ê lō͘-īng,
English: Also we made ordinances for us, to charge ourselves yearly with the third part of a shekel for the service of the house of our God;

Tailo: Páulô lo̍h-khì lâu-kha, phak tī i ê sing-khu, kā i lám-.leh, kóng, M̄-bián huân-ló, i iáu ua̍h-.leh.
English: Paul went down, and fell upon him, and embracing him said, Don't be troubled, for his life is in him.

Tailo: Guá koh mn̄g i kóng, Kaⁿ-ná tshiū ê nn̄g ki, tuì nn̄g ki kim ê kóng lâu tshut kim iû, sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù?
English: I asked him the second time, What are these two olive branches, which are beside the two golden spouts, that pour the golden oil out of themselves?

Tailo: I hō͘ sip-khì tsik muá tī ba̍t hûn, hō͘ sih-nà tuì hûn siā-tshut.
English: Yes, he loads the thick cloud with moisture. He spreads abroad the cloud of his lightning.

Tailo: Hit sî, guā-pang lâng, Iô-tá-iah lâng kah in ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ kè-bô͘ lîng-jio̍k sù-tô͘, beh īng tsio̍h-thâu kā in tìm.
English: When some of both the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, made a violent attempt to mistreat and stone them,

Tailo: Siat-sú in m̄ tuà kun-khì kah lín kuè-.khì, in tsiū tī Ka-nân tē tuì lín tiong-kan tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p.
English: but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá — Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Kóng-tio̍h thok Guá ê miâ lâi thuân-pò͘ ê hiah-ê sian-ti, Guá pīng bô tshe in, in iáu-koh kóng tsit-ê tē bē tú-tio̍h to-kiàm, ki-hng, kî-si̍t hiah-ê sian-ti ē tuì to-kiàm, ki-hng lâi bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, and I didn't send them, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land: By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.

Tailo: Ài sim-kuann tshing-khì ê lâng kóng un-tián ê uē, ông ē tsò i ê pîng-iú.
English: He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully Is the king's friend.

Tailo: I koh ē tsìn-ji̍p îng-iāu ê tē, tsin tsē kok hō͘ i tshia-tó; to̍k-to̍k Etóm, Mô͘ap kah Ammóng kiáⁿ-sun tsun-kuì ê lâng ē-tàng thuat-lī i ê tshiú.
English: He shall enter also into the glorious land, and many countries shall be overthrown; but these shall be delivered out of his hand: Edom, and Moab, and the chief of the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Nā-sī kóng-tio̍h guá, hit-ê pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì ē hián-bîng tī guá, m̄-sī in-uī guá ū tì-huī iâⁿ-kuè it-tshè ua̍h-.leh ê lâng, sī uī-tio̍h beh kái-bîng hō͘ ông tsai, koh hō͘ lí tsai lí ê sim ê sim-su ì-liām.
English: But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for any wisdom that I have more than any living, but to the intent that the interpretation may be made known to the king, and that you may know the thoughts of your heart.

Tailo: Guá tsiū tsiàu Siōngtsú ê uē, khì bé tsi̍t tiâu tuà lâi hâ io.
English: So I bought a belt according to the word of Yahweh, and put it on my waist.

Tailo: Tng Io-si-iah ông tsē-uī ê sî, Siōngtsú koh tuì guá kóng, Puē-gi̍k ê Isulael só͘ tsò ê, lí ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h bô? I tsiūⁿ tsiah-ê kuân suaⁿ, tī só͘-ū tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū kha kiânn kan-îm.
English: Moreover Yahweh said to me in the days of Josiah the king, Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and there has played the prostitute.

Tailo: in-uī Siōngtè tsai lín tsia̍h ê ji̍t, lín ê ba̍k-tsiu tsiū ē khui, lín ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Siōngtè ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t siān-ok.
English: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè tāi-sing kíng-suán ê lâng, mā tāi-sing tiāⁿ-tio̍h hō͘ in kah I ê Kiáⁿ ê hîng-siōng sio-kāng, thang hō͘ I ê Kiáⁿ tī tsē-tsē hiann-tī tiong tsò tuā-kiáⁿ.
English: For whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.

Tailo: Ông mā án-ne kóng, ' Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī I ū siúⁿ-sù guá tsi̍t-ê lâng kin-á-ji̍t tsē guá ê uī, guá mā tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h. '
English: Also thus said the king, Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who has given one to sit on my throne this day, my eyes even seeing it.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn lín ū tshe sù-tsiá khì tshiánn hn̄g-hn̄g ê lâng. Sù-tsiá kàu in hia ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, in tsiū lâi. Lí uī-tio̍h in sé sing-khu, uē ba̍k-bâi, īng tsng-sik-phín táⁿ-pān ka-kī,
English: Furthermore you have sent for men who come from far, to whom a messenger was sent, and behold, they came; for whom you did wash yourself, paint your eyes, and deck yourself with ornaments,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā in kóng, Siōngtsú kóng, ' Guá kí Guá ê ua̍h-miā lâi kóng: Lín hō͘ Guá thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê uē, Guá ē tsiàu án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi.
English: Tell them, As I live, says Yahweh, surely as you have spoken in my ears, so will I do to you:

Tailo: Taⁿ guá teh beh tńg-khì tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī hia; lín tiong-kan bô lâng mn̄g guá kóng, ' Lí beh khì tó-uī? '
English: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, Where are you going?'

Tailo: Jîn-bîn lóng tsê-siaⁿ ìn kóng, Kiàn-nā Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê, guán lóng beh tsun-thàn. Mô͘se tsiū kā jîn-bîn ê uē huê-hok Siōngtsú.
English: All the people answered together, and said, All that Yahweh has spoken we will do. Moses reported the words of the people to Yahweh.

Tailo: Isulael ông tiàu kok lāi ê tiúⁿ-ló lóng lâi, kā in kóng, Lín khuànn, tsit-ê lâng thiau-tî tshuē phāng beh hāi guá. I bat tshe lâng lâi guá tsia, ài guá ê bó͘, kiáⁿ-jî kah kim-gîn, guá lóng bô kā i the-sî.
English: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Please notice how this man seeks mischief: for he sent to me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I didn't deny him.

Tailo: Hit tong-sî, thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí ê tsheⁿ tsò-hué tshiùⁿ kua; Siōngtè ê tsìng kiáⁿ-jî mā lóng tshut huann-hí ê siann.
English: When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?

Tailo: Só͘-í, tuà tī kî-tiong ê jîn-bîn khuì-la̍t tsin tsió, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ kiàn-siàu. In tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá ê tsháu, tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshài, tshin-tshiūnn tshù tíng ê tsháu, tshin-tshiūnn tshân-.ni̍h bē tuā tsâng ê tiū-á.
English: Therefore their inhabitants had little power. They were dismayed and confounded. They were like the grass of the field, and like the green herb, like the grass on the housetops, and like a field before its crop has grown.

Tailo: Kuân-lîng kah ui-giâm lóng sī I ê, I tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi kiânn hô-pîng.
English: Dominion and fear are with him; He makes peace in his high places.

Tailo: Abiiah īng tsi̍t tīn kuè kíng ê ping sì-tsa̍p bān lâng lâi pâi tīn, lóng sī hó-tánn ê tsiàn-sū; Ia-lô-ba-am mā īng kuè kíng ê tuā ióng-sū peh-tsa̍p-bān lâng lâi tuì i pâi tīn.
English: Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: and Jeroboam set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, who were mighty men of valor.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tuì lín lâi kóng sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê, lín m̄-thang tsia̍h i ê bah; sí ê mā tio̍h lia̍h-tsò sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: and you detest them. You shall not eat of their flesh, and you shall detest their carcasses.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Tabi̍t uī-tio̍h hit tè tē tshìn la̍k pah si-khel ê kim hō͘ Olnân.
English: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.

Tailo: Kiû Lí ē kì-tit tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ ìng-ín ê uē, in-uī Lí bat hō͘ guá ū ǹg-bāng.
English: Remember your word to your servant, Because you gave me hope.

Tailo: Iésu tuì Siōngtè kóng, guá beh tuì guá ê hiann-tī tsí-muē suan-iông Lí ê miâ, tī huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng o-ló Lí ê miâ. (tsù, SPh 22:22)
English: saying, I will declare your name to my brothers. In the midst of the congregation I will sing your praise.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tī tuâⁿ tíng sio hiah-ê mi̍h, tsò hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè, tse sī pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè.
English: and the priest shall burn them on the altar for an offering made by fire to Yahweh: it is a trespass offering.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ lâi suan-pò͘, kóng: Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: You, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, You mountains of Israel, hear the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá īng ko͘-tâ, hiú-nuā kā lín kong-kik, lín ê hn̂g ê tshut-sán, lín ê phû-tô hn̂g, bû-hua-kó tshiū, kaⁿ-ná tshiū lóng hō͘ tsián-thâng tsia̍h-.khì; lín iáu-koh bô kui-ǹg Guá.
English: I struck you with blight and mildew many times in your gardens and your vineyards; And your fig trees and your olive trees have the swarming locust devoured: Yet you haven't returned to me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit sî, kìng-uì Siōngtsú ê lâng tsò-hué kóng, Siōngtsú àⁿ hīⁿ-khang teh thiaⁿ, koh ū kì-liām ê tsheh siá tī I ê bīn-tsîng, sī uī-tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú koh siàu-liām I ê miâ ê lâng.
English: Then those who feared Yahweh spoke one with another; and Yahweh listened, and heard, and a book of memory was written before him, for those who feared Yahweh, and who honored his name.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín lâi guá tsia pang-tsān guá, lán thang lâi-khì phah Gi-bóng, in-uī i kah Iosiúah í-ki̍p Isulael li̍p hô-iok.
English: Come up to me, and help me, and let us strike Gibeon; for it has made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.

Tailo: I tī Etóm tē siat-li̍p hông-siú ê ping-iâⁿ, Etóm lâng tsiū lóng khut-ho̍k Tabi̍t. Tabi̍t bô-lūn khì-kàu tó-uī, Siōngtsú lóng hō͘ i tik-sìng.
English: He put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.

Tailo: gû-tiâu lāi ê puî gû tsa̍p tsiah, tsháu-tiûⁿ ê gû jī-tsa̍p tsiah, iûⁿ tsi̍t pah tsiah, iáu ū lo̍k, lîng-iûⁿ, tshiah-lo̍k kah puî ê ke.
English: ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and one hundred sheep, besides harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fattened fowl.

Tailo: Mô͘se sì-tsa̍p huè ê sî, siūⁿ beh khì khuànn ka-kī ê hiann-tī — Isulael ê tông-pau.
English: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers , the children of Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, tī thinn-tíng, tī tē-hā, bô ū sîn-bîng tshin-tshiūnn Lí siú iok koh kiânn thiàⁿ-sim tī Lí hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, to̍h-sī tsīn-sim kiânn tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng ê.
English: and he said, Yahweh, the God of Israel, there is no God like you, in heaven above, or on earth beneath; who keep covenant and loving kindness with your servants, who walk before you with all their heart;

Tailo: Phû-tô-hn̂g kué-tsí m̄-thang bán liáu-liáu, mā m̄-thang khioh phû-tô só͘ lak ê kué-tsí, tio̍h lâu hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng kah tshut-guā lâng. Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè.
English: You shall not glean your vineyard, neither shall you gather the fallen grapes of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and for the foreigner. I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: In tio̍h tsò lí ê tshe-īng, mā tio̍h tsò pò͘-pênn ê tshe-īng, to̍k-to̍k m̄-thang uá-kīn sìng-só͘ ê khì-kū kah tuâⁿ, bián-tit in kah lín lóng sí.
English: They shall keep your charge, and the charge of all the Tent: only they shall not come near to the vessels of the sanctuary and to the altar, that they not die, neither they, nor you.

Tailo: Āu-tiān tsîng ê tiān tshim sì-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The house, that is, the temple before the oracle, was forty cubits long.

Tailo: Lín kám m̄-tsai lán lóng ū niá siū sé-lé lâi kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-ha̍p, to̍h-sī niá siū sé-lé lâi kah I tsò-hué sí?
English: Or don't you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

Tailo: Ông mn̄g kóng, Lí ê tsú-lâng ê kiáⁿ tī tó-uī? Tsi-bah ìn ông kóng, I iû-guân tī Êlúsalèm, in-uī i kóng, ' Isulael lâng kin-á-ji̍t beh kā guá ê pē ê kok hîng guá. '
English: The king said, Where is your master's son? Ziba said to the king, Behold, he abides at Jerusalem; for he said, Today will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.

Tailo: Huat-tshut kng ê sua ē piàn-tsò tsuí-tî; ta-sò ê tē ē piàn-tsò tsuí-tsuâⁿ. Tī suann-káu tó teh khùn ê só͘-tsāi, ē ū tsheⁿ-tsháu, lô͘-uí kah pô͘-tsháu.
English: The burning sand will become a pool, And the thirsty ground springs of water. Grass with reeds and rushes will be in the habitation of jackals, where they lay.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng sìng-kiat ê lé-gî hō͘-siong tshíng-an. Ki-tok ê tsìng kàu-huē lóng kā lín tshíng-an.
English: Greet one another with a holy kiss. The assemblies of Christ greet you.

Tailo: koh huì-tû i ê A-má — Mákah thài-hō͘ ê uī, in-uī i bat uī A-si-lah tsng khó-ò͘ⁿ ê siōng. Asah tshò i ê siōng, tī Kit-lông khe piⁿ kā i sio-tiāu.
English: Also Maacah his mother he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ in, in-uī Guá í-king kā i kah i ê kûn-tsiòng, í-ki̍p i ê tē lóng kau tī lí ê tshiú; lí tio̍h kā i khuán-thāi kah lí bat khuán-thāi tuà tī Hesibóng ê Amô͘lī ông Sihông sio-siâng.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Don't fear him: for I have delivered him into your hand, and all his people, and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lí í-king kóng à, m̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, tuì tann í-āu lín ē khuànn-kìnn Jîn-tsú tsē tī Tsuân-lîng-.ê ê tsiànn pîng, tsē thinn-tíng ê hûn kàng-lîm. (tsù, TE 7:13)
English: Jesus said to him, You have said it. Nevertheless, I tell you, henceforth you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Asah jī nî, Ia-lô-ba-am ê kiáⁿ Nátap khai-sí tī Isulael tsò ông, i tī Isulael tsò ông nn̄g nî.
English: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah; and he reigned over Israel two years.

Tailo: Siōngtsú, Lí í-king khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī ok-to̍k, uàn-tò͘, Lí lóng ū teh kàm-tshat, beh īng Lí ê tshiú lâi pò-ìng. Bô i-uá ê lâng kā pún-sin kau-tài Lí; Lí it-ti̍t ū teh pang-tsān ko͘-jî.
English: But you do see trouble and grief; You consider it to take it into your hand. You help the victim and the fatherless.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, hū-jîn-lâng só͘ seⁿ ê, bô tsi̍t-ê lâng pí kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh khah uí-tāi; tsóng-.sī, tī thian-kok siōng bî-sè-.ê, iáu-koh pí i khah uí-tāi.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

Tailo: Tsai-eh nā hut-jiân phah-sí-lâng, I tsiū thí-tshiò bô tsuē ê lâng tú-tio̍h tshì-thàm.
English: If the scourge kills suddenly, He will mock at the trial of the innocent.

Tailo: mā tio̍h īng tse kà-sī lín ê kiáⁿ-jî, bô-lūn lí tsē tī tshù lāi á-.sī kiânn tī lō͘-.ni̍h, khùn á-.sī khí-.lâi, lóng tio̍h káng-lūn;
English: You shall teach them your children, talking of them, when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.

Tailo: Īng un-huī khuán-thāi pháiⁿ lâng, i iû-guân m̄ ha̍k-si̍p gī; tī tsìng-ti̍t ê só͘-tsāi, i ē kiânn put-gī, mā bô tsù-ì Siōngtsú ê ui-giâm.
English: Let favor be shown to the wicked, yet he will not learn righteousness. In the land of uprightness he will deal wrongfully, and will not see Yahweh's majesty.

Tailo: Nabal ìn Tabi̍t ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Tabi̍t sī siáⁿ lâng? I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ sī siáⁿ lâng? Kīn-lâi tsin tsē lô͘-po̍k puē-gi̍k i ê tsú-lâng.
English: Nabal answered David's servants, and said, Who is David? and who is the son of Jesse? there are many servants who break away from their masters these days.

Tailo: Kuè-khì in-uī lín puē-gi̍k Siōngtè, lîng-sìng í-king sí-.khì.
English: You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins,

Tailo: Tiâⁿ-mn̂g ê mn̂g-lî sī īng siù-hue ê kang-hu, īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē tsò ê, tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, kuân gō͘ tiú kah tiâⁿ ê uî sio-phuè.
English: The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Tsiah-ê kah guá tuà ê jîn-bîn, kiâⁿ lō͘ ê tuā-lâng ū la̍k-tsa̍p bān, Lí mā ū kóng, ' Guá beh hō͘ in tsia̍h bah, hō͘ in thang tsia̍h kàu tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t muá. '
English: Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand footmen; and you have said, I will give them flesh, that they may eat a whole month.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn siu-kuah ê lâng teh siu ngó͘-kok, īng tshiú kuah hiah-ê suī, koh tshin-tshiūnn lâng tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok teh khioh be̍h-sap.
English: It will be like when the harvester gathers the wheat, and his arm reaps the grain. Yes, it will be like when one gleans grain in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: Kun-kuaⁿ uá-khì lia̍h Páulô, bīng-līng īng nn̄g tiâu thih-liān-á kā i liān khí-.lâi, koh mn̄g i sī siáⁿ lâng, ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì.
English: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what he had done.

Tailo: Bian-ha-tat kah hiah-ê ông tī pò͘-pêⁿ lāi lim tsiú, thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, tsiū kā i ê jîn-sîn kóng, Pâi-tīn kong-kik! In tsiū pâi tīn kong siâⁿ.
English: It happened, when Ben Hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings, in the pavilions, that he said to his servants, Set yourselves in array. They set themselves in array against the city.

Tailo: guá mā án-ne it-tīng ē king-kuè tsin tsē khang-hi ê gue̍h, koh ū ià-siān ê mê-sî kā guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: So am I made to possess months of misery, Wearisome nights are appointed to me.

Tailo: Siōngtè sì-tsa̍p nî tuì siáⁿ lâng siū-khì? Kám m̄-sī hiah-ê huān tsuē lâi sí tī khòng-iá ê lâng?
English: With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn't it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Siōngtè beh tshì-giām Abulahàm, tsiū kiò i lâi, kóng, Abulahàm. I ìn kóng, Guá tī tsia.
English: It happened after these things, that God tested Abraham, and said to him, Abraham! He said, Here I am.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Alông kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Aaron, saying,

Tailo: Guá kah lí tshin-tshiūnn guá ê lāu-pē kah lí ê lāu-pē ū iok, taⁿ guá īng kim-gîn tsò lé-mi̍h sàng lí, tshiáⁿ lí khì huì-tû lí kah Isulael ông Basiah só͘ li̍p ê iok, hō͘ i lī-khui guá.
English: There is a league between me and you, between my father and your father: behold, I have sent to you a present of silver and gold; go, break your league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng m̄-sī án-ne, i tshin-tshiūnn tsho͘-khng hō͘ hong tshue-suàⁿ-.khì.
English: The wicked are not so, But are like the chaff which the wind drives away.

Tailo: In-uī koh kuè kuí nî, guá beh khì kiâⁿ hit tiâu khì bô koh tò tńg-.lâi ê lō͘.
English: For when a few years are come, I shall go the way from whence I shall not return.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kā Isulael lâng kóng, ' Guá sī Siōngtsú, Guá ē tuì Aigi̍p lâng só͘ hō͘ lín taⁿ ê tāng-tàⁿ tshuā lín tshut-.lâi, koh beh kiù lín thuat-lī in só͘ hō͘ lín tsò ê khó͘-kang. Guá mā ē īng tshun tshut-.lâi ê tshiú kah tuā ê sím-phuàⁿ lâi kiù-sio̍k lín.
English: Therefore tell the children of Israel, I am Yahweh, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm, and with great judgments:

Tailo: Siōngtsú ìn I ê tsú-bîn kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hō͘ lín ū ngó͘-kok, sin tsiú kah iû, lín tsiū buán-tsiok; Guá bô koh hō͘ lín tī lia̍t pang tiong siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: Yahweh answered his people, Behold, I will send you grain, new wine, and oil, And you will be satisfied with them; And I will no more make you a reproach among the nations.

Tailo: In gāng-gāng bô koh ìn, bô uē thang kóng.
English: They are amazed. They answer no more. They don't have a word to say.

Tailo: In-uī guá í-king kā Siōngtè ê tsí-ì tsuân-pō͘ thuân hō͘ lín à.
English: for I didn't shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.

Tailo: Ioltàn hô ê tang pîng, Lūbiān lâng, Ga̍t lâng, Mánáse puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê lâng, gia̍h ta̍k tsióng ê kun-khì lâi kau-tsiàn ê, ū tsa̍p-jī bān lâng.
English: On the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, one hundred twenty thousand.

Tailo: Lín tsò tiōng-hu ê mā tio̍h kah ka-kī ê hū-jîn-lâng tuà tsò-hué, thé-thiap in jio̍k-thé siōng khah nńg-tsiáⁿ; tio̍h kā in tsun-tiōng, in-uī in mā pêⁿ-pêⁿ kah lín tsò-hué sîng-tsiap Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā ê un-tián. Án-ne, lín ê kî-tó tsiah bē tú-tio̍h tsó͘-gāi.
English: You husbands, in like manner, live with your wives according to knowledge, giving honor to the woman, as to the weaker vessel, as being also joint heirs of the grace of life; that your prayers may not be hindered.

Tailo: Tsi̍t-kuá bat hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin á-.sī phuà-pēⁿ hō͘ Iésu i hó ê hū-jîn-lâng mā kah in tsò-hué, kî-tiong ū Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâlíah. Iésu bat tuì tsit-ê Mâlíah sin tsiūⁿ kuáⁿ-tshut tshit-ê kuí.
English: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

Tailo: sīm-tsì in bô beh tuì tshân-iá khioh tshâ, mā bô beh tuì tshiū-nâ tshò tshiū; in-uī in ē īng ke-si hiâⁿ hué, koh ē tshiúⁿ hiah-ê tshiúⁿ in ê lâng, kiap hiah-ê kiap in ê lâng. Tse to̍h-sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: so that they shall take no wood out of the field, neither cut down any out of the forests; for they shall make fires of the weapons; and they shall plunder those who plundered them, and rob those who robbed them, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: tian-tò bô mn̄g Siōngtsú, só͘-í, Siōngtsú kā i thâi-sí, kā i ê kok kui hō͘ I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ Tabi̍t.
English: and didn't inquire of Yahweh: therefore he killed him, and turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá tsi̍t-ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín tuì Tsú Iésu ū sìn-sim, koh tuì só͘-ū ê sìng-tô͘ ū thiàⁿ-sim,
English: For this cause I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you, and the love which you have toward all the saints,

Tailo: Mô͘se in-uī ū sìn-sim, tsiah bô kiann ông ê siū-khì, lī-khui Aigi̍p; i ná tshin-tshiūnn ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng só͘ khuànn bē-tio̍h ê Siōngtè, só͘-í kian-tshî kàu-té, m̄-khíng tò tńg-.khì.
English: By faith, he left Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn Ebah hō͘ tsuâ ê hua-giân khá-gí phiàn-.khì, guá khióng-kiaⁿ lín ê sim-su mā ē siū bê-hi̍k, suah-khì-sak tuì Ki-tok ê sûn-kiat kah tsin-sîng.
English: But I am afraid that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness, so your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

Tailo: Nó͘ah tsiū án-ne kiânn, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘-ū ê bīng-līng khì kiâⁿ.
English: Thus Noah did. According to all that God commanded him, so he did.

Tailo: Iésu tē-saⁿ pái kā i mn̄g, Iô-há-neh ê kiáⁿ Símòng, lí ū pí tsiah-ê khah thiàⁿ guá bô? Piattò͘ in-uī Iésu tē-saⁿ pái án-ne mn̄g, tsiū tsin iu-būn, kā Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ta̍k hāng lóng tsai, Lí tsai guá ū thiàⁿ Lí. Iésu kā i kóng, Lí tio̍h iúⁿ-tshī guá hiah-ê iûⁿ.
English: He said to him the third time, Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me? Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, Do you have affection for me? He said to him, Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you. Jesus said to him, Feed my sheep.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tsìng lâng só͘ lô-lo̍k ê hō͘ hué sio-.khì, lia̍t kok lô-khó͘ kàu ià-siān ê kui tī khang-khang, kám m̄-sī lóng tshut tī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú?
English: Behold, isn't it of Yahweh of Armies that the peoples labor for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity?

Tailo: In nā kóng, ' Lín khí-lâi guán tsia. ' Lán tsiū tsiūⁿ-.khì, in-uī Siōngtsú kā in kau tī lán ê tshiú tiong, tsit-ê uē thang tsò lán ê tsìng-kì.
English: But if they say thus, Come up to us; then we will go up; for Yahweh has delivered them into our hand: and this shall be the sign to us.

Tailo: koh hō͘ tsiah-ê kui tīn ê lâng tsai, Siōngtsú kiù lâng m̄-sī īng to, mā m̄-sī īng tshiuⁿ, in-uī kau-tsiàn ê tāi-tsì tsāi tī Siōngtsú, I ē kā lín kau tī guán ê tshiú tiong.
English: and that all this assembly may know that Yahweh doesn't save with sword and spear: for the battle is Yahweh's, and he will give you into our hand.

Tailo: Hut-jiân-kan ū siaⁿ tuì thinn-tíng lâi, tshin-tshiūnn teh thàu tuā hong, tshiong-muá in teh tsē ê kui king tshù.
English: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Atsalíah saⁿ-tsa̍p káu nî, Ga̍ttí ê kiáⁿ Me-ná-hiàm tsē-uī, tī Sa-má-lī-a tsò Isulael ông, kiōng tsa̍p nî.
English: In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem the son of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsò sìng-só͘ ê tshe-īng kah tuâⁿ ê tshe-īng, bián-tit siū-khì koh kàu tī Isulael lâng.
English: You shall keep the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the altar; that there be wrath no more on the children of Israel.

Tailo: Tsit saⁿ-ê sī Nó͘ah ê kiáⁿ, tuì in tshut ê kiáⁿ-sun phiàn-muá tsuân tē.
English: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang thau-the̍h, tio̍h piáu-hiān tsa̍p-hun ê tiong-sìn, thang tī ta̍k hong-bīn îng-kng lán ê Kiù-tsú Siōngtè ê kà-sī.
English: not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things.

Tailo: Ū sî tī ke-lō͘-.ni̍h, ū sî tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi; ū sî tī ta̍k-ê hāng-á kháu teh tng-tán.
English: Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, And lurking at every corner.

Tailo: Lín ē kā tuì-ti̍k kuáⁿ-tsáu, in beh tī lín ê bīn-tsîng tó tī to hā.
English: You shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.

Tailo: Iosiúah īng to thâi Amáli̍k ông kah i ê jîn-bîn.
English: Joshua defeated Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tsiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, lín ê tsai-lān teh beh kàu à, lín tio̍h pi-siong thî-khàu!
English: Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you.

Tailo: Sàulô kóng, Guá ū tsuē, suî-jiân án-ne, kiû lí tsun-tiōng guá tī guá ê jîn-bîn ê tiúⁿ-ló kah Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng kah guá tńg-.khì, hō͘ guá kìng-pài Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Then he said, I have sinned: yet honor me now, Please, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Guā-pang lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē lóng tsin huann-hí, o-ló Siōngtè ê tō-lí. Só͘-ū siū Siōngtè kíng-suán thang tit-tio̍h íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê lâng, lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò sìn-tô͘.
English: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsìng lâng kuè Ioltàn hô, ông mā kuè-.khì. Ông tsiū kah Baltsilâi tsim-tshuì, kā i tsiok-hok; i tsiū tńg-khì i ê pún só͘-tsāi.
English: All the people went over the Jordan, and the king went over: and the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned to his own place.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p ê sî, tuì Siōngtsú — Lí kî-tó. Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí tsiàu Lí hong-sīng ê tsû-ài, tsiàu Lí tsin-si̍t ê tsín-kiù lâi ìn-tap guá!
English: But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, in an acceptable time. God, in the abundance of your loving kindness, answer me in the truth of your salvation.

Tailo: Kàu tī ông-kiong ê mn̂g tsîng, in-uī kiàn-nā tshīng muâ-saⁿ ê lâng bē-tàng ji̍p-khì ông-kiong ê mn̂g.
English: and he came even before the king's gate: for none might enter within the king's gate clothed with sackcloth.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Tsun-tsiàu tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī ê tsí-ì, koh uân-sîng I ê kang-tsok, to̍h-sī guá ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Jesus said to them, My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

Tailo: Tsiàu kì-tsài, guá kah-ì Iâkop, bô kah-ì Esáu. (tsù, MLK 1:2-3)
English: Even as it is written, Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê sio̍k Satán ê huē-tn̂g ê lâng, in tsū-tshing sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, kî-si̍t m̄-sī, in sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; guá beh hō͘ in lâi phak tī lí ê kha tsîng, koh hō͘ in tsai guá thiàⁿ lí.
English: Behold, I give of the synagogue of Satan, of those who say they are Jews, and they are not, but lie. Behold, I will make them to come and worship before your feet, and to know that I have loved you.

Tailo: Ông ǹg Êsutel gia̍h-khí i kim ê kuái-á, Êsutel tsiū khiā khí-.lâi tī ông ê bīn-tsîng, kóng,
English: Then the king held out to Esther the golden scepter. So Esther arose, and stood before the king.

Tailo: Iosiúah līng-guā īng tsa̍p-jī tè tsio̍h-thâu khiā tī Ioltàn hô tiong, to̍h-sī tī kng iok-kuī ê tsè-si kha khiā-.leh ê só͘-tsāi; kàu kin-á-ji̍t, hiah-ê tsio̍h iáu-koh tī hia.
English: Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests who bore the ark of the covenant stood: and they are there to this day.

Tailo: Siōngtè sī sìn-si̍t ê, I ho͘-tiàu lín lâi kah I ê Kiáⁿ, lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok kiat-liân.
English: God is faithful, through whom you were called into the fellowship of his Son, Jesus Christ, our Lord.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Guá beh kā Amáli̍k ê miâ-jī, tuì thian-hā uân-tsuân tshat-siau tiāu; lí tio̍h kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì siá tī tsheh-.ni̍h lâi tsò kì-liām, koh kóng hō͘ Iosiúah thiaⁿ.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: that I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under the sky.

Tailo: Elísiah kóng, The̍h tām-po̍h-á mī-hún lâi. Tsiū kā mī-hún sám tī tiánn-.ni̍h, kóng, Piàⁿ tshut-lâi hō͘ in tsia̍h! Tiáⁿ lāi tsiū bô to̍k.
English: But he said, Then bring meal. He cast it into the pot; and he said, Pour out for the people, that they may eat. There was no harm in the pot.

Tailo: Khò tsit-ê siâⁿ tsò sing-lí huat-tsâi ê lâng, in-uī tsin kiaⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siâⁿ só͘ siū ê kan-khó͘, só͘-í, lóng khiā hn̄g-hn̄g teh pi-siong thî-khàu,
English: The merchants of these things, who were made rich by her, will stand far away for the fear of her torment, weeping and mourning;

Tailo: In-uī bîn-bāng tsin tsē, giân-gí tsin tsē, kî-tiong ū khang-hi; tsóng-.sī, tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtè.
English: For in the multitude of dreams there are vanities, as well as in many words: but you must fear God.

Tailo: Tsiú lóng lim-liáu ê sî, Iésu ê lāu-bú tsiū tuì I kóng, In bô tsiú à.
English: When the wine ran out, Jesus' mother said to him, They have no wine.

Tailo: Lán ǹg-bāng pîng-an, mā bô tit-tio̍h hó-tshù; ǹg-bāng ū i hó ê sî-kî, tian-tò ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!

Tailo: Bû-hua-kó tshiū ìn kóng, ' Guá kám thang pàng-sak guá ê tinn koh hó ê kué-tsí, khì tī tsìng tshiū ê tíng-bīn iô? '
English: But the fig tree said to them, Should I leave my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?

Tailo: Guá kóng-khí guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘, Lí ū ìn-tap guá; kiû Lí kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá!
English: I declared my ways, and you answered me. Teach me your statutes.

Tailo: Nā ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tshò-gō͘ huān tsuē, i tsiū tio̍h hiàn bī-muá-nî ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-bó tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: If one person sins unwittingly, then he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering.

Tailo: Tsit-ê Hitsekia kám m̄-sī huì-tû Siōngtsú ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ kah I hiah-ê tuâⁿ, bīng-līng Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm ê lâng kóng, ' Lín tio̍h tī tsit-ê tuâⁿ tsîng kìng-pài, sio hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn. '?
English: Has not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, You shall worship before one altar, and on it shall you burn incense?

Tailo: Tong-jiân Iésu teh kuan-sim ê m̄-sī thiⁿ-sài, sī Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: For most assuredly, not to angels does he give help, but he gives help to the seed of Abraham.

Tailo: Ū peh-ê pán kah tsa̍p-la̍k-ê gîn khū, ta̍k tè pán ê ē-bīn ū nn̄g-ê khū.
English: There were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.

Tailo: Sì-gue̍h tshe-káu, siâⁿ lāi ki-hng tsin siong-tiōng, tì-sú hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn lóng bô bí-niûⁿ.
English: On the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.

Tailo: Iésu sim-lāi tsai-iáⁿ bûn-tô͘ in-uī tsit-ê tāi-tsì teh nga̍uh-nga̍uh-liām, tsiū kā in kóng, Tsiah-ê uē jiá-tio̍h lín, sī-.bô?
English: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them, Does this cause you to stumble?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē khuán-thāi in, tshin-tshiūnn tsîng-ji̍t khuán-thāi I só͘ bia̍t Amô͘lī lâng nn̄g-ê ông — Sihông kah O͘k, í-ki̍p in ê tē.
English: Yahweh will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land; whom he destroyed.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm tshuā tsa̍p-peh-ê bó͘, la̍k-tsa̍p-ê hui; seⁿ jī-tsa̍p peh-ê kiáⁿ, la̍k-tsa̍p-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ; tsóng-.sī, i thiàⁿ Αpsalôm ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mákah, iâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū hiah-ê bó͘ kah hui.
English: Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and sixty concubines, and became the father of twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.)

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tī Iôtah thuân, tī Êlúsalèm pò-iông, kóng: Lín tio̍h tī kok lāi pûn sàu-kak, tuā-siaⁿ huah: Lín tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p, lán thang tsìn-ji̍p kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ.
English: Declare you in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow you the trumpet in the land: cry aloud and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.

Tailo: Tī hia lín ē ho̍k-sāi lâng ê tshiú só͘ tsō ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī tshâ-ê á-.sī tsio̍h ê, bē-tàng khuànn, bē-tàng thiaⁿ, bē-tàng tsia̍h, bē-tàng phīⁿ ê.
English: There you shall serve gods, the work of men's hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

Tailo: Tô-tsáu ê lâng iáu-buē kàu, tsîng tsi̍t ji̍t ê ê-hng, Siōngtsú ê tshiú hē tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ, khui guá ê tshuì. Kàu keh kang tsá-khí, hit-ê lâng lâi-kàu guá tsia, guá ê tshuì tsiū khui, bô koh é-káu.
English: Now the hand of Yahweh had been on me in the evening, before he who was escaped came; and he had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more mute.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tsīn-la̍t thiàu-bú, Tabi̍t hâ iù-tē pò͘ ê tsè-si ho̍k.
English: David danced before Yahweh with all his might; and David was girded with a linen ephod.

Tailo: Tsuân tē lóng tio̍h ǹg Siōngtsú tshut huann-hí ê siann; tio̍h tshut tuā-siaⁿ huann-hí tshiùⁿ kua o-ló I!
English: Make a joyful noise to Yahweh, all the earth! Burst out and sing for joy, yes, sing praises!

Tailo: Ū siaⁿ tī khòng-iá teh huah, Tio̍h uī Tsú tsún-pī tō-lō͘, siu-ti̍t I beh kiâⁿ ê sió-lō͘. (tsù, ISI 40:3; MLK 3:1; CAG 23:20)
English: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!'

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Guá ū kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ lín kàu-sî thang ē kì-tit, guá bat kā lín kóng. Guá bô tī khí-thâu to̍h kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī in-uī guá iáu kah lín tsò-hué.
English: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn't tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

Tailo: I tsîng-ji̍t sio hiuⁿ ho̍k-sāi tsiah-ê Baal, koh īng hīⁿ-kau kah pa̍t tsióng tsng-sik-phín ka-kī táⁿ-pān, tuè i ê lông-kun khì, suah bē kì-tit Guá, in-uī án-ne, Guá beh kā i pān. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I will visit on her the days of the Baals, To which she burned incense, When she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, And went after her lovers, And forgot me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng jiok kīn Sàulô kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, Huilīsū lâng tsiū thâi-sí Sàulô ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan, Abinatap kah Mal-ki-siu-ah.
English: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines killed Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.

Tailo: In-uī tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; tsiam-pok ê khuànn hi-ké; kóng hi-ké ê bāng khang-khang an-uì lâng. Só͘-í, in bê-lō͘ tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ, koh in-uī bô bo̍k-tsiá, tì-sú siū khùn-khó͘.
English: For the teraphim have spoken vanity, and the diviners have seen a lie; And they have told false dreams. They comfort in vain. Therefore they go their way like sheep. They are oppressed, because there is no shepherd.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k khak-si̍t thiaⁿ-tio̍h Sàulô ài beh lâi Keilah, beh uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ bia̍t tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: Then said David, O Yahweh, the God of Israel, your servant has surely heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.

Tailo: Lín ná ē hō͘ guán tshut Aigi̍p, tshuā guán kàu tsit-ê pháiⁿ só͘-tsāi? Bô só͘-tsāi thang iā tsíng, mā bô bû-hua-kó, bô phû-tô, bô sia̍h-liû, koh bô tsuí thang lim.
English: Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, in taⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kā guán pò-ìng, lâi kā guán kuáⁿ-tshut Lí ê sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī Lí siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guán sîng-tsiap ê.
English: behold, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of your possession, which you have given us to inherit.

Tailo: In tsiū kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, hiat lo̍h-khì tséⁿ ni̍h; hit kháu tséⁿ sī ta ê, lāi-bīn bô tsuí.
English: and they took him, and threw him into the pit. The pit was empty. There was no water in it.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tiong-kan lîng-sìng sîng-si̍k ê lâng, tio̍h ū kāng-khuán ê sim-tsì; lín tiong-kan nā ū bô kāng-khuán ê sim-tsì, Siōngtè mā ē īng tsit-ê tāi-tsì kā lín khé-sī.
English: Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, think this way. If in anything you think otherwise, God will also reveal that to you.

Tailo: Lí koh tio̍h tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, ' Guá í-king tuì guá ê tshù the̍h-tshut sìng-mi̍h, koh hō͘ Lēbī lâng, tshut-guā lâng kah ko͘-jî, kuáⁿ-hū, sī tsiàu lí só͘ bīng-līng guá it-tshè ê kài-bīng. Lí ê kài-bīng guá lóng bô huān-.tio̍h, mā bô bē kì-.tit.
English: You shall say before Yahweh your God, I have put away the holy things out of my house, and also have given them to the Levite, and to the foreigner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, according to all your commandment which you have commanded me: I have not transgressed any of your commandments, neither have I forgotten them:

Tailo: Nā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ tsò lé-mi̍h, tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng hiàn.
English: If he offers a lamb for his offering, then he shall offer it before Yahweh;

Tailo: í-ki̍p sûn-kim ê ting-tâi kah i ê ting, thang tsiàu lē tiám tī āu-tiān ê thâu-tsîng.
English: and the lampstands with their lamps, to burn according to the ordinance before the oracle, of pure gold;

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā lín khuán-thāi só͘ uá-khò tsit king īng Guá ê miâ tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, í-ki̍p Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kah lín ê tsó͘-sian ê tē, tshin-tshiūnn Guá tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi Sī-lô án-ne.
English: therefore will I do to the house which is called by my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè só͘ tsō suaⁿ-iá it-tshè ê ua̍h-mi̍h, tsuâ sī siōng káu-khiat ê. Tsuâ tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Siōngtè kám ū-iáⁿ kóng, hn̂g lāi it-tshè ê tshiū, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h?
English: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, Has God really said, You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?'

Tailo: Tsha-put-to hit sî, Hi-lu̍t ông hē-tshiú pik-hāi tsi̍t-kuá kàu-huē ê lâng,
English: Now about that time, Herod the king stretched out his hands to oppress some of the assembly.

Tailo: Lí siâⁿ mn̂g lāi nā ū uan-ke ê tāi-tsì, á-.sī in-uī lâu hueh, á-.sī in-uī sio-kò, á-.sī in-uī sio-phah, sī lí só͘ bē liáu-kái thang phuàⁿ-tuàn ê, lí tsiū tio̍h khí-.lâi, khì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ beh kíng-suán ê só͘-tsāi.
English: If there arise a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within your gates; then shall you arise, and go up to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose;

Tailo: Hiàn ê-hng-tsè ê sî, guá tuì guá ê ut-būn khí-.lâi, thiah-li̍h saⁿ-phâu, siang kha kuī lo̍h-.khì, ǹg Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè gia̍h-khí tshiú lâi, kóng,
English: At the evening offering I arose up from my humiliation, even with my garment and my robe torn; and I fell on my knees, and spread out my hands to Yahweh my God;

Tailo: Guá kuan-sim guá ê tông-pau, guá ê kut-jio̍k tsì-tshin. Nā-sī uī-tio̍h in, guá tio̍h siū Siōngtè tsiù-tsó͘ pàng-sak, tio̍h kah Ki-tok keh-lī, guá mā kam-guān.
English: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers' sake, my relatives according to the flesh,

Tailo: Liân sìng-tiān i to beh kā i ù-uè, guán tsiū kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, siūⁿ beh tsiàu guán ka-kī ê lu̍t-huat kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iosiúah tsiū kiò Isulael jîn-bîn, in ê tiúⁿ-ló kah in ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, in ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ, in ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, só͘-ū ê lâng lóng lâi, tuì in kóng, Guá í-king huè-siū tsē nî lāu.
English: that Joshua called for all Israel, for their elders and for their heads, and for their judges and for their officers, and said to them, I am old and well stricken in years:

Tailo: Tio̍h kuan-huâi hiah-ê siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn kah in tông kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ. Tio̍h kuan-huâi hiah-ê siū gi̍k-thāi ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lín mā teh siū gi̍k-thāi.
English: Remember those who are in bonds, as bound with them; and those who are ill-treated, since you are also in the body.

Tailo: kiàn-nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h sàu-kak ê siann bô siū kíng-kài ê, to-kiàm nā lâi kā i tsâu-bia̍t tiāu, i ê tsuē ē kui tī i ê thâu-khak tíng.
English: then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet, and doesn't take warning, if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be on his own head.

Tailo: Lia̍t kok ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê kong-gī; lia̍t ông ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê îng-kng. Lí ē hông tshing-ho͘ sin ê miâ, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tshin-tshuì só͘ tshing-ho͘ ê.
English: The nations shall see your righteousness, and all kings your glory, and you shall be called by a new name, which the mouth of Yahweh shall name.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, in ē tuì Asiul kàu Aigi̍p tsiah-ê siâⁿ, tuì Aigi̍p kàu tuā hô, tuì tsit-ê hái kàu hit-ê hái, tuì tsit-ê suaⁿ kàu hit-ê suaⁿ, lóng ē kui uá-.lâi.
English: In that day they will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, And from Egypt even to the River, And from sea to sea, And mountain to mountain.

Tailo: I thiann-kìnn Iésu tuì Iô-tá-iah síng lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tsiū khì kiû I lo̍h-khì Ka-peh-ná-um i-tī i ê kiáⁿ, in-uī i ê kiáⁿ teh beh sí à.
English: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.

Tailo: Hit sì-ê thiⁿ-sài siū tháu-pàng ê tāi-tsì, tsá to̍h an-pâi hó-sè, tī hit-ê sî, hit-ê ji̍t, hit-ê gue̍h, hit-ê nî, beh lâi hāi-sí-lâng luī ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it.
English: The four angels were freed who had been prepared for that hour and day and month and year, so that they might kill one third of mankind.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn lí mā tio̍h ū tsin tsē sai-hū, phah-tsio̍h ê, tsò-ba̍k ê kah ta̍k tsióng kang-tîng-su, thang tsò ta̍k tsióng ê kang.
English: There are also workmen with you in abundance, cutters and workers of stone and timber, and all kinds of men who are skillful in every kind of work:

Tailo: Tsit-ê kài tio̍h tuì Sī-huan lo̍h-khì kàu A-iân tang pîng ê Lip-la̍h, koh lo̍h-khì kàu Kin-né-lo̍t ô͘ ê tang pîng.
English: and the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall go down, and shall reach to the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward;

Tailo: Hāi ā, lín tò-thâu siūⁿ à! Kám thang kā sio-huî ê lâng khuàⁿ-tsò tshin-tshiūnn thô͘? Siū tsō ê mi̍h kám thang lūn tsō i ê Siōngtè, kóng, I bô tsō guá ? Á-sī siū tsò ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ, kám thang lūn tsò i ê kóng, I bô tshong-bîng ?
English: You turn things upside down! Should the potter be thought to be like clay; that the thing made should say about him who made it, He didn't make me; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, He has no understanding?

Tailo: Bô phah-sǹg sī lí kah guá pîng-puè ê lâng, guá ê tâng-phuāⁿ, guá ti-kí ê pîng-iú.
English: But it was you, a man like me, My companion, and my familiar friend.

Tailo: In koh phah Gelal sì-kho͘-uî hiah-ê siâⁿ, in-uī Siōngtsú hō͘ in tsin kiaⁿ. In mā tshiúⁿ in só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, in-uī siâⁿ lāi ū tsin tsē mi̍h thang tshiúⁿ.
English: They struck all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of Yahweh came on them: and they despoiled all the cities; for there was much spoil in them.

Tailo: Tē-sann tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Ti-gu-lí-su, to̍h-sī lâu tī Asiul ê tang pîng ê. Tē-sì tiâu to̍h-sī Iu-hu-la-té.
English: The name of the third river is Hiddekel: this is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

Tailo: Tsia̍h tàu ê sî, Bôohtsuh kā i kóng, Lí lâi tsia tsia̍h piáⁿ, koh īng lí hit tè piáⁿ lâi ùn tshò͘. I tsiū tsē tī kuah be̍h ê lâng ê piⁿ-a, i the̍h hang hó ê be̍h-suī hō͘ i. I tsia̍h pá, iáu ū tshun. I tsiū khí-lâi khì khioh be̍h-sap.
English: At meal time Boaz said to her, Come here, and eat of the bread, and dip your morsel in the vinegar. She sat beside the reapers, and they reached her parched grain, and she ate, and was sufficed, and left of it.

Tailo: Guān Isulael ê tsín-kiù tuì Si-óng tshut! Siōngtsú kiù I siū lia̍h ê tsú-bîn tò tńg-.lâi, hit sî, Iâkop ē khuài-lo̍k, Isulael ē huaⁿ-hí.
English: Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When Yahweh restores the fortunes of his people, Then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

Tailo: Thiāu ê tíng-bīn ū tâng ê thiāu-táu, kuân gō͘ tiú; thiāu-táu ê sì-kho͘-uî ū bāng-á kah sia̍h-liû, lóng sī tâng tsò ê. Tē-jī ki thiāu kāng-khuán, mā ū sia̍h-liû.
English: A capital of brass was on it; and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital round about, all of brass: and the second pillar also had like these, and pomegranates.

Tailo: Guá beh kian-kò͘ Iôtah ke, tsín-kiù Iôséhuh ê ke, beh tshuā in tò tńg-.lâi. In-uī Guá liân-bín in; in ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Guá m̄-bat kā in khì-sak ê khuán, in-uī Guá sī Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè, Guá beh thiàⁿ in.
English: I will strengthen the house of Judah, And I will save the house of Joseph, And I will bring them back; For I have mercy on them; And they will be as though I had not cast them off: For I am Yahweh their God, and I will hear them.

Tailo: Guá ê tsú-bîn ē thong-kuè sìn-sim lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā. M̄-koh, i nā kiânn huan-thâu, guá ē bô kah-ì i. (tsù, HPK 2:3-4)
English: But the righteous will live by faith. If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū kim kah pó-tsio̍h tsin tsē, tsóng-.sī, ū tì-sik ê tshuì-tûn tsiah sī kuì-khì ê tin-pó.
English: There is gold and abundance of rubies; But the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.

Tailo: Mê-nî nā kiat kué-tsí to̍h hó, nā bô, tsiah kā i tshò khí-.lâi. '
English: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.'

Tailo: Tse tio̍h tsò Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì Isulael lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê hūn-gia̍h, in-uī sī kí-tsè. Tio̍h tuì Isulael lâng pîng-an-tsè ê tiong-kan tsò kí-tsè, to̍h-sī in hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê kí-tsè.
English: and it shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the children of Israel; for it is a wave offering: and it shall be a wave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, even their wave offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: Nā tú-tio̍h ū lâng kah ū tiōng-hu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tâng-pâng, kan-hu kah hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng lóng tio̍h hō͘ in sí. Án-ne tsiū ē-tàng tuì Isulael ê tiong-kan tû-khì hit-ê pháiⁿ.
English: If a man be found lying with a woman married to a husband, then they shall both of them die, the man who lay with the woman, and the woman: so shall you put away the evil from Israel.

Tailo: Iésu tsai-iáⁿ in ê pháiⁿ liām-thâu, tsiū kóng, Ké hó ê lâng, lín án-tsuáⁿ beh lâi kā guá tshì-thàm?
English: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why do you test me, you hypocrites?

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì Tsetikiah kóng, Siōngtsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Lí nā tshut-khì tâu-hâng Babúlông ông ê kuì-tso̍k, lí ê sèⁿ-miā tsiū ē ua̍h-.leh, tsit-ê siâⁿ bē tì-kàu hō͘ hué sio, lí kah lí ê tsuân ke lóng ē ua̍h-.leh.
English: Then said Jeremiah to Zedekiah, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Armies, the God of Israel: If you will go forth to the king of Babylon's princes, then your soul shall live, and this city shall not be burned with fire; and you shall live, and your house.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ông ê sim pik-tshiat siàu-liām Αpsalôm, in-uī Amnon í-king sí, tsiū siū an-uì.
English: the soul of king David longed to go forth to Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.

Tailo: Thong-kuè tiong-si̍t ê hiann-tī Sela̍h, guá siá tsit tiuⁿ té-té ê phue hō͘ lín, lâi bián-lē lín, mā kiàn-tsìng tse sī Siōngtè tsin-si̍t ê un-tián. Lín tio̍h tī tsit-ê un-tián tíng-bīn khiā tsāi.
English: Through Silvanus, our faithful brother, as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.

Tailo: Sè-kài tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng pāi-huāi, sè-kài tshiong-muá kiông-pō.
English: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tshiú the̍h kuí tè tuā lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu, tī Iôtah lâng ê bīn-tsîng khǹg tī thia̍p tsng ê hue-thô͘ lāi, to̍h-sī tī Ta̍kpeneh Huâ-láu ê ông-kiong mn̂g hia,
English: Take great stones in your hand, and hide them in mortar in the brick work, which is at the entry of Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;

Tailo: Ahiiah the̍h i só͘ tshīng ê sin saⁿ, thiah tsò tsa̍p-jī tè,
English: Ahijah laid hold of the new garment that was on him, and tore it in twelve pieces.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came again to me, saying,

Tailo: Ísak nî lāu, ba̍k-tsiu hue khuànn bē-tio̍h, tsiū kiò i ê tuā-kiáⁿ Esáu lâi, kā i kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ. Esáu ìn kóng, Guá tī tsia.
English: It happened, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, My son? He said to him, Here I am.

Tailo: Iosiúah kóng, Suá tuā tè tsio̍h kàu tōng kháu, phài lâng tiàm hia kā in kò͘-siú,
English: Joshua said, Roll great stones to the mouth of the cave, and set men by it to keep them:

Tailo: Te-li-lah kā Sâmsóng kóng, Kiû lí kā guá kóng, lí ê tuā khuì-la̍t tsāi tī tó-uī? Tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsiah ē-tàng kā lí pa̍k khí-.lâi, hō͘ lí khùn-khó͘?
English: Delilah said to Samson, Tell me, Please, in which your great strength lies, and with which you might be bound to afflict you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lu̍t-huat kàu-su khiā khí-lâi tshì-thàm Iésu kóng, Lāu-su ah, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah ē tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā?
English: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying, Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

Tailo: Ionáthan tsiū tshiú khîⁿ kha lìng peh khí-lih, gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê lâng tuè i khì. Huilīsū lâng tó tī Ionáthan ê bīn-tsîng, gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê lâng mā tuè i ê āu-bīn lâi kā in thâi.
English: Jonathan climbed up on his hands and on his feet, and his armor bearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armor bearer killed them after him.

Tailo: Tio̍h lī-khui pháiⁿ lâi tsò hó sū, tsuan-sim tui-kiû hô-pîng.
English: Let him turn away from evil, and do good. Let him seek peace, and pursue it.

Tailo: In iû-guân koh teh tshì-thàm tsì-kuân Siōngtè, koh teh puē-gi̍k I, bô siú I kiàn-tsìng ê uē.
English: Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God, And didn't keep his testimonies;

Tailo: Sian-ti ê ha̍k-sing kā Elísiah kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guán kah lí só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi siuⁿ e̍h,
English: The sons of the prophets said to Elisha, See now, the place where we dwell before you is too strait for us.

Tailo: Iàn-si̍k ê ji̍t-tsí muá liáu-āu, Iobuh tshe lâng khì kiò in lâi kā in sìng-kiat. Koh thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, tsiàu in tsìng lâng ê sò͘-gia̍h hiàn sio-tsè; in-uī Iobuh kóng, Kiám-tshái guá ê kiáⁿ ū huān tsuē, sim-lāi khì-tsua̍t Siōngtsú. Iobuh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ án-ne tsò.
English: It was so, when the days of their feasting had run their course, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all. For Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and renounced God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.

Tailo: I koh kóng, Tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-ì, tsīn-la̍t thiàⁿ Siōngtè, koh tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī, tse pí hiàn kui-tsiah tsing-seⁿ ê sio-tsè kah tsè-mi̍h khah iàu-kín.
English: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

Tailo: In-uī i ū su-khó, huê-thâu lī-khui i só͘ huān it-tshè ê tsuē-kò, i it-tīng ē ua̍h, bē sí.
English: Because he considers, and turns away from all his transgressions that he has committed, he shall surely live, he shall not die.

Tailo: Le-ba-nòng, lí tio̍h khui lí ê mn̂g, hō͘ hué thang sio-bia̍t lí ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū.
English: Open your doors, Lebanon, That the fire may devour your cedars.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h īng i ê tsíng-thâu-á hiù hueh tī tuâⁿ-.ni̍h tshit pái, hō͘ i tshing-khì, lī-khui Isulael lâng ê bô tshing-khì, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and make it holy from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iô-há-neh iáu-buē hō͘ lâng kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ.
English: For John was not yet thrown into prison.

Tailo: Lín kng lín ê ông Se-khut kah lín ê siōng Ki-ûn, to̍h-sī lín ê sîn-bîng ê tsheⁿ, uī-tio̍h pún-sin só͘ tsō ê.
English: Yes, you have borne the tent of your king and the shrine of your images, the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê lâng kóng beh huí-huāi sìng-tiān, saⁿ ji̍t lāi koh khí khí-.lâi. Taⁿ tio̍h kiù Lí ka-kī. Lí nā-sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, tio̍h tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng lo̍h-.lâi.
English: and saying, You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!

Tailo: Só͘-ū tōng-bu̍t ê sèⁿ-miā kah jîn-luī ê tshuán-khuì, lóng tī I ê tshiú.
English: In whose hand is the life of every living thing, The breath of all mankind?

Tailo: Ông tsiàu-siông tsē i ê uī, to̍h-sī uá tī piah piⁿ ê uī, Ionáthan teh khiā, Apnel tsē tī Sàulô ê sin piⁿ, Tabi̍t ê uī pàng khang.
English: The king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side: but David's place was empty.

Tailo: Hit sî, kui-ê huē-tiûⁿ luān tshau-tshau, tsi̍t-ê lâng huah tsi̍t-khuán, tuā pō͘-hūn ê lâng m̄-tsai in uī siáⁿ-mi̍h teh tsū-tsi̍p.
English: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion. Most of them didn't know why they had come together.

Tailo: In kóng, Siōngtsú kám kan-taⁿ kah Mô͘se kóng-uē? Kám mā bô kah guán kóng-uē? Tsit-ê uē Siōngtsú ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: They said, Has Yahweh indeed spoken only with Moses? Hasn't he spoken also with us? Yahweh heard it.

Tailo: Thinn tíng ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú — tsì-tuā thang kiaⁿ-uì ê Siōngtè ah, siú iok kiânn thiàⁿ-sim tī thiàⁿ I koh tsun-thàn I kài-bīng ê lâng.
English: and said, I beg you, Yahweh, the God of heaven, the great and awesome God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with those who love him and keep his commandments:

Tailo: Koh īng sûn-kim tsò hâm-lîng, īng hâm-lîng kâⁿ sia̍h-liû, hē tī phâu ê sì-kho͘-uî ē-kha pô͘, sia̍h-liû ê tiong-kan;
English: They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates;

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū kā Isulael lâng kóng, in ê siú-líng tsiū kā kuái-á kau hō͘ i, tsiàu in ê tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t-ê siú-líng tsi̍t ki, kiōng tsa̍p-jī ki kuái-á; Alông ê kuái-á mā tī hiah-ê kuái-á ê tiong-kan.
English: Moses spoke to the children of Israel; and all their princes gave him rods, for each prince one, according to their fathers' houses, even twelve rods: and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kìng-uì Lí, kiû Lí uī i kian-siú Lí ê ìng-ín!
English: Fulfill your promise to your servant, That you may be feared.

Tailo: Hn̂g-tsú koh tshe tē-sann ê lô͘-po̍k khì, hiah-ê tshân-tiān mā sī kā i phah-siong, koh kā i kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

Tailo: In-uī in m̄ tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè ê uē, uî-puē I ê iok, kiàn-nā Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê, in m̄-thiaⁿ koh m̄ tsun-siú.
English: because they didn't obey the voice of Yahweh their God, but transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded, and would not hear it, nor do it.

Tailo: Tng Ta-lió-suh ông tsē-uī tē-la̍k nî, A-ta̍t gue̍h tshe-saⁿ, tsit-ê tiān tsiū khí hó-sè.
English: This house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

Tailo: Īng hó mi̍h hō͘ lí tsi̍t-sì-lâng sim-muá ì-tsiok, hō͘ lí huê-ho̍k siàu-liân tshin-tshiūnn ing-tsiáu.
English: Who satisfies your desire with good things, So that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

Tailo: Tī tsè-si ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong, tshâ-tshut tshuā guā-pang ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê, to̍h-sī Io-tsa-tak ê kiáⁿ E-siu-ah ê ke, kah i ê hiann-tī Maaseiah, Elíetsel, Ia-lip, Getália̍h.
English: Among the sons of the priests there were found who had married foreign women: namely, of the sons of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and his brothers, Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.

Tailo: In ê bé ū tshit-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p la̍k tsiah, in ê lô ū nn̄g-pah sì-tsa̍p gō͘ tsiah,
English: Their horses were seven hundred thirty-six; their mules, two hundred forty-five;

Tailo: Ia-el tshun tshiú gia̍h ting, tsiàⁿ tshiú gia̍h tsò-kang lâng ê thuî-á, īng thuî-á kòng Sisela̍h, tìng kuè i ê thâu-khak, tsha̍k thàu-kuè i ê pìn-piⁿ.
English: She put her hand to the tent peg, Her right hand to the workmen's hammer; With the hammer she struck Sisera, she struck through his head; Yes, she pierced and struck through his temples.

Tailo: Tshun guá ka-kī tī hia. Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tuā ī-siōng, sing-khu lóng bô khuì-la̍t, jî-tshiánn guá bīn-māu ê suí-sik piàn bái, tì-kàu lóng bô la̍t.
English: So I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me; for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng, tsīn-la̍t, thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: and you shall love Yahweh your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your might.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó; Iâkop ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Yahweh, God of Armies, hear my prayer. Listen, God of Jacob. Selah.

Tailo: I kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín kā guá ê tsú Esáu kóng, ' Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Iâkop án-ne kóng, guá tī La̍hban hia kià-kha, tuà kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: He commanded them, saying, This is what you shall tell my lord, Esau: This is what your servant, Jacob, says. I have lived as a foreigner with Laban, and stayed until now.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu ìn kóng, Thiaⁿ Siōngtè ê tō-lí lâi tsun-siú ê lâng koh khah ū hok-khì!
English: But he said, On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.

Tailo: Su-io̍k huâi-īn tsiū seⁿ-tshut tsuē-ok, tsuē-ok tióng-sîng liáu-āu tsiū seⁿ-tshut sí-bông.
English: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, brings forth death.

Tailo: Hit sî, só͘-ū kiû-kiò Tsú ê miâ ê lâng lóng ē tit kiù. (tsù, IES 2:28-32)
English: It will be, that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.'

Tailo: Ông só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h tshuā in ji̍p-khì ê ji̍t í-king kàu, thài-kàm-tiúⁿ tsiū tshuā in ji̍p-khì kàu Nepkatnetsal ê bīn-tsîng.
English: At the end of the days which the king had appointed for bringing them in, the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.

Tailo: Thekouah ê tsa-bó͘ lâng koh kā ông kóng, Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, guān tsit-ê tsuē kui tī guá kah guá ê pē ê ke, ông kah i ê uī lóng bô tsuē.
English: The woman of Tekoa said to the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father's house; and the king and his throne be guiltless.

Tailo: Tsit sì-tsa̍p nî, lí ê saⁿ-khò͘ bô phuà, lí ê kha mā bô phòng-phā.
English: Your clothing didn't grow old on you, neither did your foot swell, these forty years.

Tailo: Guá tsun-thàn Lí só͘ kóng ê uē, bô tshin-tshiūnn pa̍t lâng ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h; guá ka-kī kín-sīn, bô kiâⁿ kiông-pō ê lâng ê lō͘.
English: As for the works of men, by the word of your lips I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.

Tailo: Guá beh bīng-līng in, hō͘ in koh lâi tsit-ê siâⁿ; in ē kong-kik tsit-ê siâⁿ, kā i tsing-ho̍k, īng hué kā i sio. Guá mā beh hō͘ Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ pha-hng, bô lâng tuà tī hia.
English: Behold, I will command, says Yahweh, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.

Tailo: Bē khuài siū-khì ê lâng ū tuā tshong-bîng; sò-sìng ê lâng ē hián-tshut tuā gû-gōng.
English: He who is slow to anger has great understanding, But he who has a quick temper displays folly.

Tailo: Guá siat-li̍p tsè-si Silemiah, king-ha̍k kàu-su Tsa-tok kah Lēbī lâng Petáiah tsò khò͘-pâng ê kuann, kuán-lí khò͘-pâng; hù-kuaⁿ sī Hanan, Hanan sī Tsa̍k-khul ê kiáⁿ, Tsa̍k-khul sī Mattániah ê kiáⁿ; in-uī guá khuànn tsit kuí-ê lâng sī tsīn-tiong, in ê tsit-hūn sī hun-huat mi̍h hō͘ in ê hiann-tī.
English: I made treasurers over the treasuries, Shelemiah the priest, and Zadok the scribe, and of the Levites, Pedaiah: and next to them was Hanan the son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah; for they were counted faithful, and their business was to distribute to their brothers.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê só͘-ū ê Iôtah lâng tuì in hō͘ lâng kuáⁿ-khì ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi tò tńg-.lâi, lâi-kàu Iôtah tē ê Mi-su-peh, khì kìⁿ Getália̍h, koh tsik-tsū tsin tsē tsiú kah jua̍h-thinn ê kué-tsí.
English: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, to Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.

Tailo: Lí tsioh guā-tso̍k ê lâng, thang the̍h i ê lī-sik, tsóng-.sī, tsioh lí ê hiann-tī tsiū m̄-thang the̍h i ê lī-sik; thang hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tī lí só͘ khì beh tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, tī lí ê tshiú só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, kā lí sù-hok.
English: to a foreigner you may lend on interest; but to your brother you shall not lend on interest, that Yahweh your God may bless you in all that you put your hand to, in the land where you go in to possess it.

Tailo: to̍h-sī tī Tsú īng sím-phuàⁿ ê sîn-lîng kah sio-huí ê sîn-lîng, sé-tû Si-óng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê ù-uè, tshing-khì Êlúsalèm tiong-kan thâi lâng lâu hueh ê hueh-jiah ê sî.
English: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from its midst, by the spirit of justice, and by the spirit of burning.

Tailo: Sio̍k Ê-lám ê kiáⁿ-sun, Ia-tsi-el ê kiáⁿ Sikaniah, ìn Etsula̍h kóng, Guán tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan tshuā guā-pang lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, puē-gi̍k-tio̍h lán ê Siōngtè, tsóng-.sī, Isulael lâng tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì tíng-bīn iáu-koh ū thang ǹg-bāng.
English: Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered Ezra, We have trespassed against our God, and have married foreign women of the peoples of the land: yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.

Tailo: Alông tńg-lâi-kàu Mô͘se hia, lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, un-i̍k tsiah suah.
English: Aaron returned to Moses to the door of the tent of meeting: and the plague was stayed.

Tailo: Lán nā sîng-jīn lán ê tsuē, Siōngtè sī tsin-si̍t koh kong-gī, I ē sià-bián lán ê tsuē, sé-tû lán it-tshè ê put-gī.
English: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us the sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Tailo: tshiuⁿ-pèⁿ tuā kah tshin-tshiūnn pò͘-ki ê ti̍k-sim, tshiuⁿ-bué ê thih ū la̍k pah si-khel ê tāng. Ū tsi̍t-ê gia̍h tîn-pâi ê kiânn tī i ê thâu-tsîng.
