English: The staff of his spear was like a weaver's beam; and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and his shield bearer went before him.

Tailo: Tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê khuê-tshiú ê lâng tī hia. Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng siūⁿ beh tshuē khang-phāng lâi kò Iésu, tsiū mn̄g I kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t i-pēⁿ kám ū tsiàu lu̍t-huat ê kui-tīng?
English: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. They asked him, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day? that they might accuse him.

Tailo: Hit mê, Siōngtsú huan-hù Gîtióng kóng, Lí khan lín lāu-pē ê gû-á lâi, to̍h-sī tshit nî ê tē-jī tsiah gû, mā tio̍h thiah-huí lín lāu-pē só͘-ū Baal ê tuâⁿ, kā tuâⁿ piⁿ ê A-si-lah tshò tiāu,
English: It happened the same night, that Yahweh said to him, Take your father's bull, even the second bull seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the Asherah that is by it;

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng lâi tshuē Iésu, khai-sí kah I piān-lūn. In siūⁿ beh kā I tshì-thàm, iau-kiû I kiânn tsi̍t-ê tuì thinn-tíng lâi ê sîn-jiah.
English: The Pharisees came out and began to question him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, and testing him.

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī tuà tī pîng-guân ê lâng hiah-ê tsè-si siu-lí.
English: After him repaired the priests, the men of the Plain.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, thàn guá bô tī lín hia ê sî, guá siá tsit tiuⁿ phue hō͘ lín, tsiah bián-tit guá khì-kàu lín hia ê sî, īng Tsú só͘ hō͘ guá ê kuân-pìng lâi giâm-lē tuì-thāi lín; tsit-ê kuân-pìng sī beh khí-tsō, m̄-sī beh phò-huāi.
English: For this cause I write these things while absent, that I may not deal sharply when present, according to the authority which the Lord gave me for building up, and not for tearing down.

Tailo: Ē ū kám-siā kah khuài-lo̍k-.ê ê siann tuì in tiong-kan tshut-.lâi, Guá mā beh hō͘ in ke-thinn tsin tsē, bē tì-kàu kiám-tsió; hō͘ in tsun-kuì, bē tì-kàu pi-bî.
English: Out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of those who make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

Tailo: Tiau khik ngó͘-siōng ê lâng tsuân-pō͘ lóng sī khang-hi; in só͘ huann-hí ê lóng bô lī-ik; in ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, mā m̄-tsai puàⁿ-hāng, tì-sú hō͘ in kiàn-siàu.
English: Those who fashion an engraved image are all of them vanity; and the things that they delight in shall not profit; and their own witnesses don't see, nor know: that they may be disappointed.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh khí huí-bia̍t ê hong, lâi kong-kik Babúlông kah tuà tī hia ê Kal-tí-ah lâng.
English: Thus says Yahweh: Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against those who dwell in Lebkamai, a destroying wind.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Tse sī Siōngtsú bīng-līng lín só͘ tio̍h tsò ê, Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tsiū ē hián-hiān hō͘ lín khuànn.
English: Moses said, This is the thing which Yahweh commanded that you should do: and the glory of Yahweh shall appear to you.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, I hó-tánn teh kóng, mā bô lâng tuì I kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h. Kám kóng tsiah-ê kuaⁿ-hú tsin-tsiàⁿ tsai-iáⁿ tsit-ê sī Ki-tok?
English: Behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is truly the Christ?

Tailo: Kàu tē-sì tāi, in ē tńg-lâi tsia, in-uī Amô͘lī tso̍k ê tsuē iáu-buē kuàn-buán.
English: In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tsit-hāng tāi-tsì, guá bat saⁿ pái khún-kiû Tsú, hō͘ hit ki tshì lī-khui guá.
English: Concerning this thing, I begged the Lord three times that it might depart from me.

Tailo: I kā tē-jī kiáⁿ hō-miâ kiò-tsò Ehulaim, in-uī i kóng, Siōngtè hō͘ guá tī guá siū khó͘ ê só͘-tsāi hing-ōng.
English: The name of the second, he called Ephraim : For God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ìn Iosiúah kóng, Bô lah; guán tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: The people said to Joshua, No; but we will serve Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit tsiah tn̂g-mn̂g ê kang ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ to̍h-sī Hi-la̍h ông; i nn̄g luí ba̍k-tsiu tiong-kan ê tuā ki kak to̍h-sī thâu tsi̍t-ê ông.
English: The rough male goat is the king of Greece: and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.

Tailo: Gia̍h i ê tsiàn-khì ê lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sàulô í-king sí, mā ka-kī tsha̍k tī to-.ni̍h lâi sí.
English: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword, and died.

Tailo: Su-tê-hua-no͘h kóng, Kok-uī hū-ló hiann-tī, tshiánn thiaⁿ, lán ê tsó͘-sian Abulahàm iáu-buē suá khì Khal-lân í-tsîng, iáu tuà tī Mêsó͘potamiah ê sî, îng-kng ê Siōngtè tuì i hián-hiān,
English: He said, Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín tsiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng ē ū tsai-hō! In-uī lín í-king teh hióng-siū an-lo̍k ê sing-ua̍h.
English: But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.

Tailo: Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Gîtióng nî lāu huè tsē, tsiū sí, bâi-tsòng tī Abietsel tso̍k ê O͘hulah, tī i ê lāu-pē Io-a-si ê bōng.
English: Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

Tailo: kah i tuà kuí ji̍t, thìng-hāu lí ê a-hiaⁿ siū-khì siau-.khì.
English: Stay with him a few days, until your brother's fury turns away;

Tailo: Akisi hiah-ê jîn-sîn kā i kóng, Tsit-ê kám m̄-sī hit kok ê ông Tabi̍t? In tī thiàu-bú tiong tshiùnn koh hô kóng: Sàulô kā in thâi-sí ê tshing-tshing, Tabi̍t kā in thâi-sí ê bān-bān, kám m̄ sī teh tsí tsit-ê lâng?
English: The servants of Achish said to him, Isn't this David the king of the land? Didn't they sing one to another about him in dances, saying, Saul has slain his thousands, David his ten thousands?'

Tailo: Iok-kuī tī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm ê ji̍t-tsí tsin kú, king-kuè jī-tsa̍p nî, Isulael tsuân ke tui-liām Siōngtsú.
English: It happened, from the day that the ark abode in Kiriath Jearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years: and all the house of Israel lamented after Yahweh.

Tailo: Līng-guā tsi̍t-ê bûn-tô͘, to̍h-sī Símòng Piattò͘ ê sió-tī An-to-le̍h, kā Iésu kóng,
English: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to him,

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng ìn kóng, Guá bô ang. Iésu kā i kóng, Lí kóng bô ang, bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: The woman answered, I have no husband. Jesus said to her, You said well, I have no husband,'

Tailo: Tsí-ū Io-si-iah ông tsa̍p-peh nî, tī Êlúsalèm siú tsit-ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: but in the eighteenth year of king Josiah was this Passover kept to Yahweh in Jerusalem.

Tailo: I ê ba̍k-tsiu in-uī tsiú lâi âng, i ê tshuì-khí in-uī ling lâi pe̍h.
English: His eyes will be red with wine, His teeth white with milk.

Tailo: Lí kám ē iô-tāng hō͘ hong tshue ê tshiū-hio̍h? Lí kám ē khì jiok ta-.khì ê tsháu?
English: Will you harass a driven leaf? Will you pursue the dry stubble?

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī liông-siān koh tsìng-ti̍t, I ē tsí-sī tsuē-jîn kiânn tsiàⁿ lō͘.
English: Good and upright is Yahweh, Therefore he will instruct sinners in the way.

Tailo: Páulô tī A-thé-nè teh thìng-hāu Sela̍h kah Tî-mó͘-theh ê kî-kan, khuàⁿ-tio̍h muá siâⁿ lóng sī ngó͘-siōng, tsiū siong-sim tio̍h-kip.
English: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he saw the city full of idols.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ kā I kóng, Lâng ê ang-bó͘ kuan-hē Nā-sī án-ne, lîng-khó mài kiat-hun khah hó.
English: His disciples said to him, If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.

Tailo: In ê gû-káng put-tuān seⁿ-thuàⁿ, in ê gû-bó seⁿ kiáⁿ mā bô làu-the.
English: Their bulls breed without fail. Their cows calve, and don't miscarry.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá tuì pháiⁿ lâng kóng, ' Lí it-tīng ē sí! ' I nā ua̍t tńg-lâi lī-khui i ê tsuē, kiânn tsìng-ti̍t kah ha̍p-lí ê tāi-tsì;
English: Again, when I say to the wicked, You shall surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right;

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ lín ê sìn-sim bē iô-tāng.
English: These things have I spoken to you, so that you wouldn't be caused to stumble.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tsiū kā I kóng, Lí teh uī ka-kī tsò kiàn-tsìng, Lí ê kiàn-tsìng bô hāu.
English: The Pharisees therefore said to him, You testify about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.

Tailo: Hitsekia kah hiah-ê siú-líng lâi khuànn hiah-ê tui, tsiū o-ló Siōngtsú ū tsiok-hok I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng.
English: When Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed Yahweh, and his people Israel.

Tailo: tsè-si tsiū tio̍h huan-hù lâng kā hiah-ê jiám-tio̍h tsìng-thâu ê tsio̍h iah khí-.lâi, hiat tī siâⁿ guā bô tshing-khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: then the priest shall command that they take out the stones in which is the plague, and cast them into an unclean place outside of the city:

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h kun-ông, in-uī i sī kun-ông, thang tsē tī hit lāi-bīn, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tsia̍h piáⁿ; i tio̍h tuì tsit-ê mn̂g ê lông ji̍p-.lâi, mā tio̍h tuì hia tshut-.khì.
English: As for the prince, he shall sit therein as prince to eat bread before Yahweh; he shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate, and shall go out by the way of the same.

Tailo: Siōngtè īng Páulô ê tshiú, kiânn hui-siông hi-hán ê sîn-jiah.
English: God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul,

Tailo: Tú hit sî, ū tsi̍t-ê tài hiat-lāu-pēⁿ tsa̍p-jī nî ê hū-jîn-lâng kiâⁿ uá-lâi Iésu ê āu-bīn, bong I ê saⁿ-á-ki ê tshiu.
English: Behold, a woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years came behind him, and touched the tassels of his garment;

Tailo: Ngó͘-siōng sī sai-hū tsù-tsō, gîn-tshiūⁿ īng kim kā i an, kā i tsù gîn-liān.
English: A workman has cast an image, And the goldsmith overlays it with gold, And casts silver chains for it.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí kā Alông kóng, ' Tshun-tshut lí ê kuái-á, phah tē-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún, hō͘ i tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē piàn-tsò sat-bó. '
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Tell Aaron, Stretch out your rod, and strike the dust of the earth, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.'

Tailo: Me-ná-hiàm kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: In-uī sí-bông lâi-kàu lán ê thang-á-mn̂g, ji̍p-lâi lán ê siâⁿ-pó; tuì guā-bīn tsâu-bia̍t hiah-ê gín-á, tuì ke-lō͘ tsâu-bia̍t hiah-ê siàu-liân lâng.
English: For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces; to cut off the children from outside, and the young men from the streets.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Kiû Lí hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí ê îng-kng.
English: He said, Please show me your glory.

Tailo: Guá uī ka-kī siu-tsō hue-hn̂g kah kué-tsí hn̂g, tī hit lāi-bīn tsai-tsìng ta̍k tsióng ê kué-tsí tshiū.
English: I made myself gardens and parks, and I planted trees in them of all kinds of fruit.

Tailo: ' Mā m̄-thang tham lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê bó͘, mā m̄-thang tham lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê tshù kah i ê tshân-hn̂g, i ê lô͘-po̍k, i ê lú-pī, i ê gû, i ê lî-á kah lí ê tshù-piⁿ it-tshè só͘-ū ê.
English: Neither shall you covet your neighbor's wife; neither shall you desire your neighbor's house, his field, or his male servant, or his female servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor's.

Tailo: Guán tsai Siōngtè ū tuì Mô͘se kóng-uē; to̍k-to̍k tsit-ê lâng tuì tó-uī lâi, guán m̄-tsai.
English: We know that God has spoken to Moses. But as for this man, we don't know where he comes from.

Tailo: In ê pò͘-pênn kah iûⁿ-kûn ē hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-.khì, kā tiùⁿ-pak kah it-tshè ê khì-kū, í-ki̍p lo̍k-tô, lóng tshiúⁿ-khì tsò ka-kī ê. Lâng tuì in huah, ' sì-kho͘-uî lóng ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ'.
English: Their tents and their flocks shall they take; they shall carry away for themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry to them, Terror on every side!

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Beh kā i kng khì Sīnal tē khí tshù; tshù nā khí hó-sè, tsiū ē kā i an-tì tī ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He said to me, To build her a house in the land of Shinar. When it is prepared, she will be set there in her own place.

Tailo: Iôtah thok i ê pîng-iú A-tu-lâm lâng sàng tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, beh tuì hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tshiú the̍h tsún-tǹg, m̄-koh, tshuē bē-tio̍h i.
English: Judah sent the kid of the goats by the hand of his friend, the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the woman's hand, but he didn't find her.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tshut tī sim só͘ huann-hí ê, tsa-po͘ kah tsa-bó͘ lóng lâi, ta̍k-ê kā kim-khì, to̍h-sī hing tsîng ê pín-tsiam, hīⁿ-kau, phah ìn ê tshiú-tsí kah tshiú-khuân. Tse sī ta̍k lâng kā i ê lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: They came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, and brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, and armlets, all jewels of gold; even every man who offered an offering of gold to Yahweh.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah tsè-si Êlīatsal, tsiū siu in ê kim, to̍h-sī ta̍k tsióng phah hó ê tsong-sik.
English: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all worked jewels.

Tailo: Mô͘se īng buah in ê iû buah huē-bō͘ kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê mi̍h, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and sanctified them.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, ông kuè-.khì, lâi-kàu Gilgal, Kim-hám mā kah i kuè-.khì. Iôtah tsìng lâng kah Isulael jîn-bîn ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ, mā lóng sàng ông kuè-.khì.
English: So the king went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went over with him: and all the people of Judah brought the king over, and also half the people of Israel.

Tailo: Hit-ê tshù-tsú tshut-lâi in hia, kā in kóng, Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī, tshian-bān m̄-thang tsò tsit-ê pháiⁿ tāi-tsì. Tsit-ê lâng kì-jiân ji̍p-lâi guá ê tshù, lín tsiū m̄-thang tsò tsit-ê kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì.
English: The man, the master of the house, went out to them, and said to them, No, my brothers, please don't act so wickedly; seeing that this man is come into my house, don't do this folly.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè pí lán ê sim khah tuā, mā ta̍k hāng lóng tsai.
English: because if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.

Tailo: Tsuân-lîng-.ê lán bē-tàng tshik-to̍k I; I ū tuā lîng-li̍k, ū kong-pêⁿ koh tshiong-muá kong-gī, bô beh kā lâng khó͘-to̍k.
English: We can't reach the Almighty, He is exalted in power; In justice and great righteousness he will not oppress.

Tailo: Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap tsò kun-tiúⁿ, Ahilu̍t ê kiáⁿ Iô-sa-huat tsò sú-kuaⁿ.
English: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k I lâi ê ji̍t, siáⁿ lâng tng ē khí? I hián-hiān ê sî, siáⁿ lâng khiā ē tiâu? In-uī I tshin-tshiūnn tuàn-liān kuè ê hué, koh tshin-tshiūnn phiò-pò͘ teh īng ê kinn.
English: But who can endure the day of his coming? And who will stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner's fire, and like launderer's soap;

Tailo: Só͘-í, in ìn kóng, Guán m̄-tsai sī tuì tó-uī lâi ê.
English: They answered that they didn't know where it was from.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng ē tī hit-ê lô͘-po̍k bô phah-sǹg ê ji̍t, siūnn bē kàu ê sî tńg-.lâi.
English: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn't expect it, and in an hour when he doesn't know it,

Tailo: Ki-tok thè lán sí, sī beh hō͘ lán bô-lūn sī ua̍h á-.sī sí, lóng ē-tàng tī I tsài-lîm ê sî kah I tsò-hué ua̍h.
English: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

Tailo: Guá í-king ū hō͘ in bat Lí ê miâ, mā beh kè-sio̍k tsí-sī in, thang hō͘ Lí tuì guá ê thiàⁿ tī in lāi-bīn, guá mā tī in lāi-bīn.
English: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.

Tailo: Án-ne, lâng só͘ liāu-sióng buē kàu ê Siōngtè ê pîng-an, ē thong-kuè Ki-tok Iésu lâi pó-siú lín ê sim-su ì-liām.
English: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng kóng, Tsit-ê sī sian-ti Iésu, Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng.
English: The multitudes said, This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.

Tailo: Iā-tsíng ê kah ak-tsuí ê lóng bô tiōng-iàu, hō͘ i tuā tsâng ê Siōngtè tsiah tiōng-iàu.
English: So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.

Tailo: Siōngtè it-tshè ê ìng-ín tsāi tī Iésu Ki-tok lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò Sī , só͘-í, lán thong-kuè I kóng, A-men , lâi îng-kng Siōngtè.
English: For however many are the promises of God, in him is the Yes. Therefore also through him is the Amen, to the glory of God through us.

Tailo: Siōngtè tshun tshiú phah tīng tsio̍h, tuì suaⁿ ê kin-ki kā i píng khí-.lâi.
English: He puts forth his hand on the flinty rock, And he overturns the mountains by the roots.

Tailo: Guān bān-kok khuài-lo̍k, tshut huann-hí ê siann tshiùⁿ kua! In-uī Lí ē tsiàu kong-gī sím-phuàⁿ lia̍t pang, tī-lí tē-tsiūⁿ ê bān-kok. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy, For you will judge the peoples with equity, And govern the nations on earth. Selah.

Tailo: Lāi-té mn̂g ê guā-bīn, pak-mn̂g piⁿ ê lāi-īⁿ ū pâng-king, sī uī-tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng lâi siat ê; hiah-ê pâng-king ǹg lâm, tang-mn̂g piⁿ mā ū tsi̍t king ǹg pak.
English: Outside of the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their prospect was toward the south; one at the side of the east gate having the prospect toward the north.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí sī guá ê ông; kiû Lí tshut bīng-līng lâi tsín-kiù Iâkop.
English: You are my King, God. Command victories for Jacob!

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, guá lâi-kàu tséⁿ piⁿ, kóng, ' Guá ê tsú-lâng Abulahàm ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, Lí nā khíng, kiû Lí hō͘ guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ sūn-sī. '
English: I came this day to the spring, and said, Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè sì-kè kiânn tī lí ê iâⁿ lāi, beh kā lí tsín-kiù, kā lí ê tuì-ti̍k kau hō͘ lí, só͘-í, lí ê iâⁿ-pâng ing-kai tio̍h ū sìng-kiat, bián-tit I khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí tiong-kan ū ù-uè tsiū lī-khui lí.
English: for Yahweh your God walks in the midst of your camp, to deliver you, and to give up your enemies before you; therefore shall your camp be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in you, and turn away from you.

Tailo: Iâkop mā kah La̍h-khel tâng-pâng, koh thiàⁿ La̍h-khel iâⁿ-kuè Leah. I tsiū koh kā La̍hban tsò-kang tshit nî.
English: He went in also to Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi Mítiân án-ne kā in khuán-thāi; tshin-tshiūnn tī Kisióng hô khuán-thāi Sisela̍h kah Ia-bín.
English: Do to them as you did to Midian, As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon;

Tailo: Tsìng kun-tiúⁿ, Kaleah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân, Ho-sia-iah ê kiáⁿ Ia-tsa-ni-iah, í-ki̍p tsìng lâng, tuì sè kàu tuā lóng tsìn-tsîng lâi,
English: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, came near,

Tailo: Lâng sí-.khì kám ē koh ua̍h? Guá tio̍h jím-nāi guá lô-khó͘ ê ji̍t-tsí, thìng-hāu guá thè-uāⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí kàu.
English: If a man dies, shall he live again? All the days of my warfare would I wait, Until my release should come.

Tailo: Phok-sū īng in ê siâ-su̍t mā án-ne tsò, hō͘ tshân-kap-á khí-lâi Aigi̍p tē.
English: The magicians did in like manner with their enchantments, and brought up frogs on the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Lín nā lī-khui Siōngtsú khì ho̍k-sāi guā-pang ê sîn-bîng, Siōngtsú tī kàng hok-khì hō͘ lín liáu-āu, beh ua̍t tńg-sin lâi kàng tsai-hō hō͘ lín, kā lín bia̍t-bông.
English: If you forsake Yahweh, and serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you evil, and consume you, after that he has done you good.

Tailo: Guān Lí ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī in ê sin tsiūⁿ, hō͘ Lí lia̍t-lia̍t ê siū-khì jiok-tio̍h in.
English: Pour out your indignation on them. Let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.

Tailo: Lí tī in ê bīn-tsîng kā hái hun-khui, hō͘ in tuì hái tiong ná tshin-tshiūnn kiânn ta tē kuè-.khì, Lí kā jiok in ê lâng hiat tī tshim hái, ná tshin-tshiūnn hiat tsio̍h-thâu tī tuā-tsuí tiong;
English: You divided the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and their pursuers you did cast into the depths, as a stone into the mighty waters.

Tailo: Páulô siūⁿ beh ji̍p-khì kûn-tsiòng ê lāi-bīn, bûn-tô͘ kā i tsó͘-tòng.
English: When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn't allow him.

Tailo: Lūbiān ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, in ê tsing-seⁿ hui-siông tsē; in khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ia-tsel ê tē kah Gilia̍t ê tē, sī thang tshī tsing-seⁿ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock: and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that behold, the place was a place for livestock;

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn sé-lé, huāⁿ-tshiú, sí-lâng koh-ua̍h kah íng-uán ê sím-phuàⁿ tíng-tíng ê kà-sī.
English: of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè koh ē tshe tuā-tsiah phang pue kàu in tiong-kan, it-ti̍t kàu in só͘ tshun lo̍h-lâi teh siám-bih-.ê tī lí ê bīn-tsîng siau-bia̍t.
English: Moreover Yahweh your God will send the hornet among them, until those who are left, and hide themselves, perish from before you.

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ Êlīatsal, Ithamal kóng, M̄-thang phah-suàⁿ thâu-mn̂g, mā m̄-thang thiah-li̍h saⁿ, bián-tit lín sí-bông, koh bián-tit Siōngtsú tuì huē-tsiòng siū-khì; tsóng-.sī, lín ê hiann-tī Isulael tsuân ke uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú só͘ huat-tshut ê hué lâi ai-khàu.
English: Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, Don't let the hair of your heads go loose, neither tear your clothes; that you don't die, and that he not be angry with all the congregation: but let your brothers, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which Yahweh has kindled.

Tailo: Lâng nā kóng ka-kī sing-ua̍h tī kng-bîng tiong, m̄-koh, iáu-teh uàn-hūn i ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē, i sū-si̍t siōng sī iáu-koh sing-ua̍h tī o͘-àm tiong.
English: He who says he is in the light and hates his brother, is in the darkness even until now.

Tailo: Lo-t, O͘-nó͘, kang-tshiūⁿ ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Lod, and Ono, the valley of craftsmen.

Tailo: Ji̍t-āu lín tú-tio̍h khó͘-lān, só͘ kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lîm-kàu lí, lí ē kui-ǹg Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, lâi thiaⁿ I ê uē.
English: When you are in oppression, and all these things are come on you, in the latter days you shall return to Yahweh your God, and listen to his voice:

Tailo: Guá —Té-tioh, to̍h-sī tsit tiuⁿ phue ê tāi-pit-jîn, tī Tsú lāi kā lín tshíng-an.
English: I, Tertius, who write the letter, greet you in the Lord.

Tailo: Pò hó siau-sit hō͘ Si-óng ê, lí tio̍h tsiūⁿ kuân suaⁿ; pò hó siau-sit hō͘ Êlúsalèm ê, lí tio̍h tsīn-la̍t tshut lí ê siann. Tio̍h tshut siaⁿ, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, tuì Iôtah ê siâⁿ kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, lín ê Siōngtè!
English: You who tell good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who tell good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength. Lift it up. Don't be afraid. Say to the cities of Judah, Behold, your God!

Tailo: Tuì sàn-tshiah lâng khik-po̍k sī teh siat-to̍k Tshòng-tsō-tsú; liân-bín khiàm-khueh ê lâng sī tsun-kìng Tsú.
English: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker, But he who is kind to the needy honors him.

Tailo: Ū si-thé ê só͘-tsāi, ing-tsiáu tsiū ē tsū-tsi̍p khì hia.
English: For wherever the carcass is, there will the vultures be gathered together.

Tailo: Ke-ti-mo͘t kah i ê kau-iá, Me-hua-at kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Kedemoth with its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: Ehulaim ê suaⁿ-tsē, Ta-má-su-ko ê kok-kuân, Alâm só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, lóng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Isulael ê îng-kng siau-sit-.khì. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: The fortress shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria. They will be as the glory of the children of Israel, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: In-uī lí beh ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē, m̄-sī tshin-tshiūnn lín tshut-.lâi ê Aigi̍p tē, lí tī hia iā tsíng, īng kha ta̍h lâi kuàn-ak, tshin-tshiūnn tshài-hn̂g.
English: For the land, where you go in to possess it, isn't as the land of Egypt, from whence you came out, where you sowed your seed, and watered it with your foot, as a garden of herbs;

Tailo: Só͘-í, khòng-iá ê tsáu-siù kah tshâi-lông ē tuà tī hia, to-kiàm mā ē tiàm tī hit tiong-kan, íng-uán bô jîn-ian, tāi-tāi bô lâng tuà.
English: Therefore the wild animals of the desert with the wolves shall dwell there, and the ostriches shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited forever; neither shall it be lived in from generation to generation.

Tailo: lín ē tsia̍h kàu tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t muá, kàu bah tuì lín ê phīⁿ-khang tshut-.lâi, hō͘ lín thó-ià, in-uī lín khì-sak tiàm tī lín tiong-kan ê Siōngtsú, tī I ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu kóng, guán ná ē tshut Aigi̍p? '
English: but a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome to you; because that you have rejected Yahweh who is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, I huat-tshut I ê kng tī hit tíng-bīn; I koh kā hái-té jia-khàm.
English: Behold, he spreads his light around him. He covers the bottom of the sea.

Tailo: I ê tì-huī iâⁿ-kuè bān lâng, iâⁿ-kuè Etsula̍h lâng Ethán kah Ma-hol ê kiáⁿ Hemán, Kal-kol, Tal-tah; i ê miâ-siaⁿ pò-iông tī sì-kho͘-uî ê lia̍t kok.
English: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the nations round about.

Tailo: Koh kā Isulael ông kóng, Lí īng tshiú pue̍h kiong. I tsiū īng tshiú pue̍h kiong.
English: He said to the king of Israel, Put your hand on the bow; and he put his hand on it. Elisha laid his hands on the king's hands.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tio̍h tiàu Baal ê tsìng sian-ti kah só͘-ū ho̍k-sāi Baal ê, í-ki̍p i só͘-ū ê tsè-si lâi guá tsia, m̄-thang kiám tsi̍t-ê lâng, in-uī guá beh hiàn tuā ê tsè-sū hō͘ Baal, kiàn-nā bô lâi ê lóng bē-tàng ua̍h. E-hú án-ne kiânn sī īng kuí-kè, beh tsuân-pō͘ thâi-sí pài Baal ê lâng.
English: Now therefore call to me all the prophets of Baal, all his worshippers, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtlety, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.

Tailo: I ê khuì-la̍t nā bô kàu-gia̍h thang hiàn nn̄g tsiah pan-kah á-.sī nn̄g tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ, tsiū tio̍h in-uī i só͘ huān ê tsuē, tuà i ê lé-mi̍h lâi, to̍h-sī iù ê mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, m̄-thang lo̍h iû, mā m̄-thang tsham jú-hiuⁿ, in-uī tse sī sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: But if he can't afford two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he shall bring his offering for that in which he has sinned, the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering. He shall put no oil on it, neither shall he put any frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.

Tailo: Kóng ' Lí ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián' Á-sī kóng ' Lí khí-lâi kiâⁿ', tó tsi̍t hāng khah kán-tan?
English: Which is easier to say, Your sins are forgiven you;' or to say, Arise and walk?'

Tailo: Iésu tuì in kóng, Lín tio̍h siat-huat hō͘ in tsia̍h. In kóng, Lán tsia kan-tāⁿ ū gō͘ tè piáⁿ, nn̄g bué hî. Guán nā bô khì bé, ná ū kàu tsiah-ê kûn-tsiòng tsia̍h?
English: But he said to them, You give them something to eat. They said, We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.

Tailo: Akhàtsuh kóng, Guá m̄ kiû, mā m̄ tshì-thàm Siōngtsú.
English: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt Yahweh.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ông tsiū ji̍p-.khì, tsē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, Siōngtsú — Siōngtè ah, guá sī siáⁿ lâng, guá sī siáⁿ-mi̍h hō ê ke, Lí tsiah tshuā guá kàu tsit-ê tē-pō͘?
English: Then David the king went in, and sat before Yahweh; and he said, Who am I, Yahweh God, and what is my house, that you have brought me thus far?

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Taⁿ tsit-ê sī guá kut lāi ê kut, bah lāi ê bah; guá beh kā i kiò-tsò tsa-bó͘ lâng, in-uī i sī tuì tsa-po͘ lâng the̍h tshut-.lâi ê.
English: The man said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h jī-tsa̍p saⁿ ji̍t, ông tshe jîn-bîn tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn, ta̍k-ê lâng huann-hí, sim khuài-lo̍k, sī in-uī Siōngtsú só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Tabi̍t, Só͘lômóng kah I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng ê un-huī.
English: On the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents, joyful and glad of heart for the goodness that Yahweh had shown to David, and to Solomon, and to Israel his people.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsí-put-kò sī lâng tsō tshut-.lâi ê kàu-kui kah kà-sī, īng liáu tsiū bô lō͘-īng.
English: (all of which perish with use), according to the precepts and doctrines of men?

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Guá mā beh kiâⁿ Guá ê tuā siū-khì, Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô beh thiàⁿ-sioh in, Guá mā bô beh khó-liân in; in suî-jiân ǹg Guá ê hīⁿ-khang tiong tuā-siaⁿ kiû-kiò, Guá iû-guân m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: Therefore will I also deal in wrath; my eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity; and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.

Tailo: Kú-tn̂g jím-nāi ê lâng, kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ mā ē siū i khó͘-khǹg; un-jiû ê tshuì-tsi̍h ē at-tn̄g kut-thâu.
English: By patience a ruler is persuaded. A soft tongue breaks the bone.

Tailo: Iân khe kui tīn teh kiâⁿ ê lâng uan-lâi uat-khì, in tsiūⁿ-kàu pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi tsiū sí-.khì.
English: The caravans that travel beside them turn aside; They go up into the waste, and perish.

Tailo: Guán bô īng pa̍t lâng lô-khó͘ uân-sîng ê tāi-tsì tòng-tsò ka-kī ê sîng-tsik lâi khua-kháu; guán ǹg-bāng lín ê sìn-sim ē ná tsing-tióng, guán tī lín tiong-kan kang-tsok ê huān-uî ē ná khui-khuah.
English: not boasting beyond proper limits in other men's labors, but having hope that as your faith grows, we will be abundantly enlarged by you in our sphere of influence,

Tailo: Tsiàn-tshia ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iô-sa-huat tsiū kóng, Tse sī Isulael ông, tsiū ua̍t kuè-khì beh kah i kau-tsiàn. Iô-sa-huat tsiū huah-hiu, Siōngtsú tsiū kā i pang-tsān, Siōngtsú mā kám-tōng in lī-khui i.
English: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they turned about to fight against him: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and Yahweh helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.

Tailo: Kiù-sio̍k in ê ū tuā khuì-la̍t, I ê miâ kiò-tsò bān-kun ê Siōngtsú. I ē uī in sin-uan, hō͘ tsuân tē tit-tio̍h pîng-an, mā hō͘ tuà tī Babúlông ê jîn-bîn phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: Their Redeemer is strong; Yahweh of Armies is his name: he will thoroughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the earth, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

Tailo: Guá tsiū sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Gōng lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê, guá mā ē án-ne tú-.tio̍h; guá kám m̄-bián pí in khah ū tì-huī? Guá sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Tse mā sī khang-hi.
English: Then said I in my heart, As it happens to the fool, so will it happen even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then said I in my heart that this also is vanity.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē kóng suah, Mâlíah ua̍t tńg-sin, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu khiā tī hia, mā jīn bē-tshut I sī Iésu.
English: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn't know that it was Jesus.

Tailo: Tio̍h hó-tánn, lán tio̍h uī lán ê jîn-bîn kah lán ê Siōngtè tsiah-ê siâⁿ, tsò tāi-tiōng-hu, guān Siōngtsú tsiàu I só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Be of good courage, and let us play the man for our people, and for the cities of our God: and Yahweh do that which seems him good.

Tailo: ' In-uī Siōngtsú bē-tàng tshuā tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ji̍p-khì I tuì in tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē, só͘-í, tī khòng-iá kā in thâi-sí. '
English: Because Yahweh was not able to bring this people into the land which he swore to them, therefore he has slain them in the wilderness.

Tailo: Tse sī ìng-giām Siōngtsú thok I-é-lí-miah só͘ kóng ê uē: thìng-hāu thó͘-tē hióng-siū i ê an-hioh, in-uī i pha-hng ê sî siú an-hioh, kàu muá tshit-tsa̍p nî.
English: to fulfill the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed its Sabbaths: for as long as it lay desolate it kept Sabbath, to fulfill seventy years.

Tailo: In só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì lóng sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ tsìng lâng khuànn. In kā king-bûn-tē tsò khah khuah, saⁿ-á-ki ê tshiu tsò khah tn̂g.
English: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad, enlarge the fringes of their garments,

Tailo: Lí kì-jiân sī lâ-lûn-sio, m̄-tsiâⁿ sio koh m̄-tsiâⁿ líng, guá beh kā lí tuì guá ê tshuì phuì tshut-.lâi.
English: So, because you are lukewarm, and neither hot nor cold, I will vomit you out of my mouth.

Tailo: Iésu koh kóng, Guá beh īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi pí-phīng Siōngtè kok-tō͘?
English: Again he said, To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?

Tailo: In koh tsò nn̄g-ê kim-tsô kah nn̄g-ê kim-khuân, kā tsit nn̄g-ê khuân an-tì tī pó͘-kuà ê siang thâu.
English: They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong i ê bah ê lâng ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng, i ê hueh nā hiù tī siáⁿ-mi̍h saⁿ-khò͘ ê tíng-bīn, só͘ hiù-tio̍h hit niá, lí tio̍h tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi sé.
English: Whatever shall touch its flesh shall be holy. When there is any of its blood sprinkled on a garment, you shall wash that on which it was sprinkled in a holy place.

Tailo: In-uī tāi-ke lóng ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h I, tsiū tio̍h-kiaⁿ. Iésu suî-sî kā in kóng, An lín ê sim, sī guá, m̄-bián kiaⁿ.
English: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them, Cheer up! It is I! Don't be afraid.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tio̍h uī-tio̍h Sàulô thî-khàu! I bat hō͘ lín tshīng tsu-âng sik lâi huann-hí, hō͘ lín ê saⁿ-khò͘ ū n̂g-kim ê táⁿ-pān.
English: You daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, Who clothed you in scarlet delicately, Who put ornaments of gold on your clothing.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g i kóng, Lí ài siáⁿ-mi̍h? I ìn kóng, Lí tsò ông ê sî, hō͘ guá tsit nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tsi̍t-ê tsē tuà Lí ê tsiànn pîng, tsi̍t-ê tsē tuà Lí ê tò pîng.
English: He said to her, What do you want? She said to him, Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand, and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tiong-kan ū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī hit-uī sian-ti.
English: Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, This is truly the prophet.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kiò tsi̍t-ê siàu-liân lâng, kóng, Lí uá-khì kā i thâi-sí. I tsiū khì kā i phah-sí.
English: David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall on him. He struck him, so that he died.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Asel tsiū kóng: guān Asel in-uī kiáⁿ tsē lâi tit-tio̍h hok-khì, tit-tio̍h in ê hiann-tī ê huann-hí, thang īng i ê kha tsìm tī iû-.ni̍h.
English: Of Asher he said, Blessed be Asher with children; Let him be acceptable to his brothers, Let him dip his foot in oil.

Tailo: Lín siūⁿ khuàⁿ Thiⁿ-pē sī guā-ni̍h thiàⁿ lán, I hō͘ lán thang kiò-tsò Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî; sū-si̍t siōng, lán khak-si̍t sī I ê kiáⁿ-jî. Só͘-í, sè-kan lâng m̄-bat lán, sī in-uī in m̄-bat Siōngtè.
English: Behold, how great a love the Father has bestowed on us, that we should be called children of God! For this cause the world doesn't know us, because it didn't know him.

Tailo: I ê sió-muē A-hô-lí-bah khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne, tsiū pí i koh khah hòng-tshiòng îm-io̍k; kiânn kan-îm pí i ê tuā-tsé koh khah siong-tiōng.
English: Her sister Oholibah saw this, yet was she more corrupt in her doting than she, and in her prostitution which were more than the prostitution of her sister.

Tailo: Kàu hông-hun, Alông tiám ting ê sî, mā tio̍h sio hiuⁿ, sī tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ sio ê hiuⁿ.
English: When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before Yahweh throughout your generations.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng bīn tài kiau-ngō͘, kóng, I bô beh tui-kiù. I só͘ siūⁿ ê lóng lia̍h-tsò bô Siōngtè ê tsûn-tsāi.
English: The wicked, in the pride of his face, Has no room in his thoughts for God.

Tailo: Tio̍h hiù hit-ê thái-ko beh tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tshit pái, tsiū tuàn-tīng i tsò tshing-khì, koh pàng hit tsiah ua̍h-tsiáu khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: He shall sprinkle on him who is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird go into the open field.

Tailo: Hit sî, lán tit-tio̍h tsit-ê tē. Τuì Al-nông suaⁿ-kok piⁿ ê A-ló-el khí, í-ki̍p Gilia̍t suaⁿ-tē ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ kah kî-tiong ê siâⁿ, guá lóng hō͘ Lūbiān lâng kah Ga̍t lâng.
English: This land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead, and the cities of it, gave I to the Reubenites and to the Gadites:

Tailo: Bāng tsi̍t ē muá, tsiū thua tsiūⁿ-huāⁿ, tsē lo̍h-.lâi, kíng hó ê hî khǹg tuà hî lông-á-lāi, kā bái ê hî hiat-ka̍k.
English: which, when it was filled, they drew up on the beach. They sat down, and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away.

Tailo: Hit sî, Guá beh īng ting tshiau-tshuē Êlúsalèm, Guá beh pān hiah-ê tshin-tshiūnn tī tse-tái tíng tsē-tshing ê lâng; in sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng: Siōngtsú bô beh kàng hok-khì, mā bô beh kàng tsai-hō.
English: It will happen at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with lamps, and I will punish the men who are settled on their dregs, who say in their heart, Yahweh will not do good, neither will he do evil.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsè-si, Lēbī lâng, kò͘-mn̂g ê, tshiùⁿ kua ê, jîn-bîn tiong tsi̍t-pō͘-hūn ê lâng, Na-thi-in kah Isulael jîn-bîn, ta̍k-ê tuà tī in ê siâⁿ.
English: So the priests, and the Levites, and the porters, and the singers, and some of the people, and the Nethinim, and all Israel, lived in their cities. When the seventh month was come, the children of Israel were in their cities.

Tailo: I ê lāu-pē nā bô hiann-tī, tsiū tio̍h kā i ê sán-gia̍p hō͘ i ê tso̍k tiong tsì-tshin ê, i tsiū tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p. Tse beh tsò Isulael lâng tn̄g tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē; sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: If his father have no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his kinsman who is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be to the children of Israel a statute and ordinance, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Samuel kā i kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú hō͘ Isulael kok kah lí tsua̍t-tn̄g, mā sī án-ne, beh kā kok siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê pí lí khah hó ê.
English: Samuel said to him, Yahweh has torn the kingdom of Israel from you this day, and has given it to a neighbor of yours who is better than you.

Tailo: In ta̍k-ê ti̍t-ti̍t kiânn tsìn-tsîng; sîn-lîng beh khì tó-uī, in tsiū khì hia; kiânn ê sî, sing-khu m̄-bián ua̍t.
English: Each one went straight forward: where the spirit was to go, they went; they didn't turn when they went.

Tailo: I tsiū tshut-huat tńg-khì tshuē i ê lāu-pē. Lī in lāu-pē iáu-koh tsin hn̄g ê sî, lāu-pē to̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, kám-kak tsin m̄-kam, tsáu-uá khì kā i lám-.leh, ti̍t-ti̍t kā i tsim.
English: He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lán m̄-sī kiaⁿ tio̍h lâi kiâⁿ huan-thâu, tì-sú tîm-lûn ê lâng, lán sī ū sìn-sim lâi tit-kiù ê lâng.
English: But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.

Tailo: Ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t ê siann thuân kàu guā-īⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn tsuân-lîng Siōngtè teh kóng-uē ê siann.
English: The sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of God Almighty when he speaks.

Tailo: Lâng ê tshuì ìn-tap ha̍p-gî tsiū ē huaⁿ-hí; ha̍p sî ê uē si̍t-tsāi tsin hó!
English: Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!

Tailo: Hō͘ in tsai-iáⁿ tse sī tshut tī Lí ê tshiú, sī Lí — Siōngtsú só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: That they may know that this is your hand; That you, Yahweh, have done it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí ē tú-tio̍h iau-gō, tshuì-ta, thǹg-pak-theh, bô puàⁿ-hāng mi̍h, ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú só͘ tshe lâi kong-kik lí ê tuì-ti̍k. I ē īng thih-taⁿ khuà tī lí ê ām-kún, it-ti̍t kàu kā lí bia̍t-bông.
English: therefore shall you serve your enemies whom Yahweh shall send against you, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron on your neck, until he have destroyed you.

Tailo: Kng-bîng só͘ kiat ê kué-tsí to̍h-sī liông-siān, kong-gī kah tsin-lí.
English: for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth,

Tailo: Iûⁿ it-tīng bē tuè tsheⁿ-hūn lâng khì, tian-tò ē siám-phiah, in-uī in bē jīn-tit tsheⁿ-hūn lâng ê siann.
English: They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don't know the voice of strangers.

Tailo: Tshut Aigi̍p liáu-āu tē-jī nî ê tsiaⁿ-.gue̍h, Siōngtsú tī Si-nái khòng-iá, bīng-līng Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

Tailo: Nā ū lâng huān tsuē, to̍h-sī thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiù-tsuā ê siann, i pún-lâi tio̍h tsò kiàn-tsìng, tsóng-.sī, só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h á-.sī só͘ tsai ê, i m̄-kóng, i tio̍h tam-tng i ê tsuē.
English: If anyone sins, in that he hears the voice of adjuration, he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he doesn't report it, then he shall bear his iniquity.

Tailo: Lí kóng lí ū kè-bô͘ koh ū khuì-la̍t thang kau-tsiàn. Guá kóng tse sī khang-khang ê uē niā-niā. Lí tàu-té sī uá-khò siáⁿ lâng tsiah ē lâi puē-puān guá?
English: I say that your counsel and strength for the war are only vain words. Now in whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?

Tailo: Apnel kah Isulael ê tiúⁿ-ló tsham-siông, kóng, Lín tsá-tsîng him-bō͘ Tabi̍t tsò ông lâi kā lín tī-lí,
English: Abner had communication with the elders of Israel, saying, In times past you sought for David to be king over you:

Tailo: Tiánn sī beh tuàn-liān gîn, lô͘ sī beh tuàn-liān kim; tuì o-ló mā ē-tàng tshì-giām lâng.
English: The crucible is for silver, And the furnace for gold; But man is refined by his praise.

Tailo: Nā-sī kuan-hē sìng Kiáⁿ, I khiok kóng, Siōngtè ah, Lí ê pó-tsō íng-uán tsûn-tsāi, Lí kok-tō͘ ê kuân-pìng sī tsìng-ti̍t.
English: but of the Son he says, Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your Kingdom.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng, lí tio̍h īng tsi̍t tsiah kang ê gû-á tsò sio̍k-tsuē ê tsè, kau hō͘ tsè-si Lēbī lâng Tsa-tok ê kiáⁿ-sun, to̍h-sī hiah-ê tshin-kīn Guá lâi ho̍k-sāi Guá ê.
English: You shall give to the priests the Levites who are of the seed of Zadok, who are near to me, to minister to me, says the Lord Yahweh, a young bull for a sin offering.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h siá phue hō͘ Sal-tí kàu-huē ê sù-tsiá, kóng, ū Siōngtè ê tshit-ê lîng kah tshit lia̍p tsheⁿ ê hit uī án-ne kóng, guá tsai lí ê só͘ tsò; bîng-gī-siōng lí sī teh ua̍h, kî-si̍t lí sī sí-.khì.
English: And to the angel of the assembly in Sardis write: He who has the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars says these things: I know your works, that you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang bē kì-tit guá ê kà-sī, lí ê sim tio̍h tsip-siú guá ê kài-bīng.
English: My son, don't forget my teaching; But let your heart keep my commandments:

Tailo: In ê ka-kuàn an-jiân bô kiann; Siōngtè ê kuái-á mā bô kā in phah.
English: Their houses are safe from fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tsiū mn̄g in kóng, khí tsit king tiān ê lâng kiò siáⁿ-mi̍h miâ?
English: Then we told them after this manner, what the names of the men were who were making this building.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, hiah-ê tsun-siú Siōngtè ê kài-bīng koh tuì Iésu tiong-si̍t ê sìn-tô͘ tio̍h ū nāi-sim.
English: Here is the patience of the saints, those who keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.

Tailo: huat-kuī kah i ê kǹg kah si-un-só͘,
English: the ark of the testimony with its poles, the mercy seat,

Tailo: Tsit-ê Etsula̍h sī tuì Babúlông lâi ê, thong-ta̍t Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat, i sī bín-tsia̍t ê king-ha̍k kàu-su. Ông tsún i it-tshè só͘ kiû ê, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè ê tshiú kā i pang-tsān ê.
English: this Ezra went up from Babylon: and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which Yahweh, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of Yahweh his God on him.

Tailo: Huâ-láu in-uī tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, tsiū hó khuán-thāi Abúlâm, Abúlâm tsiū tit-tio̍h iûⁿ, gû, kang ê lî, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī, bó ê lî-á, í-ki̍p lo̍k-tô.
English: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, oxen, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.

Tailo: Tiánn sī beh tuàn-liān gîn, lô͘ sī beh tuàn-liān kim, to̍k-to̍k Siōngtsú sī teh tuàn-liān lâng ê sim.
English: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, But Yahweh tests the hearts.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lâng nā tsun-siú Siōngtè ê tō-lí, i tuì Siōngtè ê thiàⁿ tsiū uân-tsuân si̍t-tsāi; án-ne, lán tsiū ē-tàng khak-sìn lán ū tsiàu Siōngtè ê tsí-ì teh sing-ua̍h.
English: But whoever keeps his word, God's love has most assuredly been perfected in him. This is how we know that we are in him:

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, to̍h-sī hit gue̍h ê tshe jī, Tabi̍t ê uī iû-guân pàng khang. Sàulô mn̄g i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan kóng, I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ ná ē tsa-hng kah kin-á-ji̍t lóng bô lâi tsia̍h?
English: It happened on the next day after the new moon, which was the second day, that David's place was empty: and Saul said to Jonathan his son, Why doesn't the son of Jesse come to meat, neither yesterday, nor today?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lán ta̍k lâng lóng tsiàu Ki-tok só͘ un-sù hō͘ lán ê hūn-gia̍h lâi niá-siū.
English: But to each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī tshù tíng pài thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng ê kah hiah-ê kìng-pài ê, kí Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā kah kí Malkam（ Tsù, Ammóng lâng ê sîn-bîng ） lâi tsiù-tsuā ê,
English: those who worship the army of the sky on the housetops, those who worship and swear by Yahweh and also swear by Malcam,

Tailo: Uàn-hūn guá ê lâng mā ē uàn-hūn guá ê Thiⁿ-pē.
English: He who hates me, hates my Father also.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ i hiah-ê suaⁿ, siū sat-hāi ê lâng muá-muá sī; hō͘ to-kiàm thâi-sí ê ē tó tī lí ê sió suaⁿ kah suaⁿ-kok, í-ki̍p só͘-ū ê kheⁿ-kau.
English: I will fill its mountains with its slain: in your hills and in your valleys and in all your watercourses shall they fall who are slain with the sword.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t uī Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài tshut-hiān tī in ê sin piⁿ, Tsú ê îng-kng sì-bīn teh kā in tsiàu; in tuā tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.

Tailo: I iah tsio̍h, khau tshù, buah hue liáu-āu, tsìng-thâu nā koh kàu, koh huat-hiān tī hit king tshù,
English: If the plague comes again, and breaks out in the house, after he has taken out the stones, and after he has scraped the house, and after it was plastered;

Tailo: Mā hiàn ū kàⁿ ê mi̍h tsò siā-un-tsè, īng kam-sim-tsè lâi suan-iông, suan-pò͘; Isulael lâng, tse sī lín só͘ huann-hí ê.
English: Offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened, And proclaim free will offerings and brag about them: For this pleases you, you children of Israel, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtè í-king hō͘ Ki-tok ta̍t-kàu uân-tsuân ê kíng-kài, I tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò só͘-ū sūn-ho̍k I ê lâng íng-uán tsín-kiù ê kin-guân,
English: Having been made perfect, he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation,

Tailo: Tio̍h kā lí ê tāi-tsì kau-tài Siōngtsú, koh uá-khò I, I ē kā lí sîng-tsuân.
English: Commit your way to Yahweh. Trust also in him, and he will do this:

Tailo: In teh tán tsuí tín-tāng. Ū sî Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài ē lo̍h-lâi tî-.ni̍h kā tsuí phah tín-tāng, tsuí tín-tāng liáu-āu, thâu tsi̍t-ê lo̍h-.khì ê lâng, bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h pēⁿ lóng ē hó-.khì. (tsù, ū ê tshau-pún ke tsit tsat )
English: for an angel of the Lord went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Guá sī ua̍h-miā ê piáⁿ. Lâi guá tsia ê lâng tsua̍t-tuì bē iau, sìn guá ê lâng íng-uán bē tshuì-ta.
English: Jesus said to them, I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

Tailo: I ē kóng, In ê sîn-bîng, in só͘ uá-khò ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ,
English: He will say, Where are their gods, The rock in which they took refuge;

Tailo: Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn só͘ kóng ê uē, lí kám bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? In kóng, ' Siōngtsú só͘ kíng ê nn̄g tso̍k, I í-king kā in khì-tsua̍t, in án-ne khuànn-khin Guá ê tsú-bîn, lia̍h-tsò bē koh tī in ê bīn-tsîng kiàn-li̍p kok-ka.
English: Don't you consider what this people has spoken, saying, The two families which Yahweh did choose, he has cast them off? thus do they despise my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Asah sann nî, Basiah kā i phah-sí lâi tshuàn i ê uī.
English: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha kill him, and reigned in his place.

Tailo: Lí suí ê miâ-siaⁿ thuân kàu tī lia̍t kok tiong, sī tuì lí ê suí koh uân-tsuân, in-uī Guá ū īng Guá ê îng-kng hō͘ lí. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Your renown went forth among the nations for your beauty; for it was perfect, through my majesty which I had put on you, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá bat kóng: Lín sī sîn-bîng, lín lóng sī Tsì-kuân-.ê ê kiáⁿ;
English: I said, You are gods, All of you are sons of the Most High.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng, ' Tháng lāi ê mī-hún bē kiám-tsió, pân lāi ê iû īng bē liáu, ti̍t-kàu Siōngtsú lo̍h hō͘ tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê ji̍t. '
English: For thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, The jar of meal shall not empty, neither shall the jar of oil fail, until the day that Yahweh sends rain on the earth.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Páulô kā hiah-ê lâng kóng, Guán sī Lô-má lâng, buē siū sím-mn̄g, in tsiū tī tsìng lâng bīn-tsîng īng kùn-á kā guán kòng, koh kā guán kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ. Taⁿ in beh thau-thau-á kuáⁿ guán tshut-.khì, sī-.bô? Án-ne bē īng-tit, tio̍h kiò Lô-má kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tshin-sin lâi tshuā guán tshut-.khì!
English: But Paul said to them, They have beaten us publicly, without a trial, men who are Romans, and have cast us into prison! Do they now release us secretly? No, most assuredly, but let them come themselves and bring us out!

Tailo: Lí thiaⁿ, ū bo̍k-tsiá teh háu, in-uī in ê îng-iāu huí-huāi à. Lí thiaⁿ, ū ióng ê sai teh hm̄-hm̄ háu, in-uī Ioltàn hô piⁿ ê tshiū-nâ hong-huì à.
English: A voice of the wailing of the shepherds! For their glory is destroyed: a voice of the roaring of young lions! For the pride of the Jordan is ruined.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tuì sian-ti só͘ suan-pò͘ ê sìn-sit koh khah khak-sìn. Lín tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, in-uī tsit-ê sìn-sit tshin-tshiūnn ting-hué tsiò tī o͘-àm, tsiàu kàu thiⁿ-kng, it-ti̍t kàu khé-bîng-tsheⁿ tshut-hiān tī lín ê sim hit sî.
English: We have the more sure word of prophecy; whereunto you do well that you take heed, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns, and the morning star arises in your hearts:

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tī tuâⁿ tíng hiàn sio-tsè kah sò͘-tsè, tsè-si tio̍h uī i sio̍k-tsuē, i tsiū tshing-khì.
English: and the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar. The priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ só͘ īng ta̍k hāng ê khì-kū kah só͘ tìng ê ting, í-ki̍p tiâⁿ lāi só͘ tìng ê ting lóng tio̍h īng tâng tsò.
English: All the instruments of the tent in all its service, and all the pins of it, and all the pins of the court, shall be of brass.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, guá ê ông, guá ê Siōngtè ah, tshik-tsiáu-á uī-tio̍h ka-kī tshuē-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tshù, ìⁿ-á uī-tio̍h ka-kī tshuē-tio̍h áⁿ kiáⁿ ê siū, to̍h-sī tī Lí ê tsè-tuâⁿ hia.
English: Yes, the sparrow has found a home, And the swallow a nest for herself, where she may have her young, Near your altars, Yahweh of Armies, my King, and my God.

Tailo: Tsit-kù uē lán thang siong-sìn, ta̍t-tit lán uân-tsuân tsiap-siū.
English: This saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance.

Tailo: Guá — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, tsá to̍h tsai-puê lí ê, taⁿ bīng-līng tsai-hō kong-kik lí, sī in-uī Isulael kah Iôtah ke kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, ǹg Baal sio hiuⁿ, jiá Guá siū-khì; ka-kī tsò, tio̍h ka-kī siū pò-ìng.
English: For Yahweh of Armies, who planted you, has pronounced evil against you, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have worked for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense to Baal.

Tailo: I bat án-tsuáⁿ îng-kng ka-kī lâi tshia-hua, tio̍h tsiàu án-ne hō͘ i kan-khó͘ pi-ai. In-uī i sim-lāi ka-kī kóng, guá tsò lú-ông tsē tī ông-uī, guá pīng m̄-sī kuáⁿ-hū, guá tsua̍t-tuì bē tú-tio̍h pi-siong ê tāi-tsì.
English: However much she glorified herself, and grew wanton, so much give her of torment and mourning. For she says in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and will in no way see mourning.'

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thiⁿ, ing-kai tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua, in-uī Siōngtsú í-king kā i tsò-tsiâⁿ. Tē ê tshim ê só͘-tsāi, ing-kai tshut huann-hí ê siann; tsiah-ê suaⁿ ing-kai tshut siaⁿ tshiùⁿ kua; tshiū-nâ kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê tshiū lóng tio̍h án-ne. In-uī Siōngtsú ū kiù-sio̍k Iâkop, mā beh tī Isulael tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: Sing, you heavens, for Yahweh has done it; shout, you lower parts of the earth; break forth into singing, you mountains, O forest, and every tree therein: for Yahweh has redeemed Jacob, and will glorify himself in Israel.

Tailo: Lín iàu-kín ê sī tio̍h ū nāi-sim, tsiah ē-tàng si̍t-hiān Siōngtè ê tsí-ì, thang niá-siū I só͘ ìng-ín ê hok-khì.
English: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.

Tailo: Hit só͘-tsāi só͘-ū ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, tshuē bô tshin-tshiūnn Iobuh ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hiah-ni̍h suí; in ê lāu-pē hō͘ in tī hiann-tī tiong tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p.
English: In all the land were no women found so beautiful as the daughters of Job. Their father gave them an inheritance among their brothers.

Tailo: Ū bé-pinn ê siann, ū tshia-lián hū-hū háu ê siann, bé phut-phut thiàu, tshia khōng-khōng háu;
English: The noise of the whip, the noise of the rattling of wheels, prancing horses, and bounding chariots,

Tailo: Jiânāu hiah-ê lâng kā Iésu ah kàu tuā-tsè-si ê só͘-tsāi. Só͘-ū ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ, tiúⁿ-ló kah king-ha̍k kàu-su lóng tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi.
English: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.

Tailo: Lín kám iáu-koh bē liáu-kái? Lín kám bē kì-tit guá hō͘ gō͘-tshing lâng tsia̍h gō͘ tè piáⁿ, tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê líng ū khioh kuí nâ?
English: Don't you yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

Tailo: In tsí ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì ē-tàng kā guá khòng-kò, to̍h-sī guá bat khiā tī in tiong-kan tuā-siaⁿ huah, ' Guá kin-á-ji̍t siū lín sím-phuàⁿ, sī uī-tio̍h sí-lâng koh-ua̍h ê tāi-tsì. '
English: unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!'

Tailo: I tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā hó-gia̍h, ná kú ná tuā, kàu tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā hù-hō͘.
English: The man grew great, and grew more and more until he became very great.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ìn Iosiúah kóng, Guán beh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè, tsun-thàn I ê uē.
English: The people said to Joshua, Yahweh our God will we serve, and to his voice will we listen.

Tailo: Amátsiah tī iâm ê suaⁿ-kok thâi-sí Etóm lâng tsi̍t bān, koh tsing-ho̍k Sela̍h, kā i kái miâ kiò-tsò Iok-thel, ti̍t-kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: He killed of Edom in the Valley of Salt ten thousand, and took Sela by war, and called the name of it Joktheel, to this day.

Tailo: Jiânāu mn̄g kûn-tsiòng kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t tsò hó tāi-tsì á-.sī tsò pháiⁿ tāi-tsì; kiù lâng ê sèⁿ-miā á-.sī hāi lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, tó tsi̍t hāng khah ha̍p-huat? In lóng tiām-tiām bô ìn puàⁿ-kù.
English: He said to them, Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill? But they were silent.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ông uī Siōngtsú só͘ khí ê tiān, tn̂g la̍k-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, kuân saⁿ-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The house which king Solomon built for Yahweh, the length of it was sixty cubits, and the breadth of it twenty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

Tailo: I tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh khí tshù, ku̍t hō͘ i tshim, kā tē-ki hē tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng; tuā-tsuí tsi̍t-ē kàu, khe lâu tshiong-tio̍h tshù, tshù mā bē iô-tāng, in-uī tshù khí liáu tsin kian-kò͘.
English: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

Tailo: Lín nā m̄ tsun-thàn Guá, m̄ lia̍h An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng-ji̍t, iû-guân tī An-hioh-ji̍t taⁿ tàⁿ ji̍p Êlúsalèm ta̍k-ê mn̂g; Guá beh tī ta̍k-ê mn̂g khí hué; tsit-ê hué mā ē sio-huí Êlúsalèm ê kiong-tiān, bē-tàng phah-hua.
English: But if you will not listen to me to make the Sabbath day holy, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates of it, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iésu tī An-hioh-ji̍t tuì be̍h-hn̂g king-kuè; I ê bûn-tô͘ pak-tó͘ iau, tsiū tiah be̍h-suī lâi tsia̍h.
English: At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

Tailo: Suah lâi uî-puē khí-thâu ê sè-guān, tì-sú ka-kī siū tīng tsuē.
English: having condemnation, because they have rejected their first pledge.

Tailo: Guá kám-siā hō͘ guá ū khuì-la̍t ê, to̍h-sī lán ê Tsú Ki-tok Iésu. In-uī I kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsīn-tiong ê, tsiū jīm-bīng guá lâi kā I ho̍k-bū.
English: And I thank him who enabled me, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he counted me faithful, appointing me to service;

Tailo: In-uī lán lóng it-tīng tio̍h sí, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí phuah tī tē-.ni̍h, bē-tàng koh siu tò tńg-.lâi. Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú bô tshiúⁿ lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, sī siat-huat hō͘ tô-miā ê lâng bián siū kuáⁿ-tshut lâi lī-khui I.
English: For we must needs die, and are as water split on the ground, which can't be gathered up again; neither does God take away life, but devises means, that he who is banished not be an outcast from him.

Tailo: Lí in-uī lâng ê tsuē-ok kā i kíng-kài ê sî, hō͘ i só͘ ì-ài ê siau-bia̍t, tshin-tshiūnn tio̍h tsiù-thâng hu khì; sè-kan lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī khang-khang. [Sè-la̍h]
English: When you rebuke and correct man for iniquity, You consume his wealth like a moth. Surely every man is but a breath. Selah.

Tailo: Tsû-ài ê lâng, Lí īng tsû-ài tuì-thāi i; uân-tsuân ê lâng, Lí īng uân-tsuân tuì-thāi i.
English: With the merciful you will show yourself merciful. With the perfect man, you will show yourself perfect.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, kiù-sio̍k guá ê Tsú ah; guān guá ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê kah sim só͘ siūⁿ ê, tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p.
English: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart Be acceptable in your sight, Yahweh, my rock, and my redeemer.

Tailo: Siōngtsú í-guā, siáⁿ lâng sī Siōngtè? Guán ê Siōngtè í-guā, siáⁿ lâng sī tsio̍h-puâⁿ?
English: For who is God, except Yahweh? Who is a rock, besides our God,

Tailo: Sàulô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, koh tsai Siōngtsú kah Tabi̍t tông-tsāi, jî-tshiánn Sàulô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal mā thiàⁿ i.
English: Saul saw and knew that Yahweh was with David; and Michal, Saul's daughter, loved him.

Tailo: I īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē, tsò tsè-si ho̍k.
English: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k hit-ê īng tuā kuân-lîng kah tshun-tshut ê tshiú-kut tshuā lín tshut Aigi̍p tē ê Siōngtsú, lín tio̍h kìng-uì I, kā I kuī-pài, kā I tsè-hiàn.
English: but Yahweh, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm, him shall you fear, and to him shall you bow yourselves, and to him shall you sacrifice:

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí khuànn tsit-ê iáu lia̍h-tsò sī sió-khuá, in-uī Lí koh kóng-tio̍h Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê ke kàu tī kú-tn̂g. Siōngtsú — Siōngtè ah, Lí khuán-thāi guá tshin-tshiūnn tsun-kuì ê lâng ê tē-uī.
English: This was a small thing in your eyes, God; but you have spoken of your servant's house for a great while to come, and have regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, Yahweh God.

Tailo: Guá ê sim, lí ná ē ut-tsut? Sī án-tsuáⁿ tī guá ê lāi-bīn tio̍h-kip? Lí tio̍h gióng-bōng Siōngtè; guá iáu-koh beh o-ló I, in-uī I sī guá ê bīn ê îng-kng, mā sī guá ê Siōngtè.
English: Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him, The saving help of my countenance, and my God.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Lí tio̍h khì kā Iôtah lâng kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn kóng: Siōngtsú kóng: Lín kám m̄-siū kà-sī, m̄ tsun-thàn Guá ê uē?
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Go, and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, Will you not receive instruction to listen to my words? says Yahweh.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê lō͘ sī Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià ê; to̍k-to̍k tui-kiû kong-gī ê lâng ē tit I thiàⁿ.
English: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, But he loves him who follows after righteousness.

Tailo: Í-tsîng, í-āu lóng bô koh ū tshin-tshiūnn hit tsi̍t ji̍t, tit-tio̍h Siōngtsú thiaⁿ lâng ê siann, sī in-uī Siōngtsú thè Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: There was no day like that before it or after it, that Yahweh listened to the voice of a man: for Yahweh fought for Israel.

Tailo: Guá tuì pháiⁿ lâng kóng: Lí it-tīng ē sí; lí nā bô kā i kíng-kài, bô īng uē kíng-kài pháiⁿ lâng, hō͘ i lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, lâi kiù i ê sèⁿ-miā; hit-ê pháiⁿ lâng tsiū ē sí tī i ê tsuē; tsóng-.sī, Guá beh tuì lí ê tshiú thó i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: When I tell the wicked, You shall surely die; and you give him no warning, nor speak to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at your hand.

Tailo: Iésu koh ji̍p-khì huē-tn̂g; tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê khuê-tshiú ê lâng.
English: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t tiâu hô, i ê tsuí-lâu khui-tshe, hō͘ Siōngtsú ê siâⁿ huann-hí; to̍h-sī Tsì-kuân-.ê tuà ê sìng-só͘.
English: There is a river, the streams of which make the city of God glad, The holy place of the tents of the Most High.

Tailo: Lâng-lâng lī-khui tsiàⁿ lō͘, lóng kiânn bê-lō͘; lóng bô lâng tsò hó, liân tsi̍t-ê to bô. (tsù, SPh 14:1-3)
English: They have all turned aside. They have together become unprofitable. There is no one who does good, No, not, so much as one.

Tailo: Lîng-khó tuà tī tshù tíng ê kak-thâu, m̄-thang kah tsháu-nāu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò-hué tuà tī khui-khuah ê tshù.
English: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than to share a house with a contentious woman.

Tailo: Lán nā m̄-sī ū iân-tshiân, í-king tē-jī pái tńg-.lâi à.
English: for if we hadn't delayed, surely we would have returned a second time by now.

Tailo: In ji̍p-lâi lāi-īⁿ ê mn̂g ê sî, tio̍h tshīng iù-tē saⁿ; in tī lāi-īⁿ ê mn̂g kah tī tiān lāi kiânn tsit-hūn ê sî, lóng m̄-thang tshīng iûⁿ-mn̂g ê saⁿ-khò͘.
English: It shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come on them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.

Tailo: Kàu thiⁿ beh kng ê sî, Siōngtsú tuì hûn kah hué ê thiāu tiong ànn-lo̍h, khuànn Aigi̍p ê kun-tuī, phah-luān in ê tuī-ngó͘;
English: It happened in the morning watch, that Yahweh looked out on the Egyptian army through the pillar of fire and of cloud, and confused the Egyptian army.

Tailo: Siōngtsú īng nn̄g tè tsio̍h-pi kau-tài guá, sī Siōngtsú īng tsíng-thâu-á siá ê. Hit tíng-bīn só͘ siá ê, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú tī tāi-huē ê ji̍t, tī suaⁿ tíng, tī hué tiong, tuì lín só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē.
English: Yahweh delivered to me the two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them was written according to all the words, which Yahweh spoke with you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.

Tailo: I pi-bî siū bô kong-gī ê sím-phuàⁿ, bô lâng thè I tsú-tshî kong-tō. Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng thuân-su̍t I ê sè-tāi? In-uī I tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê ua̍h-miā í-king kiat-sok à. (tsù, ISI 53:7-8)
English: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away. Who will declare His generation? For his life is taken from the earth.

Tailo: Iông-ín guá the̍h tām-po̍h-á tsuí hō͘ lín sé kha, tshiánn hioh-khùn tī tshiū kha.
English: Now let a little water be fetched, wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê tsheⁿ-mê tsò tsí-tō tsiá ê lâng, sè tsiah báng-á lín to̍h kā i lī khí-.lâi, lo̍k-tô suah kui-tsiah thun lo̍h-.khì.
English: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!

Tailo: Huâ-láu tio̍h án-ne kiânn, koh siat-li̍p kuaⁿ-uân kuán-lí tsit-ê tē. Tng tshit nî hó-nî-tang ê sî, tio̍h kā Aigi̍p tē só͘ siu-sîng ê, gō͘-hūn tsing-siu tsi̍t hūn,
English: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint overseers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt's produce in the seven plenteous years.

Tailo: Alông teh beh sí-bông, in-uī i bē-tàng ji̍p-khì Guá siúⁿ-sù Isulael lâng ê tē, in-uī tī Me-lí-bah ê tsuí lín uî-puē Guá ê bīng-līng.
English: Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah.

Tailo: Ông tī Ioltàn hô ê pîng-guân, Su-kot kah Tsa-le-thàn ê tiong-kan, tī liâm-thô͘ ê tē tsù-tsiâⁿ ê.
English: In the plain of the Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Guá beh hō͘ lí ê sing-khu ho̍k-guân, i hó lí ê siong-hûn, in-uī lâng lóng tshing lí tsò siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k ê, kóng: Tse sī Si-óng, bô lâng lâi thàm-mn̄g ê.
English: For I will restore health to you, and I will heal you of your wounds, says Yahweh; because they have called you an outcast, saying, It is Zion, whom no man seeks after.

Tailo: Guá to̍h-sī phû-tô tshiū, lín to̍h-sī ki; tiàm tī guá lāi-bīn ê, guá mā tiàm tī i ê lāi-bīn, tsiū ē kiat kué-tsí tsin tsē; in-uī nā kah guá sio-lī, lín tsiū bē-tàng tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.

Tailo: In koh siàn-tōng bîn-tsiòng, tiúⁿ-ló kah king-ha̍k kàu-su, tshiong-khì lia̍h Su-tê-hua-no͘h, kā i kau hō͘ gī-huē.
English: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and came against him and seized him, and brought him in to the council,

Tailo: Tsit sì-ê lâng sī Gat tuā-hàn lâng só͘ seⁿ ê, lóng sí tī Tabi̍t ê tshiú kah i ê lô͘-po̍k ê tshiú.
English: These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.

Tailo: Ta̍k nî Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê sî, Iésu ê pē-bú lóng ē khì Êlúsalèm kuè-tseh.
English: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.

Tailo: Lí ê kiong lóng lō͘-tshut, tuì tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê lóng sī tsin-si̍t ê uē. [Sè-la̍h] Lí īng kang-hô kā tāi-tē hun-khui.
English: You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. Selah. You split the earth with rivers.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè só͘ bīng-līng lín ê lō͘, lín lóng tio̍h tsiàu án-ne kiânn, hō͘ lín ua̍h-.leh, tit-tio̍h hok-khì, mā hō͘ lín tī lín só͘ beh sîng-tsiap ê tē ê ji̍t-tsí, tit-tio̍h kú-tn̂g.
English: You shall walk in all the way which Yahweh your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tsit-ê kiáⁿ, kau-puê tshiong-ki, kā lí pun hō͘ i ê tsâi-sán tsuân-pō͘ khai liáu-liáu. I tsi̍t ē tńg-.lâi, lí tsiū uī-tio̍h i thâi puî ê gû-á kiáⁿ. '
English: But when this, your son, came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.'

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng put-tsí kî-kuài kóng, I só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì lóng sī hó, I sīm-tsì hō͘ tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng ē thiann-kìnn, é-káu ê lâng ē kóng-uē.
English: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!

Tailo: Iâkop gia̍h thâu khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Esáu teh lâi, koh ū sì-pah lâng kah i tsò-hué lâi. I tsiū kā hiah-ê gín-á hun-khui, kau hō͘ Leah, kau hō͘ La̍h-khel, kau hō͘ nn̄g-ê lú-pī.
English: Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. He divided the children between Leah, Rachel, and the two handmaids.

Tailo: Guá beh tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-lē; kiû Lí m̄-thang kā guá tsuân-pō͘ pàng-sak!
English: I will observe your statutes. Don't utterly forsake me. BEIT

Tailo: Kiàn-nā king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê Lēbī lâng, to̍h-sī Mô͘se kah Alông kah Isulael tsiah-ê siú-líng, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu, in ê tsong-tso̍k, só͘ tiám-sǹg ê,
English: All those who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the princes of Israel numbered, by their families, and by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: In-uī I kian-kò͘ lí ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ, sù-hok hō͘ lí tiong-kan ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates. He has blessed your children within you.

Tailo: In sing kā I ah-khì An-na̍h hia, in-uī i sī bîn-kan tsun-tsông ê tuā-tsè-si, koh sī hit nî ( kuann phài )ê tuā-tsè-si Kai-a-huah ê tiūⁿ-lâng.
English: and led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

Tailo: I ê jîn-sîn ū tsi̍t-ê ìn ông kóng, Iáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê bé, to̍h-sī iáu lâu tī siâⁿ lāi ê, kiû lí tshe lâng khan gō͘ tsiah lâi ( lí khuàⁿ, bé tshin-tshiūnn Isulael jîn-bîn só͘ lâu tī siâⁿ lāi ê; lí khuàⁿ, bé tshin-tshiūnn Isulael jîn-bîn siū bia̍t ê), lán thang tshe lâng khì khuàⁿ-māi.
English: One of his servants answered, Please let some take five of the horses that remain, which are left in the city (behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel who are left in it; behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel who are consumed); and let us send and see.

Tailo: I ê kuân-pìng tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā, tsóng-.sī, m̄-sī tuì ka-kī ê kuân-pìng; i ē kiânn hui-siông ê huí-bia̍t, mā ē hing-thong, koh tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ, koh ē huí-bia̍t ū kuân-li̍k ê kah sìng ê tsú-bîn.
English: His power shall be mighty, but not by his own power; and he shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper and do his pleasure; and he shall destroy the mighty ones and the holy people.

Tailo: Līng-guā tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Elíetsel, in-uī Mô͘se kóng, Guá ê pē ê Siōngtè pang-tsān guá, kiù guá thuat-lī Huâ-láu ê to.
English: The name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, My father's God was my help and delivered me from Pharaoh's sword.

Tailo: I ê ki ta-.khì siū at-tn̄g, tsa-bó͘ lâng ē lâi kā i sio-sio-.khì. In-uī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn gōng-gōng, só͘-í, tshòng-tsō in ê Siōngtè bô beh liân-bín in, kā in tsō-sîng ê bô beh si un hō͘ in.
English: When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off. The women will come and set them on fire, for they are a people of no understanding. Therefore he who made them will not have compassion on them, and he who formed them will show them no favor.

Tailo: Hué-pan nā tī guân só͘-tsāi thîng-tsí, bô koh seⁿ-thuàⁿ, to̍h-sī liàp-á ê hûn-jiah, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò tshing-khì.
English: But if the bright spot stays in its place, and hasn't spread, it is the scar from the boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī thinn-tíng, tī tē-tsiūⁿ, tī hái tiong, tī só͘-ū ê tshim-ian, lóng tsiàu I ka-kī ê tsí-ì lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Whatever Yahweh pleased, that he has done, In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;

Tailo: Guá beh tín-tāng bān-kok, bān-kok só͘ him-bō͘ ê ē lâi, Guá tsiū hō͘ îng-kng tshiong-muá tsit king tiān. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: and I will shake all nations. The precious things of all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Guá ē tsò i ê Thiⁿ-pē, i ē tsò Guá ê kiáⁿ; Guá bô beh hō͘ Guá ê tsû-ài lī-khui i, tshin-tshiūnn Guá tsá-tsîng hō͘ i lī-khui hit-ê lí tsîng tsi̍t-ê ông.
English: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my loving kindness away from him, as I took it from him that was before you;

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h lō͘ piⁿ ū tsi̍t tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū, tsiū kiâⁿ uá-.khì, tshiū tíng lóng bô kué-tsí, tsí ū hio̍h-á niā-niā. Iésu tuì hit-tsâng tshiū kóng, Tuì tsit-má khí, lí íng-uán bē koh kiat kué-tsí. Hit tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū suî-sî tsiū ta-.khì.
English: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it, Let there be no fruit from you forever! Immediately the fig tree withered away.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu kiò kûn-tsiòng kah bûn-tô͘ uá-.lâi, kā in kóng, Lâng nā ài beh tuè guá, tio̍h pàng-sak ka-kī, giâ i ê si̍p-jī-kè lâi tuè guá.
English: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them, Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Guá beh hō͘ Êlúsalèm piàn-tsò thô͘-tui, tsiâⁿ-tsò iá-káu tuà ê só͘-tsāi, mā beh hō͘ Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ pha-hng, bô lâng tī hia tuà.
English: I will make Jerusalem heaps, a dwelling place of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.

Tailo: Lí tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ si it-tshè ê tsû-ài kah sîng-si̍t, to̍h-sī siōng sè ê guá mā bē kham-tit tit-tio̍h; guá tsîng gia̍h guá ê kuái-á, kuè tsit-ê Ioltàn hô, taⁿ guá í-king tsiâⁿ-tsò nn̄g tuī.
English: I am not worthy of the least of all the loving kindnesses, and of all the truth, which you have shown to your servant; for with just my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I have become two companies.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-kng, Iosiúah thàu-tsá khí-.lâi kah Isulael jîn-bîn lóng lī-khui Si̍t-tîm, lâi-kàu Ioltàn, iáu-buē kuè-.khì, tsiū tī hia hioh-khùn, thìng-hāu kuè hô.
English: Joshua rose up early in the morning; and they removed from Shittim, and came to the Jordan, he and all the children of Israel; and they lodged there before they passed over.

Tailo: Sâmsóng kā in kóng, Tsit pái guá siong-hāi Huilīsū lâng, in bô thang kā guá tsik-tsuē.
English: Samson said to them, This time shall I be blameless in regard of the Philistines, when I do them a mischief.

Tailo: Tī Si-óng suaⁿ ē ū tô-thuat ê lâng, mā ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng; Iâkop ke ē tit-tio̍h i pún-lâi to̍h ū ê sán-gia̍p.
English: But in Mount Zion, there will be those who escape, and it will be holy. The house of Jacob will possess their possessions.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t, Elī khùn tī ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi, i ê ba̍k-tsiu í-king bū, khuànn bē bîng.
English: It happened at that time, when Eli was laid down in his place (now his eyes had begun to grow dim, so that he could not see),

Tailo: Só͘-í, ìng-ín sī īng sìn tsò kin-kì, tse sī beh pó-tsìng ìng-ín sī tshut tī Siōngtè pe̍h-pe̍h ê un-tián, beh hō͘ Abulahàm só͘-ū ê kiáⁿ-sun; m̄-nā sī ū siū kat-lé ê, mā pau-hâm kah Abulahàm kāng-khuán ū sìn-khò Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k; Abulahàm sī lán tsìng lâng ê tsó͘-sian.
English: For this cause it is of faith, that it may be according to grace, to the end that the promise may be sure to all the seed, not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all.

Tailo: Jī-tsa̍p tshit nî tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: It came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Huâ-láu tsiū tsún-pī i ê tshia, tshuā i ê jîn-bîn tsò-hué khì,
English: He made ready his chariot, and took his army with him;

Tailo: Siōngtè tuì hit-ê tshīng iù-tē saⁿ ê lâng kóng, Lí ji̍p-.khì, tī tńg-se̍h ê lián ê tiong-kan, ki-lō͘-ping í-hā, tuì ki-lō͘-ping ê tiong-kan the̍h teh to̍h ê hué-thuàⁿ muá nn̄g tshiú, iā tī siâⁿ tíng. Guá tsiū tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê lâng ji̍p-.khì.
English: He spoke to the man clothed in linen, and said, Go in between the whirling wheels, even under the cherub, and fill both your hands with coals of fire from between the cherubim, and scatter them over the city. He went in as I watched.

Tailo: Lí beh phìng-tiāⁿ bó͘, pa̍t lâng kah i tâng-pâng; lí beh khí tshù, bô thang khiā tī hit lāi-bīn; lí beh tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g, mā bē-tàng tsia̍h i ê kué-tsí.
English: You shall betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: you shall build a house, and you shall not dwell therein: you shall plant a vineyard, and shall not use the fruit of it.

Tailo: Kóng, Tsú ìng-ín beh tsài-lîm, taⁿ tī tó-uī? Lán ê tsó͘-sian lóng sí-.khì à, m̄-koh, tuì tshòng-tsō ú-tiū í-lâi, it-tshè bān-mi̍h lóng sī kāng-khuán.
English: and saying, Where is the promise of his coming? For, from the day that the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng lâi kìnn Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Bia̍t-sái-tah lâng Hui-li̍p-pò͘, kiû i kóng, Sin-seⁿ, guán ài beh kìnn Iésu.
English: These, therefore, came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, Sir, we want to see Jesus.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng ìn kóng, ' Guá kā lín kóng, í-king ū ê lâng, guá beh hō͘ i koh khah tsē; bô ê lâng, liân i só͘-ū ê mā beh kā i the̍h-.lâi.
English: For I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn't have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.

Tailo: Sâmsóng tsiū tuā-tuā kā in phah-sí, sin-si sio-tha̍h. Tsiū lo̍h-khì tuà tī E-tám ê tsio̍h-thâu khang.
English: He struck them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he went down and lived in the cleft of the rock of Etam.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h sìn-sim, ū lâng tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h i-pēⁿ ê un-sù.
English: to another faith, by the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healings, by the same Spirit;

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ka-kī tsún-pī, lí kah tsū-tsi̍p tī lí hia ê kun-tuī lóng tio̍h tsún-pī, lí tio̍h tsò in ê guân-suè.
English: Be prepared, yes, prepare yourself, you, and all your companies who are assembled to you, and be a guard to them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú pó-hō͘ só͘-ū thiàⁿ I ê lâng, tsóng-.sī, só͘-ū tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng, I ē kā in siau-bia̍t.
English: Yahweh preserves all those who love him, But all the wicked he will destroy.

Tailo: Lín kám bē kì-tit guá hō͘ sì-tshing lâng tsia̍h tshit tè piáⁿ, tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lín ū khioh kuí nâ?
English: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

Tailo: Guán bat tsē tī Babúlông ê hô piⁿ, tsi̍t ē siūⁿ-tio̍h Si-óng, ba̍k-sái tsiū lâu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down. Yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
