Tailo: In-uī Lēbī lâng tī lín tiong-kan bô hūn bô gia̍p, i kah tshut-guā lâng, í-ki̍p ko͘-jî, kuáⁿ-hū, tuà tī lín mn̂g lāi ê, lóng thang lâi tsia̍h kàu pá. Tì-sú Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tī lí só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, kā lí sù-hok.
English: and the Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, and the foreigner living among you, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.

Tailo: In uī-tio̍h só͘ ǹg-bāng ê lâi kiàn-siàu, tsi̍t-ē kàu-uī tsiū làu-khuì.
English: They were distressed because they were confident; They came there, and were confounded.

Tailo: Gîtióng tsiū tshuā jîn-bîn lo̍h-khì kàu tsuí piⁿ, Siōngtsú tuì Gîtióng kóng, Kiàn-nā īng tsi̍h nà tsuí, tshin-tshiūnn káu teh nà, hit-ê lâng tio̍h hō͘ i līng-guā khiā-.leh; kiàn-nā kuī lo̍h-khì lim tsuí ê, mā tio̍h hō͘ i līng-guā khiā-.leh.
English: So he brought down the people to the water: and Yahweh said to Gideon, Everyone who laps of the water with his tongue, as a dog laps, him shall you set by himself; likewise everyone who bows down on his knees to drink.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā só͘ hē ê guān kah iok-sok ê tsiù-tsuā, i ū īng lâi khik-khó͘ ka-kī, i ê tiōng-hu thang kā i sîng-li̍p, i ê tiōng-hu mā thang kā i huì-tû.
English: Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

Tailo: Iésu siū-khì, tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê kā in khuànn, uī-tio̍h in ê sim ngē iu-būn. I tsiū tuì hit-ê lâng kóng, Kā lí ê tshiú tshun tshut-.lâi. Hit-ê lâng tsi̍t ē kā tshiú tshun tshut-.khì, tshiú tsiū ho̍k-guân.
English: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, Stretch out your hand. He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

Tailo: Tong-ji̍t, Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses that same day, saying,

Tailo: I tī tsuí-bīn tsin khin-khuài, in ê hūn-gia̍h tī tē-tsiūⁿ siū tsiù-tsó͘; i bô koh ua̍t tńg-lâi kiânn phû-tô hn̂g ê lō͘.
English: They are foam on the surface of the waters. Their portion is cursed in the earth: They don't turn into the way of the vineyards.

Tailo: I ē tī siàu-liân ê sî sí-.khì, in ê sèⁿ-miā sòng-sit ná tshin-tshiūnn gín-á piàn pháiⁿ-.khì.
English: They die in youth. Their life perishes among the unclean.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael bē kì-tit tshòng-tsō in ê Tsú, khí king-biō; Iôtah ke khí kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, Guá beh kàng hué tī i ê siâⁿ, sio in ê iâⁿ-pâng.
English: For Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; And Judah has multiplied fortified cities; But I will send a fire on his cities, And it will devour its fortresses.

Tailo: Tsú Iésu kā in kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū siū tsiap tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, tsē tī Siōngtè ê tsiànn pîng.
English: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê siū khùn-khó͘, hō͘ tuā hong iô-tāng bē-tàng an-uì ê lâng, Guá beh īng tshái-sik an-tì lí ê tsio̍h-thâu, īng nâ-sik ê pó-tsio̍h hē lí ê tē-ki.
English: you afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted, behold, I will set your stones in beautiful colors, and lay your foundations with sapphires.

Tailo: Lí tuā-siaⁿ huah ê sî, thang hō͘ lí só͘ tsū-tsi̍p ê lâi kiù lí! Hong ē kā in tshue suàⁿ; khuì ē kā in pûn-.khì. Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê uá-khò Guá ê ē tit-tio̍h thó͘-tē, beh sîng-siū Guá ê sìng-suaⁿ tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: When you cry, let those who you have gathered deliver you; but the wind shall take them, a breath shall carry them all away: but he who takes refuge in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng, Isulael ê tsú-bîn, Guá beh tsiàu lín ta̍k lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê lâi kā lín sím-phuàⁿ. Lín tio̍h huê-thâu, lī-khui só͘ huān it-tshè ê tsuē-kò; án-ne, tsuē-kò tsiū bē hō͘ lín bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore I will judge you, house of Israel, everyone according to his ways, says the Lord Yahweh. Return you, and turn yourselves from all your transgressions; so iniquity shall not be your ruin.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ tio̍h Iésu teh kóng uē ê lâng, lóng tuì I ê tshong-bîng kah ìn-tap kám-kak hi-kî.
English: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.

Tailo: sī ông tī Ioltàn hô ê pîng-guân, tī Su-kot kah Tsa-le-thàn ê tiong-kan, tī liâm-thô͘ ê tē, īng liâm-thô͘ ê bô͘-á tsù-tsiâⁿ ê.
English: In the plain of the Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarethan.

Tailo: I niû i ê tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, tī tiān ê tsîng-bīn; i tuì guá kóng, Tse sī tsì-sìng-só͘.
English: He measured the length of it, twenty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said to me, This is the most holy place.

Tailo: Sàulô put-tsí siū-khì, bô huann-hí tsit-ê uē, tsiū kóng, Kā bān-bān hō͘ Tabi̍t, tshing-tshing hō͘ guá, tsí ū tshun kok-uī bē hō͘ i niā-niā.
English: Saul was very angry, and this saying displeased him; and he said, They have ascribed to David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, ho̍k-sāi I, kí I ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: You shall fear Yahweh your God; and him shall you serve, and shall swear by his name.

Tailo: I tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tó lo̍h-khì lò͘! Tuā Babúlông tó lo̍h-khì à! Taⁿ tsit-ê siâⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò kuí teh tuà ê só͘-tsāi, it-tshè ù-uè siâ-sîn ê kaⁿ-lô, í-ki̍p só͘ ū bô tshing-khì koh khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tsiáu-luī ê tsiáu-siū.
English: He cried with a mighty voice, saying, Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great, and she has become a habitation of demons, a prison of every unclean spirit, and a prison of every unclean and hateful bird!

Tailo: Lâng nā bô sìn sim tsiū bē-tàng hō͘ Siōngtè huann-hí tsiap-la̍p. Beh tshin-kīn Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, it-tīng tio̍h siong-sìn Siōngtè ê tsûn-tsāi, koh siong-sìn I ē pò-siúⁿ hiah-ê tsáu-tshuē I ê lâng.
English: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, in tī tuì-ti̍k ê tē ê sî, Guá iáu-koh bô kā in khì-sak, mā bô thó-ià in, lâi kā in tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t, tì-sú uî-puē Guá kah in só͘ li̍p ê iok, in-uī Guá sī Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè.
English: Yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break my covenant with them; for I am Yahweh their God;

Tailo: Lín ka-kī tio̍h kín-sīn, in-uī lâng ē kā lín kau hō͘ gī-huē, lín ē tī huē-tn̂g lāi siū piⁿ-phah. Lín mā ē uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ khiā tī kuaⁿ-hú kah kun-ông ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tuì in uī guá tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

Tailo: Hit sî, lí it-tīng gia̍h-khí lí bô khuat-tiám ê bīn; lí mā ē khiā tsāi, lóng bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Surely then shall you lift up your face without spot; Yes, you shall be steadfast, and shall not fear:

Tailo: Iésu tī Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ ǹg sìng-tiān teh tsē ê sî, Piattò͘, Iâkop, Iô-há-neh kah An-to-le̍h thau-thau-á mn̄g Iésu kóng,
English: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

Tailo: Aigi̍p tshin-tshiūnn Nai-l hô tiòng muá, i ê tsuí tshin-tshiūnn kang-hô teh giâ íng. I ê uē kóng: Guá beh tshìng kuân, guá beh jia-khàm tsuân tē; guá beh huí-huāi hiah-ê siâⁿ kah tuà tī kî-tiong ê jîn-bîn.
English: Egypt rises up like the Nile, and his waters toss themselves like the rivers: and he says, I will rise up, I will cover the earth; I will destroy cities and the inhabitants of it.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kā i kóng, Lí tī guá tsia ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khiàm-khueh, lí kìng-jiân ài beh tńg-khì pún-kok? I ìn kóng, Guá bô khiàm-khueh siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsóng-.sī, tshiánn iông-ín guá tńg-.khì.
English: Then Pharaoh said to him, But what have you lacked with me, that behold, you seek to go to your own country? He answered, Nothing: however only let me depart.

Tailo: I tsiū tuì guá kóng, Tuā-tuā tit-tio̍h thióng-ài ê lâng — Taniel, lí tio̍h bîng-pi̍k guá kah lí só͘ kóng tsiah-ê uē. Khiā khí-.lâi, in-uī guá taⁿ hōng tshe-khián lâi-kàu lí tsia. I tuì guá kóng tsit-ê uē, guá tsiū khiā-teh gī-gī tshuah.
English: He said to me, Daniel, you man greatly beloved, understand the words that I speak to you, and stand upright; for to you am I now sent. When he had spoken this word to me, I stood trembling.

Tailo: Io-lâm tuà só͘-ū ê tsiàn-tshia, kuè-khì Tsa-il, thàu-mê khí-.lâi, phah kā i uî-khùn ê Etóm lâng kah hiah-ê tshia-tiúⁿ; jîn-bîn tsiū tô-tsáu, ta̍k-ê tńg-khì ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn.
English: Then Joram passed over to Zair, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and struck the Edomites who surrounded him, and the captains of the chariots; and the people fled to their tents.

Tailo: Láu-tuā kah tsun-kuì ê lâng to̍h-sī thâu, īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē kà-sī lâng ê sian-ti to̍h-sī bué.
English: The elder and the honorable man is the head, And the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-la̍t tsò, thang hō͘ Siōngtè kā lí khuàⁿ-tsò sī khó-tshú ê, tsò tsi̍t-ê bô thang hiâm ê kang-lâng, tsìng-khak káng-kái tsin-lí ê sìn-sit.
English: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn't need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsiah ē-tàng hō͘ guá tī Ki-tok tsài-lîm ê ji̍t ū thang khua-kháu, in-uī guá m̄-sī khang-khang pháu-tsáu, guá só͘-ū ê lô-khó͘ lóng bô óng-huì.
English: holding up the word of life; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ, that I didn't run in vain nor labor in vain.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng koh khí Hilâm só͘ hō͘ Só͘lômóng hiah-ê siâⁿ, hō͘ Isulael lâng tuà tī hia.
English: that the cities which Huram had given to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuâⁿ khîm lâi kám-siā Siōngtsú, īng tsa̍p tiâu hiân ê sik o-ló I.
English: Give thanks to Yahweh with the lyre. Sing praises to him with the harp of ten strings.

Tailo: He-lo̍t tsiū tiàu-tsi̍p só͘-ū ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah bîn-kan ê king-ha̍k kàu-su, mn̄g in kóng, Ki-tok ing-kai tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tshut-sì?
English: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, To-kiàm, tio̍h khí-lâi kong-kik Guá ê bo̍k-tsiá, mā kong-kik hit-ê kah Guá tsò tâng-phuāⁿ ê lâng. Phah bo̍k-tsiá, iûⁿ-kûn tsiū sì-suàⁿ; hiah-ê bî-sè-.ê, Guá beh ua̍t-tńg tshiú lâi kā in phah.
English: Awake, sword, against my shepherd, And against the man who is close to me, says Yahweh of Armies. Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered; And I will turn my hand against the little ones.

Tailo: Isulael tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h ông bô tsun-thàn in, jîn-bîn tsiū tuì ông kóng, Guán tī Tabi̍t ū siáⁿ-mi̍h hūn-gia̍h? Guán kah I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ bô kuan-hē. Isulael, tńg-khì lín ê pò͘-pênn! Tabi̍t, tio̍h kò͘ lí ka-kī ê tshù! Tsiū án-ne, Isulael lâng tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: When all Israel saw that the king didn't listen to them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: to your tents, Israel: now see to your own house, David. So Israel departed to their tents.

Tailo: Lín taⁿ tio̍h tuì Isulael tsi-tso̍k tiong-kan kíng-suán tsa̍p-jī-ê lâng, muí tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t-ê lâng,
English: Now therefore take twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, for every tribe a man.

Tailo: In tuì Iosiúah kóng, Guán sī lí ê lô͘-po̍k. Iosiúah mn̄g in kóng, Lín sī siáⁿ lâng? Sī tuì tó-uī lâi ê?
English: They said to Joshua, We are your servants. Joshua said to them, Who are you? and from whence come you?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kì-liām guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng án-tsuáⁿ tsûn uân-tsuân ê sim, tsiàu sîng-si̍t lâi kiâⁿ, koh tsò Lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê. Hitsekia tsiū tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: Remember now, Yahweh, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight. Hezekiah wept sore.

Tailo: In-uī tsi̍t-ê lâng ê puē-gi̍k, tsìng lâng lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò tsuē-jîn; kāng-khuán, in-uī tsi̍t-ê lâng sūn-ho̍k, tsìng lâng lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò gī lâng.
English: For as through the one man's disobedience many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one will many be made righteous.

Tailo: Hiah-ê ke tshut-.lâi ê lâng-gia̍h só͘ sio̍k-huê ê gîn, tio̍h kau-tài Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ.
English: and you shall give the money, with which the remainder of them is redeemed, to Aaron and to his sons.

Tailo: I sī kìng-khiân ê lâng kah tsuân ke lóng kìng-uì Siōngtè, tsín-tsè tsin tsē sàn-tshiah ê Iô-tá-iah lâng, koh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuì Siōngtè kî-tó.
English: a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

Tailo: I ū tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, miâ kiò-tsò Sàulô, ióng-tsòng koh hó khuànn thâu, tī Isulael tiong bô tsi̍t-ê lâng ē pí-tit i ê hó khuànn thâu; sing-khu pí kûn-tsiòng khah kuân tsi̍t lia̍p thâu-khak.
English: He had a son, whose name was Saul, an impressive young man; and there was not among the children of Israel a better person than he. From his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people.

Tailo: Samuel kā Sàulô kóng, Lí ná ē kā guá kiáu-jiáu, khan guá khí-.lâi? Sàulô kóng, Guá khùn-khó͘ kàu-ki̍k; in-uī Huilīsū lâng kah guá kau-tsiàn, Siōngtè mā lī-khui guá, bô koh īng sian-ti á-.sī bîn-bāng lâi ìn-tap guá, só͘-í, guá tshiáⁿ lí lâi, thang tsí-sī guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kiânn.
English: Samuel said to Saul, Why have you disquieted me, to bring me up? Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answers me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called you, that you may make known to me what I shall do.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Iésu ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h lâi tuè guá, tshut-tsāi hiah-ê lîng-sìng sí-.khì ê lâng khì bâi-tsòng in ka-kī ê sí-lâng.
English: But Jesus said to him, Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu A-mit-thài ê kiáⁿ Iôná, kóng,
English: Now the word of Yahweh came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh hō͘ tsit king tshù tshin-tshiūnn Sī-lô, hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò tē-tsiūⁿ bān-kok tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē-pèⁿ. '
English: then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.

Tailo: Guá ê sim nā siūⁿ-khí tsiah-ê, tī guá ê pak lāi tsiū ut-būn.
English: My soul still remembers them, and is bowed down within me.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Siōngtè ê kuī, Tabi̍t í-king tuì Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm tuà i khì-kàu Tabi̍t thè i tsún-pī ê só͘-tsāi, in-uī i bat tī Êlúsalèm thè Siōngtè tah pò͘-pêⁿ.
English: But David had brought the ark of God up from Kiriath Jearim to the place that David had prepared for it; for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lâi tsiò lán tsiah-ê tiàm tī o͘-àm kah sí-ìm tiong ê lâng, ín-tshuā lán ê kha kiâⁿ-ji̍p pîng-an ê lō͘.
English: To shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; To guide our feet into the way of peace.

Tailo: Guá gia̍h-khí tshiú ǹg thiⁿ kóng, Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi kóng:
English: For I lift up my hand to heaven, And say, As I live forever,

Tailo: Gōng lâng nā tiām-tiām mā sǹg-tsò sī tì-huī; bô suî-piān kóng-uē ê lâng mā sǹg-tsò sī tshong-bîng.
English: Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise. When he shuts his lips, he is thought to be discerning.

Tailo: jî-tshiánn Só͘lômóng í-king tsē kok-uī.
English: Also Solomon sits on the throne of the kingdom.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, hit khu tshân kah tshân-.ni̍h ê hia̍t, tuì Hiat lâng tiāⁿ-tio̍h kui hō͘ Abulahàm tsò sán-gia̍p, lâi tsò bōng-tē.
English: The field, and the cave that is in it, were deeded to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i ê sim kiau-ngō͘, i ê sìng giám-ngē, tì-sú kiâⁿ-ta̍h kiau-ngō͘, tsiū hông lut i ê ông-uī, tshiúⁿ-tua̍t i ê îng-kng.
English: But when his heart was lifted up, and his spirit was hardened so that he dealt proudly, he was deposed from his kingly throne, and they took his glory from him:

Tailo: Iâkop the̍h tsheⁿ ê iông-tshiū, hīng tshiū, png tshiū, nńg ê ki, kā tshiū-phuê pak tsiânn pe̍h bûn, hō͘ tshiū-ki lāi pe̍h-sik ê pō͘-hūn lō͘-hiān tshut-.lâi.
English: Jacob took to himself rods of fresh poplar, almond, plane tree, peeled white streaks in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sù-hok ê lâng ē sîng-tsiap ìng-ín ê thó͘-tē; Hō͘ I tsiù-tsó͘ ê lâng ē hông bia̍t-bông.
English: For such as are blessed by him shall inherit the land. Those who are cursed by him shall be cut off.

Tailo: Tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng tī hia tuā kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; gī lâng ê tiong-kan ū Siōngtè tông-tsāi.
English: There they were in great fear, For God is in the generation of the righteous.

Tailo: I koh kā in ê tsing-seⁿ kau hō͘ pha̍uh, kā in kui kûn ê tsing-seⁿ kau hō͘ sih-nà.
English: He gave over their livestock also to the hail, And their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

Tailo: Án-ne tsin kú, nn̄g nî āu, i ê tn̂g-á uī-tio̍h pēⁿ thu̍t tshut-.lâi, in-uī tsit-ê pēⁿ tsin tāng tsiū sí. I ê jîn-bîn bô kā i kiânn sio ê lé-sò͘, tshin-tshiūnn tsîng kā i ê tsó͘-sian só͘ sio ê.
English: It happened, in process of time, at the end of two years, that his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness, and he died of sore diseases. His people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá tī lín hia ê sî lín lóng ū sūn-ho̍k guá; tsit-má guá bô kah lín tsò-hué, lín koh khah tio̍h sūn-ho̍k. Lín tio̍h kè-sio̍k kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, phah-piàⁿ lâi uân-sîng lín ka-kī ê tit-kiù.
English: So then, my beloved, even as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, i tuì Babúlông tshut-huat, gō͘-gue̍h tshe-it tsiū kàu Êlúsalèm, in-uī i ū Siōngtè si un ê tshiú kā i pang-tsān.
English: For on the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon; and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God on him.

Tailo: Lí khì tsio-tsi̍p Isulael ê tiúⁿ-ló, kā in kóng, ' Siōngtsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī Abulahàm, Ísak, Iâkop ê Siōngtè tuì guá hián-hiān, kóng, ' Guá si̍t-tsāi tsiàu-kò͘ lín, lâng tī Aigi̍p só͘ kā lín khuán-thāi ê, Guá mā ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and tell them, Yahweh, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has appeared to me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt;

Tailo: M̄-koh, uàn-hūn hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê lâng, sī ua̍h tī o͘-àm tiong; i tī o͘-àm tiong teh sing-ua̍h, m̄-tsai ka-kī ê hong-hiòng, in-uī tsit-ê o͘-àm hō͘ i ê ba̍k-tsiu tsheⁿ-mê.
English: But he who hates his brother is in the darkness, and walks in the darkness, and doesn't know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.

Tailo: Melalih ê kiáⁿ-sun tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tsit-hūn sī siú huē-bō͘ ê pán, i ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ, i ê thiāu, i ê tsō kah só͘-ū ê khì-kū, it-tshè tsò lō͘-īng ê mi̍h,
English: The appointed charge of the sons of Merari shall be the tabernacle's boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, all its instruments, all its service,

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, tāi-kún ê tsè-si kah só͘-ū ji̍p-khì tī Asito͘t tāi-kún biō ê lâng, lóng bô ta̍h tāi-kún ê hō͘-tīng, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: Therefore neither the priests of Dagon, nor any who come into Dagon's house, tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod, to this day.

Tailo: Guá thè lín tam-sim, khióng-kiaⁿ guá í-tsîng tī lín tiong-kan ê lô-khó͘ kang-tsok ē piàn-sîng bô tshái-kang.
English: I am afraid for you, that I might have wasted my labor for you.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī thè guá sin-uan ê Siōngtsú, hō͘ hiah-ê jîn-bîn khut-ho̍k guá.
English: Even the God who executes vengeance for me, Who brings down peoples under me,

Tailo: Koh kóng, Lí nā tì-ì thiaⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê siann, koh kiânn I só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò ha̍p-gî ê tāi-tsì, tsù-ì thiaⁿ I ê kài-bīng, siú I it-tshè ê lu̍t-lē, guá hō͘ Aigi̍p lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê phuà-pēⁿ, tsiū it-tīng bô hō͘ lí tú-.tio̍h, in-uī Guá sī kā lí i-tī ê Siōngtsú.
English: and he said, If you will diligently listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, and will do that which is right in his eyes, and will pay attention to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you, which I have put on the Egyptians; for I am Yahweh who heals you.

Tailo: I īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ, tn̂g gō͘ tiú, khuah gō͘ tiú, tsit-ê tuâⁿ sī sì-kak-hîng ê, kuân saⁿ tiú.
English: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its breadth was five cubits, and its height was three cubits.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Guá án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ tsit-ê tuā ê tsai-hō lîm-kàu tī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, Guá mā beh án-ne hō͘ Guá só͘ ìng-ín in it-tshè ê hok-khì lîm-kàu in.
English: For thus says Yahweh: Like as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so will I bring on them all the good that I have promised them.

Tailo: Guá tio̍h sí tī tsit-ê tē, guá bē-tàng kuè Ioltàn hô; tsóng-.sī, lín ē-tàng kuè-khì tit-tio̍h hit-ê hó ê tē.
English: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but you shall go over, and possess that good land.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kóng, Guá ē tsún lín khì, tī khòng-iá tsè-sū Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, to̍k-to̍k m̄-thang khì hn̄g, lín tio̍h thè guá kî-tó.
English: Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to Yahweh your God in the wilderness, only you shall not go very far away. Pray for me.

Tailo: Lín tī sè-kan it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí, tī Siōngtsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê:
English: These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess it, all the days that you live on the earth.

Tailo: In ê ông kah i hiah-ê siú-líng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: And their king will go into captivity, He and his princes together, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Iobuh ìn kóng:
English: Then Job answered,

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ē kui tī im-hú, hiah-ê bē kì-tit Siōngtè ê lia̍t pang mā ē án-ne.
English: The wicked shall be turned back to Sheol, Even all the nations that forget God.

Tailo: in-uī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè to̍h-sī kah lín tsò-hué khì ê, ē thè lín kah tuì-ti̍k kau-tsiàn, lâi tsín-kiù lín.
English: for Yahweh your God is he who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí m̄-thang khí tiān, lí só͘ tshin-seⁿ ê kiáⁿ ē uī Guá ê miâ khí tiān. '
English: nevertheless you shall not build the house; but your son who shall come forth out of your body, he shall build the house for my name.

Tailo: Ū hong tuì Siōngtsú tshut-.lâi, kā ian-tshun tuì hái-.ni̍h tshue-.lâi, lo̍h tī iâⁿ piⁿ, tsit pîng tsha-put-to tsi̍t ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, hit pîng tsha-put-to tsi̍t ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, tī iâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî sì-kè lóng sī, lī tē tsha-put-to ū nn̄g tiú.
English: There went forth a wind from Yahweh, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, about a day's journey on this side, and a day's journey on the other side, round about the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth.

Tailo: Tulô ông Hilâm tshe sù-tsiá tuà pik-hiuⁿ tshâ kah thô͘-tsuí sai-hū, tsò-ba̍k sai-hū, lâi-kàu Tabi̍t hia, beh kā i khí tshù.
English: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si ）Siōngtsú sī guá ê kng, sī guá ê tsín-kiù; guá iáu-koh tio̍h-kiaⁿ siáⁿ lâng? Siōngtsú sī guá ua̍h-miā ê khuì-la̍t, guá iáu-koh tio̍h-kiaⁿ siáⁿ lâng?
English: Yahweh is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?

Tailo: M̄-thang tsia̍h hueh, án-ne, lí kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò sī tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tsiū ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: You shall not eat it; that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, when you shall do that which is right in the eyes of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, m̄-thang siong-sìn só͘-ū ê lîng, tio̍h kā i tsa-giām, khuànn i sī m̄-sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê, in-uī ū tsin tsē ké sian-ti, tshut-hiān tī tsit sè-kan.
English: Beloved, don't believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

Tailo: Hûn tuì pò͘-pêⁿ tíng suá-khui, lí khuàⁿ, Milíám thái-ko tshin-tshiūnn seh. Alông khuànn Milíám, lí khuàⁿ, i sī thái-ko.
English: The cloud removed from over the Tent; and behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow: and Aaron looked at Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.

Tailo: Bo̍k-tsiá, lín tio̍h ai-khàu tuā-siaⁿ huah; iûⁿ-kûn ê thâu-ba̍k, lín tio̍h kō tī hué-hu tiong; in-uī lín siū thâi kah hun-suànn ê ji̍t-kî í-king kàu. Lín ē tó lo̍h-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn lâng só͘ huann-hí ê khì-kū ka-la̍uh.
English: Wail, you shepherds, and cry; and wallow in ashes, you principal of the flock; for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions are fully come, and you shall fall like a goodly vessel.

Tailo: Guá ê ì-sù sī kóng lín ta̍k lâng ū bô kāng-khuán ê kóng-huat; ū ê kóng, Guá sio̍k Páulô ; ū ê kóng, Guá sio̍k A-po-lô ; ū ê kóng, Guá sio̍k Piattò͘ , koh ū ê kóng, Guá sio̍k Ki-tok.
English: Now I mean this, that each one of you says, I follow Paul, I follow Apollos, I follow Cephas, and, I follow Christ.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú sī tshòng-tsō tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê, I tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtè; I tsō tē lâi kā i uân-sîng, koh kā i kian-kò͘, m̄-sī khang-khang tsō ê, sī tshòng-tsō i lâi hō͘ lâng tuà ê. I án-ne kóng: Guá sī Siōngtsú, í-guā bô pa̍t-ê.
English: For thus says Yahweh who created the heavens, the God who formed the earth and made it, who established it and didn't create it a waste, who formed it to be inhabited: I am Yahweh; and there is no one else.

Tailo: In nā uī-tio̍h ka-kī só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè tāi-tsì lâi kiàn-siàu, lí tio̍h tsí-sī in tsit-ê tiān ê kui-bô͘ kah i ê khuán-sit, i tshut ê só͘-tsāi, i ji̍p ê só͘-tsāi kah i it-tshè ê kui-bô͘, í-ki̍p i it-tshè ê lé-gî, i it-tshè ê kui-bô͘, i it-tshè ê huat-tō͘, lóng tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng siá lo̍h-.lâi; hō͘ in siú it-tshè ê kui-bô͘, it-tshè ê lé-gî lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: If they be ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the form of the house, and the fashion of it, and the exits of it, and the entrances of it, and all the forms of it, and all the ordinances of it, and all the forms of it, and all the laws of it; and write it in their sight; that they may keep the whole form of it, and all the ordinances of it, and do them.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, in ta̍k lâng the̍h i ka-kī ê hiuⁿ-lô͘, té hué tī hit lāi-bīn, hē hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn, kah Mô͘se kah Alông khiā tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu.
English: They took every man his censer, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood at the door of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.

Tailo: In hō͘ guá kah lín ê sim-sîn tit-tio̍h kó͘-bú. Lín tio̍h tsun-tiōng tsit khuán lâng.
English: For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge those who are like that.

Tailo: Lín it-tīng ū tsai-hō ah! In-uī lín uī lín tsó͘-sian sat-hāi ê sian-ti tsō bōng.
English: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kā lín kóng, m̄-thang tshau-huân lín ê sèⁿ-miā beh tsia̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h, beh lim siáⁿ-mi̍h, á-.sī lín ê sing-khu beh tshīng siáⁿ-mi̍h. Lín ê sèⁿ-miā kám bô pí tsia̍h-mi̍h khah tiōng-iàu? Lín ê sing-khu kám bô pí saⁿ-á-khò͘ khah iàu-kín?
English: Therefore, I tell you, don't be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn't life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ ū tó tsi̍t kok tshin-tshiūnn Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tsá-tsîng khì kiù-sio̍k in lâi tsò ka-kī ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ Lí tuì ki̍k tuā koh thang kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì tit-tio̍h miâ, in-uī kuáⁿ-tio̍k lia̍t kok lī-khui Lí ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Lí só͘ kiù-sio̍k tshut Aigi̍p hiah-ê jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng.
English: What one nation in the earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to make you a name by great and awesome things, in driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeem out of Egypt?

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh kā i ê kiáⁿ Só͘lômóng kóng, Lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ khì tsò, m̄-bián lún, mā m̄-bián kiaⁿ, in-uī Siōngtsú — Siōngtè, to̍h-sī guá ê Siōngtè kah lí tông-tsāi, I it-tīng bô lī-khui lí, mā bô pàng-sak lí, it-ti̍t kàu Siōngtsú tiān ê kang lóng uân-sîng.
English: David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: don't be afraid, nor be dismayed; for Yahweh God, even my God, is with you; he will not fail you, nor forsake you, until all the work for the service of the house of Yahweh is finished.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tiong-kan tsin tsē lâng su-hā teh gī-lūn Iésu ê tāi-tsì, ū lâng kóng, I sī hó lâng. Mā ū lâng kóng, M̄-sī, I sī teh siàn-tōng kûn-tsiòng.
English: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, He is a good man. Others said, Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.

Tailo: Guá uī-tio̍h siat-li̍p Sàulô tsò ông lâi hō͘-hué, in-uī i ua̍t tńg-.khì bô tuè Guá, bô tsun-siú Guá ê bīng-līng. Samuel tsin tsheh-sim, kui mê kiû Siōngtsú.
English: It grieves me that I have set up Saul to be king; for he is turned back from following me, and has not performed my commandments. Samuel was angry; and he cried to Yahweh all night.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng bô kā tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê I-é-bú-suh lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì. I-é-bú-suh lâng iû-guân tī Êlúsalèm kah Biāniámín lâng tsò-hué tuà, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: The children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem to this day.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng beh tshì-thàm Iésu, iau-kiû I kiânn tuì thiⁿ lâi ê sîn-jiah.
English: Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven.

Tailo: I tsiū tó tī i ê kha tsîng, kàu thiⁿ iáu-buē kng bē jīn-tit lâng ê sî, tsiū khí-.lâi. Bôohtsuh kóng, M̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai ū tsa-bó͘ gín-á lâi-kàu tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: She lay at his feet until the morning. She rose up before one could discern another. For he said, Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán tsai Lí ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lóng tsai, m̄-bián lâng kā Lí mn̄g. In-uī án-ne, guán sìn Lí sī tuì Siōngtè hia lâi ê.
English: Now we know that you know all things, and don't need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came forth from God.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lín khì kā hit tsiah hô͘-lî kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, kin-á-ji̍t, bîn-á-tsài, guá kuáⁿ kuí, i-pēⁿ, kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t uân-sîng guá ê kang-tsok. '
English: He said to them, Go and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.

Tailo: Lí mā kàng-lîm tī Si-nái suaⁿ, tuì thiⁿ-.ni̍h kah in kóng-uē, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsìng-ti̍t ê huat-tō͘, tsin-si̍t ê huat-tō͘, hó ê lu̍t-lē kah kài-bīng,
English: You came down also on Mount Sinai, and spoke with them from heaven, and gave them right ordinances and true laws, good statutes and commandments,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì sian-ti án-ne kóng, ' Siōngtsú ìn lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtsú kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? '
English: Thus shall you say to the prophet, What has Yahweh answered you? and, What has Yahweh spoken?

Tailo: Isulael ông tsiū tiàu tsi̍t-ê kuaⁿ-uân lâi, kóng, Lí khì kiò Im-lah ê kiáⁿ Mikaiah kuáⁿ-kín lâi.
English: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Get quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.

Tailo: Tuì ji̍t tshut, mā tuì ji̍t lo̍h ê só͘-tsāi, hō͘ lâng lóng tsai tû Guá í-guā bô ū pa̍t-ê. Guá sī Siōngtsú, tī Guá í-guā bô ū pa̍t-ê.
English: that they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none besides me: I am Yahweh, and there is no one else.

Tailo: Lí ê tuì-ti̍k lóng ǹg lí tuā-tuā khui i ê tshuì; in thí-tshiò koh kā khí, kóng: Guán ū kā i thun-bia̍t-tiāu. Tse tsin-tsiàⁿ sī guán só͘ ǹg-bāng ê ji̍t, taⁿ guán ū tú-.tio̍h, guán ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h!
English: All your enemies have opened their mouth wide against you; They hiss and gnash the teeth; they say, We have swallowed her up; Certainly this is the day that we looked for; we have found, we have seen it.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī sán-hū tshui-tsūn thòng-khó͘ ê khai-sí.
English: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.

Tailo: Koh tshuā Alông ê kiáⁿ lâi, Mô͘se īng tām-po̍h hueh buah tī in tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê kah tsiàⁿ tshiú ê tuā-thâu-bú, í-ki̍p tsiàⁿ-kha ê tuā-thâu-bú, Mô͘se koh īng hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ tíng ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He brought Aaron's sons; and Moses put some of the blood on the tip of their right ear, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot; and Moses sprinkled the blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: In king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in tsa-po͘ ting ê sò͘-gia̍h; tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng ê, tsóng-kiōng ū la̍k-tshing nn̄g-pah miâ.
English: Those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, were six thousand two hundred.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng, Siōngtè ê sìng-tiān tsiū khui, sìng-tiān lāi bīn I ê iok-kuī khuànn hiān-hiān; suà lo̍h-lâi ū sih-nà, hiáng-siaⁿ, luî tân, tē-tāng kah tuā pha̍uh.
English: God's temple that is in heaven was opened, and the ark of the Lord's covenant was seen in his temple. Lightnings, sounds, thunders, an earthquake, and great hail followed.

Tailo: In suî-sî khuànn sì-kho͘-uî, bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h puànn-lâng, tsí ū Iésu kah in tī hia.
English: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

Tailo: In-uī Ta-má-su-ko tsò Alâm ê thâu, Le-tsín tsò Ta-má-su-ko ê thâu; tī la̍k-tsa̍p gō͘ nî lāi, Ehulaim it-tīng siū phò-huāi, tì-sú bē tsiâⁿ-tsò kok.
English: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within sixty-five years Ephraim shall be broken in pieces, so that it shall not be a people;

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, tsè-si tio̍h kā i giām, nā thuàⁿ tī phuê-hu, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò bô tshing-khì, sī thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu.
English: The priest shall examine him on the seventh day. If it has spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is the plague of leprosy.

Tailo: Nā ū sio-kò ê tāi-tsì, in tio̍h khiā-teh phuàⁿ-tuàn, tio̍h tsiàu Guá ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn. Tī Guá it-tshè ê tseh-kî, tio̍h siú Guá tsiah-ê huat-tō͘ lu̍t-lē, mā tio̍h siú Guá tsiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng.
English: In a controversy they shall stand to judge; according to my ordinances shall they judge it: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts; and they shall make my Sabbaths holy.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kah pē-bú tńg-khì kàu Na-tsa-lia̍t, lâi kā in iú-hàu. I ê lāu-bú kā tsiah-ê uē lóng kì tī sim-lāi.
English: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

Tailo: Guán bô beh kah in tī Ioltàn hô hit pîng koh khì ê tē tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p, in-uī guán ê sán-gia̍p sī tsāi tī Ioltàn hô tang pîng tsit pîng.
English: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan, and forward; because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi ài kah Tsuân-lîng-.ê kóng-uē; guá tsin ài kah Siōngtè lí-lūn.
English: Surely I would speak to the Almighty. I desire to reason with God.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, kin-á-ji̍t, tī Isulael tiong kiám tsi̍t tsi-tso̍k, Isulael tiong ná ē ū tsit khuán tāi-tsì?
English: They said, Yahweh, the God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that there should be today one tribe lacking in Israel?

Tailo: In-uī in khì E-si-kol ê suaⁿ-kok khì khuànn hit-ê tē ê sî, ū hō͘ Isulael lâng lué-tsì, bô ài ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē.
English: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which Yahweh had given them.

Tailo: Tī lâm pîng, tsiàu in ê kun-tuī, sī Lūbiān iâⁿ ê tuā kî, ū Si-ti-ul ê kiáⁿ Elitsul tsò Lūbiān lâng ê siú-líng.
English: On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their divisions. The prince of the children of Reuben shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Hitsekia kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn, in-uī sim kiau-ngō͘ tsiū ka-kī khiam-pi, tì-sú Siōngtsú ê siū-khì tī Hitsekia tī-.leh ê ji̍t bô kàu tī in.
English: Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of Yahweh didn't come on them in the days of Hezekiah.

Tailo: Pò-siû lâng-miā ê nā jiok i, in m̄-thang kā thâi lâng ê kau tī i ê tshiú, in-uī i tshò-gō͘ thâi-sí i ê tshù-piⁿ, pîng-sî pīng bô uàn-hūn i.
English: If the avenger of blood pursue after him, then they shall not deliver up the manslayer into his hand; because he struck his neighbor unawares, and didn't hate him before.

Tailo: tsá-tsîng ū lâng pò guá kóng Sàulô í-king sí, i ka-kī lia̍h-tsò sī pò hó siau-sit, guá tsiū tī Sé-keh-la̍h kā i lia̍h-lâi thâi-sí, tse sī guá hō͘ i tsò thuān siau-sit ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: when one told me, saying, Behold, Saul is dead, thinking to have brought good news, I took hold of him, and killed him in Ziklag, which was the reward I gave him for his news.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā in tsò iù-tē pò͘ ê khò͘ lâi tsa̍h in ê ē-sin, khò͘ tio̍h tuì io kàu tuā-thuí.
English: You shall make them linen breeches to cover the flesh of their nakedness; from the waist even to the thighs they shall reach:

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guán tī lia̍t pang tiong tsò uē-pèⁿ, hō͘ tsìng lâng tuì guán iô thâu.
English: You make us a byword among the nations, A shaking of the head among the peoples.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, Só͘lômóng ài beh thâi-sí Ia-lô-ba-am. Ia-lô-ba-am tsiū tô-tsáu khì Aigi̍p, lâi-kàu Aigi̍p ông Sisiak hia, tsiū tuà tī Aigi̍p, ti̍t-kàu Só͘lômóng sí-.khì.
English: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam; but Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú ê uē án-ne kóng, Tsit-ê jîn-bîn kóng-khí Siōngtsú tiān ê sî, hit-ê sî iáu-buē kàu.
English: This is what Yahweh of Armies says: These people say, The time hasn't yet come, the time for Yahweh's house to be built.'

Tailo: Hit sî, thâi-sí Mô͘ap lâng tsha-put-to tsi̍t bān, lóng sī tuā-hàn ê ióng-sū, bô kah tsi̍t-ê tsáu lī-khui.
English: They struck of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, every lusty man, and every man of valor; and there escaped not a man.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si. ）Siōngtsú sī guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, sī ing-kai o-ló ê! I tuàn-liān guá ê tshiú gâu tsing-tsiàn, kà guá ê tsíng-thâu-á ū ki-khiáu ē sio-thâi.
English: Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, Who teaches my hands to war, And my fingers to battle:

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h suan-káng tō-lí, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng-tio̍h Ammóng lâng kah in ê bú-bān, ū án-ne kóng, lí tio̍h kóng: Ū to, ū pue̍h-tshut ê to, í-king lè kng beh lâi thâi-sí-lâng, hō͘ i tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà teh thun-bia̍t lâng.
English: You, son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh concerning the children of Ammon, and concerning their reproach; and say you, A sword, a sword is drawn, for the slaughter it is furbished, to cause it to devour, that it may be as lightning;

Tailo: Io-a-si kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn kah Isulael tsiah-ê ông tsò-hué tsòng tī Sa-má-lī-a. I ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; and Jeroboam his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tio̍h tuì ta̍k hāng lé-mi̍h ê tiong-kan, the̍h tsi̍t hāng hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò kí-tsè, tse tio̍h kui tī hiù siā-un-tsè ê hueh ê tsè-si.
English: Of it he shall offer one out of each offering for a heave offering to Yahweh. It shall be the priest's who sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings.

Tailo: Tsûn kiâⁿ tsin bān, king-kuè tsin tsē ji̍t tsiah lâi-kàu Ku-ní-toh ê guā-hái. In-uī siū hong tsó͘-tòng, guán tsiū sūn Ku-lé-té tó siám-hong ê hit pîng, kiânn tuì Sa-mó͘-neh kuè-.khì.
English: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

Tailo: Gilia̍t ê jîn-bîn kah tsìng siú-líng, tāi-ke tsò-hué gī-lūn kóng, Siáⁿ lâng ē tāi-sing khì kong-kik Ammóng lâng? Hit-ê lâng beh tsò Gilia̍t tsìng lâng ê thâu-lâng.
English: The people, the princes of Gilead, said one to another, What man is he who will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? he shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hiah-ê lâng m̄-thiaⁿ i ê uē, hit-ê lâng tsiū kā i ê sè-î khan tshut-khì guā-bīn kau in, in tsiū kah i kau-ha̍p, kui mê kā i lîng-jio̍k, kàu tsá-khí thiⁿ beh kng ê sî, tsiah pàng i khì.
English: But the men wouldn't listen to him: so the man laid hold on his concubine, and brought her forth to them; and they knew her, and abused her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to spring, they let her go.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū tshiánn in ji̍p-khì tshù lāi, lâu in tuà hia kuè-mê. Keh tńg kang, Piattò͘ kah in khì, koh ū kuí-nā-ê Io̍p-pe ê sìn-tô͘ mā tuè i khì.
English: So he called them in and lodged them. On the next day Peter arose and went out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Mô͘se ji̍p-khì huat-kuī ê pò͘-pênn; lí khuàⁿ, sio̍k Lēbī ê ke, Alông ê kuái-á, í-king puh-gê, seⁿ hue-m̂, khui hue, kiat-tsiâⁿ hīng-jîn.
English: It happened on the next day, that Moses went into the tent of the testimony; and behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and put forth buds, and produced blossoms, and bore ripe almonds.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsò Isulael ông kiōng sì-tsa̍p nî; tī Hebúlông tsò ông tshit nî, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ nî.
English: The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty-three years reigned he in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tabi̍t mn̄g Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú kóng, M̄-thang ti̍t-ti̍t uá-.khì, tio̍h uan kàu in ê āu-bīn, tuì sng-tsâi tshiū tuì-bīn khì kā in phah.
English: When David inquired of Yahweh, he said, You shall not go up: make a circuit behind them, and come on them over against the mulberry trees.

Tailo: Tsuē tuì tsi̍t-ê lâng tsìn-ji̍p sè-kan, sí mā tuè teh ji̍p-.lâi. Kiat-kó só͘-ū ê lâng lóng ē sí, in-uī só͘-ū ê lâng lóng ū huān tsuē.
English: Therefore, as sin entered into the world through one man, and death through sin; and so death passed to all men, because all sinned.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bē kì-tit Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, i ê lō͘-kìng mā sī án-ne; bô kìng-khiân ê lâng, i ê ǹg-bāng ē bô-.khì.
English: So are the paths of all who forget God. The hope of the godless man shall perish,

Tailo: Bōng mā piak-khui, ū tsin tsē í-king sí-.khì ê Siōngtè tsú-bîn, in ê sing-khu koh-ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;

Tailo: Guá mā phài Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k, A-hi-sat-buat ê kiáⁿ A-ho-li-ia̍p kah i tsò-hué tsò. Kiàn-nā sim-lāi ū tì-huī ê, Guá koh siúⁿ-sù tì-huī tī in ê sim, hō͘ in ē tsò Guá it-tshè só͘ huan-hù lí ê tāi-tsì.
English: I, behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the heart of all who are wise-hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded you:

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Iosiúah kóng, Guá kin-á-ji̍t kā Aigi̍p ê lîng-jio̍k î-suá lī-khui lín. Tsiū án-ne, hit só͘-tsāi miâ kiò-tsò Gilgal, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: Yahweh said to Joshua, This day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, to this day.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá só͘ ta̍h ê tē khui-khuah; guá ê kha m̄-bat ta̍h tshū khì.
English: You have enlarged my steps under me, My feet have not slipped.

Tailo: Lâng pò guá ê lāu-pē kóng, Lí ū seⁿ tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ! Hō͘ i tsin huann-hí ê; guān hit-ê lâng siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed be the man who brought news to my father, saying, A boy is born to you; making him very glad.

Tailo: He-lo̍t tuì Tulô kah Sitòng ê lâng hui-siông siū-khì, só͘-í, hiah-ê lâng liân-ha̍p phài lâng khì kìⁿ He-lo̍t. In pài-thok ông-kiong ê tsóng-kuán Bu-la-su-toh khì kiû hô, in-uī in ê niû-si̍t tio̍h tuì ông kuán-hat ê tē-khu lâi kiòng-ìng.
English: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus, the king's chamberlain, their friend, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king's country for food.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h gia̍h kuái-á, lí kah lí ê a-hiaⁿ Alông tsio-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng; tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, lín bīng-līng tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut tsuí, lí uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn hō͘ tsuí tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut-.lâi, hō͘ huē-tsiòng kah in ê tsing-seⁿ ū tsuí thang lim.
English: Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak you to the rock before their eyes, that it give forth its water; and you shall bring forth to them water out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink.

Tailo: In tuì Mítiân khí-.lâi, lâi-kàu Palân; tuì Palân tshuā kuí-nā-ê lâng kah in khì Aigi̍p, lâi-kàu Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu hia. Huâ-láu tsiū hō͘ in tshù tuà, phuè tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê bí-niûⁿ hō͘ in, koh hō͘ in tshân-tē.
English: They arose out of Midian, and came to Paran; and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, and appointed him food, and gave him land.

Tailo: Seⁿ-tio̍h gōng kiáⁿ sī pē-bú ê iu-būn; gōng lâng ê lāu-pē lóng bô thang huann-hí.
English: He who becomes the father of a fool grieves. The father of a fool has no joy.

Tailo: In ná kiâⁿ ná teh tâm-lūn só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì.
English: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.

Tailo: In-uī lín tsá-tsîng bô án-ne tsò, lán ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú í-king kā lán tsik-hua̍t, in-uī lán bô tsiàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē tsáu-tshuē I.
English: For because you didn't carry it at the first, Yahweh our God made a breach on us, because we didn't seek him according to the ordinance.

Tailo: Tī tiān tsîng tsō nn̄g ki tâng-thiāu, kuân saⁿ-tsa̍p gō͘ tiú, muí ki thiāu ê thiāu-táu ê kuân gō͘ tiú.
English: Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty-five cubits high, and the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.

Tailo: Samuel kā tû-pâng kóng, Guá só͘ kau-tài lí tio̍h siu-.leh hit hūn, taⁿ thang phâng tshut-.lâi.
English: Samuel said to the cook, Bring the portion which I gave you, of which I said to you, Set it by you.

Tailo: Lāu sian-ti tsiū kā i kóng, Guá mā sī sian-ti, kah lí sio-siâng. Ū thiⁿ-sài īng Siōngtsú ê uē kā guá kóng, ' Lí tshuā i kah lí tńg-khì lí ê tshù, hō͘ i tsia̍h piáⁿ lim tsuí. ' Tse lóng sī lāu sian-ti teh kā i phiàn.
English: He said to him, I also am a prophet as you are; and an angel spoke to me by the word of Yahweh, saying, Bring him back with you into your house, that he may eat bread and drink water. But he lied to him.

Tailo: M̄-koh, ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì, guá tio̍h kā lí tsik-pī, to̍h-sī lí í-king khì-sak tong-tsho͘ tuì guá ê thiàⁿ.
English: But I have this against you, that you left your first love.

Tailo: Guá ê tâng-kang Má-khó, A-lí-su-ta̍t-khó͘, Tê-má kah Lū-ka, mā beh kā lí tshíng-an.
English: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

Tailo: Pó-tsō ê sì-kho͘-uî ū jī-tsa̍p sì ê tsō-uī, tíng-bīn tsē jī-tsa̍p sì ê tiúⁿ-ló, sin tshīng pe̍h saⁿ, thâu tì kim-sik ê bián-liû.
English: Around the throne were twenty-four thrones. On the thrones were twenty-four elders sitting, dressed in white garments, with crowns of gold on their heads.

Tailo: Siōngtsú īng tì-huī kiàn-li̍p tē, īng tshong-bîng an-tì thiⁿ.
English: By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth. By understanding, he established the heavens.

Tailo: In tsiū khì kiò kò͘ siâⁿ mn̂g ê lâi, kā in kóng, Guán kàu Alâm lâng ê iâⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h bô tsi̍t-ê lâng tī hia, mā bô lâng ê siaⁿ-sueh, tsí ū bé pa̍k-.leh, lî pa̍k-.leh, pò͘-pênn lóng tsiàu kū.
English: So they came and called to the porter of the city; and they told them, saying, We came to the camp of the Syrians, and, behold, there was no man there, neither voice of man, but the horses tied, and the donkeys tied, and the tents as they were.

Tailo: Thian-kok tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê phû-tô hn̂g ê tsú-lâng thàu-tsá tshut-khì tshiàⁿ-kang lâng ji̍p-khì i ê hn̂g tsò-kang.
English: For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.

Tailo: In tsiū kî-tó, kóng, Tsú ah, Lí tsai ta̍k lâng ê sim, kiû Lí tsí-sī guán, tsit nn̄g-ê lâng tiong-kan tó tsi̍t-ê sī Lí kíng-suán,
English: They prayed, and said, You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen

Tailo: Guá kā in hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t pang, kā in sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t kok ê sî, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: They shall know that I am Yahweh, when I shall disperse them among the nations, and scatter them through the countries.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, tio̍h tsīn-sim lâi tsò, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú, m̄-sī teh ho̍k-sāi lâng.
English: And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men,

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tui-liām siōng kó͘-tsá ê tāi-tsì. In-uī guá sī Siōngtè, í-guā bô pa̍t-ê; guá sī Siōngtè, mā bô pa̍t-ê kah guá ē pí-.tit.
English: Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me;

Tailo: In tsiàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē, īng hué piak Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê iûⁿ-á. Hiah-ê tsè-mi̍h īng tiánn, īng ue, īng puah lâi tsú liáu-āu, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tuà-khì hō͘ tsìng lâng.
English: They roasted the Passover with fire according to the ordinance: and the holy offerings boiled they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and carried them quickly to all the children of the people.

Tailo: Asah thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē kah sian-ti O͘tiat ê ī-giân liáu-āu, tsiū tsòng-táⁿ khí-.lâi, tī Iôtah Biāniámín tsuân tē kah i só͘ tsing-ho̍k Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē hiah-ê siâⁿ, kā só͘-ū khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h tû-.khì, koh tī Siōngtsú mn̂g-lông tsîng tiông-sin khí Siōngtsú ê tuâⁿ.
English: When Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominations out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from the hill country of Ephraim; and he renewed the altar of Yahweh, that was before the porch of Yahweh.

Tailo: Io-tsa-tak ê kiáⁿ E-siu-ah kah i ê hiann-tī hiah-ê tsè-si, í-ki̍p Sa-la-thi-el ê kiáⁿ Tso-lô-ba-bel kah i ê hiann-tī, lóng khí-lâi khí Isulael Siōngtè ê tuâⁿ, thang hiàn sio-tsè tī hit tíng-bīn, tsiàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se tī lu̍t-huat ê tsheh só͘ kì-tsài ê.
English: Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brothers the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brothers, and built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.

Tailo: Abulahàm sī tang-sî-tsūn hō͘ Siōngtè khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng? Sī siū kat-lé í-tsîng á-.sī í-āu? Sī siū kat-lé í-tsîng, m̄-sī í-āu.
English: How then was it counted? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn uī-tio̍h Biāniámín lâng tsiū hō͘-hué, in-uī Siōngtsú hō͘ Isulael tsi-tso̍k khih tsi̍t kak.
English: The people grieved for Benjamin, because that Yahweh had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.

Tailo: Tû-kàⁿ-tseh, mā kiò-tsò Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, teh beh kàu.
English: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê sî, Etóm lâng kóng, Kā i thiah-huí! Kā i thiah-huí! Ti̍t-ti̍t thiah kàu tē-ki! Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí ē kì-tit hit ji̍t!
English: Remember, Yahweh, against the children of Edom, The day of Jerusalem; Who said, Raze it! Raze it even to its foundation!

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsit-ê tsíng-tsí tìng-kin bô tshim, ua̍h bē kú, tsi̍t ē tú-tio̍h huān-lān pik-hāi, tsiū suî-sî pàng-sak.
English: yet he has no root in himself, but endures for a while. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng, Thiⁿ-ē tsiah-ê tsuí tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p kàu tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi, ta tē tio̍h tshut-hiān. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: God said, Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear, and it was so.

Tailo: Lí ē tit-tio̍h sù-hok iâⁿ-kuè bān-bîn, lín tiong-kan ê lâm-lí bô kah tsi̍t-ê bē seⁿ-thuàⁿ, lín tiong-kan ê tsing-seⁿ bô kah tsi̍t tsiah bē seⁿ-thuàⁿ.
English: You shall be blessed above all peoples: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your livestock.

Tailo: Tabi̍t lâi-kàu Tsik-lak ê sî, tuì só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h ê tiong-kan the̍h kuá khí-.lâi, kià khì sàng hō͘ i ê pîng-iú Iôtah ê tiúⁿ-ló, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê sī tuì Siōngtsú ê tuì-ti̍k tshiúⁿ-.lâi ê, sàng hō͘ lín tsò lé-mi̍h.
English: When David came to Ziklag, he sent of the spoil to the elders of Judah, even to his friends, saying, Behold, a present for you of the spoil of the enemies of Yahweh:

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng tsū-tsi̍p, tsat iâⁿ tī Siu-ném; Sàulô tsū-tsi̍p Isulael jîn-bîn, tsat iâⁿ tī Gil-buah.
English: The Philistines gathered themselves together, and came and encamped in Shunem: and Saul gathered all Israel together, and they encamped in Gilboa.

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê tsō ū sì-ê tâng-lûn kah tâng ê ti̍k-sim; phûn ê sì-kha kok ū kè, kè tsù tī phûn ê ē-bīn, ta̍k-ê kè ê piⁿ-á ū hue-khuân ê tshiu.
English: Every base had four brazen wheels, and axles of brass; and the four feet of it had supports: beneath the basin were the supports molten, with wreaths at the side of each.

Tailo: Lí í-āu ē koh hing-khí tsi̍t-ê kok, i put-jû lí ê kok, jiân-āu koh ū tē-sann kok, to̍h-sī tâng ê, beh lâi tsiáng-kuán thian-hā.
English: After you shall arise another kingdom inferior to you; and another third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all the earth.

Tailo: Guá kah lí tuà tsit jī-tsa̍p nî, lí ê mî-iûⁿ-bó kah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-bó m̄-bat ū làu-the, lí iûⁿ-kûn tiong ê iûⁿ-káng, guá m̄-bat tsia̍h.
English: These twenty years I have been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not cast their young, and I haven't eaten the rams of your flocks.

Tailo: Tsiū thâi hit tsiah gû-káng-á, Mô͘se the̍h hueh, īng tsíng-thâu-á buah tī tuâⁿ tíng sì-kho͘-uî hiah-ê kak, hō͘ tuâⁿ tshing-khì, koh kā hueh tò tī tuâⁿ-kha hia, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, kā i sio̍k-tsuē.
English: He killed it; and Moses took the blood, and put it on the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured out the blood at the base of the altar, and sanctified it, to make atonement for it.

Tailo: Hannah kî-tó kóng, Guá ê sim in-uī Siōngtsú lâi khuài-lo̍k, guá ê kak in-uī Siōngtsú lâi gia̍h kuân. Guá ǹg tuì-ti̍k káⁿ kóng tuā-uē, in-uī guá uī-tio̍h Lí ê tsín-kiù lâi huann-hí.
English: Hannah prayed, and said: My heart exults in Yahweh; My horn is exalted in Yahweh; My mouth is enlarged over my enemies; Because I rejoice in your salvation.

Tailo: （Hit-ê tē mā sǹg-tsò sī Le-hua-im lâng ê tē, tsá-tsîng Le-hua-im lâng tuà tī hia, Ammóng lâng tshing in tsò Sàn-sòng-bîng.
English: (That also is accounted a land of Rephaim: Rephaim lived therein before; but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h kín-sīn tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ lâi thiaⁿ; in-uī kiàn-nā ū ê lâng beh hō͘ i koh khah tsē; bô ê lâng liân i ka-kī lia̍h-tsò ū ê, mā beh kā i tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn't have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.

Tailo: Hit king tshù hong ba̍t ê sî-kan, lâng nā ji̍p-khì tsiū bô tshing-khì, kàu ê-hng.
English: Moreover he who goes into the house while it is shut up shall be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: tī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē, Ke-bal ê hô piⁿ, Siōngtsú ê uē thiau-tî lîm-kàu Bu-tsih ê kiáⁿ — tsè-si I-tse-kel; tī hia Siōngtsú ê tshiú hē tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: the word of Yahweh came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of Yahweh was there on him.

Tailo: Hông-hun ê sî, ū lâng tshuā tsin tsē hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng lâi tshuē Iésu. I īng tsi̍t kù uē kuáⁿ-tshut hiah-ê siâ-sîn, koh i hó só͘-ū ê pēnn-lâng.
English: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick;

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Tsú teh su-iàu.
English: They said, The Lord needs it.

Tailo: Tuā-kiáⁿ tsin siū-khì, m̄ ji̍p-.khì; lāu-pē tshut-lâi kā i khó͘-khǹg.
English: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

Tailo: Koh tī sì-kho͘-uî khiā tiâⁿ-uî, kuà tiâⁿ-mn̂g ê mn̂g-lî.
English: You shall set up the court around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.

Tailo: I tsiū kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Tsit-ê suaⁿ-kok lín tio̍h ta̍k só͘-tsāi khui kau,
English: He said, Thus says Yahweh, Make this valley full of trenches.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tsiū khì, tī Te-ka-po͘-lī suan-iông Iésu tuì i só͘ tsò ê tuā tāi-tsì. Tsìng lâng lóng hui-siông tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ia-lô-ba-am tuì Êlúsalèm tshut-.lâi, Sī-lô lâng sian-ti Ahiiah tī lō͘-.ni̍h tú-tio̍h i; hit sî i ū tshīng tsi̍t-niá sin saⁿ. In nn̄g lâng tī tshân-.ni̍h, í-guā bô pa̍t lâng.
English: It happened at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, In-uī Mô͘ap kah Seil ū teh kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Iôtah ke kah tsìng kok bô siáⁿ-mi̍h bô kāng',
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because Moab and Seir say, Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations;

Tailo: Nátap kah Amí-huh tī Si-nái ê khòng-iá, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, hiàn pa̍t tsióng hué-tsè ê sî, tsiū sí tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, in mā bô kiáⁿ-jî. Êlīatsal kah Ithamal tī in lāu-pē Alông ê bīn-tsîng, tam-tng tsè-si ê tsit-hūn.
English: Nadab and Abihu died before Yahweh, when they offered strange fire before Yahweh, in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. Eleazar and Ithamar ministered in the priest's office in the presence of Aaron their father.

Tailo: Tsí-ū sìn-khò Siōngtsú, bô tshap hiah-ê kiau-ngō͘ kah phian-hiòng hi-ké ê lâng, tsit khuán lâng ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust, And doesn't respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

Tailo: Bô kuí ji̍t āu, tsha-put-to ū tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p-ê sìn-tô͘ teh tsū-tsi̍p ê sî, Piattò͘ khiā khí-lâi kóng,
English: In these days, Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,

Tailo: Iésu lī-khui hia, tńg-khì I ê kò͘-hiong, bûn-tô͘ mā tuè I khì.
English: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò, kàu hông sî-khì kuán-ke ê tsit liáu-āu, hit sî lâng tsiah ē tsiap-la̍p guá ji̍p-khì in tshù. '
English: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.'

Tailo: Án-ne, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò? Guá beh īng sim-sîn kî-tó; mā beh īng lí-tì kî-tó. Guá beh īng sim-sîn gîm-si, mā beh īng lí-tì gîm-si.
English: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-sì nî āu, guá kah Ba-ná-ba koh tsiūⁿ Êlúsalèm, mā tshuā Tî-to tsò-hué khì.
English: Then after a period of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.

Tailo: koh tio̍h siá tī lí ê tshù ê mn̂g-khing, í-ki̍p lí ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ.
English: You shall write them on the door posts of your house, and on your gates.

Tailo: Siā tsìnn ê lâng kā i tuā siong-hāi, īng tsìnn kā i siā, kā i pik-hāi.
English: The archers have sorely grieved him, Shot at him, and persecute him:

Tailo: Guá tsiū kīn-uá i, lâi kā i thâi-sí, in-uī guá tsai i tó lo̍h-khì liáu-āu, it-tīng bē ua̍h, guá tsiū the̍h i thâu-khak-.ni̍h ê bián-liû kah i ê tshiú-khuân, tuà kàu guá ê tsú tsia.
English: So I stood beside him, and killed him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was on his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them here to my lord.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit o-ló I só͘ kiâⁿ ê tsò tuā, to̍h-sī lâng só͘ tshiùⁿ kua o-ló ê.
English: Remember that you magnify his work, Whereof men have sung.

Tailo: I suî-sî tī tsiah-ê huē-tn̂g suan-iông Iésu, kóng, I sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ.
English: Immediately in the synagogues he proclaimed the Christ, that he is the Son of God.

Tailo: In-uī tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ kah seh tuì thiⁿ kàng-lo̍h, mā bô koh tò tńg-.khì; in tsu-jūn thó͘-tē, hō͘ tē-tsiūⁿ puh-gê kiat-si̍t, hō͘ iā tsíng ê ū tsíng-tsí, hō͘ tsia̍h ê ū bí-niûⁿ.
English: For as the rain comes down and the snow from the sky, and doesn't return there, but waters the earth, and makes it bring forth and bud, and gives seed to the sower and bread to the eater;

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, tī thinn-tíng mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, ē uī-tio̍h tsuē-jîn tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng hué-kái lâi huann-hí, pí uī-tio̍h ū káu-tsa̍p-káu ê m̄-bián hué-kái ê gī lâng koh khah huann-hí.
English: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.

Tailo: Lí ê sin-tsâi ná tshin-tshiūnn tsó tshiū, lí ê ling ná tshin-tshiūnn kui pha ê kué-tsí.
English: This, your stature, is like a palm tree, Your breasts like its fruit.

Tailo: （Peh kiā-á ê si, Tabi̍t tsò ê. ）Lí khuàⁿ, hiann-tī hô-hó tsò-hué tuà, sī hô-tíng ê hó, hô-tíng ê an-lo̍k!
English: See how good and how pleasant it is For brothers to live together in unity!

Tailo: Guān Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

Tailo: Lí īng phuê kah bah hō͘ guá tshīng, koh īng kut kah kin hō͘ guá liân-kiat.
English: You have clothed me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews.

Tailo: mā bô khí tshù lâi hō͘ ka-kī tuà, mā bô ū phû-tô hn̂g, bô ū tshân-hn̂g, bô ū tsíng-tsí.
English: nor to build houses for us to dwell in; neither have we vineyard, nor field, nor seed:

Tailo: Guá sī Bethel ê Siōngtè, lí tī hia bat īng iû buah thiāu, tuì Guá hē guān. Taⁿ lí tio̍h khí-.lâi, lī-khui tsit-ê só͘-tsāi, tńg-khì lí ê pún-tē. '
English: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise, get out from this land, and return to the land of your birth.

Tailo: Isulael ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Guá kám bô kā lí kóng? Tsit-ê lâng só͘ beh ī-giân guá ê, bô kóng hó uē, tsí ū tsai-hō niā-niā.
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Didn't I tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?

Tailo: Tsí-ū Ammóng lâng ê tē, Iá-bo̍k hô piⁿ ê tē kah suaⁿ-tē tsiah-ê siâⁿ, kah Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè só͘ kìm-tsí lán khì ê tē, lí lóng bô uá-kīn i.
English: only to the land of the children of Ammon you didn't come near; all the side of the river Jabbok, and the cities of the hill country, and wherever Yahweh our God forbade us.

Tailo: Lí kám sī thâu tsi̍t-ê tshut-sì ê lâng? Á-sī pí tsiah-ê suaⁿ khah tāi-sing siū tsō?
English: Are you the first man who was born? Or were you brought forth before the hills?

Tailo: In ē bīng-līng kóng, Lín tio̍h tsún-pī kau-tsiàn kong siâⁿ; khí-.lâi! Lán tio̍h thàn tiong-tàu ê sî tsiūⁿ-.khì. Āu-lâi, in koh kóng, Tshám ah! Ji̍t í-king tshiâ sai, beh àm ê iánn í-king thua tn̂g.
English: Prepare you war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe to us! for the day declines, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.

Tailo: Páulô tuà tī ka-kī suè ê tshù nn̄g nî ê sî-kan, lâi hóng-būn ê lâng, i lóng kā in tsiap-thāi.
English: Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí ē tuī lo̍h-khì im-kan, kàu tī tshim kheⁿ ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit.

Tailo: I kóng: Guá beh kā Ka-nân tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí, tsò lí sán-gia̍p ê hūn-gia̍h.
English: Saying, To you I will give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance;

Tailo: Guá mā beh lâu khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah ê jîn-bîn tī lí ê tiong-kan, in ē uá-khò Siōngtsú ê miâ.
English: But I will leave in the midst of you an afflicted and poor people, and they will take refuge in the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h tī sìng-tiān ū lâng teh buē gû, iûⁿ, hún-tsiáu, mā ū lâng tsē tī hia teh uāⁿ tsîⁿ.
English: He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting.

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ koh lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm. Iésu tī tiān lāi teh kiâⁿ ê sî, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ, king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tiúⁿ-ló lâi tshuē Iésu,
English: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,

Tailo: E-hú hiàn sio-tsè liáu-āu, tsiū kā hō͘-uē-ping kah hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ kóng, Lín ji̍p-khì kā in thâi, m̄-thang iông-ín tsi̍t-ê lâng tshut-.lâi! In tsiū īng to kā in thâi, hō͘-uē-ping kah kun-tiúⁿ hiat sin-si tshut-.khì, tsiū khì-kàu Baal biō ê siâⁿ.
English: It happened, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in, and kill them; let none come forth. They struck them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast them out, and went to the city of the house of Baal.

Tailo: In ē tsai-iáⁿ Guá sī Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè, sī tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p tē, thang hō͘ Guá tiàm tī in tiong-kan. Guá sī Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè.
English: They shall know that I am Yahweh their God, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am Yahweh their God.

Tailo: Melalih kiáⁿ-sun tsiah-ê ke só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu, in ê tsong-tso̍k,
English: Those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, by their families, by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: Nā hué sio tshì-phè, suà sio-.tio̍h tiū-tui á-.sī iáu-buē kuah ê tiū-á, á-.sī tshân-hn̂g, khí hué ê lâng tsiū it-tīng tio̍h puê.
English: If fire breaks out, and catches in thorns so that the shocks of grain, or the standing grain, or the field are consumed; he who kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

Tailo: Koh ū hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê mi̍h, gû-káng la̍k pah tsiah, mî-iûⁿ saⁿ tshing tsiah.
English: The consecrated things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.

Tailo: I bô tsàn-sîng kî-tha gī-uân ê kè-bô͘ kah hîng-tōng. I sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê siâⁿ-tshī A-li-má-tha-iah ê lâng, pîng-sî ū teh kî-thāi Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê lâi-lîm.
English: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for the Kingdom of God:

Tailo: Gín-á tsiām-tsiām tuā-hàn, tsiū tn̄g ling. Ísak tn̄g ling ê ji̍t, Abulahàm pâi-siat tuā iàn-si̍k.
English: The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tuī beh tshut-huat ê sî, Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ kā sìng-só͘ kah sìng-só͘ só͘-ū ê khì-kū khàm liáu-āu, jiân-āu Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun tio̍h lâi kng. Tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang bong sìng ê mi̍h, bián-tit in sí; huē-bō͘ lāi tsiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng sī Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun só͘ tio̍h kng ê.
English: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary, and all the furniture of the sanctuary, as the camp moves forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to carry it: but they shall not touch the sanctuary, lest they die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Eliiah ìn pâi-tiúⁿ kóng, Guá nā-sī Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, guān hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, sio lí kah lí hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng! Tsiū ū hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-lâi sio i kah i hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng.
English: Elijah answered to the captain of fifty, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from the sky, and consume you and your fifty. Fire came down from the sky, and consumed him and his fifty.

Tailo: Tī i hē guān ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng hiah-ê ji̍t, m̄-thang hō͘ thì thâu to kàu i ê thâu-khak; kàu i ka-kī hun-pia̍t kui hō͘ Siōngtsú ê ji̍t muá, i tio̍h tsò sìng, tshut-tsāi i ê thâu-mn̂g huat tn̂g.
English: All the days of his vow of separation there shall no razor come on his head, until the days are fulfilled, in which he separates himself to Yahweh. He shall be holy. He shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long.

Tailo: Sîn-lîng thîng-.leh, tsóng-.sī, guá khuànn bē bîng i ê hîng-tsōng; ū siōng tī guá ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tsīng tsuh-tsuh, guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ, kóng:
English: It stood still, but I couldn't discern the appearance of it; A form was before my eyes. Silence, then I heard a voice, saying,

Tailo: Tàn ê lâng tsò in kè-sio̍k kiânn lo̍h-.khì, Mika khuàⁿ-tio̍h in pí i khah kiông, tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin tńg-khì i ê tshù.
English: The children of Dan went their way: and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back to his house.

Tailo: Guán ê tiúⁿ-ló kah tuà tī guán hia ê jîn-bîn tsiū kā guán kóng, ' Lín tshiú tio̍h tuà lō͘-.ni̍h īng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h khì kā in gîng-tsiap, tuì in kóng, guán sī lí ê lô͘-po̍k, taⁿ kiû lí kah guán li̍p-iok. '
English: Our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, Take provision in your hand for the journey, and go to meet them, and tell them, We are your servants: and now make you a covenant with us.

Tailo: Iésu kah sù-tô͘ tsò-hué ê sî, kā in huan-hù kóng, M̄-thang lī-khui Êlúsalèm, tsiàu guá tsîng kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h thìng-hāu Thiⁿ-pē ê ìng-ín.
English: Being assembled together with them, he charged them, Don't depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k ē ho̍k-sāi I, mā ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê bīn, I ê miâ ē siá tī in ê thâu-hia̍h.
English: They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.

Tailo: Iâm tsin ū lō͘-īng; iâm nā sit-bī, beh án-tsuáⁿ huê-ho̍k i ê kiâm-bī?
English: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?

Tailo: Mô͘se án-ne tuì Isulael lâng kóng, tsóng-.sī, in uī-tio̍h sim-lāi iu-būn, mā tsò khó͘-kang, suah m̄-khíng thiaⁿ Mô͘se.
English: Moses spoke so to the children of Israel, but they didn't listen to Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.

Tailo: Kuáⁿ-hū khì kā Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Elísiah kóng, Lí khì bē iû lâi hîng-tsè, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ thang tō͘ sing-ua̍h.
English: Then she came and told the man of God. He said, Go, sell the oil, and pay your debt, and live you and your sons of the rest.

Tailo: Guán khò siang tshiú thua-buâ tō͘ ji̍t-tsí; guán hông mē, tian-tò kā in tsiok-hok; siū lâng pik-hāi, guán jím-nāi;
English: We toil, working with our own hands. When people curse us, we bless. Being persecuted, we endure.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah hué tsham tsò-hué ê po-lê-hái, mā ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiah-ê tik-sìng ê lâng, to̍h-sī hiah-ê thuat-lī bíng-siù kah i ê tsō-siōng, í-ki̍p īng sò͘-jī tāi-piáu in ê miâ ê lâng. In khiā tī po-lê-hái, ta̍k lâng ê tshiú lóng the̍h tsi̍t ki Siōngtè hō͘ in ê khiā-khîm.
English: I saw something like a sea of glass mixed with fire, and those who overcame the beast, his image, and the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having harps of God.

Tailo: Guá in-uī hiah-ê khì-sak Lí ê lu̍t-huat ê pháiⁿ lâng tuā siū-khì, tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h.
English: Indignation has taken hold on me, Because of the wicked who forsake your law.

Tailo: Io-ho-iá-tah tī pún-sin kah jîn-bîn, kah ông ê tiong-kan li̍p-iok, lóng beh tsò Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn.
English: Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, and all the people, and the king, that they should be Yahweh's people.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tī Siōngtè ê tsìng kàu-huē, lóng īng lín lâi tsò khua-kháu, in-uī lín siū pik-hāi kah jím-siū huān-lān ê sî, ū pó-tshî jím-nāi kah sìn-sim.
English: so that we ourselves boast about you in the assemblies of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which you endure.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h siàu-liām I só͘ tsò kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì kah I ê sîn-jiah, í-ki̍p I ê tshuì só͘ phuàⁿ-tuàn ê uē.
English: You seed of Abraham, his servant, You children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

Tailo: Kā it-tshè só͘ tshiúⁿ ê, só͘ lia̍h ê lâng kah tsing-seⁿ, lóng tuà-.lâi.
English: They took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of man and of animal.

Tailo: Guá koh kā ông kóng, Ông nā huann-hí, tshiánn īng tsiàu-su hō͘ guá tuà-khì kau hō͘ hô guā hiah-ê tsóng-tok, tsún guá king-kuè khì-kàu Iôtah;
English: Moreover I said to the king, If it please the king, let letters be given me to the governors beyond the River, that they may let me pass through until I come to Judah;

Tailo: Sàulô ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan, i ê kiáⁿ Mehuibosiat siū-tio̍h ông ê pó-sioh, in-uī Tabi̍t kah Sàulô ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan tsá-tsîng bat kí Siōngtsú ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of Yahweh's oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

Tailo: Ông koh tshe tsi̍t-ê khiâ bé ê khì, i lâi-kàu in hia, kóng, Ông án-ne kóng, sī pîng-an? E-hú kóng, Pîng-ána bô kah lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Lí ua̍t-lâi tuè guá ê āu-bīn!
English: Then he sent out a second on horseback, who came to them, and said, Thus says the king, Is it peace? Jehu answered, What have you to do with peace? turn you behind me.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, jîn-bîn thau-thau-á ji̍p siâⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn tī tīn-.ni̍h tô-tsáu kiàn-siàu ê jîn-bîn thau-thau-á ji̍p-.lâi.
English: The people got them by stealth that day into the city, as people who are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.

Tailo: I tuì thiⁿ ê tsit pîng tshut, se̍h kàu thinn ê hit pîng; ta̍k hāng mi̍h lóng tit-tio̍h i ê jia̍t-khì.
English: His going forth is from the end of the heavens, His circuit to its ends; There is nothing hidden from its heat.

Tailo: Taⁿ in khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín bô koh kah in kāng-khuán kuè hòng-tōng bô tsiat-tsè ê sing-ua̍h, in tsiū kám-kak kî-kuài, suah kā lín huí-pòng.
English: They think it is strange that you don't run with them into the same excess of riot, blaspheming:

Tailo: Piattò͘ ua̍t tńg-sin, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu só͘ thiàⁿ ê bûn-tô͘ tuè tī in ê āu-piah. I to̍h-sī tsîng tī buán-tshan ê sî, khò uá Iésu ê hing-khám kóng, Tsú ah, sī siáⁿ lâng beh tshut-bē Lí? ê hit-ê bûn-tô͘.
English: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus' breast at the supper and asked, Lord, who is going to betray You?

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū lī-khui Ga-lí-la-iah síng khì Ioltàn hô tuì-huāⁿ ê Iô-tá-iah tē.
English: It happened when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

Tailo: Mn̂g-kháu khuah tsa̍p tiú. Mn̂g ê siang pîng piⁿ, tsit pîng gō͘ tiú, hit pîng gō͘ tiú. I niû i ê tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The breadth of the entrance was ten cubits; and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length of it, forty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits.

Tailo: Tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng kang-tsok ê sî, guá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn Iô-tá-iah lâng, sī in-uī beh tit-tio̍h Iô-tá-iah lâng lâi sìn Tsú. Guá suî-jiân sī bô sio̍k lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng, uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ khah tsē siū lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng lâi sìn Tsú, guá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn siū lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng.
English: To the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain those who are under the law;

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kóng, Guá koh kah lín tsò-hué bô guā kú, tsiū beh tńg-khì tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī hia.
English: Then Jesus said, I will be with you a little while longer, then I go to him who sent me.

Tailo: tì-sú Guá thang hō͘ Isulael ê tsú-bîn sim-lāi ka-kī tsik-pī, in-uī in lóng uī-tio̍h in ê ngó͘-siōng lâi kah Guá so͘-uán. '
English: that I may take the house of Israel in their own heart, because they are all estranged from me through their idols.

Tailo: Guá beh tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, kiânn tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē.
English: I will walk before Yahweh in the land of the living.

Tailo: Tsè-si tuì jîn-bîn só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê hūn to̍h-sī tsiah-ê: kiàn-nā hiàn gû á-.sī iûⁿ tsò tsè ê, tio̍h kā tsîng-thuí kah nn̄g-ê tshuì-phué, í-ki̍p tō͘ hō͘ tsè-si.
English: This shall be the priests' due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give to the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.

Tailo: Guá kah guá só͘ tshuā ê tsìng lâng beh kīn-uá siâⁿ, in tshin-tshiūnn thâu tsi̍t pái tshut-lâi kong-kik guán, hit sî guán tsiū beh tī in ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: and I, and all the people who are with me, will approach to the city. It shall happen, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them;

Tailo: In tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huann-hí lâi huah, īng kó͘-tshue, īng sàu-kak lâi tuì Siōngtsú tsiù-tsuā.
English: They swore to Yahweh with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.

Tailo: M̄-thang pò-siû, mā m̄-thang bâi-uàn lí pún-kok ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī. Guá to̍h-sī Siōngtsú.
English: You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people; but you shall love your neighbor as yourself. I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h hó-tánn lâi tsiū-kīn Siōngtè un-tián ê pó-tsō, thang niá-siū liân-bín, mā thang tit-tio̍h un-tián, tsò lán ki̍p-sî ê pang-tsān.
English: Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need.

Tailo: In tuā-siaⁿ huah, Hō͘ I sí! Hō͘ I sí! Kā I tìng si̍p-jī-kè! Pí-la̍h-to kā in kóng, Lín ài guá kā lín ê ông tìng si̍p-jī-kè, sī-.bô? Tsiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ ìn kóng, Lô-má hông-tè í-guā, guán bô ông. Jiânāu, Pí-la̍h-to kā Iésu kau hō͘ in khì tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: They cried out, Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him! Pilate said to them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar!

Tailo: Lô͘-uí bô thô͘-muê, kám ē huat? Lô͘-tik bô tsuí, kám ē tuā tsâng?
English: Can the papyrus grow up without mire? Can the rushes grow without water?

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè hō͘ lín ke-thinn tsin tsē, lí khuàⁿ, lín kin-á-ji̍t tshin-tshiūnn thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ hiah tsē.
English: Yahweh your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are this day as the stars of the sky for multitude.

Tailo: Tsing-lūn ná lâi ná ki̍k-lia̍t, iâⁿ-tiúⁿ kiaⁿ Páulô khì hō͘ in thiah-tshuì, tsiū bīng-līng ping-á lo̍h-.khì, tuì in tiong-kan kā Páulô tshiúⁿ tshut-.lâi, kā i tshuā ji̍p-khì iâⁿ-pâng.
