English: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer, fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.

Tailo: Lín la̍k-ji̍t kan thang khioh, tē-tshit ji̍t sī An-hioh-ji̍t, hit ji̍t tsiū bô thang khioh.
English: Six days you shall gather it, but on the seventh day is the Sabbath. In it there shall be none.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k beh hō͘ sè-kan tsai-iáⁿ guá ū thiàⁿ Thiⁿ-pē, mā ū tsiàu Thiⁿ-pē ê bīng-līng khì tsò. Khí-.lâi, lán lâi-.khì!
English: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.

Tailo: Koh kā lu̍t-huat hē tī kuī lāi, īng kǹg tshng tī kuī-.ni̍h, kā si-un-só͘ hē tī kuī tíng.
English: He took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the poles on the ark, and put the mercy seat above on the ark.

Tailo: Siat-sú lín m̄-thiaⁿ guán ê uē lâi siū kat-lé, guán tsiū beh tuà guán ê sió-muē lâi-.khì.
English: But if you will not listen to us, to be circumcised, then we will take our sister, and we will be gone.

Tailo: Guá beh àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ phì-jū, guá beh tuâⁿ khîm lâi kái-bîng guá ê ò-pì.
English: I will incline my ear to a proverb. I will open my riddle on the harp.

Tailo: Babúlông pîng-sî sī Siōngtsú tshiú lāi ê kim pue, hō͘ tsuân tē ê lâng tsuì; lia̍t pang bat lim i ê tsiú, só͘-í lia̍t-pang khí-kông.
English: Babylon has been a golden cup in Yahweh's hand, who made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunk of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.

Tailo: In-uī i ê tsuē í-king luí-tsik tú thiⁿ, Siōngtè ē kì-tit i ê siâ ok-hîng uī.
English: for her sins have reached to the sky, and God has remembered her iniquities.

Tailo: Kong-gī ē tsò i ê io-tuà, sìn-si̍t ē tsò i ê sing-khu ê tuà.
English: Righteousness will be the belt of his waist, And faithfulness the belt of his waist.

Tailo: Lí ê nn̄g lia̍p ling tshin-tshiūnn tī pik-ha̍p hue tiong teh tsia̍h tsháu ê tsi̍t tuì lo̍k-á, to̍h-sī lo̍k-bú siang-seⁿ ê.
English: Your two breasts are like two fawns That are twins of a roe, Which feed among the lilies.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì guá kóng, Lí the̍h tsi̍t tè tuā pâi, īng lâng thong-hîng ê jī lâi siá, lūn-khí Ma-hel-sia-lal-ha-si-ba-tsuh（ Tsù, Hi-bú-lâi bûn, ì-sù sī Tshiúⁿ-kiap liâm-piⁿ ē kàu ）.
English: Yahweh said to me, Take a large tablet, and write on it with a man's pen, For Maher Shalal Hash Baz; '

Tailo: Iôséhuh huan-hù sū-hāu i ê i-sing, īng phang-liāu kuàn i ê lāu-pē, i-sing tsiū īng phang-liāu kuàn Isulael.
English: Joseph commanded his servants, the physicians, to embalm his father; and the physicians embalmed Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Lí tshun tshiú kí Aigi̍p tē, hō͘ tsháu-me̍h khí-lâi Aigi̍p tē, tsia̍h tē-.ni̍h it-tshè ê tshài-se, to̍h-sī pha̍uh phah bô liáu ê.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up on the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail has left.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn it-tshè ê pháiⁿ, to̍h-sī lī-khui Guá, ǹg pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng sio hiuⁿ; kuī-pài in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê, Guá beh kóng-khí Guá ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, and worshiped the works of their own hands.

Tailo: Guá ai-kiò kiû pang-tsān ê sî, I hō͘ guá ê kî-tó bē-tàng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Yes, when I cry, and call for help, he shuts out my prayer.

Tailo: Tshuē-tio̍h liáu-āu tsiū kā I kóng, Tsìng lâng lóng teh tshuē Lí.
English: and they found him, and told him, Everyone is looking for you.

Tailo: Guá lâng suî-jiân bô tī lín hia, sim khiok kah lín tsò-hué. Guá í-king hōng Tsú Iésu ê miâ, kā huān tsit khuán tsuē ê lâng phuàⁿ-tsuē;
English: For I most assuredly, as being absent in body but present in spirit, have already, as though I were present, judged him who has done this thing.

Tailo: In kā Alông kóng, ' Lí tio̍h kā guán tsō sîn-bîng lâi tsò thâu tshuā guán, in-uī tsit-ê tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p ê Mô͘se m̄-tsai tú-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì. ' (tsù, CAG 32:1)
English: saying to Aaron, Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has become of him.'

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí ê tō-lō͘ sîn-sìng; ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng tshin-tshiūnn Lí hiah uí-tāi?
English: Your way, God, is in the sanctuary. What god is great like God?

Tailo: Siōngtè tuì Nó͘ah kóng, Tse to̍h-sī Guá kah tē-tsiūⁿ it-tshè ū jio̍k-thé ê mi̍h só͘ li̍p ê iok ê kì-hō.
English: God said to Noah, This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth.

Tailo: M̄-thang hō͘ tsû-ài kah sìn-si̍t lī-khui lí; tio̍h pa̍k tī lí ê ām-kún, khik tī lí ê sim-pi.
English: Don't let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.

Tailo: hō͘ tsìng lâng lóng kui lí. Lí só͘ tshuē hit-ê lâng sī tshin-tshiūnn kûn-tsiòng tò tńg-.lâi, án-ne jîn-bîn tsiū lóng pîng-an.
English: and I will bring back all the people to you: the man whom you seek is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.

Tailo: Lia̍h siâⁿ lāi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, bô-lūn tuā-sè, bô thâi-sí kah puàⁿ-ê, kan-taⁿ kā in lia̍h-.khì.
English: and had taken captive the women and all who were therein, both small and great: they didn't kill any, but carried them off, and went their way.

Tailo: Bô-lūn sī tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng, Hi-la̍h lâng á-.sī Siōngtè ê kàu-huē, lín lóng m̄-thang tsiâⁿ-tsò in ê tsó͘-gāi.
English: Give no occasions for stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the assembly of God;

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kah Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng ǹg tsit só͘-tsāi kî-tó ê sî, guān Lí thiaⁿ in ê kî-kiû, guān Lí tuì thiⁿ, tuì Lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi lâi thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, Lí thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sî tsiū kā in sià-bián.
English: Listen you to the petitions of your servant, and of your people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place: yes, hear from your dwelling place, even from heaven; and when you hear, forgive.

Tailo: Mā bô tsiūⁿ Êlúsalèm khì kìⁿ hiah-ê pí guá khah tāi-sing tsò sù-tô͘ ê lâng; tsí ū suî-sî khì A-la-puh, jiân-āu koh tńg-lâi Ta-má-su-ko.
English: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia. Then I returned to Damascus.

Tailo: Ionáthan kā Tabi̍t kóng, Lí ê sim só͘ ì-ài ê, guá ē kā lí tsò.
English: Then said Jonathan to David, Whatever your soul desires, I will even do it for you.

Tailo: Siōngtè tī I ê kiong-tiān lāi, ka-kī hián-bîng tsò kuân-tuā.
English: God has shown himself in her citadels as a refuge.

Tailo: Īng kaⁿ-ná tshâ só͘ tsō ê nn̄g-ê mn̂g-sìⁿ, tíng-bīn ū khik ki-lō͘-ping, tsó tshiū kah hue-luí ê khuán-sit, lóng an kim; koh īng kim siuⁿ tī ki-lō͘-ping kah tsó tshiū ê tíng-bīn.
English: So he made two doors of olive wood; and he carved on them carvings of cherubim and palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold; and he spread the gold on the cherubim, and on the palm trees.

Tailo: I ē tī lia̍t pang tiong lâi sím-phuàⁿ, I ē hō͘ sin-si phiàn-muá ta̍k só͘-tsāi; I ē tī tsin tsē kok phah-phuà tuì-ti̍k ê thâu-khak.
English: He will judge among the nations. He will heap up dead bodies. He will crush the ruler of the whole earth.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ í-ki̍p saⁿ-khò͘, buah in ê iû kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, nn̄g tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t khing bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, lóng tuà-.lâi.
English: Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bull of the sin offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

Tailo: M̄-koh, tsa-bó͘ lâng tī kî-tó á-.sī thuân hok-im ê sî, nā bô tà thâu-kin to̍h-sī teh bú-jio̍k i ka-kī ê thâu, to̍h-sī i ê tiōng-hu, tsit khuán ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah thâu-mn̂g hō͘ lâng thì khí-.lâi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kāng-khuán.
English: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head. For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guán beh o-ló Siōngtsú, tuì tsit sî kàu íng-uán. Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú!
English: But we will bless Yah, From this time forth and forevermore. Praise Yah!

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hiàn tsiah-ê kah i ê kuàn-tiān, tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè í-guā, lín lóng tio̍h īng bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: Besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, you shall offer them (they shall be to you without blemish), and their drink offerings.

Tailo: I tī lâng ê bīn-tsîng tshiùⁿ kua kóng: Guá ū huān tsuē, tian-tò sī-hui, bô lī-ik guá.
English: He sings before men, and says, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, And it didn't profit me.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê bē kì-tit Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, tio̍h siūⁿ tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsiah bián tì-kàu guá kā lín thiah-tshuì, bô lâng thang kā lín tsín-kiù.
English: Now consider this, you who forget God, Lest I tear you into pieces, and there be none to deliver.

Tailo: Lâng nā huān-tio̍h ing-kai sí ê tsuē, siū pān tsuē sí, lí nā kā i tiàu tī tshâ-.ni̍h,
English: If a man have committed a sin worthy of death, and he be put to death, and you hang him on a tree;

Tailo: I án-ne kóng, Tē-sì tsiah siù ē tsò tē-tsiūⁿ ê tē-sì kok, i kah só͘-ū ê kok bô kāng, koh ē thun-kā tsuân tē, ē thún-ta̍h, kā i thiah-tshuì.
English: Thus he said, The fourth animal shall be a fourth kingdom on earth, which shall be diverse from all the kingdoms, and shall devour the whole earth, and shall tread it down, and break it in pieces.

Tailo: Lí ê lāu-pē nā khuànn guá bô tī-.leh, lí tsiū kóng, ' Tabi̍t pik-tshiat kiû guá tsún i tńg-khì i ê pún-siâⁿ Bia̍tléhèm, in-uī i tsuân ke beh tī hia hiàn nî-tsè. '
English: If your father miss me at all, then say, David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Bethlehem his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family.

Tailo: Tsú ah, Lí tiām-tiām teh khuàⁿ beh kàu guā kú? Kiû Lí kiù guá ê sîn-hûn thuat-lī in ê tsân-hāi! Kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī hiong-bíng ê sai-á-thûn!
English: Lord, how long will you look on? Rescue my soul from their destruction, My precious life from the lions.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tuì līng-guā tsi̍t-ê kak-tō͘ lâi khuànn, guá siá hō͘ lín ê kài-bīng sī sin ê; tuì Ki-tok kah lín lâi kóng lóng sī tsin-si̍t ê, in-uī o͘-àm teh beh kuè-.khì, tsin kng í-king teh tsiàu.
English: Again, I write a new commandment to you, which is true in him and in you; because the darkness is passing away, and the true light already shines.

Tailo: Tī sím-phuàⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, Ni-ne-beh lâng beh kah tsit sè-tāi ê lâng tsò-hué ua̍h khí-.lâi, kā tsit sè-tāi ê lâng tīng tsuē; in-uī in thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iôná ê thuân-tō lâi hué-kái; hô-hòng tī tsia ū pí Iôná khah uí-tāi-.ê.
English: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, in tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kìng-pài liáu-āu, tsiū tńg-khì La̍h-má, kàu i ê ke. Elkánah kah i ê bó͘ Hannah tâng-pâng, Siōngtsú siàu-liām Hannah,
English: They rose up in the morning early, and worshiped before Yahweh, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and Yahweh remembered her.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thiⁿ, lí ing-kai tshut huann-hí ê siann! Tē, lí ing-kai khuài-lo̍k! Tsìng suaⁿ ing-kai tshut siaⁿ tshiùⁿ kua! In-uī Siōngtsú ū an-uì I ê tsú-bîn, mā beh liân-bín I hiah-ê khùn-khó͘ ê.
English: Sing, heavens; and be joyful, earth; and break forth into singing, mountains: for Yahweh has comforted his people, and will have compassion on his afflicted.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā i kóng, Lí khì, lo̍h-.khì, lí tio̍h kah Alông khí-.lâi; to̍k-to̍k tsè-si kah jîn-bîn m̄-thang tsông kuè-kài lâi-kàu Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, khióng-kiaⁿ I hut-jiân tshut-lâi kā in phah.
English: Yahweh said to him, Go down and you shall bring Aaron up with you, but don't let the priests and the people break through to come up to Yahweh, lest he break forth on them.

Tailo: Hit sî, mā ū nn̄g-ê thó͘-huí kah Iésu tâng-tsê tìng si̍p-jī-kè, tsi̍t-ê tī tsiànn pîng, tsi̍t-ê tī tò pîng.
English: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.

Tailo: Nn̄g-ji̍t āu, Iésu lī-khui hia khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.

Tailo: Ná m̄ kā tsit-ê phang-iû the̍h-khì bē saⁿ-pah ê gîn-á, lâi tsín-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng?
English: Why wasn't this ointment sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?

Tailo: Lí kám ē iáu-koh tuì Guá ê jîn-bîn kiau-ngō͘, m̄-tsún in lī-khui?
English: as you still exalt yourself against my people, that you won't let them go.

Tailo: Guá tsiū kàu Thel-a-bí-buh, tiàm tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ siū lia̍h ê lâng hit uī, kàu in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi; tī in tiong-kan tsē tshit kang, tī hia tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel Aviv, that lived by the river Chebar, and to where they lived; and I sat there overwhelmed among them seven days.

Tailo: In-uī Iésu tsai-iáⁿ siáⁿ lâng beh kā I tshut-bē, só͘-í tsiah kóng, Lín bô ta̍k-ê tshing-khì.
English: For he knew him who would betray him, therefore he said, You are not all clean.

Tailo: Mô͘se lo̍h Si-nái suaⁿ ê sî; i ê tshiú the̍h nn̄g tè iok-pi, i lo̍h suaⁿ ê sî, i ê bīn in-uī Siōngtsú kah i kóng-uē, tsiū siā-tshut kng, Mô͘se ka-kī m̄-tsai.
English: It happened, when Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mountain, that Moses didn't know that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit khuán lâng m̄-tsai tī i hia ū im-hûn; i ê lâng-kheh tī im-hú tshim ê só͘-tsāi.
English: But he doesn't know that the dead are there, That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.

Tailo: Án-ne lo̍h-.khì, m̄-nā lán tsit khuán hâng-gia̍p ē phah-pháiⁿ miâ-siaⁿ, ū hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin ê guî-hiám, liân tuā lú-sîn A-té-mih ê biō mā ē hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin. Tsuân A-si-a síng kah thian-hā só͘ pài ê A-té-mih lú-sîn ē sit-khì i ê tsun-giâm!
English: Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing, and her majesty destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worships.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iésu pí Iô-há-neh tsio tio̍h khah tsē bûn-tô͘, mā kā khah tsē lâng sé-lé.
English: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú nā bô īng I pì-bi̍t ê ì-sù tsí-sī I ê lô͘-po̍k tsiah-ê sian-ti, in tsiū lóng bô só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: Surely the Lord Yahweh will do nothing, Unless he reveals his secret to his servants the prophets.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsin tsē pái kā in tsín-kiù, m̄-koh, in tī in ê kè-bô͘ tiong puē-gi̍k I; in-uī ka-kī ê tsuē-ok suah tì-kàu tuī-lo̍h.
English: Many times he delivered them, But they were rebellious in their counsel, And were brought low in their iniquity.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Êlīatsal ê kiáⁿ Hui-ne-hah kā in kuán-lí, Siōngtsú mā kah i tông-tsāi.
English: Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them in time past, and Yahweh was with him.

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê tsō ê khuán-sit sī án-ne, sì pîng lóng ū keh-tó͘, i ê keh-tó͘ tī sì-ê kak ê só͘-tsāi sio-tsiap.
English: The work of the bases was on this manner: they had panels; and there were panels between the ledges;

Tailo: to̍k-to̍k m̄-thang tsia̍h i ê hueh; tio̍h piàⁿ tī tē-.ni̍h kah piàⁿ tsuí sio-siâng.
English: Only you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground as water.

Tailo: Sàulô kóng, Guān Siōngtsú sù-hok hō͘ lín, in-uī lín khó-liân guá.
English: Saul said, Blessed be you of Yahweh; for you have had compassion on me.

Tailo: Tshong-bîng ê ìn kóng, ' Guán kiaⁿ iû bô kàu pun lín īng. Siōng hó lín ka-kī kho khì bé. '
English: But the wise answered, saying, What if there isn't enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.'

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn sai khui tshuì teh tuā-siaⁿ háu, beh kā guá thiah-li̍h thun-tsia̍h.
English: They open their mouths wide against me, Lions tearing prey and roaring.

Tailo: I bô tshut-tshiú hāi Isulael tsun-kuì ê lâng. In khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè, in mā tsia̍h mā lim.
English: He didn't lay his hand on the nobles of the children of Israel. They saw God, and ate and drank.

Tailo: Sim lāi o͘-pe̍h siūⁿ ê lâng sī Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià; tsò tāi-tsì uân-siān ê lâng sī I só͘ huann-hí.
English: Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to Yahweh, But those whose ways are blameless are his delight.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Tabi̍t ê sian-kiàn Ga̍t, kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying,

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê tsû-ài kah I tuì sè-kan lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê kî-sū, guān lâng-lâng lóng o-ló I.
English: Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness, For his wonderful works for the children of men!

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ pái liam-khau sī uī-tio̍h Tse-bú-lông lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: The third lot came up for the children of Zebulun according to their families; and the border of their inheritance was to Sarid;

Tailo: Kàu-uī liáu-āu tsiū tī Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē pûn sàu-kak, Isulael lâng tsiū tuè i tuì suaⁿ-tē lo̍h-.khì, Ehut kiânn tī thâu-tsîng,
English: It happened, when he had come, that he blew a trumpet in the hill country of Ephraim; and the children of Israel went down with him from the hill country, and he before them.

Tailo: Guá tuì Lí kiû-kiò, kiû Lí kiù guá! Guá beh tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī.
English: I have called to you. Save me! I will obey your statutes.

Tailo: Tuā-tsûn ê tsō-huat sī án-ne: Tn̂g saⁿ-pah tiú, khuah gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, kuân saⁿ-tsa̍p tiú.
English: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ark will be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

Tailo: Gû bô-lūn tak-tio̍h lâng ê kiáⁿ á-.sī tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tio̍h tsiàu tsit-ê lē lâi pān.
English: Whether it has gored a son or has gored a daughter, according to this judgment it shall be done to him.

Tailo: Lín tuì guá kóng uē, Siōngtsú thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín kóng-uē ê siann, Siōngtsú tuì guá kóng, ' Guá ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn kóng-uē ê siann, to̍h-sī in só͘ tuì lí kóng ê; in só͘ kóng ê uē lóng hó.
English: Yahweh heard the voice of your words, when you spoke to me; and Yahweh said to me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken to you: they have well said all that they have spoken.

Tailo: I nā ē kah guá sio-thâi, kā guá thâi-sí, guán tsiū beh tsò lín ê lô͘-lē; guá nā khah iâⁿ i, kā i thâi-sí, lín tsiū tio̍h tsò guán ê lô͘-lē, kā guán ho̍k-sāi.
English: If he be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall you be our servants, and serve us.

Tailo: Tsit-ê ǹg-bāng bē hō͘ lán sit-bōng, in-uī Siōngtè í-king thong-kuè I só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán ê Sìng Sîn, kā thiàⁿ kuàn-ak tī lán ê sim-lāi.
English: and hope doesn't disappoint us, because God's love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá ū tuì Lí kî-kiû; tī tsá-khí sî, guá ê kî-tó ē thàu kàu Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: But to you, Yahweh, I have cried. In the morning, my prayer comes before you.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá tuì lí só͘ kóng ê uē, lí m̄-thang puē-gi̍k, tshin-tshiūnn hit-ê puē-gi̍k ê ke, lí tio̍h khui tshuì, tsia̍h Guá só͘ hō͘ lí ê.
English: But you, son of man, hear what I tell you; don't be you rebellious like that rebellious house: open your mouth, and eat that which I give you.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tī khòng-iá ê sî, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng tī An-hioh-ji̍t khioh tshâ.
English: While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Siōngtè kám bat tuì tó tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài kóng, Tsē tī guá ê tsiànn pîng, it-ti̍t kàu guá hō͘ lí ê tuì-ti̍k khut-ho̍k tī lí ê kha-ē? (tsù, SPh 110:1)
English: But of which of the angels has he said at any time, Sit at my right hand, Until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet?

Tailo: In lâi beh kiâⁿ kiông-pō, in ê bīn hiông-hiông tsìn-tsîng, tsū-tsi̍p só͘ lia̍h ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn sua hiah tsē.
English: All of them come for violence. Their hordes face the desert. He gathers prisoners like sand.

Tailo: I lâi Êlúsalèm kìng-pài suah, beh tńg-.khì. I tsē tī tshia-.ni̍h teh tha̍k Isáiah sian-ti ê tsheh.
English: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.

Tailo: Nā-sī lín só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, Guá beh hō͘ in tī tuì-ti̍k ê tē, sim kiaⁿ kah hūn-.khì. Tshiū-hio̍h hō͘ hong tshue tín-tāng ê siann jiok in, in beh tô-siám, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh tô-siám to-kiàm, bô lâng jiok i, i mā ē pua̍h-tó.
English: As for those of you who are left, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies: and the sound of a driven leaf will put them to flight; and they shall flee, as one flees from the sword; and they will fall when no one pursues.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tsi̍t-sì-lâng bô lī-khui Nebat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī hō͘ Isulael huān tsuē ê.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn't depart all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Taⁿ Lí nā tshun Lí ê tshiú, kha̍p-tio̍h i lóng-tsóng só͘-ū ê, i it-tīng ē tng-bīn kā Lí khì-tsua̍t.
English: But put forth your hand now, and touch all that he has, and he will renounce you to your face.

Tailo: tuì Tabi̍t ke thiah-li̍h kok, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí. Tsóng-.sī, lí bô tshin-tshiūnn Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t tsun-siú Guá ê kài-bīng, tsi̍t-sim tuè Guá, tsuan-sim kiânn Guá khuàⁿ-tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì.
English: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it you; and yet you have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes,

Tailo: Tī Siōngtè hō͘ Isulael lâng hióng-hok ê sî, lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê tshù ê sue-pāi, tī lí ê tshù lāi ē íng-uán bô tsi̍t-ê lāu lâng.
English: You shall see the affliction of my habitation, in all the wealth which God shall give Israel; and there shall not be an old man in your house forever.

Tailo: Sa-má-lī-a ê ông ē bia̍t-bông, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí-bīn ê phue̍h phuà-bia̍t.
English: Samaria and her king float away, Like a twig on the water.

Tailo: Gô͘-khî ū nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, in tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kóng, Hō͘ guá, hō͘ guá! In ū sann hāng bē ti tsiok ê, nā liân m̄-bat kóng Kàu-gia̍h ê ū sì hāng:
English: The leach has two daughters: Give, give.' There are three things that are never satisfied; Four that don't say, Enough:'

Tailo: I tsiū khí-.lâi, khì Tsa-le-phat. Lâi-kàu siâⁿ mn̂g ê sî, tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê kuáⁿ-hū tī hit só͘-tsāi teh khioh tshâ. Eliiah tsiū kiò i kóng, Kiû lí īng khì-kū iúⁿ tām-po̍h-á tsuí lâi hō͘ guá lim.
English: So he arose and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks: and he called to her, and said, Please get me a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.

Tailo: In tio̍h kò͘-siú huē-bō͘ só͘-ū ê khì-kū, mā tio̍h siú só͘ huan-hù Isulael lâng ê, lâi pān-lí huē-bō͘ ê tāi-tsì.
English: They shall keep all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting, and the obligations of the children of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.

Tailo: Amátsiah thâi Etóm lâng tò tńg-.lâi, tsiū tuà Seil tso̍k hiah-ê sîn-bîng, li̍p i tsò ka-kī ê sîn-bîng, tī i ê bīn-tsîng kuī-pài, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ i.
English: Now it happened, after that Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense to them.

Tailo: Guá tsuan-sim tì-ì ài tsai tì-huī, ài tsai tian-kông kah gû-gōng, jiân-āu tsiū tsai tse mā sī teh lia̍h-hong.
English: I applied my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly. I perceived that this also was a chasing after wind.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí kám sī beh khì-sak guán? Siōngtè ah, Lí kám bô beh kah guán ê kun-ping tsò-hué tshut-tsing?
English: Haven't you, God, rejected us? You don't go out with our armies, God.

Tailo: Mika mn̄g i kóng, Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? I ìn kóng, Guá sī Iôtah Bia̍tléhèm ê Lēbī lâng, beh tshuē tsi̍t-ê thang tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Micah said to him, Whence come you? He said to him, I am a Levite of Bethlehem Judah, and I go to sojourn where I may find a place.

Tailo: E-siu-ah, Ba-nî, Katmiel, Si-ba-niah, Bun-nî, Se-le-biah, Ba-nî kah Ke-ná-nî, lóng khiā tī Lēbī lâng ê tâi tíng, tuā-siaⁿ kiû-kiò Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè.
English: Then stood up on the stairs of the Levites, Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried with a loud voice to Yahweh their God.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī Siōngtsú tī Mô͘ap tē, bīng-līng Mô͘se kah Isulael lâng li̍p-iok ê uē, sī I tī Ho-lep kah in só͘ li̍p ê iok í-guā ê.
English: These are the words of the covenant which Yahweh commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsiú-khut tī siâⁿ guā hō͘ lâng thún-ta̍h, tsiū ū hueh tuì tsiú-khut lâu tshut-.lâi, kuân tāi-iok nn̄g kong-tshioh, tn̂g tsha-put-to ū saⁿ-pah kong-lí.
English: The winepress was trodden outside of the city, and blood came out from the winepress, even to the bridles of the horses, as far as one thousand six hundred stadia.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Iosiúah kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué lâi-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò Gia̍t-se-má-neh ê só͘-tsāi. Iésu kā bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín tsē tuà tsia thìng-hāu, guá beh khì kî-tó.
English: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, Sit here, while I pray.

Tailo: Ông īng tuâⁿ-hiuⁿ tshâ uī Siōngtsú ê tiān kah ông-kiong tsò lân-kan, koh uī tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng tsò khîm kah sik. Tī Iôtah tē tsîng m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê.
English: The king made of the algum trees terraces for the house of Yahweh, and for the king's house, and harps and psalteries for the singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.

Tailo: Tsetikiah tuì I-é-lí-miah kóng, M̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai tsiah-ê uē, lí tsiū bē sí.
English: Then said Zedekiah to Jeremiah, Let no man know of these words, and you shall not die.

Tailo: Kiû Lí huat-tshut Lí ê kng kah tsin-si̍t lâi ín-tshuā guá, tshuā guá kàu Lí ê sìng-suaⁿ, kàu Lí ê huē-bō͘.
English: Oh, send out your light and your truth. Let them lead me. Let them bring me to your holy hill, To your tents.

Tailo: I tuì I ê tsú-bîn hián-bîng tuā kuân-lîng ê tsok-uî; kā lia̍t pang ê sán-gia̍p siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in.
English: He has shown his people the power of his works, In giving them the heritage of the nations.

Tailo: Phelsiah ông Ko-le-si tē-saⁿ nî, ū tāi-tsì hián-sī hō͘ kiò-tsò Bel-ti-sia-tsal ê Taniel. Tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī tsin-si̍t, sī kóng-tio̍h tuā kau-tsiàn; Taniel thong-ta̍t tsit-ê tāi-tsì, bîng-pi̍k tsit-ê ī-siōng.
English: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed to Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, even a great warfare: and he understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision.

Tailo: Siōngtè mā ē íng-uán kā lí huí-huāi; I beh lia̍h lí, tuì pò͘-pênn tiong kā lí khiú tshut-.lâi, tuì ua̍h-lâng ê tē kā lí pue̍h tshut-.lâi. [Sè-la̍h]
English: God will likewise destroy you forever. He will take you up, and pluck you out of your tent, And root you out of the land of the living. Selah.

Tailo: Guán tshim-huān Ke-le-thih ê lâm pîng, kah sio̍k Iôtah ê tē, kah Ka-le̍p tē ê lâm pîng, koh īng hué sio Tsik-lak.
English: We made a raid on the South of the Cherethites, and on that which belongs to Judah, and on the South of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire.

Tailo: Tsit-ê jîn-bîn só͘ kóng ê tông-bô͘, lín m̄-thang kóng; in só͘ kiaⁿ ê, lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ, mā m̄-thang lún.
English: Don't say, A conspiracy!' concerning all about which this people say, A conspiracy!' neither fear their threats, nor be terrorized.

Tailo: Siōngtè sī to̍k-it bē sí, tiàm tī lâng bē-tàng tsiap-kīn ê kng-bîng tiong; bô lâng bat khuàⁿ-kuè I, mā bô lâng ē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h I. Guān tsun-kuì kah íng-uán ê tsú-kuân kui tī I. A-men!
English: who alone has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light; whom no man has seen, nor can see: to whom be honor and eternal power. Amen.

Tailo: Guá mā beh hō͘ un-i̍k kah lâu hueh ê tāi-tsì ji̍p-khì Sitòng ê ke-lō͘, tio̍h-siong ê tó tī i ê tiong-kan, sì-kho͘-uî ū to-kiàm teh kong-kik i, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: For I will send pestilence into her, and blood into her streets; and the wounded shall fall in the midst of her, with the sword on her on every side; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Uàn-hūn Siōngtsú ê lâng ē lâi tâu-hâng I, tsóng-.sī, in ē kú-tn̂g siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: The haters of Yahweh would cringe before him, And their punishment would last forever.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Siōngtè ah, guá ai-siong ê sî, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê siann; kiû Lí pó-hō͘ guá ê sèⁿ-miā bián-kiaⁿ tuì-ti̍k.
English: Hear my voice, God, in my complaint. Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

Tailo: Hit-ê siann kóng liáu, tsiū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshun Iésu ka-kī tī hia. Bûn-tô͘ tiām-tiām, bô kā só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì kā lâng kóng.
English: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Tsiàu lu̍t-huat ê tsè-si só͘ tsò ê ho̍k-sāi, tsí-put-kò sī hóng-tsō thinn-tíng ê huē-bō͘ kah iáⁿ-siōng. Tú tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘se beh tsō huē-bō͘ ê sî, Siōngtè ū kā i tsí-sī, kóng, Lí tio̍h kín-sīn, it-tshè tio̍h tsiò tī suaⁿ tíng guá kā lí tsí-sī ê khuán-sit lâi tsō. (tsù, CAG 25: 40)
English: who serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, for he said, See, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.

Tailo: M̄-thiaⁿ tsit uī sian-ti ê lâng, lóng ē tuì tsú-bîn ê tiong-kan kā in siau-bia̍t.
English: It will be, that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.'

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí só͘ kóng tsit-ê tāi-tsì, Guá mā beh tsò; in-uī lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, koh Guá īng Guá ê miâ kíng-tiàu lí.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, I will do this thing also that you have spoken; for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name.

Tailo: Iésu m̄-tsún, kā i kóng, Tńg-khì lí ê tshù tshuē lí ê tshin-lâng, kā Tsú liân-bín lí, tuì lí só͘ tsò hiah tuā ê tāi-tsì lóng pò in tsai.
English: He didn't allow him, but said to him, Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.

Tailo: Isulael ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h uī ka-kī li̍p tsí-lō͘ pâi, khiā ín-lō͘ thiāu, lí tio̍h tsù-ì ǹg tuā lō͘, to̍h-sī lí só͘ khì ê guân-lō͘; lí tio̍h tò tńg-.lâi, tńg-lâi tī lí tsiah-ê siâⁿ.
English: Set up road signs, make guideposts; set your heart toward the highway, even the way by which you went: turn again, virgin of Israel, turn again to these your cities.

Tailo: Jîn-tsû ê lâng lī-ik ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā; tsân-jím ê lâng hāi ka-kī ê sing-khu.
English: The merciful man does good to his own soul, But he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.

Tailo: I siâⁿ lāi ê lâng, to̍h-sī tuà tī hit-ê siâⁿ ê tiúⁿ-ló kah kuì-tso̍k, tsiū tsiàu Iétsebel só͘ siá ê uē, to̍h-sī tsiàu i kià hō͘ in ê phue só͘ siá ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: The men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who lived in his city, did as Jezebel had sent to them, according as it was written in the letters which she had sent to them.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín nā tsai ū kì-tsài kóng, ' Guá ài liân-bín, bô ài tsè-mi̍h' (tsù, HSA 6:6) tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, tsiū bē kā bô tsuē ê lâng tīng tsuē.
English: But if you had known what this means, I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,' you would not have condemned the guiltless.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tuì khí-thâu kóng bîng tsit-ê tāi-tsì hō͘ guán tsai? Siáⁿ lâng tuì khí-thâu to̍h kóng bîng, thang hō͘ guán kóng: I bô tshò? M̄-koh, bô ū kóng bîng, bô ū pâi-lia̍t, bô lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín ê uē.
English: Who has declared it from the beginning, that we may know? And before, that we may say, He is right?' Surely, there is no one who declares. Surely, there is no one who shows. Surely, there is no one who hears your words.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t Iésu tī Bē-tha-niah, khì thái-ko pēnn-lâng Símòng ê tshù teh tsē-toh tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî,
English: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ huann-hí kah iáu-koh m̄-káⁿ siong-sìn, iáu-teh bo̍k-bîng kî-biāu ê sî, Iésu kā in kóng, Lín tsia ū siáⁿ-mi̍h thang tsia̍h bô?
English: While they still didn't believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, Do you have anything here to eat?

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tiong ê ta̍k tso̍k, lín tio̍h kā kuân-lîng îng-kng, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú!
English: Ascribe to Yahweh, you relatives of the peoples, Ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength;

Tailo: I kā in kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng, ' Lín khì huê-hok hit-ê tshe lín lâi kìnn Guá ê lâng, kóng,
English: She said to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: Tell you the man who sent you to me,

Tailo: Koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê sàn-tshiah ê kuáⁿ-hū kā nn̄g-ê tâng-tsîⁿ-á hiat lo̍h-.khì.
English: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh kā guá kóng, Lí koh the̍h gōng ê bo̍k-tsiá só͘ īng hiah-ê khì-kū,
English: Yahweh said to me, Take for yourself yet again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.

Tailo: I tshun tshiú kong-kik ka-kī ê tâng-phuāⁿ, uî-puē kah i só͘ li̍p ê iok.
English: He raises his hands against his friends. He has violated his covenant.

Tailo: Iosiúah tuì I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tshe lâng khì Bethel tang pîng, uá-kīn Bia̍t-a-biân ê Ai siânn, kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín khì thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē. In tsiū khì thàm-khuàⁿ Ai siânn.
English: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the east side of Bethel, and spoke to them, saying, Go up and spy out the land. The men went up and spied out Ai.

Tailo: Guá siūⁿ ài beh liáu-kái tsit-ê tō-lí, m̄-koh si̍t-tsāi ū khùn-lân;
English: When I tried to understand this, It was too painful for me;

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Tsit khuán kuí tio̍h khò kî-tó, tsiah ū huat-tō͘ kā i kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: He said to them, This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.

Tailo: Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal tsiū lâi kā i kong-kik, īng tâng-liān kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, beh kā i ah-lâi Babúlông.
English: Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Kàu hit ji̍t, Guá beh tsū-tsi̍p pái-kha-.ê, tsio-tsi̍p siū kuáⁿ-tshut ê kah Guá só͘ bat hō͘ i siū khó͘ ê.
English: In that day, says Yahweh, I will assemble that which is lame, And I will gather that which is driven away, And that which I have afflicted;

Tailo: Guá tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè pi-tsiān ê sing-ua̍h, mā tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè hù-jū ê sing-ua̍h. Bô-lūn sī pá á-.sī iau, sī hù-jū á-.sī khiàm-khueh, guá ê pì-kuat to̍h-sī ta̍k hāng ti tsiok.
English: I know how to be humbled, and I know also how to abound. In everything and in all things I have learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in need.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá ê sim-tn̂g kiáu-ká, uī-tio̍h hit-ê siann, guá ê tshuì-tûn sih-sih tsùn, kut-hâi hiú-nuā; guá tī guá ê só͘-tsāi phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah. Guá tsí ū tiām-tiām thìng-hāu tsai-lān ê ji̍t-tsí kàu, tshim-huān kíng lāi ê jîn-bîn tsiūⁿ-.lâi.
English: I heard, and my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place, Because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, For the coming up of the people who invade us.

Tailo: Kuè bô kuí ji̍t, Iésu tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Na-tsa-lia̍t lâi, tī Ioltàn hô tuì Iô-há-neh niá siū sé-lé.
English: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

Tailo: Kò͘-kaⁿ ê lâng tshénn khí-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kaⁿ-mn̂g khui-khui, siūⁿ kóng huān-lâng lóng tô-tsáu liáu-liáu, tsiū pue̍h to beh tsū-sat.
English: The jailer, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p-it nî, gue̍h （ Tsù, Guân-bûn làu-kau gue̍h-hūn ）ê tshe-it, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: It happened in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Guá beh pue khì hn̄g-hn̄g, hioh tī khòng-iá. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Behold, then I would wander far off. I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.

Tailo: I beh tsín-kiù lán thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k kah só͘-ū uàn-hūn lán ê lâng ê tshiú,
English: Salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us;

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Samuel hō͘ Isulael tsìng tsi-tso̍k kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiū tshú-tio̍h Biāniámín ê tsi-tso̍k;
English: So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was taken.

Tailo: Tuì-ti̍k ē siū huí-bia̍t, íng-uán hong-huì; Lí huí-huāi in ê siâⁿ, bô lâng koh-tsài ē kì-tit in.
English: The enemy is overtaken by endless ruin. The very memory of the cities which you have overthrown has perished.

Tailo: Ahap ná ē tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī khiam-pi, lí kám ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h? In-uī i ka-kī tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, só͘-í, Guá bô beh tī i ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t kàng tsit-ê tsai-hō, sī beh tī i ê kiáⁿ ê ji̍t, kàng tsit-ê tsai-hō tī i ê ke.
English: See you how Ahab humbles himself before me? because he humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days; but in his son's days will I bring the evil on his house.

Tailo: Sisiak ná ē siū kong-phuà? Thian-hā só͘ o-ló ê ná ē siū pà-tsiàm? Babúlông tī lia̍t kok tiong ná ē piàn-tsò pha-hng?
English: How is Sheshach taken! and the praise of the whole earth seized! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!

Tailo: Tī i ê tsiàⁿ tshiú, ū tsiam-pok khì Êlúsalèm ê tsìnn; siat iûⁿ thâu thuî, khui tshuì huah thâi, tuā-siaⁿ huah, siat iûⁿ thâu thuî lâi kong-kik siâⁿ mn̂g, khí thô͘-tui lâi tsō tâi.
English: In his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to build forts.

Tailo: Mal-tha tuì Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, Lí nā tī tsia, guán sió-tī tsiū bē sí.
English: Therefore Martha said to Jesus, Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn't have died.

Tailo: Tē-tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài tsi̍t ē pûn kó͘-tshue, thinn-tíng ū ki̍k tuā ê siann teh kóng, Sè-kan ê kok tsiâⁿ-tsò lán ê Siōngtè kah I ê Ki-tok ê kok-tō͘. I beh tsò ông kàu bān-sè-tāi bô tsīn.
English: The seventh angel sounded, and great voices in heaven followed, saying, The kingdom of the world has become the Kingdom of our Lord, and of his Christ. He will reign forever and ever!

Tailo: Sio̍k Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Dan, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go forth to war;

Tailo: Tsoh-tshân lâng kiàn-siàu, tà thâu-khak; sī in-uī bô lo̍h hō͘, thó͘-tē pit li̍h.
English: Because of the ground which is cracked, because no rain has been in the land, the plowmen are disappointed, they cover their heads.

Tailo: Hit nî tshit gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, lí tio̍h sì-kè pûn tuā-siaⁿ ê sàu-kak; tī sio̍k-tsuē ê ji̍t, tio̍h tsuân tē pûn sàu-kak.
English: Then you shall sound the loud trumpet on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the trumpet throughout all your land.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, khe tsuí ta-.khì, in-uī hit-ê só͘-tsāi bô hō͘-tsuí.
English: It happened after a while, that the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.

Tailo: Lí nā kiû tit-tio̍h bîng-lí, tuā-siaⁿ kiû tshong-bîng;
English: Yes, if you call out for discernment, And lift up your voice for understanding;

Tailo: In kíng sin ê sîn-bîng, kau-tsiàn tsiū kàu in ê siâⁿ mn̂g. Hit sî, Isulael sì bān lâng ê tiong-kan, Kám ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tîn-pâi kah tshiuⁿ?
English: They chose new gods; Then was war in the gates: Was there a shield or spear seen Among forty thousand in Israel?

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Gîtióng kóng, Guá beh īng tsiah-ê nà tsuí ê saⁿ-pah lâng kiù lín, kā Mítiân lâng kau tī lí ê tshiú tiong, tsìng lâng lóng thang tò tńg-khì i ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Yahweh said to Gideon, By the three hundred men who lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into your hand; and let all the people go every man to his place.

Tailo: Án-ne kè-sio̍k nn̄g nî, hō͘ só͘-ū tuà tī A-si-a síng ê lâng, bô-lūn Iô-tá-iah lâng á-.sī Hi-la̍h lâng, lóng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsú ê tō-lí.
English: This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

Tailo: Elī ìn i kóng, Lí thang pîng-an tńg-.khì, guān Isulael ê Siōngtè ín-tsún lí só͘ tuì I kiû ê!
English: Then Eli answered, Go in peace; and the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him.

Tailo: I khuànn sì-kho͘-uî bô lâng tī hia, tsiū phah-sí hit-ê Aigi̍p lâng, kā i tâi tī sua-.ni̍h.
English: He looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no one, he killed the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.

Tailo: Só͘-í, hiann-tī tsí-muē, guán tī it-tshè ê khùn-khó͘ huān-lān tiong, ū tuì lín ê sìn-sim tit-tio̍h an-uì.
English: for this cause, brothers, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tuā-siaⁿ huah, Lāu-su ah, kiû Lí lâi khuànn guá ê kiáⁿ, i sī guá ê ko͘-kiáⁿ.
English: Behold, a man from the crowd called out, saying, Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

Tailo: Thang hō͘ lán ê Tsú Iésu ê miâ, tuì lín tit-tio̍h îng-kng, lín mā tuì I tit-tio̍h îng-kng. Tse lóng sī lán ê Siōngtè kah Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián.
English: that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê tshiú ē huāⁿ tī tsit-ê suaⁿ, Mô͘ap lâng tī só͘ tuà ê tē ē siū thún-ta̍h, tshin-tshiūnn ta tsháu siū thún-ta̍h tī pùn-sò tî ê tsuí lāi.
English: For in this mountain the hand of Yahweh will rest. Moab will be trodden down in his place, even like straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.

Tailo: Guá kám bô bīng-līng lí? Lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, mā m̄-thang lún, in-uī lí bô-lūn khì-kàu tó-uī, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè lóng ē kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: Haven't I commanded you? Be strong and of good courage; don't be afraid, neither be dismayed: for Yahweh your God is with you wherever you go.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Te-bó͘-la̍h kah Apílôam ê kiáⁿ Bala̍h tshiùⁿ kua:
English: Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h i sing-khu só͘ uá-.tio̍h ê mi̍h ê lâng, it-tīng ē bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng; the̍h-tio̍h hit-ê mi̍h ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ, ka-kī tī tsuí-.ni̍h sé, bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: Whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until the evening. He who carries those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Lín suî-jiân m̄-bat khuàⁿ-kuè Iésu, mā teh thiàⁿ I; tsit-má suî-jiân bô khuànn-kìnn I, mā iáu-koh teh sìn I. Lín ū īng giân-gí bô huat-tō͘ piáu-ta̍t ê hí-lo̍k,
English: whom not having known you love; in whom, though now you don't see him, yet believing, you rejoice greatly with joy unspeakable and full of glory

Tailo: Guá ē siā sann ki tsìnn tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ piⁿ, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh khó-pé.
English: I will shoot three arrows on the side of it, as though I shot at a mark.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng thau-khuàⁿ Laisi tē ê gō͘ lâng kā in ê hiann-tī kóng, Tsiah-ê tshù lāi ū tsè-si ho̍k kah tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng, koh ū tiau-khik ê siōng kah tsù ê siōng, lín kám tsai? Taⁿ lín tio̍h siūⁿ, khuàⁿ beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah hó?
English: Then the five men who went to spy out the country of Laish answered, and said to their brothers, Do you know that there is in these houses an ephod, and teraphim, and an engraved image, and a molten image? now therefore consider what you have to do.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ tuā tsai-hō, to̍h-sī tsâi-tsú tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ siú i ê tsîⁿ-tsâi lâi hāi-tio̍h ka-kī.
English: There is a grievous evil which I have seen under the sun: wealth kept by its owner to his harm.

Tailo: Tuì i ê tshuì huat-tshut to̍h ê hué-pé kah pue tshut-.lâi ê hué-tsheⁿ.
English: Out of his mouth go burning torches, Sparks of fire leap forth.

Tailo: I tī in ê thâu-tsîng tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng sing khì, to̍h-sī Iôséhuh siū bē khì tsò lô͘-lē.
English: He sent a man before them. Joseph was sold for a slave.

Tailo: M̄-thang him-bō͘ hit-ê àm-mê, to̍h-sī jîn-bîn tī in ê só͘-tsāi tú-tio̍h tû-bia̍t ê sî.
English: Don't desire the night, When people are cut off in their place.

Tailo: kóng tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Ū tsi̍t tsiah tuā ing, si̍t-kó͘ tuā, si̍t-bué tn̂g, mn̂g-tsháu tsa̍t, ū ngó͘-tshái-sik, pue kàu Le-ba-nòng, tshú pik-hiuⁿ tshiū tiong-ki ê ki bué,
English: and say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: A great eagle with great wings and long feathers, full of feathers, which had various colors, came to Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar:

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn m̄-sī Atám siū khi-phiàn, sī hū-jîn-lâng siū iú-hi̍k lâi hām-lo̍h tsuē.
English: Adam wasn't deceived, but the woman, being deceived, has fallen into disobedience;

Tailo: In kóng, Guán bat i. Koh tuì in kóng, I kám pîng-an? Ìn kóng, Pîng-an. Lí khuàⁿ, i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ La̍h-khel tshuā iûⁿ-kûn teh lâi.
English: He said to them, Is it well with him? They said, It is well. See, Rachel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t sī tuā siū-khì ê ji̍t, sī huān-lān khùn-khó͘ ê ji̍t, sī pāi-huāi hi-bî ê ji̍t, sī o͘-o͘ àm-àm ê ji̍t, sī ba̍t hûn tuā àm ê ji̍t,
English: That day is a day of wrath, a day of distress and anguish, a day of trouble and ruin, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness,

Tailo: Aigi̍p ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h tsiūⁿ-khì Gilia̍t tshú jú-hiuⁿ; lí īng tsin tsē io̍h sī bô tshái-kang, lí bē tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, virgin daughter of Egypt: in vain do you use many medicines; there is no healing for you.

Tailo: Kiânn huí-bia̍t ê ē kàu ta̍k-ê siâⁿ, bô tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ ē bián-.tit. Suaⁿ-kok ē tì-kàu sue-pāi, pîng-guân ē siū huí-huāi; tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: The destroyer shall come on every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as Yahweh has spoken.

Tailo: Kuè sann nî, Simí ê nn̄g-ê lô͘-po̍k tsáu kàu Gat ông Mákah ê kiáⁿ Akisi hia. Ū lâng kā Simí kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī Gat.
English: It happened at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. They told Shimei, saying, Behold, your servants are in Gath.

Tailo: In-uī lâng siū ko-sing m̄-sī tuì tang, m̄-sī tuì sai, mā m̄-sī tuì lâm.
English: For neither from the east, nor from the west, Nor yet from the south, comes exaltation.

Tailo: Tabi̍t him-siān kóng, Siáⁿ lâng ē kā Bia̍tléhèm siâⁿ-mn̂g piⁿ ê tséⁿ-tsuí hō͘ guá lim?
English: David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!

Tailo: Sì-tsa̍p-nî āu, tī Si-nái suaⁿ ê khòng-iá, ū thiⁿ-sài tī tshì-phè ê hué-iām tiong, tuì Mô͘se hián-hiān.
English: When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

Tailo: I tsē-uī ê sî, tsa̍p-la̍k huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông kiōng gō͘-tsa̍p jī nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò E-kho-li-ah, sī Êlúsalèm lâng.
English: Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hiàn hué-tsè tsò sio-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī gû-káng-á nn̄g tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tshit tsiah; lín lóng tio̍h īng bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: but you shall offer an offering made by fire, a burnt offering to Yahweh: two young bulls, and one ram, and seven male lambs a year old; they shall be to you without blemish;

Tailo: Lín kám m̄-tsai lín ê sing-khu sī Ki-tok ê ki-thé? Án-ne, guá kám thang kā Ki-tok ê ki-thé piàn-tsò tshiong-ki ê ki-thé? Tsua̍t-tuì m̄-thang.
English: Don't you know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ, and make them members of a prostitute? May it never be!

Tailo: Hit sî, Me-ná-hiàm phah Thê-huí-sat kah kiàn-nā tī in tiong-kan ê, í-ki̍p i ê sì-kho͘-uî, tuì Til-tsah khí, in-uī in bô kā i khui siâⁿ mn̂g, só͘-í, kā i phah, mā phuà-khui in tiong-kan it-tshè ū sin-īn ê tsa-bó͘ lâng.
English: Then Menahem struck Tiphsah, and all who were therein, and the borders of it, from Tirzah: because they didn't open to him, therefore he struck it; and all the women therein who were with child he ripped up.

Tailo: In-uī bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, ū nn̄g-saⁿ lâng hōng guá ê miâ tsū-tsi̍p, guá mā ē kah in tông-tsāi.
English: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the midst of them.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, in tsiū tsiàu Phul ê miâ kiò hiah-ê ji̍t tsò Phul ji̍t. In in-uī tsit tiuⁿ phue só͘-ū ê uē, í-ki̍p in tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì só͘ tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah tshin-sin tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì,
English: Therefore they called these days Purim, after the name of Pur. Therefore because of all the words of this letter, and of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and that which had come to them,

Tailo: Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal ông tsa̍p-káu nî, gō͘-gue̍h tshe-tshit, kin-tuè Babúlông ông ê sī-uē-tiúⁿ Nebutsalatàn lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm,
English: Now in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Iésu tshuā tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ khì piⁿ-á kā in kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ lán beh tsiūⁿ Êlúsalèm, sian-ti só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē Jîn-tsú ê it-tshè lóng ē ìng-giām.
English: He took the twelve aside, and said to them, Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Tabi̍t kiaⁿ Siōngtsú, kóng, Siōngtsú ê kuī ná thang lâi-kàu guá ê só͘-tsāi.
English: David was afraid of Yahweh that day; and he said, How shall the ark of Yahweh come to me?

Tailo: I ê kut-thâu tshin-tshiūnn tâng-kóng, i ê ki-thé tshin-tshiūnn thih-tiâu.
English: His bones are like tubes of brass. His limbs are like bars of iron.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Elísiah thiaⁿ-tio̍h Isulael ông thiah-li̍h i ê saⁿ, tsiū tshe lâng khì kìⁿ ông kóng, Lí ná ē thiah-li̍h saⁿ? Thang hō͘ hit-ê lâng lâi guá tsia, i tsiah tsai Isulael tiong ū sian-ti.
English: It was so, when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, Why have you torn your clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.

Tailo: koh huí-huāi hiah-ê thiāu-siōng, tshò hiah-ê A-si-lah, hō͘ lâng ê kut-thâu tshiong-muá hiah-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He broke in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Asherim, and filled their places with the bones of men.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-tiong ê tsiáu, hái-.ni̍h ê hî, í-ki̍p hái-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê ua̍h-mi̍h, lóng hō͘ i kuán-lí.
English: The birds of the sky, the fish of the sea, And whatever passes through the paths of the seas.

Tailo: Tuì kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh ê sî-ji̍t kàu taⁿ, thian-kok it-ti̍t siū kiông-lia̍t ê kong-kik, kiông-bíng ê lâng īng pō-li̍k lâi tshiúⁿ-tua̍t.
English: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

Tailo: I khì O͘hulah lâi-kàu i ê lāu-pē ê ke, kā Ia-lu-ba-al ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī i ê hiann-tī tshit tsa̍p lâng, lóng tī tsi̍t tè tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng kā in thâi-sí, tsí ū Ia-lu-ba-al ê suah-bué kiánn Iô-thàm lâu-.leh, in-uī i ū tsáu-khì bih.
English: He went to his father's house at Ophrah, and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal, being seventy persons, on one stone: but Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.

Tailo: Sò-sìng ê lâng ê sim ē bîng-pi̍k tì-sik; tuā tsi̍h ê lâng ē kóng-uē kín koh bîng.
English: The heart of the rash will understand knowledge, And the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.

Tailo: Siōngtè ū khé-sī hiah-ê sian-ti, hō͘ in tsai in ê ho̍k-sāi m̄-sī uī-tio̍h ka-kī, sī uī-tio̍h lín. Tsiah-ê sìn-sit tsit-má í-king uá-khò tuì thiⁿ tshe lâi ê Sìng Sîn, thong-kuè hok-im ê sù-tsiá thuân hō͘ lín; tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liân thiⁿ-sài mā pik-tshiat teh thìng-hāu ài beh tsai.
English: To them it was revealed, that not to themselves, but to you, did they minister these things, which now have been announced to you through those who preached the Good News to you by the Holy Spirit sent out from heaven; which things angels desire to look into.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Guá m̄-bat tham lâng ê tsînn gîn á-.sī saⁿ-khò͘;
English: I coveted no one's silver, or gold, or clothing.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tuì siâⁿ tiong tsiūⁿ-.khì, hioh tī siâⁿ guā tang pîng ê suaⁿ.
English: The glory of Yahweh went up from the midst of the city, and stood on the mountain which is on the east side of the city.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê tshuì puê-ióng tsin tsē lâng; gōng lâng in-uī bû-ti lâi sí.
English: The lips of the righteous feed many, But the foolish die for lack of understanding.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì Naomih kóng, Siōngtsú sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī I kin-á-ji̍t bô pàng-sak lí, tì-sú lí bô tsì-tshin ê lâng. Guān tsit-ê gín-á tī Isulael tiong tit-tio̍h miâ-siaⁿ.
English: The women said to Naomi, Blessed be Yahweh, who has not left you this day without a near kinsman; and let his name be famous in Israel.

Tailo: In ê sim tūn tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ iû pau-ba̍t, tsóng-.sī, guá ì-ài Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: Their heart is as callous as the fat, But I delight in your law.

Tailo: Siōngtè it-tīng bē siu-huê I ê siū-khì, hû-tsō͘ La̍h-hap ê, khut-lo̍h tī I ê ē-bīn.
English: God will not withdraw his anger; The helpers of Rahab stoop under him.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn sio-liân-suà ê suaⁿ-kok, tshin-tshiūnn hô piⁿ ê hn̂g, tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú só͘ tsai ê tîm-hiuⁿ tshiū, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí piⁿ ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū.
English: As valleys are they spread forth, As gardens by the riverside, As aloes which Yahweh has planted, As cedar trees beside the waters.

Tailo: Iésu tńg-.lâi, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h in in-uī ba̍k-tsiu tsin siap iáu teh khùn. In mā m̄-tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ ìn Iésu khah hó.
English: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn't know what to answer him.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kng tsiò tī o͘-àm tiong, m̄-koh, o͘-àm m̄ tsiap-la̍p kng.
English: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn't overcome it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá hōng Tsú ê miâ khó͘-khǹg lín, m̄-thang koh-tsài kè-sio̍k kuè guā-pang lâng hit khuán ê sing-ua̍h. In ê su-sióng khang-hi koh hàm-kó͘,
English: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,

Tailo: Koh tuì Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k tiong, hō͘ in I-lī-thê-ki kah i ê kau-iá, Gip-be-thòng kah i ê kau-iá,
English: Out of the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its suburbs, Gibbethon with its suburbs,

Tailo: Iésu thîng-kha, kiò lâng kā i khan-.lâi. I uá-.lâi ê sî, Iésu mn̄g i kóng,
English: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,

Tailo: In-uī lín kóng: Pà-ông ê tshù tī tó-uī? Pháiⁿ lâng pîng-sî tuà ê tshù tī tó-uī?
English: For you say, Where is the house of the prince? Where is the tent in which the wicked lived?'

Tailo: Phah gû-ling ē piàn-sîng ling-iû, phah-tio̍h phīⁿ-khang ē tshut-hueh; tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, kik lâng siū-khì ē khí sio-tseⁿ.
English: For as the churning of milk brings forth butter, And the wringing of the nose brings forth blood; So the forcing of wrath brings forth strife.

Tailo: Pún-tso̍k ê lâng kah guā-tso̍k ê lâng tshut-guā tī lín tiong-kan, lóng kâng sio-siâng ê lē.
English: One law shall be to him who is born at home, and to the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you.

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì Siōngtsú kóng, Án-ne, Aigi̍p lâng ē thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī Lí īng Lí ê kuân-lîng, tshuā tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tuì in tiong-kan khí-.lâi.
English: Moses said to Yahweh, Then the Egyptians will hear it; for you brought up this people in your might from among them;

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ Isimael siū kat-lé ê sî, tsa̍p-saⁿ huè.
English: Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iésu koh-ua̍h, koh ū hō͘ Mâlíah khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, kìng-jiân iáu m̄ siong-sìn.
English: When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.

Tailo: Tī lia̍t pang ê tiong-kan kóng-khí I ê îng-kng! Tī bān-bîn ê tiong-kan kóng-khí I kî-biāu ê tsok-uî!
English: Declare his glory among the nations, His marvelous works among all the peoples.

Tailo: Utsiiah tsiū siū-khì, tshiú the̍h hiuⁿ-lô͘ beh sio hiuⁿ. I tuì tsè-si teh siū-khì ê sî, tī Siōngtsú tiān lāi hiuⁿ-tuâⁿ piⁿ hiah-ê tsè-si ê bīn-tsîng, i ê thâu-hia̍h hut-jiân khí thái-ko.
English: Then Uzziah was angry; and he had a censer in his hand to burn incense; and while he was angry with the priests, the leprosy broke forth in his forehead before the priests in the house of Yahweh, beside the altar of incense.

Tailo: Thamal sám hué-hu tī thâu-khak, thiah-li̍h só͘ tshīng tshái-sik ê saⁿ, īng tshiú lám thâu-khak lâi kiâⁿ, ná kiâⁿ ná háu.
English: Tamar put ashes on her head, and tore her garment of various colors that was on her; and she laid her hand on her head, and went her way, crying aloud as she went.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: M̄-thang īng tshiú kā i bong, tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm, á-.sī īng tsìnn kā i siā; bô-lūn sī lâng á-.sī tsing-seⁿ khì bong-tio̍h lóng bē ua̍h. Kàu sàu-kak ê siann thua tn̂g ê sî, in tio̍h lâi suaⁿ-kha. '
English: No hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through; whether it is animal or man, he shall not live.' When the trumpet sounds long, they shall come up to the mountain.

Tailo: Isulael ông Ia-lô-ba-am tsē-uī jī-tsa̍p nî, Asah khai-sí tī Iôtah tsò ông.
English: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Asa to reign over Judah.

Tailo: Tsiū hō͘ i khiā tī tē-tsiūⁿ kuân ê só͘-tsāi, tit-tio̍h tsia̍h tshân-.ni̍h ê lông-sán-bu̍t; koh hō͘ i tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ suh bi̍t, tuì hué-tsio̍h suh iû;
English: He made him ride on the high places of the earth, He ate the increase of the field; He made him to suck honey out of the rock, Oil out of the flinty rock;

Tailo: Tsú-lâng tuì lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Tshut-khì lō͘-.ni̍h kah lî-pa piⁿ bián-kióng lâng ji̍p-.lâi, thang hō͘ guá ê tshù tsē muá.
English: The lord said to the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tsuē-kò iu-siong ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōngtè ē kā in an-uì!
English: Blessed are those who mourn, For they shall be comforted.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ê tiān ê iân-kò͘, guá beh thè lí kiû hok-khì.
English: For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God, I will seek your good.

Tailo: In-uī nā hó-hó tsīn tsip-sū ê tsit-bū, ka-kī ē tit-tio̍h hó miâ-siaⁿ, mā tsiah ē-tàng hó-tánn káng-lūn Ki-tok Iésu ê tō-lí.
English: For those who have served well as deacons gain to themselves a good standing, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Tailo: In ū hīⁿ-khang mā thiaⁿ bē-tio̍h, ū phīⁿ-khang mā phīⁿ bē-tio̍h.
English: They have ears, but they don't hear; They have noses, but they don't smell;

Tailo: In ji̍p-khì Sa-má-lī-a, Elísiah kóng, Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí khui tsiah-ê lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu, hō͘ in khuàⁿ-.tio̍h. Siōngtsú khui in ê ba̍k-tsiu, in tsiū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, bô phah-sǹg, í-king sī tī Sa-má-lī-a ê siâⁿ lāi.
English: It happened, when they were come into Samaria, that Elisha said, Yahweh, open the eyes of these men, that they may see. Yahweh opened their eyes, and they saw; and behold, they were in the midst of Samaria.

Tailo: Αpsalôm tsiū tô-tsáu. Siú-bōng ê siàu-liân lâng gia̍h thâu khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsin tsē jîn-bîn tuì i ê āu-bīn, tuì suaⁿ piⁿ ê lō͘ lâi.
English: But Absalom fled. The young man who kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold, many people were coming by way of the hillside behind him.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá beh hō͘ lí tsò phah ngó͘-kok ê sin khì-kū, lāi koh ū khí; lí ē kā suaⁿ-niá phah kàu tshuì-tshuì, hō͘ suaⁿ-thâu tshin-tshiūnn tsho͘-khng.
English: Behold, I have made you into a new sharp threshing instrument with teeth. You will thresh the mountains, And beat them small, And will make the hills like chaff.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h sio-tsè ê lō͘-īng ê sì tè toh, sī tsio̍h-thâu phah ê, tn̂g tiú puàⁿ, khuah tiú puàⁿ, kuân tsi̍t tiú; thâi sio-tsè kah tsiah-ê tsè só͘ īng ê khì-kū lóng hē tī hit tíng-bīn.
English: There were four tables for the burnt offering, of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half broad, and one cubit high; whereupon they laid the instruments with which they killed the burnt offering and the sacrifice.

Tailo: Isulael lâng ê lu̍t-huat, sī kin-kì Lēbī tso̍k ê tsè-si tsè-tō͘ pan-pò͘. Nā tuì tsit-ê tsè-tō͘ ē-tàng hō͘ lâng tit-tio̍h uân-tsuân, tsiū m̄-bián līng-guā koh siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê Malkitsetik hē-thóng ê tsè-si, m̄-sī tsiàu Alông hē-thóng lâi siat-li̍p ê.
English: Now if there was perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people have received the law), what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

Tailo: Iésu tsē tī hōng-hiàn-siuⁿ ê tuì-bīn teh khuàⁿ tsìng lâng hiat tsînn lo̍h-.khì, ū tsin tsē hó-gia̍h lâng hiat tsin tsē tsînn.
English: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

Tailo: I ê lāi-bīn it-tīng ē íng-uán bô lâng tuà, tāi-tāi bô lâng tuà; A-la-puh lâng bô tī hia tah pò͘-pêⁿ, kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng mā bô hō͘ iûⁿ-kûn tó tī hia.
English: It will never be inhabited, neither will it be lived in from generation to generation. The Arabian will not pitch a tent there, neither will shepherds make their flocks lie down there.

Tailo: Thâi-sí-lâng huān-tio̍h sí-tsuē ê, lín m̄-thang siu sio̍k-huê sèⁿ-miā ê kè-tsînn, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death; but he shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: Guá uī-tio̍h guá ê Siōngtè ê tiān, í-king tsīn khuì-la̍t, tsún-pī kim tsò kim-khì, tsún-pī gîn tsò gîn-khì, tâng tsò tâng-khì, thih tsò thih-khì, tshâ tsò tshâ-khì, koh ū âng bé-ló kah thang siuⁿ ê pó-tsio̍h, kng-tsio̍h, tshái-sik ê tsio̍h, í-ki̍p ta̍k tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h kah tāi-lí-tsio̍h ki̍k tsē.
English: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, and the silver for the things of silver, and the brass for the things of brass, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, stones for inlaid work, and of various colors, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.

Tailo: Ahatsiah tsē-uī ê sî sì-tsa̍p jī huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông tsi̍t nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Athalíiah, sī Omlī ê tsa-bó͘ sun.
English: Forty-two years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign; and he reigned one year in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Athaliah the daughter of Omri.

Tailo: I tuì lâng kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, kìng-uì Siōngtsú to̍h-sī tì-huī, lī-khui pháiⁿ to̍h-sī tshong-bîng.
English: To man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom. To depart from evil is understanding.'

Tailo: I to̍h-sī phòng-hong tsū-khua, m̄-tsai puàⁿ-hāng, koh ū hò͘ⁿ piān lūn kah sio-tsèⁿ ê mô͘-pēⁿ.
English: he is conceited, knowing nothing, but obsessed with arguments, disputes, and word battles, from which come envy, strife, reviling, evil suspicions,

Tailo: I káng-lūn tsháu-ba̍k, tuì Le-ba-nòng ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū kàu tshiûⁿ tíng huat khí-.lâi ê gû-tshik-tsháu, koh káng-lūn tsáu-siù, pue-tsiáu, thâng-thuā kah tsuí-tso̍k.
English: He spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springs out of the wall; he spoke also of animals, and of birds, and of creeping things, and of fish.

Tailo: Tshong-bîng lâng ē tsuan-sim tsáu-tshuē tì-sik; gōng lâng ê tshuì kan-taⁿ ì-ài gû-gōng.
English: The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, But the mouths of fools feed on folly.

Tailo: I īng tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t ê kim kah tsin tsē ê phang-liāu, í-ki̍p pó-tsio̍h sàng ông. Í-āu só͘ sàng lâi ê phang-liāu, m̄-bat koh ū tshin-tshiūnn Síbah lú-ông sàng Só͘lômóng ông ê hiah tsē.
English: She gave the king one hundred twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī nā piàn sàn-tshiah-khì tuà tī lí hia, kā pún-sin bē hō͘ lí, m̄-thang hō͘ i tshin-tshiūnn lô͘-po̍k ho̍k-sāi lí.
English: If your brother has grown poor among you, and sells himself to you; you shall not make him to serve as a slave.

Tailo: Lín ê io-tē lāi, lóng m̄-thang tuà kim, gîn á-.sī tâng ê tsîⁿ.
English: Don't take any gold, nor silver, nor brass in your money belts.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê tsok-uî tsin uí-tāi; huān-nā kah-ì I só͘ tsò ê lóng ē huaⁿ-hí tshâ-khó.
English: Yahweh's works are great, Pondered by all those who delight in them.

Tailo: Án-ne, tī lán ê Tsú Iésu tsài-lîm ê ji̍t, lín ē tsò guán ê khua-kháu, guán mā ē tsò lín ê khua-kháu.
English: as also you acknowledged us in part, that we are your boasting, even as you also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus.

Tailo: Ioap khuàⁿ-tio̍h tuì-ti̍k tī i ê tsîng-āu pâi tīn, tsiū tuì Isulael kun tiong kíng-suán tsing-ping, hō͘ in pâi tīn lâi tuì-hù Alâm lâng.
English: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.

Tailo: Gê-la̍h-sam sì-kho͘-uî ê lâng lóng kiû Iésu lī-khui in, in-uī in tsin kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ. Iésu tsiū tsē tsûn tńg-.khì.
English: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

Tailo: Guá koh tuì tsiah-ê tsè-si kah tsit kok ê tsìng lâng kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lín m̄-thang thiaⁿ hiah-ê sian-ti tuì lín só͘ ī-giân ê. In kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ê tiān ê khì-kū bô guā kú ē tuì Babúlông tuà tńg-lâi'; kî-si̍t in tuì lín só͘ suan-pò͘ ê sī pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus says Yahweh: Don't listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, Behold, the vessels of Yahweh's house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon; for they prophesy a lie to you.

Tailo: Guá — Siōngtsú īng kong-gī tiàu Lí, beh khan Lí ê tshiú, pó-siú Lí, hō͘ Lí tsò kah jîn-bîn ê iok ê tiong-pó, tsò guā-pang lâng ê kng,
English: I, Yahweh, have called you in righteousness, And will hold your hand, And will keep you, And make you a covenant for the people, As a light for the nations;

Tailo: Taⁿ guá kā lín kóng, m̄-thang tshap tsiah-ê lâng, tshut-tsāi in khì, in-uī in só͘ kè-bô͘ kah só͘ tsò ê nā-sī tshut tī lâng, it-tīng ē sit-pāi;
English: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.

Tailo: Tû-khì ông bīn-tsîng ê pháiⁿ lâng, i ê kok-uī tsiah ē-tàng tuì kong-gī lâi kian-kò͘.
English: Take away the wicked from the king's presence, And his throne will be established in righteousness.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, ho̍k-sāi I, kah I kiat-liân, kí I ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: You shall fear Yahweh your God; him shall you serve; and to him shall you cleave, and by his name shall you swear.

Tailo: guá nā uī-tio̍h kiaⁿ tuā-tīn ê kûn-tsiòng, kiaⁿ tsong-tso̍k ê biáu-sī, tì-sú tiām-tiām m̄-káⁿ tshut-mn̂g;
English: Because I feared the great multitude, And the contempt of families terrified me, So that I kept silence, and didn't go out of the door

Tailo: Thuân lán Lô-má lâng bô ing-kai tsiap-siū á-.sī tsun-siú ê kui-lē.
English: and set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe, being Romans.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Huilīsū lâng lâi pak hiah-ê siū sat-hāi ê lâng, tshuē-tio̍h Sàulô kah i saⁿ-ê kiáⁿ, sí tī Gil-buah suaⁿ.
English: It happened on the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

Tailo: I tshīng ê hit niá tn̂g-phàu bak kah tsuân-sī hueh. I ê miâ kiò-tsò Siōngtè ê tō .
English: He is clothed in a garment sprinkled with blood. His name is called The Word of God.

Tailo: Hit sî, hut-jiân lâng ê tshiú-tsíng-thâu-á tshut-hiān, tī ông-kiong kah ting-tâi sio-tuì ê hún-piah siá jī, ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h siá jī ê tshiú,
English: In the same hour came forth the fingers of a man's hand, and wrote over against the lampstand on the plaster of the wall of the king's palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Aigi̍p tē bat tsò lô͘-lē, só͘-í, guá bīng-līng lí tio̍h án-ne kiânn.
English: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in the land of Egypt: therefore I command you to do this thing.

Tailo: Lí nā thiaⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê uē, tsiah-ê só͘ tsiok-hok ê tsiū ē jiok lí, ē kàu tī lí:
English: and all these blessings shall come on you, and overtake you, if you shall listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Guān lín ē-tàng thé-giām Ki-tok hit khuán tshiau-ua̍t tì-sik só͘ ē-tàng lí-kái ê thiàⁿ, hō͘ Siōngtè ê uân-siān kā lín uân-tsuân tshiong-muá.
English: and to know Christ's love which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

Tailo: Tsit pîng ū lâng ê bīn, ǹg tsang tshiū; hit pîng ū sai ê bīn, ǹg tsang tshiū, tshù lāi sì-kho͘-uî lóng sī án-ne.
English: so that there was the face of a man toward the palm tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side. thus was it made through all the house round about:

Tailo: Lí ê tsú-bîn nā tshut-khì Lí só͘ tshe in khì ê lō͘ kah tuì-ti̍k kau-tsiàn, ǹg Lí só͘ kíng tsit-ê siâⁿ kah guá uī-tio̍h Lí ê miâ só͘ khí ê tiān, lâi tuì Lí kî-tó ê sî,
English: If your people go out to battle against their enemies, by whatever way you shall send them, and they pray to you toward this city which you have chosen, and the house which I have built for your name;

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng tī tseh-kî tiong teh tshuē Iésu, mn̄g lâng kóng, Hit-ê lâng tī tó-uī?
English: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

Tailo: Tio̍h kā lán ê Tsú ê khuan-iông khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsín-kiù ê ki-huē, lán tshin-ài ê hiann-tī Páulô īng Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ i ê tì-huī, siá phue hō͘ lín ê sî mā ū án-ne kóng.
English: Regard the patience of our Lord as salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also, according to the wisdom given to him, wrote to you;

Tailo: I tsiàu án-ne tsò tsa̍p-ê tâng-tsō, in ê tsù-huat, tshùn-tshioh kah khuán-sit lóng sio-kāng.
English: After this manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, and one form.

Tailo: Siōngtsú beh tī tsuân tē tsò ông. Tng hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú to̍k-it, I ê miâ mā sī to̍k-it.
English: Yahweh will be King over all the earth. In that day Yahweh will be one, and his name one.

Tailo: I m̄-sī sí-lâng ê Siōngtè, sī ua̍h-lâng ê Siōngtè, in-uī lâng lóng sī uī-tio̍h Tsú teh ua̍h.
English: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.

Tailo: Leah huâi-īn seⁿ kiáⁿ, tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Lūbiān, in-uī i kóng, Siōngtsú khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê khó͘-tsîng; taⁿ guá ê tiōng-hu ē thiàⁿ guá.
English: Leah conceived, and bore a son, and she named him Reuben. For she said, Because Yahweh has looked at my affliction. For now my husband will love me.

Tailo: Tsin tsē hiann-tī tsí-muē in-uī guá ê kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ, tuì Tsú koh khah tshim-sìn, koh khah hó-tánn bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ lâi thuân Siōngtè ê sìn-sit.
English: and that most of the brothers in the Lord, being confident through my bonds, are more abundantly bold to speak the word of God without fear.

Tailo: In-uī in kè-bô͘ beh hām-hāi Lí, tsóng-.sī, bē sîng-kong.
English: For they intended evil against you. They plotted evil against you which cannot succeed.

Tailo: Lé-mi̍h sī thè lâng khui lō͘, tshuā i kàu tuā-jîn-bu̍t ê bīn-tsîng.
English: A man's gift makes room for him, And brings him before great men.

Tailo: Guá beh īng kám-siā ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Lí, Koh beh kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ.
English: I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call on the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tio̍h uá-khò kian-tīng ê sìn-sim lâi tí-khòng i, in-uī lín tsai tsuân sè-kài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē lóng teh siū kāng-khuán ê khó͘-lān.
English: Withstand him steadfast in your faith, knowing that your brothers who are in the world are undergoing the same sufferings.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Isulael tsìng tiúⁿ-ló lâi-kàu Hebúlông kìnn ông, Tabi̍t tsiū tī Hebúlông, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kah in li̍p-iok, in tsiū īng iû buah Tabi̍t, kā i siat-li̍p tsò Isulael ông, tsiàu Siōngtsú kau-thok Samuel só͘ kóng ê.
English: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Yahweh; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of Yahweh by Samuel.

Tailo: Lín khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ammóng lâng ê ông Nahasi lâi kā lín kong-kik, tsiū tuì guá kóng, ' M̄-lah, guán tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh tsi̍t-ê ông lâi kuán-lí guán. ' Kî-si̍t Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè to̍h sī lín ê ông.
English: When you saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, you said to me, No, but a king shall reign over us; when Yahweh your God was your king.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng si̍t-uē, tī Eliiah ê sî-tāi ū khòng-hān saⁿ nî puàⁿ, ta̍k só͘-tsāi lóng tuā ki-hng, hit sî Isulael tiong ū tsin tsē kuáⁿ-hū.
English: But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tshuā i ê lāu-pē Iâkop ji̍p-khì khiā tī Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng, Iâkop tsiū kā Huâ-láu tsiok-hok.
English: Joseph brought in Jacob, his father, and set him before Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

Tailo: Tsiok-hok lí ê, Guá ē sù-hok hō͘ in; tsiù-tsó͘ lí ê, Guá ē kā i tsik-hua̍t. Tē tsiūⁿ bān-tso̍k ē in-uī lí lâi tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. In you will all of the families of the earth be blessed.

Tailo: Lín á-.sī tsia̍h á-.sī lim, kám m̄-sī lín teh tsia̍h, lín teh-lim?
English: When you eat, and when you drink, don't you eat for yourselves, and drink for yourselves?

Tailo: lí ê sim tsiū nńg, ka-kī khiam-pi tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I só͘ kóng kong-kik tsit só͘-tsāi kah tuà tī tsia ê jîn-bîn ê uē, hit sî lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī khiam-pi, koh thiah-li̍h lí ê saⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, Guá í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê uē. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: because your heart was tender, and you did humble yourself before God, when you heard his words against this place, and against the inhabitants of it, and have humbled yourself before me, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Án-ne, lín ka-kī tsìng-bîng lín sī tsò-hué sat-hāi sian-ti ê lâng ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.

Tailo: Lí īng kha-liâu tshiú-khàu khàu guá ê kha, tì-ì khuànn guá só͘-ū ê lō͘; Lí kā guá ê kha-té uē kài-hān.
English: You also put my feet in the stocks, And mark all my paths. You set a bound to the soles of my feet:

Tailo: In ji̍p siâⁿ liáu-āu, tsiū peh khí-lih in tuà ê lâu-tíng tuā thiaⁿ. Tī hia ū Piattò͘, Iô-há-neh, Iâkop, An-to-le̍h, Hui-li̍p-pò͘ kah Tho-má-suh, Ba-tho-lô-mái kah Máthài, Al-hua-ioh ê kiáⁿ Iâkop kah Se-lô-tí ê Símòng, í-ki̍p Iâkop ê kiáⁿ Iôtah.
English: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying; that is Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōngtè ah, guá beh tuâⁿ sik o-ló Lí, o-ló Lí ê sìn-si̍t! Isulael ê sìng ê ah, guá beh tuâⁿ khîm o-ló Lí!
English: I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God. I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: In tsiū kā i mā, kóng, Lí tsiah sī hit-ê lâng ê bûn-tô͘, guán sī Mô͘se ê bûn-tô͘.
English: They insulted him and said, You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.

Tailo: I kóng, Kiû lí kā guá sù-hok, lí í-king an-tì guá tī lâm-hong ê tē, kiû lí hō͘ guá tsuí-tsuâⁿ. I tsiū kā tíng ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ kah ē ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ hō͘ i.
English: She said, Give me a blessing; for that you have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water. He gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.

Tailo: Sala̍h kiaⁿ tsi̍t ē, m̄ sîng-jīn, kóng, Guá bô tshiò. Hit-ê lâng kóng, Bô iáⁿ, lí si̍t-tsāi ū tshiò.
English: Then Sarah denied, saying, I didn't laugh, for she was afraid. He said, No, but you did laugh.

Tailo: Hit sî, Biāniámín lâng tńg-.lâi, Isulael lâng tsiū kā só͘ lâu hō͘ i ua̍h ê Gilia̍t-iabesi ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kè hō͘ in, iáu-koh bô kàu-gia̍h.
English: Benjamin returned at that time; and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh Gilead: and yet so they weren't enough for them.

Tailo: Tsò tsi̍t-ê uī-tio̍h Tsú tsò siû-huān ê lâng, guá khó͘-khǹg lín tsò tāi-tsì tio̍h hû-ha̍p Siōngtè ê ho͘-tiàu.
English: I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beg you to walk worthily of the calling with which you were called,

Tailo: Asah ê kiáⁿ Iô-sa-huat suà-tsiap i tsò ông, ka-kī kiông-sīng, tí-ti̍k Isulael.
English: Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.

Tailo: M̄ kong-khai sîng-jīn tsit-hāng tāi-tsì ê, tsiū m̄-sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê Sìng Sîn, mā sī kah Ki-tok tuì-ti̍k ê lîng. Lín ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê lîng teh beh lâi, kî-si̍t tsit-má í-king lâi tī sè-kan à.
English: and every spirit who doesn't confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God, and this is the spirit of the antichrist, of whom you have heard that it comes. Now it is in the world already.

Tailo: Iésu bong i ê tshiú, jia̍t suî-sî thè, i tsiū khí-lâi sū-hāu Iésu.
