English: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and served him.

Tailo: Hit tsiah bíng-siù ê tsi̍t-ê thâu-khak, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū siū-kuè tì-miā-siong; i ê tì-miā-siong ū tit-tio̍h i hó. Tsuân-sè-kài ê lâng lóng kám-kak kî-kuài, tsiū lâi tuè hit tsiah bíng-siù kiânn.
English: One of his heads looked like it had been wounded fatally. His fatal wound was healed, and the whole earth marveled at the beast.

Tailo: Koh khí-tsō tsè-si ê īⁿ kah tuā-īⁿ, í-ki̍p īⁿ mn̂g, īng tâng an-tsng hiah-ê mn̂g.
English: Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.

Tailo: Tuā tsuí huàn-lām tī tē-tsiūⁿ sì-tsa̍p kang; tsuí tiòng ná kuân, hō͘ tuā tsûn tshìng phû, tsûn tsiū lī tē.
English: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.

Tailo: Koh lí nā tsáu-tshuē bîng-lí tshin-tshiūnn teh tshuē tsîⁿ-gîn, tshiau-tshuē bîng-lí tshin-tshiūnn teh tshiau-tshuē ún-ba̍t ê pó-puè;
English: If you seek her as silver, And search for her as for hidden treasures:

Tailo: I siâⁿ lāi ê tiúⁿ-ló tsiū tio̍h kiò i lâi, kā i kóng, i nā tsip-ì kóng, ' Guá bô beh tshuā i',
English: Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak to him: and if he stand, and say, I don't want to take her;

Tailo: Tsìng lâng niá siū sé-lé liáu-āu, Iésu mā ū lâi niá siū sé-lé. I kî-tó ê sî, thiⁿ khui,
English: Now it happened, when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized, and was praying. The sky was opened,

Tailo: A-in kah i ê kau-iá, U-tha kah i ê kau-iá, Bia̍t-si-mé-si kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng káu tsō siâⁿ, lóng sī tuì tsit nn̄g tsi-tso̍k hō͘ in.
English: and Ain with its suburbs, and Juttah with its suburbs, and Beth Shemesh with its suburbs; nine cities out of those two tribes.

Tailo: Koh ū nn̄g-ê huān-lâng hō͘ lâng ah-khì kah Iésu tsò-hué tshú sí-hîng.
English: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.

Tailo: Kè-bô͘ tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng ē hông tshing-tsò jiá tsai-hō ê lâng.
English: One who plots to do evil Will be called a schemer.

Tailo: La̍hban kah Bethuel ìn kóng, Tāi-tsì tshut tī Siōngtsú, guán bē-tàng tuì lí kóng hó á-.sī m̄-hó.
English: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, The thing proceeds from Yahweh. We can't speak to you bad or good.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsit-má teh ua̍h ê guá m̄-sī guân-lâi ê guá, sī Ki-tok tiàm tī guá lāi-bīn teh ua̍h; guá tsit-má teh ua̍h, sī khò sìn Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ teh ua̍h; Ki-tok thiàⁿ guá, uī-tio̍h guá pàng-sak sèⁿ-miā.
English: I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I that live, but Christ living in me. That life which I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself up for me.

Tailo: ( Huē-tsiòng hit tsi̍t-puàⁿ ū iûⁿ saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ bān tshit-tshing gō͘-pah tsiah,
English: (now the congregation's half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,

Tailo: Isulael ông Io-a-si, tī Bia̍t-si-mé-si lia̍h-tio̍h Ehuahátsuh ê sun, Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Iôtah ông Amátsiah, tsiū ah i kàu Êlúsalèm, koh thiah-huí Êlúsalèm ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tuì Ehulaim mn̂g kàu kak mn̂g, kiōng sì pah tiú.
English: Joash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth Shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.

Tailo: King-tián kám bô kóng, ' Ki-tok sī Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, sī tuì Tabi̍t ê kò͘-hiong Bia̍tléhèm siâⁿ tshut? '
English: Hasn't the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī lín ê bīn-tsîng só͘ bia̍t-bông hiah-ê kok, lín mā ē kāng-khuán án-ne bia̍t-bông, in-uī lín m̄ tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê uē.
English: As the nations that Yahweh makes to perish before you, so shall you perish; because you wouldn't listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah Tsú kiat-liân lâi huann-hí. Guá koh kóng tsi̍t pái, tio̍h huann-hí!
English: Rejoice in the Lord always! Again I will say, Rejoice!

Tailo: In-uī tshiū-á nā tshò khí-.lâi, iáu-koh ū ǹg-bāng koh puh íⁿ, nńg ê ki huat bē suah.
English: For there is hope for a tree, If it is cut down, that it will sprout again, That the tender branch of it will not cease.

Tailo: I kiù pa̍t lâng suah bē-tàng kiù ka-kī. I tsò Isulael ê ông, taⁿ tio̍h tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng lo̍h-.lâi, guán tsiū ē siong-sìn.
English: He saved others, but he can't save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā huān-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê, i só͘ tó ê tshn̂g lóng sī bô tshing-khì, i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h, mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Every bed whereon he who has the discharge lies shall be unclean; and everything he sits on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Nî-thâu, lia̍t ông tshut-tsiàn ê sî, Tabi̍t tshe Ioap kah i ê jîn-sîn, í-ki̍p Isulael ê kûn-tsiòng tshut-.khì. In tsiū thâi-iâⁿ Ammóng lâng, uî-kong Lap-bah. Tabi̍t iû-guân tuà tī Êlúsalèm.
English: It happened, at the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem.

Tailo: Hitsekia tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin, bīn ǹg piah, tuì Siōngtsú kî-tó, kóng,
English: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to Yahweh,

Tailo: Guá khì lín hia ê sî, m̄-thang pik guá tuì lín bô kheh-khì. Tuì hiah-ê phue-phîng guán īng sio̍k-sè ê tōng-ki teh tsò tāi-tsì ê lâng, guá it-tīng ē tuì in bô kheh-khì.
English: Yes, I beg you that I may not, when present, show courage with the confidence with which I intend to be bold against some, who consider us to be walking according to the flesh.

Tailo: Guán tshin-tshiūnn hîm teh háu, tshin-tshiūnn pan-kah teh haiⁿ-haiⁿ kiò; ǹg-bāng kong-pêⁿ, tsóng-.sī, lóng tshuē bô; ǹg-bāng kiù-un, tsóng-.sī, i lī-khui guán hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: We roar all like bears, and moan sore like doves: we look for justice, but there is none; for salvation, but it is far off from us.

Tailo: Guān Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah Thiⁿ-pē ê Kiáⁿ Iésu Ki-tok sù lán un-tián, liân-bín kah pîng-an, hō͘ lán ê sing-ua̍h tshiong-muá tsin-lí kah thiàⁿ-sim.
English: Grace, mercy, and peace will be with us, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á, guá kí lîng-iûⁿ kah tshân-iá ê lo̍k-bú pik-tshiat huan-hù lí: M̄-thang kā i phah tshéⁿ, m̄-thang kiáu-jiáu guá só͘ ài ê, tio̍h thìng-hāu i ka-kī tsîng-guān.
English: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That you not stir up, nor awaken love, Until it so desires.

Tailo: Tī Siōngtsú tiān só͘ tit-tio̍h ê gîn lóng piàⁿ tshut-.lâi, kau hō͘ tok-kang ê kah tsò-kang lâng ê tshiú.
English: They have emptied out the money that was found in the house of Yahweh, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and into the hand of the workmen.

Tailo: Tsá-khí sî káu tiám ê sî, i koh tshut-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng îng-îng khiā tī tuā lō͘-kháu,
English: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.

Tailo: In-uī ông ê tsûn-tsiah kah Hilâm ê lô͘-po̍k tsò-hué khì Talsisih, tsiah-ê Talsisih ê tsûn tsài kim, gîn, tshiūⁿ-gê, kâu kah khóng-tshiok, sann nî tńg-lâi tsi̍t pái.
English: For the king had ships that went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram; once every three years came the ships of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

Tailo: Iosiúah sí liáu-āu, Isulael lâng mn̄g Siōngtsú kóng, Siáⁿ lâng tio̍h tsò thâu khì kah kā guán kong-kik ê Ka-nân lâng kau-tsiàn?
English: It happened after the death of Joshua, the children of Israel asked of Yahweh, saying, Who shall go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?

Tailo: Tī Lú-su-toh ū tsi̍t-ê pái-kha-.ê, put-sî tsē-.leh, sī tuì tshut-sì tsiū nńg-kha, lóng bē kiânn.
English: At Lystra a certain man sat, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked.

Tailo: Koh thiah Penuel ê tâi, thâi-sí hit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê lâng.
English: He broke down the tower of Penuel, and killed the men of the city.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì I kóng bîng guá kha-pō͘ ê sò͘-gia̍h, beh tshin-tshiūnn kun-ông lâi kìnn I.
English: I would declare to him the number of my steps. As a prince would I go near to him.

Tailo: in-uī in īng kuí-tsà ê kè-bô͘ pik-hāi lín, tī Bohol ê tāi-tsì kah in ê tsí-muē, Mítiân siú-líng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, Ko-tsu-pí ê tāi-tsì, īng kuí-tsà ê kè-bô͘ ín-iú lín; tsit-ê Ko-tsu-pí, tng un-i̍k liû-hîng ê ji̍t, in-uī Bohol ê tāi-tsì í-king hông tsha̍k-sí.
English: for they vex you with their wiles, with which they have deceived you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of the prince of Midian, their sister, who was slain on the day of the plague in the matter of Peor.

Tailo: Iésu siū hāi liáu-āu, ū īng tsin tsē tsìng-kì hián-bîng I iáu ua̍h-.leh. Tī sì-tsa̍p kang ê tiong-kan, I hián-hiān hō͘ sù-tô͘ khuànn, tuì in kóng-khí Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê tāi-tsì.
English: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God's Kingdom.

Tailo: Hīnn-á nā kóng, Guá m̄-sī ba̍k-tsiu, só͘-í, bô sio̍k sing-khu. Hīnn-á bē in-uī án-ne tsiū bô sio̍k sing-khu.
English: If the ear would say, Because I'm not the eye, I'm not part of the body, it's not therefore not part of the body.

Tailo: Iésu kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, the̍h piáⁿ pun hō͘ in, hî mā sī án-ne pun hō͘ in.
English: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

Tailo: Io-lâm kóng, Thò tshia! Tsiū thò i ê tshia. Isulael ông Io-lâm kah Iôtah ông Ahatsiah tshut-.khì, ta̍k lâng tsē ka-kī ê tshia tshut-khì tsiap E-hú, tī E-tsu-le-el lâng Nabot ê hn̂g tú-tio̍h i.
English: Joram said, Make ready. They made ready his chariot. Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went out, each in his chariot, and they went out to meet Jehu, and found him in the portion of Naboth the Jezreelite.

Tailo: In mā kuáⁿ-tshut tsin-tsē kuí, īng iû buah tsin tsē pēnn-lâng, kā in i hó.
English: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

Tailo: I khuànn uī-tio̍h Ki-tok siū lîng-jio̍k pí Aigi̍p ê tsâi-pó khah kuì-khì, in-uī i gióng-bōng tsiong-lâi ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: accounting the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt; for he looked to the reward.

Tailo: In-uī guá kuat-tīng, tī lín tiong-kan tû-liáu Iésu Ki-tok kah I hông tìng si̍p-jī-kè ê sìn-sit í-guā, bô beh thê-khí kî-tha ê tāi-tsì.
English: For I determined not to know anything among you, except Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Kàu Guá pān lí ê ji̍t, lí ê sim kám iáu ē jím-siū? Lí ê tshiú kám iáu ē ū la̍t? Siōngtsú kóng tsit-ê uē, tsiū beh tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with you? I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and will do it.

Tailo: I ū nn̄g-ê bó͘, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Hannah, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Peninnah. Peninnah ū kiáⁿ-jî, Hannah bô kiáⁿ-jî.
English: and he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

Tailo: Tsiū huan-hù Biāniámín lâng kóng, Lín tio̍h khì bih tī phû-tô hn̂g tiong,
English: They commanded the children of Benjamin, saying, Go and lie in wait in the vineyards,

Tailo: Atonîiah kā i kóng, Ji̍p-.lāi! Lí sī thò-tòng ê lâng, it-tīng sī pò hó siau-sit.
English: While he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came: and Adonijah said, Come in; for you are a worthy man, and bring good news.

Tailo: In ta̍k ji̍t tī sìng-tiān lāi tâng-sim ha̍p-ì tsū-huē, mā khì ke-ke hō͘-hō͘ kí-hîng Sìng-tshan peh piáⁿ, īng huann-hí sîng-si̍t ê sim tsò-hué lim-tsia̍h, o-ló Siōngtè,
English: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng ìn I kóng, Guán ê tsó͘-sian sī Abulahàm. Iésu kā in kóng, Lín nā-sī Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, lín ē tsò Abulahàm só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: They answered him, Our father is Abraham. Jesus said to them, If you were Abraham's children, you would do the works of Abraham.

Tailo: Guá koh kā lín kóng, lo̍k-tô tshng-kuè tsiam-phīⁿ mā pí hó-gia̍h lâng ji̍p thian-kok khah kán-tan.
English: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Lí nā tuà hué-lô͘ só͘ piak ê lé-mi̍h tsò sò͘-tsè, tio̍h īng iù mī-hún ê bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, īng iû tiâu-hô ê á-.sī īng iû buah ê bô-kàⁿ ê po̍h piáⁿ.
English: When you offer an offering of a meal offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

Tailo: Koh tshe Isulael tiong ê siàu-liân lâng khì hiàn sio-tsè, mā īng gû tsò pîng-an-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: He sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to Yahweh.

Tailo: Gû-bó ti̍t-ti̍t ǹg Bia̍t-si-mé-si ê lō͘ khì, tuì tuā lō͘ kiânn, ná kiâⁿ ná háu, bô phian tsó mā bô phian iū. Huilīsū hiah-ê siú-líng tuè āu-bīn khì, lâi-kàu Bia̍t-si-mé-si ê kíng-kài.
English: The cows took the straight way by the way to Beth Shemesh; they went along the highway, lowing as they went, and didn't turn aside to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them to the border of Beth Shemesh.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ông A-to-nî-sé-tik thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iosiúah kong-tshú Ai siânn, kā siâⁿ tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-tiāu, khuán-thāi Ai siânn kah i ê ông, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ kah i ê ông, koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h tuà tī Gi-bóng ê jîn-bîn kah Isulael lâng li̍p hô-iok, tuà tī in tiong-kan,
English: Now it happened, when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;

Tailo: Aigi̍p tē lóng tī lí ê bīn-tsîng; hō͘ lí ê lāu-pē kah lí ê hiann-tī tuà tī kok lāi siōng hó ê só͘-tsāi. In thang tuà tī Go-sián ê tē. Lí nā tsai in tiong-kan khah ū pún-sū ê lâng, tsiū phài in kuán-kò͘ guá ê tsing-seⁿ.
English: The land of Egypt is before you. Make your father and your brothers dwell in the best of the land. Let them dwell in the land of Goshen. If you know any able men among them, then put them in charge of my livestock.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí ē kì-tit in, in-uī in uè lah-sap tsè-si ê tsit, uî-puē tsè-si Lēbī lâng ê iok.
English: Remember them, my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood, and of the Levites.

Tailo: Lín in-uī guá ê iân-kò͘ ē hō͘ tsìng lâng uàn-hūn,
English: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake.

Tailo: Guá ē hun-pia̍t guá ê jîn-bîn kah lí ê jîn-bîn, bîn-á-tsài ē ū tsit-ê sîn-jiah. '
English: I will put a division between my people and your people: by tomorrow shall this sign be.'

Tailo: Tsiū tio̍h kìm lí ê tsi̍h, bô kóng pháiⁿ uē; kìm lí ê tshuì-tûn, bô kóng kan-tsà ê uē.
English: Keep your tongue from evil, And your lips from speaking lies.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tam-tng tsè-si-tsit ê Lēbī ê kiáⁿ-sun, suî-jiân kah Isulael jîn-bîn lóng sī Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, pêⁿ-pêⁿ sī hiann-tī, iáu-koh tio̍h hōng bīng-līng, tsiàu lu̍t-huat tuì jîn-bîn tsing-siu in siu-ji̍p ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it.
English: They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest's office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham,

Tailo: Hit sî, Iôtah tsò I ê sìng-só͘, Isulael tsò I ê pang-kok.
English: Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

Tailo: Iésu khuàⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g tsiah tsûn tī ô͘-piⁿ, lia̍h-hî lâng lī-khui tsûn teh sé-bāng.
English: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn ji̍p-khì tó tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ á-.sī tó tsi̍t-ê hiuⁿ-siā, tio̍h thàm-thiaⁿ kî-tiong siáⁿ lâng guān-ì tsiap-thāi lín, tsiah-khì tuà hia, kàu lī-khui uî-tsí.
English: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy; and stay there until you go on.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, guān Lí ànn-lo̍h siàu-liām Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó kah khún-kiû, lâi thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kin-á-ji̍t tī Lí bīn-tsîng só͘ kî-tó ê kiû-kiò.
English: Yet have respect for the prayer of your servant, and for his supplication, Yahweh my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which your servant prays before you this day;

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si. ）Tuā kuân-lîng ê ê kiáⁿ, lín tio̍h kā îng-kng kah khuì-la̍t kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú!
English: Ascribe to Yahweh, you sons of the mighty, Ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

Tailo: Lí bô īng gîn uī Guá bé tshiong-pô͘, mā bô īng tsè-mi̍h ê iû hō͘ Guá pá-tsiok; tian-tò hō͘ Guá in-uī lí ê tsuē-ok lô-khó͘, hō͘ Guá in-uī lí ê tsuē-kò ià-siān.
English: You have bought me no sweet cane with money, neither have you filled me with the fat of your sacrifices; but you have burdened me with your sins, you have wearied me with your iniquities.

Tailo: Iâkop ê kiáⁿ Iôtah kah tshut-bē Iésu ê Ka-lio̍k lâng Iôtah.
English: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.

Tailo: tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê lóng tio̍h sǹg.
English: from thirty years old and upward until fifty years old shall you number them; all who enter in to wait on the service, to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Guá mā ē íng-uán kian-kò͘ i tī Guá ê ke, tī Guá ê kok; i ê tsō-uī mā ē kian-kò͘ kàu íng-uán. '
English: but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom forever; and his throne shall be established forever.

Tailo: I iā ê sî, ū ê ka-la̍uh tī lō͘ piⁿ. Tsiáu-á pue-.lâi, tsiū kā tsíng-tsí tsia̍h liáu-liáu.
English: and it happened, as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Iosiúah kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ in, in-uī Guá í-king kā in kau tī lí ê tshiú, in bô kah tsi̍t-ê lâng tī lí ê bīn-tsîng khiā ē tiâu.
English: Yahweh said to Joshua, Don't fear them: for I have delivered them into your hands; there shall not a man of them stand before you.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī só͘-ū ê iûⁿ kah gû, suaⁿ-iá ê tsáu-siù,
English: All sheep and oxen, Yes, and the animals of the field,

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h in-uī án-ne lâi suan-pò͘, tuì Go͘k kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Tng Guá ê jîn-bîn — Isulael an-jiân sing-ua̍h ê ji̍t, lí kám m̄-tsai?
English: Therefore, son of man, prophesy, and tell Gog, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: In that day when my people Israel dwells securely, shall you not know it?

Tailo: Tuì tuā hô kàu Huilīsū tē, it-ti̍t kàu Aigi̍p pian-kài hiah-ê kok, Só͘lômóng lóng kā in kuán-hat. Só͘lômóng ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t, in lóng lâi tsìn-kòng, kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt: they brought tribute, and served Solomon all the days of his life.

Tailo: Pîng-iú ê phah-siong sī tshut tī hó-ì; to̍k-to̍k tuì-ti̍k ê tsim-tshuì sī kuè-thâu tsē.
English: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; Although the kisses of an enemy are profuse.

Tailo: Ngó͘-siōng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē siau-bia̍t.
English: The idols shall utterly pass away.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín kah in teh piān-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: He asked the scribes, What are you asking them?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, m̄-thang pàng-sak guá! Guá ê Siōngtè ah, m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g!
English: Don't forsake me, Yahweh. My God, don't be far from me.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lín siūⁿ m̄-tio̍h à. Lín m̄-bat king-tián kah Siōngtè ê kuân-lîng.
English: But Jesus answered them, You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Tī tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, lín tio̍h tshú bô khuat-tiám ê gû-káng, lâi tshing-khì sìng-só͘.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: In the first month, in the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without blemish; and you shall cleanse the sanctuary.

Tailo: Tsetikiah ông tsiū bīng-līng kā I-é-lí-miah kuainn tī khu-liû-só͘ ê īⁿ, ta̍k ji̍t tuì tsò piáⁿ ê ke the̍h tsi̍t lia̍p mī-pau hō͘ i, ti̍t-kàu siâⁿ lāi bô mī-pau tsiah suah. Án-ne, I-é-lí-miah iû-guân tuà tī khu-liû-só͘ ê īⁿ lāi.
English: Then Zedekiah the king commanded, and they committed Jeremiah into the court of the guard; and they gave him daily a loaf of bread out of the bakers' street, until all the bread in the city was spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

Tailo: Ông tuì i ê jîn-bîn kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn — Isulael lâng pí lán khah tsē koh khah kiông.
English: He said to his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, in piàⁿ in ê pò͘-tē, siūnn bē kàu in ta̍k lâng ê gîn-pau lóng tī in ê pò͘-tē lāi; in kah in lāu-pē khuàⁿ-tio̍h gîn-pau tsiū lóng khí kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: It happened as they emptied their sacks, that behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack. When they and their father saw their bundles of money, they were afraid.

Tailo: In-uī lín tsit-ê ho̍k-sāi ê kang-tsok, m̄-nā kái-kuat sìn-tô͘ ê su-iàu, mā hō͘ tsin tsē lâng ke-thinn in tuì Siōngtè ê kám-siā.
English: For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints, but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God;

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn ji̍p-khì tó tsi̍t king tshù, tio̍h tuà tī hia, mā tio̍h tuì hia tshut-huat.
English: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

Tailo: Lán sī sio̍k Siōngtè. Jīn-bat Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k thiaⁿ lán, bô sio̍k Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k m̄-thiaⁿ lán. Án-ne, lán tsiū ē-tàng hun-pia̍t tsin-lí ê Sìng Sîn kah tshò-gō͘ ê lîng.
English: We are of God. He who knows God listens to us. He who is not of God doesn't listen to us. By this we know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Tailo: Koh tháu-pàng hiah-ê in-uī tuì sí-bông kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, suah it-sing teh tsò sí-bông lô͘-lē ê lâng.
English: and might deliver all of them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

Tailo: Guān ông ē thè khùn-khó͘ ê jîn-bîn sin-uan, ē kiù sàn-tshiah lâng, ē kā pō-gio̍k ê lâng teh tshuì.
English: He will judge the poor of the people. He will save the children of the needy, And will break the oppressor in pieces.

Tailo: mā tio̍h tuì kui khún ê thiu tām-po̍h, pàng tī tē-.ni̍h hō͘ i khioh, m̄-thang kā i huah.
English: Also pull out some for her from the bundles, and leave it, and let her glean, and don't rebuke her.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, in-uī Lí khé-sī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, kóng, ' Guá ē kā lí kiàn-li̍p ke. ' Só͘-í, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k hó-tánn īng tsit-ê kî-tó lâi tuì Lí kî-tó.
English: For you, Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, have revealed to your servant, saying, I will build you a house: therefore has your servant found in his heart to pray this prayer to you.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā in án-ne kóng: Hiah-ê m̄-sī tshòng-tsō thiⁿ-tē ê sîn-bîng lóng ē tuì tē-tsiūⁿ kah thian-hā bia̍t bô-.khì.
English: Thus shall you say to them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu tī tsûn-bué tó tī tsím-thâu teh khùn. Bûn-tô͘ kā I kiò-tshéⁿ, kóng, Lāu-su, guán teh beh bô miā lò͘, Lí kám bô teh iàu-kín?
English: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, Teacher, don't you care that we are dying?

Tailo: Gín-á tī i ê pak-lāi sio kheh, i tsiū kóng, Nā-sī án-ne, guá ná ē tú-tio̍h tsit khuán tāi-tsì? I tsiū khì mn̄g Siōngtsú.
English: The children struggled together within her. She said, If it be so, why do I live? She went to inquire of Yahweh.

Tailo: Ia-be-si ê tiúⁿ-ló kā i kóng, Kiû lí khuan-iông guán tshit ji̍t, hō͘ guán tshe lâng khì Isulael ê tsuân kíng; nā bô lâng kiù guán, guán tsiū tshut-lâi tsiū lí.
English: The elders of Jabesh said to him, Give us seven days' respite, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel; and then, if there be none to save us, we will come out to you.

Tailo: Tsit-ê un-tián teh kíng-kài lán tio̍h khì-sak bô kìng-khiân ê sing-ua̍h kah sio̍k-sè ê su-io̍k, tī tsit-ê sè-kan kuè siú-kí, kong-gī kah kìng-khiân ê sing-ua̍h,
English: instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present world;

Tailo: Khah sī-tuā ê bô tú-tú lóng ū tì-huī, khah ló-liân ê bô tú-tú lóng ē bîng-pi̍k kong-pêⁿ.
English: It is not the great who are wise, Nor the aged who understand justice.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê tiān kah ngó͘-siōng ná ē-tàng pâi tsò-hué? Lán sī íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtè ê tiān. Tsiàu Siōngtè só͘ kóng, guá beh kah Guá ê tsú-bîn tsò-hué tuà, tī in tiong-kan kiâⁿ-ta̍h. Guá beh tsò in ê Siōngtè, in mā beh tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn. (tsù, LBK 26:11-12)
English: What agreement has a temple of God with idols? For you are a temple of the living God. Even as God said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they will be my people.

Tailo: In hó kuè ji̍t-tsí, sū-sū hing-thong; tsi̍t-ba̍k-nih kú lo̍h im-kan.
English: They spend their days in prosperity. In an instant they go down to Sheol.

Tailo: Guá m̄-nā uī-tio̍h tsiah-ê lâng kî-kiû, mā uī-tio̍h tuì tsiah-ê lâng só͘ thuân ê tō-lí lâi sìn guá ê lâng kî-kiû,
English: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who believe in me through their word,

Tailo: M̄-thang kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t sio phiàn, in-uī lín í-king hòng-khì kū ê tsò lâng kah hîng-uî,
English: Don't lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old man with his doings,

Tailo: Iésu tsai tsiū kā in kóng, Lín ná ē beh thiau-lân tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng? I uī-tio̍h guá tsò tsi̍t hāng hó sū.
English: But Jesus, knowing this, said to them, Why do you trouble the woman? Because she has done a good work for me.

Tailo: Hit-ê ki-lō͘-ping tsi̍t ki si̍t mā sī gō͘ tiú, tshun-kàu tiān hit pîng ê piah; hit ki si̍t mā sī gō͘ tiú kah tsit-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t sio-tsiap.
English: The wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.

Tailo: Bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì, lóng bô hō͘ tuì-ti̍k phah tio̍h-kiaⁿ, án-ne thang tsìng-bîng in ē sit-pāi, lín ē tik-sìng. Tsit-ê tik-sìng lóng sī Siōngtè ê tsok-uî.
English: and in nothing frightened by the adversaries, which is for them a proof of destruction, but to you of salvation, and that from God.

Tailo: Guá tsiū kóng: Guá ê khuì-la̍t sue-pāi; jî-tshiánn guá tī Siōngtsú hia lóng bô ǹg-bāng!
English: I said, My strength is perished, and my expectation from Yahweh.

Tailo: Tabi̍t mn̄g i kóng, Lí sio̍k siáⁿ lâng? Tuì tó-uī lâi? I ìn kóng, Guá sī Aigi̍p ê siàu-liân lâng, sī Amáli̍k lâng ê lô͘-po̍k, in-uī guá saⁿ ji̍t tsîng phuà-pēⁿ, guá ê tsú-lâng tsiū kā guá pàng-sak.
English: David said to him, To whom belong you? and whence are you? He said, I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days ago I fell sick.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng tio̍h tuā-siaⁿ tuì Isulael jîn-bîn kóng,
English: The Levites shall answer, and tell all the men of Israel with a loud voice,

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm tuà tī Êlúsalèm, tī Iôtah tē khí kuí-nā-ê siâⁿ tsò siâⁿ-pó.
English: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem, and built cities for defense in Judah.

Tailo: Lūbiān ìn in kóng, Guá kám m̄-sī ū tuì lín kóng, m̄-thang hāi hit-ê gín-á lâi tshú-tsuē? M̄-koh, lín m̄-thiaⁿ. Só͘-í, lâu i ê hueh ê tsuē, tsit-má teh tuì lán tsiah-ê thó.
English: Reuben answered them, saying, Didn't I tell you, saying, Don't sin against the child,' and you wouldn't listen? Therefore also, behold, his blood is required.

Tailo: Iôséhuh hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ khuànn in lāu-pē í-king sí, tsiū kóng, Kiám-tshái Iôséhuh beh uàn-hūn lán, tsiàu lán í-tsîng kā i khuán-thāi só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ, tsuân-pō͘ kā lán pò-ho̍k.
English: When Joseph's brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, It may be that Joseph will hate us, and will fully pay us back for all of the evil which we did to him.

Tailo: In tú-tio̍h song-sū, bô lâng uī in peh piáⁿ, uī-tio̍h sí-lâng lâi kā in an-uì; in sí pē sí bú, mā bô lâng īng an-uì ê pue hō͘ in lim.
English: neither shall men break bread for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.

Tailo: Tú-hó tī Iésu ê bīn-tsîng ū tsi̍t-ê kó͘-tiòng-pēⁿ ê lâng.
English: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.

Tailo: I khiā-teh tuì Isulael ê kun-tuī huah, kā in kóng, Lín tshut-lâi pâi tuī-ngó͘ beh án-tsuáⁿ? Guá kám m̄-sī Huilīsū lâng, lín kám m̄-sī Sàulô ê lô͘-po̍k? Lín tiong-kan kíng tsi̍t-ê lâng, hō͘ i lo̍h-lâi guá tsia.
English: He stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, Why are you come out to set your battle in array? am I not a Philistine, and you servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.

Tailo: Lâng ua̍h tsin tsē nî, tsiū tio̍h khuài-lo̍k tsin tsē nî; tsóng-.sī, mā tio̍h siūⁿ kàu o͘-àm ê ji̍t-tsí, in-uī o͘-àm ê ji̍t-tsí ē tsin tsē. Só͘ beh lâi ê lóng sī khang-hi.
English: Yes, if a man lives many years, let him rejoice in them all; But let him remember the days of darkness, for they shall be many. All that comes is vanity.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, tī lín Isulael tē, ná ē ū tsit khuán sio̍k-gí kóng, ' Sî-ji̍t iân-tshiân, ī-siōng lóng bô ìng-giām '?
English: Son of man, what is this proverb that you have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged, and every vision fails?

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ i hong-huì, bô koh siu-tsíng, bô koh thû-thuáⁿ; tian-tò huat tshì-á kah tsi̍t-lê; guá mā ē bīng-līng hûn bô lo̍h hō͘ tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: I will lay it a wasteland. It won't be pruned nor hoed, But it will grow briers and thorns. I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain on it.

Tailo: I kā tsit-ê tshiong-tsiok ê un-tián sù hō͘ lán, kā ta̍k tsióng ê tshong-bîng tì-huī,
English: which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,

Tailo: Alông sí tī Hol suaⁿ ê sî, tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p saⁿ huè.
English: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died in Mount Hor.

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng, Thinn tíng ê kiong-tshong tio̍h ū huat kng ê thé, lâi hun-pia̍t mê-ji̍t, mā thang tsò tiāu-thâu, sù-kuì, ji̍t, nî,
English: God said, Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;

Tailo: Lâng nā ū nn̄g-ê bó͘, tsi̍t-ê sī i só͘ thiàⁿ ê, tsi̍t-ê sī i só͘ uàn ê, lóng ū kā i seⁿ kiáⁿ, tsóng-.sī, tuā-kiáⁿ sī só͘ uàn ê bó͘ só͘ seⁿ ê.
English: If a man have two wives, the one beloved, and the other hated, and they have borne him children, both the beloved and the hated; and if the firstborn son be hers who was hated;

Tailo: Tshiùⁿ kua ê Asah ê kiáⁿ-sun, khiā tī in ê uī, tsiàu Tabi̍t, Asah, Hemán kah ông ê sian-kiàn E-to-tòng só͘ bīng-līng ê, kò͘-mn̂g ê lâng kò͘-siú ta̍k-ê mn̂g, in m̄-bián lī-khui in ê kang, in-uī in ê hiann-tī Lēbī lâng ū thè in tsún-pī.
English: The singers the sons of Asaph were in their place, according to the commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun the king's seer; and the porters were at every gate: they didn't need to depart from their service; for their brothers the Levites prepared for them.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì tuè i ê lâng kóng, Lín ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h phāinn to! In tsiū lóng phāinn to, Tabi̍t mā phāinn to. Kin-tuè Tabi̍t tsiūⁿ-khì ê tsha-put-to ū sì pah lâng, lâu nn̄g pah lâng tī hia kò͘-siú tsa̍p-mi̍h.
English: David said to his men, Gird you on every man his sword. They girded on every man his sword; and David also girded on his sword: and there went up after David about four hundred men; and two hundred abode by the baggage.

Tailo: In khì ê sî, Guá beh kā Guá ê bāng pha tī in ê tíng-bīn; Guá beh hō͘ i tuī-lo̍h, tshin-tshiūnn khong-tiong ê tsiáu. Guá beh tsiàu in ê huē-tsiòng só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê lâi kā in khián-tsik.
English: When they go, I will spread my net on them. I will bring them down like the birds of the sky. I will chastise them, as their congregation has heard.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Tso-lô-ba-bel, E-siu-ah kah kî-tha Isulael tso̍k tiong ê láu-tuā, kā in kóng, Guán beh khí guán ê Siōngtè ê tiān, lín bô hūn, guán ka-kī beh uī Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè hia̍p-li̍k khí-tsō, sī tsiàu Phelsiah ông — Ko-le-si ông só͘ bīng-līng guán ê.
English: But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the heads of fathers' houses of Israel, said to them, You have nothing to do with us in building a house to our God; but we ourselves together will build to Yahweh, the God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia has commanded us.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Moreover the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tē-tshit ji̍t tio̍h sé lín ê saⁿ, lín tsiū tshing-khì; tsiah thang ji̍p-khì iâⁿ lāi.
English: You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean; and afterward you shall come into the camp.

Tailo: Tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah tshú tsi̍t-ê kuī, tī kuī-kuà tsha̍k tsi̍t khang, hē tī tuâⁿ piⁿ, tī ji̍p Siōngtsú tiān ê tsiànn pîng. Pé-mn̂g ê tsè-si kā tuà-ji̍p Siōngtsú tiān ê gîn hē tī kuī lāi.
English: But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one comes into the house of Yahweh: and the priests who kept the threshold put therein all the money that was brought into the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá ê bīn in-uī lâu ba̍k-sái tsiū piàn âng; tī guá ê ba̍k-tsiu phuê ū sí ê ìm-ńg.
English: My face is red with weeping. Deep darkness is on my eyelids.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h hiàn sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, kā hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng, uī-tio̍h i ê bô tshing-khì sio̍k-tsuē, jiân-āu thâi hit-ê sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ.
English: The priest shall offer the sin offering, and make atonement for him who is to be cleansed because of his uncleanness: and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering;

Tailo: Kā hiah-ê iûⁿ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guá ê Thiⁿ-pē, pí it-tshè lóng khah uí-tāi, bô lâng ē-tàng kā in tuì Thiⁿ-pē ê tshiú tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father's hand.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê tshù tī Sī-lô hiah-ê ji̍t, Tàn ê lâng uī ka-kī tshāi Mika só͘ tsò tiau-khik ê siōng.
English: So they set them up Micah's engraved image which he made, all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.

Tailo: Gín-á tuā-hàn, ū tsi̍t ji̍t tshut-khì kàu i ê lāu-pē, kàu siu-kuah ê lâng hia.
English: When the child was grown, it fell on a day, that he went out to his father to the reapers.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ah, Êlúsalèm ah, lí thâi-sí sian-ti, īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm-sí Siōngtè tshe-phài kàu tī lín tsia ê sù-tsiá. Guá guā tsē pái ài tsū-tsi̍p lí ê kiáⁿ-jî, tshin-tshiūnn ke-bó tsū-tsi̍p i ê ke-á-kiáⁿ tī si̍t-ē, m̄-koh, lín bô ài.
English: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá bô siong-sìn lâng sí-liáu ē koh ua̍h ê Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng lâi tshuē Iésu.
English: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Kā jîn-bîn só͘-ū ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tng-thâu pe̍h-ji̍t tiàu-sí tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, hō͘ Siōngtsú ê tuā siū-khì thang tuì Isulael siau-bia̍t.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Take all the chiefs of the people, and hang them up to Yahweh before the sun, that the fierce anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in thí-tshiò Siōngtè ê sù-tsiá, biáu-sī I ê uē, khau-sé I ê sian-ti, it-ti̍t kàu Siōngtsú tuì I ê tsú-bîn tuā siū-khì, bô huat-tō͘ thang i-tī.
English: but they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and scoffed at his prophets, until the wrath of Yahweh arose against his people, until there was no remedy.

Tailo: kî-tiong king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu kah tsong-tso̍k, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-tshing la̍k-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p miâ.
English: even those who were numbered of them, by their families, by their fathers' houses, were two thousand six hundred thirty.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng mn̄g Iésu kóng, Sī siáⁿ-mi̍h kài-bīng? Iésu ìn kóng, M̄-thang thâi-sí-lâng, m̄-thang kiânn kan-îm, m̄-thang thau-the̍h, m̄-thang lām-sám tsò kiàn-tsìng,
English: He said to him, Which ones? Jesus said, You shall not murder.' You shall not commit adultery.' You shall not steal.' You shall not offer false testimony.'

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá kám m̄-sī kíng lín tsa̍p-jī lâng? Lín tiong-kan mā ū tsi̍t-ê sī Mô͘-kuí!
English: Jesus answered them, Didn't I choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?

Tailo: Tsin hán-tit ū lâng ē thè gī lâng sí; kiám-tshái ū lâng káⁿ thè hó lâng sí.
English: For one will hardly die for a righteous man. Yet perhaps for a righteous person someone would even dare to die.

Tailo: Guá beh khui tshuì kóng phì-jū; guá beh kóng-tshut kó͘-tsá ê ò-pì,
English: I will open my mouth in a parable. I will utter dark sayings of old,

Tailo: Kā lín ê lāu-pē kah lín ê ka-kuàn lóng puaⁿ-lâi guá tsia, guá beh kā Aigi̍p tē ê hó mi̍h hō͘ lín, lín mā thang tsia̍h tsit só͘-tsāi ê san-tin hái-bī.
English: Take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.'

Tailo: In koh hō͘ mn̂g guā ê lâng, tuì sè kàu tuā, ba̍k-tsiu hîn-hîn, lóng khuànn bē-tio̍h; tshuē kàu siān, mā tshuē bô mn̂g.
English: They struck the men who were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great, so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

Tailo: Iâkop tuì i kóng, Guá ê Tsú tsai tsiah-ê gín-á nńg-tsiáⁿ, gû-iûⁿ mā tú-á seⁿ, nā tsò tsi̍t ji̍t kuáⁿ, kui kûn lóng ē sí-.khì.
English: Jacob said to him, My lord knows that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds with me have their young, and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die.

Tailo: Lín tshut-la̍t lô-khó͘ ē khang-khang, in-uī lín ê tē bô tshut i ê lông-sán-bu̍t, tē ê tshiū-ba̍k mā bô kiat i ê kué-tsí.
English: and your strength will be spent in vain; for your land won't yield its increase, neither will the trees of the land yield their fruit.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê thiàⁿ Êlúsalèm ê, tio̍h kah i tâng khuài-lo̍k, uī i huann-hí; lín uī-tio̍h i pi-ai ê, taⁿ tio̍h kah i huann-hí khuài-lo̍k;
English: Rejoice you with Jerusalem, and be glad for her, all you who love her: rejoice for joy with her, all you who mourn over her;

Tailo: Huē tiong ê tiúⁿ-ló tsiū tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī gû-káng-á ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú, tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thâi hit tsiah gû-káng-á.
English: The elders of the congregation shall lay their hands on the head of the bull before Yahweh; and the bull shall be killed before Yahweh.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng: Bān-kok ē tshing lín tsò ū hok-khì ê, in-uī lín ê tē ē tsiâⁿ-tsò thang huann-hí ê tē.
English: All nations shall call you blessed, for you will be a delightful land, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim ê nî-kan, Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal khí-.lâi. E-hō͘-iá-kim kā i ho̍k-sāi sann nî, āu-lâi tian-tò kā i puē-gi̍k.
English: In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years: then he turned and rebelled against him.

Tailo: Koh hiah-ê kià-kha tī lín tiong-kan ê tshut-guā lâng ê kiáⁿ-jî, í-ki̍p in kah lín tuà hiah-ê ka-kuàn, tī lín ê só͘-tsāi só͘ seⁿ ê, lín mā thang tuì in tiong-kan bé lâng lâi, in beh tsò lín ê ka-gia̍p.
English: Moreover of the children of the strangers who sojourn among you, of them you may buy, and of their families who are with you, which they have conceived in your land; and they will be your property.

Tailo: Iésu bīng-līng guán thuân hok-im hō͘ só͘-ū ê lâng, tsìng-si̍t I sī Siōngtè só͘ jīm-bīng lâi tsò ua̍h-lâng kah sí-lâng ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ.
English: He charged us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

Tailo: koh ū Iôséhuh tsuân ke kah i hiah-ê hiann-tī, í-ki̍p i ê lāu-pē ê ka-kuàn, tsí ū in ê gín-á kah iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn, lóng lâu tī Go-sián tē.
English: all the house of Joseph, his brothers, and his father's house. Only their little ones, their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.

Tailo: Lín m̄-bat I, to̍k-to̍k guá bat I. Guá nā kóng guá m̄-bat I, guá tsiū kah lín kāng-khuán sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; to̍k-to̍k guá bat I, mā tsun-siú I ê tō-lí.
English: You have not known him, but I know him. If I said, I don't know him,' I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and keep his word.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn guán tuì lín ê thiàⁿ-sim ná ke-thinn, guān Tsú hō͘ lín hō͘-siong ê thiàⁿ-sim kah thiàⁿ tsìng lâng ê sim mā ji̍t-ji̍t ke-thinn.
English: and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we also do toward you,

Tailo: Jiáu-luān pîng-tsīng liáu-āu, Páulô tiàu-tsi̍p bûn-tô͘, kā in kó͘-lē, jiân-āu kah in sio-sî, tsiū tshut-huat khì Ma-ke-tó-niah.
English: After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples, took leave of them, and departed to go into Macedonia.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsòng tī Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ. I ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Siōngtsú siū-khì Isulael lâng, kā in bē hō͘ Huilīsū lâng ê tshiú tiong kah Ammóng lâng ê tshiú tiong.
English: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Bô lâng-iân ê lú-tsú tshut-kè, lú-pī tshú-tāi tsú-bó.
English: For an unloved woman when she is married; And a handmaid who is heir to her mistress.

Tailo: In thâi-sí kuáⁿ-hū kah tshut-guā lâng, koh hāi-sí ko͘-jî.
English: They kill the widow and the alien, And murder the fatherless.

Tailo: Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap kah Tabi̍t ê jîn-sîn mā tshut-.lâi, tī Gi-bóng ê tî piⁿ sio tú-.tio̍h; in tsiū tsē lo̍h-.lâi, tsi̍t tuī tsē tī tî ê tsit pîng, tsi̍t tuī tsē tī tî ê hit pîng.
English: Joab the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David, went out, and met them by the pool of Gibeon; and they sat down, the one on the one side of the pool, and the other on the other side of the pool.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì tē-á lāi piàⁿ-tshut kim, īng thian-phîng tshìn gîn, koh tshiàⁿ gîn-tshiūⁿ tsè-tsō sîn-pu̍t, jiân-āu in phak-lo̍h, koh kā i kuī-pài.
English: Some pour out gold from the bag, and weigh silver in the balance. They hire a goldsmith, and he makes it a god. They fall downyes, they worship.

Tailo: I koh kiông-pik tsìng lâng, bô-lūn tuā-sè, hó-gia̍h á-.sī sàn-tshiah, tsū-iû ê á-.sī tsò lô͘-po̍k ê, lóng tio̍h tī tsiàⁿ tshiú á-.sī thâu-hia̍h khàm ìn tsò kì-hō.
English: He causes all, the small and the great, the rich and the poor, and the free and the slave, to be given marks on their right hands, or on their foreheads;

Tailo: Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ kā Iésu kóng, Lāu-su, lâi tsia̍h.
English: In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying, Rabbi, eat.

Tailo: thǹg Alông ê saⁿ, kā i ê kiáⁿ Êlīatsal tshīng; Alông ē sí tī hia, tńg-khì tsó͘-ke.
English: and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be gathered to his people, and shall die there.

Tailo: Hit-ê siann tē-jī pái tuì i kóng, Siōngtè só͘ hō͘ i tshing-khì ê, lí m̄-thang lia̍h-tsò lah-sap.
English: A voice came to him again the second time, What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.

Tailo: In-uī guá īng thó͘-khuì tāi-thè tsia̍h-mi̍h; guá tuā-siaⁿ háu, tshin-tshiūnn tuā-tsuí tshìng tshut-.lâi.
English: For my sighing comes before I eat, My groanings are poured out like water.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài kā i hiat lo̍h-khì bô-té tshim kheⁿ, kuainn khí-.lâi, koh īng hong-ìn hong khí-.lâi, hō͘ i bē-tàng koh bê-hi̍k lia̍t kok, it-ti̍t kàu tsi̍t tshing nî muá; tsit-ê kî-hān liáu-āu, i it-tīng ē tsiām-sî siū tháu-pàng.
English: and cast him into the abyss, and shut it, and sealed it over him, that he should deceive the nations no more, until the thousand years were finished. After this, he must be freed for a short time.

Tailo: Tio̍h thiah-li̍h lín ê sim, m̄-thang thiah-li̍h lín ê saⁿ. Kui-ǹg Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè; in-uī I ū jîn-tsû, liân-bín, bô khuài siū-khì, muá-muá un-huī, koh hō͘-hué I ê tsai-hō.
English: Tear your heart, and not your garments, And turn to Yahweh, your God; For he is gracious and merciful, Slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, And relents from sending calamity.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ìn kóng, Guá ka-kī tsi̍t-ê ta̍h tsiú-khut; tsìng lâng ê tiong-kan bô tsi̍t-ê lâng kah Guá tông-tsāi. Guá siū-khì kā in ta̍h, tuā siū-khì kā in thún-ta̍h. In ê hueh tsuāⁿ tī Guá ê saⁿ, koh hō͘ Guá só͘-ū ê saⁿ-khò͘ bô tshing-khì.
English: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the peoples there was no man with me: yes, I trod them in my anger, and trampled them in my wrath; and their lifeblood is sprinkled on my garments, and I have stained all my clothing.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-liōng kuáⁿ-kín lâi guá tsia.
English: Be diligent to come to me soon,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tio̍h sîng-jīn só͘ uàn ê bó͘ ê kiáⁿ tsò tuā-kiáⁿ, kā só͘-ū ê sán-gia̍p hō͘ i siang-hūn, in-uī tsit-ê sī i khuì-la̍t ê khí-thâu, tuā-kiáⁿ ê miâ-hūn sī i ê.
English: but he shall acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the hated, by giving him a double portion of all that he has; for he is the beginning of his strength; the right of the firstborn is his.

Tailo: Bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h siù, m̄-thang kah i kau-ha̍p lâi uè lah-sap ka-kī. Tsa-bó͘ lâng mā m̄-thang khiā tī siù ê thâu-tsîng kah i kau-ha̍p, tse sī gi̍k-sìng ê tāi-tsì.
English: You shall not lie with any animal to defile yourself with it; neither shall any woman give herself to an animal, to lie down with it: it is a perversion.

Tailo: Sī thinn-tíng, á-.sī tē-tsiūⁿ, á-.sī jīm-hô siū-tsō-bu̍t, lóng bē-tàng tshiat-tn̄g Siōngtè thong-kuè Tsú Ki-tok Iésu tuì lán ê thiàⁿ!
English: nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Tailo: Hó thâu put-jû hó bué. Sim jím-nāi iâⁿ-kuè sim kiau-ngō͘.
English: Better is the end of a thing than its beginning. The patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

Tailo: Baal tsiàu Palân ê uē lâi kiâⁿ; Baal kah Palân tī ta̍k tsō ê tuâⁿ, hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng.
English: Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram.

Tailo: Isulael lâng koh kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú tsiū hō͘ Mô͘ap ông Egúlóng kiông-sīng, lâi kong-kik Isulael lâng, in-uī in kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê.
English: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

Tailo: to̍h-sī huē-bō͘, i ê pò͘-pênn kah i ê kuà, i ê kau, i ê pán, i ê huâiⁿ-kông, i ê thiāu, i ê khū,
English: the tent, its outer covering, its roof, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets;

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko tsiū kiânn tsìn-tsîng, tuì tsē tī pó-tsō hit uī ê tsiàⁿ tshiú the̍h hit kńg tsheh.
English: Then he came, and he took it out of the right hand of him who sat on the throne.

Tailo: Kóng, Ki-tok ah, Lí sī sian-ti, tann kā guán kóng, siáⁿ lâng kā Lí phah?
English: saying, Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Guá beh koh hō͘ tsi̍t hāng tsai-hō lîm-kàu Huâ-láu kah Aigi̍p, jiân-āu i ē tsún lín lī-khui tsia. I tsún lín lī-khui ê sî, i ē kā lín lóng tuì tsia kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Yet one plague more will I bring on Pharaoh, and on Egypt; afterwards he will let you go. When he lets you go, he will surely thrust you out altogether.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá īng lín huān tsuē ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī lín só͘ tsù ê gû-á, īng hué sio-tiāu, koh kā i gíng kah iù-iù, iù kah tshin-tshiūnn thô͘-sua hún, guá kā tsit-ê thô͘-sua hún iā tī tuì suaⁿ tíng lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê khe.
English: I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust: and I cast the dust of it into the brook that descended out of the mountain.

Tailo: Tsiàu guá só͘ kah-ì ê, tsú hō͘ i ū hó tsu-bī, phâng lâi hō͘ guá tsia̍h, hō͘ guá tī buē sí tsìn-tsîng, kā lí tsiok-hok.
English: Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, tio̍h kā lí ê sim hiàn hō͘ guá, lí ê ba̍k-tsiu mā tio̍h ì-ài guá ê lō͘,
English: My son, give me your heart; And let your eyes keep in my ways.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín m̄-thang hō͘-siong kóng pháiⁿ uē; kóng hiann-tī tsí-muē ê pháiⁿ uē á-.sī phue-phîng hiann-tī tsí-muē ê lâng, to̍h-sī teh kóng lu̍t-huat ê pháiⁿ uē, teh phue-phîng lu̍t-huat. Lí nā phue-phîng lu̍t-huat, tsiū m̄-sī siú lu̍t-huat ê lâng, sī teh phue-phîng lu̍t-huat.
English: Don't speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Tailo: In khòng-kò kóng, Guán khuànn tsit-ê lâng bê-hi̍k guán ê jîn-bîn, kìm-tsí lâng la̍p-suè hō͘ hông-tè, koh tsū-tshing tsò Ki-tok, tsò ông.
English: They began to accuse him, saying, We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.

Tailo: I tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông sì-tsa̍p-it nî, i ê A-má miâ kiò-tsò Mákah, sī Αpsalôm ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Forty-one years reigned he in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

Tailo: Biāniámín tē Anáthot siâⁿ ê tsè-si tiong, Hilkíiah ê kiáⁿ I-é-lí-miah ê uē kì tī ē-té:
English: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsáu-.khì, tô-siám khì-kàu La̍h-má, kìnn Samuel, kā Sàulô tuì i só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lóng kā i kóng. I kah Samuel tsiū khì Na-iot tuà.
English: Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. He and Samuel went and lived in Naioth.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē pîng-iú ê lâng ū sî ē ka-kī tsū tshú bia̍t-bông; ū tsi̍t-ê ti-kí ê pîng-iú ē pí hiann-tī khah tshin.
English: A man of many companions may be ruined, But there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

Tailo: Tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng kám bē liáu-kái? In thun-tsia̍h guá ê jîn-bîn tshin-tshiūnn teh tsia̍h piáⁿ. In mā bô kiû-kiò Siōngtè.
English: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And don't call on God?

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ Gilia̍t-iabesi ê lâng, kā in kóng, Guān Siōngtsú sù-hok hō͘ lín, in-uī lín īng tsit-ê jîn-tsû khuán-thāi lí ê tsú Sàulô, kā i bâi-tsòng.
English: David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh Gilead, and said to them, Blessed be you of Yahweh, that you have shown this kindness to your lord, even to Saul, and have buried him.

Tailo: I kā Abúlâm tsiok-hok, kóng, Guān thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú, tsì-kuân Siōngtè sù-hok hō͘ Abúlâm!
English: He blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth:

Tailo: In ê ba̍k-tsiu kan-taⁿ ài khuànn siâ-îm; in huān tsuē bô suah; in bê-hi̍k sim bô kian-kò͘ ê lâng; in ê sim kuàn-sì tham-tsâi, ing-kai tio̍h siū Siōngtè ê tsiù-tsó͘.
English: having eyes full of adultery, and who can't cease from sin; enticing unsettled souls; having a heart trained in greed; children of cursing;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tsai koh siong-sìn Siōngtè thiàⁿ lán. Siōngtè to̍h-sī thiàⁿ; sèⁿ-miā lāi ū thiàⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī ua̍h tī Siōngtè lāi-bīn, Siōngtè mā kah i kiat-liân.
English: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.

Tailo: lí kám ū huat-tō͘ hō͘ kng khiú tē ê sì-ki̍k, thang kā pháiⁿ lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì?
English: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And shake the wicked out of it?

Tailo: Iésu kî-tó suah, khiā khí-.lâi, khì-kàu sù-tô͘ hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in in-uī iu-būn suah khùn-.khì.
English: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,

Tailo: Siú-bōng ê lâng kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h thâu-tsîng teh tsáu ê tshin-tshiūnn Tsa-tok ê kiáⁿ Ahimâtsu teh tsáu ê khuán. Ông kóng, I sī hó lâng, lâi pò hó siau-sit.
English: The watchman said, I think the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. The king said, He is a good man, and comes with good news.

Tailo: Asah só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tuì-thâu kàu-bué lóng kì tī Iôtah kah Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k.
English: Behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Kàu hit ji̍t, Guá kám bô tuì Etóm tû-bia̍t tì-huī ê lâng, tuì Esáu ê suaⁿ tû-bia̍t tshong-bîng ê lâng?
English: Won't I in that day, says Yahweh, destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of the mountain of Esau?

Tailo: Tī guá huān-lān ê ji̍t, guá tsáu-tshuē Tsú; tī àm-sî, guá gia̍h-khí tshiú, bô thîng kî-tó; guá ê sim m̄-khíng siū an-uì.
English: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord. My hand was stretched out in the night, and didn't get tired. My soul refused to be comforted.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiàu guá ê kong-gī kā guá pò-tap, tsiàu guá ê tshiú ê tshing-khì kā guá pò-siúⁿ.
English: Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands has he recompensed me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Hit sî, Iosiúah kiò Lūbiān lâng, Ga̍t lâng kah Mánáse puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê lâng lâi,
English: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,

Tailo: Koh tuì hiah-ê kui tī Siōngtsú tsò sìng, kà-sī Isulael lâng ê Lēbī lâng, kóng, Lín tio̍h kā sìng ê iok-kuī hē tī Isulael ông Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ Só͘lômóng só͘ khí ê tiān lāi, m̄-bián lín īng king-kah-thâu kng. Taⁿ lín tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè kah I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng.
English: He said to the Levites who taught all Israel, who were holy to Yahweh, Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel did build; there shall no more be a burden on your shoulders: now serve Yahweh your God, and his people Israel.

Tailo: In tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê the-sî. Thâu tsi̍t-ê kā i kóng, ' Guá ū bé tsi̍t khu hn̂g, it-tīng tio̍h khì khuànn lè. Tshiáⁿ lí liōng-kái. '
English: They all as one began to make excuses. The first said to him, I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.'

Tailo: Guá beh tshun Guá ê tshiú, kong-kik Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, mā beh tuì tsit-ê só͘-tsāi tsián-tû Baal só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, í-ki̍p Ka-mal（ Tsù, Pài ngó͘-siōng ê tsè-si ）ê miâ kah tsè-si.
English: I will stretch out my hand against Judah, and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place: the name of the idolatrous and pagan priests,

Tailo: Án-ne, lí ê kng ē huat-tshut, tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí ê kng, lí ê siong ē tsin kín tit-tio̍h i hó. Lí ê kong-gī beh kiâⁿ tī lí ê thâu-tsîng; Siōngtsú ê îng-kng beh tsò lí āu-bīn ê pó-hō͘.
English: Then shall your light break forth as the morning, and your healing shall spring forth speedily; and your righteousness shall go before you; the glory of Yahweh shall be your rear guard.

Tailo: Lín ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tī khòng-iá phiau-liû sì-tsa̍p nî, tam-tng lín îm-hīng ê tsuē, it-ti̍t kàu lín ê sin-si tī khòng-iá siau-bia̍t.
English: Your children shall be wanderers in the wilderness forty years, and shall bear your prostitution, until your dead bodies be consumed in the wilderness.

Tailo: Guá tī sè-kan ê sî, guá sī sè-kan ê kng.
English: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng só͘ tsò ê tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ún-tàng, Lí ê sím-phuàⁿ i bô khuànn tsāi gán-lāi; i biáu-sī só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: His ways are prosperous at all times; He is haughty, and your laws are far from his sight: As for all his adversaries, he sneers at them.

Tailo: Tse m̄-sī kóng guán ka-kī ū tsâi-tiāu tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì; guán ê tsâi-tiāu sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê.
English: not that we are sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God;

Tailo: Tàn tso̍k hiah-ê la̍k pah lâng tuà kun-khì, lóng khiā tī mn̂g-kháu.
English: The six hundred men girt with their weapons of war, who were of the children of Dan, stood by the entrance of the gate.

Tailo: Kan-taⁿ ū kuí-nā-ê tuì A-si-a síng lâi ê Iô-tá-iah lâng tī hia. In nā beh kò guá, ing-kai ka-kī lâi lí ê bīn-tsîng kò guá tsiah tio̍h ah.
English: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael lâng kah Lēbī lâng tio̍h kā in hiàn tsè ê ngó͘-kok, sin tsiú kah iû, tuà kàu siu-tsông sìng-só͘ ê khì-kū ê pâng-king, to̍h-sī tam-tng tsit ê tsè-si, kò͘-mn̂g ê kah tshiùⁿ kua ê teh tuà ê pâng-king. Án-ne, guán tsiū bô beh pàng-sak guán Siōngtè ê tiān.
English: For the children of Israel and the children of Levi shall bring the wave offering of the grain, of the new wine, and of the oil, to the chambers, where are the vessels of the sanctuary, and the priests who minister, and the porters, and the singers: and we will not forsake the house of our God.

Tailo: Thau-khuàⁿ tē ê gō͘-ê lâng tsiū ji̍p-.khì, kā tiau-khik ê siōng, tsè-si ho̍k, tshù lāi ê siōng kah tsù ê siōng lóng the̍h-.khì. Tsè-si kah tuà kun-khì ê la̍k pah lâng tsò-hué khiā tī mn̂g-kháu.
English: The five men who went to spy out the land went up, and came in there, and took the engraved image, and the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image: and the priest stood by the entrance of the gate with the six hundred men girt with weapons of war.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Guá kám tsò kīn ê Siōngtsú, bô tsò hn̄g ê Siōngtsú?
English: Am I a God at hand, says Yahweh, and not a God afar off?

Tailo: Io-si-iah tsē-uī ê sî peh huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông kiōng saⁿ-tsa̍p it nî.
English: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign; and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Guá ê ài-jîn-á, lí ê tshuì-tûn tshin-tshiūnn bi̍t-pâng ê bi̍t teh tih, lí ê tsi̍h ē ū bi̍t ū ling; lí ê saⁿ-khò͘ ê phang-bī tshin-tshiūnn Le-ba-nòng ê phang-bī.
English: Your lips, my bride, drip like the honeycomb. Honey and milk are under your tongue. The smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.

Tailo: Kàu siu-sîng ê sî, lín tio̍h kā gō͘-hūn tsi-it la̍p hō͘ Huâ-láu, sì-hūn kui lín, tsò tshân-.ni̍h ê tsíng-tsí, mā tsò lín kah lín tshù lāi ê lâng, í-ki̍p lín ê gín-á ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: It will happen at the harvests, that you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and four parts will be your own, for seed of the field, for your food, for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.

Tailo: Su-san kiong ū tsi̍t-ê Iôtah lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Moltékái, sī Biāniámín lâng Kisi ê kan-á-sun, Simí ê sun, Iail ê kiáⁿ.
English: There was a certain Jew in Shushan the palace, whose name was Mordecai, the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjamite,

Tailo: Ē ū to-kiàm lîm-kàu Aigi̍p; tī Aigi̍p siū thâi ê lâng tó lo̍h-.khì ê sî, Kú-si̍t lâng tsiū ū thòng-khó͘, in ē lia̍h i ê tsìng lâng, thiah-huí i ê tē-ki.
English: A sword shall come on Egypt, and anguish shall be in Ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in Egypt; and they shall take away her multitude, and her foundations shall be broken down.

Tailo: Guān Lí kā Lí ê siū-khì piàⁿ-lo̍h-khì hiah-ê m̄-bat Lí ê guā-pang, í-ki̍p hiah-ê bô kiû-kiò Lí ê miâ ê lia̍t kok.
English: Pour out your wrath on the nations that don't know you; On the kingdoms that don't call on your name;

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ông tuì Isulael jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan phài lâng-kang, só͘ phài ê lâng-kang kiōng saⁿ bān.
English: King Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.

Tailo: Tuì tiúⁿ-ló ê khòng-kò, nā m̄-sī ū nn̄g-ê á-.sī saⁿ-ê tsìng-jîn, tsiū m̄-thang siū-lí.
English: Don't receive an accusation against an elder, except at the word of two or three witnesses.

Tailo: Tshim-ian kóng: bô tī guá tsia; tuā hái kóng: bô kah guá tông-tsāi.
English: The deep says, It isn't in me.' The sea says, It isn't with me.'

Tailo: Hô-.ni̍h ê hî ē sí, hô tsuí mā ē piàn tshàu-bī, Aigi̍p lâng tsiū ē thó-ià lim hô ê tsuí. '
English: The fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall become foul; and the Egyptians shall loathe to drink water from the river.'

Tailo: Tsú tshut bīng-līng, thuân hó siau-sit ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiâⁿ tuā-tīn.
English: The Lord announced the word. The ones who proclaim it are a great company.

Tailo: Alông tio̍h īng siang tshiú huāⁿ tī ua̍h ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê thâu-khak, tī i ê tíng-bīn sîng-jīn Isulael lâng só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ, kuè-sit kah in só͘-ū ê tsuē-kò; lóng kui tī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê thâu-khak, kau-tài só͘ phài ê lâng, sàng-khì khòng-iá.
English: Aaron shall lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, even all their sins; and he shall put them on the head of the goat, and shall send him away into the wilderness by the hand of a man who is in readiness.

Tailo: Ísak tuà tī Lâm-tē, hit sî í-king tuì Pí-jíⁿ-la̍h-hái-lâi ê lō͘ lâi.
English: Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, for he lived in the land of the South.

Tailo: Tsè-si sim-lāi huann-hí, tsiū the̍h tsè-si ho̍k kah tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng, í-ki̍p tiau-khik ê siōng, kiânn tī jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan.
English: The priest's heart was glad, and he took the ephod, and the teraphim, and the engraved image, and went in the midst of the people.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê phàⁿ ê suī kā hit tshit suī phauh koh pá-muá ê thun lo̍h-.khì. Huâ-láu tshénn khí-.lâi, tsiah tsai sī teh bîn-bāng.
English: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven healthy and full ears. Pharaoh awoke, and behold, it was a dream.

Tailo: Tho-má-suh, mā kiò-tsò Ti-tu-mô͘( siang-seⁿ-á ê ì-sù ), sī tsa̍p-jī bûn-tô͘ ê tsi̍t-ê, Iésu kàu ê sî, i bô tsò-hué tī hia.
English: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn't with them when Jesus came.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē kā i tshì-thàm, it-ti̍t kàu I só͘ kóng ê ìng-giām.
English: Until the time that his word happened, And Yahweh's word proved him true.

Tailo: Tsè-si Etsula̍h khí-.lâi, kā in kóng, Lín ū tsuē, lín tshuā guā-pang ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, ke-thinn Isulael lâng ê tsuē.
English: Ezra the priest stood up, and said to them, You have trespassed, and have married foreign women, to increase the guilt of Israel.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Isulael lâng phah-piàⁿ tui-kiû, siūⁿ beh tuì lu̍t-huat lâi kah Siōngtè ū hô-hó ê kuan-hē, kiat-kó mā bô tit-tio̍h.
English: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, didn't arrive at the law of righteousness.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Iôséhuh tshiú tiong ê tāi-tsì, kuán-kaⁿ ê it-khài bô tshap, in-uī Siōngtsú kah Iôséhuh tông-tsāi, jî-tshiánn i só͘ tsò ê, Siōngtsú lóng hō͘ i hing-thong.
English: The keeper of the prison didn't look after anything that was under his hand, because Yahweh was with him; and that which he did, Yahweh made it prosper.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, kuan-hē sian-tsó͘ Tabi̍t ê tāi-tsì, guá ē-tàng hó-tánn tuì lín kóng, i í-king sí koh bâi-tsòng, i ê bōng kàu kin-á-ji̍t iáu tī lán tsia.
English: Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t tio̍h tsò-kang, to̍k-to̍k tē-tshit ji̍t sī an-hioh ê tuā ji̍t, sī Siōngtsú ê sìng-ji̍t. Só͘-ū tī An-hioh-ji̍t tsò-kang ê lâng, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to Yahweh. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: I tio̍h thâi pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè ê iûⁿ-á, tsè-si tshú tām-po̍h-á pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè ê hueh, buah tī hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê kah tsiàⁿ tshiú ê tuā-thâu-bú kah tsiàⁿ-kha ê tuā-thâu-bú.
English: He shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering. The priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

Tailo: Guá — Iésu í-king tshe-phài guá ê thiⁿ-sài khì tsiah-ê kàu-huē, tuì lín tsìng-bîng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, guá sī Tabi̍t ê kin-thâu, koh sī i ê kiáⁿ-sun, sī kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ ê khé-bîng-tsheⁿ.
English: I, Jesus, have sent my angel to testify these things to you for the assemblies. I am the root and the offspring of David; the Bright and Morning Star.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tī lâng ê bīn-tsîng sîng-jīn guá ê, guá mā beh tī guá Thiⁿ-pē ê bīn-tsîng sîng-jīn i.
English: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kóng, Tī tsia kám bô Siōngtsú ê sian-ti, lán thang thok i lâi mn̄g Siōngtsú? Isulael ông tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k ìn kóng, Tsîng piàⁿ tsuí tī Eliiah ê tshiú ê, Siahuat ê kiáⁿ Elísiah tī tsia.
English: But Jehoshaphat said, Isn't there here a prophet of Yahweh, that we may inquire of Yahweh by him? One of the king of Israel's servants answered, Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.

Tailo: Apnel tò tńg-lâi-kàu Hebúlông, Ioap tshuā i lâi-kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, ké beh thau-thau-á kah i kóng-uē, tsiū tī hia tsha̍k-thàu i ê pak-tó͘, i tsiū sí. Tse sī uī-tio̍h i ê sió-tī Asahel hō͘ i thâi-sí.
English: When Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside into the midst of the gate to speak with him quietly, and struck him there in the body, so that he died, for the blood of Asahel his brother.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ, in-uī lí beh hō͘ tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tit-tio̍h hit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī Guá tuì in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā beh hō͘ in ê.
English: Be strong and of good courage; for you shall cause this people to inherit the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú huann-hí sún-hāi i, hō͘ i siū thòng-khó͘; i ê ua̍h-miā tsò sio̍k-tsuē ê tsè, hit sî i ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ-sun, koh ke-thinn huè-siū, Siōngtsú só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì ē tī i ê tshiú tiong hing-thong.
English: Yet it pleased Yahweh to bruise him; he has put him to grief: when you shall make his soul an offering for sin, he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of Yahweh shall prosper in his hand.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsun-thàn bīng-līng, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng gia̍h kuái-á.
English: Moses took the rod from before Yahweh, as he commanded him.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng kā Iôséhuh ê saⁿ siu tī i hia, thìng-hāu i ê tsú-lâng tńg-.lâi,
English: She laid up his garment by her, until his master came home.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā i kóng, ' Tsin hó, hó koh tsīn-tiong ê lô͘-po̍k, lí kì-jiân tī sió-sió ê tāi-tsì tsīn-tiong, guá beh phài lí lâi kuán-lí tuā ê tāi-tsì. Tshiánn ji̍p-lâi kah guá tsò-hué khuài-lo̍k. '
English: His lord said to him, Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.'

Tailo: In koh mn̄g Palosih kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, lí īng siáⁿ khuán lâi siá i só͘ thuân it-tshè ê uē?
English: They asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How did you write all these words at his mouth?

Tailo: In tsàu ông ê pió-tsiuⁿ lāi ū kóng, Guān Ta-lió-suh ông bān sū pîng-an.
English: they sent a letter to him, in which was written thus: To Darius the king, all peace.

Tailo: Hong beh tshue khì tó-uī tsiū tshue khì tó-uī, lí ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h siaⁿ, m̄-tsai i tuì tó-uī lâi, beh tuì tó-uī khì. Ta̍k-ê tuì Sìng Sîn lâi tshut-sì ê lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don't know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.

Tailo: I tuì Lâm-tē tsiām-tsiām suá khì Bethel, kàu tī Bethel kah Ai siânn ê tiong-kan, in tsá-tsîng tah pò͘-pêⁿ ê só͘-tsāi,
English: He went on his journeys from the South even to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,

Tailo: kìng-jiân kiau-ngō͘ lâi kong-kik thinn-tíng ê Tsú. Lí ū tshe lâng tuà I tiān lāi ê khì-kū kàu tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, lí kah lí tsiah-ê tāi-sîn í-ki̍p lí ê hō͘-hui lóng īng i lâi lim tsiú. Lí koh o-ló hiah-ê gîn, kim, tâng, thih, tshâ kah tsio̍h-thâu só͘ tsò ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī bē khuànn, bē thiaⁿ, bē tsai ê; tsóng-.sī, kuán lí ê tshuán-khuì, tiāⁿ-tio̍h lí ê tso-gū ê Siōngtè, lí khiok bô îng-kng I.
English: but have lifted up yourself against the Lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessels of his house before you, and you and your lords, your wives and your concubines, have drunk wine from them; and you have praised the gods of silver and gold, of brass, iron, wood, and stone, which don't see, nor hear, nor know; and the God in whose hand your breath is, and whose are all your ways, you have not glorified.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tsit-ê khùn-khó͘ koh tsuì, khiok m̄-sī in-uī tsiú lâi tsuì ê lâng, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ.
English: Therefore hear now this, you afflicted, and drunken, but now with wine:

Tailo: Tuì taⁿ í-āu, bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng lóng m̄-thang kā guá kiáu-jiáu, in-uī guá ê sing-khu ū tuà Iésu ê siong-jiah, tsìng-bîng guá sī I ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: From now on, let no one cause me any trouble, for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus branded on my body.

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí it-tshè ê kài-bīng, lí nā tsip-siú lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kiânn I hiah-ê tō-lō͘, tsiū tī tsit saⁿ-ê siâⁿ í-guā, tio̍h koh uī ka-kī ke siat saⁿ-ê siâⁿ.
English: if you shall keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you this day, to love Yahweh your God, and to walk ever in his ways; then shall you add three cities more for you, besides these three:

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Akisi tsiū kā Tsik-lak hō͘ i, in-uī án-ne, Tsik-lak sio̍k Iôtah ông, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day: why Ziklag pertains to the kings of Judah to this day.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ ê kun-ông, tuā-kuaⁿ, kun-tiúⁿ, hó-gia̍h lâng, ū sè-li̍k ê, í-ki̍p só͘-ū tsò lô͘-po̍k ê kah tsū-iû ê, lóng khì bih tiàm suaⁿ-tōng kah suaⁿ-giâm.
English: The kings of the earth, the princes, the commanding officers, the rich, the strong, and every slave and free person, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô beh pó-sioh lí, Guá mā bô beh khó-liân lí, sī beh tsiàu lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ kā lí pò-ìng, lí khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì ē kui tī lí ê tiong-kan. Lín tsiū tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: My eye shall not spare you, neither will I have pity; but I will bring your ways on you, and your abominations shall be in the midst of you: and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: I ê tuā-tsé lâi kā Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kóng, Guá lâi-khì Hi-bú-lâi tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tiong-kan kiò tsi̍t-ê ling-bú, kā lí io tsit-ê gín-á, kám hó?
English: Then his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, Should I go and call a nurse for you from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for you?

Tailo: Guá kuan-khuàⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ki-lō͘-ping thâu-khak tíng kah kiong-tshong ê tiong-kan, ū tshin-tshiūnn nâ-sik ê pó-tsio̍h, tshin-tshiūnn pó-tsō ê hîng-siōng ê khuán-sit.
English: Then I looked, and see, in the expanse that was over the head of the cherubim there appeared above them as it were a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.

Tailo: Guān in tshin-tshiūnn tshuah lâu ê tsuí siau-sit-khì; in ê tsìnn teh beh siā ê sî, guān in ê tsìnn-thâu tn̄g khì.
English: Let them vanish as water that flows away. When they draw the bow, let their arrows be made blunt.

Tailo: Guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn jia̍t phut-phut. Guá tiām-tiām siūⁿ ê sî, hué tsiū to̍h khí-.lâi, guá tsiū īng tsiap lâi kóng.
English: My heart was hot within me. While I meditated, the fire burned: I spoke with my tongue:

Tailo: In nn̄g lâng tī ta̍k-ê kàu-hē kā in siat-li̍p tiúⁿ-ló, kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, kā in kau-thok tī in só͘ sìn ê Tsú.
English: When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

Tailo: M̄-sī tshing-ho͘ Guá ' Tsú ah, Tsú ah'ê lâng lóng ē-tàng ji̍p-khì thian-kok; kan-taⁿ si̍t-hiān Guá ê Thiⁿ-pē tsí-ì ê lâng, tsiah ē-tàng ji̍p-.khì.
English: Not everyone who says to me, Lord, Lord,' will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì guá án-ne kóng, Lí khì khiā tī tsìng lâng ê mn̂g, to̍h-sī Iôtah lia̍t ông tuì hia ji̍p, tuì hia tshut ê, koh khiā tī Êlúsalèm tsiah-ê mn̂g,
English: Thus said Yahweh to me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, through which the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

Tailo: Ū īng gîn phah kui phìⁿ, tuì Talsisih tuà-.lâi ê, mā ū tuì U-huah lâi ê kim, lóng sī sai-hū kah gîn-tshiūⁿ ê tshiú tsò ê, koh ū nâ-sik tsí-sik ê liāu tsò saⁿ, lóng sī kî-khiáu ê sai-hū tsò ê.
English: There is silver beaten into plates, which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the artificer and of the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple for their clothing; they are all the work of skillful men.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán tuì Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, koh beh thuân hō͘ lín ê sìn-sit sī án-ne, Siōngtè sī kng, tī I lāi-bīn uân-tsuân bô o͘-àm.
English: This is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ tì-huī lâng ê uē; tsuan-sim lâi niá-siū guá ê tì-sik.
English: Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.

Tailo: Guān tuì guá kóng Ho͘h, lí tshám à! ê lâng, in-uī kiàn-siàu lâi bia̍t-bông!
English: Let them be desolate by reason of their shame that tell me, Aha! Aha!

Tailo: Só͘-ū ài beh kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân lâi kuè kìng-khiân sing-ua̍h ê lâng, lóng ē siū pik-hāi.
English: Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.

Tailo: Tabi̍t lia̍h i ê bé-ping tsi̍t-tshing tshit-pah kah pō͘-ping nn̄g bān, Tabi̍t kā tsiàn-tshia ê bé kuah-tn̄g i ê kha-kin, tsí ū lâu tsi̍t pah tâi tshia ê bé.
English: David took from him one thousand seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for one hundred chariots.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guán sí à, guán bia̍t-bông à, lóng bia̍t-bông à.
English: The children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, Behold, we perish, we are undone, we are all undone.

Tailo: Tsetikiah ông tshe Malkiiah ê kiáⁿ Pasihul kah tsè-si Maaseiah ê kiáⁿ Tse-huán-iah, khì kìⁿ I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, when king Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Tabi̍t phah Huilīsū lâng, hō͘ in khut-ho̍k, koh tuì Huilīsū lâng ê tshiú tsing-ho̍k Gat kah i ê hiuⁿ-lí.
English: After this it happened, that David struck the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.

Tailo: I án-ne kóng, m̄-sī in-uī i kuan-sim sàn-tshiah lâng, sī in-uī i sī tsha̍t, koh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ thau-the̍h i só͘ kuán-lí ê kong-khuáⁿ.
English: Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kah Iôtah lâng tsiū khí-.lâi, huah-hiàm, jiok Huilīsū lâng, kàu Ka-í kah Ik-lóng ê siâⁿ mn̂g. Tio̍h siong ê Huilīsū lâng tó tī Sia-la̍h-im ê lō͘, it-ti̍t kàu Gat kah Ik-lóng.
English: The men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until you come to Gai, and to the gates of Ekron. The wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even to Gath, and to Ekron.

Tailo: I mā kā lán khàm ìn tsò kì-hō, koh siúⁿ-sù Sìng Sîn tī lán ê sim-lāi tsò tam-pó.
English: who also sealed us, and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts.

Tailo: King-ha̍k kàu-su Etsula̍h khiā tī in uī-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì só͘ tsún-pī ê tshâ-tâi tíng. Tī i ê sin piⁿ ū Mat-ta-thí-iah, Sī-má, A-ná-iah, Ulīa, Hilkíiah kah Maaseiah, khiā tī i ê tsiànn pîng; Petáiah, Misael, Malkiiah, Ha-siúm, Ha-si-bat-ta-nah, Tsa-kha-lī-a kah Mesiulám, khiā tī i ê tò pîng.
English: Ezra the scribe stood on a pulpit of wood, which they had made for the purpose; and beside him stood Mattithiah, and Shema, and Anaiah, and Uriah, and Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, on his right hand; and on his left hand, Pedaiah, and Mishael, and Malchijah, and Hashum, and Hashbaddanah, Zechariah, and Meshullam.

Tailo: Lâng tó tī bîn-tshn̂g teh khùn, kàu i khùn tāng-bîn ê sî, tī bîn-bāng tiong, tī àm-sî ê ī-siōng tiong,
English: In a dream, in a vision of the night, When deep sleep falls on men, In slumbering on the bed;

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Tio̍h put-sî īng sìn-sim tsò tîn-pâi, tsiah ē-tàng phah-bia̍t siâ-ok tsiá ê hué-tsìnn.
English: above all, taking up the shield of faith, with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one.

Tailo: Guá tī àm-tiong kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h tī kng-bîng ê só͘-tsāi kóng tshut-.lâi; àⁿ tī hīⁿ-khang kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h tī tshù-bué-tíng suan-iông tshut-.khì.
English: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.

Tailo: Guá tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí ê sî, guá ê tshuì-tûn kah Lí só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê guá ê lîng-hûn beh huann-hí tshut siaⁿ;
English: My lips shall shout for joy! My soul, which you have redeemed, sings praises to you!

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan nā ū kiù-hun, tio̍h hō͘-siong khuan-iông, hō͘-siōng sià-bián; tshin-tshiūnn Tsú ū sià-bián lín, lín mā tio̍h án-ne hō͘-siōng sià-bián.
English: bearing with one another, and forgiving each other, if any man has a complaint against any; even as Christ forgave you, so you also do.

Tailo: Phah kó͘ ê khuài-lo̍k lóng bô-.khì; iàn-lo̍k ê siann-im lóng suah, tuâⁿ khîm ê khuài-lo̍k mā lóng siau-sit-.khì.
English: The mirth of tambourines ceases. The sound of those who rejoice ends. The joy of the harp ceases.

Tailo: Guá koh īng âng-pó-tsio̍h tsō lí ê siâⁿ kak-thâu, īng âng-gi̍k tsō lí ê siâⁿ mn̂g, īng pó-tsio̍h tsō lí sì-kho͘-uî ê pian-kài.
English: I will make your pinnacles of rubies, and your gates of emeralds, and all your border of precious stones.

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun, to̍h-sī tuà tī in ê siâⁿ guā ê tshân-tē ê tsè-si, tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ ū kì miâ ê lâng, lâi hun-huat in ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê hūn-gia̍h, hō͘ tsè-si ê tsa-po͘ ting, í-ki̍p kiàn-nā kì tī tso̍k-phó͘ ê Lēbī lâng.
English: Also for the sons of Aaron the priests, who were in the fields of the suburbs of their cities, in every city, there were men who were mentioned by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests, and to all who were reckoned by genealogy among the Levites.
