Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h tsiàu guán í-tsîng kā lín huan-hù ê, tio̍h li̍p-tsì kuè pîng-tsīng ê sing-ua̍h, tsīn ka-kī ê pún-hūn tshin-tshiú tsò-kang lâi î-tshî ka-kī ê sing-ua̍h,
English: and that you make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, even as we charged you;

Tailo: Tī lán ê ông iàn-lo̍k ê ji̍t, tsiah-ê siú-líng in-uī lia̍t-tsiú lâi phuà-pēⁿ; i kah bú-bān ê lâng khan-tshiú.
English: On the day of our king, the princes made themselves sick with the heat of wine. He joined his hand with mockers.

Tailo: In ná kiâⁿ khuì-la̍t ná ke-thinn, ta̍k lâng lâi-kàu Si-óng tiâu-kìnn Siōngtè.
English: They go from strength to strength. Everyone of them appears before God in Zion.

Tailo: Ài thâi lâng ê lâng uàn-hūn uân-siān ê lâng; to̍k-to̍k tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ē-tàng pó-siú ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: The bloodthirsty hate a man of integrity; And they seek the life of the upright.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá ê khîm piàn-tsò pi-ai ê im, guá ê siau piàn-tsò thî-khàu ê siann.
English: Therefore is my harp turned to mourning, And my pipe into the voice of those who weep.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ kah tuà tī Iô-tá-iah ê sìn-tô͘ lóng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h guā-pang lâng mā tsiap-siū Siōngtè ê tō-lí.
English: Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

Tailo: Samuel tsiū īng kak lāi ê iû, tī i hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ ê tiong-kan kā i buah iû. Τuì hit ji̍t khí, Siōngtsú ê Sìng Sîn tuā-tuā lîm-kàu Tabi̍t. Samuel tshut-huat tńg-khì La̍h-má.
English: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brothers: and the Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.

Tailo: Lí nā tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê uē, tsip-siú tsit-ê lu̍t-huat só͘ kì ê kài-bīng lu̍t-lē, koh tsīn-sim tsīn-sìng kui-ǹg Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè,
English: Yahweh your God will make you plenteous in all the work of your hand, in the fruit of your body, and in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground, for good: for Yahweh will again rejoice over you for good, as he rejoiced over your fathers;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guán ê Siōngtè tī thinn-tíng, lóng tsiàu I só͘ ài ê tsò tāi-tsì.
English: But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever he pleases.

Tailo: Io-si-iah ê nî-kan, Aigi̍p ông Pa-lo-ne-koh khì Iu-hu-la-té tuā hô kong-kik Asiul ông, Io-si-iah khì kā i tí-tòng. Aigi̍p ông tī Megitóng tú-tio̍h Io-si-iah, tsiū kā i thâi.
English: In his days Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and Pharaoh Necoh killed him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí sī guá ê ting, Siōngtsú ē tsiò-kng tī guá ê o͘-àm.
English: For you are my lamp, Yahweh; Yahweh will lighten my darkness.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Lán ê tsó͘-sian m̄-khíng thiaⁿ i ê uē, tian-tò kā i kī-tsua̍t, siūⁿ beh tò tńg-khì Aigi̍p.
English: to whom our fathers wouldn't be obedient, but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,

Tailo: Ông, taⁿ kiû lí huann-hí tsiap-la̍p guá ê khó͘-khǹg, īng kiânn kong-gī lâi tuān-tsua̍t lí ê tsuē-kò, īng liân-bín sàn-tshiah lâng lâi tû-khì lí ê kuè-sit, án-ne kiám-tshái lí ê pîng-an ē kú-tn̂g.
English: Therefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable to you, and break off your sins by righteousness, and your iniquities by showing mercy to the poor; if there may be a lengthening of your tranquillity.

Tailo: at-tn̄g i siōng bué-liu ê tsíⁿ ki, the̍h kàu sing-lí-tiûⁿ, hē tī bé-bē ê lâng ê siâⁿ.
English: he cropped off the topmost of the young twigs of it, and carried it to a land of traffic; he set it in a city of merchants.

Tailo: Ko-le-si ông guân nî, Ko-le-si ông tshut līng, kuan-hē tī Êlúsalèm Siōngtè ê tiān kóng, tio̍h khí hit king tiān, thang tsò hiàn tsè ê só͘-tsāi, tē-ki hē hō͘ i ê kian-kò͘, tiān kuân la̍k-tsa̍p tiú, khuah la̍k-tsa̍p tiú,
English: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be built, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the foundations of it be strongly laid; the height of it sixty cubits, and the breadth of it sixty cubits;

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Kun-ông nā kā sán-gia̍p hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê, to̍h-sī tsò i ê sán-gia̍p, kui tī i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, sī in sîng-tsiap tsò sán-gia̍p ê.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: If the prince give a gift to any of his sons, it is his inheritance, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.

Tailo: Thian-kok tshin-tshiūnn ē-bīn ê phì-jū, tsa̍p-ê tsāi-sik-lí gia̍h ting tshut-khì gîng-tsiap sin-lông.
English: Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.

Tailo: Guá beh án-ne thiah-huí lín tshíng hue-tsuí ê tshiûⁿ, thiah kàu pêⁿ-tē, tì-sú tshiûⁿ-ki lō͘-hiān, tshiûⁿ ē tó-huāi, lín mā ē tī hit tiong-kan bia̍t-bông. Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: So will I break down the wall that you have daubed with whitewash, and bring it down to the ground, so that the foundation of it shall be uncovered; and it shall fall, and you shall be consumed in the midst of it: and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Ísak tshut-sì peh ji̍t, Abulahàm tsiàu Siōngtè só͘ huan-hù ê kā i ê kiáⁿ kiânn kat-lé.
English: Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.

Tailo: I tsiū kā tshing-it gîn hîng i ê lāu-bú, i ê lāu-bú kóng, Guá í-king tuì guá ê tshiú īng tsit-ê gîn, uī guá ê kiáⁿ hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, thang tiau-khik tsi̍t sian siōng, tsù tsi̍t sian siōng. Τaⁿ guá iû-guân koh kau lí.
English: He restored the eleven hundred pieces of silver to his mother; and his mother said, I most assuredly dedicate the silver to Yahweh from my hand for my son, to make an engraved image and a molten image: now therefore I will restore it to you.

Tailo: á-.sī khong-tiong pue-tsiáu ê siōng, á-.sī tē-tsiūⁿ teh sô ê mi̍h ê siōng, á-.sī tē-hā tsuí tiong hî-luī ê siōng.
English: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Lēbī tsi-tso̍k lí m̄-thang tiám-sǹg, mā m̄-thang tī Isulael tiong sǹg in ê tsóng-gia̍h.
English: Only the tribe of Levi you shall not number, neither shall you take a census of them among the children of Israel;

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Siōngtè hō͘ in ê sim-sîn bâ-pì, ba̍k-tsiu bô khuànn-kìnn, hīⁿ-khang bô thiann-kìnn, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t. （ Tsù, SBK 29:4; ISI 29:10)
English: According as it is written, God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, to this very day.

Tailo: Iâkop ke, Isulael ê tsú-bîn só͘-ū iáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá ê uē: Lín tuì tshut-sì tsiū hō͘ Guá āiⁿ, tuì tshut thai tsiū hō͘ Guá phō.
English: Listen to me, house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, that have been borne by me from their birth, that have been carried from the womb;

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h bīn ǹg Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, lâi tuì in suan-pò͘,
English: Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy to them,

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng beh seⁿ kiáⁿ tsiū iu-būn, in-uī i ê sán-kî kàu à; enn-á tshut-sì liáu-āu, i suah bē kì-tit seⁿ kiáⁿ ê thòng-khó͘, in-uī i ē huaⁿ-hí ū enn-á tshut-sì tī sè-kan.
English: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn't remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ē lóng thiaⁿ-tio̍h lâi kiaⁿ, bô koh ngē-ngē beh kiâⁿ.
English: All the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.

Tailo: Hiah-ê the̍h tshit tè uáⁿ ê tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài, kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê lâi kah guá kóng-uē, kóng, Lâi, guá beh hō͘ lí khuàⁿ hit-ê tuā îm-hū, to̍h-sī khí-tsō tī tsin-tsē tiâu hô hit-ê tuā siâⁿ só͘ tio̍h siū ê sím-phuàⁿ.
English: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and spoke with me, saying, Come here. I will show you the judgment of the great prostitute who sits on many waters,

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Iô-tá-iah lâng huán-tuì, guá put-tik-í tsiah tuì Lô-má hông-tè siōng-sò͘. Kî-si̍t guá bô ì-sù beh khòng-kò ka-kī ê tông-pau.
English: But when the Jews spoke against it, I was constrained to appeal to Caesar, not that I had anything about which to accuse my nation.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí liân-bín guá, hō͘ guá koh ióng-kiāⁿ khí-.lâi, thang kā in pò-ho̍k!
English: But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me, and raise me up, That I may repay them.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k kā hit pún hē tī su-kì Elísiamah ê pâng, tsiah ji̍p-khì īⁿ lāi kìnn ông, kā tsiah-ê uē lóng kóng hō͘ ông thiaⁿ.
English: They went in to the king into the court; but they had laid up the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe; and they told all the words in the ears of the king.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kóng, Bîn-á-tsài. Mô͘se kóng, Τhang tsiàu lí ê uē, hō͘ lí tsai guán ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú bô tsi̍t-ê ē pí-phīng-.tit.
English: He said, Tomorrow. He said, Be it according to your word, that you may know that there is none like Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Ammóng lâng ê ông m̄-khíng thiaⁿ I-é-hú-thah tshe lâng tuì i kóng ê uē.
English: However the king of the children of Ammon didn't listen to the words of Jephthah which he sent him.

Tailo: Iésu tsìn-ji̍p Êlúsalèm, ji̍p-khì sìng-tiān lāi, sì-kè khuànn tsi̍t liàn-tńg. In-uī thiⁿ í-king àm à, Iésu tsiū kah tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ tshut-.khì, khì-kàu Bē-tha-niah.
English: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

Tailo: Iô-thàm kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, bâi-tsòng tī Tabi̍t siâⁿ. I ê kiáⁿ Akhàtsuh suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Ahaz his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Kàu Ki-tóng ê tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ, in-uī gû kha that-tio̍h, Utsà tshun tshiú-huānn hit-ê kuī.
English: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.

Tailo: Guán ê tuì-ti̍k, lóng ǹg guán tuā-tuā khui tshuì.
English: All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Tsiàu-kò͘ sàn-tshiah lâng ê lâng ū hok-khì! Tng huān-lān ê ji̍t, Siōngtsú ē kiù i.
English: Blessed is he who considers the poor: Yahweh will deliver him in the day of evil.

Tailo: Tī lín tiong-kan ū lō͘-hiān lāu-pē ê ē-sin, tī lín tiong-kan ū lîng-jio̍k gue̍h-king bô tshing-khì ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê.
English: In you have they uncovered their fathers' nakedness; in you have they humbled her who was unclean in her impurity.

Tailo: Tsit-má ua̍h-.leh lâi sìn guá ê lâng, íng-uán bē sí. Lí ū án-ne sìn bô?
English: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?

Tailo: Suà lo̍h-.lâi, Isulael lâng án-ne kî-tó, Siōngtsú ah, to̍k-to̍k Lí sī Siōngtsú! Lí tshòng-tsō thiⁿ kah tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê thiⁿ kah thinn-tíng ê bān-kun, tē kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê bān-mi̍h, hái kah hái tiong ê bān-mi̍h, tse it-tshè lóng sī Lí só͘ pó-tsûn ê. Thian-kun mā kìng-pài Lí.
English: You are Yahweh, even you alone; you have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their army, the earth and all things that are thereon, the seas and all that is in them, and you preserve them all; and the army of heaven worships you.

Tailo: tsiū hiàn tsè hō͘ i ê bāng-á, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ i ê tuā bāng, in-uī in tuì tsiah-ê tit-tio̍h puî koh suí ê hūn-gia̍h kah tshiong-tsiok ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Therefore he sacrifices to his net, and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious, and his food is good.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín m̄-sī tī o͘-àm tiong teh kuè-ji̍t, hit-ê ji̍t bē tshin-tshiūnn tsha̍t-á hut-jiân-kan lâi-kàu lín tau.
English: But you, brothers, aren't in darkness, that the day should overtake you like a thief.

Tailo: Tī lo̍k-hn̂g, i thiaⁿ-tio̍h bē tit thang kóng ê uē, to̍h-sī lâng só͘ m̄-thang kóng ê tāi-tsì.
English: how he was caught up into Paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

Tailo: Kiám-tshái in khíng tsun-thàn, ta̍k lâng huê-thâu lī-khui in ê pháiⁿ lō͘, guá tsiū uī-tio̍h in só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, siūⁿ beh kàng hō͘ in ê tsai-hō lâi hō͘-hué.
English: It may be they will listen, and turn every man from his evil way; that I may repent me of the evil which I purpose to do to them because of the evil of their doings.

Tailo: Lín nā sio̍k tsit sè-kan, sè-kan tsiū ē khuànn lín tsò ka-kī ê lâng lâi thiàⁿ lín; to̍k-to̍k In-uī lín bô sio̍k tsit sè-kan, guá í-king kā lín tuì sè-kan kíng-suán tshut-.lâi, só͘-í, sè-kan ē uàn-hūn lín.
English: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang kah in kāng-khuán, in-uī lín iáu-buē kiû tsìn-tsîng, Thiⁿ-pē í-king tsai-iáⁿ lín ê su-iàu.
English: Therefore don't be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.

Tailo: Siōngtè lîm-kàu Palân, mn̄g i kóng, Kah lí tuà tsò-hué hiah-ê lâng sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: God came to Balaam, and said, What men are these with you?

Tailo: Nā-sī tsiáng-kuân-.ê ê sim-sîn siūⁿ beh kong-kik lí, m̄-thang lī-khui lí ê pún uī, in-uī un-hô ē bián-tit tuā ê kuè-sit.
English: If the spirit of the ruler rises up against you, don't leave your place; for gentleness lays great offenses to rest.

Tailo: I tsik-pī hái hō͘ i ta, mā hō͘ tsiah-ê hô lóng bô tsuí. Basiáng kah Kal-mel sue-pāi, Le-ba-nòng ê hue-ba̍k mā sue-pāi.
English: He rebukes the sea, and makes it dry, and dries up all the rivers. Bashan languishes, and Carmel; and the flower of Lebanon languishes.

Tailo: Hò͘ⁿ-tsiú kah tham-tsia̍h ê lâng, lí m̄-thang kah i óng-lâi tsò-tīn.
English: Don't be among ones drinking too much wine, Or those who gorge themselves on meat:

Tailo: Isulael ông kah Iôtah ông kah Etóm ông tsiū khì, kiâⁿ-se̍h tshit ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, kun-tuī kah tuè in ê tsing-seⁿ bô tsuí thang lim.
English: So the king of Israel went, and the king of Judah, and the king of Edom; and they made a circuit of seven days' journey: and there was no water for the army, nor for the animals that followed them.

Tailo: Sin-lông khah uànn kàu, hiah-ê tsāi-sik-lí suah lóng tuh-ku khùn-.khì.
English: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng ē ín-iú Ahap, hō͘ i tsiūⁿ-khì Gilia̍t ê La̍h-mot, sí tī hia? ' Tsit-ê kóng án-ne, hit-ê kóng án-ne.
English: Yahweh said, Who shall entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth Gilead? One said on this manner; and another said on that manner.

Tailo: Kelsióng ê kiáⁿ-sun king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu kah tsong-tso̍k,
English: Those who were numbered of the sons of Gershon, their families, and by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: Ài kā lâng kiù-tsìng koh bú-bān ê lâng, ka-kī tsio lâi lîng-jio̍k; tsik-pī pháiⁿ lâng, ē hō͘ ka-kī kiàn-siàu.
English: He who corrects a mocker invites insult. He who reproves a wicked man invites abuse.

Tailo: Kiû Lí kì-liām, Lí bat ná tshin-tshiūnn teh tshiau-thô͘ lâi tsè-tsō guá; Lí kám sī beh hō͘ guá koh kui tī thô͘-hún?
English: Remember, I beg you, that you have fashioned me as clay. Will you bring me into dust again?

Tailo: Sîn-lîng tsiū ji̍p-lâi guá ê lāi-bīn, hō͘ guá khiā khí-.lâi. I kah guá kóng-uē, tuì guá kóng, Lí khì, lí tio̍h ka-kī kuainn tī tshù lāi.
English: Then the Spirit entered into me, and set me on my feet; and he spoke with me, and said to me, Go, shut yourself within your house.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bē kì-tit Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè, khì ho̍k-sāi tsiah-ê Baal kah A-si-tha-lot.
English: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and forgot Yahweh their God, and served the Baals and the Asheroth.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tsin tsē, bē-tàng kng uá-khì Iésu ê sin piⁿ, in tsiū tī Iésu tíng-bīn ê tshù tíng thiah tsi̍t khang, thang kā piàn-suī-.ê teh tó ê pho͘-á luī lo̍h-.khì.
English: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

Tailo: Tuì hok-im ê kuan-tiám lâi khuànn, in-uī lín ū tsiap-siū, in khiok kī-tsua̍t, só͘-í, in tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōngtè ê tuì-ti̍k; tuì siū kíng-suán ê kuan-tiám lâi khuànn, in-uī Siōngtè tài-liām tuì in tsó͘-sian ê ìng-ín, só͘-í, in tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōngtè só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng.
English: Concerning the Good News, they are enemies for your sake. But concerning the election, they are beloved for the fathers' sake.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tē, bí-niûⁿ tuì hia tshut; i ê ē-té tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ hué kā i píng khí-.lâi.
English: As for the earth, out of it comes bread; Underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.

Tailo: Tsuē-ok tī i ê tshuì suî-jiân tinn, suî-jiân i khǹg tī i ê tsi̍h hē;
English: Though wickedness is sweet in his mouth, Though he hide it under his tongue,

Tailo: Tī lia̍t pang tiòng-tio̍h kóng, Siōngtsú tsò ông! Sè-kài kian-kò͘ bē iô-tāng; I ē tsiàu kong-pêⁿ sím-phuàⁿ bān-bîn.
English: Say among the nations, Yahweh reigns. The world is also established. It can't be moved. He will judge the peoples with equity.

Tailo: Guá beh īng Iôtah tsò Guá só͘ bán ê kiong, īng Ehulaim tsò an-tì tī kiong ê tsìnn. Si-óng, Guá beh kik-tōng lí ê jîn-bîn lâi kong-kik Iá-uán ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ lí tshin-tshiūnn ióng-sū ê to-kiàm.
English: For indeed I bend Judah as a bow for me. I have filled the bow with Ephraim; And I will stir up your sons, Zion, Against your sons, Greece, And will make you like the sword of a mighty man.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h huan-hù lán ka-kī ê lâng, tio̍h ha̍k-si̍p tsò hó sū, lâi kiong-kip hiah-ê si̍t-tsāi ū su-iàu ê lâng, tsiah bián-tit bô kiat kué-tsí.
English: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.

Tailo: Lín nā tì-ì tsip-siú guá só͘ bīng-līng lín it-tshè ê kài-bīng, lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, kiânn I it-tshè ê lō͘ kah I kiat-liân,
English: For if you shall diligently keep all this commandment which I command you, to do it, to love Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cleave to him;

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí beh sù-hok hō͘ gī lâng, īng un-huī tshin-tshiūnn tîn-pâi kā i sì-bīn uî khí-.lâi.
English: For you will bless the righteous. Yahweh, you will surround him with favor as with a shield.

Tailo: Sio̍k Tse-bú-lông tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing, sio̍k Iôséhuh tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing, sio̍k Biāniámín tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing.
English: Of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand, Of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand, Of the tribe of Benjamin were sealed twelve thousand.

Tailo: Guán í-king tshiân tsin tsē ji̍t, koh in-uī kìm-tsia̍h ê kî í-king kuè-.khì, kiâⁿ-tsûn tsin guî-hiám. Páulô tsiū khǹg tāi-ke,
English: When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them,

Tailo: Tī E-tsu-le-el ê hn̂g, káu ē tsia̍h Iétsebel, bô lâng kā i bâi-tsòng. ' Siàu-liân lâng tsiū khui mn̂g tô-tsáu.
English: The dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel, and there shall be none to bury her. He opened the door, and fled.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h uī ka-kī sǹg tshit-ê tshit ji̍t, tuì lí khí-thâu īng liâm-á kuah ngó͘-kok ê sî sǹg-khí, tsiū sǹg tshit-ê tshit ji̍t.
English: Seven weeks shall you number to you: from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain shall you begin to number seven weeks.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Siōngtsú í-king tsiù-tsuā, Siōngtsú ē tāi-tāi kah Amáli̍k lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: He said, Yah has sworn: Yahweh will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.'

Tailo: Kám ū lâng bat tuì Siōngtè kóng: Guá í-king siū tsik-hua̍t, bô koh huān tsuē?
English: For has any said to God, I am guilty, but I will not offend any more.

Tailo: Siâⁿ tshiûⁿ sī īng phik-gi̍k lâi khí, siâⁿ pún-sin sī īng tshing kah tshin-tshiūnn po-lê ê sûn-kim khí-tsō ê.
English: The construction of its wall was jasper. The city was pure gold, like pure glass.

Tailo: Ē ū lâng tuà tī hit tiong-kan, bô koh ū tsiù-tsó͘. Êlúsalèm ē an-jiân thài-pîng.
English: Men will dwell therein, and there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will dwell safely.

Tailo: Iésu thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iô-há-neh hō͘ lâng lia̍h-khì kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ, tsiū siám-phiah-khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng;
English: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.

Tailo: Tse beh kā in tsò íng-uán ê lē, koh hit-ê kā lâng hiù tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí, hit-ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ; kiàn-nā bong hit-ê tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí ê, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: It shall be a perpetual statute to them: and he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until even.

Tailo: Tse sī Siōngtsú só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê ji̍t-tsí, lán tī tsit ji̍t ê tiong-kan tio̍h huann-hí khuài-lo̍k!
English: This is the day that Yahweh has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it!

Tailo: Iôtah tsiū khì, Siōngtsú kā Ka-nân lâng kah Pe-lí-ji lâng, kau tī in ê tshiú tiong.
English: Judah went up; and Yahweh delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand: and they struck of them in Bezek ten thousand men.

Tailo: Iésu koh tuì līng-guā tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng, Lâi tuè Guá! Hit-ê lâng ìn kóng, Tsú ah, hō͘ guá tńg-khì sing bâi-tsòng guá ê lāu-pē.
English: He said to another, Follow me! But he said, Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.

Tailo: Guá ē siū tīng tsuē, guá ná ē khang-khang lô-khó͘?
English: I shall be condemned; Why then do I labor in vain?

Tailo: Lín tio̍h sūn-ho̍k Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, kìng-uì I, tsun-siú I ê kài-bīng, thiaⁿ I ê uē, ho̍k-sāi I, kah I kiat-liân.
English: You shall walk after Yahweh your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and you shall serve him, and cleave to him.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khuànn Si-óng, lán siú sìng-tseh ê siâⁿ; lí ê ba̍k-tsiu ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Êlúsalèm tsò an-tsīng ê tshù-the̍h, tsò bô î-suá ê pò͘-pênn; i ê khit íng bô pue̍h-tshut, i ê soh lóng bô tn̄g.
English: Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation, A tent that won't be removed. Its stakes will never be plucked up, Nor will any of its cords be broken.

Tailo: kóng, Esáu nā lâi kong-kik tsit tuī, tshun-ê hit-tuī iáu thang tô-tsáu.
English: and he said, If Esau comes to the one company, and strikes it, then the company which is left will escape.

Tailo: Tī hia lín ē kì-tit lín ê só͘ kiâⁿ, só͘ tsò, to̍h-sī lín tuì hiah-ê lâi kā lín ka-kī uè lah-sap ê, koh beh in-uī lín só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê pháiⁿ lâi ka-kī thó-ià.
English: There shall you remember your ways, and all your doings, in which you have polluted yourselves; and you shall loathe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that you have committed.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h sio̍k-huê lín ê sèⁿ-miā, kā tsit-ê hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê sî, hó-gia̍h lâng m̄-thang tshut khah tsē, sàn-tshiah lâng mā m̄-thang tshut khah tsió, ta̍k lâng lóng tshut tú-hó ê puàⁿ si-khel.
English: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of Yahweh, to make atonement for your souls.

Tailo: I koh tī hia khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò El-e-ló-he Isulael.
English: He erected an altar there, and called it El Elohe Israel.

Tailo: Sàulô ê jîn-sîn huê-hok, kóng, Tabi̍t kóng ê, án-ne, án-ne.
English: The servants of Saul told him, saying, On this manner spoke David.

Tailo: In-uī Guá kah lí tông-tsāi, lâi kā lí tsín-kiù, mā beh kā Guá só͘ kuáⁿ lí khì-kàu hiah-ê kok tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t, tsóng-.sī, bô tsuân-pō͘ kā lí tsâu-bia̍t, Guá beh tsiàu só͘ ha̍p-gî ê kā lí tsik-pī, tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng bô kā lí hîng-hua̍t. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: For I am with you, says Yahweh, to save you: for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have scattered you, but I will not make a full end of you; but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.

Tailo: In koh ài tī iàn-si̍k tsē tuā-uī, tī huē-tn̂g lāi tsē kuân uī,
English: and love the place of honor at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū tshut-khì tshiúⁿ Alâm lâng ê iâⁿ-pâng. Tsiū án-ne, tsi̍t sè-a ê iù mī-hún ta̍t gîn tsi̍t si-khel, nn̄g sè-a tuā-be̍h mā ta̍t gîn tsi̍t si-khel, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: The people went out, and plundered the camp of the Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael ê tsú-bîn kah Iôtah ke teh tuā-tuā kiânn kuí-tsà, kong-kik Guá. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: ' Kah tiūⁿ-ḿ tâng-pâng ê tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Lí í-king muá tsiah-ê ji̍t, tio̍h koh khi tsiànn pîng tó-.leh, tam-tng Iôtah ê tsú-bîn ê tsuē-kò, Guá kā lí hān sì-tsa̍p kang, tsi̍t ji̍t tú tsi̍t nî.
English: Again, when you have accomplished these, you shall lie on your right side, and shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah: forty days, each day for a year, have I appointed it to you.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, kuan-hē Tsú tsài-lîm ê sî kah kî, guá bô su-iàu siá tī pue lāi.
English: But concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need that anything be written to you.

Tailo: Tuà tsit-ê siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn ē khì-kàu hit-ê siâⁿ, kóng, ' Lán tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lâi-khì kiû Siōngtsú ê un, lâi-khì tshuē bān-kun ê Siōngtsú; nā-sī guá, guá mā beh khì. '
English: and the inhabitants of one shall go to another, saying, Let us go speedily to entreat the favor of Yahweh, and to seek Yahweh of Armies. I will go also.'

Tailo: I hō͘ lí khiam-pi, hō͘ lí iau-gō, īng lí só͘ m̄-bat, lí ê tsó͘-sian mā m̄-bat ê má-ná iúⁿ-tshī lí, hō͘ lí thang tsai lâng m̄-sī kan-taⁿ uá-khò piáⁿ lâi ua̍h, lâng sī uá-khò Siōngtsú ê tshuì só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē lâi ua̍h.
English: He humbled you, and allowed you to hunger, and fed you with manna, which you didn't know, neither did your fathers know; that he might make you know that man does not live by bread only, but by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of Yahweh does man live.

Tailo: Lí án-ne kiò, guá tsiū ìn; á-.sī hō͘ guá kóng, Lí lâi ìn guá.
English: Then call, and I will answer; Or let me speak, and you answer me.

Tailo: I khí hûn jia thiⁿ, uī-tio̍h tē tsún-pī hō͘-tsuí, hō͘ suaⁿ huat-tsháu.
English: Who covers the sky with clouds, Who prepares rain for the earth, Who makes grass grow on the mountains.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng tsiàu i só͘ mn̄g ê, lóng kā i ìn, bô tsi̍t hāng Só͘lômóng bē liáu-kái thang kā i kóng.
English: Solomon told her all her questions; and there was not anything hid from Solomon which he didn't tell her.

Tailo: Uá-khò Sìng Sîn ê pang-tsān, lín mā tsò-hué siū khí-tsō, lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōngtè só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t só͘ kiâⁿ ê, Siōngtsú huan-hù tio̍h án-ne kiânn, uī-tio̍h lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: What has been done this day, so Yahweh has commanded to do, to make atonement for you.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsai kiù-sio̍k guá ê sī ua̍h ê Siōngtè; ji̍t-āu I ē khiā tī thô͘ ê tíng-bīn;
English: But as for me, I know that my Redeemer lives. In the end, he will stand upon the earth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hiah-ê buē kah tsa-po͘ lâng tâng-pâng ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, lín thang uī ka-kī lâu in ê ua̍h-miā.
English: But all the girls, who have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.

Tailo: Tio̍h kíng-síng, in-uī lín m̄-tsai lín ê Tsú siáⁿ-mi̍h ji̍t-tsí ē tsài-lîm.
English: Watch therefore, for you don't know in what hour your Lord comes.

Tailo: In-uī só͘-ū ún-ba̍t ê tāi-tsì tsiong-lâi lóng ē lō͘-hiān; só͘-ū pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì kàu-sî lóng ē pō-lō͘ tshut-lâi hō͘ lâng tsai.
English: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kíng-kài tio̍h tuì Ap-bûn uat kàu Aigi̍p ê khe, thàng-kàu hái uî-tsí.
English: and the border shall turn about from Azmon to the brook of Egypt, and the goings out of it shall be at the sea.

Tailo: I tsi̍t ē khuànn, tsiū khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū piáⁿ tī hué-thuàⁿ ê tíng-bīn teh piak, koh ū tsi̍t pân tsuí tī i ê thâu-khak piⁿ, i tsiū tsia̍h tsiū lim, jiân-āu koh tó lo̍h-.khì.
English: He looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drink, and laid him down again.

Tailo: Lí bô huâi-īn bô seⁿ kiáⁿ ê, tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua; lí m̄-bat king-kuè seⁿ kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘, tio̍h tshut siaⁿ tshiùⁿ kua, tshut huann-hí ê siann; in-uī ka-kī tuà ê tsa-bó͘ lâng pí ū tiōng-hu ê seⁿ khah tsē kiáⁿ. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Sing, barren, you who didn't bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, you who did not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tshú tshâ-liāu, lâi khí tsit-ê tiān, Guá tsiū ē in-uī án-ne lâi huann-hí, koh tit-tio̍h îng-kng. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Go up to the mountain, bring wood, and build the house. I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tsioh i tsînn m̄-thang kā i the̍h lī-sik, lí tsioh i bí-niûⁿ mā m̄-thang kā i the̍h khah ke.
English: You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor give him your food for profit.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng: Taⁿ tsit-ê kok beh kui Tabi̍t ê ke;
English: Jeroboam said in his heart, Now will the kingdom return to the house of David:

Tailo: Guá bô tuì lí ê gû-tiâu tshú kang ê gû, mā bô tuì lí ê iûⁿ-tiâu tshú kang ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ.
English: I have no need for a bull from your stall, Nor male goats from your pens.

Tailo: In-uī lí bē kì-.tit kiù lí ê Siōngtsú, bē kì-tit tsò lí khuì-la̍t ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ; só͘-í, lí tsai tsin sim-sik ê tshiū-á-tsai, mā tsìng pa̍t uī lâi ê tsíng.
English: For you have forgotten the God of your salvation, and have not remembered the rock of your strength. Therefore you plant pleasant plants, and set out foreign seedlings.

Tailo: Kang-lâng lâi kā tsú-lâng pò-kò kóng, ' Thâu-ke, lí kám m̄-sī iā hó tsíng-tsí tī lí ê hn̂g-.ni̍h? Hiah-ê phê-á-.sī tuì tó-uī lâi? '
English: The servants of the householder came and said to him, Sir, didn't you sow good seed in your field? Where did this darnel come from?'

Tailo: Thiⁿ-kng ê sî, Iésu khì-kàu phian-phiah ê só͘-tsāi; kui tīn lâng lâi tshuē I, tshuē-tio̍h tsiū kā I lâu, tshiánn I m̄-thang lī-khui in.
English: When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place, and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn't go away from them.

Tailo: Tio̍h ǹg Siōngtsú tshiùⁿ kua, o-ló I ê miâ! Ji̍t-ji̍t thuân-pò I ê kiù-un!
English: Sing to Yahweh! Bless his name! Proclaim his salvation from day to day!

Tailo: I ê tshiū-nâ kah puî tē ê îng-kng, tuì sîn-hûn kàu jio̍k-thé lóng kā i sio bia̍t-tiāu, sè-bīn tshin-tshiūnn phuà-pēⁿ ê lâng tsiām-tsiām sue-pāi.
English: He will consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body. It will be as when a standard bearer faints.

Tailo: Tsáu bûn-su ê tuà ông kah i hiah-ê siú-líng ê phue, piàn kiâⁿ Isulael kah Iôtah tē, tsiàu ông ê bīng-līng, kóng, Isulael lâng, lín tio̍h koh kui-ǹg Abulahàm, Ísak, Isulael ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú, I tsiū ē kui-ǹg lín tsiah-ê thuat-lī Asiul hiah-ê ông ê tshiú só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn.
English: So the posts went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, You children of Israel, turn again to Yahweh, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, that he may return to the remnant that have escaped of you out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.

Tailo: Kín-kín kuè-khì tshin-tshiūnn khuài-tsûn, koh tshin-tshiūnn ing kuáⁿ-kín pue lo̍h-khì la̍k mi̍h.
English: They have passed away as the swift ships, As the eagle that swoops on the prey.

Tailo: Êsutel ê kiong-lí kah i ê thài-kàm lâi kā i kóng, ông-hō͘ tsiū iu-būn kàu-ki̍k, kià saⁿ-khò͘ khì hō͘ Moltékái-uāⁿ-tshīng, ài thǹg-khì i ê muâ-sann, tsóng-.sī, i m̄ tsiap-siū.
English: Esther's maidens and her chamberlains came and told it her; and the queen was exceedingly grieved: and she sent clothing to clothe Mordecai, and to take his sackcloth from off him; but he didn't receive it.

Tailo: Guá ê ì-sù sī beh thong-ti lí kóng, tio̍h tī tsiah-ê tsē-.leh ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng kah guá ê jîn-bîn ê tiúⁿ-ló ê bīn-tsîng kóng hō͘ bîng, lí nā beh sio̍k, tsiū kā i sio̍k-huê; lí nā m̄-sio̍k, tsiū kóng hō͘ guá tsai, in-uī lí í-guā bô pa̍t lâng thang kā i sio̍k-huê; pâi tē-jī ê to̍h-sī guá. I ìn kóng, Guá beh kā i sio̍k-huê.
English: I thought to disclose it to you, saying, Buy it before those who sit here, and before the elders of my people. If you will redeem it, redeem it: but if you will not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know; for there is none to redeem it besides you; and I am after you. He said, I will redeem it.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā lâng ū nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu, iù-tē, suaⁿ-iûⁿ mn̂g, ní âng ê iûⁿ-káng phuê, hái-káu phuê lóng the̍h-.lâi.
English: Everyone, with whom was found blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, and sea cow hides, brought them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tsiàu Mô͘se ê uē lâi kiâⁿ, kiàn-nā tī tshù lāi, īⁿ tiong, tshân-.ni̍h ê tshân-kap-á lóng sí.
English: Yahweh did according to the word of Moses, and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Isulael jîn-bîn lóng lī-khui Tabi̍t, khì tuè Biklih ê kiáⁿ Síbah. To̍k-to̍k Iôtah lâng, tuì Ioltàn hô kàu Êlúsalèm, lóng tuè i ê ông tiâu-tiâu.
English: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Hâng-ho̍k Hatatetsel hiah-ê ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tī Isulael ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su, tsiū kah Isulael hô-hó, lâi khut-ho̍k in. Tsiū án-ne, Alâm lâng m̄-káⁿ koh pang-tsān Ammóng lâng.
English: When all the kings who were servants to Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. So the Syrians feared to help the children of Ammon any more.

Tailo: Tabi̍t bīng-līng tsū-tsi̍p tuà Isulael tē ê tshut-guā lâng, koh phài phah tsio̍h ê sai-hū phah tsio̍h, ài beh khí Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: David commanded to gather together the foreigners who were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew worked stones to build the house of God.

Tailo: Nethániah ê kiáⁿ Isimael kah peh ê lâng thuat-lī Io-ha-nân ê tshiú, tsáu-khì Ammóng tso̍k hia.
English: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê siàu-liân lâng tsáu-lâi kā Mô͘se kóng, Ilīta̍t kah Bíta̍t tī iâⁿ lāi teh kóng sian-ti ê uē.
English: There ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t, kàu bué ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sí-bông ê lō͘.
English: There is a way which seems right to a man, But in the end it leads to death.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lâng ê tāi-tsì, I bô su-iàu lâng koh lâi tuì I tsìng-bîng, in-uī I tsin liáu-kái lâng ê lāi-sim.
English: and because he didn't need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

Tailo: Tī lín it-tshè só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi, bô-lūn sī tsiáu á-.sī iá-siù ê hueh, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: You shall not eat any blood, whether it is of bird or of animal, in any of your dwellings.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh khì phah Mô͘ap, hō͘ in tó tī tē-.ni̍h, īng soh-á lâi niû, niû nn̄g tiâu soh-á tn̂g ê hō͘ i sí, niû muá tsi̍t tiâu soh-á tn̂g ê hō͘ i ua̍h. Mô͘ap lâng tsiū kui-ho̍k Tabi̍t, lâi tsìn-kòng.
English: He struck Moab, and measured them with the line, making them to lie down on the ground; and he measured two lines to put to death, and one full line to keep alive. The Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè kiû tsi̍t-ê tiāu-thâu, thang tī tshim-ian á-.sī ki̍k kuân ê thiⁿ tuì I kiû.
English: Ask a sign of Yahweh your God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí hō͘ guán ua̍t tńg-lâi kui Lí, guán tsiū ua̍t tńg-.lâi. Kiû Lí kā guán ê ji̍t-tsí uāⁿ sin, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-sî án-ne.
English: Turn you us to you, Yahweh, and we shall be turned; Renew our days as of old.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng, lín tio̍h tsáu tshut Êlúsalèm, tī Thekouah pûn sàu-kak, tī Bia̍t-ha-ke-lém pàng ian-hué; in-uī ū tsai-hō kah tuā ê huí-bia̍t tuì pak-hong lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Flee for safety, you children of Benjamin, out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise up a signal on Beth Haccherem; for evil looks forth from the north, and a great destruction.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng ê gê tshin-tshiūnn kiàm, khí tshin-tshiūnn to, in beh thun-bia̍t tē-bīn tsiūⁿ khùn-khó͘ ê lâng kah sè-kan ê sàn-tshiah lâng.
English: There is a generation whose teeth are like swords, And their jaws like knives, To devour the poor from the earth, and the needy from among men.

Tailo: Jiânāu ông ē kā tò pîng ê kóng, ' Lín tsiah-ê siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê lâng, tio̍h lī-khui guá, ji̍p-khì uī-tio̍h Mô͘-kuí kah i ê sù-tsiá só͘ tsún-pī ê íng-uán ê hué-.ni̍h.
English: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;

Tailo: Guán bô tshin-tshiūnn tsin tsē lâng kā Siōngtè ê tō-lí tòng-tsò siong-phín lâi phah-buē; guán tian-tò sī tsò tsi̍t-ê sîng-si̍t ê lâng, siū Siōngtè ê tshe-phài, uá-khò Ki-tok lâi suan-káng tō-lí.
English: For we are not as so many, peddling the word of God. But as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God, we speak in Christ.

Tailo: Guán ē tsiàu lí só͘ su-iàu ê tuì Le-ba-nòng tshò tshiū, ká kui pâi phû tī hái-.ni̍h ūn lâi-kàu Io̍p-pe, lí tsiū thang ūn khì-kàu Êlúsalèm.
English: and we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as you shall need; and we will bring it to you in floats by sea to Joppa; and you shall carry it up to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Taniel kóng: Guá àm-sî khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng, lí khuàⁿ, thiⁿ-.ni̍h ê sì-bīn hut-jiân khí hong, tshue tī tuā hái ê tíng-bīn.
English: Daniel spoke and said, I saw in my vision by night, and, behold, the four winds of the sky broke forth on the great sea.

Tailo: Uan-khiau ê bē-tàng hō͘ i ti̍t, bô tsûn-tsāi ê bē-tàng koh sǹg-.tit.
English: That which is crooked can't be made straight; and that which is lacking can't be counted.

Tailo: I tshut-la̍t thiah-huí i ê lî-pa, tshin-tshiūnn hue-hn̂g, I huí-huāi i tsū-huē ê só͘-tsāi. Só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tseh-kî kah An-hioh-ji̍t, tī Si-óng lóng bē kì-.tit; Siōngtsú hō͘ i án-ne, koh tī I ê siū-khì thòng-hūn tiong, khuànn-khin kun-ông kah tsè-si.
English: He has violently taken away his tent, as if it were of a garden; he has destroyed his place of assembly: Yahweh has caused solemn assembly and Sabbath to be forgotten in Zion, Has despised in the indignation of his anger the king and the priest.

Tailo: Jiânāu I tsiū kā hiah-ê tsē tī I sì-kho͘-uî ê lâng khuànn tsi̍t liàn, kóng, Lín tsiah-ê to̍h-sī guá ê lāu-bú kah guá ê hiann-tī.
English: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, Behold, my mother and my brothers!

Tailo: Siōngtsú mā siū-khì Alông, beh kā i bia̍t-tiāu, siâng hit sî, guá mā thè Alông kî-tó.
English: Yahweh was very angry with Aaron to destroy him: and I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.

Tailo: In-uī ū tsit-ê khak-sìn, guá tsiah kuat-tīng sing lâi hóng-būn lín, hō͘ lín thang tiông-sin koh-tsài tit-tio̍h tsiok-hok.
English: In this confidence, I was determined to come first to you, that you might have a second benefit;

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ bē bîng-pi̍k tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, in-uī ū tuì in am-khàm tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, hō͘ in bē-tàng liáu-kái. Bûn-tô͘ mā m̄-káⁿ mn̄g Iésu tsit kù uē ê ì-sù.
English: But they didn't understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tshut Aigi̍p tē liáu-āu, tē-saⁿ kò-gue̍h tú-tú hit ji̍t, in tsiū lâi-kàu Si-nái ê khòng-iá.
English: In the third month after the children of Israel had gone forth out of the land of Egypt, on that same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ē kì-tit Lótoh ê bó͘ só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì.
English: Remember Lot's wife!

Tailo: Náthan tsiū tsiàu tsiah-ê uē, tsiah-ê bi̍k-sī, khì kā Tabi̍t kóng.
English: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak to David.

Tailo: In-uī lín ta̍k lâng lóng thang lûn-liû thuân-káng Siōngtè ê sìn-sit, thang tsò-hué ha̍k-si̍p, hō͘-siong bián-lē.
English: For you all can prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be exhorted.

Tailo: In ē īng Lí ê huat-tō͘ kà-sī Iâkop, īng Lí ê lu̍t-huat kà-sī Isulael. In ē īng hiuⁿ hē tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng kah tsuân-pō͘ tsiah-ê sio-tsè tī Lí ê tuâⁿ tíng.
English: They shall teach Jacob your ordinances, Israel your law: They shall put incense before you, Whole burnt offering on your altar.

Tailo: tuè Isulael lâng ji̍p-khì tîng-á lāi, tsha̍k-sí nn̄g lâng, to̍h-sī tsha̍k-thàu Isulael lâng kah hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê pak-tó͘. Án-ne, tī Isulael lâng tiong-kan ê un-i̍k tsiū suah.
English: and he went after the man of Israel into the pavilion, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her body. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lú-ông īng tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tha-lan-t ê kim, kah tsin tsē phang-liāu, kah pó-tsio̍h sàng ông, m̄-bat ū phang-liāu tshin-tshiūnn Síbah lú-ông sàng Só͘lômóng ông ê.
English: She gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, and spices in great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Mô͘se kah Alông ji̍p-.khì, kā Huâ-láu kóng, Isulael ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Tio̍h tsún Guá ê tsú-bîn lī-khui, thang hō͘ in tī khòng-iá uī Guá siú tseh. '
English: Afterward Moses and Aaron came, and said to Pharaoh, This is what Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.'

Tailo: Kiàn-nā gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn, thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, kang ê, lí tio̍h hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè. Gû-kûn thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê m̄-thang hō͘ i tsò-kang; iûⁿ-kûn thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê m̄-thang tsián i ê mn̂g.
English: All the firstborn males that are born of your herd and of your flock you shall sanctify to Yahweh your God: you shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang tī lim-tsia̍h, siú tseh-kî, tshe-it á-.sī An-hioh-ji̍t ê būn-tê hō͘ lâng phue-phîng.
English: Let no man therefore judge you in eating, or in drinking, or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day,

Tailo: Lín tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi thâi-sí tsin tsē lâng, hō͘ sin-si muá ke-lō͘.
English: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and you have filled the streets of it with the slain.

Tailo: Thamal kā i kóng, M̄-thang án-ne, lí kuáⁿ guá tshut-khì ē hāi-tio̍h guá, pí lí tsîng khuán-thāi guá ê khah thiám! Tsóng-.sī, Amnon m̄-khíng thiaⁿ i.
English: She said to him, Not so, because this great wrong in putting me forth is worse than the other that you did to me. But he would not listen to her.

Tailo: kiû Lí tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h suê-thiaⁿ lâi kā i pān-lí; sím-phuàⁿ Lí tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, tīng pháiⁿ lâng ê tsuē, tsiàu i só͘ kiâⁿ ê pò-ìng tī i ê thâu-khak; tīng gī lâng tsò gī, tsiàu i ê gī lâi hō͘ i.
English: then hear you in heaven, and do, and judge your servants, condemning the wicked, to bring his way on his own head, and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù guá tio̍h tuì in án-ne kóng, Lâng pua̍h-tó, kám bô koh peh khí-.lâi? Lâng uat tsáu-.khì, kám bô koh uat tò tńg-.lâi?
English: Moreover you shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh: Shall men fall, and not rise up again? Shall one turn away, and not return?

Tailo: I ín-tshuā in king-kuè sua-bô͘, in mā bô tshuì-ta; I uī-tio̍h in hō͘ tsuí tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ lâu tshut; tsio̍h-puâⁿ li̍h-.khui, tsuí tsiū tshìng tshut-.lâi. Siōngtsú kóng: Pháiⁿ lâng it-tīng bē pîng-an.
English: They didn't thirst when he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he split the rock also, and the waters gushed out.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí bē-tàng koh lo̍h-khì lí só͘ tsiūⁿ-khì ê bîn-tshn̂g, it-tīng ē sí! ' Eliiah tsiū khì.
English: Now therefore thus says Yahweh, You shall not come down from the bed where you are gone up, but shall surely die. Elijah departed.

Tailo: Hit sî, sian-kiàn Hananih lâi kìnn Iôtah ông Asah, kā i kóng, In-uī lí uá-khò Alâm ông, bô uá-khò Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, só͘-í, Alâm ông ê kun-ping thuat-lī lí ê tshiú.
English: At that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said to him, Because you have relied on the king of Syria, and have not relied on Yahweh your God, therefore is the army of the king of Syria escaped out of your hand.

Tailo: Tú-tio̍h tshì-liān ê lâng m̄-thang kóng, Guá hō͘ Siōngtè iú-hi̍k , in-uī Siōngtè bē siū siâ-ok iú-hi̍k, I ka-kī mā bē iú-hi̍k lâng.
English: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted by God, for God can't be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.

Tailo: Guān Lí phài tsi̍t-ê pháiⁿ lâng kā i kuán-hat, phài tsi̍t-ê tuì-ti̍k khiā tī i ê tsiànn pîng!
English: Set a wicked man over him. Let an adversary stand at his right hand.

Tailo: Isulael ông Ahap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm tsa̍p-jī nî, Iôtah ông Io-lâm ê kiáⁿ Ahatsiah khai-sí tsē-uī.
English: In the twelfth year of Joram the son of Ahab king of Israel did Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah begin to reign.

Tailo: Asah kiânn Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè khuàⁿ-tsò hó, tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì,
English: Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Yahweh his God:

Tailo: Siōngtè ê tì-huī hui-siông tshim-tîm, tì-sik hui-siông hong-hù! I ê phuàⁿ-tuàn oh-tit thui-tshik, I ê tō-lō͘ oh-tit tshuē-.tio̍h!
English: Oh the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past tracing out!

Tailo: Hit sî, tuā-tsè-si Elíasip kah i ê hiann-tī hiah-ê tsè-si, khí-lâi khí-tsō Iûⁿ-mn̂g, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, an hit-ê mn̂g-sìⁿ, to̍h-sī kàu Ha-me-ah ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu, mā kàu Ha-na-nel ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu, lóng hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests, and they built the sheep gate; they sanctified it, and set up the doors of it; even to the tower of Hammeah they sanctified it, to the tower of Hananel.

Tailo: Īng hit-ê tsi̍t-tshing tshit-pah tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ si-khel ê gîn tsò thiāu ê kau, mā pau thiāu-táu, mā tsò i ê huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ.
English: Of the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.

Tailo: Kiû Lí uī-tio̍h Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t ê iân-kò͘, m̄-thang khì-sak Lí buah iû siat-li̍p ê kun-ông!
English: For your servant David's sake, Don't turn away the face of your anointed one.

Tailo: Í-tsîng bô lu̍t-huat, guá mā teh ua̍h, kài-bīng tsi̍t ē lo̍h-.lâi, tsuē tsiū ua̍h khí-.lâi, guá suah sí-.khì.
English: I was alive apart from the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

Tailo: Ông kah tuè i ê lâng lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm beh kong-kik tuà tī hit só͘-tsāi ê I-é-bú-suh lâng. In tuì Tabi̍t kóng, Lí nā bô tû tsiah-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kah pái-kha-.ê, tsiū bē-tàng ji̍p-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi. In siūⁿ kóng Tabi̍t tsua̍t-tuì bē ji̍p-lâi tsia.
English: The king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spoke to David, saying, Except you take away the blind and the lame, you shall not come in here; thinking, David can't come in here.

Tailo: Tuì thâu tsi̍t ji̍t kàu lō͘-bué ji̍t, Etsula̍h ta̍k ji̍t tha̍k Siōngtsú ê lu̍t-huat. Tsìng lâng siú tseh tshit ji̍t, kàu tē-peh ji̍t ū giâm-siok-huē, lóng tsiàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē.
English: Also day by day, from the first day to the last day, he read in the book of the law of God. They kept the feast seven days; and on the eighth day was a solemn assembly, according to the ordinance.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tsò tsi̍t hāng sin ê tāi-tsì, taⁿ teh hián-hiān, lín kám m̄-tsai? Guá beh tī khòng-iá khui tō-lō͘, tī sua-bô͘ khui kang-hô.
English: Behold, I will do a new thing; now shall it spring forth; shall you not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu ua̍t-tsáu bô khuànn hi-ké, koh hō͘ guá ē-tàng kiânn Lí ê lō͘ lâi sing-ua̍h.
English: Turn my eyes away from looking at worthless things. Revive me in your ways.

Tailo: Kî-tiong mā pau-hâm lín tsiah-ê siū Siōngtè suán-tiàu, lâi kui-sio̍k Iésu Ki-tok ê lâng.
English: among whom you are also called to belong to Jesus Christ;

Tailo: In-uī Ka-nân lâng kah tuà tī tsit só͘-tsāi só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū beh kā guán uî-khùn, tī tē-tsiūⁿ kā guán ê miâ tû-bia̍t. Hit sî, Lí uī-tio̍h Lí ê tuā miâ beh án-tsuáⁿ tsiah hó?
English: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it, and will compass us round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what will you do for your great name?

Tailo: Lí tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ ìng-ín ê, Lí ū siú iok. Lí tshin-tshuì kóng ê, ū tshin-tshiú kā i ìng-giām, tú tsiàu kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán.
English: who have kept with your servant David my father that which you did promise him: yes, you spoke with your mouth, and have fulfilled it with your hand, as it is this day.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsai Siōngtsú sī Siōngtè! Lán sī I tshòng-tsō ê, lán sio̍k tī I; lán sī I ê tsú-bîn, mā sī I tsháu-tiûⁿ ê iûⁿ.
English: Know that Yahweh, he is God. It is he who has made us, and we are his. We are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng bô tsuí thang lim, in tsiū tsū-tsi̍p uá-lâi kong-kik Mô͘se kah Alông.
English: There was no water for the congregation: and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.

Tailo: In-uī jîn-sìng ê luán-jio̍k, lu̍t-huat tsò bē-kàu ê, Siōngtè ū tsò-tsiâⁿ. Siōngtè uī-tio̍h beh kiù jîn-luī thuat-lī tsuē kah sí ê huat-tsik, I hō͘ ka-kī ê Kiáⁿ tshái-tshú kah lán kāng-khuán ū tsuē ê pún-sìng, īng I ê jio̍k-thé lâi sím-phuàⁿ jîn-luī jio̍k-thé ê tsuē, kā tsuē tû-.khì.
English: For what the law couldn't do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God did, sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, he condemned sin in the flesh;

Tailo: Lí teh tshńg uē-phāng beh kàu tang-sî ah? Lí tio̍h tsim-tsiok siūⁿ, jiân-āu guán tsiah kóng.
English: How long will you hunt for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí khí-lâi sím-phuàⁿ sè-kài, in-uī Lí ē tit-tio̍h bān-kok tsò ki-gia̍p.
English: Arise, God, judge the earth, For you inherit all of the nations.

Tailo: Guá beh tī Guá ê tē phah-pāi Asiul lâng, tī Guá ê suaⁿ kā in thún-ta̍h. I ê ka-tann ē lī-khui Guá ê jîn-bîn, i ê tāng-tàⁿ ē lī-khui Guá ê jîn-bîn ê king-kah-thâu.
English: that I will break the Assyrian in my land, and tread him under foot on my mountains. Then his yoke will leave them, and his burden leave their shoulders.

Tailo: Siâ-sîn lī-khui hū-sin ê lâng, tsiū tī bô tsuí ê tē-khu beh tshuē tsi̍t-ê hioh-khùn ê só͘-tsāi, m̄-koh, lóng tshuē bô.
English: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn't find it.

Tailo: Hn̂g-tsú ē lâi kā hiah-ê tshân-tiān tsâu-bia̍t, kā i ê hn̂g tso͘ hō͘ pa̍t lâng. In thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu tsiū kóng, Tshian-bān m̄-thang án-ne.
English: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others. When they heard it, they said, May it never be!

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, tio̍h thiaⁿ lí ê lāu-pē ê kàu-tok; m̄-thang khì-sak lí ê lāu-bú ê kà-sī.
English: My son, listen to your father's instruction, And don't forsake your mother's teaching:

Tailo: Iâkop tuì Pa-tàn-a-lâm tńg-.lâi ê sî, pîng-an lâi-kàu Ka-nân tē ê Sīkhiàm siâⁿ, tī siâⁿ ê thâu-tsîng tah pò͘-pêⁿ.
English: Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan Aram; and encamped before the city.

Tailo: Me-ná-hiàm kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn liáu-āu, i ê kiáⁿ Pekahiap suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá king-ha̍k kàu-su kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng teh tng-tán, khuànn Iésu ū tī An-hioh-ji̍t kā lâng i-pēⁿ á-bô, ì-sù sī beh tshuē khang-phāng thang kò Iésu.
English: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tse kì-jiân sī lín teh piān-lūn lín ê lu̍t-huat ê jī-gán kah bîng-tshing, lín to̍h ka-kī khì kái-kuat, guá bô ài pān tsit khuán ê tāi-tsì!
English: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves. For I don't want to be a judge of these matters.

Tailo: Isulael ông Ehuahátsuh ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si sí liáu-āu, Iôtah ông Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Amátsiah iáu-koh ua̍h tsa̍p-gō͘ nî.
English: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.

Tailo: Isulael tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k tshe lâng sì-kè khì kā Biāniámín ê tsi-tso̍k kóng, Lín tiong-kan só͘ kiâⁿ ê, sī siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ tāi?
English: The tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, What wickedness is this that is happen among you?

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, sià-bián in, in-uī in m̄-tsai in só͘ tsò ê. Jiânāu in tsiū liam-khau lâi pun Iésu ê saⁿ.
English: Jesus said, Father, forgive them, for they don't know what they are doing. Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.

Tailo: Guá tshuì ê khì-bī hō͘ guá ê bó͘ thó-ià; kah guá siâng-pak ê mā thó-ià guá ê tshàu-bī.
English: My breath is offensive to my wife. I am loathsome to the children of my own mother.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiū tsiàu in ê lō͘-thîng tshut-huat, lī-khui Si-nái ê khòng-iá, hûn thîng tī Palân ê khòng-iá.
English: The children of Israel set forward according to their journeys out of the wilderness of Sinai; and the cloud abode in the wilderness of Paran.

Tailo: Lí ê lâng ū hok-khì! Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsin ū hok-khì! In tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ khiā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, thiaⁿ lí ê tì-huī.
English: Happy are your men, happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you, and who hear your wisdom.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k In-uī guán ê tsó͘-sian jiá thinn-tíng ê Siōngtsú ê siū-khì, I kā in kau tī Kal-tí-ah lâng, Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal ê tshiú, ông tsiū thiah-huí tsit king tiān, lia̍h jîn-bîn khì-kàu Babúlông.
English: But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí í-king kàu à; só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tsai-hō í-king huat-tshut. Kuái-á í-king khui hue, kiau-ngō͘ í-king puh-gê.
English: Behold, the day, behold, it comes: your doom is gone forth; the rod has blossomed, pride has budded.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî huah-hiàm; i í-king tâu-hâng. I ê iâⁿ-tsē tó-huāi à, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ thiah-huí à; in-uī tse sī Siōngtsú pò-siû ê tāi-tsì. Lín tio̍h ǹg i pò-siû; i án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi lâng, mā tio̍h án-ne kā i khuán-thāi.
English: Shout against her round about: she has submitted herself; her bulwarks are fallen, her walls are thrown down; for it is the vengeance of Yahweh: take vengeance on her; as she has done, do to her.

Tailo: Siā tsìnn ê lâng siā tio̍h Io-si-iah ông, ông tuì i ê jîn-sîn kóng, Tuà guá tshut-.khì, in-uī guá siū tāng siongà!
English: The archers shot at king Josiah; and the king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am sore wounded.

Tailo: Guá bô khì tsò guá só͘ ì-ài ê hó, tian-tò tńg-khì tsò guá bô ì-ài ê pháiⁿ.
English: For the good which I desire, I don't do; but the evil which I don't desire, that I practice.

Tailo: Guá sī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, guá bat tshuā lí tuì Aigi̍p tē tshut-.lâi. Tio̍h tuā khui lí ê tshuì, guá tsiū hō͘ lí pá-tsiok.
English: I am Yahweh, your God, Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

Tailo: Iésu kóng suah, tsiū tuì in pûn-khuì, kóng, Lín niá-siū Sìng Sîn.
English: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, Receive the Holy Spirit!

Tailo: Sàulô kah tuè i ê jîn-bîn lóng tsū-tsi̍p, lâi-kàu tsiàn-tiûⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Huilīsū lâng ta̍k-ê īng to hō͘-siong tsân-sat, hui-siông tāi-luān.
English: Saul and all the people who were with him were gathered together, and came to the battle: and behold, every man's sword was against his fellow, and there was a very great confusion.

Tailo: Ko͘-to̍k ê lâng tui-kiû ka-kī só͘ ì-ài ê, koh thòng-hūn it-tshè tsin ê tì-huī.
English: An unfriendly man pursues selfishness, And defies all sound judgment.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsuan-sim niá-siū kà-sī, tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ tì-huī ê uē.
English: Apply your heart to instruction, And your ears to the words of knowledge.

Tailo: Iésu īng phì-jū kà-sī in tsin tsē hāng sū. I kà-sī in kóng,
English: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,

Tailo: Lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h thê-hông i ê tshù-piⁿ, lóng m̄-thang sìn-khò hiann-tī; in-uī hiann-tī tsuân-pō͘ lóng hō͘-siong muâ-phiàn, tshù-piⁿ lóng sì-kè kiâⁿ khì huí-pòng lâng.
English: Take you heed everyone of his neighbor, and don't you trust in any brother; for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbor will go about with slanders.

Tailo: Guá tī tē-tsiūⁿ sī tsò kià-kha ê tshut-guā lâng, kiû Lí m̄-thang tuì guá khàm ba̍t Lí ê kài-bīng!
English: I am a stranger on the earth. Don't hide your commandments from me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kiù-sio̍k ê jîn-bîn beh tò tńg-.lâi. In beh tshiùⁿ kua lâi-kàu Si-óng; beh tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê huann-hí tsò bián-liû. In ē huaⁿ-hí khuài-lo̍k, iu-būn thó͘-khuì lóng ē tsáu-.khì.
English: The ransomed of Yahweh shall return, and come with singing to Zion; and everlasting joy shall be on their heads: they shall obtain gladness and joy; and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.

Tailo: Tē-la̍k-ê thiⁿ-sài kā i hit-ê uánn piàⁿ lo̍h-khì Iu-hu-la-té tuā hô, hô tsuí suî-sî ta-.khì, uī-tio̍h tuì tang-hong lâi ê lia̍t ông tsún-pī tsi̍t tiâu lō͘.
English: The sixth poured out his bowl on the great river, the Euphrates. Its water was dried up, that the way might be made ready for the kings that come from the sunrise.

Tailo: Guá ē īng ba̍k-tsiu khuànn, īng hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ tī tsit só͘-tsāi só͘ hiàn ê kî-tó.
English: Now my eyes shall be open, and my ears attentive, to the prayer that is made in this place.

Tailo: Guá bat án-ne tī sìng-só͘ tiâu-kìnn Lí, uī-tio̍h ài beh khuànn Lí ê kuân-lîng kah îng-kng.
English: So I have seen you in the sanctuary, Watching your power and your glory.

Tailo: Guá kā bé-khè kau hō͘ Nêléiù ê kiáⁿ Palosih í-āu, tsiū tuì Siōngtsú kî-tó, kóng,
English: Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ke-thinn jîn-bîn, hō͘ kok-ka hing-ōng; Lí tit-tio̍h îng-kng, koh khui-khuah tsit-ê tē sì-bīn ê tē-kài.
English: You have increased the nation, O Yahweh. You have increased the nation! You are glorified! You have enlarged all the borders of the land.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iésu kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú, guá kám-siā Lí, in-uī Lí kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tuì tì-huī tshong-bîng ê lâng am-khàm khí-.lâi, khiok ū tuì sè-hàn gín-á khé-sī.
English: At that time, Jesus answered, I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, In-uī guá kā lí kóng, guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí tī bû-hua-kó tshiū kha, lí tsiū sìn guá, sī-.bô? Lí ē khuànn-kìnn pí tse koh khah tuā ê tāi-tsì.
English: Jesus answered him, Because I told you, I saw you underneath the fig tree,' do you believe? You will see greater things than these!

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Ionáthan kóng, Bîn-á-tsài sī tshe-it, guá ing-kai tio̍h kah ông tsē-toh, kiû lí iông-ín guá khì bih tī tshân-.ni̍h, kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t ê-hng.
English: David said to Jonathan, Behold, tomorrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field to the third day at evening.

Tailo: In tsiū kah i tsē tī thô͘-kha tshit ji̍t tshit mê, bô kah i kóng kah tsi̍t kù, in-uī in khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê thòng-khó͘ tsin tuā.
English: So they sat down with him on the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spoke a word to him, for they saw that his grief was very great.

Tailo: In pâi-siat iàn-si̍k, phài lâng siú-bōng, mā tsia̍h, mā lim. Siú-líng, lín tio̍h khí-.lâi, īng iû buah lín ê tîn-pâi.
English: They prepare the table. They set the watch. They eat. They drink. Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!

Tailo: Bô lâng īng iáu-buē kiu-tsuí ê pò͘ khì pó͘ kū sann. Nā án-ne tsò, hit tè sin pò͘ ē kiù-li̍h kū sann, tian-tò phuà koh khah tuā khang.
English: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.

Tailo: Ông kā hit pún, to̍h-sī Palosih só͘ siá I-é-lí-miah só͘ thuân ê uē, sio-khì liáu-āu, Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: Then the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang tuì guá thîng-tsí Lí ê tsû-pi; guān Lí ê tsû-ài kah sìn-si̍t tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ pó-siú guá.
English: Don't withhold your tender mercies from me, Yahweh. Let your loving kindness and your truth continually preserve me.

Tailo: Guá ê hiann-tī gō͘ guá, tshin-tshiūnn khe, koh tshin-tshiūnn khe tsuí lâu-kuè ê khe té;
English: My brothers have dealt deceitfully as a brook, As the channel of brooks that pass away;

Tailo: Nā bô siū tshe-phài, in ná ē khì thuân? Tsiàu kì-tsài, thuân-pò hok-im ê lâng, in ê kha-jiah sī guā-ni̍h-á suí! （ Tsù, ISI 52:7; NHS 1:15)
English: And how will they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the Good News of peace, Who bring glad tidings of good things!

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú pān-lí bān-kok ê ji̍t-tsí kīn à. Tsiàu lí só͘ kiânn ê mā ē án-ne kiânn tī lí; lí só͘ tsò ê ē kui tī lí ê thâu-khak.
English: For the day of Yahweh is near all the nations! As you have done, it will be done to you. Your deeds will return upon your own head.

Tailo: Iésu īng phì-jū kā in kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê tsoh-sit lâng tshut-khì iā tsíng-tsí, teh iā ê sî, ū ê ka-la̍uh tī lō͘ piⁿ, hō͘ kuè-lō͘ lâng ta̍h, khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kā in tsuân-pō͘ tsia̍h liáu-liáu.
English: The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.

Tailo: Lí sī hó, Lí ê só͘ tsò mā sī hó; kiû Lí kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá!
English: You are good, and do good. Teach me your statutes.

Tailo: Tī huē-bō͘ tíng tah pò͘-pêⁿ, kā pò͘-pênn ê kuà khàm tī i ê tíng-bīn, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: He spread the covering over the tent, and put the roof of the tent above on it, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: An-tì hīⁿ-khang ê Siōngtè kám ē bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? Tshòng-tsō ba̍k-tsiu ê Siōngtè kám ē bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h?
English: He who implanted the ear, won't he hear? He who formed the eye, won't he see?

Tailo: Iésu kā tsheh kńg khí-.lâi, hîng huē-tn̂g ê tsip-sū, tsiū tsē lo̍h-.lâi. Huē-tn̂g lāi ê tsìng lâng lóng tsù-ba̍k kā I khuànn.
English: He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng khiā tī tsit pîng ê suaⁿ, Isulael lâng khiā tī hit pîng ê suaⁿ, tiong-kan ū suaⁿ-kok.
English: The Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

Tailo: [siàu-lí ê hiann-tī] Guán ū tsi̍t-ê sè-hàn sió-muē, i iáu-buē tióng-sîng, lâng lâi kóng tshin-tsiâⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ thè guán ê sió-muē siat-huat?
English: We have a little sister. She has no breasts. What shall we do for our sister In the day when she is to be spoken for?

Tailo: I tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, khí-lâi kìnn Isulael ê ke, mā īng Guá ê uē kā in kóng.
English: He said to me, Son of man, go, get you to the house of Israel, and speak with my words to them.

Tailo: The̍h tsi̍t-ê la̍p-suè ê gîn-pè lâi hō͘ guá khuànn. In tsiū the̍h tsi̍t-ê gîn-pè hō͘ Iésu khuànn.
English: Show me the tax money. They brought to him a denarius.

Tailo: Koh kā Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê pó-bu̍t kah ông-kiong ê pó-bu̍t, lóng tuì hia the̍h-.khì, koh kā Isulael ông Só͘lômóng só͘ tsō Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê kim-khì lóng phah-phuà, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê uē;
English: He carried out there all the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king's house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold, which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Yahweh, as Yahweh had said.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá ê ti-kí pîng-iú lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g, Hō͘ in thó-ià guá; guá siū kuaiⁿ-kìm, bē-tàng tshut-.lâi.
English: You have taken my friends from me. You have made me an abomination to them. I am confined, and I can't escape.

Tailo: Mā ū jio̍k-kuì, tāu-khò͘, phang-liāu, phang-iû, jú-hiuⁿ, tsiú, iû, iù-mī, be̍h, gû, iûⁿ, bé, tshia, lô͘-po̍k, í-ki̍p sīm-tsì lâng ê lîng-hûn.
English: and cinnamon, incense, perfume, frankincense, wine, olive oil, fine flour, wheat, sheep, horses, chariots, and people's bodies and souls.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī ū tsi̍t ji̍t in pún-sin mā beh siū tháu-pàng lâi thuat-lī ē pāi-huāi ê khu-sok, thang kah Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî hióng-siū îng-kng ê tsū-iû.
English: that the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of decay into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

Tailo: Tsetikiah ông thau-thau-á tuì I-é-lí-miah tsiù-tsuā kóng, Hit-ê tshòng-tsō lán ê ua̍h-miā ê Siōngtsú sī ua̍h ê, guá kí I lâi tsiù-tsuā, guá it-tīng bô beh thâi lí, mā bē kā lí kau hō͘ tsiah-ê siàu-siūⁿ lí sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê tshiú.
English: So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying, As Yahweh lives, who made us this soul, I will not put you to death, neither will I give you into the hand of these men who seek your life.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lín m̄-khíng siú Guá ê bīng-līng, Guá ê lu̍t-huat, beh kàu tang-sî?
English: Yahweh said to Moses, How long do you refuse to keep my commandments and my laws?

Tailo: Khòng-iá kah ta-sò ê tē it-tīng ē huaⁿ-hí; sua-bô͘ mā ē khuài-lo̍k, koh tshin-tshiūnn muî-kuì teh khui hue.
English: The wilderness and the dry land will be glad. The desert will rejoice and blossom like a rose.

Tailo: Guá tī Huâ-láu kah i ê tshia, i ê bé-ping, tit-tio̍h îng-kng ê sî, Aigi̍p lâng tsiū tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: The Egyptians shall know that I am Yahweh, when I have gotten myself honor over Pharaoh, over his chariots, and over his horsemen.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, tī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ si̍t-hiān í-tsîng, guá bē koh tsia̍h tsit khuán ê buán-tshan.
English: for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Thiⁿ tshin-tshiūnn teh kńg tsheh án-ne siau-sit-.khì, suaⁿ kah hái-tó lóng iô-tsuah, lī-khui guân uī.
English: The sky was removed like a scroll when it is rolled up. Every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng suaⁿ-iûⁿ mn̂g tsit tsa̍p-it pak ê tiùⁿ, tsò huē-bō͘ tíng ê pò͘-pênn.
English: You shall make curtains of goats' hair for a covering over the tent: eleven curtains shall you make them.

Tailo: I tuì I ê pó-tsō khuànn lo̍h-.lâi, khuànn I tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê tsú-bîn.
English: From the place of his habitation he looks out on all the inhabitants of the earth,

Tailo: Lí ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tsin kín tò tńg-.lâi; huí-huāi lí ê kah hō͘ lí pha-hng ê beh lī-khui lí tshut-.khì.
English: Your children make haste; your destroyers and those who made you waste shall go forth from you.

Tailo: In-uī guá bat kóng, Lí ê tsû-ài ē siū kiàn-li̍p kàu íng-uán; Lí ê sìn-si̍t ē kian-kò͘ tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: I indeed declare, Love stands firm forever. You established the heavens. Your faithfulness is in them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah, i ê sim-lāi ū Sìng Sîn, lí tshuā i lâi, tī i ê tíng-bīn huāⁿ-tshiú,
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him;

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tuì Aigi̍p khí-lâi jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng ê lâng, tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tuì Abulahàm, Ísak, Iâkop, tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē, in-uī in bô tsuan-sim kin-tuè Guá.
English: Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:

Tailo: In kóng, Kiû lí kā guán siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê ông lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn guán ê būn-tê. Hit-ê tāi-tsì Samuel bô huann-hí, Samuel tsiū tuì Siōngtsú kî-tó.
English: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. Samuel prayed to Yahweh.

Tailo: Sîn-lîng kā guá kí-khí, tī ī-siōng tiong tuì Siōngtè ê lîng tshuā guá kàu Kal-tí-ah siū lia̍h ê lâng hia; guá só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê ī-siōng, tsiū lī-khui guá tsiūⁿ-.khì.
English: The Spirit lifted me up, and brought me in the vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.

Tailo: Iésu tī Lēbī ê tshù tsia̍h pn̄g, ū tsin tsē thiu-suè ê lâng í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn kah Iésu tsham I ê bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g; in-uī ū tsin tsē lâng teh kin-tuè Iésu.
English: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

Tailo: tì-sú lâng bô saⁿ thǹg-pak-theh lâi kiâⁿ; pak-tó͘ iau-iau teh taⁿ tiū-pé.
English: So that they go around naked without clothing. Being hungry, they carry the sheaves.

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah tuì in kóng, Guá kah guá ê jîn-bîn kah Ammóng lâng tuā kè-kàu, guá tsio lín lâi, lín kìng-jiân bô kiù guá thuat-lī in ê tshiú.
English: Jephthah said to them, I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, you didn't save me out of their hand.

Tailo: Guá tī khùn-khó͘ tiong, uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê tiān, tsún-pī kim tsa̍p bān tha-lan-t, gîn tsi̍t-pah bān tha-lan-t, tâng kah thih tāng kàu bē tshìn-.tit, in-uī tsin tsē; guá mā ū tsún-pī tshâ kah tsio̍h, lí thang koh kā i ke-thinn.
English: Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the house of Yahweh one hundred thousand talents of gold, and one thousand thousand talents of silver, and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and you may add to them.

Tailo: Khí-.lâi! Lí khì! Tsia m̄-sī lín an-hioh ê só͘-tsāi; in-uī tē í-king hō͘ ù-uè só͘ pāi-huāi, i ê pāi-huāi tsin siong-tiōng.
English: Arise, and depart! For this is not your resting place, Because of uncleanness that destroys, Even with a grievous destruction.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Nā m̄-sī Siōngtè sù lí kuân-pìng, lí bô kuân thang pān guá. Só͘-í, kā guá kau hō͘ lí ê lâng, i ê tsuē koh khah tāng.
English: Jesus answered, You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.

Tailo: Koh tsiàu i ê khuì-la̍t tshú nn̄g tsiah pan-kah á-.sī nn̄g tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio-tsè.
English: and two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to afford; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.

Tailo: I lâi thiaⁿ Páulô káng tō-lí, Páulô lia̍h i kim-kim khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ū sìn-sim thang tit-tio̍h hó,
English: He was listening to Paul speaking, who, fastening eyes on him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,

Tailo: suî-jiân ū tsit saⁿ-ê lâng tī in tiong-kan, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, in bē-tàng kiù in ê kiáⁿ-jî, tsí ū in pún-sin tit-tio̍h kiù niā-niā.
English: though these three men were in it, as I live, says the Lord Yahweh, they should deliver neither sons nor daughters, but they only should be delivered themselves.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā guá kóng, ' M̄-bián kiaⁿ i, in-uī Guá í-king kā i kah i ê jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p i ê tē, lóng kau tī lí ê tshiú tiong; lí tio̍h khuán-thāi in tshin-tshiūnn khuán-thāi tuà tī Hesibóng ê Amô͘lī ông Sihông. '
English: Yahweh said to me, Don't fear him; for I have delivered him, and all his people, and his land, into your hand; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, I koh tsi̍t pái tuì gō͘-pah guā-ê hiann-tī tsí-muē hián-hiān; hiah-ê lâng ū ê í-king sí-.khì, m̄-koh, tuā pō͘-hūn ê lâng iáu ua̍h-.leh.
English: Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once, most of whom remain until now, but some have also fallen asleep.

Tailo: Siat-sú tsè-si bé lâng lâi, sī i īng gîn bé-ê, hit-ê lâng thang tsia̍h sìng-mi̍h; tshut-sì tī i ê ke ê mā thang tsia̍h i ê bí-niûⁿ.
English: But if a priest buys a slave, purchased by his money, he shall eat of it; and such as are born in his house, they shall eat of his bread.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tì-huī ē hō͘ lí kiâⁿ hó lâng ê lō͘, tshî-siú gī lâng ê tō-lō͘.
English: That you may walk in the way of good men, And keep the paths of the righteous.

Tailo: Tán kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, lí tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lo̍h-khì kàu lí tsîng tú-tio̍h tāi-tsì só͘ bih ê só͘-tsāi, tī Í-sik ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ hia thìng-hāu.
English: When you have stayed three days, you shall go down quickly, and come to the place where you did hide yourself when the business was in hand, and shall remain by the stone Ezel.

Tailo: Tsiú-kuáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng á-.sī siū lī ê tsa-bó͘ lâng só͘ hē ê guān, kah i ka-kī iok-sok ê uē, lóng ē tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ sîng-li̍p.
English: But the vow of a widow, or of her who is divorced, even everything with which she has bound her soul, shall stand against her.

Tailo: Hō͘ in tsiàu-sî sím-phuàⁿ jîn-bîn, tuā sū tio̍h hō͘ in kàu lí tsia, sió-sū in thang ka-kī sím-phuàⁿ. Án-ne, lí tsiū ē khah kiám khin tāng-tàⁿ, in mā thang kah lí tsò-hué tam-tng.
English: Let them judge the people at all times. It shall be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they shall judge themselves. So shall it be easier for you, and they shall share the load with you.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, A-po-lô kuat-tīng beh khì A-kha-iah ê sî, Ê-hu-soh ê sìn-tô͘ kā i kó͘-lē, koh siá phue tshiánn A-kha-iah ê bûn-tô͘ kā i tsiap-thāi. I khì-kàu hia liáu-āu, hiah-ê uá-khò Siōngtè ê un-tián lâi sìn Tsú ê lâng, siū-tio̍h tsin tuā ê pang-tsān,
English: When he had determined to pass over into Achaia, the brothers encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him. When he had come, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace;

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsún-pī tuā hî lâi thun Iôná;, Iôná tī hî ê pak-tó͘ lāi saⁿ ji̍t saⁿ mê.
English: Yahweh prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

Tailo: In-uī I thiàⁿ lí ê tsó͘-sian, só͘-í, kíng-suán in ê kiáⁿ-sun, īng tuā kuân-lîng tshin-sin tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p,
English: Because he loved your fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought you out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt;

Tailo: I koh kā in huan-hù, m̄-thang tuà lō͘-huì, tsí ū tuà tsi̍t ki kuái-á; m̄-thang tuà kan-niûⁿ; m̄-thang tuà hîng-lí tē; m̄-thang khǹg tsîⁿ tī io-tuà;
English: He charged them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,

Tailo: Sâmsóng kah i ê pē-bú lo̍h-khì Tim-nah, lâi-kàu Tim-nah ê phû-tô hn̂g, tú-hó ū tsi̍t tsiah sai-á-thûn uá-lâi tuì i háu.
English: Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnah, and came to the vineyards of Timnah: and behold, a young lion roared against him.

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Ū nn̄g-ê lâng ji̍p-khì sìng-tiān kî-tó, tsi̍t-ê sī Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, tsi̍t-ê sī thiu-suè ê lâng.
English: Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

Tailo: Lâng ê phuê-hu nā tsíng, kiám-tshái seⁿ sián á-.sī seⁿ hué-pan, tī i ê phuê-hu piàn-tsò thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu, tio̍h tshuā i kàu tsè-si Alông, á-.sī kàu i ê kiáⁿ-sun ê tsi̍t-ê tsè-si bīn-tsîng.
English: When a man shall have a rising in his body's skin, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it becomes in the skin of his body the plague of leprosy, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to one of his sons the priests:

Tailo: tuì i kóng, Lí kín khì kā hit-ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, ' Êlúsalèm ē ū lâng tuà, tshin-tshiūnn bô siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê hiuⁿ-lí, in-uī hit tiong-kan ê lâng kah tsing-seⁿ tsin tsē. '
English: and said to him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem will be inhabited as villages without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Ô-bá-tí-ah só͘ tit-tio̍h ê bi̍k-sī. Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng-tio̍h Etóm kóng: Guán tuì Siōngtsú hia thiaⁿ-tio̍h siau-sit, mā ū sù-tsiá hōng tshe-khián khì lia̍t kok, kóng: Khí-.lâi, lán tio̍h khí-lâi kah i kau-tsiàn!
English: The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord Yahweh says about Edom. We have heard news from Yahweh, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, Arise, and let's rise up against her in battle.

Tailo: Guá tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I, tsiū kah-ná sí-lâng phak tī I ê kha tsîng. I īng tsiàⁿ tshiú huāⁿ guá, kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ, guá sī khí-thâu ê, mā sī kiat-bué ê.
English: When I saw him, I fell at his feet like a dead man. He laid his right hand on me, saying, Don't be afraid. I am the first and the last,

Tailo: Iâkop tsiū thiah-li̍h saⁿ, io hâ muâ-pò͘, uī i ê kiáⁿ ai-siong tsin tsē kang.
English: Jacob tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his waist, and mourned for his son many days.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Mánáse ê kiáⁿ-sun bē-tàng kā hiah-ê siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, Ka-nân lâng tsiū kuat-ì beh tuà tī hit-ê tē.
English: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn't drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Guān siúⁿ-sù pîng-an ê Tsú tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ īng ta̍k tsióng hong-huat tshin-sin siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín pîng-an. Guān Tsú kah lín tāi-ke tông-tsāi!
English: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khì guá ê lāu-pē ê ke, guá ê pún tso̍k hia, kā guá ê kiáⁿ tshuā tsi̍t-ê bó͘. '
English: but you shall go to my father's house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.'

Tailo: Siōngtè hing-khí, guá beh án-tsuáⁿ tsiah hó? I sím-mn̄g ê sî, guá beh án-tsuáⁿ ìn?
English: What then shall I do when God rises up? When he visits, what shall I answer him?

Tailo: Tsú tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kā i liân-bín, kóng, M̄-thang háu.
English: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, Don't cry.
