Tailo: Ū ê lâng kóng, Guán í-king kā tshân kah phû-tô hn̂g the̍h-khì tsioh gîn lâi la̍p ông ê suè.
English: There were also that said, We have borrowed money for the king's tribute on our fields and our vineyards.

Tailo: Kàu ji̍t àm ê sî, Iésu tsiū kah tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ tsò-hué lâi.
English: When it was evening he came with the twelve.

Tailo: Nn̄g lâng khì-kàu suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tiàm hia saⁿ ji̍t, thìng-hāu jiok in ê lâng tńg-.khì. Jiok in ê lâng-iân-lō͘ tshuē in, mā tshuē bô tio̍h in.
English: They went, and came to the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers were returned: and the pursuers sought them throughout all the way, but didn't find them.

Tailo: Ū sî tuì ê-hng kàu tsá-khí hûn jia-.leh, tsá-khí sî hûn siu tńg-.khì, in tsiū tshut-huat; bô-lūn ji̍t-sî àm-sî, hûn siu tńg-.khì, in tsiū tshut-huat.
English: Sometimes the cloud was from evening until morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they traveled: or by day and by night, when the cloud was taken up, they traveled.

Tailo: Námān tsiū siū-khì, thè-.khì, kóng, Guá pún siūⁿ kóng i it-tīng ē tshut-lâi kìnn guá, khiā-teh kiû-kiò Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè ê miâ, tī huān-.tio̍h ê só͘-tsāi iô tshiú, lâi i hó thái-ko ê.
English: But Naaman was angry, and went away, and said, Behold, I thought, He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of Yahweh his God, and wave his hand over the place, and recover the leper.

Tailo: Lín siūⁿ kóng guá lâi sī beh hō͘ tē-tsiūⁿ hô-pîng? Guá kā lín kóng, m̄-sī, tian-tò sī uan-ke.
English: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.

Tailo: Lín tsit-má suî-jiân iáu-teh siū tsióng-tsióng ê tshì-liān, tsiām-sî sim kan-khó͘, mā tio̍h in-uī án-ne lâi huann-hí.
English: Wherein you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been put to grief in various trials,

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, uī-tio̍h Lí ê iân-kò͘, guán kui ji̍t bīn-tuì sí-bông ê ui-hia̍p. Guán hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò teh beh hō͘ lâng thâi ê iûⁿ. (tsù, SPh 44:22)
English: Even as it is written, For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

Tailo: Gī lâng ē sîng-tsiap ìng-ín ê thó͘-tē, íng-uán tuà tī hia.
English: The righteous shall inherit the land, And live in it forever.

Tailo: Kiû Lí pó-hō͘ guá thuat-lī in uī-tio̍h guá tiuⁿ ê lô-bāng kah pháiⁿ lâng ê khuan-thò!
English: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, From the traps of the workers of iniquity.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ Lēbī lâng khiā tī Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ ê bīn-tsîng, hiàn in tsò iô-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: You shall set the Levites before Aaron, and before his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú kau-tsiàn ê tsheh ū kóng: So͘-huat ê Ua-hap-pik kah Al-nông hiah-ê suaⁿ-kok,
English: Therefore it is said in the book of the Wars of Yahweh, Vaheb in Suphah, The valleys of the Arnon,

Tailo: Tio̍h kah huann-hí ê lâng tsò-hué huann-hí kah pi-siong ê lâng tsò-hué pi-siong.
English: Rejoice with those who rejoice. Weep with those who weep.

Tailo: Koh-tsài kóng, guán ná tio̍h sî-sî khik-khik lâi mō͘-hiám?
English: Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?

Tailo: Siōngtè kā Nó͘ah kah i ê kiáⁿ kóng,
English: God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h pik-hāi Mítiân lâng, koh kā in phah;
English: Vex the Midianites, and strike them;

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, guá tuì Lí só͘ hē ê guān, guá beh īng siā-un ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Lí.
English: Your vows are on me, God. I will give thank offerings to you.

Tailo: Gilia̍t ê tiúⁿ-ló ìn I-é-hú-thah kóng, Siōngtsú tī lán tiong-kan tsò kiàn-tsìng, guán it-tīng beh tsiàu lí ê uē kiânn.
English: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, Yahweh shall be witness between us; surely according to your word so will we do.

Tailo: I jia-tsa̍h I ê tsō-uī, koh kā hûn pho͘ tī hit tíng-bīn.
English: He encloses the face of his throne, And spreads his cloud on it.

Tailo: In mn̄g i kóng, Lí ê bó͘ Sala̍h tī tó-uī? I ìn kóng, Tī pò͘-pêⁿ lāi.
English: They said to him, Where is Sarah, your wife? He said, See, in the tent.

Tailo: Siat-sú Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng, in-uī tik-tsuē Lí, tsiah tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su, in nā kui-ǹg Lí, jīn Lí ê miâ, koh tī tsit king tiān kî-tó, kā Lí khún-kiû,
English: When your people Israel are struck down before the enemy, because they have sinned against you; if they turn again to you, and confess your name, and pray and make supplication to you in this house:

Tailo: Hîng-uî uân-tsuân koh tsun-thàn Siōngtsú lu̍t-huat ê lâng, tsit khuán lâng tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, Who walk according to Yahweh's law.

Tailo: Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu m̄-thang khó-liân i, tī Isulael tiong tio̍h tû-khì bô tsuē ê hueh, hō͘ lí thang tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall put away the innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with you.

Tailo: Iésu kóng án-ne sī teh tsí Ka-lio̍k lâng Símòng ê kiáⁿ Iôtah, i sī tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ ê tsi̍t-ê, teh beh tshut-bē Iésu.
English: Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.

Tailo: Mô͘se lo̍h suaⁿ khì-kàu jîn-bîn hia, kā in hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, in tsiū ka-kī sé saⁿ.
English: Moses went down from the mountain to the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū án-ne kóng, Abulahàm sìn Siōngtè, só͘-í, Siōngtè tsiū kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng. (tsù, CSK 15:6)
English: For what does the Scripture say? Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

Tailo: Guá beh uī-tio̍h i tshî-siú Guá ê tsû-ài kàu íng-uán; Guá kah i só͘ li̍p ê iok it-tīng bē kái-piàn.
English: I will keep my loving kindness for him forevermore. My covenant will stand firm with him.

Tailo: In īng pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng kik I tsi̍t-tò͘, īng khó-ò͘ⁿ ê jiá I siū-khì.
English: They moved him to jealousy with strange gods; With abominations provoked they him to anger.

Tailo: Guán kin-á-ji̍t nā-sī uī-tio̍h tsit-ê pái-kha-.ê tit-tio̍h i hó ê hó tāi-tsì lâi siū sím-mn̄g,
English: if we are examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, by what means this man has been healed,

Tailo: Lín uân-tsuân sūn-ho̍k liáu-āu, guán tsiū beh lâi tshú-hua̍t hiah-ê m̄ sūn-ho̍k ê lâng.
English: and being in readiness to avenge all disobedience, when your obedience will be made full.

Tailo: Khióng-kiaⁿ lí kah tuà tī hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn li̍p-iok, in tuè in ê sîn-bîng kiânn siâ-îm, tsè-sū in ê sîn-bîng, ū lâng kiò lí, lí tsiū tsia̍h i ê tsè-mi̍h,
English: Don't make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, lest they play the prostitute after their gods, and sacrifice to their gods, and one call you and you eat of his sacrifice;

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, kóng-tio̍h lín, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khì, ta̍k lâng ho̍k-sāi i ê ngó͘-siōng, m̄-koh āu-lâi it-tīng ē thiaⁿ Guá ê uē, bô koh īng lé-mi̍h kah ngó͘-siōng siat-to̍k Guá ê sìng-miâ.
English: As for you, house of Israel, thus says the Lord Yahweh: Go you, serve everyone his idols, and hereafter also, if you will not listen to me; but my holy name shall you no more profane with your gifts, and with your idols.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ Si-óng bí-niûⁿ hong-sīng, Guá ē īng tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ i ê sàn-tshiah lâng kàu-gia̍h thang tsia̍h.
English: I will abundantly bless her provision. I will satisfy her poor with bread.

Tailo: A-si-a síng ū kuí-nā-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ sī Páulô ê pîng-iú, in mā tshe lâng lâi khǹg Páulô m̄-thang mō͘-hiám ji̍p-khì hì-hn̂g.
English: Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h kā tām-po̍h iû tò tī ka-kī tò tshiú ê tshiú tiong-sim.
English: The priest shall pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand;

Tailo: Guá só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê hit tsiah bíng-siù tshin-tshiūnn pà; i ê kha tshin-tshiūnn hîm ê kha, tshuì tshin-tshiūnn sai ê tshuì. Hit bué liông kā i ê tsâi-lîng, tsō-uī kah tuā kuân-pìng hō͘ hit tsiah bíng-siù.
English: The beast which I saw was like a leopard, and his feet were like those of a bear, and his mouth like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and great authority.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah iáu-buē tńg-.khì, sī-uē-tiúⁿ koh kā i kóng, Lí thang tò tńg-khì Siahuánn ê sun — Ahikam ê kiáⁿ Getália̍h hia; hiān-kim Babúlông ông siat-li̍p i kuán-hat Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ. Lí thang kah i tuà tī jîn-bîn tiong-kan, á-.sī lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò ha̍p-gî ê só͘-tsāi, tsiū thang khì. Tsiū án-ne, sī-uē-tiúⁿ sàng I-é-lí-miah bí-niûⁿ kah lé-mi̍h, hō͘ i khì.
English: Now while he was not yet gone back, Go back then, said he, to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people; or go wherever it seems right to you to go. So the captain of the guard gave him food and a present, and let him go.

Tailo: Hit tiâu lō͘ ing-tsiáu m̄-bat; sió-ing ê ba̍k-tsiu mā bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: That path no bird of prey knows, Neither has the falcon's eye seen it.

Tailo: Ge-bal láu-liān ê kah gâu ê lâng lóng tī lín tiong-kan tsò pó͘ tsûn-khang ê; só͘-ū kuè hái ê tsûn-tsiah kah in ê tsuí-siú lóng tī lí tiong-kan king-îng sing-lí.
English: The old men of Gebal and the wise men of it were in you your repairers of ship seams: all the ships of the sea with their mariners were in you to deal in your merchandise.

Tailo: mā kā sio-tsè î-suá, thang tsiàu jîn-bîn tsong-tso̍k ê pâng-thâu pun hō͘ in thang hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, tsiàu Mô͘se ê tsheh só͘ kì ê; tshù-lí hiah-ê gû mā sī án-ne.
English: They removed the burnt offerings, that they might give them according to the divisions of the fathers' houses of the children of the people, to offer to Yahweh, as it is written in the book of Moses. So did they with the oxen.

Tailo: I tio̍h tsiàu i ê khuì-la̍t hiàn hiah-ê pan-kah ê tsi̍t tsiah á-.sī hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ ê tsi̍t tsiah, to̍h-sī tsiàu i só͘ ē ê,
English: He shall offer one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, such as he is able to afford,

Tailo: In tuì guá ê kìng-pài sī khang-khang, in-uī in īng lâng ê kui-lu̍t tòng-tsò kài-bīng lâi kà-sī lâng. (tsù, ISI 29:13)
English: And in vain do they worship me, Teaching as doctrine rules made by men.'

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá ē kā lín khuán-thāi, tshin-tshiūnn Guá bat siūⁿ beh khuán-thāi in ê khuán-sit.
English: It shall happen that as I thought to do to them, so will I do to you.

Tailo: Lín nā tsun-siú king-tián só͘ kì-tsài ê Tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī (tsù, LBK 19:18) hit-ê Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê lu̍t-huat, án-ne tsiū tio̍h ā.
English: However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, You shall love your neighbor as yourself, you do well.

Tailo: In-uī lán iáu teh puē-gi̍k Siōngtè ê sî, I hō͘ ka-kī ê Kiáⁿ thè lán sí, hō͘ lán thang kah I koh-tsài hô-hó. Kì-jiân lán tsit-má í-king tit-tio̍h kah I hô-hó, lán ē koh khah in-uī Ki-tok ê ua̍h lâi tit-tio̍h tsín-kiù.
English: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we will be saved by his life.

Tailo: Só͘-í, i ê pē-bú kóng, I í-king tuā-hàn à, lín khì mn̄g i ka-kī.
English: Therefore his parents said, He is of age. Ask him.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iôtah lâng Moltékái tsē tī ông-kiong ê mn̂g, tsiū tsai tsit-ê lóng tuì guá put-lī.
English: Yet all this avails me nothing, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate.

Tailo: Ioap tsiū kā só͘ sǹg jîn-bîn ê tsóng-gia̍h pò-kò Tabi̍t, Isulael lâng ē gia̍h to ê ū tsi̍t-pah tsa̍p-bān, Iôtah lâng ē gia̍h to ê sì-tsa̍p tshit bān.
English: Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to David. All those of Israel were one million one hundred thousand men who drew sword: and in Judah were four hundred seventy thousand men who drew sword.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè tī Ho-lep kah lán li̍p-iok.
English: Yahweh our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.

Tailo: Siōngtsú khí-.lâi, hō͘ tē tuā tín-tāng ê sî, lâng tsiū ji̍p-khì tsio̍h-tōng, ji̍p-khì thô͘-khang, siám-phiah Siōngtsú ê hián-hik kah I ui-giâm ê îng-kng.
English: Men shall go into the caves of the rocks, And into the holes of the earth, From before the terror of Yahweh, And from the glory of his majesty, When he arises to shake the earth mightily.

Tailo: Tsia̍h ling ê enn-á, i ê tsi̍h ta-sò, liâm tī tíng-hâm; gín-á thó piáⁿ, bô lâng peh hō͘ i.
English: The tongue of the sucking child cleaves to the roof of his mouth for thirst: The young children ask bread, and no man breaks it to them.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kā Huilīsū lâng jiok tò tńg-.lâi, tsiū tshiúⁿ in ê iâⁿ-pâng.
English: The children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they plundered their camp.

Tailo: Guá pí lāu lâng khah bîng-pi̍k, in-uī guá ū teh tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī.
English: I understand more than the aged, Because I have kept your precepts.

Tailo: Esáu kóng, Tshiánn iông-ín guá kā tuè guá ê lâng lâu kuí-ê-á kah lí tsò-tīn. Iâkop kóng, M̄-bián án-ne! Tī guá ê tsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián to̍h hó.
English: Esau said, Let me now leave with you some of the folk who are with me. He said, Why? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.

Tailo: In tsiū jiok in lâi-kàu Ioltàn hô, khuàⁿ-tio̍h muá lō͘ lóng sī Alâm lâng kín tsáu ê sî só͘ hiat-ka̍k ê saⁿ-khò͘ kah khì-kū, sù-tsiá tsiū tńg-lâi huê-hok ông.
English: They went after them to the Jordan: and behold, all the way was full of garments and vessels, which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. The messengers returned, and told the king.

Tailo: Hit-ê hū-jîn-lâng khiā tī Iésu ê āu-bīn teh thî-khàu, ū ba̍k-sái tih-tâm Iésu ê kha. I tsiū īng ka-kī ê thâu-mn̂g lâi tshit, koh tsia̍p-tsia̍p tsim Iésu ê kha, īng phang-iû lâi buah kha.
English: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

Tailo: Sàn-tshiah lâng bô la̍t thang hiàn tsit khuán mi̍h, tsiū kíng bē-tàng hiú-huāi ê tshâ, uī i tshuē kî-khiáu ê sai-hū, lâi tshāi bē iô-tāng ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: He who is too impoverished for such an offering chooses a tree that will not rot. He seeks a skillful workman to set up an engraved image for him that will not be moved.

Tailo: Bô kian-siú koh phian-lī Ki-tok kà-sī ê lâng, in ê gán-tiong bô Siōngtè; kian-siú kà-sī ê lâng, tsiah ū kah Thiⁿ-pē í-ki̍p Kiáⁿ kiat-liân.
English: Whoever transgresses and doesn't remain in the teaching of Christ, doesn't have God. He who remains in the teaching, the same has both the Father and the Son.

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah tsiū tuì Siōngtsú hē guān, kóng, Lí nā kā Ammóng lâng kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong,
English: Jephthah vowed a vow to Yahweh, and said, If you will indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand,

Tailo: （ kám-siā ê si. ）Tsuân tē tio̍h ǹg Siōngtsú tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Shout for joy to Yahweh, all you lands!

Tailo: Lín lāu-bú sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Sī bó ê sai, phak tī tsiah-ê sai ê tiong-kan, tī sè-tsiah sai ê tiong-kan, iúⁿ-tshī i ê kiáⁿ.
English: and say, What was your mother? A lioness: she couched among lions, in the midst of the young lions she nourished her cubs.

Tailo: tē-tāng liáu-āu ū hué, Siōngtsú mā bô tī hué tiong; hué āu-bīn ū sè koh khin ê siann.
English: and after the earthquake a fire; but Yahweh was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.

Tailo: Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá tī Isulael ê tiong-kan, koh tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, í-guā bô pa̍t-ê. Guá ê tsú-bîn it-tīng íng-uán bô kiàn-siàu.
English: You will know that I am in the midst of Israel, And that I am Yahweh, your God, and there is no one else; And my people will never again be disappointed.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ná ē khì-sak guá? Sī án-tsuáⁿ am Lí ê bīn m̄-khuàⁿ guá?
English: Yahweh, why do you reject my soul? Why do you hide your face from me?

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá tī àu-náu, siū-khì, tuā thòng-hūn ê tiong-kan, īng tshun-tshut ê tshiú kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú-kut, tshin-sin kā lín kong-kik;
English: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation.

Tailo: Iésu tsai in ài beh mn̄g I, tsiū kā in kóng, Lín in-uī guá kóng, ' Koh bô guā kú, lín tsiū bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, koh-tsài bô guā kú, lín tsiū ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá. ' Teh mn̄g-lâi mn̄g-khì, sī-.bô?
English: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?'

Tailo: Taⁿ tio̍h kiù Lí ka-kī, tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng lo̍h-.lâi!
English: save yourself, and come down from the cross!

Tailo: Tsò lô͘-po̍k ê lâng tio̍h ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì sūn-ho̍k hiah-ê sè-tsiūⁿ ê tsú-lâng. Lín phah-piàⁿ tsò, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ in huann-hí, tio̍h sîng-sim sîng-ì lâi tsò, in-uī lín sī kìng-uì Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Servants, obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh, not just when they are looking, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.

Tailo: Sebah kah Tsal-mú-nah kóng, Lí ka-kī khí-lâi thâi guán, in-uī lâng án-tsuáⁿ, khuì-la̍t mā sī án-ne. Gîtióng tsiū khí-lâi thâi-sí Sebah kah Tsal-mú-nah, tshú in lo̍k-tô ām-kún ê táⁿ-pān, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn gue̍h-bâi.
English: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise you, and fall on us; for as the man is, so is his strength. Gideon arose, and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels' necks.

Tailo: I kóng, Amô͘su, lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá kóng, Khuànn-kìnn tsi̍t luâ jua̍h-thinn ê kué-tsí. Siōngtsú tsiū tuì guá kóng, Guá ê jîn-bîn — Isulael ê bua̍t-ji̍t kàu à, Guá it-tīng bô beh koh kā in liōng-tsîng.
English: He said, Amos, what do you see? I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then Yahweh said to me, The end has come on my people Israel. I will not again pass by them any more.

Tailo: Mô͘se tò tńg-khì Siōngtsú hia, kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ná ē pháiⁿ khuán-thāi tsiah-ê jîn-bîn? Ná ē tshe guá?
English: Moses returned to Yahweh, and said, Lord, why have you brought trouble on this people? Why is it that you have sent me?

Tailo: Amátsiah koh tuì Amô͘su kóng, Lí tsit-ê sian-kiàn, lí khì, tio̍h tsáu-khì Iôtah tē, tī hia thàn-tsia̍h, tī hia tsò sian-ti.
English: Amaziah also said to Amos, You seer, go, flee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:

Tailo: I tsiū tī hia khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ, koh tī hia tah i ê pò͘-pênn. Ísak ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū tī hia khui tsi̍t kháu tséⁿ.
English: He built an altar there, and called on the name of Yahweh, and pitched his tent there. There Isaac's servants dug a well.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Huâ-láu ná kā in khó͘-to̍k, in ná tsē suah ná huat-tián. Tsiū án-ne, ông to̍h uī-tio̍h Isulael lâng tshau-huân.
English: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread out. They were grieved because of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Tíng-bīn tsiah-ê lóng sī Lēbī lâng ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tī in ê sè-tāi tsin tshut-miâ, tuà tī Êlúsalèm.
English: These were heads of fathers' houses of the Levites, throughout their generations, chief men: these lived at Jerusalem.

Tailo: Ū sì tshing lâng tsò kò͘-mn̂g ê, koh ū sì tshing lâng kā Tabi̍t tsò īng lâi o-ló Siōngtsú ê ga̍k-khì.
English: and four thousand were doorkeepers; and four thousand praised Yahweh with the instruments which I made, said David, for giving praise.

Tailo: I só͘ khua-kháu ê sī i ióng-tsòng ê lân; ha̍p-uá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn hong ba̍t-ba̍t,
English: Strong scales are his pride, Shut up together with a close seal.

Tailo: Guá sim só͘ ài ê lâng, kiû lí kā guá kóng, lí tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi teh tshī iûⁿ? Tiong-tàu sî lí hō͘ in hioh tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi? Tī lí tâng-phuāⁿ ê iûⁿ-kûn ê piⁿ-á, guá ná ē tshin-tshiūnn tà bīn ê lâng?
English: Tell me, you whom my soul loves, Where you graze your flock, Where you rest them at noon; For why should I be as one who is veiled Beside the flocks of your companions? Lover

Tailo: M̄-koh, gû-káng-á, i ê phuê, i ê bah, i ê sái, lóng īng hué tī iâⁿ guā sio, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê.
English: But the bull, and its skin, and its flesh, and its dung, he burned with fire outside the camp; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t hāng m̄-hó, tshin-tshiūnn sī tshut tī tsiáng-kuân-.ê ê tshò-gō͘;
English: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, the sort of error which proceeds from the ruler.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, guá tsun-thàn bīng-līng lâi suan-pò͘. Tng guá teh suan-pò͘ ê sî, ū siaⁿ huat-tshut, hut-jiân tē-tāng, tsiah-ê kut sio liân-ha̍p, ta̍k ki kui i ê pún uī.
English: So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, an earthquake; and the bones came together, bone to its bone.

Tailo: Hit sî, Mítiân lâng, Amáli̍k lâng kah tang-hong ê jîn-bîn, lóng tsū-tsi̍p kuè hô, tī E-tsu-le-el ê suaⁿ-kok tsat iâⁿ.
English: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east assembled themselves together; and they passed over, and encamped in the valley of Jezreel.

Tailo: I hō͘ thiⁿ kē lo̍h-.lâi, tsiū kàng-lîm, tī I ê kha tsîng ū o͘-hûn.
English: He bowed the heavens also, and came down; Thick darkness was under his feet.

Tailo: Lín kám kóng siūⁿ beh piān-pok lâng ê uē? Tsua̍t-bāng ê lâng ê giân-lūn sī tshin-tshiūnn hong.
English: Do you intend to reprove words, Seeing that the speeches of one who is desperate are as wind?

Tailo: àm-kong-tsiáu, lô͘-tsî, ko͘-n̂g,
English: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,

Tailo: Mô͘se tiàu Betsalel, A-ho-li-ia̍p kah kiàn-nā sim ū tì-huī ê lâng lâi, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú īng tì-huī siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê sim, sim siū kám-tōng lâi tsò-kang ê.
English: Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart Yahweh had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it:

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tsim-tsiok thiaⁿ i ê kháu-khì, suî-sî sūn i ê uē-bué, kóng, Sī lah! Sī lí ê hiann-tī Bian-ha-tat! I kóng, Lín khì kā i tshuā-.lâi. Bian-ha-tat tshut-lâi kìnn ông, ông tsiū hō͘ i tsē tshia.
English: Now the men observed diligently, and hurried to catch whether it were his mind; and they said, Your brother Ben Hadad. Then he said, Go you, bring him. Then Ben Hadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.

Tailo: Tsuí koh tsiām-tsiām siau-thè, it-ti̍t kàu tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe-it, suaⁿ-thâu tsiah lō͘-hiān.
English: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsuí lāi bô si̍t bô lân ê, lín lóng tio̍h lia̍h-tsò sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: Whatever has no fins nor scales in the waters, that is an abomination to you.

Tailo: Mô͘ap ē tú-tio̍h huí-bia̍t, bô koh tsiâⁿ-tsò kok, in-uī in kiau-ngō͘, puē-gi̍k Siōngtsú.
English: Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he has magnified himself against Yahweh.

Tailo: In khì-kàu in só͘ kàu ê guā-pang lâng hia, siat-to̍k Guá ê sìng-miâ; in-uī lâng kí in lâi kóng, tse sī Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn, tuì I ê tē tshut-.lâi ê.
English: When they came to the nations, where they went, they profaned my holy name; in that men said of them, These are the people of Yahweh, and are gone forth out of his land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ui-giâm ê siann, koh hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h I phah lo̍h-.khì ê tshiú kah siū-khì tiong ê siū-khì, thun-bia̍t ê hué-iām, tshè-luî, tuā hong, ping-pha̍uh.
English: Yahweh will cause his glorious voice to be heard, and will show the descent of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a blast, tempest, and hailstones.

Tailo: kàu tē-tshit-ê An-hioh-ji̍t ê keh tńg kang, lín tio̍h sǹg gō͘-tsa̍p kang, koh tio̍h kā sin ê sò͘-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: even to the next day after the seventh Sabbath you shall number fifty days; and you shall offer a new meal offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú uī-tio̍h I ê tē lâi jia̍t-sim, liân-bín I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Then Yahweh was jealous for his land, And had pity on his people.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê kong-gī kah tiong-sìn lâi kā i pò-tap, in-uī kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú kā lí kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong. Tsóng-.sī, guá m̄-khíng tshun tshiú lâi hāi Siōngtsú só͘ buah iû ê.
English: Yahweh will render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; because Yahweh delivered you into my hand today, and I wouldn't put forth my hand against Yahweh's anointed.

Tailo: Iobuh só͘ kóng ê bô tì-sik, i ê uē bô tì-huī.
English: Job speaks without knowledge, His words are without wisdom.'

Tailo: Hiah-ê tuì lí tshut ê lâng, beh khí-tsō tsin kú í-king hong-huì ê só͘-tsāi; lí beh kiàn-li̍p li̍k-tāi huí-huāi ê tē-ki. Lí ē hō͘ lâng tshing-tsò ' Pó͘ siâⁿ tshiûⁿ phuà-khiah ê', kah ' Siu-lí ke-lō͘ thang hó tuà ê'.
English: Those who shall be of you shall build the old waste places; you shall raise up the foundations of many generations; and you shall be called The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.

Tailo: In-uī tì-huī ē ji̍p-khì lí ê sim, tì-sik ē tsò lí ê sim-sîn só͘ huann-hí ê.
English: For wisdom will enter into your heart. Knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Io-a-si ông jī-tsa̍p saⁿ nî, tsè-si iáu-buē kā tiān phò-huāi ê só͘-tsāi siu-lí hó-sè.
English: But it was so, that in the three and twentieth year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kóng, Huilīsū lâng ē kàu Gilgal lâi kong-kik guá, guá koh iáu-buē kiû Siōngtsú si un, guá tsiū bián-kióng hiàn sio-tsè.
English: therefore said I, Now will the Philistines come down on me to Gilgal, and I haven't entreated the favor of Yahweh: I forced myself therefore, and offered the burnt offering.

Tailo: tuì in kóng, Guá kin-á-ji̍t tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p huè, bē koh tsiàu-siông tshut-ji̍p; Siōngtsú mā bat tuì guá kóng, ' Lí bē-tàng kuè tsit-ê Ioltàn. '
English: He said to them, I am one hundred twenty years old this day; I can no more go out and come in: and Yahweh has said to me, You shall not go over this Jordan.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, I tshiúⁿ-.khì, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng tsó͘-tòng I? Siáⁿ lâng káⁿ mn̄g I, Lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Behold, he snatches away; who can hinder him? Who will ask him, What are you doing?'

Tailo: Hit sî, tú-tio̍h un-i̍k sí ê, ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: Iáu ū in ê hiann-tī tuā kuân-lîng ê ióng-sū, kiōng tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p peh lâng; Hat-ge-to-lîm ê kiáⁿ Tsap-ti-el sī in ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ.
English: and their brothers, mighty men of valor, one hundred twenty-eight; and their overseer was Zabdiel, the son of Haggedolim.

Tailo: ài in uī-tio̍h tsit-ê pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì, khì kî-kiû thinn-tíng ê Siōngtè liân-bín, bián-tit Taniel kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ, í-ki̍p Babúlông kî-tha tì-huī ê lâng tsò-hué bia̍t-bông.
English: that they would desire mercies of the God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his companions should not perish with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.

Tailo: In-uī ông-hō͘ só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì ē thuân-kàu tsìng tsa-bó͘ lâng, kóng, ' Ahasuiló͘ ông tiàu ông-hō͘ Ua-si-thih kàu ông ê bīn-tsîng, tsóng-.sī, i m̄ lâi', án-ne in ē biáu-sī in ê tiōng-hu.
English: For this deed of the queen will come abroad to all women, to make their husbands contemptible in their eyes, when it shall be reported, The king Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she didn't come.

Tailo: Īng khàm pak-lāi ê iû kah pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû, í-ki̍p nn̄g lia̍p io-tsí kah in só͘-ū ê iû, to̍h-sī uá-kīn io siang pîng ê iû kah kuaⁿ tíng-bīn ê bāng-se, í-ki̍p io-tsí, it-khài the̍h khí-.lâi.
English: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away.

Tailo: hue-bō, kha-liān, hue-tuà, hiuⁿ-a̍h, hû-tē,
English: the headdresses, the ankle chains, the sashes, the perfume bottles, the charms,

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun, I só͘ kíng Iâkop ê kiáⁿ-sun,
English: Remember his marvelous works that he has done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí hō͘ guán tò tńg-.lâi, hō͘ Lí ê bīn huat-tshut kng, guán tsiū tit-kiù!
English: Turn us again, Yahweh God of Armies. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.

Tailo: Guán tó tī guán ê kiàn-siàu tiong, guán ê lîng-jio̍k jia-khàm guán; in-uī tuì siàu-liân kàu taⁿ, guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tik-tsuē guán ê Siōngtè, bô tsun-thàn guán ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ê siann.
English: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against Yahweh our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even to this day; and we have not obeyed the voice of Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê iû kah ta̍k tsióng sio-tsè só͘ phuè ê kuàn-tiān tsin tsē. Án-ne, Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê tāi-tsì tsiàu tshù-sū pâi-lia̍t.
English: Also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings, and with the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of Yahweh was set in order.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ê tsiong-kio̍k í-king kàu à, Guá beh hō͘ Guá ê siū-khì lîm-kàu tī lí, mā beh tsiàu lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ lâi kā lí sím-phuàⁿ; tsiàu lí it-tshè khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì kā lí pò-ìng.
English: Now is the end on you, and I will send my anger on you, and will judge you according to your ways; and I will bring on you all your abominations.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ tsin-lí ê uē bô tsuân-pō͘ lī-khui guá ê tshuì, in-uī guá gióng-bōng Lí ê phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: Don't snatch the word of truth out of my mouth, For I put my hope in your ordinances.

Tailo: Iôtah tē kah Êlúsalèm só͘-ū thiàu-tâng ê, tsò sai-kong ê kah tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng, sîn-pu̍t, í-ki̍p it-tshè khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h, Io-si-iah lóng huì-tû tiāu, lâi tsiânn lu̍t-huat ê uē, sī kì tī tsè-si Hilkíiah tī Siōngtsú ê tiān só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsheh ê.
English: Moreover those who had familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the teraphim, and the idols, and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit-ê hiàn lé-mi̍h ê, ta̍k tsiah iûⁿ-á tio̍h phuè iù ê mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat kah iû sì-hūn tsi-it hin, tiâu-hô tsò sò͘-tsè.
English: then shall he who offers his offering offer to Yahweh a meal offering of a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the fourth part of a hin of oil:

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h kā i giām, lí khuàⁿ, phuê-hu nā ū só͘-tsāi tsíng kah pe̍h-pe̍h, tì-sú i ê mn̂g piàn-pe̍h, tī tsíng ê só͘-tsāi khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiah-bah,
English: and the priest shall examine him. Behold, if there is a white rising in the skin, and it has turned the hair white, and there is raw flesh in the rising,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsìng lâng ta̍k lâng tńg-khì in ê ke; Tabi̍t mā tńg-.khì, kā i ê ke tsiok-hok.
English: All the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.

Tailo: Piattò͘ koh līng-guā īng tsin tsē uē tshut-la̍t kiàn-tsìng, lâi khó͘-khǹg in kóng, Lín tio̍h kiù ka-kī thuat-lī tsit-ê siâ-ok ê sè-tāi.
English: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, Save yourselves from this crooked generation!

Tailo: So͘tóm ông kā Abúlâm kóng, Kā lâng kui guá, mi̍h lóng hō͘ lí.
English: The king of Sodom said to Abram, Give me the people, and take the goods to yourself.

Tailo: I ài tsiù-tsó͘, guān tsiù-tsó͘ lîm-kàu i; I bô ài tsiok-hok, guān tsiok-hok lī-khui i hn̄g-hn̄g!
English: Yes, he loved cursing, and it came to him. He didn't delight in blessing, and it was far from him.

Tailo: In pàng-sak Siōngtsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè ê tiān, khì ho̍k-sāi hiah-ê A-si-lah kah ngó͘-siōng; in-uī in tsit-ê tsuē, tsiū ū Siōngtsú ê siū-khì lîm-kàu Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm.
English: They forsook the house of Yahweh, the God of their fathers, and served the Asherim and the idols: and wrath came on Judah and Jerusalem for this their guiltiness.

Tailo: I tsiū īng Ahap ê miâ siá phue, īng ông ê ìn lâi tǹg, kià hiah-ê phue hō͘ Nabot ê lāi siâⁿ hiah-ê kah i tuà tsò-hué ê tiúⁿ-ló kuì-tso̍k.
English: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles who were in his city, and who lived with Naboth.

Tailo: Ū lâng mn̄g, Guá lâi kìnn Siōngtsú, kuī-pài tī suaⁿ-niá kuân ê só͘-tsāi ê Siōngtè, tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám tio̍h īng sio-tsè, á-.sī muá-nî ê gû-á lâi kìnn I?
English: How shall I come before Yahweh, And bow myself before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, With calves a year old?

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông tuì Isulael jîn-bîn kóng, Kàu ê-hng lín ē tsai, tshuā lín tshut Aigi̍p tē ê sī Siōngtsú.
English: Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, At evening, then you shall know that Yahweh has brought you out from the land of Egypt;

Tailo: Guá tī só͘ tshiúⁿ ê tsâi-bu̍t tiong khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-niá Sīnal ê suí saⁿ, gîn nn̄g-pah si-khel, kim tsi̍t tiāⁿ, tāng gō͘-tsa̍p si-khel, guá tham tsiah-ê mi̍h, tsiū kā i the̍h-.lâi, taⁿ tâi tī guá ê pò͘-pêⁿ lāi ê thô͘-kha, gîn tī i ê ē-té.
English: when I saw among the spoil a goodly Babylonian mantle, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.

Tailo: Lán kì-jiân siong-sìn Iésu sí-khì koh-tsài ua̍h khí-.lâi, lán mā siong-sìn Siōngtè ē thong-kuè Iésu tshuā hiah-ê sí-.khì ê lâng kah Iésu tsò-hué lâi.
English: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so those who have fallen asleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, m̄-thang tsia̍h ni̍h-sí ê tsing-seⁿ kah hueh, m̄-thang îm-luān. Lín nā bô huān-tio̍h tsiah-ê kài-bīng tsiū hó. Guān lín pîng-an.
English: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality, from which if you keep yourselves, it will be well with you. Farewell.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê lâng ū ua̍h-miā ê lō͘ thang kiânn, tsiah ē-tàng lī-khui im-hú.
English: The path of life leads upward for the wise, To keep him from going downward to Sheol.

Tailo: Lām-sám tsò-tsìng ê lâng ē bia̍t-bông; to̍k-to̍k tshin-hīⁿ thiaⁿ-tio̍h lâi kiàn-tsìng ê lâng, bô lâng ē-tàng kā i piān-tó.
English: A false witness will perish, And a man who listens speaks to eternity.

Tailo: Hō͘ lán ē-tàng thuat-lī tsiah-ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú,
English: To grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear,

Tailo: Ông kóng, Tse kám m̄-sī tuā ê Babúlông, guá īng guá tuā la̍t ê kuân, mā uī-tio̍h guá ê ui-giâm ê îng-kng lâi khí ê, lâi tsò pún-kok ê kiong-tiān?
English: The king spoke and said, Is not this great Babylon, which I have built for the royal dwelling place, by the might of my power and for the glory of my majesty?

Tailo: In ná tshin-tshiūnn gín-á tsē tī ke-lō͘ kháu, hō͘-siong tuā-siaⁿ huah, guán pûn phín-á, lín bô thiàu-bú! Guán tuì lín tshiùnn tsòng-sik ê ai-ko, lín bô thî-khàu.
English: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call one to another, saying, We piped to you, and you didn't dance. We mourned, and you didn't weep.'

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi, Guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh hō͘ lín kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, siau-sán, jia̍t-pēⁿ, ba̍k-tsiu phah-pháiⁿ, sim iu-siong. Lín ē khang-khang iā tsíng, in-uī lín ê tuì-ti̍k ē kā tsíng-tsí tsia̍h tiāu.
English: I also will do this to you: I will appoint terror over you, even consumption and fever, that shall consume the eyes, and make the soul to pine away; and you will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will eat it.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tiong thâu-tsiūⁿ ê tsa-po͘ ting, pí Lēbī lâng khah tsē nn̄g-pah tshit-tsa̍p-saⁿ-ê, lí beh kā i sio̍k tshut-.lâi.
English: For the redemption of the two hundred seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel, who exceed the number of the Levites,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá.
English: Then the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Hit sî, tshiū-nâ lāi ê tshiū-ba̍k ē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tshut huann-hí ê siann, in-uī I lâi beh sím-phuàⁿ tsuân tē.
English: Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Yahweh; For he comes to judge the earth.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan iáu tsûn-tsāi ê lâng, ū siáⁿ lâng bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit king tiān tsá-tsîng ê îng-kng? Tsit-má lín khuàⁿ-liáu án-tsuáⁿ? Kám m̄-sī tī lín ê ba̍k-tsiu kah-ná khuàⁿ bô siáⁿ-mi̍h kè-ta̍t?
English: Who is left among you who saw this house in its former glory? How do you see it now? Isn't it in your eyes as nothing?

Tailo: hit sî, lí tio̍h kā só͘-ū thâu-the ê tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ kah só͘-ū thâu-tsuí kang ê tsing-seⁿ, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, tsiah-ê lóng sio̍k Siōngtsú.
English: that you shall set apart to Yahweh all that opens the womb, and every firstborn which you have that comes from an animal. The males shall be Yahweh's.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì só͘ kóng-tshut ê uē mā beh án-ne, tsua̍t-tuì bô khang-khang tò tńg-lâi Guá tsia, sī beh tsiâⁿ Guá só͘ huann-hí ê, beh hō͘ Guá só͘ tshe i tsò ê tāi-tsì tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: so shall my word be that goes forth out of my mouth: it shall not return to me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.

Tailo: Tsháu ē ta, hue ē siā, in-uī Siōngtsú ê khuì tshue tī i ê tíng-bīn. Lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī tshin-tshiūnn hue-tsháu.
English: The grass withers, The flower fades, Because Yahweh's breath blows on it. Surely the people are like grass.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī tī suaⁿ-tē, tī pîng-guân, tī Ala̍hbah, tī suaⁿ-kha, tī khòng-iá, tī lâm-hong ê tē sī Hiat lâng, Amô͘lī lâng, Ka-nân lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Hi-bī lâng, I-é-bú-suh lâng tsiah-ê ông kì tī ē-té:
English: in the hill country, and in the lowland, and in the Arabah, and in the slopes, and in the wilderness, and in the South; the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:

Tailo: Koh lín mā ē uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ lâng thua-khì tsóng-tok kah kun-ông ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tuì in kah guā-pang lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

Tailo: I ē tshut kî-hō, ho͘-tiàu hn̄g-hn̄g ê jîn-bîn, huah kháu-hō kiò in tuì tē-ki̍k lâi; lí khuàⁿ, in teh kuáⁿ-kín tsàu-.lâi.
English: He will lift up a banner to the nations from far, And he will whistle for them from the end of the earth. Behold, they will come speedily and swiftly.

Tailo: Guá tsiū tuā-tuā tsik-pī hiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, kā in kóng, Siōngtè ê tiān ná ē pàng hong-huì? Guá tsiū tsū-tsi̍p Lēbī lâng, huê-ho̍k in guân-lâi ê jīm-bū.
English: Then contended I with the rulers, and said, Why is the house of God forsaken? I gathered them together, and set them in their place.

Tailo: Asah kiû-kiò Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, kóng, Siōngtsú ah, tī kiông ê kah luán-jio̍k-.ê ê tiong-kan, tû Lí í-guā lóng bô pang-tsān ê. Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí pang-tsān guán, in-uī guán uá-khò Lí, koh hōng Lí ê miâ khì tí-ti̍k hiah-ê kûn-tsiòng. Siōngtsú ah, Lí sī guán ê Siōngtè, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng khah iâⁿ Lí.
English: Asa cried to Yahweh his God, and said, Yahweh, there is none besides you to help, between the mighty and him who has no strength: help us, Yahweh our God; for we rely on you, and in your name are we come against this multitude. Yahweh, you are our God; don't let man prevail against you.

Tailo: Lí ē tsia̍h lí ê tshiú lô-khó͘ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, lí ē hióng-hok, sū-sū hing-thong.
English: For you will eat the labor of your hands. You will be happy, and it will be well with you.

Tailo: tsē tī suí ê bîn-tshn̂g, tshn̂g thâu-tsîng tshāi tsi̍t tè toh, kā Guá ê phang-liāu, Guá ê phang-iû pâi tī hit tíng-bīn.
English: and sit on a stately bed, with a table prepared before it, whereupon you did set my incense and my oil.

Tailo: Guá bat kóng, guá m̄-sī Ki-tok, tsí-put-kò sī siū-phài lâi tsò I ê sian-hong. Tsit-ê tāi-tsì, lín pún-sin sī guá ê kiàn-tsìng.
English: You yourselves testify that I said, I am not the Christ,' but, I have been sent before him.'

Tailo: Kun-ông tī An-hioh-ji̍t só͘ tio̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê sio-tsè, tio̍h īng bô khuat-tiám ê iûⁿ-ko la̍k tsiah, bô khuat-tiám ê mî-iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t tsiah;
English: The burnt offering that the prince shall offer to Yahweh shall be on the Sabbath day six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish;

Tailo: Nā ū hó-gia̍h lâng kuà kim tshiú-tsí, tshīng suí saⁿ ji̍p-lâi lín ê huē-tn̂g, koh ū tshīng phuà-saⁿ ê sàn-tshiah lâng ji̍p-.lâi,
English: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue , and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;

Tailo: I kā kok tsióng tsing-seⁿ līng-guā tsi̍t kûn tsi̍t kûn hun-khui, kau-tài lô͘-po̍k kuán-lí, koh kā lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lín tsò guá ê thâu-tsîng khì, tio̍h hō͘ ta̍k kûn tsi kan ū sio-lī.
English: He delivered them into the hands of his servants, every herd by itself, and said to his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space between herd and herd.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsiū kóng, Lí kiânn siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-jiah hō͘ guán khuànn, thang hō͘ guán lâi sìn Lí? Lí beh tsò ê kang sī siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: They said therefore to him, What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?

Tailo: In tsiū siám-khui kûn-tsiòng, tsē tsûn khì phian-phiah ê só͘-tsāi tuà.
English: They went away in the boat to a desert place by themselves.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín khì kā I ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, ' Iésu tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ā, I ē pí lín khah tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tī hia lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I. ' Taⁿ guá í-king kā lín kóng à.
English: Go quickly and tell his disciples, He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.' Behold, I have told you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng beh tshì-thàm Iésu, uá-lâi mn̄g I kóng, Lâng kám thang lî i ê bó͘?
English: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng king-îng ē tit-tio̍h hi-ké ê kang-tsînn; iā gī ê tsíng-tsí ê ē tit-tio̍h si̍t-tsāi ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: Wicked people earn deceitful wages, But one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

Tailo: Guá ū lâu hó bô͘-iūⁿ hō͘ lín, sī beh hō͘ lín thang tsiàu guá tuì lín só͘ tsò ê khì tsò.
English: For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsù-ì hit tīn káu tóng, thê-hông hiah-ê pháiⁿ lâng, tsù-ì hiah-ê kian-tshî kat-lé ê lâng.
English: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the false circumcision.

Tailo: Kám-siā īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú kah tshun tshiú kut tshut-.lâi ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: In ê enn-á ē tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng hō͘ lâng siak-sí, in ê tshù ē hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, in ê bó͘ ē hō͘ lâng lîng-jio̍k.
English: Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be ransacked, and their wives raped.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī guá ê tuì-ti̍k! Hō͘ guá tsáu-khì bih tī Lí hia.
English: Deliver me, Yahweh, from my enemies. I flee to you to hide me.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h lâi Guá tsia, lâi thiaⁿ tse, Guá tuì khí-thâu m̄-bat tī ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi kóng; tuì ū tsit-ê tāi-tsì khí, Guá to̍h tī hia. Taⁿ tsì-kuân Siōngtsú tshe guá kah I ê sîn lâi.
English: Come you near to me, hear you this; from the beginning I have not spoken in secret; from the time that it was, there am I: and now the Lord Yahweh has sent me, and his Spirit.

Tailo: Bú-bān ê lâng beh tshuē tì-huī, mā tshuē bē-tio̍h; tshong-bîng ê lâng ē tsin kín tit-tio̍h tì-sik.
English: A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn't find it, But knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h in-uī Guá só͘ tshòng-tsō ê lâi íng-uán huann-hí khuài-lo̍k; in-uī Guá tshòng-tsō Êlúsalèm, hō͘ i tsò huann-hí ê, tshòng-tsō i ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ in huann-hí khuài-lo̍k.
English: But be you glad and rejoice forever in that which I create; for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lú-pī khuàⁿ-tio̍h Piattò͘ tsē tī hia teh hang-hué, tsiū ba̍k-tsiu kim-kim kā i siòng, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng mā sī kah Iésu teh tsò-tīn ê.
English: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, This man also was with him.

Tailo: Guān lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè, tit-tio̍h o-ló! Tsiàu I bô hān ê tsû-pi, thong-kuè Iésu Ki-tok tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, I hō͘ lán tîng-thâu-seⁿ, thang tit-tio̍h sin ua̍h-miā ê ǹg-bāng,
English: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy became our father again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

Tailo: In tī sìng-tiān khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê sî, guá í-king uân-sîng kiat-tsīng-lé. Hit sî, pīng bô kûn-tsiòng, mā bô jiáu-luān,
English: amid which certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī suaⁿ tíng, tuì hué tiong bīn tuì bīn kah lín kóng-uē.
English: Yahweh spoke with you face to face on the mountain out of the midst of the fire,

Tailo: Nā ū nn̄g lâng sio-phah, kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê lâng ê bó͘ kīn uá-.lâi, beh kiù i ê tiōng-hu thuat-lī kā i phah-ê lâng ê tshiú, tshun tshiú lia̍h-tiâu hit-ê lâng ê ē-sin,
English: When men strive together one with another, and the wife of the one draws near to deliver her husband out of the hand of him who strikes him, and puts forth her hand, and takes him by the secrets;

Tailo: Tshiánn Lí kā guán kóng, la̍p-suè hō͘ Lô-má ê hông-tè ū ha̍h lu̍t-huat bô?
English: Tell us therefore, what do you think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?

Tailo: Tsè-si lóng bô kóng: Siōngtsú tī tó-uī? Káng-kái lu̍t-huat ê m̄-bat Guá, kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ puē-gi̍k Guá, sian-ti khò Baal lâi ī-giân, koh tsun-thàn bô lī-ik ê tāi-tsì.
English: The priests didn't say, Where is Yahweh? and those who handle the law didn't know me: the rulers also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

Tailo: Àm-sî, bîn-bāng tiong, Siōngtè lâi kā Amí-me-li̍k kóng, Lí sī kai sí ê lâng, in-uī lí só͘ tshuā hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng sī lâng ê bó͘.
English: But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to him, Behold, you are a dead man, because of the woman whom you have taken. For she is a man's wife.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū thǹg khí-.lâi, i tshiú gia̍h kuái-á, koh tī suaⁿ-kheⁿ-á kíng gō͘ tè kng-ku̍t ê nn̄g-tsio̍h, hē tī tē-á lāi, to̍h-sī kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng só͘ tuà ê lông; tshiú the̍h hìⁿ tsio̍h ê soh-á; tsiū kiâⁿ uá hit-ê Huilīsū lâng.
English: He took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the shepherd's bag which he had, even in his wallet; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.

Tailo: I kā hiah-ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ kóng, Kín-sīn lín ê só͘ tsò ê, in-uī lín sím-phuàⁿ m̄-sī uī-tio̍h lâng, sī uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú. Lín sím-phuàⁿ ê sî, I ē kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: and said to the judges, Consider what you do: for you don't judge for man, but for Yahweh; and he is with you in the judgment.

Tailo: In-uī Só͘lômóng kiû tse, Tsú huann-hí i ê uē.
English: The speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.

Tailo: Bô lō͘-īng ê lâng tô͘-bô͘ hāi lâng; i ê tshuì-tûn tshin-tshiūnn ū hué teh sio.
English: A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsú-lâng ē lâi kā lí kóng, ' Tshiánn niū uī hō͘ tsit-ê lâng', lí ē kám-kak kiàn-siàu, suah tio̍h khì tsē tī siōng bué ê uī.
English: and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, Make room for this person.' Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.

Tailo: In-uī in uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê miâ tshut-guā thuân hok-im, lóng bô tuì bī-sìn-tsiá tsiap-siū siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: because for the sake of the Name they went out, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

Tailo: Lán ná ē lóng thiaⁿ-tio̍h in tsiàu lán tāi-ke tshut-sì to̍h teh kóng ê gí-giân teh kóng uē?
English: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

Tailo: Lí ē huaⁿ-hí koh khuài-lo̍k; tsin tsē lâng mā ē uī-tio̍h i ê tshut-sì lâi huann-hí.
English: You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.

Tailo: Guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh siàu-liām lín. Tuì lín tsìng lâng ū tsit khuán ê kám-tsîng sī tong-jiân ê tāi-tsì, in-uī bô-lūn guá tī kaⁿ-ga̍k lāi, á-.sī uī-tio̍h hok-im teh piān-hō͘ kah tsò-tsìng ê sî, lín lóng ū kah guá hun-hióng Siōngtè ê un-tián.
English: It is even right for me to think this way on behalf of all of you, because I have you in my heart, because, both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the Good News, you all are partakers with me of grace.

Tailo: Piáu-bīn khuàⁿ khí-.lâi, pài thiⁿ-sài, ké khiam-pi, gi̍k-thāi ka-kī ê sing-khu kah-ná sī ū tì-huī, kî-si̍t tuì khòng-tsè jio̍k-thé ê tsîng-io̍k lóng bô lō͘-īng.
English: Which things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship, and humility, and severity to the body; but aren't of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lâng pí sûn-kim khah tsió, hō͘ lâng pí Ohui ê kim khah tsió.
English: I will make people more rare than fine gold, even a person than the pure gold of Ophir.

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê tsai-lān kuè-liáu ê ji̍t-tsí, ji̍t ē piàn o͘-àm, gue̍h bē huat kng,
English: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,

Tailo: Tsit sè-kan ê sîn-bîng hō͘ hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng ê sim-sîn tsheⁿ-mê, bē-tàng khuànn-kìnn hok-im ê kng; tsit-ê hok-im teh kiàn-tsìng Ki-tok ê îng-kng, Ki-tok sī Siōngtè ê hîng-siōng.
English: in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving, that the light of the Good News of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not dawn on them.

Tailo: Sàulô tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ I-é-sái, kóng, Tshe lí ê kiáⁿ Tabi̍t, to̍h-sī hit-ê tshī iûⁿ ê, lâi guá tsia.
English: Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, Send me David your son, who is with the sheep.

Tailo: Li-bé-kah koh hiaⁿh tuā-kiáⁿ Esáu siu tī i tshù lāi ê suí saⁿ, hō͘ i ê sè-hàn kiánn Iâkop tshīng,
English: Rebekah took the good clothes of Esau, her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob, her younger son.

Tailo: In tsìng be̍h, siu-sîng tshì-phè; lô-khó͘ mā lóng bô lī-ik. In-uī Siōngtsú ê tuā siū-khì, in ē uī-tio̍h in ê lông-sán-bu̍t lâi kiàn-siàu.
English: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, and profit nothing: and you shall be ashamed of your fruits, because of the fierce anger of Yahweh.

Tailo: I tsò lâng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ iá-lî, i ê tshiú ē kong-kik kûn-tsiòng, kûn-tsiòng ê tshiú ē kong-kik i; i ē khiā tī tsìng hiann-tī ê thâu-tsîng.
English: He will be like a wild donkey among men. His hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him. He will live opposite all of his brothers.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Piattò͘ kah tsa̍p-it-ê sù-tô͘ khiā khí-.lâi, tuā-siaⁿ tuì in kóng, Iô-tá-iah lâng kah só͘-ū tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê lâng, lín tio̍h tsai tsit-ê tāi-tsì, mā tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ guá ê uē.
English: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

Tailo: In-uī guá só͘ tsin kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì lîm-kàu guá, guá só͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê kàu tī guá.
English: For the thing which I fear comes on me, That which I am afraid of comes to me.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā bān-tsú ê Tsú, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Give thanks to the Lord of lords; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Guān guá hō͘ kong-tō ê thian-phîng lâi tshìn, hō͘ Siōngtè tsai-iáⁿ guá ê sûn-tsuân.
English: (Let me be weighed in an even balance, That God may know my integrity);

Tailo: Kā thâu-khak té tī puâⁿ-.ni̍h, phâng lâi hō͘ tsa-bó͘ gín-á. Tsa-bó͘ gín-á tsiū the̍h-khì hō͘ in lāu-bú.
English: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.

Tailo: lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, lí tshù lāi só͘-ū ê kah lí ê tsó͘-sian tsik-tsū kàu hiān-kim ê, lóng ē siū tshiúⁿ kàu Babúlông, bô lâu kah puàⁿ-hāng. Tse sī Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: Behold, the days come, that all that is in your house, and that which your fathers have laid up in store to this day, shall be carried to Babylon: nothing shall be left, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá kah i, nn̄g lâng siâng hit mê ū bāng-kìnn, guán kok lâng ê bāng ū bô kāng ê ì-gī.
English: We dreamed a dream in one night, I and he. We dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.

Tailo: Tsè-si ê sò͘-tsè tio̍h tsuân-pō͘ sio, m̄-thang the̍h-lâi tsia̍h.
English: Every meal offering of a priest shall be wholly burned. It shall not be eaten.

Tailo: Kám-siā tshuā Isulael lâng tuì Aigi̍p tshut-.lâi ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: And brought out Israel from among them; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Só͘lômóng khì tuè Sitòng lâng ê lú-sîn A-si-tha-lot kah Ammóng lâng khó-ò͘ⁿ ê sîn-bîng Mil-kham.
English: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Guá ê sim uī-tio̍h Mô͘ap tshin-tshiūnn phín-siau teh tân, Guá ê sim uī-tio̍h Kel-ha-la-siat lâng tshin-tshiūnn phín-siau teh tân, in-uī in só͘ tsik-tsū ê tsâi-bu̍t lóng bô-.khì à.
English: Therefore my heart sounds for Moab like pipes, and my heart sounds like pipes for the men of Kir Heres: therefore the abundance that he has gotten is perished.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Hū-jîn lâng, lí ê sìn-sim hō͘ lí ê pēⁿ hó-.khì. Tsò lí an-sim tńg-.khì.
English: He said to her, Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.

Tailo: Lāi-īⁿ ū mn̂g ǹg lâm, tuì mn̂g kàu mn̂g i ǹg lâm lâi niû, tsi̍t pah tiú.
English: There was a gate to the inner court toward the south: and he measured from gate to gate toward the south a hundred cubits.

Tailo: Tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng tuì Êlúsalèm sì-kho͘-uî ê pîng-guân kah tuì Ne-to-huat ê tsng-thâu lâi tsū-tsi̍p,
English: The sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of the Netophathites;

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ Babúlông ông ê tshiú-kut ū la̍t, kā Guá ê to kau tī i ê tshiú; Guá beh at-tn̄g Huâ-láu ê tshiú-kut, i ē tī i ê bīn-tsîng ai-siaⁿ thó͘-khuì, tshin-tshiūnn sí-siong ê lâng teh ai-siaⁿ thó͘-khuì.
English: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groanings of a deadly wounded man.

Tailo: Kok-ông ē pi-ai, ông-tshin ē hi-bî, jîn-bîn ê tshiú phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah. Guá beh tsiàu in ê só͘ kiâⁿ lâi kā in khuán-thāi, tsiàu in ing-kai siū ê sím-phuàⁿ lâi kā in sím-phuàⁿ. In tsiū tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do to them after their way, and according to their own judgments will I judge them; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtsú hut-jiân tuì Mô͘se, Alông kah Milíám kóng, Lín saⁿ lâng tshut-lâi huē-bō͘ tsia. In saⁿ lâng tsiū tshut-.lâi.
English: Yahweh spoke suddenly to Moses, and to Aaron, and to Miriam, Come out you three to the tent of meeting. They three came out.

Tailo: Sit-lo̍h ê, Guá beh khì tshuē i; siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k ê, Guá beh tshuā i tńg-.lâi; siū-siong ê, Guá beh kā i pau; phuà-pēⁿ ê, Guá beh kā i i-tī; tsóng-.sī, puî ê, ióng ê, Guá beh kā i tû-bia̍t, mā beh píng kong kā in iúⁿ-tshī.
English: I will seek that which was lost, and will bring back that which was driven away, and will bind up that which was broken, and will strengthen that which was sick: but the fat and the strong I will destroy; I will feed them in justice.

Tailo: Iésu koh tuì Tulô ê tē-khu, king-kuè Sitòng kah Te-ka-po͘-lī tē-khu, lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘.
English: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the region of Decapolis.

Tailo: Tsiū tiàu-tsi̍p tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng, kā in kóng, Lín tio̍h khì Iôtah hiah-ê siâⁿ, tuì Isulael jîn-bîn bō͘-khuán, thang ta̍k nî siu-lí lín ê Siōngtè ê tiān; lín tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín pān-lí tsit-ê tāi-tsì. Tsóng-.sī, Lēbī lâng bô teh kuáⁿ-kín.
English: He gathered together the priests and the Levites, and said to them, Go out to the cities of Judah, and gather of all Israel money to repair the house of your God from year to year; and see that you hasten the matter. However the Levites didn't hurry.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsi̍t-ê lâng ē tshī tsi̍t tsiah gû-bó kah nn̄g tsiah mî-iûⁿ-bó.
English: It shall happen in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow, and two sheep;

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah án-ne kóng: Isulael lâng pīng bô tsiàm Mô͘ap tē kah Ammóng lâng ê tē.
English: and he said to him, Thus says Jephthah: Israel didn't take away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon,

Tailo: Lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Tsú-lâng, lí só͘ huan-hù ê guá lóng í-king tsò à, m̄-koh, iáu-koh ū khang-uī. '
English: The servant said, Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.'

Tailo: Só͘lômóng tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh uī Siōngtsú ê miâ khí sìng-tiān, mā uī ka-kī ê kok khí hông-kiong.
English: Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the name of Yahweh, and a house for his kingdom.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel; tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê tsáu-siù, só͘-ū ê thâng-thuā, só͘-ū ê pue-tsiáu, kiàn-nā tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê tōng-bu̍t, kok tsiàu i ê tso̍k-luī mā lóng tshut tuā tsûn.
English: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went forth out of the ark.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h siám-phiah gû-gōng ê tsing-lūn, tso̍k-phó͘ ê hun-tsing kah lu̍t-huat ê tsing-tsip, in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī bô lī-ik koh bô kè-ta̍t.
English: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

Tailo: In siat-li̍p kun-ông, m̄-sī tuì Guá lâi siat-li̍p i; in siat-li̍p siú-líng, Guá mā m̄-tsai. In īng in ê gîn kah in ê kim tsō ngó͘-siōng, tì-sú in siū tsián-tû.
English: They have set up kings, but not by me. They have made princes, and I didn't approve. Of their silver and their gold they have made themselves idols, That they may be cut off.

Tailo: Īng thih-liān pa̍k in ê kun-ông, īng thih-khàu lâi só in ê jîn-sîn;
English: To bind their kings with chains, And their nobles with fetters of iron;

Tailo: Bián-liû beh kui tī He-lêm（ Tsù, Mā kiò-tsò Hel-tāi）, Tobiiah, Ia-ta-iah kah Tse-huán-iah ê kiáⁿ — Hiân （ Tsiū-sī Io-si-iah ）, hē tī Siōngtsú ê tiān tsò kì-liām.
English: The crowns shall be to Helem, and to Tobijah, and to Jedaiah, and to Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá beh uī-tio̍h Si-bú-mah ê phû-tô tshiū ai-khàu kah Ia-tsel lâng ê ai-khàu sio-siâng. Hesibóng kah E-lé-a-leh, guá beh īng ba̍k-sái kā lí kuàn-ak, in-uī lín siu-sîng kué-tsí kah ngó͘-kok ê sî, huah-hiàm ê siann hut-jiân kàu.
English: Therefore I will weep with the weeping of Jazer for the vine of Sibmah. I will water you with my tears, Heshbon, and Elealeh: for on your summer fruits and on your harvest the battle shout has fallen.

Tailo: Kā in hiat-lo̍h hué-lô͘, tī hia in ē thî-khàu, kā-gê tshiat-khí.
English: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be weeping and the gnashing of teeth.

Tailo: Lín tsit-má pá-tsiok ê lâng ē ū tsai-hō! In-uī lín teh beh iau; lín tsit-má teh tshiò ê lâng ē ū tsai-hō! In-uī lín teh beh ai-siong thî-khàu.
English: Woe to you, you who are full now! For you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now! For you will mourn and weep.

Tailo: Tē-bīn tsiū án-ne piàn-uāⁿ tshin-tshiūnn khàm ìn ê thô͘, bān-mi̍h hián-hiān tshin-tshiūnn saⁿ-khò͘ ê tshái-sik.
English: It is changed as clay under the seal, And stands forth as a garment.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, Guá ê siū-khì tit-tio̍h tsiânn, Guá tuì in tuā siū-khì ê ē suah, Guá tsiū siū an-uì. Jî-tshiánn Guá tuì in tuā siū-khì ê í-king tsiânn, in tsiū thang tsai Guá — Siōngtsú sī jia̍t-sim lâi kóng ê.
English: Thus shall my anger be accomplished, and I will cause my wrath toward them to rest, and I shall be comforted; and they shall know that I, Yahweh, have spoken in my zeal, when I have accomplished my wrath on them.

Tailo: In kā in ê kiáⁿ-jî tsò tsè-mi̍h, lâi hiàn hō͘ kuí-sîn,
English: Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

Tailo: Guá sī tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ê khé-sī tsiah tńg-.khì. Guá su-hā tuì hiah-ê ū bîng-bōng ê lâng suat-bîng guá tī guā-pang só͘ thuân ê hok-im, bián-tit guá tsit-má á-.sī í-tsîng só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì piàn-sîng bô tshái-kang.
English: I went up by revelation, and I laid before them the Good News which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately before those who were respected, for fear that I might be running, or had run, in vain.

Tailo: In-uī ū tsin tsē m̄ sūn-ho̍k ê lâng, to̍h-sī hiah-ê kóng siáu-uē lâi khi-phiàn lâng ê, iû-kî-sī tsú-tiunn tio̍h siū kat-lé ê Iô-tá-iah Ki-tok-tô͘.
English: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,

Tailo: Guá só͘ kóng ê iàu-tiám to̍h-sī, lán ū tsit khuán ê tuā-tsè-si, I tsē tī thinn-tíng tsì-tuā Siōngtè pó-tsō ê tsiànn pîng.
English: Now in the things which we are saying, the main point is this. We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,

Tailo: Lí khí-lâi khì-kàu Sitòng ê Tsa-le-phat, khì tuà tī hia. Lí khuàⁿ, Guá í-king bīng-līng hit só͘-tsāi ê tsi̍t-ê kuáⁿ-hū kā lí iúⁿ-tshī.
English: Arise, get you to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tī tshì-phè lāi ê hué-iām tiong tuì i tshut-hiān. I khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshì-phè teh to̍h, lí khuàⁿ, tshì-phè ā bô hō͘ hué sio-.khì.
English: The angel of Yahweh appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush. He looked, and behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.

Tailo: Ta-lió-suh jī nî tsa̍p-it-.gue̍h, to̍h-sī Se-bat gue̍h （ Tsù, Iô-tá-iah lâng siū lia̍h āu Iô-tá-iah ji̍t li̍k ê tē 11-ê gue̍h-hūn, siong-tong se-li̍k ê it-gue̍h hi̍k jī-gue̍h ） jī-tsa̍p sì, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Ittó͘ ê sun — Belékiah ê kiáⁿ — sian-ti Tsa-kha-lī-a, kóng,
English: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán m̄-thang īng pháiⁿ-sim ok-to̍k ê kū kàⁿ-bó, tio̍h īng sûn-tsuân tsin-si̍t ê bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tsò tsè-mi̍h lâi siú tseh.
English: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old yeast, neither with the yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

Tailo: Io-ho-iá-tah tsiām-tsiām lāu, ji̍t-tsí buán-tsiok tsiū sí. Sí ê sî tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p huè,
English: But Jehoiada grew old and was full of days, and he died; one hundred thirty years old was he when he died.

Tailo: Phó͘-thinn-ē ê kok-uī, kuân-pìng kah lia̍t kok ê ui-kuân lóng kau hō͘ tsì-kuân ê sìng ê tsú-bîn. I ê kok sī íng-uán ê kok, kiàn-nā ū kuân ê lóng ē ho̍k-sāi sūn-ho̍k I.
English: The kingdom and the dominion, and the greatness of the kingdoms under the whole sky, shall be given to the people of the saints of the Most High: his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.

Tailo: In kô-kô tîⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tshì-phè, tshin-tshiūnn lim tsiú lim kah tsuì-tsuì, in iáu-koh ē sio-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn ta-ta ê tsháu.
English: For entangled like thorns, and drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly like dry stubble.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tuì hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí tshiú tshun tshut-.lâi! I tsi̍t ē tshun tshiú, tshiú tsiū suî-sî ho̍k-guân, tshin-tshiūnn līng-guā hit ki tshiú.
English: Then he told the man, Stretch out your hand. He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

Tailo: Ǹg lâm tī īⁿ ê tshiûⁿ ê khuah, tī keh-khui ê só͘-tsāi tuì-bīn, mā tī tshù-the̍h ê tuì-bīn, ū hiah-ê pâng.
English: In the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, before the separate place, and before the building, there were chambers.

Tailo: I tuà tī Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē, La̍h-má kah Bethel ê tiong-kan, tī Te-bó͘-la̍h ê tsó tshiū kha. Isulael lâng lóng khì i hia, siū i phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: She lived under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.

Tailo: Koh tuì Itsakal tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan, īng Kisióng kah i ê kau-iá, Ta-be-lat kah i ê kau-iá,
English: Out of the tribe of Issachar, Kishion with its suburbs, Daberath with its suburbs,

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ kiò I-é-lí-miah lâi, kā i kóng, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè bat kóng: Beh kàng tsit-ê tsai-hō hō͘ tsit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: The captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said to him, Yahweh your God pronounced this evil on this place;

Tailo: Tng lín tshut Aigi̍p ê sî, Guá kah lín li̍p-iok ê uē. Guá ê Sìng Sîn tiàm tī lín tiong-kan, lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ.
English: This is the word that I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt, and my Spirit lived among you. Don't be afraid.'

Tailo: Bô sàng lé kan-taⁿ khua-kháu lé-mi̍h guā hó ê lâng, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū hong ū hûn ā bô lo̍h hō͘.
English: As clouds and wind without rain, So is he who boasts of gifts deceptively.

Tailo: in ê lo̍k-tô ū sì-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p gō͘ tsiah, lî ū la̍k-tshing tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tsiah.
English: their camels, four hundred thirty-five; their donkeys, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.

Tailo: Thâu-tsi̍t-tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn sai, tē-jī tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn gû-á kiáⁿ, tē-saⁿ tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h ê bīn tshin-tshiūnn lâng, tē-sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn teh pue ê ing.
English: The first creature was like a lion, and the second creature like a calf, and the third creature had a face like a man, and the fourth was like a flying eagle.

Tailo: In hiàn tsè tī suaⁿ tíng, sio hiuⁿ tī suaⁿ-thâu, tī siōng tshiū, iông tshiū kah la̍t tshiū ê ē-bīn, in-uī in ê ìm-ńg tsin hó; só͘-í, lín ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ îm-luān, lín ê sin-niû kiânn kan-îm.
English: They sacrifice on the tops of the mountains, And burn incense on the hills, under oaks and poplars and terebinths, Because its shade is good. Therefore your daughters play the prostitute, And your brides commit adultery.

Tailo: Iésu khiā tī tsóng-tok ê bīn-tsîng; tsóng-tok mn̄g I kóng, Lí sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông, sī-.bô? Iésu ìn kóng, Tse sī lí kóng ê.
English: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Are you the King of the Jews? Jesus said to him, So you say.

Tailo: Tio̍h pi-siong, thî-khàu lâu ba̍k-sái, kā lín ê tshiò-bīn piàn-tsò ai-siong, huann-hí piàn-tsò iu-tshiû.
English: Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsē tī gī-huē tiong ê lâng lóng lia̍h Su-tê-hua-no͘h kim-kim khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê bīn ná tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ-sài ê bīn.
English: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h hiah-ê sian-ti, guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn iu-siong, guá ê kut lóng gī-gī tshuah; uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú kah I sìng ê uē, guá tshin-tshiūnn tsiú-tsuì ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ tsiú só͘ khah iâⁿ ê lâng.
English: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of Yahweh, and because of his holy words.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tuì jîn-bîn suan-pò͘ liáu-āu, tio̍h siat-li̍p hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ tsò thâu lâi tshuā jîn-bîn.
English: It shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking to the people, that they shall appoint captains of armies at the head of the people.

Tailo: （ Tsi̍t phiⁿ si-kua, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Tsuân tē lóng tio̍h tuì Siōngtè lâi tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!

Tailo: Hesibóng kah E-lé-a-leh, pi-ai ê siann thàu kàu Ia-hat. Só͘-í, Mô͘ap tuà kun-khì ê tuā-siaⁿ huah-hiàm, in ê sim phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: Heshbon cries out with Elealeh. Their voice is heard even to Jahaz. Therefore the armed men of Moab cry aloud. Their souls tremble within them.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì hia king-kuè, lí khuàⁿ, i sí-.khì à; guá tshuē mā lóng tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: But he passed away, and behold, he was not. Yes, I sought him, but he could not be found.

Tailo: Guá nā kóng beh bē kì-tit guá ê ai-uàn, beh kái guá ê iu-iông tsiâⁿ-tsò huann-hí;
English: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face, and cheer up;'

Tailo: In tsiū kā Siōngtsú ê kuī kah huē-bō͘, í-ki̍p pò͘-pêⁿ lāi it-tshè sìng ê khì-kū ūn-.lâi; tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng lóng kā i kng khí-.lâi.
English: They brought up the ark of Yahweh, and the tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; even these did the priests and the Levites bring up.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng ê tsìng lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, kiàn-nā Isulael tiong, tuì jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng, ē tshut-khì kau-tsiàn ê, tio̍h sǹg in ê tsóng-gia̍h.
English: Take the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers' houses, all who are able to go forth to war in Israel.

Tailo: Lín ài lâng án-tsuáⁿ tuì-thāi lín, mā tio̍h án-ne tuì-thāi lâng.
English: As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.

Tailo: ' Siat-sú ū tsai-hō lîm-kàu guán, á-.sī to-kiàm, khián-tsik, á-.sī un-i̍k, ki-hng, tng huān-lān ê sî, guán ē khiā tī tsit king ê thâu-tsîng, tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng khún-kiû Lí, in-uī Lí ê miâ sī tiàm tī tsit king tiān, Lí ē thiaⁿ guán ê kî-kiû lâi tsín-kiù. '
English: If evil come on us, the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we will stand before this house, and before you, (for your name is in this house), and cry to you in our affliction, and you will hear and save.

Tailo: guān Lí tuì thiⁿ, Lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi lâi thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, tsiàu guā-pang lâng it-tshè só͘ tuì Lí kiû ê lâi kiâⁿ; hō͘ thiⁿ-ē bān-bîn lóng bat Lí ê miâ, kìng-uì Lí kah Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng sio-siâng, koh hō͘ in tsai guá só͘ khí tsit king tiān, sī īng Lí ê miâ lâi tshing ê.
English: then hear from heaven, even from your dwelling place, and do according to all that the foreigner calls to you for; that all the peoples of the earth may know your name, and fear you, as does your people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by your name.

Tailo: Bô tsi̍t-ê lâng hiah hó-tánn káⁿ jiá-tio̍h i; án-ne, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng?
English: None is so fierce that he dare stir him up. Who then is he who can stand before me?

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ lī-khui gī-huē, muá-sim huann-hí, tse sī in-uī in hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò ē kham-tit uī-tio̍h Tsú ê miâ siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus' name.

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì Siōngtsú kóng,
English: Moses spoke to Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Lóng m̄-sī; tī tsiah-ê só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì, lán uá-khò thiàⁿ lán ê Siōngtè, í-king tit-tio̍h uân-tsuân ê sìng-lī.
English: No, in all these things, we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.

Tailo: Sâmsóng tshuì-ta kàu-ki̍k, tsiū kiû-kiò Siōngtsú kóng, Lí kì-jiân īng Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tshiú kiânn tsiah tuā ê tsín-kiù, tsóng-bô guá taⁿ tio̍h tshuì-ta lâi sí, hām-lo̍h tī bô siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tshiú?
English: He was very thirsty, and called on Yahweh, and said, You have given this great deliverance by the hand of your servant; and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng ê tiong-kan, Ahiiah kuán-lí Siōngtsú tiān ê kim-khò͘ kah sìng-mi̍h ê kim-khò͘.
English: Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng huâi-īn, seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i sī tsi̍t-ê tshing-siù ê gín-á, tsiū kā i tshàng saⁿ gue̍h-ji̍t.
English: The woman conceived, and bore a son. When she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him three months.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t tsì-kuân Siōngtè pīng bô tuà tī lâng ê tshiú só͘ khí ê tshù, tshin-tshiūnn sian-ti só͘ kóng,
English: However, the Most High doesn't dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says,

Tailo: Alông tsiàu Mô͘se só͘ kóng ê the̍h-.lâi, tsáu kàu huē tiong; lí khuàⁿ, un-i̍k í-king huat tī jîn-bîn tiong. I tsiū hē hiuⁿ, kā jîn-bîn sio̍k-tsuē.
English: Aaron took as Moses spoke, and ran into the midst of the assembly; and behold, the plague was begun among the people: and he put on the incense, and made atonement for the people.

Tailo: to̍h-sī khòng-iá pîng-guân ê Betsik, uī-tio̍h Lūbiān lâng Siat ê; Gilia̍t ê Lah-bua̍t, uī-tio̍h Ga̍t lâng Siat ê; Basiáng ê Ko-lân, uī-tio̍h Mánáse lâng Siat ê.
English: namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.

Tailo: In-uī kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ piàn-tsò hi-bî, pha-hng ê tshù-the̍h tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá; gû-á ē tī hia tsia̍h tsháu, tó tī hia, mā ē kā tshiū-ki ê hio̍h tsia̍h liáu-liáu.
English: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī kah i tī-.leh ê tsiàn-sū, lóng khì kīn-uá siâⁿ ê thâu-tsîng, tī Ai siânn ê pak pîng tsat iâⁿ. Τī i kah Ai siânn ê tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: All the people, even the men of war who were with him, went up, and drew near, and came before the city, and encamped on the north side of Ai: now there was a valley between him and Ai.

Tailo: Lí lâi-kàu Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, sîng-tsiap lâi tuà tī hia,
English: It shall be, when you are come in to the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, and possess it, and dwell therein,

Tailo: Tāi-ke bô sio e-kheh, ta̍k-ê tsiàu i ê lō͘-suàⁿ tsìn-hîng, tú-tio̍h tshiuⁿ, to mā bô siám-phiah.
English: Neither does one jostle another; They march everyone in his path, And they burst through the defenses, And don't break ranks.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê sian-ti lâi kìnn Isulael ông Ahap kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t tuā-tīn ê lâng bô? Lí khuàⁿ, kin-á-ji̍t guá ē kā in kau tī lí ê tshiú tiong, lí tsiū tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú. '
English: Behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel, and said, Thus says Yahweh, Have you seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into your hand this day; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Babúlông lâng, tshiúⁿ Guá ê sán-gia̍p ê, in-uī lín huann-hí khuài-lo̍k, in-uī lín thiàu-lâi thiàu-khì, tshin-tshiūnn ta̍h ngó͘-kok ê gû-bó, mā teh háu tshin-tshiūnn ióng ê bé.
English: Because you are glad, because you rejoice, O you who plunder my heritage, because you are wanton as a heifer that treads out the grain, and neigh as strong horses;

Tailo: M̄-thang khi-phiàn ka-kī, Siōngtè sī bē-tàng bú-jio̍k ê. Lâng ē tsiàu i só͘ iā ê tsíng lâi siu-sîng.
English: Don't be deceived. God is not mocked, for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsáu kàu tô-siám ê siâⁿ ê lâng, lín m̄-thang kā i the̍h sio̍k-huê ê kè, hō͘ i tī tsè-si buē sí ê tsìn-tsîng, koh lâi tuà pún-tē.
English: You shall take no ransom for him who is fled to his city of refuge, that he may come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.

Tailo: Tsú ah, kiû Lí kā in thun-bia̍t, phah-luān in ê giân-gí! In-uī guá tī siâⁿ lāi bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h kiông-pō kah hun-tsing ê tāi-tsì.
English: Confuse them, Lord, and confound their language, For I have seen violence and strife in the city.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè beh kin-kì lí ê uē lâi tīng lí ū tsuē á-.sī bô tsuē.
English: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, gī lâng ē huaⁿ-hí, in tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng ē khuài-lo̍k, in mā ē sî-siông huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí.
English: But let the righteous be glad. Let them rejoice before God. Yes, let them rejoice with gladness.

Tailo: Iésu koh kā in kóng, Tio̍h tsù-ì lín só͘ thiaⁿ ê. Lín īng siáⁿ-mi̍h niû-khì lâi niû hō͘ lâng, Siōngtè mā beh īng kāng-khuán ê niû-khì niû hō͘ lín, sīm-tsì ē koh khah ke-thinn hō͘ lín.
English: He said to them, Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

Tailo: Guá ē īng niû Sa-má-lī-a ê tsîn-suàⁿ kah Ahap ê ke ê tuī-tsîn, khan tī Êlúsalèm ê tíng-bīn, beh tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh tshit puâⁿ án-ne lâi tshit Êlúsalèm, tshit-liáu tsiū píng-phak.
English: I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab; and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down.

Tailo: Elísiah mn̄g i kóng, Guá ē-tàng kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí kā guá kóng; lí tshù lāi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h? kuáⁿ-hū kóng, Lí ê lú-pī tshù lāi tshun tsi̍t pân iû, í-guā lóng bô puàⁿ-hāng.
English: Elisha said to her, What shall I do for you? tell me; what have you in the house? She said, Your handmaid has nothing in the house, except a pot of oil.

Tailo: Lín í-tsîng tī tsiah-ê io̍k-bōng tiong teh sing-ua̍h ê sî, kiâⁿ-ta̍h mā siū tsiah-ê io̍k-bōng tsi-phuè.
English: You also once walked in those, when you lived in them;

Tailo: Ū thinn-tíng ê thé, mā ū tē-tsiūⁿ ê thé; tsóng-.sī, thian-thé ê kng kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê thé ê kng bô kāng-khuán.
English: There are also celestial bodies, and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial.

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu iáu-koh sī thiàⁿ-sioh in, bô kā in huí-bia̍t, bô tī khòng-iá kā in bia̍t liáu-liáu.
English: Nevertheless my eye spared them, and I didn't destroy them, neither did I make a full end of them in the wilderness.

Tailo: I ê kài lo̍h-khì kàu Ka-ná hô, tī hô ê lâm pîng, tī Mánáse hiah-ê siâⁿ ê tiong-kan, tsiah-ê siâⁿ sī sio̍k Ehulaim. Mánáse ê tē-kài sī tī hô ê pak pîng, thàng-kàu hái uî-tsí.
English: The border went down to the brook of Kanah, southward of the brook: these cities belonged to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh: and the border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook, and the goings out of it were at the sea:

Tailo: In-uī in bô-iân bô-kò͘ àm-tiong siat lô-bāng tī hām-kheⁿ lāi, ku̍t hām-kheⁿ beh hāi guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: For without cause they have hidden their net in a pit for me. Without cause they have dug a pit for my soul.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê ké-hó ê king-ha̍k kàu-su kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, lín tshám à! In-uī lín uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ tsi̍t-ê lâng ji̍p-kàu, thiⁿ-piⁿ hái-kak kiâⁿ thàu-thàu. M̄-koh, hit-ê lâng ji̍p-kàu liáu-āu, lín suah hō͘ i piàn-tsò pí lín ka-puē pháinn ê lâng.
