English: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel around by sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much of a son of Gehenna as yourselves.

Tailo: Ta-lió-suh jī nî peh-.gue̍h, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Ittó͘ ê sun — Belékiah ê kiáⁿ — sian-ti Tsa-kha-lī-a, kóng:
English: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

Tailo: In suî-piān kóng-tshut kiau-ngō͘ ê uē; só͘-ū tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng lóng ka-kī phòng-hong.
English: They pour out arrogant words. All the evil-doers boast.

Tailo: Guá tuì in ê bīn-tsîng tû-bia̍t Amô͘lī lâng, hiah-ê lâng kuân-tuā tshin-tshiūnn pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, ióng-bíng tshin-tshiūnn siōng tshiū. Tsóng-.sī, Guá kā i tíng-bīn ê kué-tsí bia̍t-tiāu, kā ē-bīn ê kin tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose height was like the height of the cedars, And he was strong as the oaks; Yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

Tailo: Siū lia̍h tńg-.lâi ê lâng án-ne kiânn. Tsè-si Etsula̍h kah tso̍k-tiúⁿ kuí-nā-ê lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, lóng tsiàu in ê miâ siū-phài; tī tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe-it, in tsò-hué tsē, lâi tiâu-tsa tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: The children of the captivity did so. Ezra the priest, with certain heads of fathers' houses, after their fathers' houses, and all of them by their names, were set apart; and they sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.

Tailo: Thang hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h kám-siā ê si-kua, koh thang kóng-khí Lí it-tshè kî-biāu ê tsok-uî.
English: That I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard, And tell of all your wondrous works.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng huann-hí ê sim lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú, tshiùⁿ kua lâi-kàu I ê bīn-tsîng!
English: Serve Yahweh with gladness. Come before his presence with singing.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h thiàⁿ tshut-guā lâng, in-uī lín mā bat tshut-guā tī Aigi̍p tē.
English: Therefore love the foreigner; for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

Tailo: In tsiū kóng, Guán m̄-lim tsiú, in-uī guán ê sian-tsó͘ — Le-kap ê kiáⁿ Io-Nátap bat huan-hù guán kóng, ' Lín kah lín ê kiáⁿ-sun íng-uán m̄-thang lim tsiú,
English: But they said, We will drink no wine; for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, You shall drink no wine, neither you, nor your sons, forever:

Tailo: Tsí-ū Iésu m̄-bián kā tsè-si ê tsit kau hō͘ pa̍t lâng, in-uī I íng-uán ua̍h-.leh.
English: But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable.

Tailo: In pun guá ê saⁿ, liam-khau lâi pun guá ê saⁿ-khò͘.
English: They divide my garments among them. They cast lots for my clothing.

Tailo: Lín í-king tuì tsuē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò gī ê lô͘-lē.
English: Being made free from sin, you became bondservants of righteousness.

Tailo: Guá thang tsìng-bîng, i khak-si̍t uī-tio̍h lín kah tī Lâu-tí-kiah í-ki̍p Hi-la-pó-lih ê lâng lô-khó͘ tsò-kang.
English: For I testify about him, that he has great zeal for you, and for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis.

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang kā un-jiû ê hún-tsiáu kau hō͘ iá-siù; m̄-thang íng-uán bē kì-tit sàn-tshiah lâng ê ua̍h-miā.
English: Don't deliver the soul of your dove to wild beasts. Don't forget the life of your poor forever.

Tailo: Kóng-kàu lâng, i ê ji̍t-tsí tshin-tshiūnn tsháu. I ê hing-ōng tshin-tshiūnn suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê hue,
English: As for man, his days are like grass. As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.

Tailo: I īng sûn-kim tsò ting-tâi, ting-tâi ê tsō kah tiong thiāu, i ê pue, i ê ki, i ê hue, lóng īng phah ê hong-huat, tsò kui tsō.
English: He made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of beaten work. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were of one piece with it.

Tailo: Lâng in-uī siū tsin tsē pō-gio̍k tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, in-uī siū-tio̍h kiông-li̍k ê ap-tsè tsiū huah kiù lâng.
English: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū īng hó uē kah an-uì ê uē, ìn hit-ê kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá.
English: Yahweh answered the angel who talked with me with kind and comforting words.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá kā tsit pái hō͘ in tsai; Guá beh hō͘ in tsai Guá ê tshiú-tuāⁿ kah Guá ê lîng-li̍k. In tsiū ē tsai Guá ê miâ sī I-é-ho-bah.
English: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is Yahweh.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iobuh tuì i kóng, Lí kóng-uē ná tshin-tshiūnn hiah-ê gōng tsa-bó͘ lâng só͘ teh kóng ê. Sī án-tsuánn lè? Lán tuì Siōngtsú niá-siū hok-khì, kám bē tuì I niá-siū tsai-hō? Tī tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, Iobuh pīng bô tuì i ê tshuì lâi huān tsuē.
English: But he said to her, You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. What? Shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil? In all this Job didn't sin with his lips.

Tailo: Tsit ki to í-king kau hō͘ lâng khì lè kng, thang hō͘ lâng ê tshiú gia̍h; i í-king buâ lāi, lè kng, thang kau tī thâi lâng-.ê ê tshiú.
English: It is given to be furbished, that it may be handled: the sword, it is sharpened, yes, it is furbished, to give it into the hand of the killer.

Tailo: Samuel ìn kóng, Uī-tio̍h pîng-an, guá sī beh tsè-hiàn Siōngtsú. Lín tio̍h tshing-khì ka-kī, lâi kah guá hù tsè-sū. Samuel tsiū hō͘ I-é-sái kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ tshing-khì, kiò in lâi hù tsè-sū.
English: He said, Peaceably; I am come to sacrifice to Yahweh: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. He sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

Tailo: Tio̍h hō͘ lâng, lín tsiah ē tit-tio̍h, koh ē īng tsiok-gia̍h ê táu niû hō͘ lín; kā i ji̍h koh iô, hō͘ i tsa̍t kah muá tshut-.lâi, tsiah piàⁿ lo̍h-khì lín ê saⁿ-á phè; in-uī lín īng siáⁿ-mi̍h niû-khì lâi niû hō͘ lâng, lâng mā ē tsiàu án-ne niû tò tńg-khì hō͘ lín.
English: Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá tsai lâng ê lō͘, m̄-sī tuì ka-kī, kiâⁿ lō͘ ê lâng mā bē-tàng tsú-ì ka-kī ê kha-pō͘.
English: Yahweh, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man who walks to direct his steps.

Tailo: ū saⁿ-bān gō͘-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Benjamin, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Guán lāu-pē ê sèⁿ-miā kah tsit-ê gín-á ê sèⁿ-miā sio-liân, taⁿ guá tńg-khì lí ê lô͘-po̍k guá ê lāu-pē hia, nā gín-á bô kah guán tông-tsāi,
English: Now therefore when I come to your servant my father, and the boy is not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the boy's life;

Tailo: Tuā hō͘ ê ji̍t, tsuí tih bē suah, tsháu-nāu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: A continual dropping on a rainy day And a contentious wife are alike:

Tailo: Koh īng kuè-pháng ê iù-tē kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu, īng siù-hue ê tshiú-kang tsò io-tuà, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: and the sash of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Koh kā i tiò pó͘-kuà, kā o͘-lîng kah thô͘-bîng hē tī pó͘-kuà lāi.
English: He placed the breastplate on him; and in the breastplate he put the Urim and the Thummim.

Tailo: Tē-sì tsuā sī li̍k-gi̍k, âng bé-ló kah phik-gi̍k, tsiah-ê lóng siuⁿ tī kim-tsô lāi.
English: and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g-ê bûn-tô͘ tsiū tshut-.khì, lâi-kàu siâⁿ lāi, kó-jiân tú-tio̍h tsiàu Iésu só͘ kóng ê it-tshè. In tsiū tuà hia tsún-pī Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê buán-tshan.
English: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

Tailo: In ū kā lín kóng, Bua̍t-ji̍t ê sî, ū tsi̍t-kuá tsiàu in ka-kī bô kìng-khiân ê su-io̍k tsò tāi-tsì ê lâng ē tshut-hiān, in ài thí-tshiò pa̍t lâng ê sìn-gióng.
English: They said to you that In the last time there will be mockers, walking after their own ungodly lusts.

Tailo: Lāu lâng gia̍h thâu khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng-kheh tī siâⁿ lāi ê ke-lō͘, tsiū mn̄g i kóng, Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? Beh khì tó-uī?
English: He lifted up his eyes, and saw the wayfaring man in the street of the city; and the old man said, Where go you? and whence come you?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang tsiàu pháiⁿ lâng só͘ ì-ài ê; m̄-thang hō͘ in ê kè-bô͘ sîng-kong, tì-sú in ē kiau-ngō͘. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Yahweh, don't grant the desires of the wicked. Don't let their evil plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah.

Tailo: Isulael sí ê ji̍t teh beh kàu, i tsiū kiò i ê kiáⁿ Iôséhuh lâi, kā i kóng, Guá nā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, tshiáⁿ lí hē tshiú tī guá ê tuā-thuí hā tuì guá tsiù-tsuā, īng tsû-ài kah sîng-si̍t khuán-thāi guá, m̄-thang kā guá bâi-tsòng tī Aigi̍p.
English: The time drew near that Israel must die, and he called his son Joseph, and said to him, If now I have found favor in your sight, please put your hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me. Please don't bury me in Egypt,

Tailo: Atonîiah uī-tio̍h Só͘lômóng tsiū kiaⁿ, khí-lâi khì lia̍h-tiâu tsè-tuâⁿ ê kak.
English: Adonijah feared because of Solomon; and he arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá beh ùn piáⁿ the̍h hō͘ i, hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī. I tsiū ùn tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, the̍h hō͘ Ka-lio̍k lâng Símòng ê kiáⁿ Iôtah.
English: Jesus therefore answered, It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it. So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

Tailo: Lán só͘ thiàⁿ ê hiann-tī, mā sī tiong-si̍t ê tshe-īng — Tu-khi-kó͘, ē kā lín pò-kò guá ê tāi-tsì kah guá ê kīn-hóng.
English: But that you also may know my affairs, how I am doing, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord, will make known to you all things;

Tailo: In tsiū án-ne liam-khau, tsiū liam-tio̍h Iôná. In tuì i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, lán tú-tio̍h tsit-ê tsai-hō, sī in-uī siáⁿ lâng ê iân-kò͘; lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h sū-gia̍p? Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? Lí ê pún só͘-tsāi tī tó-uī? Lí sio̍k siáⁿ-mi̍h tso̍k?
English: Then they asked him, Tell us, please, for whose cause this evil is on us. What is your occupation? Where do you come from? What is your country? Of what people are you?

Tailo: Siōngtè hō͘ bô tsuē ê Ki-tok lâi taⁿ lán ê tsuē, sī beh hō͘ lán kah I kiat-liân, lâi kah Siōngtè kiàn-li̍p ha̍p-gî ê kuan-hē.
English: For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá kā lín kóng, guá beh tuì guá ê phû-tô hn̂g án-tsuáⁿ tsò, guá beh thiah-khì lî-pa, hō͘ i siū thun-bia̍t; thiah-huí uî-tshiûⁿ, hō͘ i siū thún-ta̍h.
English: Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard. I will take away its hedge, and it will be eaten up. I will break down its wall of it, and it will be trampled down.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lí só͘ kóng ê uē ē tsin kín tsiânn, kàu tsiânn ê sî, in tsiū ē tsai bat ū sian-ti tī in tiong-kan.
English: When this comes to pass, (behold, it comes), then shall they know that a prophet has been among them.

Tailo: I ê kut tshiong-muá siàu-liân ê khuì-la̍t, tsóng-.sī, ē kah i tsò-hué tó tī thô͘-.ni̍h.
English: His bones are full of his youth, But youth shall lie down with him in the dust.

Tailo: Êlīatsal ê kiáⁿ-sun, Ithamal ê kiáⁿ-sun, lóng tsiàu thiu-tshiam hun-phài, bô hun tsit-ê hit-ê; ū ê tī sìng-só͘ tsò siú-líng, ū ê tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng tsò siú-líng.
English: Thus were they divided impartially by drawing lots; for there were princes of the sanctuary, and princes of God, both of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.

Tailo: Sàulô kā Ionáthan kóng, Lí kā guá kóng lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h sū. Ionáthan kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi īng tshiú-.ni̍h ê kuái-á bué ùn tsi̍t-tiám-á bi̍t lâi tshì-khuàⁿ māi leh, án-ne guá kám tio̍h sí ā?
English: Then Saul said to Jonathan, Tell me what you have done. Jonathan told him, and said, I did certainly taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand; and behold, I must die.

Tailo: Lán tsiàu Siōngtè ê kài-bīng sing-ua̍h, tse to̍h-sī sio-thiànn. Tsit-ê kài-bīng sī lín tuì khí-thâu to̍h thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê.
English: This is love, that we should walk according to his commandments. This is the commandment, even as you heard from the beginning, that you should walk in it.

Tailo: Guá tshuā lín ê tsó͘-sian tshut Aigi̍p, lín tsiū kàu hái-huāⁿ, Aigi̍p lâng tuà in ê tshia kah bé-ping lâi jiok lín ê tsó͘-sian ti̍t-kàu Âng-hái.
English: I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and you came to the sea; and the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and with horsemen to the Red Sea.

Tailo: Īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò kǹg, īng tâng pau khí-.lâi.
English: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with brass.

Tailo: Huán-tńg kah guā-pang lâng hūn-tsa̍p thong-hun, o̍h in ê só͘ tsò,
English: But mixed themselves with the nations, And learned their works.

Tailo: Su-tê-hua-no͘h tshiong-muá un-tián kah tsâi-lîng, tī bîn-tsiòng ê tiong-kan kiânn tuā ê kî-sū kah sîn-jiah.
English: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū lâng īng pho͘-á kng piàn-suī-.ê lâi, ài beh kng ji̍p-khì hē tī Iésu ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.

Tailo: Mô͘ap ê siú-líng tsiū khí-.lâi, tńg-khì Baal hia, kóng, Palân m̄-khíng kah guán lâi.
English: The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak, and said, Balaam refuses to come with us.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ khì-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Gia̍t-se-má-neh ê só͘-tsāi. I tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín tuà tsia tsē, thìng-hāu guá khì hia kî-tó.
English: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, Sit here, while I go there and pray.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Iôtah ông tshe lín lâi Guá tsia mn̄g Guá, lín tio̍h án-ne kā i kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê tshut-lâi beh pang-tsān lín ê Huâ-láu ê kun-ping ē tò tńg-khì Aigi̍p pún-kok.
English: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Thus shall you tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: Behold, Pharaoh's army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.

Tailo: Guá siá phue kià hō͘ lí — Tî-to, tī lán kiōng-tông ê sìn-gióng tiong, lí sī guá tsin ê kiáⁿ. Guān Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah lán ê Kiù-tsú Ki-tok Iésu, sù lí un-tián kah pîng-an.
English: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, āu-lâi, Guá ē hō͘ Ammóng tso̍k siū lia̍h ê lâng tò tńg-.lâi. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: But afterward I will bring back the captivity of the children of Ammon, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí bat tī Etiân — Siōngtè ê hn̂g lāi, īng ta̍k tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h tsò lí ê táⁿ-pān, to̍h-sī âng-pó-tsio̍h, n̂g-gi̍k kah kim-kong-tsio̍h, tsheⁿ-gi̍k, âng bé-ló, í-ki̍p phik-gi̍k, lâm-gi̍k, li̍k-pó-tsio̍h, tshiah-gi̍k kah n̂g-kim; kó͘ kah siau koh sī tī lí hia tsè-tsō, tng lí siū tsō ê ji̍t, lí to̍h lóng tsê-pī.
English: You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone adorned you: ruby, topaz, emerald, chrysolite, onyx, jasper, sapphire , turquoise, and beryl. Gold work of tambourines and of pipes was in you. In the day that you were created they were prepared.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiūⁿ suaⁿ ji̍p-khì hûn tiong, Mô͘se tī suaⁿ tíng sì-tsa̍p kang sì-tsa̍p mê.
English: Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up on the mountain; and Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.

Tailo: Lín nā sio-thiànn, tsìng lâng ē tsiū án-ne lâi tsai lín sī guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.

Tailo: Tī hia bô koh ū àm-sî, mā bô su-iàu ting ê kng kah ji̍t-thâu ê kng, in-uī Tsú — Siōngtè ē kā in tsiò-kng, in ē íng-uán tsiáng-kuân tsò ông.
English: There will be no night, and they need no lamp light; for the Lord God will illuminate them. They will reign forever and ever.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h hiàn iù mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat kah tiâu-hô kheh hó ê iû sì-hūn tsi-it hin tsò sò͘-tsè.
English: and the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil.

Tailo: Asiul kah i ê jîn-bîn lóng tī hia, in ê bōng tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî; in lóng sī siū thâi tó tī to hā ê.
English: Asshur is there and all her company; her graves are round about her; all of them slain, fallen by the sword;

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ tshù-piⁿ, to̍h-sī hāi-tio̍h guá hō͘ guá ê Isulael jîn-bîn sîng-tsiap ê sán-gia̍p ê. Siōngtsú ū án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā in kuáⁿ-tshut in ê tē, koh beh kā Iôtah ke tuì in tiong-kan kuáⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Thus says Yahweh against all my evil neighbors, who touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê kuì-tso̍k siū-khì I-é-lí-miah, tsiū kā i phah, kā i kuainn tī su-kì Ionáthan ê tshù ê kaⁿ-.ni̍h, in-uī in īng hit king tsò kaⁿ-lô.
English: The princes were angry with Jeremiah, and struck him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.

Tailo: I ē tsiàu kong-gī lâi sím-phuàⁿ sè-kài, tsiàu kong-pêⁿ phuàⁿ-kuat tsìng lâng.
English: He will judge the world in righteousness. He will administer judgment to the peoples in uprightness.

Tailo: jî-tshiánn koh kā Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, iù-mī, í-ki̍p iû kah bi̍t, sī Guá só͘ īng lâi iúⁿ-tshī lí ê, lí tsiū kā i pâi tī in ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tsò phang-bī, lí si̍t-tsāi ū án-ne tsò. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: My bread also which I gave you, fine flour, and oil, and honey, with which I fed you, you did even set it before them for a sweet savor; and thus it was, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kóng, Lán bô beh uat ji̍p-khì guā-pang lâng ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī bô sio̍k Isulael lâng ê, khah hó lán tio̍h kuè lâi-khì Gi-be-at.
English: His master said to him, We won't turn aside into the city of a foreigner, that is not of the children of Israel; but we will pass over to Gibeah.

Tailo: Tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê, lóng tio̍h sǹg.
English: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old shall you number them, everyone who enters on the service, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Hit-ê thiⁿ-sài tsiū kā liâm-li̍k-á hiat lo̍h-khì tē-tsiūⁿ, kā tē-tsiūⁿ ê phû-tô kuah khí-.lâi, koh kā phû-tô hiat lo̍h-khì Siōngtè tuā siū-khì ê tsiú-khut.
English: The angel thrust his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vintage of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

Tailo: Lí siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k ê, nā ū tī thinn-pinn ê, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè mā ē tuì hia kā lí tsū-tsi̍p, tuì hia kā lí tshōa tńg-.lâi.
English: If any of your outcasts are in the uttermost parts of the heavens, from there will Yahweh your God gather you, and from there he will bring you back:

Tailo: Guá tang-sî kóng-tio̍h tsi̍t tso̍k á-.sī tsi̍t kok, kóng beh kiàn-li̍p, beh tsai-tsìng;
English: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;

Tailo: Hit-ê ka-tîng nā guān-ì tsiap-thāi lín, lín só͘ tsiok-hok ê pîng-an tsiū ē hō͘ in. Nā bô guān-ì, tio̍h siu huê líng só͘ tsiok-hok ê pîng-an.
English: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn't worthy, let your peace return to you.

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Tio̍h kín-sīn! M̄-thang khì hō͘ lâng bê-hi̍k, in-uī ē ū tsin tsē lâng lī-iōng guá ê miâ lâi kóng, ' Guá to̍h-sī Ki-tok', koh kóng, ' Sî-ki teh beh kàu à'. Lín m̄-thang tuè in khì.
English: He said, Watch out that you don't get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, I AM,' and, The time is at hand.' Therefore don't follow them.

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Mô͘ap lâng kah Ammóng lâng, koh ū Mi-u-nî lâng tsò-hué lâi, beh kah Iô-sa-huat kau-tsiàn.
English: It happened after this, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them some of the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā i kóng, Lí kā Guá tshú tsi̍t tsiah saⁿ huè tuā bó ê gû, tsi̍t tsiah saⁿ huè tuā bó ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ, tsi̍t tsiah saⁿ huè tuā kang ê mî-iûⁿ, tsi̍t tsiah pan-kah, tsi̍t tsiah hún-tsiáu.
English: He said to him, Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ hō͘-siong gī-lūn kóng, Kám sī lán bô tuà piáⁿ, I tsiah án-ne kóng?
English: They reasoned with one another, saying, It's because we have no bread.

Tailo: Kè-sio̍k huān tsuē ê lâng sī sio̍k Mô͘-kuí, in-uī Mô͘-kuí tuì khí-thâu to̍h huān tsuē; Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ hián-hiān ê bo̍k-tik sī beh huí-huāi Mô͘-kuí-ê kang-tsok.
English: He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. To this end the Son of God was revealed, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Tailo: Lín ē kong-phuà ta̍k-ê kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ kah ta̍k-ê suí ê siâⁿ, tshò ta̍k tsâng hó ê tshiū, that tiâu só͘-ū ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, īng tsio̍h-thâu phah-pháiⁿ só͘-ū hó ê tshân.
English: You shall strike every fortified city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all springs of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.

Tailo: Lí huat-tshut tuā ui-giâm, tshia-tó hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik Lí ê; Lí huat-tshut tuā siū-khì, kā in sio-huí tshin-tshiūnn teh sio tsháu.
English: In the greatness of your excellency, you overthrow those who rise up against you: You send forth your wrath. It consumes them as stubble.

Tailo: In tsin kín to̍h lī-khui Guá só͘ kā in huan-hù ê lō͘, in uī ka-kī tsù-tsiâⁿ tsi̍t tsiah gû-á, kuī lo̍h-khì kā i pài, kā i hiàn tsè, kóng, ' Isulael lâng, tse to̍h-sī tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p tē ê sîn-bîng. '
English: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made themselves a molten calf, and have worshiped it, and have sacrificed to it, and said, These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.'

Tailo: （ Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu sī īng lú-im. ）Siōngtè sī guán tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi kah khuì-la̍t, mā sī huān-lān tiong ki̍p-sî ê pang-tsān.
English: God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble.

Tailo: Tû-liáu Iésu í-guā, lóng bô tsín-kiù, in-uī tī thiⁿ-ē jîn-kan, Siōngtè bô siúⁿ-sù pa̍t-ê miâ tī lâng ê tiong-kan, hō͘ lán thang khò hit-ê miâ lâi tit-kiù.
English: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!

Tailo: Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu sī sing-khu ê ting, lí ê ba̍k-tsiu nā kim, tsuân sing-khu tsiū kng-bîng; lí ê ba̍k-tsiu nā hue, kui sing-khu tsiū o͘-àm.
English: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tô-tsáu ê khuì-la̍t í-king tsīn-pōng, khiā tī Hesibóng ìm-ńg ē; tsóng-.sī, hué tuì Hesibóng tshut-.lâi, hué-iām tuì Sihông huat-tshut, sio-khì Mô͘ap ê tsuân-pō͘ pian-kài kah tsok-luān ê lâng thâu-khak tíng bīn.
English: Those who fled stand without strength under the shadow of Heshbon; for a fire is gone forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and has devoured the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.

Tailo: Guá — Taniel, guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê ī-siōng, ài beh bîng-pi̍k hit-ê ì-sù. Hit sî, hut-jiân ū tsi̍t uī tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê khuán-sit ê khiā tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: It happened, when I, even I Daniel, had seen the vision, that I sought to understand it; and behold, there stood before me as the appearance of a man.

Tailo: Guá ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, siōng iàu-kín ê sī, M̄-thang kí thiⁿ á-.sī tē á-.sī siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h-kiāⁿ lâi tsiù-tsuā. Sī To̍h kóng Sī , M̄-sī To̍h kóng M̄-sī , án-ne tsiah bián siū Siōngtè sím-phuàⁿ.
English: But above all things, my brothers, don't swear, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your yes be yes, and your no, no; so that you don't fall into hypocrisy.

Tailo: Guá hō͘ in siū lia̍h khì tī lia̍t pang, koh kā in tsū-tsi̍p tò tńg-lâi pún só͘-tsāi, bô lâu kah tsi̍t-ê lâng tī hia; in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī in ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú.
English: They shall know that I am Yahweh their God, in that I caused them to go into captivity among the nations, and have gathered them to their own land; and I will leave none of them any more there;

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g! Siōngtè — guá ê khuì-la̍t ah, kiû Lí kín lâi pang-tsān guá!
English: But don't be far off, Yahweh. You are my help: hurry to help me.

Tailo: Kàu thiⁿ-kng, Huâ-láu sim bô pîng-an, tsiū tshe lâng tiàu Aigi̍p só͘-ū ê su̍t-sū kah tsheⁿ-siōng-ka lâi; Huâ-láu tsiū kā i só͘ bāng-kìnn ê kā in kóng, in bô lâng ē-hiáu kā Huâ-láu kái-bāng.
English: It happened in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all of Egypt's magicians and wise men. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was no one who could interpret them to Pharaoh.

Tailo: Símòng Piattò͘ ìn kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ū íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê uē, guán tio̍h koh khì tuè siáⁿ lâng?
English: Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.

Tailo: Kiû Lí khuànn guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ hîng-uî á-bô, kiû Lí tshuā guá kiânn íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê lō͘.
English: See if there is any wicked way in me, And lead me in the everlasting way.

Tailo: [siàu-lí] Lí thiaⁿ, sī guá lông-kun ê siann; lí khuàⁿ, i lâi ā; i tiô tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, thiàu tī niá-.ni̍h.
English: The voice of my beloved! Behold, he comes, Leaping on the mountains, Skipping on the hills.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-it nî tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-tshit, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: It happened in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Ē ū huah siaⁿ thuân kàu tē-ki̍k, in-uī Siōngtsú ē kah lia̍t kok kè-kàu; kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê, I ē kah in tsing-piān; nā-sī pháiⁿ lâng, I ē kā in kau hō͘ to-kiàm. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: A noise shall come even to the end of the earth; for Yahweh has a controversy with the nations; he will enter into judgment with all flesh: as for the wicked, he will give them to the sword, says Yahweh.

Tailo: I mā ū tshit-ê kiáⁿ kah saⁿ-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: He had also seven sons and three daughters.

Tailo: Kì-jiân ū hiah tsē lâng teh tián sio̍k-sè ê tāi-tsì, guá mā beh khua-kháu tsi̍t ē.
English: Seeing that many boast after the flesh, I will also boast.

Tailo: （Taⁿ Hannah sim-lāi tiām-tiām kiû, tsí ū tshuì-tûn tín-tāng, bô thiaⁿ-tio̍h siaⁿ, só͘-í, Elī lia̍h-tsò i sī teh tsiú-tsuì. ）
English: Now Hannah, she spoke in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard: therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.

Tailo: Lí bô ing-kai khiā tī siang-tshe lō͘, tsa̍h in tiong-kan tô-tsáu ê lâng; in tú-tio̍h tsai-lān ê ji̍t, lí bô ing-kai kā in tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng kau-hù tuì-ti̍k.
English: Don't stand in the crossroads to cut off those of his who escape. Don't deliver up those of his who remain in the day of distress.

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k ê kiáⁿ-sun ē sîng-tsiap hit-ê tē, thiàⁿ I ê lâng ē tuà tī hit tiong-kan.
English: The children also of his servants shall inherit it. Those who love his name shall dwell therein.

Tailo: Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun kî-tha ê tsong-tso̍k, só͘ tit-tio̍h ê siâⁿ, kiōng tsa̍p tsō kah in ê kau-iá.
English: All the cities of the families of the rest of the children of Kohath were ten with their suburbs.

Tailo: Lâng tuì Siōngtè kám ū lī-ik? Tì-huī ê lâng si̍t-tsāi sī lī-ik ka-kī.
English: Can a man be profitable to God? Surely he who is wise is profitable to himself.

Tailo: La̍h-khel seⁿ Iôséhuh liáu-āu, Iâkop tuì La̍hban kóng, Tshiánn tshe guá lī-khui, hō͘ guá tńg-khì guá ê pún só͘-tsāi, guá ê kò͘-hiong.
English: It happened, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, Send me away, that I may go to my own place, and to my country.

Tailo: koh tuà ông kah i ê bô͘-sū só͘ huann-hí hiàn ê kim-gîn, beh hō͘ Isulael ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê,
English: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,

Tailo: Mā tio̍h kà-sī in tsun-siú guá hō͘ lín it-tshè ê bīng-līng, mā tio̍h ē kì-tit guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah lín tông-tsāi, it-ti̍t kàu sè-kài ê bua̍t-ji̍t.
English: teaching them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age. Amen.

Tailo: Tsiū kā i ê sim-té só͘ khǹg ê lóng pò i tsai, kā i kóng, Íng-kuè m̄-bat ū thì thâu to lîm-kàu guá ê thâu-khak, in-uī guá tuì bó-sin tsiū kui Siōngtsú tsò hiàn-sin-tsiá; nā kā guá thì khí-.lâi, guá ê khuì-la̍t tsiū ē lī-khui guá, guá tsiū ē luán-jio̍k tshin-tshiūnn pa̍t lâng.
English: He told her all his heart, and said to her, No razor has ever come on my head; for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother's womb. If I am shaved, then my strength will go from me, and I will become weak, and be like any other man.

Tailo: Tik-sìng ê lâng mā ē án-ne tshīng pe̍h saⁿ, guá tsua̍t-tuì bē kā i ê miâ tuì ua̍h-miā-tsheh tshat-siau; guá ē tī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē kah I hiah-ê thiⁿ-sài ê bīn-tsîng, kong-khai sîng-jīn i ê miâ.
English: He who overcomes will be arrayed in white garments, and I will in no way blot his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê hiann-tī tsí-muē lóng kā lín tshíng-an. Lín tio̍h īng sìng-kiat ê lé-gî lâi hō͘-siong tshíng-an.
English: All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

Tailo: Isulael kóng, Lín án-tsuáⁿ beh án-ne hāi guá, ná ē kā hit-ê lâng kóng lín iáu ū sió-tī?
English: Israel said, Why did you treat me so badly, telling the man that you had another brother?

Tailo: Lí ē īng thih-kuái kā in phah-phuà, tshin-tshiūnn teh kòng tshuì huî-khì.
English: You shall break them with a rod of iron. You shall dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

Tailo: Guá nā tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, Lí tī hia; guá nā khùn tī im-hú, Lí mā tī hia.
English: If I ascend up into heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there!

Tailo: Tī La̍h-má thiaⁿ-tio̍h siaⁿ, thî-khàu koh tuā pi-siong, La̍h-khel uī i ê kiáⁿ-jî teh khàu; m̄-khíng siū an-uì, in-uī in lóng sí-.khì à. (tsù, ILM 31:15)
English: A voice was heard in Ramah, Lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; She wouldn't be comforted, Because they are no more.

Tailo: Iôséhuh hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h lāu-pē khah thiàⁿ Iôséhuh, tsiū uàn-hūn Iôséhuh, m̄ kah i kóng hô-bo̍k ê uē.
English: His brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, and they hated him, and couldn't speak peaceably to him.

Tailo: Ahiméli̍k ìn ông kóng, Lí ê jîn-sîn tiong-kan, siáⁿ lâng ē pí-tit Tabi̍t ê tsīn-tiong? I sī ông ê kiáⁿ-sài, koh tsò lí ê tsham-bô͘, mā tī lí ê tshù lāi sī tsun-kuì ê.
English: Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, Who among all your servants is so faithful as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and is taken into your council, and is honorable in your house?

Tailo: Hit-ê lê hn̂g beh iā tsíng ê lâng, kám sī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh lê? Kám sī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh ku̍t lâi phāinn i ê thô͘?
English: Does he who plows to sow plow continually? Does he keep turning the soil and breaking the clods?

Tailo: Tabi̍t mā tshuā E-tsu-le-el lâng Ahinoám, in nn̄g lâng lóng tsò i ê bó͘.
English: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel; and they became both of them his wives.

Tailo: Mô͘se tshuā jîn-bîn tshut iâⁿ-pâng khì gîng-tsiap Siōngtè, in lóng khiā tī suaⁿ-kha.
English: Moses led the people out of the camp to meet God; and they stood at the lower part of the mountain.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī tuâⁿ piⁿ ê pak pîng, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā i thâi. Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê, tio̍h īng i ê hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He shall kill it on the north side of the altar before Yahweh. Aaron's sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar.

Tailo: I ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ miâ kiò-tsò Se-e-lah, to̍h-sī khí tíng Bia̍t-ho-lông kah hē Bia̍t-ho-lông, í-ki̍p U-tsian-se-lah ê.
English: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Beth Horon the lower and the upper, and Uzzen Sheerah.

Tailo: Guá sī Páulô, uī-tio̍h Ki-tok Iésu lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò siû-huān. Guá kah lán ê hiann-tī Tî-mó͘-theh siá phue hō͘ guán só͘ thiàⁿ ê tâng-kang Hui-lé-móng,
English: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,

Tailo: Lín bat tsìng-tsoh kan-ok, siu-sîng tsuē-kò, tsia̍h pe̍h-tsha̍t ê kué-tsí. In-uī lí uá-khò ka-kī ê só͘ kiâⁿ, mā uá-khò lí tsin tsē ê ióng-sū.
English: You have plowed wickedness. You have reaped iniquity. You have eaten the fruit of lies, For you trusted in your way, in the multitude of your mighty men.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông tsiū phak-lo̍h tī Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lia̍t-pang án-tsuáⁿ teh tsō siaⁿ-sè? Jîn-bîn án-tsuáⁿ teh kè-bô͘ khang-khang ê tāi-tsì?
English: Why do the nations rage, And the peoples plot a vain thing?

Tailo: Lín tsai, i āu-lâi ài beh niá-siū tsiok-hok ê sî hō͘ lāu-pē kī-tsua̍t, in-uī i tshuē bô pān-huat lâi kái-piàn lāu-pē ê sim-ì, só͘-í suî-jiân lâu ba̍k-sái, pik-tshiat kî-kiû, mā bē-tàng tit-tio̍h tsiok-hok.
English: For you know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, for he found no place for a change of mind though he sought it diligently with tears.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Tulô ê bi̍k-sī. Talsisih ê tsûn, lín tio̍h ai-khàu, in-uī Tulô í-king pha-hng ā, sīm-tsì bô tshù-the̍h, mā bô lâng teh tshut-ji̍p. Tuì Kitthê ê só͘-tsāi ū pò in tsai tsit-ê siau-sit.
English: The burden of Tyre. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in. From the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng, I kóng, ' Guá beh khì ê só͘-tsāi, lín bē-tàng khì. ', kám kóng I beh khì tsū-sat?
English: The Jews therefore said, Will he kill himself, that he says, Where I am going, you can't come?'

Tailo: īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì siàu-liân lâng kah tsāi-sik-lí; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì bo̍k-tsiá kah i ê iûⁿ-kûn; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì tsoh-tshân lâng kah i ê tsi̍t tuì gû; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì tsóng-tok kah kuaⁿ-uân.
English: and with you will I break in pieces the shepherd and his flock; and with you will I break in pieces the farmer and his yoke of oxen; and with you will I break in pieces governors and deputies.

Tailo: Guá beh tshuā lín khì-kàu guā-pang lâng ê khòng-iá, tī hia tng-bīn kā lín sím-mn̄g.
English: and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there will I enter into judgment with you face to face.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si tsiū kóng, Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kám sī án-ne?
English: The high priest said, Are these things so?

Tailo: In-uī Tsú hō͘ Alâm ê kun-tuī thiaⁿ-tio̍h tshia ê siann kah bé ê siann, to̍h-sī tuā kun-tuī ê siann. In tsiū tsò-hué kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī Isulael ông bé-siu Hiat lâng tsiah-ê ông kah Aigi̍p lâng tsiah-ê ông, lâi beh kong-kik lán.
English: For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots, and a noise of horses, even the noise of a great army: and they said one to another, Behold, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of the Egyptians, to come on us.

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū gō͘-bān káu-tshing saⁿ-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

Tailo: Hut-jiân khí tuā tē-tāng, liân kaⁿ ê tē-ki lóng iô-tāng, só͘-ū ê kaⁿ-mn̂g suî-sî lóng khui, huān-lâng ê kha-liâu tshiú-khàu tsuân-pō͘ lak-.khì.
English: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone's bonds were loosened.

Tailo: Gia̍h tshit ki iûⁿ-kak ê hō-tâng ê tshit-ê tsè-si, tī Siōngtsú ê kuī tsîng ti̍t-ti̍t kiânn, pûn hō-tâng; tuà kun-khì ê tī in ê thâu-tsîng kiânn, āu-tuī tuè Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī kiânn, tsè-si ná kiâⁿ ná pûn hō-tâng.
English: The seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of Yahweh went on continually, and blew the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; and the rearward came after the ark of Yahweh, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, to̍h-sī kàu thiⁿ-tē siau-sit kah lu̍t-huat ê bo̍k-tik lóng ta̍t-sîng ê sî, lu̍t-huat ê tsi̍t-tiám tsi̍t-ui̍h to bē siau-sit-.khì.
English: For most assuredly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.

Tailo: Aigi̍p ông tuì in kóng, Mô͘se kah Alông, lín ná ē beh hō͘ jîn-bîn tam-gō͘ in ê kang-tsok? Lín tio̍h kín khì tsò lín ing-kai tsò ê kang!
English: The king of Egypt said to them, Why do you, Moses and Aaron, take the people from their work? Get back to your burdens!

Tailo: I bat tit-tio̍h Sìng Sîn tsí-sī, tsai-iáⁿ i sí í-tsîng ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tsú só͘ ìng-ín ê Ki-tok.
English: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

Tailo: Tsò lāu-pē ê lâng m̄-thang kik kiáⁿ-jî siū-khì, tsiah bē hō͘ in hue-sim sit-tsì.
English: Fathers, don't provoke your children, so that they won't be discouraged.

Tailo: Koh īng tsiú puàⁿ hin tsò kuàn-tiān ê tsè, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: and you shall offer for the drink offering half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, in khì siám-phiah tsai-hāi; Aigi̍p lâng ē kā in tsū-tsi̍p, Mo͘-hu lâng ē kā in bâi-tsòng. In īng gîn só͘ tsò thang ì-ài ê mi̍h ē huat-tshut tsi̍t-lê; in ê tiùⁿ-pâng lāi ē huat-tshut tshì-phè.
English: For, behold, they have gone away from destruction. Egypt will gather them up. Memphis will bury them. Nettles will possess their pleasant things of silver. Thorns will be in their tents.

Tailo: Guá to̍h-sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, tshut-sì tī Ki-lí-kiah ê Tà-soh, tī Êlúsalèm siâⁿ tsò Gâmáliel ê bûn-tô͘ tióng-tuā kah kin-á-ji̍t tī tsia ê kok-uī kāng-khuán, ū siū lán tsó͘-sian giâm-keh lu̍t-huat ê kà-sī, jia̍t-sim ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè.
English: I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict manner of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

Tailo: Iésu huan-hù tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ liáu-āu, tsiū lī-khui hia, khì hù-kīn ê siâⁿ kà-sī lâng kah thuân hok-im.
English: It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Lô-má ê liân-tiúⁿ só͘ tiōng-iōng ê lô͘-po̍k phuà-pēⁿ kah teh beh sí.
English: A certain centurion's servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí tio̍h kā Alông kóng, ' Gia̍h lí ê kuái-á, tshun lí ê tshiú tī Aigi̍p tsiah-ê tsuí ê tíng-bīn, to̍h-sī tī in ê kang, hô, tî kah só͘-ū ê tsuí-khut tíng-bīn, hō͘ in lóng piàn-tsò hueh. Tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē, bô-lūn tshâ-ê khì-kū, á-.sī tsio̍h ê khì-kū lóng ē ū hueh. '
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Tell Aaron, Take your rod, and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams, and over their pools, and over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood; and there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.'

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā hiah-ê kah i tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-sîn kóng, Khí-.lâi, lán tio̍h tô-tsáu, nā bô, lóng bē-tàng siám-phiah Αpsalôm; lán tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lâi-.khì, khióng-kiaⁿ i ē tsin kín lâi jiok-tio̍h lán, kā lán hām-hāi, īng to thâi-sí siâⁿ lāi ê lâng.
English: David said to all his servants who were with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for else none of us shall escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtake us quickly, and bring down evil on us, and strike the city with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsai, Siōngtè tsit ê tsín-kiù ê sìn-sit í-king thuân hō͘ guā-pang lâng, in ē thiaⁿ koh ē tsiap-siū.
English: Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations. They will also listen.

Tailo: Pang-kok, lí ê ông nā-sī gín-á, lí ê kuì-tso̍k tsá-khí sî iàn-lo̍k, lí tsiū ū tsai-hō.
English: Woe to you, land, when your king is a child, And your princes eat in the morning!

Tailo: Phak tuà Iésu ê kha tsîng kā I kám-siā, tsit-ê lâng sī Sa-má-lī-a lâng.
English: He fell on his face at Jesus' feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.

Tailo: Lí ê tshuì-tûn tshin-tshiūnn tsu-âng suàⁿ, lí ê tshuì mā seⁿ-tsò suí, lí ê tshuì-phué tī phè lāi, tshin-tshiūnn peh khui ê sia̍h-liû.
English: Your lips are like scarlet thread. Your mouth is lovely. Your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate behind your veil.

Tailo: Ing-tsiáu tshìng kuân tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi tsò siū, kám sī tsiàu lí ê bīng-līng?
English: Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up, And makes his nest on high?

Tailo: Tsò lāu-pē ê, lín m̄-thang kik kiáⁿ-jî siū-khì, tio̍h īng Tsú ê kíng-kài kah kà-sī lâi kā in puê-ióng.
English: You fathers, don't provoke your children to wrath, but nurture them in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, Ia-lô-ba-am iû-guân bô lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, koh tuì tsìng lâng tiong siat-li̍p suaⁿ-thâu ê tsè-si, kiàn-nā ài ê, tsiū hun-pia̍t i, hō͘ i tsò suaⁿ-thâu ê tsè-si.
English: After this thing Jeroboam didn't return from his evil way, but made again from among all the people priests of the high places: whoever would, he consecrated him, that there might be priests of the high places.

Tailo: Guá tsiū ē kian-kò͘ lí ê kok-uī, tshin-tshiūnn Guá kah lí ê lāu-pē — Tabi̍t li̍p ê iok, kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun beh kuán-lí Isulael, íng-uán bô tn̄g. '
English: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom, according as I covenanted with David your father, saying, There shall not fail you a man to be ruler in Israel.

Tailo: M̄-thang tsia̍h tàng-sng lâng ê pn̄g, mā m̄-thang tham i ê hó tsu-bī.
English: Don't eat the food of him who has a stingy eye, And don't crave his delicacies:

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū si̍t ê thâng, īng sì-kha kiânn ê, lín lóng tio̍h lia̍h-tsò sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: All flying insects that walk on all fours are an abomination to you.

Tailo: Isáiah kóng, Tio̍h the̍h tsi̍t tè bû-hua-kó piáⁿ lâi. In tsiū the̍h-.lâi, tah tī liàp-á tíng-bīn, ông tsiū hó-.khì.
English: Isaiah said, Take a cake of figs. They took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Sî-kan kah ji̍t-kî sī Thiⁿ-pē ka-kī ê kuân-pìng só͘ kuat-tīng ê, m̄-sī lín ē-tàng tsai ê.
English: He said to them, It isn't for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within His own authority.

Tailo: Kàu Siōngtsú siúⁿ-sù pîng-an hō͘ lín ê hiann-tī kah í-king siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín sio-siâng, in mā koh ū tit-tio̍h Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè kā Ioltàn hô hit pîng ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in, jiân-āu lín ta̍k lâng thang tńg-lâi guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē. '
English: until Yahweh give rest to your brothers, as to you, and they also possess the land which Yahweh your God gives them beyond the Jordan: then shall you return every man to his possession, which I have given you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē tsiū lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Lâng nā bô tsun-siú lu̍t-huat tiong ê tsi̍t tiâu, to̍h-sī bô tsun-siú tsuân-pō͘ ê lu̍t-huat.
English: For whoever shall keep the whole law, and yet stumble in one point, he has become guilty of all.

Tailo: In-uī ū siū á-.sī bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, siōng iàu-kín ê sī tsun-siú Siōngtè ê kài-bīng.
English: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

Tailo: In tī ông ê bīn-tsîng ìn kóng, Ông, tī Iôtah tso̍k siū lia̍h ê lâng tiong-kan hit-ê Taniel, i bô lia̍h lí kah lí só͘ tshiam-jī ê kìm-līng tsò iàu-kín, i kìng-jiân tsi̍t ji̍t kî-tó saⁿ pái.
English: Then answered they and said before the king, That Daniel, who is of the children of the captivity of Judah, doesn't regard you, O king, nor the interdict that you have signed, but makes his petition three times a day.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī tshòng-tsō tuā kng-thé ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who made the great lights; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Nó͘ah ê sè-hē kì tī ē-té: Nó͘ah sī gī lâng, tī hit sè-tāi ê tiong-kan sī uân-tsuân ê lâng; nó͘-ah kah Siōngtè tsò-hué kiânn.
English: This is the history of the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

Tailo: tsiū tuì i kóng-khí tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, kóng, Lí só͘ tshuā-lâi lán tau ê hit-ê Hi-bú-lâi lô͘-po̍k lâi-kàu guá tsia, beh kā guá hì-lāng,
English: She spoke to him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought to us, came in to me to mock me,

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, to̍h-sī Moltékái tsē tī ông-kiong mn̂g kháu ê sî, ông ê thài-kàm tiong-kan ū kò͘-mn̂g ê nn̄g lâng — Bikthàn kah The-le-sih, in siū-khì kè-bô͘ beh hāi Ahasuiló͘ ông.
English: In those days, while Mordecai was sitting in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those who kept the threshold, were angry, and sought to lay hands on the king Ahasuerus.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn tsit-má tsin tsē, lín kìng-jiân beh kiò in mài tsò-kang.
English: Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land are now many, and you make them rest from their burdens.

Tailo: I tī in ê bīn-tsîng kā lia̍t pang ê lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì; īng soh-á kā guā-pang lâng ê tē niû hō͘ in tsò sán-gia̍p; hō͘ Isulael ê tsi-tso̍k tuà guā-pang lâng ê pò͘-pênn.
English: He also drove out the nations before them, Allotted them for an inheritance by line, And made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

Tailo: Guān Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián kah lín tông-tsāi! A-men!
English: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí tńg-khì Aigi̍p ê sî, tio̍h tsù-ì kā Guá só͘ kau tī lí ê tshiú ê só͘-ū kî-sū lóng kiânn tī Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng. Tsóng-.sī, Guá ē hō͘ i ê sim ngē, i mā bô beh pàng tsiah-ê jîn-bîn khì.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, When you go back into Egypt, see that you do before Pharaoh all the wonders which I have put in your hand, but I will harden his heart and he will not let the people go.

Tailo: Si-óng ê sè-ka pîng-sî pí seh khah tshing-khì, pí ling khah pe̍h, in ê sing-khu pí âng-pó-gi̍k khah âng, tshin-tshiūnn nâ-pó-tsio̍h ê kng-ku̍t.
English: Her nobles were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk; They were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was as of sapphire.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h Iôtah ông E-hō͘-iá-kim, lí tio̍h kóng: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí sio hit pún, kóng, ' Lí ná ē tī hit lāi-bīn siá kóng, Babúlông ông it-tīng ē lâi huí-bia̍t tsit-ê thó͘-tē, hō͘ tsit só͘-tsāi ê lâng kah tsing-seⁿ lóng sí-.khì? '
English: Concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, Thus says Yahweh: You have burned this scroll, saying, Why have you written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from there man and animal?

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Iosiúah kóng, Khí-.lâi! Lí ná ē án-ne phak tī tē-.ni̍h?
English: Yahweh said to Joshua, Get you up; why are you thus fallen on your face?

Tailo: Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ lâi mn̄g Iésu, kóng, Tī thian-kok siáⁿ lâng siōng tuā?
English: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê tsìnn siā tio̍h guá ê sing-khu, Lí ê tshiú tāng-tāng kā guá tshi̍h tiâu-.leh.
English: For your arrows have pierced me, Your hand presses hard on me.

Tailo: Iésu kah i khì. Kui tuā-tīn ê lâng mā e-e-kheh-kheh tuè I khì.
English: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.

Tailo: Koh īng kim an-tsng tiān kah thong-niû, hō͘-tīng, tshiûⁿ-piah kah mn̂g-sìⁿ, piah tíng khik ki-lō͘-ping.
English: He overlaid also the house, the beams, the thresholds, and the walls of it, and the doors of it, with gold; and engraved cherubim on the walls.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá tsit sî beh kā tuà tī tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn hiàt tshut-.khì, koh beh hō͘ in khùn-khó͘, hō͘ in hiáu-ngō͘.
English: For thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it.

Tailo: hō͘ lín ê ji̍t-tsí kah lín ê kiáⁿ-sun ê ji̍t-tsí, tī Siōngtsú tuì lín ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē, tit-tio̍h ke-thinn tsin tsē, tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ khàm tē ê ji̍t-tsí hiah kú.
English: that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm khì Sīkhiàm, in-uī Isulael jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Sīkhiàm, beh kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông.
English: Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.

Tailo: Lín khì, uī guá kah jîn-bîn, koh uī Iôtah kûn-tsiòng, kā só͘ khioh-tio̍h tsit pún tsheh ê uē mn̄g Siōngtsú, in-uī Siōngtsú tuì lán tuā siū-khì, sī in-uī lán ê tsó͘-sian bô tsun-thàn tsit pún tsheh ê uē, bô tsiàu it-tshè só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē lán ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Go you, inquire of Yahweh for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found; for great is the wrath of Yahweh that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not listened to the words of this book, to do according to all that which is written concerning us.

Tailo: Tng Amí-a-thal tsò tuā-tsè-si ê sî, Tabi̍t ji̍p-khì Siōngtè ê tiān, tsia̍h tsè-tuâⁿ tíng ê piáⁿ, mā hō͘ kin-tuè ê lâng tsia̍h. Tsiàu lu̍t-huat kui-tīng, tsit-ê hiàn tsè ê piáⁿ, tsè-si í-guā ê lâng bē īng-tit tsia̍h.
English: How he entered into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the show bread, which it is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?

Tailo: In ê sò͘-tsè īng tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, uī-tio̍h tsit tsa̍p-saⁿ tsiah gû-káng, ta̍k tsiah gû-káng hiàn tsa̍p-hūn tsi saⁿ e-huat, uī-tio̍h nn̄g tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, ta̍k tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng hiàn gō͘-hūn tsi-it e-huat.
English: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenth parts for every bull of the thirteen bulls, two tenth parts for each ram of the two rams,

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng o-ló Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh, tsin-lí pún-sin mā uī i tsò-tsìng; guán mā uī i tsò kiàn-tsìng, lí tsai guán ê kiàn-tsìng sī tsin-si̍t.
English: Demetrius has the testimony of all, and of the truth itself; yes, we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.

Tailo: Lí nā bîng-lí, tsiū tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē, àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá kóng uē ê siann.
English: If now you have understanding, hear this. Listen to the voice of my words.

Tailo: Guān guá ê tsi̍h tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí ê ìng-ín, in-uī Lí só͘-ū ê kài-bīng lóng sī kong-gī.
English: Let my tongue sing of your word, For all your commandments are righteousness.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá kóng, Lí m̄-thang tī tsit-ê gín-á ê sin tsiūⁿ hē tshiú, mā m̄-thang tuì i án-tsuáⁿ tsò, in-uī Guá taⁿ tsai lí sī kìng-uì Siōngtè, lí mā bô kā lí ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī lí to̍k-seⁿ ê lâu-.leh m̄ hō͘ Guá.
English: He said, Don't lay your hand on the boy, neither do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, seeing you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me.

Tailo: I mā kah kóng Hi-la̍h uē ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng-uē piān-lūn; hiah-ê lâng iáu-koh put-sî kè-bô͘ beh kā i thâi.
English: preaching boldly in the name of the Lord. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

Tailo: Guá ē kā lí ê guā-phàu hō͘ i tshīng, kā lí ê io-tuà hō͘ i hâ, kā lí tsiáng-lí ê tsìng-kuân kau tī i ê tshiú. I ē tsò tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn kah Iôtah ê ke ê pē.
English: and I will clothe him with your robe, and strengthen him with your belt. I will commit your government into his hand; and he will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

Tailo: In tsē tsûn beh kuè ô͘ khì Ka-peh-ná-um hit pîng. Thiⁿ í-king àm, Iésu iáu-buē kàu in hia.
English: and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.

Tailo: Lāu-pē tuì in kóng, I tuì tó tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ khì? In-uī i ê kiáⁿ ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tuì Iôtah lâi ê Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ khì ê lō͘.
English: Their father said to them, Which way did he go? Now his sons had seen which way the man of God went, who came from Judah.

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Lín tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, guá liâm-piⁿ ē kàu lín tiong-kan. Tsun-siú tsit pún tsheh ī-giân ê uē ê lâng, tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Behold, I come quickly. Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.

Tailo: Mô͘se ua̍t tńg-sin lo̍h suaⁿ, tshiú the̍h nn̄g tè iok-pi, tsiah-ê pi nn̄g bīn lóng ū siá, tsit bīn hit bīn lóng ū siá jī.
English: Moses turned, and went down from the mountain, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand; tablets that were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other they were written.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsì-tuā, ing-kai siū tuā o-ló; I ê uí-tāi bô huat-tō͘ tshik-to̍k.
English: Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised! His greatness is unsearchable.

Tailo: Guá tuà ê só͘-tsāi siū tshian-suá lī-khui guá, tshin-tshiūnn kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng ê pò͘-pênn án-ne; guá kā sèⁿ-miā kńg khí-.lâi kah tsit pò͘ ê lâng kńg pò͘ sio-siâng. I beh kā guá tuì pò͘-kui-thâu tsián-tn̄g; tuì tsá-khí kàu ê-hng, Siōngtsú it-ti̍t siūⁿ beh kiat-sok guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: My dwelling is removed, And is carried away from me like a shepherd's tent. I have rolled up, like a weaver, my life. He will cut me off from the loom. From day even to night you will make an end of me.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng, tsīn-ì thiàⁿ Tsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Jesus said to him, You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.'

Tailo: Tsè-si Atsalíah tshuā Siōngtsú ê ióng-kám tsè-si peh-tsa̍p lâng tuè i ji̍p-.khì.
English: Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him eighty priests of Yahweh, who were valiant men:

Tailo: Sàulô kóng, Tio̍h tī guá kah guá ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan ê tiong-kan lâi liam-khau. Tsiū liam-tio̍h Ionáthan.
English: Saul said, Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son. Jonathan was taken.

Tailo: Lí só͘ kàng ê tsik-hua̍t, kiû Lí kā guá tû-.khì; in-uī Lí ê tshiú ê tok-tsik, guá teh beh hông siau-bia̍t.
English: Remove your scourge away from me. I am overcome by the blow of your hand.

Tailo: Tī hia, liân-tiúⁿ tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tuì A-li̍k-san-toh lâi ê tsûn, beh khui-khì I-ta-lí-ah, i tsiū kiò guán tsē hit tsiah tsûn.
English: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tah pò͘-pêⁿ, kok tsiàu in ê kun-tuī, kok kui in ê pún-iâⁿ, kok kui in ê tuā kî.
English: The children of Israel shall pitch their tents, every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, according to their divisions.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kàu kin-á-ji̍t, tsiah-ê Isulael lâng bô tsia̍h tuā-thuí-thâu ê kin, in-uī hit-ê lâng siàn Iâkop tuā-thuí-khū ê kin.
English: Therefore the children of Israel don't eat the sinew of the hip, which is on the hollow of the thigh, to this day, because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew of the hip.

Tailo: Hitsekia huan-hù tī Siōngtsú ê tiān lāi tio̍h tsún-pī tshik-tshng, in tsiū án-ne tsún-pī.
English: Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of Yahweh; and they prepared them.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Ki-tok ê tāi-tsì lín siūⁿ án-tsuáⁿ? I sī siáⁿ lâng ê kiáⁿ-sun? In ìn Iésu kóng, Sī Tabi̍t ê kiánn-sun.
English: saying, What do you think of the Christ? Whose son is he? They said to him, Of David.

Tailo: In-uī guá ū kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân, só͘-í, guá khuànn ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè tsò îng-kng.
English: I have therefore my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God.

Tailo: ū gō͘-bān saⁿ-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Án-ne, lín ta̍k lâng nā bô tsin-sim sià-bián lín ê hiann-tī, guá ê Thiⁿ-pē mā bô beh án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi.
English: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don't each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.

Tailo: Tsuí tuì tē-tsiūⁿ ti̍t-ti̍t thè, tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p kang āu, tsuí tsiū tsiām-tsiām siau-thè.
English: The waters receded from the earth continually. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters decreased.

Tailo: Hit sî, kong-pêⁿ ē tuà tī khòng-iá, kong-gī ē tuà tī puî ê tshân.
English: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness; And righteousness will remain in the fruitful field.

Tailo: Tsiàu lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok kā guá tsí-sī ê, guá ka-kī tsai guá lī-khui sè-kan ê ji̍t-tsí í-king teh beh kàu.
English: knowing that the putting off of my tent comes swiftly, even as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me.

Tailo: Ông ìn kóng, Guá tsún-tsún tsai lín sī thiau-kang iân-tshiân, in-uī lín tsai hit-ê bāng guá í-king bē kì-.tit à.
English: The king answered, I know of a certainty that you would gain time, because you see the thing is gone from me.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī Ki-tok án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h siū khó͘, tsiâⁿ-tsò thâu tsi̍t-ê tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, thang kā tsín-kiù ê kng-bîng thuân hō͘ Iô-tá-iah lâng kah guā-pang lâng.
English: how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h tsò hó sū, m̄-thang siūⁿ siān.
English: But you, brothers, don't be weary in doing well.

Tailo: Aigi̍p lâng jiok in, Huâ-láu só͘-ū ê bé, tshia kah i ê bé-ping, í-ki̍p i ê kun-tuī, tsiū tī hái piⁿ uá-kīn Pí-hap-hi-lio̍k, tī Pa-li̍k-sé-hun ê tuì-bīn, tī Isulael lâng tsat iâⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, jiok-tio̍h in.
English: The Egyptians pursued after them: all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and his army; and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pihahiroth, before Baal Zephon.

Tailo: Tse sī tī Ta-lió-suh ông jī nî la̍k-gue̍h jī-tsa̍p sì.
English: in the twenty-fourth day of the month, in the sixth month, in the second year of Darius the king.

Tailo: Lâng ē kā lia̍t kok ê îng-kng kah tsun-kuì tuà-lâi hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: and they shall bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it so that they may enter.

Tailo: Lín khak-si̍t tsai, îm-luān, ù-uè á-.sī tham-luân ( Tse sī tsi̍t tsióng ngó͘-siōng tsông-pài ) ê lâng, lóng bē-tàng tsiâⁿ-tsò Ki-tok kah Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê tsú-bîn.
English: Know this for sure, that no sexually immoral person, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God.

Tailo: In mā bē-tàng tuì lí the̍h-tshut tsit-má teh kā guá khòng-kò ê tsìng-kì.
English: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Guá beh tshuā tsin tsē lâng lâi kā in kong-kik, hō͘ in hông hiat lâi hiat khì, tú-tio̍h tshiúⁿ-tua̍t.
English: For thus says the Lord Yahweh: I will bring up a company against them, and will give them to be tossed back and forth and robbed.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî, Baal tsiū tshuā Palân kàu Só-hui ê suaⁿ-iá, tsiūⁿ Pi-su-gah ê suaⁿ-thâu, khí tshit tsō tuâⁿ, ta̍k tsō tuâⁿ hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng.
English: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, lí hia mā ū lâng tshî-siú Nî-ko-láu ê kà-sī.
English: So you also have some who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans likewise .

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiàu Siōngtsú ê uē bīng-līng Isulael lâng, kóng, Iôséhuh kiáⁿ-sun ê tsi-tso̍k só͘ kóng ê sī tio̍h.
English: Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of Yahweh, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph speaks right.

Tailo: Thau-the̍h lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú ê mi̍h, koh kóng, Tse m̄-sī tsuē , tsit khuán lâng sī kah kiông-tō kâng luī.
English: Whoever robs his father or his mother, and says, It's not wrong. He is a partner with a destroyer.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tsò-hué kóng, ' Taⁿ lán tio̍h uī ka-kī khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h sio-tsè, mā m̄-sī uī-tio̍h pa̍t tsióng ê tsè,
English: Therefore we said, Let us now prepare to build us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice:

Tailo: Tsín-kiù tuì Siōngtsú hia lâi; guān Lí sù-hok Lí ê tsú-bîn. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Salvation belongs to Yahweh. Your blessing be on your people. Selah.

Tailo: Kóng, Lí nā-sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông, tio̍h kiù Lí ka-kī.
English: and saying, If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá í-tsîng khì lín hia, pīng bô īng suí ê giân-sû á-.sī tì-huī lâi tuì lín thuân Siōngtè ê ò-pì.
English: When I came to you, brothers, I didn't come with excellence of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God.

Tailo: I tsiū kuáⁿ-kín kā pân lāi ê tsuí piàⁿ tī tsô-.ni̍h, koh tsáu-khì tséⁿ-.ni̍h tshiūⁿ tsuí, hō͘ i só͘-ū ê lo̍k-tô lim tsuí.
English: She hurried, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiàu Siōngtsú ê bīng-līng kì-tsài in tshut-huat só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘-thîng, in tshut-huat kiânn ê lō͘-thîng to̍h-sī án-ne.
English: Moses wrote their goings out according to their journeys by the commandment of Yahweh: and these are their journeys according to their goings out.

Tailo: Lí kiânn ê sî, bô tì-sú ū tsó͘-gāi; lí tsáu ê sî, mā bē tì-sú kha that-tio̍h mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: When you go, your steps will not be hampered. When you run, you will not stumble.

Tailo: Guá ē tshun Guá ê tshiú, īng Guá tī Aigi̍p tiong só͘ beh kiâⁿ it-tshè ê kî-sū lâi kā i phah, jiân-āu i tsiah ē tsún lín khì.
English: I will put forth my hand and strike Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst of it, and after that he will let you go.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ lia̍h tuā-tsè-si Selaiah kah tē-jī kip ê tsè-si Tse-huan-iah kah saⁿ-ê kò͘-mn̂g ê,
English: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold:

Tailo: Koh ū līng-guā tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài tuì sìng-tiān tshut-.lâi, tuì tsē tī hûn tíng hit uī tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tio̍h īng Lí ê liâm-li̍k-á lâi siu-kuah, in-uī siu-kuah ê sî-kî í-king kàu, tē-tsiūⁿ ê lông-tsok-bu̍t lóng kàu si̍k à.
English: Another angel came out from the temple, crying with a loud voice to him who sat on the cloud, Send forth your sickle, and reap; for the hour to reap has come; for the harvest of the earth is ripe!

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ mn̂g piⁿ, tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī siâⁿ tshut-ji̍p ê só͘-tsāi, tuā-siaⁿ huah,
English: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, At the entry doors, she cries aloud:

Tailo: Kàu hit sî, tsit-ê kuân-tuā, phuê-hu kng-ku̍t ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī tuì khai-kok í-lâi hui-siông thang kiaⁿ, hun tē-kài kā lâng thún-ta̍h ê, in ê tē ū kang-hô hun-khui, in ē kā lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī hiàn-kàu Si-óng suaⁿ, Siōngtsú an-tì I ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: In that time, a present will be brought to Yahweh of Armies from a people tall and smooth, even from a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of Yahweh of Armies, Mount Zion.

Tailo: In ē tshut-khì khuànn hiah-ê puē-gi̍k Guá ê lâng ê sin-si; in-uī in ê thâng bē sí, in ê hué bē hua; kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê lóng ē thó-ià in.
English: They shall go forth, and look on the dead bodies of the men who have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring to all flesh.

Tailo: Gī lâng, lín tio̍h in-uī Siōngtsú lâi huann-hí, kì-liām I ê sìng-miâ lâi o-ló.
English: Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous people! Give thanks to his holy Name.

Tailo: Lín tī i ê bīn-tsîng tio̍h kín-sīn, tsun-thàn i ê uē, m̄-thang uî-puē i, i bô beh sià-bián lín ê kuè-sit, in-uī i sī hōng Guá ê miâ lâi ê.
English: Pay attention to him, and listen to his voice. Don't provoke him, for he will not pardon your disobedience, for my name is in him.

Tailo: Lín kóng-uē ing-kai, ' Sī' tsiū kóng ' Sī', ' M̄-sī' tsiū kóng ' M̄-sī'; kî-tha ke kóng ê, sī tuì hit-ê Mô͘-kuí tshut-.lâi ê.
English: But let your Yes' be Yes' and your No' be no.' Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Tabi̍t ē íng-uán ū lâng tsē Isulael ê pó-tsō;
English: For thus says Yahweh: David shall never want a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hun-pia̍t siān-ok ê tshiū, i ê kué-tsí m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī tsia̍h ê ji̍t, lí it-tīng ē sí.
English: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, you shall not eat of it; for in the day that you eat of it you will surely die.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá beh tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí ê khuì-la̍t, tsá-khí sî beh tuā-siaⁿ o-ló Lí ê tsû-ài; in-uī Lí bat tsò guá ê siâⁿ-pó, tī huān-lān ê ji̍t, tsò guá tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi.
English: But I will sing of your strength. Yes, I will sing aloud of your loving kindness in the morning. For you have been my high tower, A refuge in the day of my distress.

Tailo: Lí ê kè-uē siuⁿ tsē, tì-sú ià-siān. Taⁿ tio̍h hō͘ hiah-ê kuan thiⁿ-siōng ê, khuànn tsheⁿ-sîn ê, tī gue̍h-tshe kóng ī-giân ê, lóng khí-.lâi, kiù lí thuat-lī só͘ beh lîm-kàu lí ê tāi-tsì.
English: You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels: let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save you from the things that shall come on you.

Tailo: Mikaiah kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Isulael tsìng lâng sì-suàⁿ tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tshin-tshiūnn bô bo̍k-tsiá ê iûⁿ tsi̍t-iūⁿ. Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Tsiah-ê bô tsú-lâng ê, in ta̍k-ê thang pîng-an tńg-khì in ka-kī ê ke. '
English: He said, I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and Yahweh said, These have no master; let them return every man to his house in peace.

Tailo: Lí tiàu tiùⁿ-lî tio̍h tī kau ê ē-té ê só͘-tsāi, kā huat-kuī kng ji̍p-khì tiùⁿ-lî lāi; tsit-ê tiùⁿ-lî sī kā lín keh-khui sìng-só͘ kah tsì-sìng-só͘.
English: You shall hang up the veil under the clasps, and shall bring the ark of the testimony in there within the veil: and the veil shall separate the holy place from the most holy for you.

Tailo: Ba̍k-tsiu pàng-kheh sī teh tô͘-bô͘ tsò pháiⁿ, tshuì-tûn ha̍p uá-lâi tsiū tsiânn hit-ê pháiⁿ tāi.
English: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, One who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.

Tailo: Khóla̍h tsio-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, kā in kong-kik; Siōngtsú ê îng-kng hián-hiān tī huē-tsiòng.
English: Korah assembled all the congregation against them to the door of the tent of meeting: and the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the congregation.

Tailo: Hái piⁿ ê tē ē piàn-tsò tsháu-tiûⁿ, ū bo̍k-tsiá ê tsháu-liâu, ū iûⁿ-kûn ê tiâu.
English: The sea coast will be pastures, with cottages for shepherds and folds for flocks.

Tailo: Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah tit-tio̍h tì-huī ê sîn tshiong-muá, in-uī Mô͘se bat tī i ê tíng-bīn huāⁿ-tshiú, Isulael lâng tsiū tsun-thàn i, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands on him: and the children of Israel listened to him, and did as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng tsi̍t hāng, guá ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g hāng, to̍h-sī kuân-lîng sio̍k tī Siōngtè,
English: God has spoken once, Twice I have heard this, That power belongs to God.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kui-ǹg lí ê Siōngtè, tsip-siú thiàⁿ-sim, kong-pêⁿ, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ thìng-hāu lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Therefore turn to your God. Keep kindness and justice, And wait continually for your God.

Tailo: In ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ bô tshin-tshiūnn lán ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, liân lán ê tuì-ti̍k mā án-ne phîng-tuàn.
English: For their rock is not as our Rock, Even our enemies themselves being judges.

Tailo: Iôtah koh kā i ê lāu-pē Isulael kóng, Lí tshe gín-á kah guá-.khì, guán tsiū tshut-huat khì, thang hō͘ guán kah lí, í-ki̍p guán ê gín-á tit-tio̍h ua̍h, bián sí.
English: Judah said to Israel, his father, Send the boy with me, and we'll get up and go, so that we may live, and not die, both we, and you, and also our little ones.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì Aigi̍p, tuì ta̍k só͘-tsāi, tuà bé lâi hō͘ Só͘lômóng.
English: They brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt, and out of all lands.

Tailo: Tabi̍t m̄-bat tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, m̄-koh i kóng, Siōngtè tuì guá ê Tsú kóng, Lí tsē guá ê tuā-pîng,
English: For David didn't ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit by my right hand,

Tailo: Guá siá phue kià hō͘ guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê kiáⁿ Tî-mó͘-theh. Guān lí tuì Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah lán ê Tsú Ki-tok Iésu, tit-tio̍h un-tián, liân-bín kah pîng-an.
English: to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

Tailo: Guá kā lín tòng-tsò ka-kī ê kiáⁿ teh tuì lín kóng, lín tio̍h o̍h guán ê khuán-sit, kā lín ê sim-hing pàng khah khui-khuah.
English: Now in return, I speak as to my children, you also be open wide.

Tailo: In kám bô kà-sī lí, kā lí kóng, kóng-tshut i sim-pak ê uē?
English: Shall they not teach you, tell you, And utter words out of their heart?

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū tsi̍t uī tuì tiān lāi ǹg guá kóng-uē; ū tsi̍t-ê lâng khiā tī guá ê sin piⁿ.
English: I heard one speaking to me out of the house; and a man stood by me.

Tailo: Koh khah tsē ê tsuí mā bē-tàng siau-bia̍t ài-tsîng; tuā-tsuí mā bē-tàng kā i im-ba̍t. Nā ū lâng beh īng tshù lāi tsuân-pō͘ ê sán-gia̍p lâi uāⁿ ài-tsîng, i tik-khak ē hō͘ lâng biáu-sī.
English: Many waters can't quench love, Neither can floods drown it. If a man would give all the wealth of his house for love, He would be utterly scorned. Friends

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè;
English: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê kong-gī phuàⁿ-tuàn guá; m̄-thang iông-ín in tuì guá khua-kháu.
English: Vindicate me, Yahweh my God, according to your righteousness; Don't let them gloat over me.

Tailo: Tī in ê tshiú-hā ū kuè-liān ê kun-tuī, kiōng saⁿ-tsa̍p-bān tshit-tshing gō͘-pah lâng, lóng sī tuā lîng-li̍k koh gâu tsing-tsiàn, ē-tàng pang-tsān ông kong-kik tuì-ti̍k ê.
English: Under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, who made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal lâi-kàu tsit-ê tē ê sî, guán tsiū kóng, ' Lâi, lán tio̍h tsiuΝ7 Êlúsalèm, lâi siám-phiah Kal-tí-ah lâng ê ping kah Alâm ê ping; in-uī án-ne, guán tsiah tuà tī Êlúsalèm.
English: But it happened, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, that we said, Come, and let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans, and for fear of the army of the Syrians; so we dwell at Jerusalem.

Tailo: Guá tsai lí ê khó͘-lān kah sàn-tshiah; kî-si̍t lí sī hó-gia̍h. Guá mā tsai lí ū siū hiah-ê tsū-tshing Iô-tá-iah lâng ê lâng kā lí huí-pòng; kî-si̍t in m̄-sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, in sī sio̍k Satán ê tsi̍p-thuân.
English: I know your works, oppression, and your poverty (but you are rich), and the blasphemy of those who say they are Jews, and they are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.

Tailo: ' Bô kian-siú tsiah-ê lu̍t-huat ê uē lâi kiâⁿ ê tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who doesn't confirm the words of this law to do them. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Ammóng lâng tsai in hō͘ Tabi̍t thó-ià, tsiū tshe lâng khì tshiàⁿ Biat-le-ho͘p ê Alâm lâng kah Tso͘-ba ê Alâm lâng, pō͘-ping nn̄g bān kah Mákah ông ê lâng tsi̍t tshing, koh ū Tô-pik lâng tsi̍t bān nn̄g tshing.
English: When the children of Ammon saw that they were become odious to David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth Rehob, and the Syrians of Zobah, twenty thousand footmen, and the king of Maacah with one thousand men, and the men of Tob twelve thousand men.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, in-uī Tulô ǹg Êlúsalèm, kóng, ' Ah-hah! Hit-ê tsò lia̍t pang ê mn̂g ê í-king phuà, taⁿ kui-ǹg Guá; i í-king pha-hng, Guá ē hong-sīng. '
English: Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken: the gate of the peoples; she is turned to me; I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste:

Tailo: I só͘ hiàn ê lé-mi̍h, to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: He offered for his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Êlúsalèm, lí tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú! Si-óng, lí tio̍h o-ló lí ê Siōngtè!
English: Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!

Tailo: Tī hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, ū sin-īn kah hō͘ enn-á tsia̍h ling ê hū-jîn-lâng si̍t-tsāi tsin put-hīng!
English: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn tshik-tsiáu-á pue khí pue lo̍h, ìⁿ-á pue-lâi pue khì, bô-iân bô-kò͘ ê tsiù-tsó͘ mā bē ìng-giām.
English: Like a fluttering sparrow, Like a darting swallow, So the undeserved curse doesn't come to rest.

Tailo: Kóng si̍t-uē ê lâng hián-bîng kong-gī; lām-sám kiàn-tsìng ê lâng hián-tshut kuí-tsà.
English: He who is truthful testifies honestly, But a false witness lies.

Tailo: Guá ê phuê-hu o͘ tsiū liù phuê, guá ê kut-thâu in-uī jia̍t suah siū sio-.khì.
English: My skin grows black and peels from me. My bones are burned with heat.

Tailo: In-uī tshuē-tio̍h guá ê lâng tsiū ē tshuē-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, mā ē tuì Siōngtsú tit-tio̍h un-huī.
English: For whoever finds me, finds life, And will obtain favor from Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsiáng-kuán ông ê kim-khò͘ ê sī A-ti-el ê kiáⁿ Atsumabet. Tsiáng-kuán tshân-iá, siâⁿ-ip, hiuⁿ-tsng, siâⁿ-pó ê kim-khò͘ ê sī Utsiiah ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan.
English: Over the king's treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the treasures in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers, was Jonathan the son of Uzziah:

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū khì Gilgal, tī Gilgal tng Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng siat-li̍p Sàulô tsò ông, in tī hia hiàn siā-un-tsè tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng. Sàulô kah Isulael jîn-bîn tuā-tuā huann-hí.
English: All the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before Yahweh in Gilgal; and there they offered sacrifices of peace offerings before Yahweh; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-sī kā guá piàⁿ-tshut tshin-tshiūnn ling, hō͘ guá kiat kui thuân tshin-tshiūnn ling-piáⁿ?
English: Haven't you poured me out like milk, And curdled me like cheese?

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú hō͘ in ê sim ngē, tí-ti̍k Isulael lâi kah in kau-tsiàn, hō͘ in tsuân-pō͘ siū bia̍t, bô tit-tio̍h liân-bín, tì-sú tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-bông, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê.
English: For it was of Yahweh to harden their hearts, to come against Israel in battle, that he might utterly destroy them, that they might have no favor, but that he might destroy them, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Lín kóng, ' Bô ah, guán beh khiâ bé lâi tsáu. ' Só͘-í, lín teh beh tsáu, koh kóng, ' Guán beh khiâ hit-ê tsin gâu tsáu ê tsing-seⁿ', só͘-í, jiok lín-.ê mā ē tsin gâu tsáu.
English: but you said, No, for we will flee on horses; therefore you will flee; and, We will ride on the swift; therefore those who pursue you will be swift.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tshiú gia̍h kuân, in iû-guân m̄-khuàⁿ; in ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê jia̍t-sim lâi kiàn-siàu, koh ū hué sio-bia̍t Lí ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: Yahweh, your hand is lifted up, yet they don't see; but they will see your zeal for the people, and be disappointed. Yes, fire will consume your adversaries.

Tailo: koh tshú bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ kah kiáu iû ê bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, í-ki̍p buah iû bô-kàⁿ ê po̍h piáⁿ, lóng tio̍h īng hó ê mī-hún lâi tsò.
English: unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil: you shall make them of fine wheat flour.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng ê Iâ-nê í-ki̍p Iâm-bù kah Mô͘se tuì-ti̍k, tsit-má tsiah-ê lâng mā án-ne teh kah tsin-lí tuì-ti̍k. In ê sim-tsì í-king pāi-huāi, tī sìn-gióng siōng bô huat-tō͘ koh siū khó-giām.
English: Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, reprobate concerning the faith.

Tailo: In-uī Kitthê ê tsûn ē lâi kong-kik i, tì-sú i sim iu-būn, tsiū tò tńg-.khì. I koh thòng-hūn sìng iok, tsiàu i ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ; i ē tò tńg-lâi kah khì-sak sìng iok ê lâng tsò-hué kè-bô͘.
English: For ships of Kittim shall come against him; therefore he shall be grieved, and shall return, and have indignation against the holy covenant, and shall do his pleasure: he shall even return, and have regard to those who forsake the holy covenant.

Tailo: Lí ē an-jiân sí-bông, tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū, hō͘ lâng bâi-tsòng.
English: but you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried in a good old age.

Tailo: In īng kau-tsiàn ê sî só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h lâi hiàn, thang siu-tsíng Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: Out of the spoil won in battles did they dedicate to repair the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Kò͘-kaⁿ ê lâng kiò lâng gia̍h ting hué lâi, tsông ji̍p-.khì, phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah phak tī Páulô kah Sela̍h ê kha tsîng.
English: He called for lights and sprang in, and, fell down trembling before Paul and Silas,

Tailo: Tē-gō͘-ê thiⁿ-sài tsi̍t ē pûn, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t lia̍p tsheⁿ tuì thinn-tíng lak lo̍h tē. Tsit lia̍p tsheⁿ ū niá-siū bô-té tshim kheⁿ ê só-sî.
English: The fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star from the sky which had fallen to the earth. The key to the pit of the abyss was given to him.

Tailo: Keh kang tsá-khí, Tabi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, tshut-huat tńg-khì Huilīsū ê tē. Huilīsū lâng mā khì E-tsu-le-el.
English: So David rose up early, he and his men, to depart in the morning, to return into the land of the Philistines. The Philistines went up to Jezreel.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng koh ū tsi̍t-ê tuā tiāu-thâu tshut-hiān, tsi̍t-ê hū-jîn-lâng sing-khu tshīng ji̍t-thâu, kha-ta̍h gue̍h-niû, thâu-khak tì tsa̍p-jī lia̍p tsheⁿ ê bián-liû.
English: A great sign was seen in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.

Tailo: Hō͘ lín thang tī guá ê kok-tō͘ kah guá tsò-hué tsē-toh lim-tsia̍h, koh tsē tuà pó-tsō lâi sím-phuàⁿ Isulael tsa̍p-jī-ê tsi-tso̍k.
English: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

Tailo: Ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng só͘ bong-.tio̍h ê huî khì-kù tio̍h kòng-phuà, tshâ-ê khì-kū tio̍h īng tsuí sé.
English: The earthen vessel, which he who has the discharge touches, shall be broken; and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù jîn-bîn kóng, ' Esáu ê kiáⁿ-sun lín ê hiann-tī tuà tī Seil, lín tio̍h king-kuè in ê kíng-kài, in ē kiaⁿ lín, só͘-í, lín tio̍h put-tsí kín-sīn.
