English: Command you the people, saying, You are to pass through the border of your brothers the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir; and they will be afraid of you: take good heed to yourselves therefore;

Tailo: Guá tsai ka-kī ê kuè-sit; guá ê tsuē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hō͘ lín só͘ gia̍h ê kun-khì, to̍h-sī lín tī siâⁿ guā kah Babúlông ông, í-ki̍p uî-khùn lín ê Kal-tí-ah lâng kau-tsiàn ê kun-khì tò tńg-.lâi, koh beh hō͘ tsiah-ê lóng tsū-tsi̍p tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi.
English: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans who besiege you, without the walls; and I will gather them into the midst of this city.

Tailo: （ Khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ki̍k luán-jio̍k ê sî, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thò͘-tshut khó͘-tsîng ê kî-tó. ）Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó, hō͘ guá kiû-kiò ê siann thàu kàu Lí ê bīn-tsîng!
English: Hear my prayer, Yahweh! Let my cry come to you.

Tailo: Kiû Lí mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne īng Lí ê kông hong kā in jiok, īng Lí ê tuā hong hō͘ in kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: So pursue them with your tempest, And terrify them with your storm.

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, koh kā in kóng, Lán ê pîng-iú La̍h-tsa-lō͘ teh khùn, guá beh lâi-khì kā i kiò-tshéⁿ.
English: He said these things, and after that, he said to them, Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.

Tailo: Lâng ē kóng, ' Sī in-uī in khì-sak Siōngtsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè ê iok, sī I tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p tē ê sî só͘ li̍p ê,
English: Then men shall say, Because they forsook the covenant of Yahweh, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,

Tailo: Taⁿ lí m̄-thang sǹg i bô tsuē, in-uī lí sī tshong-bîng ê lâng, mā ē tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā i khuán-thāi, tio̍h hō͘ i pe̍h thâu-mn̂g lâu hueh lo̍h im-kan.
English: Now therefore don't hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man; and you will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood.

Tailo: Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun tī Lūbiān ê tuì-bīn, tuà tī Basiáng ê tē kàu tī Sal-kah.
English: The sons of Gad lived over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salecah:

Tailo: Ionáthan bô thiaⁿ-tio̍h in lāu-pē ǹg jîn-bîn tsiù-tsuā, só͘-í, tshun i tshiú-.ni̍h ê kuái-á bué tuh tī bi̍t-pâng, i ê tshiú uat kàu tshuì-.ni̍h, ba̍k-tsiu tsiū kim.
English: But Jonathan didn't hear when his father charged the people with the oath: therefore he put forth the end of the rod who was in his hand, and dipped it in the honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.

Tailo: Kì-jiân Siōngtè ū kā lán sìn Tsú só͘ niá-siū kāng-khuán ê un-sù sù hō͘ in, guá sī siáⁿ lâng, ná ē-tàng tsó͘-tòng Siōngtè ê tsok-uî?
English: If then God gave to them the same gift as us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?

Tailo: Hit-ê í-tsîng in-uī huān tsuē kah jio̍k-thé bô siū kat-lé ê líng í-king sí-.khì, taⁿ Siōngtè hō͘ lín kah Ki-tok tsò-hué koh-ua̍h. Siōngtè í-king sià-bián lán só͘-ū ê tsuē-kò,
English: You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,

Tailo: Lín ē tó tī to hā, Guá beh tī Isulael ê kau-kài sím-phuàⁿ lín, lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: You shall fall by the sword; I will judge you in the border of Israel; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sim sī khuan-iông koh tsû-pi, thiàⁿ-sim sī bē uàn-tò͘, bē khua-kháu, bē kiau-ngō͘,
English: Love is patient and is kind; love doesn't envy. Love doesn't brag, is not proud,

Tailo: Koh tio̍h kā lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘ kà-sī in, tsí-sī in só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê lō͘, só͘ tio̍h tsò ê tāi-tsì;
English: You shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and shall show them the way in which they must walk, and the work that they must do.

Tailo: Song-sū kiat-sok liáu-āu, Tabi̍t tshe lâng tshuā i lâi-kàu kiong lāi, i tsiū tsò Tabi̍t ê bó͘, kā i seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, Tabi̍t só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú tsin bô huann-hí.
English: When the mourning was past, David sent and took her home to his house, and she became his wife, and bore him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased Yahweh.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá kā Tabi̍t kóng, Tuì-ti̍k pí guán khah kiông, tshut-lâi kau-iá kong-kik guán, guán kā i phah kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu.
English: The messenger said to David, The men prevailed against us, and came out to us into the field, and we were on them even to the entrance of the gate.

Tailo: Thó͘-tē tsū-jiân sing-sán ngó͘-kok; khí-thâu sī ng-á puh-gê, āu-lâi thò͘ suī, tsuè-āu tsiū pá-suī kiat-tsiâⁿ ngó͘-kok.
English: For the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ tsiū huann-hí tsiap I tsiūⁿ tsûn, tsûn liâm-piⁿ to̍h kàu in beh khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, tú-tú tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Eliiah í-king lâi ā, jî-tshiánn lâng tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù kā i khuán-thāi.
English: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.

Tailo: Husia koh kóng, Lí tsai lí ê lāu-pē kah tuè i ê lâng, lóng sī ióng-sū, taⁿ in ê sim bíng-lia̍t, tshin-tshiūnn tī tshân-iá sit-lo̍h kiáⁿ ê hîm-bú, jî-tshiánn lí ê lāu-pē sī tsiàn-sū, it-tīng bô kah jîn-bîn tsò-hué hioh.
English: Hushai said moreover, You know your father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are fierce in their minds, as a bear robbed of her cubs in the field; and your father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.

Tailo: Lí ê lāu-pē hō͘ guán phāinn kan-khó͘ ê ka-tann, lí ê lāu-pē só͘ hē tī guán ê khó͘-kang kah tāng ê ka-tann, kiû lí kiám khin, guán tsiū kā lí ho̍k-sāi.
English: Your father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make you the grievous service of your father, and his heavy yoke which he put on us, lighter, and we will serve you.

Tailo: Guá m̄-nā kah lín li̍p tsit-ê iok kah tsit-ê tsiù-tsuā,
English: Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath,

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Beh àm á sî, lín kóng, ' In-uī thiⁿ-sik âng, só͘-í, bîn-á-tsài ē hó thiⁿ. '
English: But he answered them, When it is evening, you say, It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.'

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiàu kun-tuī ê pâi-lia̍t tshut-huat, in ê tuī-ngó͘ to̍h-sī án-ne:
English: Thus were the travels of the children of Israel according to their armies; and they set forward.

Tailo: M̄-thang hut-lio̍k lí só͘ niá-siū ê sio̍k-lîng un-sù, to̍h-sī thong-kuè sian-ti ê uē kah tiúⁿ-ló-thuân ê huāⁿ-tshiú sù hō͘ lí ê.
English: Don't neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elders.

Tailo: Thàn lâng bô thê-hông ê sî, i ē lâi-kàu síng lāi ê puî tē, mā ē kiâⁿ i ê tsó͘-sian kah in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ m̄-bat kiânn ê; i ē īng só͘ tshiúⁿ ê, só͘ kiap ê kah tsâi-bu̍t hun-suànn hō͘ lâng, koh ē siat kè-bô͘ lâi kong-kik tsiah-ê hiám-iàu ê só͘-tsāi, ti̍t-kàu i ê sî-kî.
English: In time of security shall he come even on the fattest places of the province; and he shall do that which his fathers have not done, nor his fathers' fathers; he shall scatter among them prey, and spoil, and substance: yes, he shall devise his devices against the strongholds, even for a time.

Tailo: Mô͘se kā in kóng, Lín khiā-teh thìng-hāu, guá beh thiaⁿ Siōngtsú án-tsuáⁿ kā lín huan-hù.
English: Moses answered them, Wait, that I may hear what Yahweh will command concerning you.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am tuì i ê bó͘ kóng, Lí khí-lâi kái-tsong, hō͘ lâng m̄-tsai lí sī Ia-lô-ba-am ê bó͘. Jiânāu khì Sī-lô, tī hia ū sian-ti Ahiiah, kuan-hē guá i bat kóng, guá ē tsò tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê ông.
English: Jeroboam said to his wife, Please get up and disguise yourself, that you not be known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get you to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, who spoke concerning me that I should be king over this people.

Tailo: Beh khioh hó-gia̍h lâng toh-kha só͘ ka-la̍uh ê tsia̍h-mi̍h lâi tsí-iau, káu mā lâi tsīⁿ i ê kha seⁿ liàp-á ê só͘-tsāi.
English: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man's table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

Tailo: Sio̍k Tsa-tok ê ke, tuā-tsè-si Atsalíah ìn kóng, Tuì jîn-bîn tuà kiong-kip ê mi̍h kàu Siōngtsú ê tiān í-lâi, guán tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h, koh tshun tsin tsē, in-uī Siōngtsú sù-hok I ê tsú-bîn, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kàu hiah tsē.
English: Azariah the chief priest, of the house of Zadok, answered him and said, Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of Yahweh, we have eaten and had enough, and have left plenty: for Yahweh has blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.

Tailo: hō͘ thiàⁿ guá ê lâng sîng-siū tsâi-bu̍t, mā tshiong-muá in ê kim-khò͘.
English: That I may give wealth to those who love me. I fill their treasuries.

Tailo: Guá nā án-ne tsò, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài it-tīng ē huat-sing ê tsit-ê tāi-tsì ná ē ìng-giām?
English: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?

Tailo: Tse ē bîng-lí ê lâng lóng ē liáu-kái, tit-tio̍h tì-sik ê lâng lóng lia̍h-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t.
English: They are all plain to him who understands, Right to those who find knowledge.

Tailo: Taⁿ ông nā lia̍h-tsò hó, tshiánn tshâ-khó ông tī Babúlông ê kok-khò͘, khuànn Ko-le-si ông kó-jiân ū kàng-tsiàu tī Êlúsalèm khí Siōngtè hit king tiān á-bô. Tshiánn ông tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì kàng tsí lâi kā guán tsí-sī.
English: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem; and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.

Tailo: Lán nā kóng ka-kī bô tsuē, sī teh khi-phiàn ka-kī, lán ê sim-lāi tsiū bô tsin-lí.
English: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Tailo: Ji̍t-sî, ji̍t-thâu bē siong-tio̍h lí; àm-sî, gue̍h-niû mā bē hāi lí.
English: The sun will not harm you by day, Nor the moon by night.

Tailo: Suaⁿ-thâu in-uī I tín-tāng, suaⁿ-niá mā lóng siau-iûⁿ, tāi-tē tī I ê bīn-tsîng phòng khí-.lâi, sè-kài kah tiàm tī hit tiong-kan ê mā sī án-ne.
English: The mountains quake before him, and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, yes, the world, and all who dwell in it.

Tailo: Lín tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ puē-gi̍k, kám sī ài koh siū phah? Lín ê muá thâu-khak í-king thàng-thiàⁿ, muá-sim í-king sue-jio̍k.
English: Why should you be beaten more, That you revolt more and more? The whole head is sick, And the whole heart faint.

Tailo: Lí beh tsia̍h, tsóng-.sī, tsia̍h bē pá; lí ê khang-hi ē tī lí lāi-bīn. Lí ē puaⁿ-suá, tsóng-.sī, an-jiân tuà mi̍h-kiāⁿ khì; lí só͘ tuà-.khì ê, Guá lóng beh kau hō͘ to-kiàm.
English: You shall eat, but not be satisfied. Your humiliation will be in your midst. You will store up, but not save; And that which you save I will give up to the sword.

Tailo: Siōngtsú bat tshut bīng-līng, kóng-tio̍h Asiul lâng, I kóng, Sio̍k lí ê lâng it-tīng bô koh thuân tsíng; Guá beh tuì lí ê sîn-bîng ê biō lāi tû-bia̍t tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng kah tsù-tsō ê siōng; Guá beh kā lí tsún-pī hûn-bōng, in-uī lí sī pi-tsiān.
English: Yahweh has commanded concerning you: No more descendants will bear your name. Out of the house of your gods, will I cut off the engraved image and the molten image. I will make your grave, for you are vile.

Tailo: I tiàu hiah-ê tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng lâi, tsū-tsi̍p tī tang pîng khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi,
English: He brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the broad place on the east,

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne bīng-līng Mô͘se, i tsiū tī Si-nái ê khòng-iá tiám-sǹg jîn-kháu.
English: As Yahweh commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.

Tailo: Guān hit mê thiⁿ-phú-kng ê tsheⁿ piàn o͘-àm; guān i ǹg-bāng thiⁿ-kng mā bē-tàng, mā bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsá-khí sî ê thiⁿ-phú-kng;
English: Let the stars of the twilight of it be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, Neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,

Tailo: Kàu hiah-ê ji̍t liáu-āu, Siōngtsú tiān ê suaⁿ beh kiàn-li̍p tī tsiah-ê suaⁿ ê tíng-bīn, puâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū ê suaⁿ-niá; bān-kok lóng ē lâi kui-sūn.
English: It shall happen in the latter days, that the mountain of Yahweh's house shall be established on the top of the mountains, And shall be raised above the hills; And all nations shall flow to it.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan kiàn-nā sim ū tì-huī ê, lóng tio̍h lâi tsò Siōngtsú it-tshè só͘ huan-hù ê,
English: Let every wise-hearted man among you come, and make all that Yahweh has commanded:

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê lâng, Lí kám ē khui lí ê ba̍k-tsiu khuànn i? Koh tshuā guá siū Lí ê sím-phuàⁿ?
English: Do you open your eyes on such a one, And bring me into judgment with you?

Tailo: Lín tio̍h lâu kàu pún gue̍h tsa̍p-sì ji̍t, hông-hun ê sî, Isulael tsuân-huē tsìng lâng lóng tio̍h thâi iûⁿ-á.
English: and you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month; and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at evening.

Tailo: Siōngtsú khuànn Leah bô tit-tio̍h Iâkop ê thiàⁿ, tsiū hō͘ i huâi-īn; to̍k-to̍k La̍h-khel bô.
English: Yahweh saw that Leah was hated, and he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.

Tailo: Lín tsò tāi-tsì nā kah Guá huán-tuì, m̄-khíng tsun-thàn Guá, Guá tsiū beh tsiàu lín só͘ tsò ê ke-thinn tshit puē kàng tsai-hō hō͘ lín.
English: If you walk contrary to me, and won't listen to me, then I will bring seven times more plagues on you according to your sins.

Tailo: Lán ē tit-tio̍h ta̍k tsióng ê tsâi-bu̍t, kā só͘ tshiúⁿ ê tún-muá lán ê tshù.
English: We'll find all valuable wealth. We'll fill our houses with spoil.

Tailo: In-uī lín sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî, Siōngtè ū tshe I ê Kiáⁿ ê Sìng Sîn ji̍p-khì lín ê sim, hō͘ lín tuā-siaⁿ kiò, A-pa, Thiⁿ-pē ah!
English: And because you are children, God sent out the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father!

Tailo: Lí sī iá-lî, kuàn-sì tī khòng-iá, io̍k-sim huat-tōng, tsiū khip hong; siáu ê sî, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng tsó͘-tsí i? Kiàn-nā teh tshuē i ê, m̄-bián lô-khó͘; tī i hit gue̍h it-tīng ē tshuē-.tio̍h.
English: a wild donkey used to the wilderness, that snuffs up the wind in her desire; in her occasion who can turn her away? all those who seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā I kóng, Lí ê lāu-bú kah hiann-tī khiā tī guā-bīn, ài beh kìnn Lí.
English: It was told him by some saying, Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.

Tailo: Īng tì-huī tsò tāi-tsì ê tshe-īng ē tit-tio̍h ông ê un-huī; tsí ū pāi-ke ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h siū-khì.
English: The king's favor is toward a servant who deals wisely, But his wrath is toward one who causes shame.

Tailo: I mā sī ū siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tsó͘-sian, in-uī in m̄-nā ū siū kat-lé, mā ū kin-tuè lán ê tsó͘-sian Abulahàm iáu-buē siū kat-lé í-tsîng to̍h ū ê sìn-sim, īng i tsò bô͘-huān teh sing-ua̍h.
English: The father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had in uncircumcision.

Tailo: I ê jîn-sîn puē-puān i, tī ông-kiong lāi kā i thâi-sí.
English: His servants conspired against him, and put him to death in his own house.

Tailo: Guá ê tuì-ti̍k kui ji̍t huí-pòng guá; thòng-hūn guá ê lâng kí guá lâi tsiù-tsó͘.
English: My enemies reproach me all day. Those who are mad at me use my name as a curse.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī Lí ê huat sìng-tē tuā siū-khì; in-uī Lí kā guá kí-khí, koh kā guá hiat lo̍h-.khì.
English: Because of your indignation and your wrath, For you have taken me up, and thrown me away.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hueh m̄-thang tsia̍h, tio̍h piàⁿ tī tē-.ni̍h, tshin-tshiūnn teh piàⁿ tsuí.
English: Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h sìn guá tī Thiⁿ-pē lāi-bīn, Thiⁿ-pē tī guá lāi-bīn. Nā bô, mā tio̍h in-uī guá só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì lâi sìn.
English: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works' sake.

Tailo: Tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī kah guá tông-tsāi, I bô pàng guá ka-kī tsi̍t-ê, in-uī guá put-sî teh tsò I só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì.
English: He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn't left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ huan-hù lí ê, lí tio̍h tsip-siú. Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tuì lí ê bīn-tsîng kuáⁿ-tshut Amô͘lī, Ka-nân, Hiat, Pe-lí-ji, Hi-bī kah I-é-bú-suh hiah-ê tso̍k.
English: Observe that which I command you this day. Behold, I drive out before you the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ pē-bú tshiau-kuè thiàⁿ guá ê lâng, bô tsu-keh tsò guá ê bûn-tô͘; thiàⁿ kiáⁿ-jî tshiau-kuè thiàⁿ guá ê lâng, mā bô tsu-keh tsò guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn't worthy of me.

Tailo: Kiû lí ín-tsún, lán thang tī tshiûⁿ tíng khí tsi̍t king sè-king pâng, tī hia kā i an-tì bîn-tshn̂g, toh, í kah ting-tâi, hō͘ i lâi lán tsia, thang ji̍p-khì hioh-khùn.
English: Let us make, Please, a little chamber on the wall; and let us set for him there a bed, and a table, and a seat, and a lamp stand: and it shall be, when he comes to us, that he shall turn in there.

Tailo: Tī Bethel hiah-ê sian-ti ê ha̍k-sing tshut-lâi kìnn Elísiah, kā i kóng, Siōngtsú kin-á-ji̍t beh tshú lí ê lāu-su lī-khui lí khì, lí kám tsai? I kóng, Sī, guá tsai, lín mài tshut siaⁿ.
English: The sons of the prophets who were at Bethel came forth to Elisha, and said to him, Do you know that Yahweh will take away your master from your head today? He said, Yes, I know it; hold your peace.

Tailo: Lí hē guān nā bô siā guān, lîng-khó bô hē.
English: It is better that you should not vow, than that you should vow and not pay.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì Hiat lâng Ahiméli̍k kah Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap ê hiann-tī Abisai kóng, Siáⁿ lâng beh kah guá lo̍h-.khì, kàu iâⁿ-pâng, kàu Sàulô hia? Abisai kóng, Guá kah lí lo̍h-.khì.
English: Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp? Abishai said, I will go down with you.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Guá sī uī-tio̍h Guá ê miâ ê iân-kò͘ teh tsò tāi-tsì, bián-tit Guá ê miâ tī lia̍t pang lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng siū siat-to̍k, to̍h-sī hiah-ê ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p ê lia̍t pang.
English: But I worked for my name's sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I brought them out.

Tailo: Lín kám ē phian-thán I? Beh uī Siōngtè piān-hō͘?
English: Will you show partiality to him? Will you contend for God?

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng khi-phiàn.
English: Don't be deceived, my beloved brothers.

Tailo: Ì-hiòng jio̍k-thé ê kiat-kó sī sí, ì-hiòng Sìng Sîn ê kiat-kó sī ua̍h-miā kah pîng-an.
English: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace;

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú hō͘ Iosiúah tī Isulael jîn-bîn ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tsò tuā. Τī i it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí, jîn-bîn kìng-uì i, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng kìng-uì Mô͘se.
English: On that day Yahweh magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel; and they feared him, as they feared Moses, all the days of his life.

Tailo: Tī lín tiong-kan ū huí-pòng lâng kah beh hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê; tī lín tiong-kan ū tī suaⁿ tíng tsia̍h tsè-mi̍h, tī lín tiong-kan ū kiânn kan-îm.
English: Slanderous men have been in you to shed blood; and in you they have eaten on the mountains: in the midst of you they have committed lewdness.

Tailo: Kiâⁿ kīn I-é-bú-suh ê sî, ji̍t í-king beh lo̍h suaⁿ, lô͘-po̍k kā tsú-lâng kóng, Lâi, lán put-jû uat ji̍p-khì I-é-bú-suh lâng tsit-ê siâⁿ, tī hia hioh mê.
English: When they were by Jebus, the day was far spent; and the servant said to his master, Please come and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites, and lodge in it.

Tailo: Tng i hó-gia̍h tshiong-tsiok ê sî, ē kàu e̍h tsiⁿ-tsiⁿ ê só͘-tsāi; kan-khó͘ ê lâng lóng ē tshut-tshiú kā i phah.
English: In the fullness of his sufficiency, distress shall overtake him: The hand of everyone who is in misery shall come on him.

Tailo: I tuì hia khì phah tuà tī Te-bil ê jîn-bîn; Te-bil í-tsîng ê miâ kiò-tsò Ki-lia̍t-se-hut.
English: From there he went against the inhabitants of Debir. (Now the name of Debir before was Kiriath Sepher.)

Tailo: Jiânāu thiⁿ-sài kā guá kóng, Lí tio̍h siá lo̍h-.lâi, siū iau-tshiáⁿ lâi hù iûⁿ-ko hun-iàn ê lâng, tsin ū hok-khì. I koh kā guá kóng, Tse sī Siōngtè tsin-si̍t ê uē.
English: He said to me, Write, Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb.' He said to me, These are true words of God.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h án-ne khuán-thāi in, iông-ín in ua̍h-.leh, khióng-kiaⁿ lán uī-tio̍h tuì in só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê siū-khì lîm-kàu tī lán.
English: This we will do to them, and let them live; lest wrath be on us, because of the oath which we swore to them.

Tailo: I tsiū khì hō͘ hit só͘-tsāi ê tsi̍t-ê lâng tshiàⁿ, hit-ê lâng tshe i khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê hn̂g tshī ti.
English: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

Tailo: Mā ū lâng thí-tshiò in kóng, In sī lim sin tsiú teh tsuì.
English: Others, mocking, said, They are filled with new wine.

Tailo: Guá tuì i kóng, Lí tio̍h kah guá ka-kī tuà tsē-tsē ji̍t, m̄-thang khì kiâⁿ kan-îm, mā m̄-thang tuè pa̍t lâng khì, guá mā ē án-ne tuì-thāi lí.
English: I said to her, You shall stay with me many days. You shall not play the prostitute, and you shall not be with any other man. I will also be so toward you.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Iésu tī ta̍k hong-bīn lóng tio̍h kah hiann-tī tsí-muē kāng-khuán, tsiah ē-tàng tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, tsò jîn-tsû koh tiong-si̍t ê tuā-tsè-si, thang hō͘ tsìng lâng ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people.

Tailo: Bô kah tsi̍t-ê ū huat-tō͘ sio̍k-huê ka-kī ê hiann-tī, mā bē-tàng īng tsînn tuì Siōngtè sio̍k-huê sèⁿ-miā.
English: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, Nor give God a ransom for him.

Tailo: Kàu thiⁿ-kng tsiū kiò bûn-tô͘ lâi, tuì in tiong-kan kíng-suán tsa̍p-jī lâng, tshing in tsò sù-tô͘,
English: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:

Tailo: Lâng uī-tio̍h lí khuàⁿ hi-ké ê ī-siōng, kiânn pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsiam-pok, kā lí hē tī siū tāng-siong pháiⁿ lâng ê ām-kún. In ê tsuē-ok kuàn-buán, in ê ji̍t-tsí kàu à.
English: while they see for you false visions, while they divine lies to you, to lay you on the necks of the wicked who are deadly wounded, whose day is come in the time of the iniquity of the end.

Tailo: Αpsalôm só͘ tshiánn hit nn̄g pah lâng kah i tuì Êlúsalèm khì, hiah-ê lâng lóng sī bô-ì-tiong khì ê, m̄-tsai hit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: With Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, who were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they didn't know anything.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Asiul ông m̄-sī tsit khuán ì-sù, i ê sim mā m̄-sī tsit-ê phah-sǹg. I ê sim-lāi tian-tò siūⁿ beh huí-bia̍t, siūⁿ beh tsâu-bia̍t tsin tsē kok.
English: However he doesn't mean so, neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.

Tailo: Tshù-the̍h tsâi-sán sī tsó͘-sian só͘ lâu ê, to̍k-to̍k hiân-huī ê bó͘ sī Siōngtsú só͘ sù.
English: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, But a prudent wife is from Yahweh.

Tailo: Isulael lâng, taⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ài lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám m̄-sī to̍k-to̍k ài lí kìng-uì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, kiânn I it-tshè ê tō-lō͘, thiàⁿ I, tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè,
English: Now, Israel, what does Yahweh your God require of you, but to fear Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul,

Tailo: I nā khan tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-á tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê lé-mi̍h, tsiū tio̍h khan tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê iûⁿ-bó.
English: If he brings a lamb as his offering for a sin offering, he shall bring a female without blemish.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Tsiah-ê kài-bīng guá tsū sè-hàn to̍h lóng ū teh tsun-siú.
English: He said, I have observed all these things from my youth up.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kok ê bua̍t-ji̍t lîm-kàu ê sî, lâng ê tsuē-ok kuàn-buán, tsiū ē ū tsi̍t-ê ông hing-khí, bīn-māu hiong-ok, gâu īng kuí-tsà ê uē.
English: In the latter time of their kingdom, when the transgressors are come to the full, a king of fierce face, and understanding dark sentences, shall stand up.

Tailo: In tuâⁿ khîm, tuâⁿ sik, pûn kó͘-tshue, tńg-lâi Êlúsalèm, lâi-kàu Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: They came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets to the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá khì lín hia, nā kan-taⁿ kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē, bô thuân-káng Siōngtè ê khé-sī, tì-sik, sìn-sit á-.sī kà-sī, án-ne, tuì lín ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik?
English: But now, brothers, if I come to you speaking with other languages, what would I profit you, unless I speak to you either by way of revelation, or of knowledge, or of prophesying, or of teaching?

Tailo: Lí ê tsîⁿ-tsâi, á-.sī lí it-tshè ê sè-li̍k, kám ū hāu-giām hō͘ lí bô tú-tio̍h huān-lān?
English: Would your wealth sustain you in distress, Or all the might of your strength?

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi ê tsìng lâng lóng tsū-tsi̍p, jiok in; in jiok Iosiúah, tsiū siū ín-iú lī-khui in ê siâⁿ.
English: All the people who were in the city were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.

Tailo: Iâkop kiâⁿ kàu Su-kot, tī hia uī ka-kī khí tshù, uī tsing-seⁿ tah tsháu-liâu, só͘-í, kā hit só͘-tsāi hō-tsò Su-kot.
English: Jacob traveled to Succoth, built himself a house, and made shelters for his livestock. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.

Tailo: tuì in kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī lín tshe guá kàu I ê bīn-tsîng, lâi hiàn lín só͘ kiû ê, I án-ne kóng,
English: and said to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before him:

Tailo: In tsò-hué kóng, Lán tuì lán ê sió-tī si̍t-tsāi ū tsuē. I ai-kiû lán ê sî, lán ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h i sim-lāi ê kan-khó͘, mā m̄-khíng thiaⁿ i ê uē; só͘-í, tsit tiûⁿ khó͘-lān tsiah ē lîm-kàu lán.
English: They said one to another, We are certainly guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul, when he begged us, and we wouldn't listen. Therefore this distress has come upon us.

Tailo: Kàu Isulael lâng ê hí-nî, in ê sán-gia̍p tsiū ke-thinn tī in só͘ beh sio̍k ê tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p; án-ne, in ê sán-gia̍p to̍h-sī tuì guán tsó͘-sian tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p puah kuè-.khì.
English: When the jubilee of the children of Israel shall be, then will their inheritance be added to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong: so will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘ Lēbī lâng ê siâⁿ, tsóng-kiōng sì-tsa̍p-peh-ê; siâⁿ kah kau-iá, lóng tio̍h hō͘ in.
English: All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities; them shall you give with their suburbs.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: Then came the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: Mā m̄-sī tī hái-guā, tì-sú lí kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng uī guán kuè hái tuà-lâi guán tsia, hō͘ guán thiaⁿ lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ? '
English: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?

Tailo: Siú ti̍k-pia̍t ji̍t-tsí ê lâng sī uī-tio̍h Tsú lâi siú, ta̍k hāng lóng tsia̍h ê lâng mā sī uī-tio̍h Tsú lâi tsia̍h, in-uī i kám-siā Siōngtè. Bô ta̍k hāng tsia̍h ê lâng mā sī uī-tio̍h Tsú lâi bô tsia̍h, i mā kāng-khuán kám-siā Siōngtè.
English: He who observes the day, observes it to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He who eats, eats to the Lord, for he gives God thanks. He who doesn't eat, to the Lord he doesn't eat, and gives God thanks.

Tailo: Lâng nā beh kah lí tâm-lūn, lí ē khì-hiâm thó-ià bē? Tsóng-.sī, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng ka-kī iok-sok bô kóng-uē?
English: If someone ventures to talk with you, will you be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?

Tailo: jî-tshiánn Iétsebel ê sin-si ē tī E-tsu-le-el ê hn̂g tshin-tshiūnn pùn tī thô͘-bīn, tì-sú lâng bô beh kóng tse sī Iétsebel. '
English: and the body of Jezebel shall be as dung on the face of the field in the portion of Jezreel, so that they shall not say, This is Jezebel.

Tailo: Beh bong i ê lâng, tio̍h īng thih-khì kah tshiuⁿ-pèⁿ, tī i ê só͘-tsāi beh hō͘ hué tsuân-pō͘ sio-.khì.
English: But the man who touches them Must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear: They shall be utterly burned with fire in their place

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h tsip-siú tsin ê tì-huī kah kè-uē; m̄-thang hō͘ in lī-khui lí ê ba̍k-tsiu.
English: My son, let them not depart from your eyes. Keep sound wisdom and discretion:

Tailo: I hō͘ lâng siū khó͘, iu-būn, m̄-sī I só͘ kam-sim tsîng-guān ê.
English: For he does not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of men.

Tailo: Guá sī tsìng sìn-tô͘ tiong-kan siōng bî-sè-.ê, kìng-jiân tit-tio̍h tsit-ê un-tián, thang kā Ki-tok sǹg bē-liáu ê hong-sīng hok-im thuân hō͘ guā-pang lâng.
English: To me, the very least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kàm-la̍p guá ê tshuì só͘ huann-hí hiàn ê o-ló, koh kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá.
English: Accept, I beg you, the willing offerings of my mouth. Yahweh, teach me your ordinances.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tshut līng, huan-hù guá só͘ kuán-hat ê kok ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h tī Taniel ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, in-uī I sī ua̍h ê Siōngtè, kú-tn̂g tsûn-tsāi, I ê kok íng-uán bē bia̍t-bông; I ê kuân-pìng bô kiông bô tsīn!
English: I make a decree, that in all the dominion of my kingdom men tremble and fear before the God of Daniel; for he is the living God, and steadfast forever, His kingdom that which shall not be destroyed; and his dominion shall be even to the end.

Tailo: I phâng khì hō͘ i tsia̍h, i tsiū khiú i, kā i kóng, Guá ê sió-muē, lí lâi kah guá tsò-hué khùn.
English: When she had brought them near to him to eat, he took hold of her, and said to her, Come, lie with me, my sister.

Tailo: Hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng lim hit-ê tsuí liáu-āu, i nā bô tshing-khì tik-tsuē i ê tiōng-hu, tsit-ê tì-sú tsiù-tsó͘ ê tsuí beh ji̍p-khì i ê lāi-bīn, tsiâⁿ-tsò khó͘, i ê pak-tó͘ tsiū ē kó͘-tiòng, tuā-thuí tsiū ē nuā, hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū ē tī i ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan tsiâⁿ-tsò tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē-pèⁿ.
English: When he has made her drink the water, then it shall happen, if she is defiled, and has committed a trespass against her husband, that the water that causes the curse will enter into her and become bitter, and her body will swell, and her thigh will fall away: and the woman will be a curse among her people.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán tsia ū hiann-tī tshit lâng. Tuā-hiaⁿ tshuā bó͘ liáu tsiū sí-.khì, bô kiáⁿ, kā i e bó͘ pàng hō͘ i ê sió-tī.
English: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and having no seed left his wife to his brother.

Tailo: Keh tńg nî, Nepkatnetsal tshe lâng tuà i kah Siōngtsú tiān lāi hiah-ê pó-puè ê khì-kū lâi-kàu Babúlông, tsiū siat-li̍p i ê a-tsik Tsetikiah tsò Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm ê ông.
English: At the return of the year king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of Yahweh, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sim só͘ gí-tiāⁿ ê iáu-buē tsò, iáu-buē tsiânn, I ê siū-khì it-tīng bô tò-tńg, ji̍t-āu lín ē thiat-té bîng-pi̍k.
English: The anger of Yahweh shall not return, until he has executed, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days you shall understand it perfectly.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, Lín tī tē-tsiūⁿ só͘ kìm-tsí ê, tī thinn-tíng mā ē kā i kìm-tsí. Lín tī tē-tsiūⁿ ín-tsún ê, tī thinn-tíng mā ē kā i ín-tsún.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, whatever things you will bind on earth will be have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you will release on earth will have been released in heaven.

Tailo: Guān Alông ê ke kóng: I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi!
English: Let the house of Aaron now say That his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū tuì Isulael ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ kóng, Kiàn-nā sio̍k lín ê lâng, ū kah Baal-pau-al liân-ha̍p ê, lín tio̍h kā i thâi-sí.
English: Moses said to the judges of Israel, Kill you everyone his men who have joined themselves to Baal Peor.

Tailo: Koh hō͘ i kah Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k, A-hi-sat-buat ê kiáⁿ A-ho-li-ia̍p, sim ū lîng-khiàu, ē kà-sī lâng.
English: He has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

Tailo: Só͘-í, i ing-kai uī-tio̍h pún-sin, tshin-tshiūnn i uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê tsuē lâi hiàn tsè.
English: Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself.

Tailo: Ná ē ū lāu-bú ê kha-thâu-u tsiap-la̍p guá? Án-tsuáⁿ ū ling hō͘ guá suh?
English: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should suck?

Tailo: Guá kî-tó ê uē kóng iáu-buē uân, guá khí-thâu tī ī-siōng tiong só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng — Ga-bu-li-el, hōng bīng-līng kuáⁿ-kín pue-.lâi, tsha-put-to tī hiàn ê-hng-tsè ê sî, lâi bong guá.
English: yes, while I was speaking in prayer, the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about the time of the evening offering.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn hiann-tī tsí-muē kè-sio̍k sio-thiànn.
English: Let brotherly love continue.

Tailo: In m̄-thang koh hiàn tsè tī in kiânn siâ-îm só͘ tsun-thàn ê kuí-kuài; tse beh tsò in ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.'

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē hō͘ tshing-khì ê tuì bô tshing-khì ê tshut-.lâi? Bô tsi̍t-ê ē.
English: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one.

Tailo: Páulô kóng Í-āu lín bē-tàng koh kìⁿ-tio̍h guá ê bīn , tsit kù uē hō͘ in hui-siông siong-sim. Liáu-āu in tsiū sàng i tsiūⁿ tsûn.
English: sorrowing most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū tshit-bān sì-tshing la̍k-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of them, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.

Tailo: Siōngtè koh tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí kám ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h in só͘ tsò ê? Tsiū-sī Isulael ê jîn-bîn tī tsia só͘ kiâⁿ tuā khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ Guá lī-khui Guá ê sìng-só͘ hn̄g-hn̄g. Tsóng-.sī, lí koh khuànn, iáu ū koh khah tuā khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: He said to me, Son of man, see you what they do? even the great abominations that the house of Israel do commit here, that I should go far off from my sanctuary? but you shall again see yet other great abominations.

Tailo: Tuì kó͘-tsá í-lâi, m̄-bat thiaⁿ-kuè ū lâng hō͘ tshut-sì to̍h tsheⁿ-mê ê lâng ē koh khuànn-kìnn.
English: Since the world began it has never been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Lín hiàn ka-kī hō͘ Siōngtsú, ta̍k lâng kong-kik i ê kiáⁿ kah i ê hiann-tī, kin-á-ji̍t tit-tio̍h Siōngtsú kā lín sù-hok.
English: Moses said, Consecrate yourselves today to Yahweh, yes, every man against his son, and against his brother; that he may bestow on you a blessing this day.

Tailo: Siú-bōng ê lâng ìn kóng, Tsá-khí sî teh beh kàu, o͘-àm mê mā beh lâi. Lí nā beh mn̄g tsiū thang mn̄g; thang huê-thâu koh lâi mn̄g.
English: The watchman said, The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire. Come back again.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī īng ji̍t-thâu lâi kuán ji̍t-sî ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: The sun to rule by day; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Tng hit ji̍t, tī hî mn̂g ē ū pi-ai ê siann, tuì tē-jī-ê só͘-tsāi ē ū tuā-siaⁿ huah, tuì tsiah-ê suaⁿ ē ū tuā pang-hām ê siann.
English: In that day, says Yahweh, there will be the noise of a cry from the fish gate, a wailing from the second quarter, and a great crashing from the hills.

Tailo: Guá beh tī bô tsháu ê suaⁿ khui kang-hô, tī suaⁿ-kok tiong khui tsuí-tsuâⁿ; Guá beh hō͘ sua-bô͘ piàn-tsò tsuí-tî, hō͘ ta tē piàn-tsò tsuí-tsuâⁿ.
English: I will open rivers on the bare heights, And springs in the midst of the valleys. I will make the wilderness a pool of water, And the dry land springs of water.

Tailo: Guá beh kóng-khí Siōngtsú ê tsok-uî; siàu-liām I tsá-tsîng ê sîn-jiah.
English: I will remember Yah's deeds; For I will remember your wonders of old.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí tio̍h tsai, mā tio̍h phah-sǹg, khuànn lí beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò; in-uī ū tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh hāi guán ê tsú-lâng kah i ê tsuân ke. I ê sìng-tsîng hiong-ok, bô lâng káⁿ kah i kóng-uē.
English: Now therefore know and consider what you will do; for evil is determined against our master, and against all his house: for he is such a worthless fellow that one can't speak to him.

Tailo: Án-ne, Nimsī ê sun, Iô-sa-huat ê kiáⁿ E-hú puē-puān Io-lâm. Io-lâm kah Isulael jîn-bîn bat pé-siú Gilia̍t ê La̍h-mot, in-uī Alâm ông Hatsael ê iân-kò͘;
English: So Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. (Now Joram was keeping Ramoth Gilead, he and all Israel, because of Hazael king of Syria;

Tailo: In-uī lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ lóng tī Siōngtsú ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng; I mā siu pêⁿ lâng só͘-ū ê lō͘.
English: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Yahweh. He examines all his paths.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in bô lī-khui Ia-lô-ba-am ê ke ê tsuē, to̍h-sī hō͘ Isulael lâng huān tsuē ê, iû-guân án-ne khì kiâⁿ; Sa-má-lī-a ê A-si-lah iáu lâu-.leh.
English: Nevertheless they didn't depart from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin, but walked therein: and there remained the Asherah also in Samaria.)

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì To-hu-teh, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tshe i khì thuân bīng-līng ê só͘-tsāi, tò tńg-.lâi, khiā tī Siōngtsú ê tiān ê īⁿ lāi, tuì kûn-tsiòng kóng,
English: Then came Jeremiah from Topheth, where Yahweh had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of Yahweh's house, and said to all the people:

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng tsiū tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tsiàu in ê lâng-gia̍h tuì thiàu-bú ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tiong-kan só͘ lia̍h ê lâi tshuā in tsò bó͘, tsiū tò tńg-khì in pún-tē, koh khí siâⁿ lâi tuà tī hia.
English: The children of Benjamin did so, and took them wives, according to their number, of those who danced, whom they carried off: and they went and returned to their inheritance, and built the cities, and lived in them.

Tailo: Tē-sì ji̍t tio̍h hiàn gû-káng-á tsa̍p tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsa̍p-sì tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: I tuì in kóng, Kim-mê lín hioh tsia; tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù guá ê, guá ē kā lín huê-hok. Mô͘ap ê siú-líng tsiū hioh tī Palân hia.
English: He said to them, Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as Yahweh shall speak to me: and the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.

Tailo: Khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah ê tshiàⁿ-kang lâng, bô-lūn sī lí ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tshut-guā lâng tuà tī lí ê tē, tī lí ê siâⁿ mn̂g lāi ê, lí m̄-thang kā i khi-hū.
English: You shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether he be of your brothers, or of your foreigners who are in your land within your gates:

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu ua̍t tńg-sin khuànn bûn-tô͘, tsiū tsik-pī Piattò͘ kóng, Satán, siám-khui! Lí só͘ siūⁿ ê m̄-sī Siōngtè ê tāi-tsì, sī lâng ê tāi-tsì.
English: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guán pún-sin beh tuà kun-khì, kiânn tī Isulael lâng ê thâu-tsîng, thìng-hāu guán tshuā in kàu in ê só͘-tsāi; in-uī tuà tsit-ê tē ê jîn-bîn ê iân-kò͘, to̍k-to̍k guán ê gín-á ē tuà tī kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ lāi.
English: but we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them to their place: and our little ones shall dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.

Tailo: Iôtah tuì tsiah-ê hiann-tī kóng, Lán thâi-sí lán ê sió-tī, ún-ba̍t i ê hueh, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik?
English: Judah said to his brothers, What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?

Tailo: Tang pîng ê kài kàu Ioltàn hô. Tse sī Biāniámín lâng ê sán-gia̍p, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, in sì-kho͘-uî ê kau-kài.
English: The Jordan was the border of it on the east quarter. This was the inheritance of the children of Benjamin, by the borders of it round about, according to their families.

Tailo: In-uī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Tsiong-lâi tī tsit só͘-tsāi, lâng ē koh bé tshù-the̍h, tshân-hn̂g kah phû-tô hn̂g.
English: For thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Houses and fields and vineyards shall yet again be bought in this land.

Tailo: tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò kng mi̍h-kiāⁿ ê kang ê,
English: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered in to do the work of service, and the work of bearing burdens in the Tent of Meeting,

Tailo: Siōngtè tshe I to̍k-seⁿ ê Kiáⁿ lâi-kàu sè-kan, hō͘ lán tuì I lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā. Siōngtè īng án-ne tuì lán hián-bîng I ê thiàⁿ tī lán tiong-kan.
English: By this was God's love revealed in us, that God has sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.

Tailo: īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì bé kah khiâ bé ê; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì tsiàn-tshia kah tsē tī hit tíng-bīn ê lâng;
English: and with you will I break in pieces the horse and his rider;

Tailo: Hit-ê jiám-tio̍h tsìng-thâu ê saⁿ-khò͘, á-.sī king, sī huī, sī iûⁿ-mn̂g, sī tē-pò͘ á-.sī phuê tsò ê mi̍h, i lóng tio̍h sio-tiāu, in-uī tse sī ok ê thái-ko, it-tīng tī hué tiong sio-tiāu.
English: He shall burn the garment, whether the warp or the woof, in wool or in linen, or anything of skin, in which the plague is: for it is a destructive mildew. It shall be burned in the fire.

Tailo: I koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h pau Iésu thâu-khak ê kin, bô kah iù-tē pò͘ hē tsò-hué, kńg teh līng-guā hē.
English: and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsin tsē Hua-lí-sái phài kah Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng lâi beh hō͘ i sé-lé, tsiū kā in kóng, Lín tsiah-ê to̍k-tsuâ, siáⁿ lâng kíng-kò lín siám-phiah Siōngtè teh beh huat ê siū-khì?
English: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Sî-ji̍t teh beh kàu, lín tsin ài khuàⁿ-tio̍h Jîn-tsú lâi-lîm ê hit ji̍t, lín mā khuànn bē-tio̍h.
English: He said to the disciples, The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

Tailo: Iésu kiáu thô͘ lâi khui i ê ba̍k-tsiu ê ji̍t sī An-hioh-ji̍t.
English: It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá só͘ siū ê uan-óng, kiû Lí kā guá phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: Yahweh, you have seen my wrong; judge you my cause.

Tailo: Lâng nā kah i ê tsím-ḿ su-thong, to̍h-sī lîng-jio̍k i ê tsik-peh; in tio̍h tam-tng in ka-kī ê tsuē, ē tsi̍t-sì-lâng bô kiáⁿ.
English: If a man lies with his uncle's wife, he has uncovered his uncle's nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.

Tailo: Tsit nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hō͘ Ísak kah Li-bé-kah sim-lāi tuā iu-būn.
English: They grieved Isaac's and Rebekah's spirits.

Tailo: Guá ê tsú ah, Siōngtsú kì-jiân kìm-tsí lí huān-tio̍h thâi-sí-lâng ê tsuē, īng lí ê tshiú pò ka-kī ê siû-ti̍k, só͘-í, guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú kah lí ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā kóng: Guān lí ê tuì-ti̍k kah kè-bô͘ hāi guá ê tsú ê, lóng tshin-tshiūnn Nabal. '
English: Now therefore, my lord, as Yahweh lives, and as your soul lives, seeing Yahweh has withheld you from blood guiltiness, and from avenging yourself with your own hand, now therefore let your enemies, and those who seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.

Tailo: In-uī Lí sī hō͘ guá ū khuì-la̍t ê Siōngtè, Lí ná ē pàng-sak guá? Guá sī án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h in-uī tuì-ti̍k ê ap-pik, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ iu-būn, kiâⁿ lâi kiâⁿ khì?
English: For you are the God of my strength. Why have you rejected me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

Tailo: Ahap kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê kah i só͘ khí tshiūⁿ-gê ê tshù, í-ki̍p só͘ khí só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, kám bô kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, and the ivory house which he built, and all the cities that he built, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: In tsiū tshuā i lâi Iésu hia. Hit-ê kuí tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu, tsiū suî-sî hō͘ hit-ê gín-á tuā thiu-tshuah, kā i siak lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha, hō͘ i liàn-lâi liàn-khì koh lâu-nuā.
English: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

Tailo: Sìn-si̍t tuì tē-.ni̍h huat-sing; kong-gī tuì thiⁿ kàng lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Truth springs out of the earth. Righteousness has looked down from heaven.

Tailo: I hō͘ hô͘-sîn kui tīn kàu in tiong-kan lâi kā in tsam, koh hō͘ tshân-kap-á lâi kā in sún-hāi.
English: He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them; And frogs, which destroyed them.

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ mn̂g hia ū sì-ê thái-ko ê, in tsò-hué kóng, Lán ná ē tsē tī tsia teh thìng-hāu sí?
English: Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die?

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Lâi! Piattò͘ tsiū tuì tsûn tíng lo̍h-.khì, kiânn tsuí-bīn lâi-kàu Iésu hia.
English: He said, Come! Peter stepped down from the boat, and walked on the waters to come to Jesus.

Tailo: Siōngtè hō͘ lán ū tsit-ê kái-piàn, I mā sù Sìng Sîn lâi tsò lán ê pó-tsìng.
English: Now he who made us for this very thing is God, who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit.

Tailo: M̄-thang kā lí ê tsing-li̍k tsuân-pō͘ hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng, lí ê só͘ tsò m̄-thang tsiàu hiah-ê pāi-huāi ê ông.
English: Don't give your strength to women, Nor your ways to that which destroys kings.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá tī huān-lān tiong kiû Lí lâi kàm-tshat. Guá ê sim-tn̂g kiáu-ká, guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn luān tshau-tshau, in-uī guá tuā-tuā puē-gi̍k. Tī guā-bīn, to-kiàm hō͘ lâng sí kiáⁿ; tī tshù lāi tshin-tshiūnn ū sí-sit.
English: See, Yahweh; for I am in distress; my heart is troubled; My heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: Abroad the sword bereaves, at home there is as death.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, guá beh tsuân-sim o-ló Lí; guá beh îng-kng Lí ê miâ kàu íng-uán.
English: I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole heart. I will glorify your name forevermore.

Tailo: Amô͘su ê kiáⁿ Isáiah só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h kuan-hē Babúlông ê bi̍k-sī.
English: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw:

Tailo: Bián-tit Guá kā i thǹg kng-kng, hō͘ i tshin-tshiūnn tú-á tshut-sì ê ji̍t, hō͘ i tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá, tshin-tshiūnn ta-sò ê tē, hō͘ i tuì tshuì-ta lâi sí.
English: Lest I strip her naked, And make her bare as in the day that she was born, And make her like a wilderness, And set her like a dry land, And kill her with thirst.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng m̄ sîng-jīn, kóng, Guá m̄-tsai lí teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: But he denied it before them all, saying, I don't know what you are talking about.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-tsíng lâng ē tuà tī Asito͘t; Guá beh tû-bia̍t Huilīsū lâng ê kiau-ngō͘.
English: Foreigners will dwell in Ashdod, And I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài tsiū khì, kā i hit uánn piàⁿ lo̍h-khì tē-tsiūⁿ, hiah-ê ū bíng-siù ê kì-hō kah pài i ê tsō-siōng ê lâng tsiū seⁿ tshàu koh to̍k ê tshng.
English: The first went, and poured out his bowl into the earth, and it became a harmful and evil sore on the people who had the mark of the beast, and who worshiped his image.

Tailo: I kàu-liān guá ê tshiú gâu kau-tsiàn, hō͘ guá ê tshiú-kut ē khui tâng ê kiong.
English: He teaches my hands to war; So that my arms bend a bow of bronze.

Tailo: I tio̍h khan gû-káng-á kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī gû-káng-á ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thâi hit tsiah gû-káng-á.
English: He shall bring the bull to the door of the Tent of Meeting before Yahweh; and he shall lay his hand on the head of the bull, and kill the bull before Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá beh uī-tio̍h guá só͘ tshin-ài ê lâng tshiùⁿ kua, sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng ê kua, sī kuan-hē i ê phû-tô hn̂g: Guá só͘ tshin-ài ê lâng ū phû-tô hn̂g, tī tsin puî ê suaⁿ-thâu.
English: Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard on a very fruitful hill.

Tailo: koh tuì siâⁿ lāi lia̍h tsi̍t-ê kuán ping-á ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ kah tī siâⁿ lāi só͘ tú-tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kìnn ông ê bīn ê tshit-ê lâng, kah kun-tiúⁿ ê su-kì, tiám-sǹg jîn-bîn ê, í-ki̍p siâⁿ tiong só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê jîn-bîn la̍k-tsa̍p lâng.
English: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and seven men of those who saw the king's face, who were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the midst of the city.

Tailo: nā ài tuì gû-kûn á-.sī iûⁿ-kûn hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò hué-tsè, to̍h-sī sio-tsè á-.sī pa̍t tsióng ê tsè, beh siā guān á-.sī tsò huann-hí hiàn ê tsè, á-.sī kàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tseh-kî, tsò phang-phang ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: and will make an offering by fire to Yahweh, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or as a freewill offering, or in your set feasts, to make a sweet savor to Yahweh, of the herd, or of the flock;

Tailo: Tú-tú hit ji̍t, Abulahàm kah i ê kiáⁿ Isimael tâng-siū kat-lé.
English: In the same day both Abraham and Ishmael, his son, were circumcised.

Tailo: Tabi̍t óng-lâi tī Sàulô ê só͘-tsāi, tī Bia̍tléhèm tshī in lāu-pē ê iûⁿ.
English: Now David went back and forth from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Bethlehem.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín nā si̍t-tsāi tsun-thàn Guá ê uē, tsun-siú Guá ê iok, lín tsiū ē tī lia̍t kok tiong tsò Guá ka-kī ê pó-puè, in-uī tsuân tē lóng sī Guá ê.
English: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice, and keep my covenant, then you shall be my own possession from among all peoples; for all the earth is mine;

Tailo: guán mā bô thiaⁿ Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè ê uē, lâi kiâⁿ I kau-thok I ê lô͘-po̍k —tsiah-ê sian-ti só͘ pâi-lia̍t tī guán ê bīn-tsîng ê lu̍t-huat.
English: neither have we obeyed the voice of Yahweh our God, to walk in his laws, which he set before us by his servants the prophets.

Tailo: Guān in ê tshuì o-ló Siōngtsú tsò kuân, in tshiú gia̍h siaam bīn lāi ê kiàm,
English: May the high praises of God be in their mouths, And a two-edged sword in their hand;

Tailo: kóng: M̄-thang bong-tio̍h guá siū buah-iû ê, mā m̄-thang pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guá ê sian-ti!
English: Saying, Don't touch my anointed ones, Do my prophets no harm.

Tailo: Īng ha̍p-gî ê uē ìn-tap, ná tshin-tshiūnn īng tshuì kā lâng tsim.
English: An honest answer Is like a kiss on the lips.

Tailo: （ Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun ê si-kua. ）Siōngtsú tsì-tuā, ing-kai tuā-tuā tit-tio̍h o-ló, to̍h-sī tī lán Siōngtè ê siâⁿ, tī I ê sìng-suaⁿ.
English: Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised, In the city of our God, in his holy mountain.

Tailo: Sa-má-lī-a tuā ki-hng, in uî-khùn siâⁿ, tì-sú tsi̍t-ê lî thâu ta̍t gîn peh-tsa̍p si-khel, kap-pùn tsi̍t khap ê sì-hūn tsi-it ta̍t gîn gō͘ si-khel.
English: There was a great famine in Samaria: and behold, they besieged it, until a donkey's head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a kab of dove's dung for five pieces of silver.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá beh tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí ê miâ kàu íng-uán; thang ji̍t-ji̍t siā guá ê guān.
English: So I will sing praise to your name forever, That I may fulfill my vows daily.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t ē ū ua̍h-tsuí tuì Êlúsalèm tshut-.lâi, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì tang-hái, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì se-hái; kuâⁿ-thiⁿ, jua̍h-thinn lóng sī án-ne.
English: It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter will it be.

Tailo: In nā kè Isulael pa̍t tsi-tso̍k ê lâng, in ê sán-gia̍p tsiū tuì guán tsó͘-sian só͘ lâu ê sán-gia̍p puah kuè-.khì, ke-thinn tī in só͘ beh sio̍k ê tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p; án-ne tsiū tuì guán liam-khau só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p puah kuè-.khì.
English: If they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong: so will it be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.

Tailo: Gōng kiáⁿ sī lāu-pē ê tsai-hō; bó͘ ê tsháu-nāu tshin-tshiūnn hō͘-tsuí tsho̍p-tsho̍p tih.
English: A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife's quarrels are a continual dripping.

Tailo: Tuì Huilīsū ê iâⁿ tiong ū tsi̍t-ê tsiàn-tsiòng tshut-.lâi, miâ kiò-tsò Golīat, sī Gat lâng, sing-khu kuân la̍k tiú koh tsi̍t lia̍h;
English: There went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.

Tailo: Guá koh ua̍t tńg-lâi khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ huat-sing ê it-tshè ê ap-pik. Lí khuàⁿ, siū ap-pik ê teh lâu ba̍k-sái, mā bô lâng an-uì. In bô tit-tio̍h an-uì, sī in-uī ap-pik in ê ū sè-li̍k..
English: Then I returned and saw all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold, the tears of those who were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t, Êsutel tshīng ông-hō͘ ê lé-ho̍k, khiā tī ông-kiong ê lāi-īⁿ, tī ông-kiong ê tuì-bīn. Hit sî, ông tī ông-kiong lāi tsē i ê ông-uī, tī ông-kiong mn̂g ê tuì-bīn.
English: Now it happened on the third day, that Esther put on her royal clothing, and stood in the inner court of the king's house, over against the king's house: and the king sat on his royal throne in the royal house, over against the entrance of the house.

Tailo: I kā Amáli̍k ông Agak ua̍h-ua̍h lia̍h khí-.lâi, īng to kā i ê jîn-bîn tsuân-pō͘ thâi-sí.
English: He took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: In īng tuì Aigi̍p tuà tshut-.lâi ê tsheⁿ-mī piak tsò bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, bô huat-kànn, sī in-uī siū-pik tshut Aigi̍p, bē-tàng iân-tshiân-.tit, mā bô uī ka-kī tsún-pī siáⁿ-mi̍h tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: They baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt; for it wasn't leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, and couldn't wait, neither had they prepared for themselves any food.

Tailo: Án-ne, Tabi̍t īng hìⁿ soh kah tsio̍h-thâu-á khah iâⁿ Huilīsū lâng, kā i phah-sí; tsóng-.sī, Tabi̍t ê tshiú bô to.
English: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and struck the Philistine, and killed him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kā lín kóng, lín kî-tó bô-lūn kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h, tio̍h siong-sìn í-king tit-tio̍h, tsiū lóng ē tsiàu án-ne si̍t-hiān.
English: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

Tailo: Lí the̍h guá ê gîn, bē bí-niûⁿ hō͘ guá tsia̍h, the̍h guá ê gîn, bē tsuí hō͘ guá lim, tsí-iàu tsún guá kiâⁿ lō͘ kuè-.khì.
English: You shall sell me food for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only let me pass through on my feet,

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim ông tshe lâng khì Aigi̍p, to̍h-sī Akbol ê kiáⁿ Elnáthan kah kuí-nā-ê lâng khì-kàu Aigi̍p.
English: and Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, namely, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him, into Egypt;

Tailo: Só͘-í, Naomih tńg-.lâi, i ê sim-pū Mô͘ap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Lùthuh, tuì Mô͘ap tē tńg-.lâi ê, mā kah i lâi; in tńg-lâi-kàu Bia̍tléhèm ê sî, tú-á sī khai-sí beh siu-kuah tuā-be̍h ê sî.
English: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter-in-law, with her, who returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

Tailo: Lâi kah guá tsò-hué tsing-tsiàn. Lín í-tsîng khuàⁿ-kuè guá án-tsuáⁿ tsiàn-tàu, tsit-má lín koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá iáu-teh tsiàn-tàu.
English: having the same conflict which you saw in me, and now hear is in me.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lâng khuànn, thiau-kò͘-ì tī lâng ê bīn-tsîng tsò hó sū. Nā án-ne tsò, lín bē-tàng tit-tio̍h Thiⁿ-pē ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: Be careful that you don't do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them, or else you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: Iâkop tsiū tsiàu án-ne tsò. Kah Leah ê hun-kî muá tshit ji̍t, La̍hban tsiū kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ La̍h-khel hō͘ i tsò bó͘.
English: Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week. He gave him Rachel his daughter as wife.

Tailo: Tsú ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó kah hiah-ê ì-ài huann-hí kìng-uì Lí ê miâ hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó, koh kiû Lí hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kin-á-ji̍t hing-thong, tī tsit-ê lâng bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián. Hit sî, guá tsò ông ê tsiú-tsìng.
English: Lord, I beg you, let now your ear be attentive to the prayer of your servant, and to the prayer of your servants, who delight to fear your name; and please prosper your servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. Now I was cup bearer to the king.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Iésu beh khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tú-tio̍h Hui-li̍p-pò͘, tsiū kā i kóng, Lâi tuè guá.
English: On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him, Follow me.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kah tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsòng tī i ê tsó͘-sian Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ; i ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father; Jehoram his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Lín ē tit-tio̍h lín só͘ su-iàu ê tsìng-kì, lâi tsìng-bîng Ki-tok thong-kuè guá lâi teh kóng uē. Ki-tok tuì-thāi lín pīng bē nńg-tsiáⁿ, tian-tò ē tī lín tiong-kan hián-tshut tuā kuân-lîng.
English: seeing that you seek a proof of Christ who speaks in me; who toward you is not weak, but is powerful in you.

Tailo: Amí-me-li̍k kui ji̍t kong-kik siâⁿ, tsing-ho̍k hit-ê siâⁿ, thâi-sí hit lāi-bīn ê jîn-bîn, thiah-huí hit-ê siâⁿ, īng iâm kā i iā.
English: Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city, and killed the people who were therein: and he beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.

Tailo: Tsit-ê pâi tio̍h khuà tī Alông ê thâu-hia̍h, hō͘ Alông lâi tam-tng Isulael lâng tī it-tshè sìng ê lé-mi̍h só͘ huān ê tsuē. Tsit-ê pâi tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī i ê thâu-hia̍h, hō͘ in tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p.
English: It shall be on Aaron's forehead, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall make holy in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always on his forehead, that they may be accepted before Yahweh.

Tailo: Koh kā in só͘-ū ê huè-bu̍t kah tsîⁿ-tsâi, it-tshè ê gín-á kah tsa-bó͘ lâng, í-ki̍p ta̍k tè tshù só͘-ū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: and all their wealth. They took captive all their little ones and their wives, and took as plunder everything that was in the house.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, Siōngtè ē kuáⁿ-kín thè in tsú-tshî kong-tō. Tsóng-.sī, Jîn-tsú lâi-lîm ê sî, I tī sè-kan kám ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit khuán ê sìn-sim?
English: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?

Tailo: In tī ke-lō͘-.ni̍h io lóng hâ muâ-pò͘; tī tshù tíng kah hit-ê khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, ta̍k lâng lóng thî-khàu, ba̍k-sái ti̍t-ti̍t lâu.
English: In their streets, they dress themselves in sackcloth. In their streets and on their housetops, everyone wails, weeping abundantly.

Tailo: tī tò pîng I teh tsò tāi-tsì, guá bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h I; tī tsiànn pîng I bih khí-.lâi, guá mā bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h I.
English: He works to the north, but I can't see him; He turns south, but I can't catch a glimpse of him.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, tī lí ê tiong-kan, lāu-pē ē thâi kiáⁿ lâi tsia̍h, kiáⁿ mā ē thâi lāu-pē lâi tsia̍h. Guá beh tī lín tiong-kan kā lín sím-phuàⁿ, Guá beh kā lí só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn lóng kā in sì-suàⁿ tī sì-hng.
English: Therefore the fathers shall eat the sons in the midst of you, and the sons shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments on you; and the whole remnant of you will I scatter to all the winds.

Tailo: Tuì guá kah guá ê uē kám-kak kiàn-siàu ê lâng, Jîn-tsú tī ka-kī kah Thiⁿ-pē í-ki̍p sìng thiⁿ-sài ê îng-kng tiong lâi-lîm ê sî, mā beh uī hit-ê lâng kám-kak kiàn-siàu.
English: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

Tailo: Jīn Siōngtsú tsò Siōngtè ê kok tsin ū hok-khì! Siū kíng-suán tsò I ê sán-gia̍p ê tsú-bîn tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed is the nation whose God is Yahweh, The people whom he has chosen for his own inheritance.

Tailo: Kuah tshân-.ni̍h ê niû-tsháu, bán pháiⁿ lâng só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê phû-tô.
English: They cut their provender in the field. They glean the vineyard of the wicked.

Tailo: Kuan-hē sí-lâng koh-ua̍h ê tāi-tsì, lín kám bô tha̍k-tio̍h Siōngtè só͘ kā lín kóng ê uē,
English: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven't you read that which was spoken to you by God, saying,

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Mô͘ap lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsâi-bu̍t kah só͘ tsik-tsū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng ē tuà-kuè liú-tshiū khe.
English: Therefore they will carry away the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have stored up, over the brook of the willows.

Tailo: Kî-tha ê jîn-bîn só͘ hiàn ê kim nn̄g-bān ta-lik, gîn nn̄g-tshing mi-nah, tsè-si ê lé-ho̍k la̍k-tsa̍p tshit niá.
English: That which the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand minas of silver, and sixty-seven priests' garments.

Tailo: Guán beh tī Isulael tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong, tsi̍t pah lâng tshú tsa̍p lâng, tsi̍t-tshing tshú tsi̍t pah, tsi̍t-bān tshú tsi̍t tshing, kā jîn-bîn ūn niû, hō͘ in kàu Biāniámín ê Gi-be-at ê sî, thang tsiàu in tī Isulael tiong só͘ kiâⁿ kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì lâi tuì-thāi in.
English: and we will take ten men of one hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and one hundred of one thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to get food for the people, that they may do, when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, according to all the folly that they have worked in Israel.

Tailo: Koh ū tī Mô͘ap kah Ammóng tso̍k ê tiong-kan, tī Etóm kah lia̍t kok tiong-kan só͘-ū ê Iôtah lâng, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Babúlông ông ū lâu só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê Iôtah lâng, koh siat-li̍p Siahuánn ê sun — Ahikam ê kiáⁿ Getália̍h kā in kuán-hat.
English: Likewise when all the Jews who were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and who were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan;

Tailo: Guá koh kā lín kóng, lín tiong-kan nā ū nn̄g lâng tī tē-tsiūⁿ tâng-sim ha̍p-ì lâi kî-kiû, guá ê Thiⁿ-pē it-tīng ē kā in sîng-tsuân.
English: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: Altasiásuta ông jī-tsa̍p nî, nî-sàn gue̍h, ū tsiú tī ông ê bīn-tsîng, guá tsiū kā ông kìng tsiú. Guá pîng-sî tī ông ê bīn-tsîng m̄-bat ū iu-būn ê bīn-sik.
English: It happened in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, when wine was before him, that I took up the wine, and gave it to the king. Now I had not been before sad in his presence.

Tailo: Uan-khiau ê sim-su it-tīng hō͘ i lī-khui guá; só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ tāi-tsì, guá lóng kā i kī-tsua̍t.
English: A perverse heart will be far from me. I will have nothing to do with evil.

Tailo: M̄-thang lō͘-hiān lí ê a-ko͘ ê ē-sin, i sī lí ê lāu-pē kut-jio̍k ê tshin.
English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister: she is your father's near kinswoman.

Tailo: Ū siaⁿ kóng: Thūn kuân, thūn kuân, tsún-pī lō͘, tuì Guá ê jîn-bîn ê lō͘ tiong tû-khì tsó͘-gāi.
English: He will say, Cast up, cast up, prepare the way, take up the stumbling-block out of the way of my people.

Tailo: Sàulô tsia̍h pá liáu-āu tsiū ióng-kiāⁿ khí-.lâi. I kah Ta-má-su-ko ê bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tuà kuí-nā ji̍t.
English: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

Tailo: Αpsalôm pik i, ông tsiū ín-tsún Amnon kah ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ tsò-hué khì.
English: But Absalom pressed him, and he let Amnon and all the king's sons go with him.

Tailo: Amí-me-li̍k khì-kàu Thê-pī-su, tī Thê-pī-su tsat iâⁿ, lâi kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.

Tailo: Hit tíng-bīn īng kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit ê tuà, só͘ īng lâi hâ ê kah tsè-si ho̍k sio-siâng ê tsò-huat kah i liân tsò tsi̍t tè, īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē lâi tsò, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê sìn-tô͘ lóng beh kā lín tshíng-an.
English: All the saints greet you.

Tailo: Nā-sī lín lia̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú tsò m̄-hó, kin-á-ji̍t lín tio̍h kíng-suán lín só͘ beh ho̍k-sāi ê, khuànn sī lín tsó͘-sian tī tuā hô hit pîng só͘ ho̍k-sāi hiah-ê sîn-bîng, á-.sī lín só͘ tuà in ê tē ê Amô͘lī lâng hiah-ê sîn-bîng? Kóng-tio̍h guá kah guá ê ke, guán tsua̍t-tuì beh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: If it seem evil to you to serve Yahweh, choose you this day whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve Yahweh.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kā Ioap kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Αpsalôm kuì tī siōng tshiū-.ni̍h.
English: A certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak.

Tailo: Guá sī tuì lín guā-pang lâng teh kóng uē, in-uī guá sī guā-pang lâng ê sù-tô͘, guá tuì guá ê suan-kàu tsit-hūn kám-kak tsin kong-îng.
English: For I speak to you who are Gentiles. Since then as I am an apostle to Gentiles, I glorify my ministry;

Tailo: Hit sî, Babúlông ông ê kun-tuī uî-khùn Êlúsalèm, I-é-lí-miah sian-ti kuainn tī khu-liû-só͘ ê īⁿ, tī Iôtah ông ê tshù.
English: Now at that time the king of Babylon's army was besieging Jerusalem; and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah's house.

Tailo: In-uī Ehulaim, Mánáse, Itsakal kah Tse-bú-lông, ū tsin tsē lâng bô tshing-khì ka-kī, tsóng-.sī, in mā tsia̍h Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, bô ha̍h só͘ kì-tsài ê lē.
English: For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet did they eat the Passover otherwise than it is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, The good Yahweh pardon everyone

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng huâi-īn beh seⁿ ê sî, tsiū kiáu-ká, tī thòng-khó͘ ê sî, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah. Siōngtsú ah, guán tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng mā sī án-ne.
English: Like as a woman with child, who draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain and cries out in her pangs; so we have been before you, Yahweh.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú beh tī I ê Thiⁿ-pē ê îng-kng tiong kah I ê thiⁿ-sài tsò-hué lâi-lîm, hit sî I ē tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê só͘ tsò lâi kā in pò-siúⁿ á-.sī hîng-hua̍t.
English: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.

Tailo: Amí-me-li̍k jiok i, i tī i ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, ū tsin tsē lâng tio̍h-siong tó-.leh, it-ti̍t kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu.
English: Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and there fell many wounded, even to the entrance of the gate.

Tailo: In tsiap-kīn Mika ê tshù, jīn-tio̍h hit-ê siàu-liân Lēbī lâng ê siann-im, tsiū ji̍p-khì mn̄g i, Siáⁿ lâng tshuā lí lâi tsia? Lí tī tsia tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí tī tsia tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: When they were by the house of Micah, they knew the voice of the young man the Levite; and they turned aside there, and said to him, Who brought you here? and what do you in this place? and what have you here?

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh mn̄g kóng, Keilah lâng kám ē kā guá kah tuè guá ê lâng kau tī Sàulô ê tshiú? Siōngtsú kóng, In ē kā lí kau hō͘ i.
English: Then said David, Will the men of Keilah deliver up to me and my men into the hand of Saul? Yahweh said, They will deliver you up.

Tailo: E-thu-ló in-uī Siōngtsú khuán-thāi Isulael lâng it-tshè ê hó sū, kiù in thuat-lī Aigi̍p lâng ê tshiú, tsiū tsin huann-hí.
English: Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Yahweh had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā in ê bó͘ hō͘ pa̍t lâng, kā in ê tshân-hn̂g hō͘ pa̍t lâng lâi sîng-tsiap tsò sán-gia̍p; in-uī in tuì siōng sè kàu siōng tuā ê lóng it-bī tham-sim, tuì sian-ti kàu tsè-si lóng kiânn kan-tsà.
English: Therefore will I give their wives to others, and their fields to those who shall possess them: for everyone from the least even to the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even to the priest every one deals falsely.

Tailo: Tho-má-suh ìn kóng, Guá ê Tsú ah, guá ê Siōngtè ah.
English: Thomas answered him, My Lord and my God!

Tailo: Sî-kî nā kàu, tsiū thong-kuè sìn-sit ê thuân-káng, kā tsit-ê ìng-ín hián-bîng tshut-.lâi. Guá ū siū-thok, hōng lán ê Kiù-tsú Siōngtè ê bīng-līng, lâi suan-káng tsit-ê hok-im.
English: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;

Tailo: Hit sî,. Guá īng tsuí kā lí sé, kā lí sing-khu ê hueh sé tshing-khì, koh īng iû kā lí buah.
English: Then washed I you with water; yes, I thoroughly washed away your blood from you, and I anointed you with oil.

Tailo: Pîn-tuāⁿ ê lâng kóng, Ū sai tī guā-bīn, guá nā khì ke-lō͘, ē hō͘ i kā-sí.
English: The sluggard says, There is a lion outside! I will be killed in the streets!

Tailo: Tng i ê jîn-sîn uî-khùn siâⁿ ê sî, Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal tsiū lâi.
English: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to the city, while his servants were besieging it;

Tailo: Isulael ông Ehuahátsuh ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si tē-jī nî, Iôtah ông Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Amátsiah tsē-uī.
English: In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel began Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah to reign.

Tailo: In hō͘ tē pha-hng; tē-it-ē pha-hng, tsiū tuì Guá ai-kiû; tsuân tē pha-hng, in-uī bô lâng khuà-ì.
English: They have made it a desolation; it mourns to me, being desolate; the whole land is made desolate, because no man lays it to heart.

Tailo: Tshiú-kang iù ê saⁿ-khò͘, tsè-si Alông ê sìng-saⁿ kah i ê kiáⁿ ê saⁿ, hō͘ in tsò tsè-si lâi ho̍k-sāi,
English: the finely worked garmentsthe holy garments for Aaron the priestthe garments of his sons to minister in the priest's office,

Tailo: In tuì Aigi̍p tuà tńg-.lâi ê ngó͘-kok í-king tsia̍h-liáu, in lāu-pē kā in kóng, Lín koh khì kā lán tia̍h tām-po̍h-á bí-niûⁿ tńg-.lâi.
English: It happened, when they had eaten up the grain which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said to them, Go again, buy us a little more food.

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t khuàⁿ-tiōng lí ê sèⁿ-miā, guān Siōngtsú mā án-ne khuàⁿ-tiōng guá ê sèⁿ-miā, koh kiù guá thuat-lī só͘-ū ê huān-lān.
English: Behold, as your life was much set by this day in my eyes, so let my life be much set by in the eyes of Yahweh, and let him deliver me out of all oppression.

Tailo: Lín taⁿ tio̍h khuànn, Guá, Guá to̍h-sī; Guá í-guā bô ū Siōngtè. Guá hō͘ lâng sí, Guá hō͘ lâng ua̍h; Guá kā i sún-siong, Guá kā i i-tī, bô tsi̍t-ê ē tuì Guá ê tshiú kiù tshut.
English: See now that I, even I, am he, There is no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; There is none who can deliver out of my hand.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Tsiū-sī kàu hit sî, Guá mā bô beh kā lín tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t.
English: But even in those days, says Yahweh, I will not make a full end with you.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tó-sū, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ guá ê uē! Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, lín tio̍h tuì hn̄g-hn̄g tsù-ì lâi thiaⁿ! Tuì guá tī thai-.ni̍h, Siōngtsú to̍h kíng-tiàu guá; tuì guá tī lāu-bú ê pak-tó͘ lāi, I to̍h kiò guá ê miâ.
English: Listen, islands, to me; and listen, you peoples, from far: Yahweh has called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother has he made mention of my name:

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá tò tńg-khì siūⁿ, uī-tio̍h guá tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn ê lô-lo̍k hō͘ guá tsin sit-bōng.
English: Therefore I began to cause my heart to despair concerning all the labor in which I had labored under the sun.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Asah saⁿ-tsa̍p peh nî, Omlī ê kiáⁿ Ahap tsē-uī, tsò Isulael ông. Omlī ê kiáⁿ Ahap tī Sa-má-lī-a tsò Isulael ông jī-tsa̍p jī nî.
English: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.

Tailo: Guán uá-khò Lí lâi phah-tó guán ê tuì-ti̍k; guán uá-khò Lí ê miâ lâi thún-ta̍h hiah-ê kong-kik guán ê lâng.
English: Through you, will we push down our adversaries. Through your name, will we tread them under who rise up against us.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì ìng-giām Siōngtè thong-kuè I-é-lí-miah sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, kóng, In the̍h hit saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê gîn-á, to̍h-sī i-su-la-el lâng uī-tio̍h i só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn.
English: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying, They took the thirty pieces of silver, The price of him upon whom a price had been set, Whom some of the children of Israel priced,

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Etóm ē tsiâⁿ-tsò thang tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì ê, kiàn-nā tuì hia king-kuè ê it-tīng ē kám-kak kî-kuài, in-uī i só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê it-tshè tsai-hō lâi kā i thí-tshiò.
English: Edom shall become an astonishment: everyone who passes by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues of it.

Tailo: Kám-siā Siōngtè! Lín suî-jiân bat tsò tsuē ê lô͘-lē, tsit-má lín í-king tsuân-sim sūn-ho̍k hit-ê thuân-siū hō͘ lín tsò kui-huān ê kà-sī.
English: But thanks be to God, that, whereas you were bondservants of sin, you became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto you were delivered.

Tailo: La̍k nî tio̍h tsìng-tsoh lí ê tshân-hn̂g, la̍k nî tio̍h siu-tsíng lí ê phû-tô hn̂g, lâi siu tē ê tshut-sán.
English: Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and gather in its fruits;

Tailo: In tú uī-tio̍h án-ne iáu teh tiû-tû ê sî, hut-jiân ū nn̄g-ê lâng tshīng kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ ê saⁿ khiā tī in sin piⁿ.
English: It happened, while they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.

Tailo: tsiū tshe i ê kiáⁿ Hatolám khì kìⁿ Tabi̍t ông, kā i tshíng-an, mā kā i tsiok-hok, in-uī i ū kah Hatatetsel kau-tsiàn lâi khah iâⁿ i （ pún-lâi Hatatetsel kah Tou to̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ū kau-tsiàn ê iân-kò͘ ）. Hatolám suà tuà kim, gîn, tâng tsiah-ê khì-kū.
English: he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to Greet him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadarezer and struck him; (for Hadarezer had wars with Tou;) and he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.

Tailo: Guán kā guá ê tsú kóng, ' Gín-á bē-tàng lī-khui i ê lāu-pē, nā lī-khui i ê lāu-pē, lāu-pē it-tīng ē sí. '
English: We said to my lord, The boy can't leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.'

Tailo: Kiû Lí bô hō͘ guá ê sim phian-ǹg siâ-ok, tì-sú guá kah tsok-gia̍t ê lâng tàu-tīn tsò pháiⁿ sū, mā bô hō͘ guá tsia̍h in ê hó mi̍h.
English: Don't incline my heart to any evil thing, To practice deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity. Don't let me eat of their delicacies.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘-siong hun-tam tāng-tàⁿ, án-ne tsò tsiah sī teh si̍t-hiān Ki-tok ê kà-sī.
English: Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.

Tailo: Tio̍h tuì tì-huī kóng, Lí sī guá ê tsí-muē ; tio̍h kiò tshong-bîng tsò lí ê tshin-lâng.
English: Tell wisdom, You are my sister. Call understanding your relative,

Tailo: Símòng Piattò͘ tsiū peh khí-lih tsûn tíng, kā bāng thua tsiūⁿ-huāⁿ, kui-bāng tuā-bué hî muá-muá, tsóng-kiōng tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p-saⁿ bué; hî suî-jiân hiah tsē, bāng mā bô phuà-li̍h.
English: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn't torn.

Tailo: Bian-ha-tat án-ne kóng: Lí ê gîn, lí ê kim, lóng sī guá ê, lí hiah-ê bó͘, lí hiah-ê kiáⁿ-jî, siōng suí ê, mā sī guá ê.
English: Your silver and your gold is mine; your wives also and your children, even the best, are mine.

Tailo: Lán bô lâng kan-taⁿ uī-tio̍h ka-kī teh ua̍h, mā bô lâng kan-taⁿ uī-tio̍h ka-kī lâi sí.
English: For none of us lives to himself, and none dies to himself.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê khì-kū, Phelsiah ông Ko-le-si thok kuán khò͘-pâng ê Mitletat the̍h tshut-lâi tiám-sǹg, kau hō͘ Iôtah ê siú-líng Sesibatsal.
English: even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.

Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h thiah-huí in ê tsè-tuâⁿ, phah-tshuì in tiau-khik ê thiāu, īng hué sio in ê A-si-lah, tshò in só͘ tiau-khik ê sîn-bîng ê siōng, mā tio̍h tuì hit só͘-tsāi kā in ê miâ tû-bia̍t.
English: and you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and burn their Asherim with fire; and you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods; and you shall destroy their name out of that place.

Tailo: Pó-tsō ū la̍k tsàn ê kiā-á, koh ū kim ê kha-ta̍h-í kah pó-tsō sio-liân. Siang pîng ū khò-tshiú, khò-tshiú piⁿ ū nn̄g tsiah sai khiā-.leh.
English: And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the stays.

Tailo: Tsú phah Isulael, kám tshin-tshiūnn phah hiah-ê bat kā i phah ê lâng? I siū thâi, kám tshin-tshiūnn hiah-ê thâi i ê lâng siū thâi?
English: Has he struck them as he struck those who struck them? Or are they killed like those who killed them were killed?

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí ē hō͘ in hām-lo̍h tī bia̍t-bông ê tshim kheⁿ; thâi-sí-lâng kah kan-tsà ê lâng bē ua̍h kàu tiong-liân. Nā-sī guá, guá beh uá-khò Lí.
