English: But you, God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction. Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days, But I will trust in you.

Tailo: Koh īng to phah tsè-si ê siâⁿ — Νo͘p kî-tiong ê lâm-lí, gín-á, tsia̍h ling ê enn-á kah gû, lî, iûⁿ, lóng īng to thâi-sí.
English: Nob, the city of the priests, struck he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and nursing babies, and oxen and donkeys and sheep, with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Lín koh kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ni̍h lo-so huì-khì! ' Mā am phīⁿ-khang thó-ià I. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê. Lín kā só͘ tshiúⁿ ê, pái-kha-.ê, phuà-siùⁿ ê, the̍h-lâi hiàn tsò lé-mi̍h, Guá kám ē tuì lín ê tshiú tsiap-la̍p? Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: You say also, Behold, what a weariness it is!' and you have sniffed at it, says Yahweh of Armies; and you have brought that which was taken by violence, the lame, and the sick; thus you bring the offering. Should I accept this at your hand? says Yahweh.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì in kóng, lín tio̍h án-ne kā Tsetikiah kóng,
English: Then said Jeremiah to them, Thus shall you tell Zedekiah:

Tailo: I thè guán kíng guán ê sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī I só͘ thiàⁿ ê Iâkop ê îng-kng. [Sè-la̍h]
English: He chooses our inheritance for us, The glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

Tailo: Guá ē kì-tit lí ū sûn tsin ê sìn-gióng, to̍h-sī lí ê guā-má Lô-í kah lí ê lāu-bú Iû-nî-ke khah tsá to̍h ū ê, guá khak-sìn lí tsit-má mā ū tsit khuán ê sìn-gióng.
English: having been reminded of the unfeigned faith that is in you; which lived first in your grandmother Lois, and your mother Eunice, and, I am persuaded, in you also.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng: Tse to̍h-sī m̄ tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè ê uē, bô siū kàu-tok ê jîn-bîn; sîng-si̍t tsiū siau-sit-.khì, tuì in ê tshuì tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: You shall tell them, This is the nation that has not listened to the voice of Yahweh their God, nor received instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.

Tailo: Tì-huī an-jiân tiàm tī tshong-bîng lâng ê sim-lāi; gōng lâng ê pak-lāi hō͘ lâng khuànn hiān-hiān.
English: Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding, And is even made known in the inward part of fools.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī i ê thâu-khak huāⁿ-tshiú, tī huē-bō͘ tsîng kā i thâi. Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tio̍h kā hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: and he shall lay his hand on its head, and kill it before the tent of meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: Tē-jī-ê, tē-saⁿ-ê mā lóng tshuā hit-ê hiaⁿ-só.
English: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

Tailo: Kiû Lí kā guá ún-ba̍t, hō͘ guá thuat-lī pháiⁿ lâng ê im-bô͘, thuat-lī put-gī ê lâng ê jiáu-luān.
English: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, From the noisy crowd of the ones doing evil;

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng kā tē kau-thok I? Siáⁿ lâng an-tīng tsuân sè-kài?
English: Who gave him a charge over the earth? Or who has appointed him over the whole world?

Tailo: Guān i ē kú-tn̂g ua̍h-.leh. Lâng ē kā Síbah ê kim hō͘ i; ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ uī i kî-tó, kui ji̍t o-ló i.
English: They shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba. Men shall pray for him continually. They shall bless him all day long.

Tailo: hit uī îng-kng ê ông sī siáⁿ lâng? Sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, I sī îng-kng ê ông. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Who is this King of glory? Yahweh of Armies, He is the King of glory. Selah.

Tailo: Lí khuànn-khin Guá ê sìng-mi̍h, huān-tio̍h Guá ê An-hioh-ji̍t.
English: You have despised my holy things, and have profaned my Sabbaths.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí kóng, khì kā lí ê tsú kóng, ' Eliiah tī tsia', i it-tīng ē kā guá thâi-sí.
English: Now you say, Go, tell your lord, Behold, Elijah is here; and he will kill me.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tiúⁿ suî-sî tshuā ping kah kun-kuaⁿ lâi-kàu bîn-tsiòng hia. In khuàⁿ-tio̍h kun-kuaⁿ kah ping tsiū thîng tshiú, bô koh phah Páulô.
English: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê kǹg tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī kuī ê khuân lāi, m̄-thang thiu tshut-.lâi.
English: The poles shall be in the rings of the ark. They shall not be taken from it.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, in-uī in phian-ǹg pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê pháiⁿ, só͘-í, Guá tsua̍t-tuì ng Guá ê bīn.
English: I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they shall have worked, in that they are turned to other gods.

Tailo: Tī iok-tīng ê ji̍t-tsí, He-lo̍t tshīng ông-ho̍k tsē tī ông-uī, tuì jîn-bîn ián-káng.
English: On an appointed day, Herod dressed himself in royal clothing, sat on the throne, and gave a speech to them.

Tailo: Tshit-gue̍h tshe-it, tsè-si Etsula̍h tuà lu̍t-huat ê tsheh lâi-kàu gī-huē tsîng, sī lâm sī lí, í-ki̍p kiàn-nā thiaⁿ-liáu ē-hiáu-.tit ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Ezra the priest brought the law before the assembly, both men and women, and all who could hear with understanding, on the first day of the seventh month.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Mô͘se ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kah I kóng-uē, phè tsiū hian khí-.lâi, it-ti̍t kàu i tshut-.lâi. I tshut-.lâi ê sî, tsiū kā Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù ê uē tuì Isulael lâng kóng.
English: But when Moses went in before Yahweh to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ì-ài Si-óng ê tsio̍h-thâu, liân i ê thô͘-sua hún to pó-sioh.
English: For your servants take pleasure in her stones, And have pity on her dust.

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê m̄-kam-guān ē suî-sî hián-tshut; thong-ta̍t ê lâng ún-ba̍t ka-kī ê kiàn-siàu.
English: A fool shows his annoyance the same day, But one who overlooks an insult is prudent.

Tailo: Guá ê sim ū tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī; tsiah-ê uē, guá hui-siông ì-ài.
English: My soul has observed your testimonies. I love them exceedingly.

Tailo: Lín tsiū tò tńg-.lâi, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu; tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú m̄-thiaⁿ lín ê siann, mā m̄ àⁿ hīⁿ-khang ǹg lín.
English: You returned and wept before Yahweh; but Yahweh didn't listen to your voice, nor gave ear to you.

Tailo: Hô-hòng Ki-tok sī thong-kuè íng-uán ê Sìng Sîn, hiàn I ka-kī bô khuat-tiám ê pún-sin hō͘ Siōngtè; I ê hueh kám bô koh khah hō͘ lán ê liông-sim tshing-khì, thang thuat-lī sí-bông ê hîng-uî, lâi ho̍k-sāi íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtè?
English: how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Tailo: Hì-lāng liáu-āu, tsiū kā hit niá tn̂g-phàu thǹg khí-.lâi, koh kā I ka-kī ê saⁿ-tshīng tò tńg-.khì, jiân-āu ah I tshut-khì tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off of him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ē ū tsi̍t-ê ông tsiàu kong-gī lâi tsò ông, ē ū siú-líng tsiàu kong-pêⁿ lâi tsiáng-kuân.
English: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, And princes shall rule in justice.

Tailo: Guá ua̍t tńg-sin siūⁿ beh khuànn kah guá kóng-uē ê sī siáⁿ lâng, kiat-kó khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshit ki kim ting-tâi.
English: I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. Having turned, I saw seven golden lampstands.

Tailo: In-uī in khì-sak Guá, sio hiuⁿ tī pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, īng in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê kik Guá ê siū-khì, só͘-í, Guá ê tuā siū-khì piàⁿ lo̍h-khì tī tsit só͘-tsāi bô suah. '
English: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore is my wrath poured out on this place, and it shall not be quenched.

Tailo: In-uī I ē kiù lí thuat-lī tng tsiáu-á ê lô-bāng kah to̍k-hāi ê un-i̍k.
English: For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, And from the deadly pestilence.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tio̍h lâu i ê kin-thâu tī tē-.ni̍h, īng thih kah tâng ê khuân kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, tī tshân-.ni̍h sin huat ê tsháu tiong, īng thinn ê lō͘-tsuí kā i sip-tâm, mā hō͘ i kah tsáu-siù tsò-hué tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsháu-tiûⁿ,
English: Nevertheless leave the stump of its roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of the sky: and let his portion be with the animals in the grass of the earth:

Tailo: Guán hông phah, hông kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ, hō͘ pō-bîn jiáu-luān; guán lô-khó͘, bô khùn, bô tsia̍h.
English: in beatings, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;

Tailo: Babúlông án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ Isulael siū thâi ê lâng tó lo̍h-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, i tsuân tē siū thâi ê lâng mā ē tī Babúlông tó lo̍h-.khì.
English: As Babylon has caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the land.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm khì Sīkhiàm, in-uī Isulael jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Sīkhiàm, beh kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông.
English: Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.

Tailo: Jio̍k-thé bô siū kat-lé, m̄-koh ū tsun-siú lu̍t-huat ê lâng kám bô beh kā lí tīng tsuē? In-uī lí ū lu̍t-huat ê tiâu bûn koh ū siū kat-lé, tian-tò bô tsun-siú lu̍t-huat.
English: Won't the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfills the law, judge you, who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law?

Tailo: Isáiah án-ne kóng sī in-uī i ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu ê îng-kng, tsiah kóng kuan-hē I ê tāi-tsì.
English: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.

Tailo: I koh tshuā in lâi-kàu sìng-tē ê kau-kài, lâi-kàu I īng tsiàⁿ tshiú só͘ tit-tio̍h ê suaⁿ.
English: He brought them to the border of his sanctuary, To this mountain, which his right hand had taken.

Tailo: I tsò huē-bō͘ ê pán, lâm pîng ū jī-tsa̍p tè pán.
English: He made the boards for the tent: twenty boards for the south side southward.

Tailo: In ê sim-lāi tô͘-bô͘ siâ-ok, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsū-tsi̍p ài beh kau-tsiàn.
English: Those who devise mischief in their hearts. They continually gather themselves together for war.

Tailo: In-uī ông ê uē ū kuân-ui, siáⁿ lâng ē tuì i kóng, Lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: for the king's word is supreme. Who can say to him, What are you doing?

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ kā I kóng, Lāu-su, kīn-lâi Iô-tá-iah lâng ài beh īng tsio̍h-thâu kā Lí tìm, Lí kám beh koh khì hia?
English: The disciples told him, Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone you, and are you going there again?

Tailo: Lí ê tuì-ti̍k tī Lí ê tiān lāi huā-huā háu; in khiā in ê kî tsò kì-hō,
English: Your adversaries have roared in the midst of your assembly. They have set up their standards as signs.

Tailo: Sian-ti kóng, Guá khùn-tshéⁿ teh siūⁿ, guá ê khùn tsin huann-hí!
English: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.

Tailo: Ū hó siau-sit tuì hn̄g-hn̄g thuân-.lâi, ná tshin-tshiūnn īng líng-tsuí hō͘ tshuì-ta ê lâng lim.
English: Like cold water to a thirsty soul, So is good news from a far country.

Tailo: Lán tsai Siōngtè bô thiaⁿ tsuē-jîn ê kî-kiû, to̍k-to̍k lâng nā kìng-pài Siōngtè lâi tsun-tsiàu I ê tsí-ì, Siōngtè tsiū ē thiaⁿ i ê kî-kiû.
English: We know that God doesn't listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshipper of God, and does his will, he listens to him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i siū tshian-suá hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì; i ê enn-á hō͘ lâng siak-sí tī ke-lō͘ thâu. Lâng uī-tio̍h i tsun-kuì ê lâng liam-khau ; i ê tuā kuaⁿ-uân lóng hō͘ thih-liān pa̍k khí-.lâi.
English: Yet was she carried away. She went into captivity. Her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets, and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ê tok-kang kah in ê thâu-ba̍k tshut-khì kā jîn-bîn kóng, Huâ-láu án-ne kóng, ' Guá bô bueh koh khioh tsháu hō͘ lín.
English: The taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spoke to the people, saying, This is what Pharaoh says: I will not give you straw.

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah liáu-āu, ū Bia̍tléhèm lâng Iptsàn tsò Isulael ê sū-su.
English: After him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tshe tsi̍t-ê sù-tsiá ji̍p-khì Asiul ông ê iâⁿ tiong, kā hiah-ê tuā lîng-li̍k ê ióng-sū, í-ki̍p hiah-ê siú-líng kun-tiúⁿ tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-tiāu. Asiul ông muá-bīn kiàn-siàu tńg-khì pún-kok, ji̍p-khì i ê sîn-bîng ê biō lāi, ū i tshin-seⁿ ê kiáⁿ tī hia īng to kā i thâi-sí.
English: Yahweh sent an angel, who cut off all the mighty men of valor, and the leaders and captains, in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. When he was come into the house of his god, those who came forth from his own bowels killed him there with the sword.

Tailo: Tng Ma-tái ông — Ta-lió-suh guân nî, guá khiā khí-.lâi, hō͘ i kian-kò͘ ióng-tsòng.
English: As for me, in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood up to confirm and strengthen him.

Tailo: I beh tuà tī hit-ê siâⁿ, thìng-hāu khiā tī huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng siū sím-phuàⁿ, thìng-hāu hit sî ê tuā-tsè-si í-king sí, thâi lâng ê tsiah thang tńg-khì kàu pún-siâⁿ, pún-ke, to̍h-sī i só͘ tuì hia tsáu tshut-lâi hit-ê siâⁿ. '
English: He shall dwell in that city, until he stand before the congregation for judgment, until the death of the high priest that shall be in those days: then shall the manslayer return, and come to his own city, and to his own house, to the city from whence he fled.

Tailo: Guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê uē, lín m̄-thang ke-thinn, mā m̄-thang kā i kiám-tsió, thang hō͘ lín tsip-siú Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê.
English: You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you diminish from it, that you may keep the commandments of Yahweh your God which I command you.

Tailo: Guá ē sù-hok hō͘ i, Guá mā ē hō͘ lí tuì i tit-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ. Guá ē sù-hok hō͘ i, i mā ē tsò lia̍t kok ê lāu-bú; ē ū pang-kok ê ông tuì i tshut.
English: I will bless her, and moreover I will give you a son by her. Yes, I will bless her, and she will be a mother of nations. Kings of peoples will come from her.

Tailo: ' Liân lín ê siâⁿ tiâu tī guán kha-té ê thô͘-sua hún, guán to beh puāⁿ-tiāu; tsóng-.sī, lín tio̍h tsai Siōngtè kok-tō͘ teh beh kàu à. '
English: Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the Kingdom of God has come near to you.'

Tailo: Lín khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, sim tsiū khuài-lo̍k; lín ê kut ē tit-tio̍h tsu-jūn, tshin-tshiūnn nńg-nńg ê tsháu. Siōngtsú ê tshiú ē hián-hiān hō͘ I ê lô͘-po̍k tsai; I mā ē tuì I ê tuì-ti̍k siū-khì.
English: You shall see it, and your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like the tender grass: and the hand of Yahweh shall be known toward his servants; and he will have indignation against his enemies.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí tī lí sì-kho͘-uî ê lia̍t pang tiong tsò hi-bî, tsò lîng-jio̍k, hō͘ king-kuè ê lâng tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Moreover I will make you a desolation and a reproach among the nations that are round about you, in the sight of all that pass by.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, suaⁿ-thâu biō bô huì-tû, jîn-bîn iáu tī suaⁿ-thâu biō hiàn tsè sio hiuⁿ.
English: However the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kiù-sio̍k Abulahàm ê Siōngtè lūn Iâkop ê ke ê sî, án-ne kóng, Iâkop taⁿ it-tīng bô koh kiàn-siàu, i ê bīn mā bô piàn-sik.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: Jacob shall no longer be ashamed, neither shall his face grow pale.

Tailo: Kóng khí-lâi tsin kiàn-siàu, guán kuè-khì m̄-káⁿ tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì. Tsóng-.sī, nā ū lâng káⁿ khua-kháu siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsún-tsò sī tsi̍t-ê gōng lâng teh kóng uē, guá mā káⁿ.
English: I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Yet however any is bold (I speak in foolishness), I am bold also.

Tailo: Samuel tsiū īng tsi̍t tsiah tsia̍h ling ê iûⁿ-á, sio kui-tsiah lâi hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò sio-tsè, Samuel thè Isulael lâng kiû-kiò Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú ū ìn i.
English: Samuel took a sucking lamb, and offered it for a whole burnt offering to Yahweh: and Samuel cried to Yahweh for Israel; and Yahweh answered him.

Tailo: koh tshìn kim hō͘ i tsò ta̍k tsióng ìng-iōng ê kim-khì, mā tshìn gîn hō͘ i tsò ta̍k tsióng ìng-iōng ê gîn-khì,
English: of gold by weight for the vessels of gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; of silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;

Tailo: Guá beh phìng-tiāⁿ hō͘ lí íng-uán kui tī Guá, jî-tshiánn Guá beh īng kong-gī, kong-pêⁿ, tsû-ài, liân-bín, lâi kā lí phìng-tiāⁿ kui tī Guá;
English: I will betroth you to me forever. Yes, I will betroth you to me in righteousness, in justice, in loving kindness, and in compassion.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Ehulaim īng khi-phiàn uî guá, Isulael ê tsú-bîn mā īng kuí-kè kā guá pau-uî; Iôtah khò Siōngtè tsiáng-kuân, ǹg sìng ê ū tsīn-tiong ê sim.
English: Ephraim surrounds me with falsehood, And the house of Israel with deceit. Judah still strays from God, And is unfaithful to the Holy One.

Tailo: I ê siàu-liân lâng ē tī ke-lō͘ tó lo̍h-.khì; tng hit ji̍t, i só͘-ū ê ping-á ē bia̍t-bông. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Lán tsai, só͘-ū siū-tsō-bu̍t tsit-má iáu-teh thó͘-khuì ai-kiò, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh king-giām sing-sán ê thòng-khó͘.
English: For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí khó-liân guá, in-uī guá sue-lám; Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí i-tī guá, in-uī guá ê kut-thâu phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: Have mercy on me, Yahweh, for I am faint. Yahweh, heal me, for my bones are troubled.

Tailo: Gilia̍t kám bô tsuē? In tsuân-jiân sī hi-ké ê. Tī Gilgal hiàn gû-á tsò tsè, in ê tsè-tuâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tshân-.ni̍h lê-tsuā ê tsio̍h-tui.
English: If Gilead is wicked, Surely they are worthless. In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls. Indeed, their altars are like heaps in the furrows of the field.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tuì i kóng, Lí ê tsînn kah lí tsò-hué bia̍t-bông! In-uī lí siūⁿ kóng Siōngtè ê un-sù ē-tàng īng tsînn lâi bé!
English: But Peter said to him, May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t sim-lāi ū ì-sù, beh uī Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ê miâ khí tiān.
English: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tshiūⁿ tsuí, tsún-pī siū uî-khùn; tio̍h kian-kò͘ lí ê siâⁿ-pó, tio̍h kàu thô͘-khut ta̍h thô͘, siu-lí tsng-iô.
English: Draw water for the siege. Strengthen your fortresses. Go into the clay, and tread the mortar. Make the brick kiln strong.

Tailo: kiò Lótoh kóng, Kin-àm kàu lí tsia ê lâng tī tó-uī? Hō͘ in tshut-.lâi, thang tsiàu guán só͘ ài-tsò ê.
English: They called to Lot, and said to him, Where are the men who came in to you this night? Bring them out to us, that we may have sex with them.

Tailo: Mn̄g Iésu kóng, Lí tio̍h kā guán kóng, Lí sī khò siáⁿ-mi̍h kuân-pìng lâi tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Sī siáⁿ lâng hō͘ Lí tsit-ê kuân-pìng?
English: They asked him, Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?

Tailo: Guá tshim-sìn, ua̍h-.leh ê lâng ē-tàng tit-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê un-huī, it-tīng bē tsua̍t-bāng.
English: I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsiâⁿ-tsò huān tsuē, in-uī jîn-bîn khì Tàn, tī hit tsiah ê thâu-tsîng kìng-pài.
English: This thing became a sin; for the people went to worship before the one, even to Dan.

Tailo: Piⁿ-pâng ê mn̂g lóng ǹg só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tē; tsi̍t-ê mn̂g ǹg pak, tsi̍t-ê mn̂g ǹg lâm. Sì-kho͘-uî só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tē lóng khuah gō͘ tiú.
English: The doors of the side chambers were toward the place that was left, one door toward the north, and another door toward the south: and the breadth of the place that was left was five cubits round about.

Tailo: Asiul ông lia̍h Isulael lâng kàu Asiul, kā in an-tì tī Ha-la̍h kah Ha-bool, tī Go-tsán hô piⁿ ê kah Ma-tái lâng hiah-ê siâⁿ.
English: The king of Assyria carried Israel away to Assyria, and put them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes,

Tailo: Guá ta̍k pái siūⁿ-tio̍h lín ê sî, tsiū kám-siā guá ê Siōngtè.
English: I thank my God whenever I remember you,

Tailo: Guá kā Guá ê uē hē tī lí ê tshuì, īng Guá ê tshiú ê iánn jia-khàm lí, Guá khai-thian pi̍t-tē, koh tuì Si-óng kóng: Lí sī Guá ê tsú-bîn.
English: I have put my words in your mouth, and have covered you in the shadow of my hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and tell Zion, You are my people.

Tailo: Tio̍h tshīng liâng-ê, mā m̄-thang ke tuà lāi-saⁿ.
English: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.

Tailo: tshiú khì the̍h bi̍t tsiū kiânn, ná kiâⁿ ná tsia̍h, lâi-kàu i ê pē-bú hia, tsiū kā bi̍t the̍h hō͘ in, in mā tsia̍h; tsóng-.sī, bô kā i ê pē-bú kóng tsit-ê bi̍t sī tuì sai ê sin-si the̍h tshut-.lâi ê.
English: He took it into his hands, and went on, eating as he went; and he came to his father and mother, and gave to them, and they ate: but he didn't tell them that he had taken the honey out of the body of the lion.

Tailo: Lín tsai lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián; I suî-jiân pún-lâi tsin hù-jū, khiok uī-tio̍h lín tsiâⁿ-tsò sàn-tshiah, sī beh hō͘ lín tuì I ê sàn-tshiah lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò hù-jū.
English: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that you through his poverty might become rich.

Tailo: Iésu tshut-khì tī lō͘-.ni̍h, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-lâi kuī tī I ê bīn-tsîng, mn̄g kóng, Hó ê lāu-su ah, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah ē-tàng tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā?
English: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

Tailo: Kā i kóng ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Guá ngó͘-jiân kàu Gil-buah suaⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sàulô uá tī i ê tshiuⁿ, ū tsiàn-tshia kah bé-ping jiok uá i.
English: The young man who told him said, As I happened by chance on Mount Gilboa, behold, Saul was leaning on his spear; and behold, the chariots and the horsemen followed hard after him.

Tailo: Khòng-uāⁿ kah sio-jua̍h siau-bia̍t seh-tsuí; im-kan tuì huān tsuē ê lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: Drought and heat consume the snow waters; So does Sheol those who have sinned.

Tailo: Be-l（ tsù, Babúlông lâng ê tsi̍t-ê tsú-iáu sîn-bîng ）khut-lo̍h-.khì, Nebó（ tsù, tsi̍t-ê Babúlông lâng ê sîn-bîng, tsiáng-kuán ha̍k-si̍p kah bûn-jī ）phak lo̍h-.khì; in ê ngó͘-siōng tô tī siù kah tsing-seⁿ ê tíng-bīn; lín pîng-sî só͘ kng ê, taⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò tāng-tàⁿ, hō͘ ià-siān ê tsing-seⁿ teh tsài.
English: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops; their idols are on the animals, and on the livestock: the things that you carried about are made a load, a burden to the weary animal.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā in kóng, Lín só͘ tsò ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h sū? Lín kám m̄-tsai, tshin-tshiūnn guá tsit khuán ê lâng ē tsiam-pok?
English: Joseph said to them, What deed is this that you have done? Don't you know that such a man as I can indeed divine?

Tailo: Tshú iûⁿ-kûn tiong siōng hó ê, kā tshâ thia̍p tī tiáⁿ-ē, hō͘ tiánn kún tshiāng-tshiāng, thang kā kut tī hit lāi-bīn kûn.
English: Take the choice of the flock, and also a pile of wood for the bones under the caldron; make it boil well; yes, let the bones of it be boiled in the midst of it.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè koh tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá it-tīng tuā-tuā ke-thinn lí huâi-īn ê kan-khó͘, lí ē kan-khó͘ seⁿ kiáⁿ. Lí ē luân-bō͘ lí ê tiōng-hu, i ē kā lí kuán-hat.
English: To the woman he said, I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bring forth children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.

Tailo: In beh khí tshù, ka-kī tuà; beh tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g, lâi tsia̍h i ê kué-tsí.
English: They shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Siōngtsú tī hia sì-tsa̍p kang sì-tsa̍p mê, bô tsia̍h piáⁿ bô lim tsuí. I kā tsit-ê iok ê uē, to̍h-sī tsa̍p-tiâu-kài, siá tī nn̄g tè pi.
English: He was there with Yahweh forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread, nor drank water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.

Tailo: Lí tī Hô-lep suann khiā tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, hit ji̍t Siōngtsú tuì guá kóng, ' Lí kā Guá tsio-tsi̍p jîn-bîn, Guá beh hō͘ in thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê uē, hō͘ in ua̍h tī sè-kan ê ji̍t, thang ha̍k-si̍p kìng-uì Guá, koh thang kà-sī in ê kiáⁿ-jî. '
English: the day that you stood before Yahweh your God in Horeb, when Yahweh said to me, Assemble me the people, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè tsiàu kong-gī teh sím-phuàⁿ, I ē īng tsai-lān pò-ìng hiah-ê hō͘ lín tú-tio̍h tsai-lān ê lâng,
English: Since it is a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to those who afflict you,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, in beh hāi guá hiah-ê kè-bô͘, Lí lóng tsai. Kiû Lí m̄-thang sià-bián in ê tsuē-kò, mā m̄-thang tuì Lí ê bīn-tsîng tshat-siau in ê tsuē-ok; tio̍h hō͘ in tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng pua̍h-tó; Lí siū-khì ê sî, tio̍h kā in pān.
English: Yet, Yahweh, you know all their counsel against me to kill me; don't forgive their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from your sight; but let them be overthrown before you; deal you with them in the time of your anger.

Tailo: Hit sî, I ê siann hō͘ tē iô-tāng, m̄-koh, taⁿ I ū ìng-ín kóng, Guá m̄-nā beh koh tsi̍t pái hō͘ tē iô-tāng, mā beh hō͘ thiⁿ iô-tāng. (tsù, HGS 2:6)
English: whose voice shook the earth, then, but now he has promised, saying, Yet once more I will shake not only the earth, but also the heavens.

Tailo: Kì-jiân m̄-sī khò ka-kī ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h, lín tsiū bô siáⁿ-mi̍h thang khua-kháu.
English: not of works, that no one would boast.

Tailo: I ē īng tì-huī kà-sī siáⁿ lâng? Ē hō͘ siáⁿ lâng bîng-pi̍k i só͘ thuân ê? Kám sī hit khuán tú-á tn̄g ling, tú-á lī-khui hing tsîng ê?
English: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? Those who are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?

Tailo: í-ki̍p Ni-ne-beh kah Ka-la̍h tiong-kan ê Lē-sián; Lē-sián to̍h-sī hit-ê tuā siâⁿ.
English: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city).

Tailo: Tse kám sī guá ê tsú — guá ê ông só͘ tsò, jî-tshiánn mā bô kā lí ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, siáⁿ lâng ē suà-tsiap guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, lâi tsē i ê uī?
English: Is this thing done by my lord the king, and you haven't shown to your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?

Tailo: Só͘-í, kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē ê lâng, tio̍h kî-kiû ē-tàng ū kái-sueh ê lîng-li̍k.
English: Therefore let him who speaks in another language pray that he may interpret.

Tailo: Iésu teh beh kàu I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tsē tī lō͘ piⁿ teh kiû-khit.
English: It happened, as he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn án-ne kóng, In ài hòng-tōng, bô iok-sok in ê kha, só͘-í, Siōngtsú m̄ tsiap-la̍p in. Taⁿ Guá beh ē kì-tit in ê tsuē-kò, lâi pān in ê tsuē-ok.
English: Thus says Yahweh to this people, Even so have they loved to wander; they have not refrained their feet: therefore Yahweh does not accept them; now he will remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah king-ha̍k kàu-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu só͘ tsò ê kî-sū, iū-koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h gín-á tī sìng-tiān huah, Hô-sàn-ná! Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun. Tsiū tsin siū-khì,
English: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying in the temple and saying, Hosanna to the son of David! they were indignant,

Tailo: Guá ê tsú-lâng ê bó͘ Sala̍h, nî lāu ê sî, kā guá ê tsú-lâng seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ; guá ê tsú-lâng mā kā it-tshè só͘-ū ê hō͘ tsit-ê kiáⁿ.
English: Sarah, my master's wife, bore a son to my master when she was old. He has given all that he has to him.

Tailo: Tī lia̍t pang ê tiong-kan kóng-khí I ê îng-kng, tī bān-bîn ê tiong-kan kóng-khí I kî-biāu ê só͘ tsò.
English: Declare his glory among the nations, His marvelous works among all the peoples.

Tailo: Tì-huī sī tī bîng-lí ê lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng; gōng lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu khuànn tī tē ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding, But the eyes of a fool wander to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: Tng Ahasuiló͘ ê sî, （tsit-ê Ahasuiló͘ kuán-hat tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tshit síng, tuì Ìn-tō͘ kàu Kú-si̍t ）
English: Now it happened in the days of Ahasuerus (this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India even to Ethiopia, over one hundred twenty-seven provinces),

Tailo: hō͘ Guá ê lô͘-po̍k ê uē ìng-giām, Guá ê sù-tsiá ê kè-uē tit-tio̍h tsiânn. Kóng-tio̍h Êlúsalèm, Guá kóng: Tik-khak ū lâng tī hia tuà; kóng-tio̍h Iôtah ê siâⁿ, Guá kóng: Tik-khak ē siū khí-tsō; pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi Guá beh hō͘ i hing-khí.
English: who confirms the word of his servant, and performs the counsel of his messengers; who says of Jerusalem, She shall be inhabited; and of the cities of Judah, They shall be built, and I will raise up the waste places of it;

Tailo: Iosiúah kā in kiânn kat-lé ê iân-kò͘, sī in-uī tuì Aigi̍p tshut-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, kiàn-nā ē kau-tsiàn ê tsa-po͘ ting, tshut Aigi̍p í-āu tī lō͘-.ni̍h sí tī khòng-iá.
English: This is the cause why Joshua did circumcise: all the people who came forth out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way, after they came forth out of Egypt.

Tailo: Lín ê tshiú tio̍h giám-ngē, lín tio̍h ióng-kám, in-uī lín ê tsú Sàulô í-king sí, Iôtah tso̍k mā ū īng iû buah guá tsò in ê ông.
English: Now therefore let your hands be strong, and be you valiant; for Saul your lord is dead, and also the house of Judah have anointed me king over them.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê tshuì sī ua̍h-miā ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ; kiông-pō am-khàm pháiⁿ lâng ê tshuì.
English: The mouth of the righteous is a spring of life, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng to̍h-sī Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tshe-phài ê.
English: The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî lóng ē-tàng iâⁿ-kuè sè-kan; lán ê sìn-gióng hō͘ lán iâⁿ-kuè sè-kan.
English: For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world: your faith.

Tailo: Siâⁿ guā ū tsi̍t-ê Tse-ú-su biō ê tsè-si, i khan gû-á, the̍h hue-khuân, lâi-kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, beh kah tsìng lâng tsò-hué tuì in hiàn tsè.
English: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and would have made a sacrifice along with the multitudes.

Tailo: I ê bûn-tô͘ Iâkop kah Iô-há-neh khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne, tsiū kóng, Tsú ah, Lí kám ài guán tuì thinn-tíng kiò hué kàng lo̍h-lâi kā in siau-bia̍t?
English: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?

Tailo: I tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī tshing-khì ê ting-tâi tíng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ pān-lí tsiah-ê ting.
English: He shall keep in order the lamps on the pure gold lampstand before Yahweh continually.

Tailo: Lô͘-po̍k tsò tsú-lâng só͘ huan-hù ê tāi-tsì, tsú-lâng kám tio̍h kā i sueh-siā?
English: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.

Tailo: Iésu tuì kā I siat-li̍p ê Siōngtè tsīn-tiong, tú tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘se tī Siōngtè ê ke tsīn-tiong.
English: who was faithful to him who appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ tsiū tuì hit-tuāⁿ king-tián khai-sí, tuì i thuân Iésu ê hok-im.
English: Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, preached to him Jesus.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê to̍k-tsuâ, lín bîng-bîng sī pháiⁿ ê, ná ē kóng hó uē? In-uī lâng sim-lāi tshiong-muá siáⁿ-mi̍h, tshuì tsiū ē kóng-tshut siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.
